verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्वा॑ देव सवित॒रीशा॑नं॒ वार्या॑णाम् सदा॑वन्भा॒गमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: abhí tvā deva savitar  ī́śānaṃ vā́ryāṇām  sádāvan bhāgám īmahe

translation.text: To thee, O Savitar, the Lord of precious things, who helpest us Continually, for our share we come-

verses.sanskrit_deva: यश्चि॒द्धि त॑ इ॒त्था भगः॑ शशमा॒नः पु॒रा नि॒दः अ॒द्वे॒षो हस्त॑योर्द॒धे
verses.transliteration: yáś cid dhí ta itthā́ bhágaḥ  śaśamānáḥ purā́ nidáḥ  adveṣó hástayor dadhé

translation.text: Wealth, highly lauded ere reproach hath fallen on it, which is laid, Free from all hatred, in thy hands

verses.sanskrit_deva: भग॑भक्तस्य ते व॒यमुद॑शेम॒ तवाव॑सा मू॒र्धानं॑ रा॒य आ॒रभे॑
verses.transliteration: bhágabhaktasya te vayám  úd aśema távā́vasā  mūrdhā́naṃ rāyá ārábhe

translation.text: Through thy protection may we come to even the height of affluence Which Bhaga hath dealt out to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि ते॑ क्ष॒त्रं न सहो॒ न म॒न्युं वय॑श्च॒नामी प॒तय॑न्त आ॒पुः नेमा आपो॑ अनिमि॒षं चर॑न्ती॒र्न ये वात॑स्य प्रमि॒नन्त्यभ्व॑म्
verses.transliteration: nahí te kṣatráṃ ná sáho ná manyúṃ  váyaś canā́mī́ patáyanta āpúḥ  némā́ ā́po animiṣáṃ cárantīr  ná yé vā́tasya praminánty ábhvam

translation.text: Ne'er have those birds that fly through air attained to thy high dominion or thy might or spirit; Nor these the waters that flow on for ever, nor hills, abaters of the wind's wild fury.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒बु॒ध्ने राजा॒ वरु॑णो॒ वन॑स्यो॒र्ध्वं स्तूपं॑ ददते पू॒तद॑क्षः नी॒चीनाः॑ स्थुरु॒परि॑ बु॒ध्न ए॑षाम॒स्मे अ॒न्तर्निहि॑ताः के॒तवः॑ स्युः
verses.transliteration: abudhné rā́jā váruṇo vánasya-  -ūrdhváṃ stū́paṃ dadate pūtádakṣaḥ  nīcī́nā sthur upári budhná eṣām  asmé antár níhitāḥ ketávaḥ syuḥ

translation.text: Varuṇa, King, of hallowed might, sustaineth erect the Tree's stem in the baseless region. Its rays, whose root is high above, stream downward. Deep may they sink within us, and be hidden.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रुं हि राजा॒ वरु॑णश्च॒कार॒ सूर्या॑य॒ पन्था॒मन्वे॑त॒वा उ॑ अ॒पदे॒ पादा॒ प्रति॑धातवेऽकरु॒ताप॑व॒क्ता हृ॑दया॒विध॑श्चित्
verses.transliteration: urúṃ hí rā́jā váruṇaś cakā́ra  sū́ryāya pánthām ánvetavā́ u  apáde pā́dā prátidhātave (')kar  utā́pavaktā́ hr̥dayāvídhaś cit

translation.text: King Varuṇa hath made a spacious pathway, a pathway for the Sun wherein to travel. Where no way was he made him set his footstep, and warned afar whate'er afflicts the spirit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं ते॑ राजन्भि॒षजः॑ स॒हस्र॑मु॒र्वी ग॑भी॒रा सु॑म॒तिष्टे॑ अस्तु बाध॑स्व दू॒रे निर्ऋ॑तिं परा॒चैः कृ॒तं चि॒देनः॒ प्र मु॑मुग्ध्य॒स्मत्
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ te rājan bhiṣájaḥ sahásram  urvī́ gabhīrā́ sumatíṣ ṭe astu  bā́dhasva dūré nírr̥tim parācaíḥ  kr̥táṃ cid énaḥ prá mumugdhy asmát

translation.text: A hundred balms are thine, O King, a thousand; deep and wide-reaching also be thy favours. Far from us, far away drive thou Destruction. Put from us e'en the sin we have committed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒मी य ऋक्षा॒ निहि॑तास उ॒च्चा नक्तं॒ ददृ॑श्रे॒ कुह॑ चि॒द्दिवे॑युः अद॑ब्धानि॒ वरु॑णस्य व्र॒तानि॑ वि॒चाक॑शच्च॒न्द्रमा॒ नक्त॑मेति
verses.transliteration: amī́ yá ŕ̥kṣā níhitāsa uccā́  náktaṃ dádr̥śre kúha cid díveyuḥ  ádabdhāni váruṇasya vratā́ni  vicā́kaśac candrámā náktam eti

translation.text: Whither by day depart the constellations that shine at night, set high in heaven above us? Varuṇa's holy laws remain unweakened, and through the night the Moon moves on in splendor

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्त्वा॑ यामि॒ ब्रह्म॑णा॒ वन्द॑मान॒स्तदा शा॑स्ते॒ यज॑मानो ह॒विर्भिः॑ अहे॑ळमानो वरुणे॒ह बो॒ध्युरु॑शंस॒ मा न॒ आयुः॒ प्र मो॑षीः
verses.transliteration: tát tvā yāmi bráhmaṇā vándamānas  tád ā́ śāste yájamāno havírbhiḥ  áheḷamāno varuṇehá bodhi-  úruśaṃsa mā́ na ā́yuḥ prá moṣīḥ

translation.text: I ask this of thee with my prayer adoring; thy worshipper craves this with his oblation. Varuṇa, stay thou here and be not angry; steal not our life from us, O thou Wide-Ruler.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदिन्नक्तं॒ तद्दिवा॒ मह्य॑माहु॒स्तद॒यं केतो॑ हृ॒द आ वि च॑ष्टे शुनः॒शेपो॒ यमह्व॑द्गृभी॒तः सो अ॒स्मान्राजा॒ वरु॑णो मुमोक्तु
verses.transliteration: tád ín náktaṃ tád dívā máhyam āhus  tád ayáṃ kéto hr̥dá ā́ ví caṣṭe  śúnaḥśépo yám áhvad gr̥bhītáḥ  só asmā́n rā́jā váruṇo mumoktu

translation.text: Nightly and daily this one thing they tell me, this too the thought of mine own heart repeateth. May he to whom prayed fettered Ṣunaḥṣepa, may he the Sovran Varuṇa release us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुनः॒शेपो॒ ह्यह्व॑द्गृभी॒तस्त्रि॒ष्वा॑दि॒त्यं द्रु॑प॒देषु॑ ब॒द्धः अवै॑नं॒ राजा॒ वरु॑णः ससृज्याद्वि॒द्वाँ अद॑ब्धो॒ वि मु॑मोक्तु॒ पाशा॑न्
verses.transliteration: śúnaḥśépo hy áhvad gr̥bhītás  triṣv ā̀dityáṃ drupadéṣu baddháḥ  ávainaṃ rā́jā váruṇaḥ sasr̥jyād  vidvā́m̐ ádabdho ví mumoktu pā́śān

translation.text: Bound to three pillars captured Ṣunaḥṣepa thus to the Âditya made his supplication. Him may the Sovran Varuṇa deliver, wise, ne'er deccived, loosen the bonds that bind him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ ते॒ हेळो॑ वरुण॒ नमो॑भि॒रव॑ य॒ज्ञेभि॑रीमहे ह॒विर्भिः॑ क्षय॑न्न॒स्मभ्य॑मसुर प्रचेता॒ राज॒न्नेनां॑सि शिश्रथः कृ॒तानि॑
verses.transliteration: áva te héḷo varuṇa námobhir  áva yajñébhir īmahe havírbhiḥ  kṣáyann asmábhyam asura pracetaḥ-  rā́jann énāṃsi śiśrathaḥ kr̥tā́ni

translation.text: With bending down, oblations, sacrifices, O Varuṇa, we deprecate thine anger: Wise Asura, thou King of wide dominion, loosen the bonds of sins by us committed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॑त्त॒मं व॑रुण॒ पाश॑म॒स्मदवा॑ध॒मं वि म॑ध्य॒मं श्र॑थाय अथा॑ व॒यमा॑दित्य व्र॒ते तवाना॑गसो॒ अदि॑तये स्याम
verses.transliteration: úd uttamáṃ varuṇa pā́śam asmád  ávādhamáṃ ví madhyamáṃ śrathāya  áthā vayám āditya vraté táva-  -ánāgaso áditaye syāma

translation.text: Loosen the bonds, O Varuṇa, that hold me, loosen the bonds above, between, and under. So in thy holy law may we made sinless belong to Aditi, O thou Âditya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्चि॒द्धि ते॒ विशो॑ यथा॒ प्र दे॑व वरुण व्र॒तम् मि॒नी॒मसि॒ द्यवि॑द्यवि
verses.transliteration: yác cid dhí te víśo yathā  prá deva varuṇa vratám  minīmási dyávi-dyavi

translation.text: WHATEVER law of thine, O God, O Varuṇa, as we are men, Day after day we violate.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ व॒धाय॑ ह॒त्नवे॑ जिहीळा॒नस्य॑ रीरधः मा हृ॑णा॒नस्य॑ म॒न्यवे॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ no vadhā́ya hatnáve  jihīḷānásya rīradhaḥ  mā́ hr̥ṇānásya manyáve

translation.text: give us not as a prey to death, to be destroyed by thee in wrath, To thy fierce anger when displeased.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि मृ॑ळी॒काय॑ ते॒ मनो॑ र॒थीरश्वं॒ न संदि॑तम् गी॒र्भिर्व॑रुण सीमहि
verses.transliteration: ví mr̥ḷīkā́ya te máno  rathī́r áśvaṃ ná sáṃditam  gīrbhír varuṇa sīmahi

translation.text: To gain thy mercy, Varuṇa, with hymns we bind thy heart, as binds The charioteer his tethered horse.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॒ हि मे॒ विम॑न्यवः॒ पत॑न्ति॒ वस्य॑इष्टये वयो॒ न व॑स॒तीरुप॑
verses.transliteration: párā hí me vímanyavaḥ  pátanti vásya: iṣṭaye  váyo ná vasatī́r úpa

translation.text: They flee from me dispirited, bent only on obtaining wealths As to their nests the birds of air.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒दा क्ष॑त्र॒श्रियं॒ नर॒मा वरु॑णं करामहे मृ॒ळी॒कायो॑रु॒चक्ष॑सम्
verses.transliteration: kadā́ kṣatraśríyaṃ náram  ā́ váruṇaṃ karāmahe  mr̥ḷīkā́yorucákṣasam

translation.text: When shall we bring, to be appeased, the Hero, Lord of warrior might, Him, the far-seeing Varuṇa?

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदित्स॑मा॒नमा॑शाते॒ वेन॑न्ता॒ न प्र यु॑च्छतः धृ॒तव्र॑ताय दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: tád ít samānám āśāte  vénantā ná prá yuchataḥ  dhr̥távratāya dāśúṣe

translation.text: This, this with joy they both accept in common: never do they fail The ever-faithful worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेदा॒ यो वी॒नां प॒दम॒न्तरि॑क्षेण॒ पत॑ताम् वेद॑ ना॒वः स॑मु॒द्रियः॑
verses.transliteration: védā yó vīnā́m padám  antárikṣeṇa pátatām  véda nāváḥ samudríyaḥ

translation.text: He knows the path of birds that fly through heaven, and, Sovran of the sea, He knows the ships that are thereon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेद॑ मा॒सो धृ॒तव्र॑तो॒ द्वाद॑श प्र॒जाव॑तः वेदा॒ य उ॑प॒जाय॑ते
verses.transliteration: véda māsó dhr̥távrato  dvā́daśa prajā́vataḥ  védā yá upajā́yate

translation.text: True to his holy law, he knows the twelve moons with their progeny: He knows the moon of later birth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेद॒ वात॑स्य वर्त॒निमु॒रोर्ऋ॒ष्वस्य॑ बृह॒तः वेदा॒ ये अ॒ध्यास॑ते
verses.transliteration: véda vā́tasya vartaním  urór r̥ṣvásya br̥hatáḥ  védā yé adhyā́sate

translation.text: He knows the pathway of the wind, the spreading, high, and mighty wind He knows the Gods who dwell above.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि ष॑साद धृ॒तव्र॑तो॒ वरु॑णः प॒स्त्या॒३॒॑स्वा साम्रा॑ज्याय सु॒क्रतुः॑
verses.transliteration: ní ṣasāda dhr̥távrato  váruṇaḥ pastyā̀sv ā́  sā́mrājyāya sukrátuḥ

translation.text: Varuṇa, true to holy law, sits down among his people; he, Most wise, sits there to govern all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अतो॒ विश्वा॒न्यद्भु॑ता चिकि॒त्वाँ अ॒भि प॑श्यति कृ॒तानि॒ या च॒ कर्त्वा॑
verses.transliteration: áto víśvāny ádbhutā  cikitvā́m̐ abhí paśyati  kr̥tā́ni yā́ ca kártvā

translation.text: From thence percerving he beholds all wondrous things, both what hath been, And what hereafter will be done.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ वि॒श्वाहा॑ सु॒क्रतु॑रादि॒त्यः सु॒पथा॑ करत् प्र ण॒ आयूं॑षि तारिषत्
verses.transliteration: sá no viśvā́hā sukrátur  ādityáḥ supáthā karat  prá ṇa ā́yūṃṣi tāriṣat

translation.text: May that Âditya, very -wise, make fair paths for us all our days: May lie prolong our lives for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बिभ्र॑द्द्रा॒पिं हि॑र॒ण्ययं॒ वरु॑णो वस्त नि॒र्णिज॑म् परि॒ स्पशो॒ नि षे॑दिरे
verses.transliteration: bíbhrad drāpíṃ hiraṇyáyaṃ  váruṇo vasta nirṇíjam  pári spáśo ní ṣedire

translation.text: Varuṇa, wearing golden mail, hath clad him in a shining robe. His spies are seated found about.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यं दिप्स॑न्ति दि॒प्सवो॒ न द्रुह्वा॑णो॒ जना॑नाम् न दे॒वम॒भिमा॑तयः
verses.transliteration: ná yáṃ dípsanti dipsávo  ná drúhvāṇo jánānām  ná devám abhímātayaḥ

translation.text: The God whom enemies threaten not, nor those who tyrannize o'er men, Nor those whose minds are bent on wrong.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त यो मानु॑षे॒ष्वा यश॑श्च॒क्रे असा॒म्या अ॒स्माक॑मु॒दरे॒ष्वा
verses.transliteration: utá yó mā́nuṣeṣv~ā́  yáśaś cakré ásāmy ā́  asmā́kam udáreṣv ā́

translation.text: He who gives glory to mankind, not glory that is incomplete, To our own bodies giving it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॑ मे यन्ति धी॒तयो॒ गावो॒ न गव्यू॑ती॒रनु॑ इ॒च्छन्ती॑रुरु॒चक्ष॑सम्
verses.transliteration: párā me yanti dhītáyo  gā́vo ná gávyūtīr ánu  ichántīr urucákṣasam

translation.text: Yearning for the wide-seeing One, my thoughts move onward unto him, As kine unto their pastures move.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं नु वो॑चावहै॒ पुन॒र्यतो॑ मे॒ मध्वाभृ॑तम् होते॑व॒ क्षद॑से प्रि॒यम्
verses.transliteration: sáṃ nú vocāvahai púnar  yáto me mádhv ā́bhr̥tam  hóteva kṣádase priyám

translation.text: Once more together let us speak, because my meath is brought: priest-like Thou eatest what is dear to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दर्शं॒ नु वि॒श्वद॑र्शतं॒ दर्शं॒ रथ॒मधि॒ क्षमि॑ ए॒ता जु॑षत मे॒ गिरः॑
verses.transliteration: dárśaṃ nú viśvádarśataṃ  dárśaṃ rátham ádhi kṣámi  etā́ juṣata me gíraḥ

translation.text: Now saw I him whom all may see, I saw his car above the earth: He hath accepted these my songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं मे॑ वरुण श्रुधी॒ हव॑म॒द्या च॑ मृळय त्वाम॑व॒स्युरा च॑के
verses.transliteration: imám me varuṇa śrudhī  hávam adyā́ ca mr̥ḷaya  tvā́m avasyúr ā́ cake

translation.text: Varuṇa, hear this call of mine: be gracious unto us this day Longing for help I cried to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं विश्व॑स्य मेधिर दि॒वश्च॒ ग्मश्च॑ राजसि स याम॑नि॒ प्रति॑ श्रुधि
verses.transliteration: tváṃ víśvasya medhira  diváś ca gmáś ca rājasi  sá yā́mani práti śrudhi

translation.text: Thou, O wise God, art Lord of all, thou art the King of earth and heaven Hear, as thou goest on thy way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॑त्त॒मं मु॑मुग्धि नो॒ वि पाशं॑ मध्य॒मं चृ॑त अवा॑ध॒मानि॑ जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: úd uttamám mumugdhi no  ví pā́śam madhyamáṃ cr̥ta  ávādhamā́ni jīváse

translation.text: Release us from the upper bond, untie the bond between, and loose The bonds below, that I may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वसि॑ष्वा॒ हि मि॑येध्य॒ वस्त्रा॑ण्यूर्जां पते सेमं नो॑ अध्व॒रं य॑ज
verses.transliteration: vásiṣvā hí miyedhya  vástrāṇy ūrjām pate  sémáṃ no adhvaráṃ yaja

translation.text: O WORTHY of oblation, Lord of prospering powers, assume thy robes, And offer this our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि नो॒ होता॒ वरे॑ण्यः॒ सदा॑ यविष्ठ॒ मन्म॑भिः अग्ने॑ दि॒वित्म॑ता॒ वचः॑
verses.transliteration: ní no hótā váreṇyaḥ  sádā yaviṣṭha mánmabhiḥ  ágne divítmatā vácaḥ

translation.text: Sit ever to be chosen, as our Priest., most youthful, through our hymns, O Agni, through our heavenly word.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ हि ष्मा॑ सू॒नवे॑ पि॒तापिर्यज॑त्या॒पये॑ सखा॒ सख्ये॒ वरे॑ण्यः
verses.transliteration: ā́ hí ṣmā sūnáve pitā́-  -āpír yájaty āpáye  sákhā sákhye váreṇyaḥ

translation.text: For here a Father for his son, Kinsman for kinsman worshippeth, And Friend, choice-worthy, for his friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ ब॒र्ही रि॒शाद॑सो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा सीद॑न्तु॒ मनु॑षो यथा
verses.transliteration: ā́ no barhī́ riśā́daso  váruṇo mitró aryamā́  sī́dantu mánuṣo yathā

translation.text: Fiere let the foe-destroyers sit, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Like men, upon our sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पूर्व्य॑ होतर॒स्य नो॒ मन्द॑स्व स॒ख्यस्य॑ च इ॒मा उ॒ षु श्रु॑धी॒ गिरः॑
verses.transliteration: pū́rvya hotar asyá no  mándasva sakhyásya ca  imā́ u ṣú śrudhī gíraḥ

translation.text: O ancient Herald, be thou glad in this our rite and fellowship: Hearken thou well to these our songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्चि॒द्धि शश्व॑ता॒ तना॑ दे॒वंदे॑वं॒ यजा॑महे त्वे इद्धू॑यते ह॒विः
verses.transliteration: yác cid dhí śáśvatā tánā  deváṃ-devaṃ yájāmahe  tvé íd dhūyate havíḥ

translation.text: Whate'er in this perpetual course we sacrifice to God and God, That gift is offered up in thee

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रि॒यो नो॑ अस्तु वि॒श्पति॒र्होता॑ म॒न्द्रो वरे॑ण्यः प्रि॒याः स्व॒ग्नयो॑ व॒यम्
verses.transliteration: priyó no astu viśpátir  hótā mandró váreṇyaḥ  priyā́ḥ svagnáyo vayám

translation.text: May he be our dear household Lord, Priest, pleasant and, choice-worthy may We, with bright fires, be dear to him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒ग्नयो॒ हि वार्यं॑ दे॒वासो॑ दधि॒रे च॑ नः स्व॒ग्नयो॑ मनामहे
verses.transliteration: svagnáyo hí vā́ryaṃ devā́so  dadhiré ca naḥ  svagnáyo manāmahe

translation.text: The Gods, adored with brilliant fires. have granted precious wealth to us So, with bright fires, we pray to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अथा॑ न उ॒भये॑षा॒ममृ॑त॒ मर्त्या॑नाम् मि॒थः स॑न्तु॒ प्रश॑स्तयः
verses.transliteration: áthā na ubháyeṣām  ámr̥ta mártyānām  mitháḥ santu práśastayaḥ

translation.text: And, O Immortal One, so may the eulogies of mortal men Belong to us and thee alike.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑भिरग्ने अ॒ग्निभि॑रि॒मं य॒ज्ञमि॒दं वचः॑ चनो॑ धाः सहसो यहो
verses.transliteration: víśvebhir agne agníbhir  imáṃ yajñám idáṃ vácaḥ  cáno dhāḥ sahaso yaho

translation.text: With all thy fires, O Agni, find pleasure in this our sacrifice, And this our speech, O Son of Strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वं॒ न त्वा॒ वार॑वन्तं व॒न्दध्या॑ अ॒ग्निं नमो॑भिः स॒म्राज॑न्तमध्व॒राणा॑म्
verses.transliteration: áśvaṃ ná tvā vā́ravantaṃ  vandádhyā agníṃ námobhiḥ  samrā́jantam adhvarā́ṇām

translation.text: WITH worship will I glorify thee, Agni, like a long-tailed steed, Imperial Lord of sacred rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स घा॑ नः सू॒नुः शव॑सा पृ॒थुप्र॑गामा सु॒शेवः॑ मी॒ढ्वाँ अ॒स्माकं॑ बभूयात्
verses.transliteration: sá ghā naḥ sūnúḥ śávasā  pr̥thúpragāmā suśévaḥ  mīḍhvā́m̐ asmā́kam babhūyāt

translation.text: May the far-striding Son of Strength, bringer of great felicity, Who pours his gifts like rain, be ours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ दू॒राच्चा॒साच्च॒ नि मर्त्या॑दघा॒योः पा॒हि सद॒मिद्वि॒श्वायुः॑
verses.transliteration: sá no dūrā́c cāsā́c ca  ní mártyād aghāyóḥ  pāhí sádam íd viśvā́yuḥ

translation.text: Lord of all life, from near; from far, do thou, O Agni evermore Protect us from the sinful man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ममू॒ षु त्वम॒स्माकं॑ स॒निं गा॑य॒त्रं नव्यां॑सम् अग्ने॑ दे॒वेषु॒ प्र वो॑चः
verses.transliteration: imám ū ṣú tvám asmā́kaṃ  saníṃ gāyatráṃ návyāṃsam  ágne devéṣu prá vocaḥ

translation.text: O Agni, graciously announce this our oblation to the Gods, And this our newest song of praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ भज पर॒मेष्वा वाजे॑षु मध्य॒मेषु॑ शिक्षा॒ वस्वो॒ अन्त॑मस्य
verses.transliteration: ā́ no bhaja paraméṣv  ā́ vā́jeṣu madhyaméṣu  śíkṣā vásvo ántamasya

translation.text: Give us a share of strength most high, a share of strength that is below, A share of strength that is between.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒भ॒क्तासि॑ चित्रभानो॒ सिन्धो॑रू॒र्मा उ॑पा॒क आ स॒द्यो दा॒शुषे॑ क्षरसि
verses.transliteration: vibhaktā́si citrabhāno  síndhor ūrmā́ upāká ā́  sadyó dāśúṣe kṣarasi

translation.text: Thou dealest gifts, resplendent One; nigh, as with waves of Sindhu, thou Swift streamest to the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यम॑ग्ने पृ॒त्सु मर्त्य॒मवा॒ वाजे॑षु॒ यं जु॒नाः स यन्ता॒ शश्व॑ती॒रिषः॑
verses.transliteration: yám agne pr̥tsú mártyam  ávā vā́jeṣu yáṃ junā́ḥ  sá yántā śáśvatīr íṣaḥ

translation.text: That man is lord of endless strength whom thou protectest in the fight, Agni, or urgest to the fray.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नकि॑रस्य सहन्त्य पर्ये॒ता कय॑स्य चित् वाजो॑ अस्ति श्र॒वाय्यः॑
verses.transliteration: nákir asya sahantya  paryetā́ káyasya cit  vā́jo asti śravā́yyaḥ

translation.text: Him, whosoever he may be, no man may vanquish, mighty One: Nay, very glorious power is his.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वाजं॑ वि॒श्वच॑र्षणि॒रर्व॑द्भिरस्तु॒ तरु॑ता विप्रे॑भिरस्तु॒ सनि॑ता
verses.transliteration: sá vā́jaṃ viśvácarṣaṇir  árvadbhir astu tárutā  víprebhir astu sánitā

translation.text: May he who dwells with all mankind bear us with war-steeds through the fight, And with the singers win the spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जरा॑बोध॒ तद्वि॑विड्ढि वि॒शेवि॑शे य॒ज्ञिया॑य स्तोमं॑ रु॒द्राय॒ दृशी॑कम्
verses.transliteration: járābodha tád viviḍḍhi  viśé-viśe yajñíyāya  stómaṃ rudrā́ya dŕ̥śīkam

translation.text: Help, thou who knowest lauds, this work, this eulogy to Rudra, him Adorable in every house.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ म॒हाँ अ॑निमा॒नो धू॒मके॑तुः पुरुश्च॒न्द्रः धि॒ये वाजा॑य हिन्वतु
verses.transliteration: sá no mahā́m̐ animānó  dhūmáketuḥ puruścandráḥ  dhiyé vā́jāya hinvatu

translation.text: May this our God, great, limitless, smoke-bannered excellently bright, Urge us to strength and holy thought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स रे॒वाँ इ॑व वि॒श्पति॒र्दैव्यः॑ के॒तुः शृ॑णोतु नः उ॒क्थैर॒ग्निर्बृ॒हद्भा॑नुः
verses.transliteration: sá revā́m̐ iva viśpátir  daívyaḥ ketúḥ śr̥ṇotu naḥ  ukthaír agnír br̥hádbhānuḥ

translation.text: Like some rich Lord of men may he, Agni the banner of the Gods, Refulgent, hear us through our lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नमो॑ म॒हद्भ्यो॒ नमो॑ अर्भ॒केभ्यो॒ नमो॒ युव॑भ्यो॒ नम॑ आशि॒नेभ्यः॑ यजा॑म दे॒वान्यदि॑ श॒क्नवा॑म॒ मा ज्याय॑सः॒ शंस॒मा वृ॑क्षि देवाः
verses.transliteration: námo mahádbhyo námo arbhakébhyo  námo yúvabhyo náma āśinébhyaḥ  yájāma devā́n yádi śaknávāma  mā́ jyā́yasaḥ śáṃsam ā́ vr̥kṣi devāḥ

translation.text: Glory to Gods, the mighty and the lesser glory to Gods the younger and the elder! Let us, if we have power, pay the God worship: no better prayer than this, ye Gods, acknowledge.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॒ ग्रावा॑ पृ॒थुबु॑ध्न ऊ॒र्ध्वो भव॑ति॒ सोत॑वे उ॒लूख॑लसुताना॒मवेद्वि॑न्द्र जल्गुलः
verses.transliteration: yátra grā́vā pr̥thúbudhnaḥ-  ūrdhvó bhávati sótave  ulū́khalasutānām  ávéd v indra jalgulaḥ

translation.text: THERE where the broad-based stone raised on high to press the juices out, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॒ द्वावि॑व ज॒घना॑धिषव॒ण्या॑ कृ॒ता उ॒लूख॑लसुताना॒मवेद्वि॑न्द्र जल्गुलः
verses.transliteration: yátra dvā́v iva jaghánā-  -adhiṣavaṇyā̀ kr̥tā́  ulū́khalasutānām  ávéd v indra jalgulaḥ

translation.text: Where, like broad hips, to hold the juice the platters of the press are laid, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॒ नार्य॑पच्य॒वमु॑पच्य॒वं च॒ शिक्ष॑ते उ॒लूख॑लसुताना॒मवेद्वि॑न्द्र जल्गुलः
verses.transliteration: yátra nā́ry apacyavám  upacyaváṃ ca śíkṣate  ulū́khalasutānām  ávéd v indra jalgulaḥ

translation.text: There where the woman marks and leans the pestle's constant rise and fall, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॒ मन्थां॑ विब॒ध्नते॑ र॒श्मीन्यमि॑त॒वा इ॑व उ॒लूख॑लसुताना॒मवेद्वि॑न्द्र जल्गुलः
verses.transliteration: yátra mánthāṃ vibadhnáte  raśmī́n yámitavā́ iva  ulū́khalasutānām  ávéd v indra jalgulaḥ

translation.text: Where, as with reins to guide a horse, they bind the churning-staff with cords, O Indra, drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्चि॒द्धि त्वं गृ॒हेगृ॑ह॒ उलू॑खलक यु॒ज्यसे॑ इ॒ह द्यु॒मत्त॑मं वद॒ जय॑तामिव दुन्दु॒भिः
verses.transliteration: yác cid dhí tváṃ gr̥hé-gr̥he-  úlūkhalaka yujyáse  ihá dyumáttamaṃ vada  jáyatām iva dundubhíḥ

translation.text: If of a truth in every house, O Mortar thou art set for work, Here give thou forth thy clearest sound, loud as the drum of conquerors.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्म॑ ते वनस्पते॒ वातो॒ वि वा॒त्यग्र॒मित् अथो॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ पात॑वे सु॒नु सोम॑मुलूखल
verses.transliteration: utá sma te vanaspate  vā́to ví vāty ágram ít  átho índrāya pā́tave  sunú sómam ulūkhala

translation.text: O Sovran of the Forest, as the wind blows soft in front of thee, Mortar, for Indra press thou forth the Soma juice that he may drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒य॒जी वा॑ज॒सात॑मा॒ ता ह्यु१॒॑च्चा वि॑जर्भृ॒तः हरी॑ इ॒वान्धां॑सि॒ बप्स॑ता
verses.transliteration: āyajī́ vājasā́tamā  tā́ hy ùccā́ vijarbhr̥táḥ  hárī ivā́ndhāṃsi bápsatā

translation.text: Best strength-givers, ye stretch wide jaws, O Sacrificial Implements, Like two bay horses champing herbs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता नो॑ अ॒द्य व॑नस्पती ऋ॒ष्वावृ॒ष्वेभिः॑ सो॒तृभिः॑ इन्द्रा॑य॒ मधु॑मत्सुतम्
verses.transliteration: tā́ no adyá vanaspatī  r̥ṣvā́v r̥ṣvébhiḥ sotŕ̥bhiḥ  índrāya mádhumat sutam

translation.text: Ye Sovrans of the Forest, both swift, with swift pressers press to-day Sweet Soma juice for Indra's drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उच्छि॒ष्टं च॒म्वो॑र्भर॒ सोमं॑ प॒वित्र॒ आ सृ॑ज नि धे॑हि॒ गोरधि॑ त्व॒चि
verses.transliteration: úc chiṣṭáṃ camvòr bhara  sómam pavítra ā́ sr̥ja  ní dhehi gór ádhi tvací

translation.text: Take up in beakers what remains: the Soma on the filter pour, and on the ox-hide set the dregs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्चि॒द्धि स॑त्य सोमपा अनाश॒स्ता इ॑व॒ स्मसि॑ आ तू न॑ इन्द्र शंसय॒ गोष्वश्वे॑षु शु॒भ्रिषु॑ स॒हस्रे॑षु तुवीमघ
verses.transliteration: yác cid dhí satya somapāḥ-  anāśastā́ iva smási  ā́ tū́ na indra śaṃsaya  góṣv áśveṣu śubhríṣu  sahásreṣu tuvīmagha

translation.text: O SOMA DRINKER, ever true, utterly hopeless though we be, Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शिप्रि॑न्वाजानां पते॒ शची॑व॒स्तव॑ दं॒सना॑ आ तू न॑ इन्द्र शंसय॒ गोष्वश्वे॑षु शु॒भ्रिषु॑ स॒हस्रे॑षु तुवीमघ
verses.transliteration: śíprin vājānām pate  śácīvas táva daṃsánā  ā́ tū́ na indra śaṃsaya  góṣv áśveṣu śubhríṣu  sahásreṣu tuvīmagha

translation.text: O Lord of Strength, whose jaws are strong, great deeds are thine, the powerful: Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि ष्वा॑पया मिथू॒दृशा॑ स॒स्तामबु॑ध्यमाने आ तू न॑ इन्द्र शंसय॒ गोष्वश्वे॑षु शु॒भ्रिषु॑ स॒हस्रे॑षु तुवीमघ
verses.transliteration: ní ṣvāpayā mithūdŕ̥śā  sastā́m ábudhyamāne  ā́ tū́ na indra śaṃsaya  góṣv áśveṣu śubhríṣu  sahásreṣu tuvīmagha

translation.text: Lull thou asleep, to wake no more, the pair who on each other look Do thou, O Indra, give us, help of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒सन्तु॒ त्या अरा॑तयो॒ बोध॑न्तु शूर रा॒तयः॑ आ तू न॑ इन्द्र शंसय॒ गोष्वश्वे॑षु शु॒भ्रिषु॑ स॒हस्रे॑षु तुवीमघ
verses.transliteration: sasántu tyā́ árātayo  bódhantu śūra rātáyaḥ  ā́ tū́ na indra śaṃsaya  góṣv áśveṣu śubhríṣu  sahásreṣu tuvīmagha

translation.text: Hero, let hostile spirits sleep, and every gentler genius wake: Do thou, O Indra,. give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑न्द्र गर्द॒भं मृ॑ण नु॒वन्तं॑ पा॒पया॑मु॒या आ तू न॑ इन्द्र शंसय॒ गोष्वश्वे॑षु शु॒भ्रिषु॑ स॒हस्रे॑षु तुवीमघ
verses.transliteration: sám indra gardabhám mr̥ṇa  nuvántam pāpáyāmuyā́  ā́ tū́ na indra śaṃsaya  góṣv áśveṣu śubhríṣu  sahásreṣu tuvīmagha

translation.text: Destroy this ass, O Indra, who in tones discordant brays to thee: Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पता॑ति कुण्डृ॒णाच्या॑ दू॒रं वातो॒ वना॒दधि॑ आ तू न॑ इन्द्र शंसय॒ गोष्वश्वे॑षु शु॒भ्रिषु॑ स॒हस्रे॑षु तुवीमघ
verses.transliteration: pátāti kuṇḍr̥ṇā́cyā  dūráṃ vā́to vánād ádhi  ā́ tū́ na indra śaṃsaya  góṣv áśveṣu śubhríṣu  sahásreṣu tuvīmagha

translation.text: Far distant on the forest fall the tempest in a circling course! Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सर्वं॑ परिक्रो॒शं ज॑हि ज॒म्भया॑ कृकदा॒श्व॑म् आ तू न॑ इन्द्र शंसय॒ गोष्वश्वे॑षु शु॒भ्रिषु॑ स॒हस्रे॑षु तुवीमघ
verses.transliteration: sárvam parikrośáṃ jahi  jambháyā kr̥kadāśvàm  ā́ tū́ na indra śaṃsaya  góṣv áśveṣu śubhríṣu  sahásreṣu tuvīmagha

translation.text: Slay each reviler, and destroy him who in secret injures us: Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine In thousands, O most wealthy One.

suktas.deity: Indra, Final Verses Asvins and Usas

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ व॒ इन्द्रं॒ क्रिविं॑ यथा वाज॒यन्तः॑ श॒तक्र॑तुम् मंहि॑ष्ठं सिञ्च॒ इन्दु॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ā́ va índraṃ kríviṃ yathā  vājayántaḥ śatákratum  máṃhiṣṭhaṃ siñca índubhiḥ

translation.text: WE seeking strength with Soma-drops fill full your Indra like a well, Most liberal, Lord of Hundred Powers,

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं वा॒ यः शुची॑नां स॒हस्रं॑ वा॒ समा॑शिराम् एदु॑ नि॒म्नं न री॑यते
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ vā yáḥ śúcīnāṃ  sahásraṃ vā sámāśirām  éd u nimnáṃ ná rīyate

translation.text: Who lets a hundred of the pure, a thousand of the milk-blent draughts Flow, even as down a depth, to him;

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं यन्मदा॑य शु॒ष्मिण॑ ए॒ना ह्य॑स्यो॒दरे॑ स॒मु॒द्रो न व्यचो॑ द॒धे
verses.transliteration: sáṃ yán mádāya śuṣmíṇe-  enā́ hy àsyodáre  samudró ná vyáco dadhé

translation.text: When for the strong, the rapturous joy he in this manner hath made room Within his belly, like the sea.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यमु॑ ते॒ सम॑तसि क॒पोत॑ इव गर्भ॒धिम् वच॒स्तच्चि॑न्न ओहसे
verses.transliteration: ayám u te sám atasi  kapóta iva garbhadhím  vácas tác cin na ohase

translation.text: This is thine own. Thou drawest near, as turns a pigeon to his mate: Thou carest too for this our prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तो॒त्रं रा॑धानां पते॒ गिर्वा॑हो वीर॒ यस्य॑ ते विभू॑तिरस्तु सू॒नृता॑
verses.transliteration: stotráṃ rādhānām pate  gírvāho vīra yásya te  víbhūtir astu sūnŕ̥tā

translation.text: O Hero, Lord of Bounties, praised in hymns, may power and joyfulness Be his who sings the laud to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वस्ति॑ष्ठा न ऊ॒तये॒ऽस्मिन्वाजे॑ शतक्रतो सम॒न्येषु॑ ब्रवावहै
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvás tiṣṭhā na ūtáye  -asmín vā́je śatakrato  sám anyéṣu bravāvahai

translation.text: Lord of a Hundred Powers, stand up to lend us succour in this fight In others too let us agree.

verses.sanskrit_deva: योगे॑योगे त॒वस्त॑रं॒ वाजे॑वाजे हवामहे सखा॑य॒ इन्द्र॑मू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: yóge-yoge tavástaraṃ  vā́je-vāje havāmahe  sákhāya índram ūtáye

translation.text: In every need, in every fray we call as friends to succour us Indra the mightiest of all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ घा॑ गम॒द्यदि॒ श्रव॑त्सह॒स्रिणी॑भिरू॒तिभिः॑ वाजे॑भि॒रुप॑ नो॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ ghā gamad yádi śrávat  sahasríṇībhir ūtíbhiḥ  vā́jebhir úpa no hávam

translation.text: If he will hear us let him come with succour of a thousand kinds, And all that strengthens, to our call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑ प्र॒त्नस्यौक॑सो हु॒वे तु॑विप्र॒तिं नर॑म् यं ते॒ पूर्वं॑ पि॒ता हु॒वे
verses.transliteration: ánu pratnásyaúkaso  huvé tuvipratíṃ náram  yáṃ te pū́rvam pitā́ huvé

translation.text: I call him mighty to resist, the Hero of our ancient home, Thee whom my sire invoked of old.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ व॒यं वि॑श्ववा॒रा शा॑स्महे पुरुहूत सखे॑ वसो जरि॒तृभ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā vayáṃ viśvavāra-  -ā́ śāsmahe puruhūta  sákhe vaso jaritŕ̥bhyaḥ

translation.text: We pray to thee, O much-invoked, rich in all prccious gifts, O Friend, Kind God to those who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माकं॑ शि॒प्रिणी॑नां॒ सोम॑पाः सोम॒पाव्ना॑म् सखे॑ वज्रि॒न्त्सखी॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: asmā́kaṃ śipríṇīnāṃ  sómapāḥ somapā́vnām  sákhe vajrin sákhīnām

translation.text: O Soma-drinker, Thunder-armed, Friend of our lovely-featured dames And of our Soma-drinking friends.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तथा॒ तद॑स्तु सोमपाः॒ सखे॑ वज्रि॒न्तथा॑ कृणु यथा॑ त उ॒श्मसी॒ष्टये॑
verses.transliteration: táthā tád astu somapāḥ  sákhe vajrin táthā kr̥ṇu  yáthā ta uśmásīṣṭáye

translation.text: Thus, Soma-drinker, may it be; thus, Friend, who wieldest thunder, act To aid each wish as we desire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रे॒वती॑र्नः सध॒माद॒ इन्द्रे॑ सन्तु तु॒विवा॑जाः क्षु॒मन्तो॒ याभि॒र्मदे॑म
verses.transliteration: revátīr naḥ sadhamā́de-  índre santu tuvívājāḥ  kṣumánto yā́bhir mádema

translation.text: With Indra splendid feasts be ours, rich in all strengthening things wherewith, Wealthy in food, we may rejoice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ घ॒ त्वावा॒न्त्मना॒प्तः स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ धृष्णविया॒नः ऋ॒णोरक्षं॒ न च॒क्र्योः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ gha tvā́vān tmánāptáḥ-  stotŕ̥bhyo dhr̥ṣṇav iyānáḥ  r̥ṇór ákṣaṃ ná cakryòḥ

translation.text: Like thee, thyself, the singers' Friend, thou movest, as it were, besought, Bold One, the axle of the car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यद्दुवः॑ शतक्रत॒वा कामं॑ जरितॄ॒णाम् ऋ॒णोरक्षं॒ न शची॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yád dúvaḥ śatakratav  ā́ kā́maṃ jaritr̥̄ṇā́m  r̥ṇór ákṣaṃ ná śácībhiḥ

translation.text: That, Ṣatakratu, thou to grace and please thy praisers, as it were, Stirrest the axle with thy strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शश्व॒दिन्द्रः॒ पोप्रु॑थद्भिर्जिगाय॒ नान॑दद्भिः॒ शाश्व॑सद्भि॒र्धना॑नि स नो॑ हिरण्यर॒थं दं॒सना॑वा॒न्त्स नः॑ सनि॒ता स॒नये॒ स नो॑ऽदात्
verses.transliteration: śáśvad índraḥ pópruthadbhir jigāya  nā́nadadbhiḥ śā́śvasadbhir dhánāni  sá no hiraṇyaratháṃ daṃsánāvān  sá naḥ sanitā́ sanáye sá no (')dāt

translation.text: With champing, neighing loudly-snorting horses Indra hath ever won himself great treasures A car of gold hath he whose deeds are wondrous received from us, and let us too receive it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आश्वि॑ना॒वश्वा॑वत्ये॒षा या॑तं॒ शवी॑रया गोम॑द्दस्रा॒ हिर॑ण्यवत्
verses.transliteration: ā́śvināv áśvāvatyā-  -iṣā́ yātaṃ śávīrayā  gómad dasrā híraṇyavat

translation.text: Come, Aṣvins, with enduring strength wealthy in horses and in kine, And gold, O ye of wondrous deeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नयो॑जनो॒ हि वां॒ रथो॑ दस्रा॒वम॑र्त्यः स॒मु॒द्रे अ॑श्वि॒नेय॑ते
verses.transliteration: samānáyojano hí vāṃ  rátho dasrāv ámartyaḥ  samudré aśvinéyate

translation.text: Your chariot yoked for both alike, immortal, ye of mighty acts, Travels, O Aivins, in the sea.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न्य१॒॑घ्न्यस्य॑ मू॒र्धनि॑ च॒क्रं रथ॑स्य येमथुः परि॒ द्याम॒न्यदी॑यते
verses.transliteration: ny àghnyásya mūrdháni  cakráṃ ráthasya yemathuḥ  pári dyā́m anyád īyate

translation.text: High on the forehead of the Bull one chariot wheel ye ever keep, The other round the sky revolves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कस्त॑ उषः कधप्रिये भु॒जे मर्तो॑ अमर्त्ये कं न॑क्षसे विभावरि
verses.transliteration: kás ta uṣaḥ kadhapriye  bhujé márto amartye  káṃ nakṣase vibhāvari

translation.text: What mortal, O immortal Dawn, enjoyeth thee? Where lovest thou? To whom, O radiant, dost thou go?

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं हि ते॒ अम॑न्म॒ह्यान्ता॒दा प॑रा॒कात् अश्वे॒ न चि॑त्रे अरुषि
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ hí te ámanmahi-  ā́ntād ā́ parākā́t  áśve ná citre aruṣi

translation.text: For we have had thee in our thoughts whether anear or far away, Red-hued and like a dappled mare.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं त्येभि॒रा ग॑हि॒ वाजे॑भिर्दुहितर्दिवः अ॒स्मे र॒यिं नि धा॑रय
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tyébhir ā́ gahi  vā́jebhir duhitar divaḥ  asmé rayíṃ ní dhāraya

translation.text: Hither, O Daughter of the Sky, come thou with these thy strengthenings, And send thou riches down to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने प्रथ॒मो अङ्गि॑रा॒ ऋषि॑र्दे॒वो दे॒वाना॑मभवः शि॒वः सखा॑ तव॑ व्र॒ते क॒वयो॑ विद्म॒नाप॒सोऽजा॑यन्त म॒रुतो॒ भ्राज॑दृष्टयः
verses.transliteration: tvám agne prathamó áṅgirā ŕ̥ṣir  devó devā́nām abhavaḥ śiváḥ sákhā  táva vraté kaváyo vidmanā́pasaḥ-  -ájāyanta marúto bhrā́jadr̥ṣṭayaḥ

translation.text: Thou, Agni, wast the earliest Angiras, a Seer; thou wast, a God thyself, the Gods' auspicious Friend. After thy holy ordinance the Maruts, sage, active through wisdom, -with their glittering spears, were born.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने प्रथ॒मो अङ्गि॑रस्तमः क॒विर्दे॒वानां॒ परि॑ भूषसि व्र॒तम् वि॒भुर्विश्व॑स्मै॒ भुव॑नाय॒ मेधि॑रो द्विमा॒ता श॒युः क॑ति॒धा चि॑दा॒यवे॑
verses.transliteration: tvám agne prathamó áṅgirastamaḥ  kavír devā́nām pári bhūṣasi vratám  vibhúr víśvasmai bhúvanāya médhiro  dvimātā́ śayúḥ katidhā́ cid āyáve

translation.text: O Agni, thou, the best and earliest Angiras, fulfillest as a Sage the holy law of Gods. Sprung from two mothers, wise, through all existence spread, resting in many a place for sake of living man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने प्रथ॒मो मा॑त॒रिश्व॑न आ॒विर्भ॑व सुक्रतू॒या वि॒वस्व॑ते अरे॑जेतां॒ रोद॑सी होतृ॒वूर्येऽस॑घ्नोर्भा॒रमय॑जो म॒हो व॑सो
verses.transliteration: tvám agne prathamó mātaríśvane-  āvír bhava sukratūyā́ vivásvate  árejetāṃ ródasī hotr̥vū́rye-  -ásaghnor bhārám áyajo mahó vaso

translation.text: To Mâtariṣvan first thou, Agni, wast disclosed, and to Vivasvan through thy noble inward power. Heaven and Earth, Vasu! shook at the choosing of the Priest: the burthen thou didst bear, didst worship mighty Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ मन॑वे॒ द्याम॑वाशयः पुरू॒रव॑से सु॒कृते॑ सु॒कृत्त॑रः श्वा॒त्रेण॒ यत्पि॒त्रोर्मुच्य॑से॒ पर्या त्वा॒ पूर्व॑मनय॒न्नाप॑रं॒ पुनः॑
verses.transliteration: tvám agne mánave dyā́m avāśayaḥ  purūrávase sukŕ̥te sukŕ̥ttaraḥ  śvātréṇa yát pitrór múcyase pári-  ā́ tvā pū́rvam anayann ā́param púnaḥ

translation.text: Agni thou madest heaven to thunder for mankind; thou, yet more pious, for pious Purûravâs. When thou art rapidly freed from thy parents, first eastward they bear thee round, and, after, to the west.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने वृष॒भः पु॑ष्टि॒वर्ध॑न॒ उद्य॑तस्रुचे भवसि श्र॒वाय्यः॑ य आहु॑तिं॒ परि॒ वेदा॒ वष॑ट्कृति॒मेका॑यु॒रग्रे॒ विश॑ आ॒विवा॑ससि
verses.transliteration: tvám agne vr̥ṣabháḥ puṣṭivárdhanaḥ-  údyatasruce bhavasi śravā́yyaḥ  yá ā́hutim pári védā váṣaṭkr̥tim  ékāyur ágre víśa āvívāsasi

translation.text: Thou, Agni, art a Bull who makes our store increase, to be invoked by him who lifts the ladle up. Well knowing the oblation with the hallowing word, uniting all who live, thou lightenest first our folk

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने वृजि॒नव॑र्तनिं॒ नरं॒ सक्म॑न्पिपर्षि वि॒दथे॑ विचर्षणे यः शूर॑साता॒ परि॑तक्म्ये॒ धने॑ द॒भ्रेभि॑श्चि॒त्समृ॑ता॒ हंसि॒ भूय॑सः
verses.transliteration: tvám agne vr̥jinávartaniṃ náraṃ  sákman piparṣi vidáthe vicarṣaṇe  yáḥ śū́rasātā páritakmye dháne  dabhrébhiś cit sámr̥tā háṃsi bhū́yasaḥ

translation.text: Agni, thou savest in the synod when pursued e'en him, farseeing One! who walks in evil ways. Thou, when the heroes fight for spoil which men rush, round, slayest in war the many by the hands of few.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं तम॑ग्ने अमृत॒त्व उ॑त्त॒मे मर्तं॑ दधासि॒ श्रव॑से दि॒वेदि॑वे यस्ता॑तृषा॒ण उ॒भया॑य॒ जन्म॑ने॒ मयः॑ कृ॒णोषि॒ प्रय॒ आ च॑ सू॒रये॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tám agne amr̥tatvá uttamé  mártaṃ dadhāsi śrávase divé-dive  yás tātr̥ṣāṇá ubháyāya jánmane  máyaḥ kr̥ṇóṣi práya ā́ ca sūráye

translation.text: For glory, Agni, day by day, thou liftest up the mortal man to highest immortality, Even thou who yearning for both races givest them great bliss, and to the prince grantest abundant food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ अग्ने स॒नये॒ धना॑नां य॒शसं॑ का॒रुं कृ॑णुहि॒ स्तवा॑नः ऋ॒ध्याम॒ कर्मा॒पसा॒ नवे॑न दे॒वैर्द्या॑वापृथिवी॒ प्राव॑तं नः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no agne sanáye dhánānāṃ  yaśásaṃ kārúṃ kr̥ṇuhi stávānaḥ  r̥dhyā́ma kármāpásā návena  devaír dyāvāpr̥thivī prā́vataṃ naḥ

translation.text: O Agni, highly lauded, make our singer famous that he may win us store of riches: May we improve the rite with new performance. O Earth and Heaven, with all the Gods, protect us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ अग्ने पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थ॒ आ दे॒वो दे॒वेष्व॑नवद्य॒ जागृ॑विः त॒नू॒कृद्बो॑धि॒ प्रम॑तिश्च का॒रवे॒ त्वं क॑ल्याण॒ वसु॒ विश्व॒मोपि॑षे
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no agne pitrór upástha~ā́  devó devéṣv anavadya jā́gr̥viḥ  tanūkŕ̥d bodhi prámatiś ca kāráve  tváṃ kalyāṇa vásu víśvam ópiṣe

translation.text: O blameless Agni lying in thy Parents' lap, a God among the Gods, be watchful for our good. Former of bodies, be the singer's Providence: all good things hast thou sown for him, auspicious One!

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ प्रम॑ति॒स्त्वं पि॒तासि॑ न॒स्त्वं व॑य॒स्कृत्तव॑ जा॒मयो॑ व॒यम् सं त्वा॒ रायः॑ श॒तिनः॒ सं स॑ह॒स्रिणः॑ सु॒वीरं॑ यन्ति व्रत॒पाम॑दाभ्य
verses.transliteration: tvám agne prámatis tvám pitā́si nas  tváṃ vayaskŕ̥t táva jāmáyo vayám  sáṃ tvā rā́yaḥ śatínaḥ sáṃ sahasríṇaḥ  suvī́raṃ yanti vratapā́m adābhya

translation.text: Agni, thou art our Providence, our Father thou – we are thy brethren and thou art our spring of life. in thee, rich in good heroes, guard of high decrees, meet hundred, thousand treasures, O infallible!

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाम॑ग्ने प्रथ॒ममा॒युमा॒यवे॑ दे॒वा अ॑कृण्व॒न्नहु॑षस्य वि॒श्पति॑म् इळा॑मकृण्व॒न्मनु॑षस्य॒ शास॑नीं पि॒तुर्यत्पु॒त्रो मम॑कस्य॒ जाय॑ते
verses.transliteration: tvā́m agne prathamám āyúm āyáve  devā́ akr̥ṇvan náhuṣasya viśpátim  íḷām akr̥ṇvan mánuṣasya śā́sanīm  pitúr yát putró mámakasya jā́yate

translation.text: Thee, Agni, have the Gods made the first living One for living man, Lord of the house of Nahusha. Iḷâ they made the teacher of the sons of men, what time a Son was born to the father of my race.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ अग्ने॒ तव॑ देव पा॒युभि॑र्म॒घोनो॑ रक्ष त॒न्व॑श्च वन्द्य त्रा॒ता तो॒कस्य॒ तन॑ये॒ गवा॑म॒स्यनि॑मेषं॒ रक्ष॑माण॒स्तव॑ व्र॒ते
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no agne táva deva pāyúbhir  maghóno rakṣa tanvàś ca vandya  trātā́ tokásya tánaye gávām asi-  ánimeṣaṃ rákṣamāṇas táva vraté

translation.text: Worthy to be revered, O Agni, God, preserve our wealthy patrons with thy succours, and ourselves. Guard of our seed art thou, aiding our cows to bear, incessantly protecting in thy holy way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ यज्य॑वे पा॒युरन्त॑रोऽनिष॒ङ्गाय॑ चतुर॒क्ष इ॑ध्यसे यो रा॒तह॑व्योऽवृ॒काय॒ धाय॑से की॒रेश्चि॒न्मन्त्रं॒ मन॑सा व॒नोषि॒ तम्
verses.transliteration: tvám agne yájyave pāyúr ántaro  -aniṣaṅgā́ya caturakṣá idhyase  yó rātáhavyo 'vr̥kā́ya dhā́yase  kīréś cin mántram mánasā vanóṣi tám

translation.text: Agni, thou art a guard close to the pious man; kindled art thou, four-eyed! for him who is unarmcd. With fond heart thou acceptest e'en the poor man's prayer, when he hath brought his gift to gain security.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्न उरु॒शंसा॑य वा॒घते॑ स्पा॒र्हं यद्रेक्णः॑ पर॒मं व॒नोषि॒ तत् आ॒ध्रस्य॑ चि॒त्प्रम॑तिरुच्यसे पि॒ता प्र पाकं॒ शास्सि॒ प्र दिशो॑ वि॒दुष्ट॑रः
verses.transliteration: tvám agna uruśáṃsāya vāgháte  spārháṃ yád rékṇaḥ paramáṃ vanóṣi tát  ādhrásya cit prámatir ucyase pitā́  prá pā́kaṃ śā́ssi prá díśo vidúṣṭaraḥ

translation.text: Thou, Agni gainest for the loudly-praising priest the highest wealth, the object of a man's desire. Thou art called Father, caring even for the weak, and wisest, to the simple one thou teachest lore.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ प्रय॑तदक्षिणं॒ नरं॒ वर्मे॑व स्यू॒तं परि॑ पासि वि॒श्वतः॑ स्वा॒दु॒क्षद्मा॒ यो व॑स॒तौ स्यो॑न॒कृज्जी॑वया॒जं यज॑ते॒ सोप॒मा दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: tvám agne práyatadakṣiṇaṃ náraṃ  vármeva syūtám pári pāsi viśvátaḥ  svādukṣádmā yó vasataú syonakŕ̥j  jīvayājáṃ yájate sópamā́ diváḥ

translation.text: Agni, the man who giveth guerdon to the priests, like well-sewn armour thou guardest on every side. He who with grateful food shows kindness in his house, an offerer to the living, is the type of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒माम॑ग्ने श॒रणिं॑ मीमृषो न इ॒ममध्वा॑नं॒ यमगा॑म दू॒रात् आ॒पिः पि॒ता प्रम॑तिः सो॒म्यानां॒ भृमि॑रस्यृषि॒कृन्मर्त्या॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: imā́m agne śaráṇim mīmr̥ṣo naḥ-  imám ádhvānaṃ yám ágāma dūrā́t  āpíḥ pitā́ prámatiḥ somyā́nām  bhŕ̥mir asy r̥ṣikŕ̥n mártyānām

translation.text: Pardon, we pray, this sin of ours, O Agni, -- the path which we have trodden, widely straying, Dear Friend and Father, caring for the pious, who speedest nigh and who inspirest mortals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒नु॒ष्वद॑ग्ने अङ्गिर॒स्वद॑ङ्गिरो ययाति॒वत्सद॑ने पूर्व॒वच्छु॑चे अच्छ॑ या॒ह्या व॑हा॒ दैव्यं॒ जन॒मा सा॑दय ब॒र्हिषि॒ यक्षि॑ च प्रि॒यम्
verses.transliteration: manuṣvád agne aṅgirasvád aṅgiro  yayātivát sádane pūrvavác chuce  ácha yāhy ā́ vahā daívyaṃ jánam  ā́ sādaya barhíṣi yákṣi ca priyám

translation.text: As erst to Manus, to Yayâti, Angiras, so Angiras! pure Agni! come thou to our hall Bring hither the celestial host and seat them here upon the sacred grass, and offer what they love.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तेना॑ग्ने॒ ब्रह्म॑णा वावृधस्व॒ शक्ती॑ वा॒ यत्ते॑ चकृ॒मा वि॒दा वा॑ उ॒त प्र णे॑ष्य॒भि वस्यो॑ अ॒स्मान्त्सं नः॑ सृज सुम॒त्या वाज॑वत्या
verses.transliteration: eténāgne bráhmaṇā vāvr̥dhasva  śáktī vā yát te cakr̥mā́ vidā́ vā  utá prá ṇeṣy abhí vásyo asmā́n  sáṃ naḥ sr̥ja sumatyā́ vā́javatyā

translation.text: By this our prayer be thou, O Agni, strengthened, prayer made by us after our power and knowledge. Lead thou us, therefore, to increasing riches; endow us with thy strength-bestowing favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्य॒ नु वी॒र्या॑णि॒ प्र वो॑चं॒ यानि॑ च॒कार॑ प्रथ॒मानि॑ व॒ज्री अह॒न्नहि॒मन्व॒पस्त॑तर्द॒ प्र व॒क्षणा॑ अभिन॒त्पर्व॑तानाम्
verses.transliteration: índrasya nú vīryā̀ṇi prá vocaṃ  yā́ni cakā́ra prathamā́ni vajrī́  áhann áhim ánv apás tatarda  prá vakṣáṇā abhinat párvatānām

translation.text: I WILL declare the manly deeds of Indra, the first that he achieved, the Thunder-wielder. He slew the Dragon, then disclosed the waters, and cleft the channels of the mountain torrents.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अह॒न्नहिं॒ पर्व॑ते शिश्रिया॒णं त्वष्टा॑स्मै॒ वज्रं॑ स्व॒र्यं॑ ततक्ष वा॒श्रा इ॑व धे॒नवः॒ स्यन्द॑माना॒ अञ्जः॑ समु॒द्रमव॑ जग्मु॒रापः॑
verses.transliteration: áhann áhim párvate śiśriyāṇáṃ  tváṣṭāsmai vájraṃ svaryàṃ tatakṣa  vāśrā́ iva dhenávaḥ syándamānāḥ-  áñjaḥ samudrám áva jagmur ā́paḥ

translation.text: He slew the Dragon lying on the mountain: his heavenly bolt of thunder Tvashṭar fashioned. Like lowing kine in rapid flow descending the waters glided downward to the ocean.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒षा॒यमा॑णोऽवृणीत॒ सोमं॒ त्रिक॑द्रुकेष्वपिबत्सु॒तस्य॑ आ साय॑कं म॒घवा॑दत्त॒ वज्र॒मह॑न्नेनं प्रथम॒जामही॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: vr̥ṣāyámāṇo 'vr̥ṇīta sómaṃ  tríkadrukeṣv apibat sutásya  ā́ sā́yakam maghávādatta vájram  áhann enam prathamajā́m áhīnām

translation.text: Impetuous as a bull, he chose the Soma and in three sacred beakers drank the juices. Maghavan grasped the thunder for his weapon, and smote to death this firstborn of the dragons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॒न्द्राह॑न्प्रथम॒जामही॑ना॒मान्मा॒यिना॒ममि॑नाः॒ प्रोत मा॒याः आत्सूर्यं॑ ज॒नय॒न्द्यामु॒षासं॑ ता॒दीत्ना॒ शत्रुं॒ न किला॑ विवित्से
verses.transliteration: yád indrā́han prathamajā́m áhīnām  ā́n māyínām ámināḥ prótá māyā́ḥ  ā́t sū́ryaṃ janáyan dyā́m uṣā́saṃ  tādī́tnā śátruṃ ná kílā vivitse

translation.text: When, Indra, thou hadst slain the dragon's firstborn, and overcome the charms of the enchanters, Then, giving life to Sun and Dawn and Heaven, thou foundest not one foe to stand against thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अह॑न्वृ॒त्रं वृ॑त्र॒तरं॒ व्यं॑स॒मिन्द्रो॒ वज्रे॑ण मह॒ता व॒धेन॑ स्कन्धां॑सीव॒ कुलि॑शेना॒ विवृ॒क्णाहिः॑ शयत उप॒पृक्पृ॑थि॒व्याः
verses.transliteration: áhan vr̥tráṃ vr̥tratáraṃ vyàṃsam  índro vájreṇa mahatā́ vadhéna  skándhāṃsīva kúliśenā vívr̥kṇā-  -áhiḥ śayata upapŕ̥k pr̥thivyā́ḥ

translation.text: Indra with his own great and deadly thunder smote into pieces Vr̥itra, worst of Vr̥itras. As trunks of trees, what time the axe hath felled them, low on the earth so lies the prostrate Dragon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यो॒द्धेव॑ दु॒र्मद॒ आ हि जु॒ह्वे म॑हावी॒रं तु॑विबा॒धमृ॑जी॒षम् नाता॑रीदस्य॒ समृ॑तिं व॒धानां॒ सं रु॒जानाः॑ पिपिष॒ इन्द्र॑शत्रुः
verses.transliteration: ayoddhéva durmáda ā́ hí juhvé  mahāvīráṃ tuvibādhám r̥jīṣám  nā́tārīd asya sámr̥tiṃ vadhā́nāṃ  sáṃ rujā́nāḥ pipiṣa índraśatruḥ

translation.text: He, like a mad weak warrior, challenged Indra, the great impetuous many-slaying Hero. He. brooking not the clashing of the weapons, crushed-Indra's foe-the shattered forts in falling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पाद॑ह॒स्तो अ॑पृतन्य॒दिन्द्र॒मास्य॒ वज्र॒मधि॒ सानौ॑ जघान वृष्णो॒ वध्रिः॑ प्रति॒मानं॒ बुभू॑षन्पुरु॒त्रा वृ॒त्रो अ॑शय॒द्व्य॑स्तः
verses.transliteration: apā́d ahastó apr̥tanyad índram  ā́sya vájram ádhi sā́nau jaghāna  vŕ̥ṣṇo vádhriḥ pratimā́nam búbhūṣan  purutrā́ vr̥tró aśayad vyàstaḥ

translation.text: Footless and handless still he challenged Indra, who smote him with his bolt between the shoulders. Emasculate yet claiming manly vigour, thus Vr̥itra lay with scattered limbs dissevered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒दं न भि॒न्नम॑मु॒या शया॑नं॒ मनो॒ रुहा॑णा॒ अति॑ य॒न्त्यापः॑ याश्चि॑द्वृ॒त्रो म॑हि॒ना प॒र्यति॑ष्ठ॒त्तासा॒महिः॑ पत्सुतः॒शीर्ब॑भूव
verses.transliteration: nadáṃ ná bhinnám amuyā́ śáyānam  mánor úhāṇā áti yanty ā́paḥ  yā́ś cid vr̥tró mahinā́ paryátiṣṭhat  tā́sām áhiḥ patsutaḥśī́r babhūva

translation.text: There as he lies like a bank-bursting river, the waters taking courage flow above him. The Dragon lies beneath the feet of torrents which Vr̥itra with his greatness had encompassed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नी॒चाव॑या अभवद्वृ॒त्रपु॒त्रेन्द्रो॑ अस्या॒ अव॒ वध॑र्जभार उत्त॑रा॒ सूरध॑रः पु॒त्र आ॑सी॒द्दानुः॑ शये स॒हव॑त्सा॒ न धे॒नुः
verses.transliteration: nīcā́vayā abhavad vr̥tráputrā-  -índro asyā áva vádhar jabhāra  úttarā sū́r ádharaḥ putrá āsīd  dā́nuḥ śaye sahávatsā ná dhenúḥ

translation.text: Then humbled was the strength of Vr̥itra's mother: Indra hath cast his deadly bolt against her. The mother was above, the son was under and like a cow beside her calf lay Dânu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अति॑ष्ठन्तीनामनिवेश॒नानां॒ काष्ठा॑नां॒ मध्ये॒ निहि॑तं॒ शरी॑रम् वृ॒त्रस्य॑ नि॒ण्यं वि च॑र॒न्त्यापो॑ दी॒र्घं तम॒ आश॑य॒दिन्द्र॑शत्रुः
verses.transliteration: átiṣṭhantīnām aniveśanā́nāṃ  kā́ṣṭhānām mádhye níhitaṃ śárīram  vr̥trásya niṇyáṃ ví caranty ā́po  dīrgháṃ táma ā́śayad índraśatruḥ

translation.text: Rolled in the midst of never-ceasing currents flowing without a rest for ever onward. The waters bear off Vr̥itra's nameless body: the foe of Indra sank to during darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दा॒सप॑त्नी॒रहि॑गोपा अतिष्ठ॒न्निरु॑द्धा॒ आपः॑ प॒णिने॑व॒ गावः॑ अ॒पां बिल॒मपि॑हितं॒ यदासी॑द्वृ॒त्रं ज॑घ॒न्वाँ अप॒ तद्व॑वार
verses.transliteration: dāsápatnīr áhigopā atiṣṭhan  níruddhā ā́paḥ paṇíneva gā́vaḥ  apā́m bílam ápihitaṃ yád ā́sīd  vr̥tráṃ jaghanvā́m̐ ápa tád vavāra

translation.text: Guarded by Ahi stood the thralls of Dâsas, the waters stayed like kine held by the robber. But he, when he had smitten Vr̥itra, opened the cave wherein the floods had been imprisoned.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्व्यो॒ वारो॑ अभव॒स्तदि॑न्द्र सृ॒के यत्त्वा॑ प्र॒त्यह॑न्दे॒व एकः॑ अज॑यो॒ गा अज॑यः शूर॒ सोम॒मवा॑सृजः॒ सर्त॑वे स॒प्त सिन्धू॑न्
verses.transliteration: áśvyo vā́ro abhavas tád indra  sr̥ké yát tvā pratyáhan devá ékaḥ  ájayo gā́ ájayaḥ śūra sómam  ávāsr̥jaḥ sártave saptá síndhūn

translation.text: A horse's tail wast thou when he, O Indra, smote on thy bolt; thou, God without a second, Thou hast won back the kine, hast won the Soma; thou hast let loose to flow the Seven Rivers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नास्मै॑ वि॒द्युन्न त॑न्य॒तुः सि॑षेध॒ न यां मिह॒मकि॑रद्ध्रा॒दुनिं॑ च इन्द्र॑श्च॒ यद्यु॑यु॒धाते॒ अहि॑श्चो॒ताप॒रीभ्यो॑ म॒घवा॒ वि जि॑ग्ये
verses.transliteration: nā́smai vidyún ná tanyatúḥ siṣedha  ná yā́m míham ákirad dhrādúniṃ ca  índraś ca yád yuyudhā́te áhiś ca-  -utā́parī́bhyo maghávā ví jigye

translation.text: Nothing availed him lightning, nothing thunder, hailstorm or mist which had spread around him: When Indra and the Dragon strove in battle, Maghavan gained the victory for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अहे॑र्या॒तारं॒ कम॑पश्य इन्द्र हृ॒दि यत्ते॑ ज॒घ्नुषो॒ भीरग॑च्छत् नव॑ च॒ यन्न॑व॒तिं च॒ स्रव॑न्तीः श्ये॒नो न भी॒तो अत॑रो॒ रजां॑सि
verses.transliteration: áher yātā́raṃ kám apaśya indra  hr̥dí yát te jaghnúṣo bhī́r ágachat  náva ca yán navatíṃ ca srávantīḥ  śyenó ná bhītó átaro rájāṃsi

translation.text: Whom sawest thou to avenge the Dragon, Indra, that fear possessed thy heart when thou hadst slain him; That, like a hawk affrighted through the regions, thou crossedst nine-and-ninety flowing rivers?

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ या॒तोऽव॑सितस्य॒ राजा॒ शम॑स्य च शृ॒ङ्गिणो॒ वज्र॑बाहुः सेदु॒ राजा॑ क्षयति चर्षणी॒नाम॒रान्न ने॒मिः परि॒ ता ब॑भूव
verses.transliteration: índro yātó 'vasitasya rā́jā  śámasya ca śr̥ṅgíṇo vájrabāhuḥ  séd u rā́jā kṣayati carṣaṇīnā́m  arā́n ná nemíḥ pári tā́ babhūva

translation.text: Indra is King of all that moves and moves not, of creatures tame and horned, the Thunder-wielder. Over all living men he rules as Sovran, containing all as spokes within the felly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एताया॒मोप॑ ग॒व्यन्त॒ इन्द्र॑म॒स्माकं॒ सु प्रम॑तिं वावृधाति अ॒ना॒मृ॒णः कु॒विदाद॒स्य रा॒यो गवां॒ केतं॒ पर॑मा॒वर्ज॑ते नः
verses.transliteration: étā́yāmópa gavyánta índram  asmā́kaṃ sú prámatiṃ vāvr̥dhāti  anāmr̥ṇáḥ kuvíd ā́d asyá rāyó  gávāṃ kétam páram āvárjate naḥ

translation.text: Come, fain for booty let us seek to Indra: yet more shall he increase his care that guides us. Will not the Indestructible endow us with perfect knowledge of this wealth, of cattle?

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपेद॒हं ध॑न॒दामप्र॑तीतं॒ जुष्टां॒ न श्ये॒नो व॑स॒तिं प॑तामि इन्द्रं॑ नम॒स्यन्नु॑प॒मेभि॑र॒र्कैर्यः स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ हव्यो॒ अस्ति॒ याम॑न्
verses.transliteration: úpéd aháṃ dhanadā́m ápratītaṃ  júṣṭāṃ ná śyenó vasatím patāmi  índraṃ namasyánn upamébhir arkaír  yá stotŕ̥bhyo hávyo ásti yā́man

translation.text: I fly to him invisible Wealth-giver as flies the falcon to his cherished eyrie, With fairest hymns of praise adoring Indra, whom those who laud him must invoke in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि सर्व॑सेन इषु॒धीँर॑सक्त॒ सम॒र्यो गा अ॑जति॒ यस्य॒ वष्टि॑ चो॒ष्कू॒यमा॑ण इन्द्र॒ भूरि॑ वा॒मं मा प॒णिर्भू॑र॒स्मदधि॑ प्रवृद्ध
verses.transliteration: ní sárvasena iṣudhī́m̐r asakta  sám aryó gā́ ajati yásya váṣṭi  coṣkūyámāṇa indra bhū́ri vāmám  mā́ paṇír bhūr asmád ádhi pravr̥ddha

translation.text: Mid all his host, he bindeth on the quiver he driveth cattle from what foe he pleaseth: Gathering up great store of riches, Indra. be thou no trafficker with us, most mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वधी॒र्हि दस्युं॑ ध॒निनं॑ घ॒नेनँ॒ एक॒श्चर॑न्नुपशा॒केभि॑रिन्द्र धनो॒रधि॑ विषु॒णक्ते व्या॑य॒न्नय॑ज्वानः सन॒काः प्रेति॑मीयुः
verses.transliteration: vádhīr hí dásyuṃ dhanínaṃ ghanénam̐  ékaś cárann upaśākébhir indra  dhánor ádhi viṣuṇák té vy ā̀yann  áyajvānaḥ sanakā́ḥ prétim īyuḥ

translation.text: Thou slewest with thy bolt the wealthy Dasyu, alone, yet going with thy helpers, Indra! Far from the floor of heaven in all directions, the ancient riteless ones fled to destruction.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॑ चिच्छी॒र्षा व॑वृजु॒स्त इ॒न्द्राय॑ज्वानो॒ यज्व॑भिः॒ स्पर्ध॑मानाः प्र यद्दि॒वो ह॑रिवः स्थातरुग्र॒ निर॑व्र॒ताँ अ॑धमो॒ रोद॑स्योः
verses.transliteration: párā cic chīrṣā́ vavr̥jus tá indra-  -áyajvāno yájvabhi spárdhamānāḥ  prá yád divó hariva sthātar ugra  nír avratā́m̐ adhamo ródasyoḥ

translation.text: Fighting with pious worshippers, the riteless turned and fled, Indra! with averted faces. When thou, fierce Lord of the Bay Steeds, the Stayer, blewest from earth and heaven and sky the godless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अयु॑युत्सन्ननव॒द्यस्य॒ सेना॒मया॑तयन्त क्षि॒तयो॒ नव॑ग्वाः वृ॒षा॒युधो॒ न वध्र॑यो॒ निर॑ष्टाः प्र॒वद्भि॒रिन्द्रा॑च्चि॒तय॑न्त आयन्
verses.transliteration: áyuyutsann anavadyásya sénām  áyātayanta kṣitáyo návagvāḥ  vr̥ṣāyúdho ná vádhrayo níraṣṭāḥ  pravádbhir índrāc citáyanta āyan

translation.text: They met in fight the army of the blameless. then the Navagvas put forth all their power. They, like emasculates with men contending, fled, conscious, by steep paths from Indra, scattered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमे॒तान्रु॑द॒तो जक्ष॑त॒श्चायो॑धयो॒ रज॑स इन्द्र पा॒रे अवा॑दहो दि॒व आ दस्यु॑मु॒च्चा प्र सु॑न्व॒तः स्तु॑व॒तः शंस॑मावः
verses.transliteration: tvám etā́n rudató jákṣataś ca-  -áyodhayo rájasa indra pāré  ávādaho divá ā́ dásyum uccā́  prá sunvatá stuvatáḥ śáṃsam āvaḥ

translation.text: Whether they weep or laugh, thou hast o'erthrown them, O Indra, on the sky's extremest limit. The Dasyu thou hast burned from heaven, and welcomed the prayer of him who pours the juice and lauds thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒क्रा॒णासः॑ परी॒णहं॑ पृथि॒व्या हिर॑ण्येन म॒णिना॒ शुम्भ॑मानाः न हि॑न्वा॒नास॑स्तितिरु॒स्त इन्द्रं॒ परि॒ स्पशो॑ अदधा॒त्सूर्ये॑ण
verses.transliteration: cakrāṇā́saḥ parīṇáham pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  híraṇyena maṇínā śúmbhamānāḥ  ná hinvānā́sas titirus tá índram  pári spáśo adadhāt sū́ryeṇa

translation.text: Adorned with their array of gold and jewels, they o'er the earth a covering veil extended. Although they hastened, they o'ercame not Indra: their spies he compassed with the Sun of morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ यदि॑न्द्र॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे अबु॑भोजीर्महि॒ना वि॒श्वतः॑ सीम् अम॑न्यमानाँ अ॒भि मन्य॑मानै॒र्निर्ब्र॒ह्मभि॑रधमो॒ दस्यु॑मिन्द्र
verses.transliteration: pári yád indra ródasī ubhé  ábubhojīr mahinā́ viśvátaḥ sīm  ámanyamānām̐ abhí mányamānair  nír brahmábhir adhamo dásyum indra

translation.text: As thou enjoyest heaven and earth, O Indra, on every side surrounded with thy greatness, So thou with priests bast blown away the Dasyu, and those who worship not with those who worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ये दि॒वः पृ॑थि॒व्या अन्त॑मा॒पुर्न मा॒याभि॑र्धन॒दां प॒र्यभू॑वन् युजं॒ वज्रं॑ वृष॒भश्च॑क्र॒ इन्द्रो॒ निर्ज्योति॑षा॒ तम॑सो॒ गा अ॑दुक्षत्
verses.transliteration: ná yé diváḥ pr̥thivyā́ ántam āpúr  ná māyā́bhir dhanadā́m paryábhūvan  yújaṃ vájraṃ vr̥ṣabháś cakra índro  nír jyótiṣā támaso gā́ adukṣat

translation.text: They who pervaded earth's extremest limit subdued not with their charms the Wealth-bestower: Indra, the Bull, made his ally the thunder, and with its light milked cows from out the darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑ स्व॒धाम॑क्षर॒न्नापो॑ अ॒स्याव॑र्धत॒ मध्य॒ आ ना॒व्या॑नाम् स॒ध्री॒चीने॑न॒ मन॑सा॒ तमिन्द्र॒ ओजि॑ष्ठेन॒ हन्म॑नाहन्न॒भि द्यून्
verses.transliteration: ánu svadhā́m akṣarann ā́po asya-  -ávardhata mádhya ā́ nāvyā̀nām  sadhrīcī́nena mánasā tám índraḥ-  ójiṣṭhena hánmanāhann abhí dyū́n

translation.text: The waters flowed according to their nature; he raid the navigable streams waxed mighty. Then Indra, with his spirit concentrated, smote him for ever with his strongest weapon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न्या॑विध्यदिली॒बिश॑स्य दृ॒ळ्हा वि शृ॒ङ्गिण॑मभिन॒च्छुष्ण॒मिन्द्रः॑ याव॒त्तरो॑ मघव॒न्याव॒दोजो॒ वज्रे॑ण॒ शत्रु॑मवधीः पृत॒न्युम्
verses.transliteration: ny ā̀vidhyad ilībíśasya dr̥ḷhā́  ví śr̥ṅgíṇam abhinac chúṣṇam índraḥ  yā́vat táro maghavan yā́vad ójo  vájreṇa śátrum avadhīḥ pr̥tanyúm

translation.text: Indra broke through Ilîbiṣa's strong castles, and Ṣushṇa with his horn he cut to pieces: Thou, Maghavan, for all his might and swiftness, slewest thy fighting foeman with thy thunder

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि सि॒ध्मो अ॑जिगादस्य॒ शत्रू॒न्वि ति॒ग्मेन॑ वृष॒भेणा॒ पुरो॑ऽभेत् सं वज्रे॑णासृजद्वृ॒त्रमिन्द्रः॒ प्र स्वां म॒तिम॑तिर॒च्छाश॑दानः
verses.transliteration: abhí sidhmó ajigād asya śátrūn  ví tigména vr̥ṣabhéṇā púro 'bhet  sáṃ vájreṇāsr̥jad vr̥trám índraḥ  prá svā́m matím atirac chā́śadānaḥ

translation.text: Fierce on his enemies fell Indra's weapon: with. his sharp bull he rent their forts in pieces. He with his thunderbolt dealt blows on Vr̥itra; and conquered, executing all his purpose.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आवः॒ कुत्स॑मिन्द्र॒ यस्मि॑ञ्चा॒कन्प्रावो॒ युध्य॑न्तं वृष॒भं दश॑द्युम् श॒फच्यु॑तो रे॒णुर्न॑क्षत॒ द्यामुच्छ्वै॑त्रे॒यो नृ॒षाह्या॑य तस्थौ
verses.transliteration: ā́vaḥ kútsam indra yásmiñ cākán  prā́vo yúdhyantaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ dáśadyum  śaphácyuto reṇúr nakṣata dyā́m  úc chvaitreyó nr̥ṣā́hyāya tasthau

translation.text: Indra, thou helpest Kutsa whom thou lovedst, and guardedst brave Daṣadyu when he battled, The dust of trampling horses rose to heaven, and Ṣvitrâ's son stood up again for conquest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आवः॒ शमं॑ वृष॒भं तुग्र्या॑सु क्षेत्रजे॒षे म॑घव॒ञ्छ्वित्र्यं॒ गाम् ज्योक्चि॒दत्र॑ तस्थि॒वांसो॑ अक्रञ्छत्रूय॒तामध॑रा॒ वेद॑नाकः
verses.transliteration: ā́vaḥ śámaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ túgryāsu  kṣetrajeṣé maghavañ chvítryaṃ gā́m  jyók cid átra tasthivā́ṃso akrañ  -śatrūyatā́m ádharā védanākaḥ

translation.text: Ṣvitrâ's mild steer, O Maghavan thou helpest in combat for the land, mid Tugra's houses. Long stood they there before the task was ended: thou wast the master of the foemen's treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिश्चि॑न्नो अ॒द्या भ॑वतं नवेदसा वि॒भुर्वां॒ याम॑ उ॒त रा॒तिर॑श्विना यु॒वोर्हि य॒न्त्रं हि॒म्येव॒ वास॑सोऽभ्यायं॒सेन्या॑ भवतं मनी॒षिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: tríś cin no adyā́ bhavataṃ navedasā  vibhúr vāṃ yā́ma utá rātír aśvinā  yuvór hí yantráṃ himyéva vā́saso  -abhyāyaṃsényā bhavatam manīṣíbhiḥ

translation.text: Ye who observe this day be with us even thrice: far-stretching is you bounty, Aṣvins and your course. To you, as to a cloak in winter, we cleave close: you are to be drawn nigh unto us by the wise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रयः॑ प॒वयो॑ मधु॒वाह॑ने॒ रथे॒ सोम॑स्य वे॒नामनु॒ विश्व॒ इद्वि॑दुः त्रयः॑ स्क॒म्भासः॑ स्कभि॒तास॑ आ॒रभे॒ त्रिर्नक्तं॑ या॒थस्त्रिर्व॑श्विना॒ दिवा॑
verses.transliteration: tráyaḥ paváyo madhuvā́hane ráthe  sómasya venā́m ánu víśva íd viduḥ  tráya skambhā́sa skabhitā́sa ārábhe  trír náktaṃ yāthás trír v aśvinā dívā

translation.text: Three are the fellies in your honey-bearing car, that travels after Soma's loved one, as all know. Three are the pillars set upon it for support: thrice journey ye by night, O Aṣvins, thrice by day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒ने अह॒न्त्रिर॑वद्यगोहना॒ त्रिर॒द्य य॒ज्ञं मधु॑ना मिमिक्षतम् त्रिर्वाज॑वती॒रिषो॑ अश्विना यु॒वं दो॒षा अ॒स्मभ्य॑मु॒षस॑श्च पिन्वतम्
verses.transliteration: samāné áhan trír avadyagohanā  trír adyá yajñám mádhunā mimikṣatam  trír vā́javatīr íṣo aśvinā yuváṃ  doṣā́ asmábhyam uṣásaś ca pinvatam

translation.text: Thrice in the self-same day, ye Gods who banish want, sprinkle ye thrice to-day our sacrifice with meath; And thrice vouchsafe us store of food with plenteous strength, at evening, O ye Aṣvins, and at break of day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिर्व॒र्तिर्या॑तं॒ त्रिरनु॑व्रते ज॒ने त्रिः सु॑प्रा॒व्ये॑ त्रे॒धेव॑ शिक्षतम् त्रिर्ना॒न्द्यं॑ वहतमश्विना यु॒वं त्रिः पृक्षो॑ अ॒स्मे अ॒क्षरे॑व पिन्वतम्
verses.transliteration: trír vartír yātaṃ trír ánuvrate jané  tríḥ suprāvyè tredhéva śikṣatam  trír nāndyàṃ vahatam aśvinā yuváṃ  tríḥ pŕ̥kṣo asmé akṣáreva pinvatam

translation.text: Thrice come ye to our home, thrice to the righteous folk, thrice triply aid the man who well deserves your help. Thrice, O ye Aṣvins, bring us what shall make us glad; thrice send us store of food as nevermore to fail.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिर्नो॑ र॒यिं व॑हतमश्विना यु॒वं त्रिर्दे॒वता॑ता॒ त्रिरु॒ताव॑तं॒ धियः॑ त्रिः सौ॑भग॒त्वं त्रिरु॒त श्रवां॑सि नस्त्रि॒ष्ठं वां॒ सूरे॑ दुहि॒ता रु॑ह॒द्रथ॑म्
verses.transliteration: trír no rayíṃ vahatam aśvinā yuváṃ  trír devátātā trír utā́vataṃ dhíyaḥ  tríḥ saubhagatváṃ trír utá śrávāṃsi nas  triṣṭháṃ vāṃ sū́re duhitā́ ruhad rátham

translation.text: Thrice, O ye Aṣvins, bring to us abundant wealth: thrice in the Gods' assembly, thrice assist our thoughts. Thrice, grant ye us prosperity, thrice grant us fame; for the Sun's daughter hath mounted your threewheeled car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिर्नो॑ अश्विना दि॒व्यानि॑ भेष॒जा त्रिः पार्थि॑वानि॒ त्रिरु॑ दत्तम॒द्भ्यः ओ॒मानं॑ शं॒योर्मम॑काय सू॒नवे॑ त्रि॒धातु॒ शर्म॑ वहतं शुभस्पती
verses.transliteration: trír no aśvinā divyā́ni bheṣajā́  tríḥ pā́rthivāni trír u dattam adbhyáḥ  omā́naṃ śaṃyór mámakāya sūnáve  tridhā́tu śárma vahataṃ śubhas patī

translation.text: Thrice, Aṣvins, grant to us the heavenly medicines, thrice those of earth and thrice those that the waters hold, Favour and health and strength bestow upon my son; triple protection, Lords of Splendour, grant to him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिर्नो॑ अश्विना यज॒ता दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ परि॑ त्रि॒धातु॑ पृथि॒वीम॑शायतम् ति॒स्रो ना॑सत्या रथ्या परा॒वत॑ आ॒त्मेव॒ वातः॒ स्वस॑राणि गच्छतम्
verses.transliteration: trír no aśvinā yajatā́ divé-dive  pári tridhā́tu pr̥thivī́m aśāyatam  tisró nāsatyā rathyā parāvátaḥ-  ātméva vā́taḥ svásarāṇi gachatam

translation.text: Thrice are ye to be worshipped day by day by us: thrice, O ye Aṣvins, ye travel around the earth. Car-borne from far away, O ye Nâsatyas, come, like vital air to bodies, come ye to the three.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिर॑श्विना॒ सिन्धु॑भिः स॒प्तमा॑तृभि॒स्त्रय॑ आहा॒वास्त्रे॒धा ह॒विष्कृ॒तम् ति॒स्रः पृ॑थि॒वीरु॒परि॑ प्र॒वा दि॒वो नाकं॑ रक्षेथे॒ द्युभि॑र॒क्तुभि॑र्हि॒तम्
verses.transliteration: trír aśvinā síndhubhiḥ saptámātr̥bhis  tráya āhāvā́s tredhā́ havíṣ kr̥tám  tisráḥ pr̥thivī́r upári pravā́ divó  nā́kaṃ rakṣethe dyúbhir aktúbhir hitám

translation.text: Thrice, O ye Aṣvins, with the Seven Mother Streams; three are the jars, the triple offering is prepared. Three are the worlds, and moving on above the sky ye guard the firm-set vault of heaven through days and nights.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व१॒॑ त्री च॒क्रा त्रि॒वृतो॒ रथ॑स्य॒ क्व१॒॑ त्रयो॑ व॒न्धुरो॒ ये सनी॑ळाः क॒दा योगो॑ वा॒जिनो॒ रास॑भस्य॒ येन॑ य॒ज्ञं ना॑सत्योपया॒थः
verses.transliteration: kvà trī́ cakrā́ trivŕ̥to ráthasya  kvà tráyo vandhúro yé sánīḷāḥ  kadā́ yógo vājíno rā́sabhasya  yéna yajñáṃ nāsatyopayātháḥ

translation.text: Where are the three wheels of your triple chariot, where are the three seats thereto firmly fastened? When will ye yoke the mighty ass that draws it, to bring you to our sacrifice. Nâsatyas?

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ना॑सत्या॒ गच्छ॑तं हू॒यते॑ ह॒विर्मध्वः॑ पिबतं मधु॒पेभि॑रा॒सभिः॑ यु॒वोर्हि पूर्वं॑ सवि॒तोषसो॒ रथ॑मृ॒ताय॑ चि॒त्रं घृ॒तव॑न्त॒मिष्य॑ति
verses.transliteration: ā́ nāsatyā gáchataṃ hūyáte havír  mádhvaḥ pibatam madhupébhir āsábhiḥ  yuvór hí pū́rvaṃ savitóṣáso rátham  r̥tā́ya citráṃ ghr̥távantam íṣyati

translation.text: Nâsatyas, come: the sacred gift is offered up; drink the sweet juice with lips that know the sweetness well. Savitar sends, before the dawn of day, your car, fraught with oil, various-coloured, to our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ना॑सत्या त्रि॒भिरे॑काद॒शैरि॒ह दे॒वेभि॑र्यातं मधु॒पेय॑मश्विना प्रायु॒स्तारि॑ष्टं॒ नी रपां॑सि मृक्षतं॒ सेध॑तं॒ द्वेषो॒ भव॑तं सचा॒भुवा॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ nāsatyā tribhír ekādaśaír ihá  devébhir yātam madhupéyam aśvinā  prā́yus tā́riṣṭaṃ nī́ rápāṃsi mr̥kṣataṃ  sédhataṃ dvéṣo bhávataṃ sacābhúvā

translation.text: Come, O Nâsatyas, with the thrice-eleven Gods; come, O ye Aṣvins, to the drinking of the meath. Make long our days of life, and wipe out all our sins: ward off our enemies; be with us evermore.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ अश्विना त्रि॒वृता॒ रथे॑ना॒र्वाञ्चं॑ र॒यिं व॑हतं सु॒वीर॑म् शृ॒ण्वन्ता॑ वा॒मव॑से जोहवीमि वृ॒धे च॑ नो भवतं॒ वाज॑सातौ
verses.transliteration: ā́ no aśvinā trivŕ̥tā ráthena-  -arvā́ñcaṃ rayíṃ vahataṃ suvī́ram  śr̥ṇvántā vām ávase johavīmi  vr̥dhé ca no bhavataṃ vā́jasātau

translation.text: Borne in your triple car, O Aṣvins, bring us present prosperity with noble offspring. I cry to you who hear me for protection be ye our helpers where men win the booty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह्वया॑म्य॒ग्निं प्र॑थ॒मं स्व॒स्तये॒ ह्वया॑मि मि॒त्रावरु॑णावि॒हाव॑से ह्वया॑मि॒ रात्रीं॒ जग॑तो नि॒वेश॑नीं॒ ह्वया॑मि दे॒वं स॑वि॒तार॑मू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: hváyāmy agním prathamáṃ svastáye  hváyāmi mitrā́váruṇāv ihā́vase  hváyāmi rā́trīṃ jágato nivéśanīṃ  hváyāmi deváṃ savitā́ram ūtáye

translation.text: AGNI I first invoke for our prosperity; I call on Mitra, Varuṇa, to aid us here. I call on Night who gives rest to all moving life; I call on Savitar the God to lend us help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ कृ॒ष्णेन॒ रज॑सा॒ वर्त॑मानो निवे॒शय॑न्न॒मृतं॒ मर्त्यं॑ च हि॒र॒ण्यये॑न सवि॒ता रथे॒ना दे॒वो या॑ति॒ भुव॑नानि॒ पश्य॑न्
verses.transliteration: ā́ kr̥ṣṇéna rájasā vártamāno  niveśáyann amŕ̥tam mártyaṃ ca  hiraṇyáyena savitā́ ráthena-  -ā́ devó yāti bhúvanāni páśyan

translation.text: Throughout the dusky firmament advancing, laying to rest the immortal and the mortal, Borne in his golden chariot he cometh, Savitar, God who looks on every creature.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याति॑ दे॒वः प्र॒वता॒ यात्यु॒द्वता॒ याति॑ शु॒भ्राभ्यां॑ यज॒तो हरि॑भ्याम् आ दे॒वो या॑ति सवि॒ता प॑रा॒वतोऽप॒ विश्वा॑ दुरि॒ता बाध॑मानः
verses.transliteration: yā́ti deváḥ pravátā yā́ty udvátā  yā́ti śubhrā́bhyāṃ yajató háribhyām  ā́ devó yāti savitā́ parāvátaḥ-  -ápa víśvā duritā́ bā́dhamānaḥ

translation.text: The God moves by the upward path, the downward; with two bright Bays, adorable, he journeys. Savitar comes, the God from the far distance, and chases from us all distress and sorrow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भीवृ॑तं॒ कृश॑नैर्वि॒श्वरू॑पं॒ हिर॑ण्यशम्यं यज॒तो बृ॒हन्त॑म् आस्था॒द्रथं॑ सवि॒ता चि॒त्रभा॑नुः कृ॒ष्णा रजां॑सि॒ तवि॑षीं॒ दधा॑नः
verses.transliteration: abhī́vr̥taṃ kŕ̥śanair viśvárūpaṃ  híraṇyaśamyaṃ yajató br̥hántam  ā́sthād ráthaṃ savitā́ citrábhānuḥ  kr̥ṣṇā́ rájāṃsi táviṣīṃ dádhānaḥ

translation.text: His chariot decked with pearl, of various colours, lofty, with golden pole, the God hath mounted, The many-rayed One, Savitar the holy, bound, bearing power and might, for darksome regions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि जना॑ञ्छ्या॒वाः शि॑ति॒पादो॑ अख्य॒न्रथं॒ हिर॑ण्यप्रउगं॒ वह॑न्तः शश्व॒द्विशः॑ सवि॒तुर्दैव्य॑स्यो॒पस्थे॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि तस्थुः
verses.transliteration: ví jánāñ chyāvā́ḥ śitipā́do akhyan  ráthaṃ híraṇyapraÅgaṃ váhantaḥ  śáśvad víśaḥ savitúr daívyasya-  -upásthe víśvā bhúvanāni tasthuḥ

translation.text: Drawing the gold-yoked car his Bays, white-footed, have manifested light to all the peoples. Held in the lap of Savitar, divine One, all men, all beings have their place for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒स्रो द्यावः॑ सवि॒तुर्द्वा उ॒पस्थाँ॒ एका॑ य॒मस्य॒ भुव॑ने विरा॒षाट् आ॒णिं न रथ्य॑म॒मृताधि॑ तस्थुरि॒ह ब्र॑वीतु॒ य उ॒ तच्चिके॑तत्
verses.transliteration: tisró dyā́vaḥ savitúr dvā́ upásthām̐  ékā yamásya bhúvane virāṣā́ṭ  āṇíṃ ná ráthyam amŕ̥tā́dhi tasthur  ihá bravītu yá u tác cíketat

translation.text: Three heavens there are; two Savitar's, adjacent: in Yama's world is one, the home of heroes, As on a linch-pin, firm, rest things immortal: he who hath known it let him here declare it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि सु॑प॒र्णो अ॒न्तरि॑क्षाण्यख्यद्गभी॒रवे॑पा॒ असु॑रः सुनी॒थः क्वे॒३॒॑दानीं॒ सूर्यः॒ कश्चि॑केत कत॒मां द्यां र॒श्मिर॒स्या त॑तान
verses.transliteration: ví suparṇó antárikṣāṇy akhyad  gabhīrávepā ásuraḥ sunītháḥ  kvèdā́nīṃ sū́ryaḥ káś ciketa  katamā́ṃ dyā́ṃ raśmír asyā́ tatāna

translation.text: He, strong of wing, hath lightened up the regions, deep-quivering Asura, the gentle Leader. Where now is Sûrya, where is one to tell us to what celestial sphere his ray hath wandered?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ष्टौ व्य॑ख्यत्क॒कुभः॑ पृथि॒व्यास्त्री धन्व॒ योज॑ना स॒प्त सिन्धू॑न् हि॒र॒ण्या॒क्षः स॑वि॒ता दे॒व आगा॒द्दध॒द्रत्ना॑ दा॒शुषे॒ वार्या॑णि
verses.transliteration: aṣṭaú vy àkhyat kakúbhaḥ pr̥thivyā́s  trī́ dhánva yójanā saptá síndhūn  hiraṇyākṣáḥ savitā́ devá ā́gād  dádhad rátnā dāśúṣe vā́ryāṇi

translation.text: The earth's eight points his brightness hath illumined, three desert regions and the Seven Rivers. God Savitar the gold-eyed hath come hither, giving choice treasures unto him who worships.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यपाणिः सवि॒ता विच॑र्षणिरु॒भे द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॒न्तरी॑यते अपामी॑वां॒ बाध॑ते॒ वेति॒ सूर्य॑म॒भि कृ॒ष्णेन॒ रज॑सा॒ द्यामृ॑णोति
verses.transliteration: híraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā́ vícarṣaṇir  ubhé dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ antár īyate  ápā́mīvām bā́dhate véti sū́ryam  abhí kr̥ṣṇéna rájasā dyā́m r̥ṇoti

translation.text: The golden-handed Savitar, far-seeing, goes on his way between the earth and heaven, Drives away sickness, bids the Sun approach us, and spreads the bright sky through the darksome region.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यहस्तो॒ असु॑रः सुनी॒थः सु॑मृळी॒कः स्ववाँ॑ यात्व॒र्वाङ् अ॒प॒सेध॑न्र॒क्षसो॑ यातु॒धाना॒नस्था॑द्दे॒वः प्र॑तिदो॒षं गृ॑णा॒नः
verses.transliteration: híraṇyahasto ásuraḥ sunītháḥ  sumr̥ḷīkáḥ svávām̐ yātv arvā́ṅ  apasédhan rakṣáso yātudhā́nān  ásthād deváḥ pratidoṣáṃ gr̥ṇānáḥ

translation.text: May he, gold-handed Asura, kind Leader, come hither to us with his help and favour. Driving off Raksasas and Yatudhanas, the God is present, praised in hymns at evening.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये ते॒ पन्थाः॑ सवितः पू॒र्व्यासो॑ऽरे॒णवः॒ सुकृ॑ता अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे तेभि॑र्नो अ॒द्य प॒थिभिः॑ सु॒गेभी॒ रक्षा॑ च नो॒ अधि॑ च ब्रूहि देव
verses.transliteration: yé te pánthāḥ savitaḥ pūrvyā́so  -areṇávaḥ súkr̥tā antárikṣe  tébhir no adyá pathíbhiḥ sugébhir-  rákṣā ca no ádhi ca brūhi deva

translation.text: O Savitar, thine ancient dustless pathways are well established in the air's midregion: O God, come by those paths so fair to travel, preserve thou us from harm this day, and bless us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ य॒ह्वं पु॑रू॒णां वि॒शां दे॑वय॒तीना॑म् अ॒ग्निं सू॒क्तेभि॒र्वचो॑भिरीमहे॒ यं सी॒मिद॒न्य ईळ॑ते
verses.transliteration: prá vo yahvám purūṇā́ṃ  viśā́ṃ devayatī́nām  agníṃ sūktébhir vácobhir īmahe  yáṃ sīm íd anyá ī́ḷate

translation.text: WITH words sent forth in holy hymns, Agni we supplicate, the Lord Of many families who duly serve the Gods, yea, him whom others also praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जना॑सो अ॒ग्निं द॑धिरे सहो॒वृधं॑ ह॒विष्म॑न्तो विधेम ते स त्वं नो॑ अ॒द्य सु॒मना॑ इ॒हावि॒ता भवा॒ वाजे॑षु सन्त्य
verses.transliteration: jánāso agníṃ dadhire sahovŕ̥dhaṃ  havíṣmanto vidhema te  sá tváṃ no adyá sumánā ihā́vitā́  bhávā vā́jeṣu santya

translation.text: Men have won Agni, him who makes their strength abound: we, with oblations, worship thee. Our gracious-minded Helper in our deeds of might, be thou, O Excellent, this day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र त्वा॑ दू॒तं वृ॑णीमहे॒ होता॑रं वि॒श्ववे॑दसम् म॒हस्ते॑ स॒तो वि च॑रन्त्य॒र्चयो॑ दि॒वि स्पृ॑शन्ति भा॒नवः॑
verses.transliteration: prá tvā dūtáṃ vr̥ṇīmahe  hótāraṃ viśvávedasam  mahás te sató ví caranty arcáyo  diví spr̥śanti bhānávaḥ

translation.text: Thee for our messenger we choose, thee, the Omniscient, for our Priest. The flames of thee the mighty are spread wide around: thy splendour reaches to the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वास॑स्त्वा॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा सं दू॒तं प्र॒त्नमि॑न्धते विश्वं॒ सो अ॑ग्ने जयति॒ त्वया॒ धनं॒ यस्ते॑ द॒दाश॒ मर्त्यः॑
verses.transliteration: devā́sas tvā váruṇo mitró aryamā́  sáṃ dūtám pratnám indhate  víśvaṃ só agne jayati tváyā dhánaṃ  yás te dadā́śa mártyaḥ

translation.text: The Gods enkindle thee their ancient messenger, – Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman. That mortal man, O Agni, gains through thee all wealth, who hath poured offerings unto thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒न्द्रो होता॑ गृ॒हप॑ति॒रग्ने॑ दू॒तो वि॒शाम॑सि त्वे विश्वा॒ संग॑तानि व्र॒ता ध्रु॒वा यानि॑ दे॒वा अकृ॑ण्वत
verses.transliteration: mandró hótā gr̥hápatir  ágne dūtó viśā́m asi  tvé víśvā sáṃgatāni vratā́ dhruvā́  yā́ni devā́ ákr̥ṇvata

translation.text: Thou, Agni, art a cheering Priest, Lord of the House, men's messenger: All constant high decrees established by the Gods, gathered together, meet in thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे इद॑ग्ने सु॒भगे॑ यविष्ठ्य॒ विश्व॒मा हू॑यते ह॒विः स त्वं नो॑ अ॒द्य सु॒मना॑ उ॒ताप॒रं यक्षि॑ दे॒वान्त्सु॒वीर्या॑
verses.transliteration: tvé íd agne subháge yaviṣṭhya  víśvam ā́ hūyate havíḥ  sá tváṃ no adyá sumánā utā́paráṃ  yákṣi devā́n suvī́ryā

translation.text: In thee, the auspicious One, O Agni, youthfullest, each sacred gift is offered up: This day, and after, gracious, worship thou our Gods, that we may have heroic sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं घे॑मि॒त्था न॑म॒स्विन॒ उप॑ स्व॒राज॑मासते होत्रा॑भिर॒ग्निं मनु॑षः॒ समि॑न्धते तिति॒र्वांसो॒ अति॒ स्रिधः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ ghem itthā́ namasvínaḥ-  úpa svarā́jam āsate  hótrābhir agním mánuṣaḥ sám indhate  titirvā́ṃso áti srídhaḥ

translation.text: To him in his own splendour bright draw near in worship the devout. Men kindle Agni with their sacrificial gifts, victorious o'er the enemies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घ्नन्तो॑ वृ॒त्रम॑तर॒न्रोद॑सी अ॒प उ॒रु क्षया॑य चक्रिरे भुव॒त्कण्वे॒ वृषा॑ द्यु॒म्न्याहु॑तः॒ क्रन्द॒दश्वो॒ गवि॑ष्टिषु
verses.transliteration: ghnánto vr̥trám ataran ródasī apáḥ-  urú kṣáyāya cakrire  bhúvat káṇve vŕ̥ṣā dyumny ā́hutaḥ  krándad áśvo gáviṣṭiṣu

translation.text: Vr̥itra they smote and slew, and made the earth and heaven and firmament a wide abode. The glorious Bull, invoked, hath stood at Kaṇva's side: loud neighed the Steed in frays for kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं सी॑दस्व म॒हाँ अ॑सि॒ शोच॑स्व देव॒वीत॑मः वि धू॒मम॑ग्ने अरु॒षं मि॑येध्य सृ॒ज प्र॑शस्त दर्श॒तम्
verses.transliteration: sáṃ sīdasva mahā́m̐ asi  śócasva devavī́tamaḥ  ví dhūmám agne aruṣám miyedhya  sr̥já praśasta darśatám

translation.text: Seat thee, for thou art mighty; shine, best entertainer of the Gods. Worthy of sacred food, praised Agni! loose the smoke, ruddy and beautiful to see.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं त्वा॑ दे॒वासो॒ मन॑वे द॒धुरि॒ह यजि॑ष्ठं हव्यवाहन यं कण्वो॒ मेध्या॑तिथिर्धन॒स्पृतं॒ यं वृषा॒ यमु॑पस्तु॒तः
verses.transliteration: yáṃ tvā devā́so mánave dadhúr ihá  yájiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhana  yáṃ káṇvo médhyātithir dhanaspŕ̥taṃ  yáṃ vŕ̥ṣā yám upastutáḥ

translation.text: Bearer of offerings, whom, best sacrificing Priest, the Gods for Manu's sake ordained; Whom Kaṇva, whom Medhyâtithi made the source of wealth, and Vr̥ishan and Upastuta.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यम॒ग्निं मेध्या॑तिथिः॒ कण्व॑ ई॒ध ऋ॒तादधि॑ तस्य॒ प्रेषो॑ दीदियु॒स्तमि॒मा ऋच॒स्तम॒ग्निं व॑र्धयामसि
verses.transliteration: yám agním médhyātithiḥ  káṇva īdhá r̥tā́d ádhi  tásya préṣo dīdiyus tám imā́ ŕ̥cas  tám agníṃ vardhayāmasi

translation.text: Him, Agni, whom Medhyâtithi, whom Kaṇva kindled for his rite, Him these our songs of praise, him, Agni, we extol: his powers shine out preeminent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रा॒यस्पू॑र्धि स्वधा॒वोऽस्ति॒ हि तेऽग्ने॑ दे॒वेष्वाप्य॑म् त्वं वाज॑स्य॒ श्रुत्य॑स्य राजसि॒ स नो॑ मृळ म॒हाँ अ॑सि
verses.transliteration: rāyás pūrdhi svadhāvó 'sti hí te-  -ágne devéṣv ā́pyam  tváṃ vā́jasya śrútyasya rājasi  sá no mr̥ḷa mahā́m̐ asi

translation.text: Make our wealth perfect thou, O Agni, Lord divine: for thou hast kinship with the Gods. Thou rulest as a King o'er widely-famous strength: be good to us, for thou art great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्व ऊ॒ षु ण॑ ऊ॒तये॒ तिष्ठा॑ दे॒वो न स॑वि॒ता ऊ॒र्ध्वो वाज॑स्य॒ सनि॑ता॒ यद॒ञ्जिभि॑र्वा॒घद्भि॑र्वि॒ह्वया॑महे
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvá ū ṣú ṇa ūtáye  tíṣṭhā devó ná savitā́  ūrdhvó vā́jasya sánitā yád añjíbhir  vāghádbhir vihváyāmahe

translation.text: Stand up erect to lend us aid, stand up like Savitar the God: Erect as strength-bestower we call aloud, with unguents and with priests, on thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वो नः॑ पा॒ह्यंह॑सो॒ नि के॒तुना॒ विश्वं॒ सम॒त्रिणं॑ दह कृ॒धी न॑ ऊ॒र्ध्वाञ्च॒रथा॑य जी॒वसे॑ वि॒दा दे॒वेषु॑ नो॒ दुवः॑
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvó naḥ pāhy áṃhaso ní ketúnā  víśvaṃ sám atríṇaṃ daha  kr̥dhī́ na ūrdhvā́ñ caráthāya jīváse  vidā́ devéṣu no dúvaḥ

translation.text: Erect, preserve us from sore trouble; with thy flame burn thou each ravening demon dead. Raise thou us up that we may walk and live. so thou shalt find our worship mid the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पा॒हि नो॑ अग्ने र॒क्षसः॑ पा॒हि धू॒र्तेररा॑व्णः पा॒हि रीष॑त उ॒त वा॒ जिघां॑सतो॒ बृह॑द्भानो॒ यवि॑ष्ठ्य
verses.transliteration: pāhí no agne rakṣásaḥ  pāhí dhūrtér árāvṇaḥ  pāhí rī́ṣata utá vā jíghāṃsato  bŕ̥hadbhāno yáviṣṭhya

translation.text: Preserve us, Agni, from the fiend, preserve us from malicious wrong. Save us from him who fain would injure us or slay, Most Youthful, thou with lofty light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घ॒नेव॒ विष्व॒ग्वि ज॒ह्यरा॑व्ण॒स्तपु॑र्जम्भ॒ यो अ॑स्म॒ध्रुक् यो मर्त्यः॒ शिशी॑ते॒ अत्य॒क्तुभि॒र्मा नः॒ स रि॒पुरी॑शत
verses.transliteration: ghanéva víṣvag ví jahy árāvṇas  tápurjambha yó asmadhrúk  yó mártyaḥ śíśīte áty aktúbhir  mā́ naḥ sá ripúr īśata

translation.text: Smite down as with a club, thou who hast fire for teeth, smite thou the wicked, right and left. Let not the man who plots against us in the night, nor any foe prevail o'er us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्व॑व्ने सु॒वीर्य॑म॒ग्निः कण्वा॑य॒ सौभ॑गम् अ॒ग्निः प्राव॑न्मि॒त्रोत मेध्या॑तिथिम॒ग्निः सा॒ता उ॑पस्तु॒तम्
verses.transliteration: agnír vavne suvī́ryam  agníḥ káṇvāya saúbhagam  agníḥ prā́van mitrótá médhyātithim  agníḥ sātā́ upastutám

translation.text: Agni hath given heroic might to Kainva, and felicity: Agni hath helped our friends, hath helped Medhyitithi, hath helped Upastuta to win.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निना॑ तु॒र्वशं॒ यदुं॑ परा॒वत॑ उ॒ग्रादे॑वं हवामहे अ॒ग्निर्न॑य॒न्नव॑वास्त्वं बृ॒हद्र॑थं तु॒र्वीतिं॒ दस्य॑वे॒ सहः॑
verses.transliteration: agnínā turváśaṃ yádum parāvátaḥ-  ugrā́devaṃ havāmahe  agnír nayan návavāstvam br̥hádrathaṃ  turvī́tiṃ dásyave sáhaḥ

translation.text: We call on Ugrâdeva, Yadu, Turvaṣa, by means of Agni, from afar; Agni, bring Navavâstva and Br̥ihadratba, Turvîti, to subdue the foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ मनु॑र्दधे॒ ज्योति॒र्जना॑य॒ शश्व॑ते दी॒देथ॒ कण्व॑ ऋ॒तजा॑त उक्षि॒तो यं न॑म॒स्यन्ति॑ कृ॒ष्टयः॑
verses.transliteration: ní tvā́m agne mánur dadhe  jyótir jánāya śáśvate  dīdétha káṇva r̥tájāta ukṣitó  yáṃ namasyánti kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ

translation.text: Manu hath stablished thee a light, Agni, for all the race of men: Sprung from the Law, oil-fed, for Kaṇva hast thou blazed, thou whom the people reverence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे॒षासो॑ अ॒ग्नेरम॑वन्तो अ॒र्चयो॑ भी॒मासो॒ न प्रती॑तये र॒क्ष॒स्विनः॒ सद॒मिद्या॑तु॒माव॑तो॒ विश्वं॒ सम॒त्रिणं॑ दह
verses.transliteration: tveṣā́so agnér ámavanto arcáyo  bhīmā́so ná prátītaye  rakṣasvínaḥ sádam íd yātumā́vato  víśvaṃ sám atríṇaṃ daha

translation.text: The flames of Agni full of splendour and of might are fearful, not to be approached. Consume for ever all demons and sorcerers, consume thou each devouring fiend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्री॒ळं वः॒ शर्धो॒ मारु॑तमन॒र्वाणं॑ रथे॒शुभ॑म् कण्वा॑ अ॒भि प्र गा॑यत
verses.transliteration: krīḷáṃ vaḥ śárdho mā́rutam  anarvā́ṇaṃ ratheśúbham  káṇvā abhí prá gāyata

translation.text: SING forth, O Kaṇvas, to your band of Maruts unassailable, Sporting, resplendent on their car

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये पृष॑तीभिर्ऋ॒ष्टिभिः॑ सा॒कं वाशी॑भिर॒ञ्जिभिः॑ अजा॑यन्त॒ स्वभा॑नवः
verses.transliteration: yé pŕ̥ṣatībhir r̥ṣṭíbhiḥ  sākáṃ vā́śībhir añjíbhiḥ  ájāyanta svábhānavaḥ

translation.text: They who, self-luminous, were born together, with the spotted deer, Spears, swords, and glittering ornaments.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒हेव॑ शृण्व एषां॒ कशा॒ हस्ते॑षु॒ यद्वदा॑न् नि याम॑ञ्चि॒त्रमृ॑ञ्जते
verses.transliteration: ihéva śr̥ṇva eṣāṃ  káśā hásteṣu yád vádān  ní yā́mañ citrám r̥ñjate

translation.text: One hears, as though 'twere close at hand, the cracking of the whips they hold They gather glory on their way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वः॒ शर्धा॑य॒ घृष्व॑ये त्वे॒षद्यु॑म्नाय शु॒ष्मिणे॑ दे॒वत्तं॒ ब्रह्म॑ गायत
verses.transliteration: prá vaḥ śárdhāya ghŕ̥ṣvaye  tveṣádyumnāya śuṣmíṇe  deváttam bráhma gāyata

translation.text: Now sing ye forth the God-given hymn to your exultant Marut host, The fiercely-vigorous, the strong.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र शं॑सा॒ गोष्वघ्न्यं॑ क्री॒ळं यच्छर्धो॒ मारु॑तम् जम्भे॒ रस॑स्य वावृधे
verses.transliteration: prá śaṃsā góṣv ághnyaṃ  krīḷáṃ yác chárdho mā́rutam  jámbhe rásasya vāvr̥dhe
