translation.text: Praise ye the Bull among the cows; for 'tis the Maruts' sportive band: It strengthened as it drank the rain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को वो॒ वर्षि॑ष्ठ॒ आ न॑रो दि॒वश्च॒ ग्मश्च॑ धूतयः यत्सी॒मन्तं॒ न धू॑नु॒थ
verses.transliteration: kó vo várṣiṣṭha ā́ naro  diváś ca gmáś ca dhūtayaḥ  yát sīm ántaṃ ná dhūnuthá

translation.text: Who is your mightiest, Heroes, when, O shakers of the earth and heaven, Ye shake them like a garment's hem?

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि वो॒ यामा॑य॒ मानु॑षो द॒ध्र उ॒ग्राय॑ म॒न्यवे॑ जिही॑त॒ पर्व॑तो गि॒रिः
verses.transliteration: ní vo yā́māya mā́nuṣo  dadhrá ugrā́ya manyáve  jíhīta párvato giríḥ

translation.text: At your approach man holds him down before the fury of your wrath: The rugged-jointed mountain yields.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येषा॒मज्मे॑षु पृथि॒वी जु॑जु॒र्वाँ इ॑व वि॒श्पतिः॑ भि॒या यामे॑षु॒ रेज॑ते
verses.transliteration: yéṣām ájmeṣu pr̥thivī́  jujurvā́m̐ iva viśpátiḥ  bhiyā́ yā́meṣu réjate

translation.text: They at whose racings forth the earth, like an age-weakened lord of men, Trembles in terror on their ways.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्थि॒रं हि जान॑मेषां॒ वयो॑ मा॒तुर्निरे॑तवे यत्सी॒मनु॑ द्वि॒ता शवः॑
verses.transliteration: sthiráṃ hí jā́nam eṣāṃ  váyo mātúr níretave  yát sīm ánu dvitā́ śávaḥ

translation.text: Strong is their birth: vigour have they to issue from their Mother; strength, Yea, even twice enough, is theirs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ त्ये सू॒नवो॒ गिरः॒ काष्ठा॒ अज्मे॑ष्वत्नत वा॒श्रा अ॑भि॒ज्ञु यात॑वे
verses.transliteration: úd u tyé sūnávo gíraḥ  kā́ṣṭhā ájmeṣv atnata  vāśrā́ abhijñú yā́tave

translation.text: And these, the Sons, the Singers, in their racings have enlarged the bounds, So that the kine must walk knee-deep.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्यं चि॑द्घा दी॒र्घं पृ॒थुं मि॒हो नपा॑त॒ममृ॑ध्रम् प्र च्या॑वयन्ति॒ याम॑भिः
verses.transliteration: tyáṃ cid ghā dīrghám pr̥thúm  mihó nápātam ámr̥dhram  prá cyāvayanti yā́mabhiḥ

translation.text: Before them, on the ways they go, they drop this offspring of the cloud, Long, broad, and inexhaustible.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मरु॑तो॒ यद्ध॑ वो॒ बलं॒ जनाँ॑ अचुच्यवीतन गि॒रीँर॑चुच्यवीतन
verses.transliteration: máruto yád dha vo bálaṃ  jánām̐ acucyavītana  girī́m̐r acucyavītana

translation.text: O Maruts, as your strength is great, so have ye cast men down on earth, So have ye made the mountains fall.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्ध॒ यान्ति॑ म॒रुतः॒ सं ह॑ ब्रुव॒तेऽध्व॒न्ना शृ॒णोति॒ कश्चि॑देषाम्
verses.transliteration: yád dha yā́nti marútaḥ  sáṃ ha bruvaté 'dhvann ā́  śr̥ṇóti káś cid eṣām

translation.text: The while the Maruts pass along, they talk together on the way: Doth any hear them as they speak?

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र या॑त॒ शीभ॑मा॒शुभिः॒ सन्ति॒ कण्वे॑षु वो॒ दुवः॑ तत्रो॒ षु मा॑दयाध्वै
verses.transliteration: prá yāta śī́bham āśúbhiḥ  sánti káṇveṣu vo dúvaḥ  tátro ṣú mādayādhvai

translation.text: Come quick with swift steeds, for ye have worshippers among Kaṇva's sons May you rejoice among them well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्ति॒ हि ष्मा॒ मदा॑य वः॒ स्मसि॑ ष्मा व॒यमे॑षाम् विश्वं॑ चि॒दायु॑र्जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: ásti hí ṣmā mádāya vaḥ  smási ṣmā vayám eṣām  víśvaṃ cid ā́yur jīváse

translation.text: All is prepared for your delight. We are their servants evermore, To live as long as life may last.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कद्ध॑ नू॒नं क॑धप्रियः पि॒ता पु॒त्रं न हस्त॑योः द॒धि॒ध्वे वृ॑क्तबर्हिषः
verses.transliteration: kád dha nūnáṃ kadhapriyaḥ  pitā́ putráṃ ná hástayoḥ  dadhidhvé vr̥ktabarhiṣaḥ

translation.text: WHAT now? When will ye take us by both hands, as a dear sire his son, Gods, for whom sacred grass is clipped?

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व॑ नू॒नं कद्वो॒ अर्थं॒ गन्ता॑ दि॒वो न पृ॑थि॒व्याः क्व॑ वो॒ गावो॒ न र॑ण्यन्ति
verses.transliteration: kvà nūnáṃ kád vo árthaṃ  gántā divó ná pr̥thivyā́ḥ  kvà vo gā́vo ná raṇyanti

translation.text: Now whither? To what goal of yours go ye in heaven, and not on earth? Where do your cows disport themselves?

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व॑ वः सु॒म्ना नव्यां॑सि॒ मरु॑तः॒ क्व॑ सुवि॒ता क्वो॒३॒॑ विश्वा॑नि॒ सौभ॑गा
verses.transliteration: kvà vaḥ sumnā́ návyāṃsi  márutaḥ kvà suvitā́  kvò víśvāni saúbhagā

translation.text: Where are your newest favours shown? Where, Maruts, your prosperity? Where all your high felicities?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्यू॒यं पृ॑श्निमातरो॒ मर्ता॑सः॒ स्यात॑न स्तो॒ता वो॑ अ॒मृतः॑ स्यात्
verses.transliteration: yád yūyám pr̥śnimātaro  mártāsaḥ syā́tana  stotā́ vo amŕ̥taḥ syāt

translation.text: If, O ye Maruts, ye the Sons whom Pr̥iṣni bore, were mortal, and Immortal he who sings your praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा वो॑ मृ॒गो न यव॑से जरि॒ता भू॒दजो॑ष्यः प॒था य॒मस्य॑ गा॒दुप॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ vo mr̥gó ná yávase  jaritā́ bhūd ájoṣyaḥ  pathā́ yamásya gād úpa

translation.text: Then never were your praiser loathed like a wild beast in pasture-land, Nor should he go on Yama's path.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मो षु णः॒ परा॑परा॒ निर्ऋ॑तिर्दु॒र्हणा॑ वधीत् प॒दी॒ष्ट तृष्ण॑या स॒ह
verses.transliteration: mó ṣú ṇaḥ párā-parā  nírr̥tir durháṇā vadhīt  padīṣṭá tŕ̥ṣṇayā sahá

translation.text: Let not destructive plague on plague hard to be conquered, strike its down: Let each, with drought, depart from us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्यं त्वे॒षा अम॑वन्तो॒ धन्व॑ञ्चि॒दा रु॒द्रिया॑सः मिहं॑ कृण्वन्त्यवा॒ताम्
verses.transliteration: satyáṃ tveṣā́ ámavanto  dhánvañ cid ā́ rudríyāsaḥ  míhaṃ kr̥ṇvanty avātā́m

translation.text: Truly, they the fierce and mighty Sons of Rudra send their windless Rain e'en on the desert places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒श्रेव॑ वि॒द्युन्मि॑माति व॒त्सं न मा॒ता सि॑षक्ति यदे॑षां वृ॒ष्टिरस॑र्जि
verses.transliteration: vāśréva vidyún mimāti  vatsáṃ ná mātā́ siṣakti  yád eṣāṃ vr̥ṣṭír ásarji

translation.text: Like a cow the lightning lows and follows, motherlike, her youngling, When their rain-flood hath been loosened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दिवा॑ चि॒त्तमः॑ कृण्वन्ति प॒र्जन्ये॑नोदवा॒हेन॑ यत्पृ॑थि॒वीं व्यु॒न्दन्ति॑
verses.transliteration: dívā cit támaḥ kr̥ṇvanti  parjányenodavāhéna  yát pr̥thivī́ṃ vyundánti

translation.text: When they inundate the earth they spread forth darkness e'en in day time, With the water-laden rain-cloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॑ स्व॒नान्म॒रुतां॒ विश्व॒मा सद्म॒ पार्थि॑वम् अरे॑जन्त॒ प्र मानु॑षाः
verses.transliteration: ádha svanā́n marútāṃ  víśvam ā́ sádma pā́rthivam  árejanta prá mā́nuṣāḥ

translation.text: O Maruts, at your voice's sound this earthly habitation shakes, And each man reels who dwells therein.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मरु॑तो वीळुपा॒णिभि॑श्चि॒त्रा रोध॑स्वती॒रनु॑ या॒तेमखि॑द्रयामभिः
verses.transliteration: máruto vīḷupāṇíbhiś  citrā́ ródhasvatīr ánu  yātém ákhidrayāmabhiḥ

translation.text: O Maruts, with your strong-hoofed steeds, unhindered in their courses, haste Along the bright embanked streams.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्थि॒रा वः॑ सन्तु ने॒मयो॒ रथा॒ अश्वा॑स एषाम् सुसं॑स्कृता अ॒भीश॑वः
verses.transliteration: sthirā́ vaḥ santu nemáyo  ráthā áśvāsa eṣām  súsaṃskr̥tā abhī́śavaḥ

translation.text: Firm be the fellies of your wheels, steady your horses and your cars, And may your reins be fashioned well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ वदा॒ तना॑ गि॒रा ज॒रायै॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॑म् अ॒ग्निं मि॒त्रं न द॑र्श॒तम्
verses.transliteration: áchā vadā tánā girā́  jarā́yai bráhmaṇas pátim  agním mitráṃ ná darśatám

translation.text: Invite thou hither with this song, for praise, Agni the Lord of Prayer, Him who is fair as Mitra is.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒मी॒हि श्लोक॑मा॒स्ये॑ प॒र्जन्य॑ इव ततनः गाय॑ गाय॒त्रमु॒क्थ्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: mimīhí ślókam āsyè  parjánya iva tatanaḥ  gā́ya gāyatrám ukthyàm

translation.text: Form in thy mouth the hymn of praise expand thee like, a rainy cloud Sing forth the measured eulogy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वन्द॑स्व॒ मारु॑तं ग॒णं त्वे॒षं प॑न॒स्युम॒र्किण॑म् अ॒स्मे वृ॒द्धा अ॑सन्नि॒ह
verses.transliteration: vándasva mā́rutaṃ gaṇáṃ  tveṣám panasyúm arkíṇam  asmé vr̥ddhā́ asann ihá

translation.text: Sing glory to the Marut host, praiseworthy, tuneful, vigorous: Here let the Strong Ones dwell with us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यदि॒त्था प॑रा॒वतः॑ शो॒चिर्न मान॒मस्य॑थ कस्य॒ क्रत्वा॑ मरुतः॒ कस्य॒ वर्प॑सा॒ कं या॑थ॒ कं ह॑ धूतयः
verses.transliteration: prá yád itthā́ parāvátaḥ  śocír ná mā́nam ásyatha  kásya krátvā marutaḥ kásya várpasā  káṃ yātha káṃ ha dhūtayaḥ

translation.text: WHEN thus, like flame, from far away, Maruts, ye cast your measure forth, To whom go Ye, to whom, O shakers of the earth, moved by whose wisdom, whose design?

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्थि॒रा वः॑ स॒न्त्वायु॑धा परा॒णुदे॑ वी॒ळू उ॒त प्र॑ति॒ष्कभे॑ यु॒ष्माक॑मस्तु॒ तवि॑षी॒ पनी॑यसी॒ मा मर्त्य॑स्य मा॒यिनः॑
verses.transliteration: sthirā́ vaḥ santv ā́yudhā parāṇúde  vīḷū́ utá pratiṣkábhe  yuṣmā́kam astu táviṣī pánīyasī  mā́ mártyasya māyínaḥ

translation.text: Strong let your weapons be to drive away your foes, firm for resistance let them be. Yea, passing glorious must be your warrior might, not as a guileful mortal's strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॑ ह॒ यत्स्थि॒रं ह॒थ नरो॑ व॒र्तय॑था गु॒रु वि या॑थन व॒निनः॑ पृथि॒व्या व्याशाः॒ पर्व॑तानाम्
verses.transliteration: párā ha yát sthiráṃ hathá  náro vartáyathā gurú  ví yāthana vanínaḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  vy ā́śāḥ párvatānām

translation.text: When what is strong ye overthrow, and whirl about each ponderous thing, Heroes, your course is through the forest trees of earth, and through the fissures of the rocks.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि वः॒ शत्रु॑र्विवि॒दे अधि॒ द्यवि॒ न भूम्यां॑ रिशादसः यु॒ष्माक॑मस्तु॒ तवि॑षी॒ तना॑ यु॒जा रुद्रा॑सो॒ नू चि॑दा॒धृषे॑
verses.transliteration: nahí vaḥ śátrur vividé ádhi dyávi  ná bhū́myāṃ riśādasaḥ  yuṣmā́kam astu táviṣī tánā yujā́  rúdrāso nū́ cid ādhŕ̥ṣe

translation.text: Consumers of your foes, no enemy of yours is found in heaven or on the earth: Ye Rudras, may the strength, held in this bond, be yours, to bid defiance even now.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वे॑पयन्ति॒ पर्व॑ता॒न्वि वि॑ञ्चन्ति॒ वन॒स्पती॑न् प्रो आ॑रत मरुतो दु॒र्मदा॑ इव॒ देवा॑सः॒ सर्व॑या वि॒शा
verses.transliteration: prá vepayanti párvatān  ví viñcanti vánaspátīn  pró ārata maruto durmádā iva  dévāsaḥ sárvayā viśā́

translation.text: They make the mountains rock and reel, they rend the forest-kings apart. onward, ye Maruts, drive, like creatures drunk with wine, ye, Gods with all your company.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपो॒ रथे॑षु॒ पृष॑तीरयुग्ध्वं॒ प्रष्टि॑र्वहति॒ रोहि॑तः आ वो॒ यामा॑य पृथि॒वी चि॑दश्रो॒दबी॑भयन्त॒ मानु॑षाः
verses.transliteration: úpo rátheṣu pŕ̥ṣatīr ayugdhvam  práṣṭir vahati róhitaḥ  ā́ vo yā́māya pr̥thivī́ cid aśrod  ábībhayanta mā́nuṣāḥ

translation.text: Ye to your chariot have yoked the spotted deer: a red deer, as a leader, draws. Even the Earth herself listened as ye came near, and men were sorely terrified.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वो॑ म॒क्षू तना॑य॒ कं रुद्रा॒ अवो॑ वृणीमहे गन्ता॑ नू॒नं नोऽव॑सा॒ यथा॑ पु॒रेत्था कण्वा॑य बि॒भ्युषे॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ vo makṣū́ tánāya káṃ  rúdrā ávo vr̥ṇīmahe  gántā nūnáṃ nó 'vasā yáthā purā́-  -itthā́ káṇvāya bibhyúṣe

translation.text: O Rudras, quickly we desire your succour for this work of ours. Come to us with your aid as in the days of old, so now for frightened Kaṇva's sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ष्मेषि॑तो मरुतो॒ मर्त्ये॑षित॒ आ यो नो॒ अभ्व॒ ईष॑ते वि तं यु॑योत॒ शव॑सा॒ व्योज॑सा॒ वि यु॒ष्माका॑भिरू॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: yuṣméṣito maruto mártyeṣitaḥ-  ā́ yó no ábhva ī́ṣate  ví táṃ yuyota śávasā vy ójasā  ví yuṣmā́kābhir ūtíbhiḥ

translation.text: Should any monstrous foe, O Maruts, sent by you or sent by mortals threaten us, Tear ye him from us with your power and with your might, and with the succours that are yours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असा॑मि॒ हि प्र॑यज्यवः॒ कण्वं॑ द॒द प्र॑चेतसः असा॑मिभिर्मरुत॒ आ न॑ ऊ॒तिभि॒र्गन्ता॑ वृ॒ष्टिं न वि॒द्युतः॑
verses.transliteration: ásāmi hí prayajyavaḥ  káṇvaṃ dadá pracetasaḥ  ásāmibhir maruta ā́ na ūtíbhir  gántā vr̥ṣṭíṃ ná vidyútaḥ

translation.text: For ye, the worshipful and wise, have guarded Kaṇva perfectly. O Maruts, come to us with full protecting help, as lightning flashes seek the rain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असा॒म्योजो॑ बिभृथा सुदान॒वोऽसा॑मि धूतयः॒ शवः॑ ऋ॒षि॒द्विषे॑ मरुतः परिम॒न्यव॒ इषुं॒ न सृ॑जत॒ द्विष॑म्
verses.transliteration: ásāmy ójo bibhr̥thā sudānavaḥ-  -ásāmi dhūtayaḥ śávaḥ  r̥ṣidvíṣe marutaḥ parimanyáve-  íṣuṃ ná sr̥jata dvíṣam

translation.text: Whole strength have ye, O Bounteous Ones; perfect, earth-shakers, is your might. Maruts, against the poet's wrathful enemy send ye an enemy like a dart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्ति॑ष्ठ ब्रह्मणस्पते देव॒यन्त॑स्त्वेमहे उप॒ प्र य॑न्तु म॒रुतः॑ सु॒दान॑व॒ इन्द्र॑ प्रा॒शूर्भ॑वा॒ सचा॑
verses.transliteration: út tiṣṭha brahmaṇas pate  devayántas tvemahe  úpa prá yantu marútaḥ sudā́navaḥ-  índra prāśū́r bhavā sácā

translation.text: O BRAMANASPATI, stand up: God-serving men we pray to thee. May they who give good gifts, the Maruts, come to us. Indra, most swift, be thou with them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामिद्धि स॑हसस्पुत्र॒ मर्त्य॑ उपब्रू॒ते धने॑ हि॒ते सु॒वीर्यं॑ मरुत॒ आ स्वश्व्यं॒ दधी॑त॒ यो व॑ आच॒के
verses.transliteration: tvā́m íd dhí sahasas putra mártyaḥ-  upabrūté dháne hité  suvī́ryam maruta ā́ sváśvyaṃ  dádhīta yó va ācaké

translation.text: O Son of Strength, each mortal calls to thee for aid when spoil of battle waits for him. O Maruts, may this man who loves you well obtain wealth of good steeds and hero might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रैतु॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिः॒ प्र दे॒व्ये॑तु सू॒नृता॑ अच्छा॑ वी॒रं नर्यं॑ प॒ङ्क्तिरा॑धसं दे॒वा य॒ज्ञं न॑यन्तु नः
verses.transliteration: praítu bráhmaṇas pátiḥ  prá devy ètu sūnŕ̥tā  áchā vīráṃ náryam paṅktírādhasaṃ  devā́ yajñáṃ nayantu naḥ

translation.text: May Brahmaṇaspati draw nigh, may Sunrta the Goddess come, And Gods bring to this rite which gives the five-fold gift the Hero, lover of mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वा॒घते॒ ददा॑ति सू॒नरं॒ वसु॒ स ध॑त्ते॒ अक्षि॑ति॒ श्रवः॑ तस्मा॒ इळां॑ सु॒वीरा॒मा य॑जामहे सु॒प्रतू॑र्तिमने॒हस॑म्
verses.transliteration: yó vāgháte dádāti sūnáraṃ vásu  sá dhatte ákṣiti śrávaḥ  tásmā íḷāṃ suvī́rām ā́ yajāmahe  suprátūrtim anehásam

translation.text: He who bestows a noble guerdon on the priest wins fame that never shall decay. For him we offer sacred hero-giving food, peerless and conquering easily.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र नू॒नं ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॒र्मन्त्रं॑ वदत्यु॒क्थ्य॑म् यस्मि॒न्निन्द्रो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा दे॒वा ओकां॑सि चक्रि॒रे
verses.transliteration: prá nūnám bráhmaṇas pátir  mántraṃ vadaty ukthyàm  yásminn índro váruṇo mitró aryamā́  devā́ ókāṃsi cakriré

translation.text: Now Brahmaṇaspati speaks forth aloud the solemn hymn of praise, Wherein Indra and Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, the Gods, have made their dwelling place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमिद्वो॑चेमा वि॒दथे॑षु श॒म्भुवं॒ मन्त्रं॑ देवा अने॒हस॑म् इ॒मां च॒ वाचं॑ प्रति॒हर्य॑था नरो॒ विश्वेद्वा॒मा वो॑ अश्नवत्
verses.transliteration: tám íd vocemā vidátheṣu śambhúvam  mántraṃ devā anehásam  imā́ṃ ca vā́cam pratiháryathā naro  víśvéd vāmā́ vo aśnavat

translation.text: May we in holy synods, Gods! recite that hymn, peerless, that brings felicity. If you, O Heroes, graciously accept this word, may it obtain all bliss from you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को दे॑व॒यन्त॑मश्नव॒ज्जनं॒ को वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषम् प्रप्र॑ दा॒श्वान्प॒स्त्या॑भिरस्थितान्त॒र्वाव॒त्क्षयं॑ दधे
verses.transliteration: kó devayántam aśnavaj  jánaṃ kó vr̥ktábarhiṣam  prá-pra dāśvā́n pastyā̀bhir asthita-  -antarvā́vat kṣáyaṃ dadhe

translation.text: Who shall approach the pious? who the man whose sacred grass is trimmed? The offerer with his folk advances more and more: he fills his house with precious things.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ क्ष॒त्रं पृ॑ञ्ची॒त हन्ति॒ राज॑भिर्भ॒ये चि॑त्सुक्षि॒तिं द॑धे नास्य॑ व॒र्ता न त॑रु॒ता म॑हाध॒ने नार्भे॑ अस्ति व॒ज्रिणः॑
verses.transliteration: úpa kṣatrám pr̥ñcītá hánti rā́jabhir  bhayé cit sukṣitíṃ dadhe  nā́sya vartā́ ná tarutā́ mahādhané  nā́rbhe asti vajríṇaḥ

translation.text: He amplifies his lordly might, with kings he slays: e'en mid alarms he dwells secure In great or lesser fight none checks him, none subdues,– the wielder of the thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं रक्ष॑न्ति॒ प्रचे॑तसो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा नू चि॒त्स द॑भ्यते॒ जनः॑
verses.transliteration: yáṃ rákṣanti prácetaso  váruṇo mitró aryamā́  nū́ cit sá dabhyate jánaḥ

translation.text: NE'ER is he injured whom the Gods Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, The excellently wise, protect.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं बा॒हुते॑व॒ पिप्र॑ति॒ पान्ति॒ मर्त्यं॑ रि॒षः अरि॑ष्टः॒ सर्व॑ एधते
verses.transliteration: yám bāhúteva píprati  pā́nti mártyaṃ riṣáḥ  áriṣṭaḥ sárva edhate

translation.text: He prospers ever, free from scathe, whom they, as with full hands, enrich, Whom they preserve from every foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि दु॒र्गा वि द्विषः॑ पु॒रो घ्नन्ति॒ राजा॑न एषाम् नय॑न्ति दुरि॒ता ति॒रः
verses.transliteration: ví durgā́ ví dvíṣaḥ puró  ghnánti rā́jāna eṣām  náyanti duritā́ tiráḥ

translation.text: The Kings drive far away from him his troubles and his enemies, And lead him safely o'er distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒गः पन्था॑ अनृक्ष॒र आदि॑त्यास ऋ॒तं य॒ते नात्रा॑वखा॒दो अ॑स्ति वः
verses.transliteration: sugáḥ pánthā anr̥kṣaráḥ-  ā́dityāsa r̥táṃ yaté  nā́trāvakhādó asti vaḥ

translation.text: Thornless, Âdityas, is the path, easy for him who seeks the Law: With him is naught to anger you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं य॒ज्ञं नय॑था नर॒ आदि॑त्या ऋ॒जुना॑ प॒था प्र वः॒ स धी॒तये॑ नशत्
verses.transliteration: yáṃ yajñáṃ náyathā naraḥ-  ā́dityā r̥júnā pathā́  prá vaḥ sá dhītáye naśat

translation.text: What sacrifice, Âdityas, ye Heroes guide by the path direct,– May that come nigh unto your thought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स रत्नं॒ मर्त्यो॒ वसु॒ विश्वं॑ तो॒कमु॒त त्मना॑ अच्छा॑ गच्छ॒त्यस्तृ॑तः
verses.transliteration: sá rátnam mártyo vásu  víśvaṃ tokám utá tmánā  áchā gachaty ástr̥taḥ

translation.text: That mortal, ever unsubdued, gains wealth and every precious thing, And children also of his own.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒था रा॑धाम सखायः॒ स्तोमं॑ मि॒त्रस्या॑र्य॒म्णः महि॒ प्सरो॒ वरु॑णस्य
verses.transliteration: kathā́ rādhāma sakhāyaḥ-  stómam mitrásyāryamṇáḥ  máhi psáro váruṇasya

translation.text: How, my friends, shall we prepare Aryaman's and Mitra's laud, Glorious food of Varuṇa?

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा वो॒ घ्नन्तं॒ मा शप॑न्तं॒ प्रति॑ वोचे देव॒यन्त॑म् सु॒म्नैरिद्व॒ आ वि॑वासे
verses.transliteration: mā́ vo ghnántam mā́ śápantam  práti voce devayántam  sumnaír íd va ā́ vivāse

translation.text: I point not out to you a man who strikes the pious, or reviles: Only with hymns I call you nigh.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒तुर॑श्चि॒द्दद॑मानाद्बिभी॒यादा निधा॑तोः न दु॑रु॒क्ताय॑ स्पृहयेत्
verses.transliteration: catúraś cid dádamānād  bibhīyā́d ā́ nídhātoḥ  ná duruktā́ya spr̥hayet

translation.text: Let him not love to speak ill words: but fear the One who holds all four Within his hand, until they fall.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं पू॑ष॒न्नध्व॑नस्तिर॒ व्यंहो॑ विमुचो नपात् सक्ष्वा॑ देव॒ प्र ण॑स्पु॒रः
verses.transliteration: sám pūṣann ádhvanas tira  vy áṃho vimuco napāt  sákṣvā deva prá ṇas puráḥ

translation.text: SHORTEN our ways, O Pûshan, move aside obstruction in the path: Go close before us, cloud-born God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो नः॑ पूषन्न॒घो वृको॑ दुः॒शेव॑ आ॒दिदे॑शति अप॑ स्म॒ तं प॒थो ज॑हि
verses.transliteration: yó naḥ pūṣann aghó vŕ̥ko  duḥśéva ādídeśati  ápa sma tám pathó jahi

translation.text: Drive, Pûshan, from our road the wolf, the wicked inauspicious wolf, Who lies in Wait to injure us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॒ त्यं प॑रिप॒न्थिनं॑ मुषी॒वाणं॑ हुर॒श्चित॑म् दू॒रमधि॑ स्रु॒तेर॑ज
verses.transliteration: ápa tyám paripanthínam  muṣīvā́ṇaṃ huraścítam  dūrám ádhi srutér aja

translation.text: Who lurks about the path we take, the robber with a guileful heart: Far from the road chase him away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं तस्य॑ द्वया॒विनो॒ऽघशं॑सस्य॒ कस्य॑ चित् प॒दाभि ति॑ष्ठ॒ तपु॑षिम्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tásya dvayāvíno  -agháśaṃsasya kásya cit  padā́bhí tiṣṭha tápuṣim

translation.text: Tread with thy foot and trample out the firebrand of the wicked one, The double-tongued, whoe'er he be.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ तत्ते॑ दस्र मन्तुमः॒ पूष॒न्नवो॑ वृणीमहे येन॑ पि॒तॄनचो॑दयः
verses.transliteration: ā́ tát te dasra mantumaḥ  pū́ṣann ávo vr̥ṇīmahe  yéna pitr̥̄́n ácodayaḥ

translation.text: Wise Pûshan, Wonder-Worker, we claim of thee now the aid wherewith Thou furtheredst our sires of old.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑ नो विश्वसौभग॒ हिर॑ण्यवाशीमत्तम धना॑नि सु॒षणा॑ कृधि
verses.transliteration: ádhā no viśvasaubhaga  híraṇyavāśīmattama  dhánāni suṣáṇā kr̥dhi

translation.text: So, Lord of all prosperity, best wielder of the golden sword, Make riches easy to be won.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अति॑ नः स॒श्चतो॑ नय सु॒गा नः॑ सु॒पथा॑ कृणु पूष॑न्नि॒ह क्रतुं॑ विदः
verses.transliteration: áti naḥ saścáto naya  sugā́ naḥ supáthā kr̥ṇu  pū́ṣann ihá krátuṃ vidaḥ

translation.text: Past all pursuers lead us, make pleasant our path and fair to tread: O Pûshan, find thou power for this.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि सू॒यव॑सं नय॒ न न॑वज्वा॒रो अध्व॑ने पूष॑न्नि॒ह क्रतुं॑ विदः
verses.transliteration: abhí sūyávasaṃ naya  ná navajvāró ádhvane  pū́ṣann ihá krátuṃ vidaḥ

translation.text: Lead us to meadows rich in grass: send on our way no early heat: O Pûshan, find thou power for this.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒ग्धि पू॒र्धि प्र यं॑सि च शिशी॒हि प्रास्यु॒दर॑म् पूष॑न्नि॒ह क्रतुं॑ विदः
verses.transliteration: śagdhí pūrdhí prá yaṃsi ca  śiśīhí prā́sy udáram  pū́ṣann ihá krátuṃ vidaḥ

translation.text: Be gracious to us, fill us full, give, feed us, and invigorate: O Pûshan, find thou power for this.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न पू॒षणं॑ मेथामसि सू॒क्तैर॒भि गृ॑णीमसि वसू॑नि द॒स्ममी॑महे
verses.transliteration: ná pūṣáṇam methāmasi  sūktaír abhí gr̥ṇīmasi  vásūni dasmám īmahe

translation.text: No blame have we for Pûshan; him we magnify with songs of praise: We seek the Mighty One for wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कद्रु॒द्राय॒ प्रचे॑तसे मी॒ळ्हुष्ट॑माय॒ तव्य॑से वो॒चेम॒ शंत॑मं हृ॒दे
verses.transliteration: kád rudrā́ya prácetase  mīḷhúṣṭamāya távyase  vocéma śáṃtamaṃ hr̥dé

translation.text: WHAT shall we sing to Rudra, strong, most bounteous, excellently wise, That shall be dearest to his heart?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ नो॒ अदि॑तिः॒ कर॒त्पश्वे॒ नृभ्यो॒ यथा॒ गवे॑ यथा॑ तो॒काय॑ रु॒द्रिय॑म्
verses.transliteration: yáthā no áditiḥ kárat  páśve nŕ̥bhyo yáthā gáve  yáthā tokā́ya rudríyam

translation.text: That Aditi may grant the grace of Rudra to our folk, our kine, Our cattle and our progeny;

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ नो मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो॒ यथा॑ रु॒द्रश्चिके॑तति यथा॒ विश्वे॑ स॒जोष॑सः
verses.transliteration: yáthā no mitró váruṇo  yáthā rudráś cíketati  yáthā víśve sajóṣasaḥ

translation.text: That Mitra and that Varuṇa, that Rudra may remember us, Yea, all the Gods with one accord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गा॒थप॑तिं मे॒धप॑तिं रु॒द्रं जला॑षभेषजम् तच्छं॒योः सु॒म्नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: gāthápatim medhápatiṃ  rudráṃ jálāṣabheṣajam  tác chaṃyóḥ sumnám īmahe

translation.text: To Rudra Lord of sacrifice, of hymns and balmy medicines, We pray for joy and health and strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः शु॒क्र इ॑व॒ सूर्यो॒ हिर॑ण्यमिव॒ रोच॑ते श्रेष्ठो॑ दे॒वानां॒ वसुः॑
verses.transliteration: yáḥ śukrá iva sū́ryo  híraṇyam iva rócate  śréṣṭho devā́nāṃ vásuḥ

translation.text: He shines in splendour like the Sun, refulgent as bright gold is he, The good, the best among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नः॑ कर॒त्यर्व॑ते सु॒गं मे॒षाय॑ मे॒ष्ये॑ नृभ्यो॒ नारि॑भ्यो॒ गवे॑
verses.transliteration: śáṃ naḥ karaty árvate  sugám meṣā́ya meṣyè  nŕ̥bhyo nā́ribhyo gáve

translation.text: May he grant health into our steeds, wellbeing to our rams and ewes, To men, to women, and to kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे सो॑म॒ श्रिय॒मधि॒ नि धे॑हि श॒तस्य॑ नृ॒णाम् महि॒ श्रव॑स्तुविनृ॒म्णम्
verses.transliteration: asmé soma śríyam ádhi  ní dhehi śatásya nr̥ṇā́m  máhi śrávas tuvinr̥mṇám

translation.text: O Soma, set thou upon us the glory of a hundred men, The great renown of mighty chiefs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नः॑ सोमपरि॒बाधो॒ मारा॑तयो जुहुरन्त आ न॑ इन्दो॒ वाजे॑ भज
verses.transliteration: mā́ naḥ somaparibā́dho  mā́rātayo juhuranta  ā́ na indo vā́je bhaja

translation.text: Let not malignities, nor those who trouble Soma, hinder us. Indu, give us a share of strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यास्ते॑ प्र॒जा अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ पर॑स्मि॒न्धाम॑न्नृ॒तस्य॑ मू॒र्धा नाभा॑ सोम वेन आ॒भूष॑न्तीः सोम वेदः
verses.transliteration: yā́s te prajā́ amŕ̥tasya  párasmin dhā́mann r̥tásya  mūrdhā́ nā́bhā soma venaḥ-  ābhū́ṣantīḥ soma vedaḥ

translation.text: Soma! head, central point, love these; Soma! know these as serving thee, Children of thee Immortal, at the highest place of holy law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ विव॑स्वदु॒षस॑श्चि॒त्रं राधो॑ अमर्त्य आ दा॒शुषे॑ जातवेदो वहा॒ त्वम॒द्या दे॒वाँ उ॑ष॒र्बुधः॑
verses.transliteration: ágne vívasvad uṣásaś  citráṃ rā́dho amartya  ā́ dāśúṣe jātavedo vahā tvám  adyā́ devā́m̐ uṣarbúdhaḥ

translation.text: IMMORTAL Jâtavedas, thou many-hued fulgent gift of Dawn, Agni, this day to him who pays oblations bring the Gods who waken with the morn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जुष्टो॒ हि दू॒तो असि॑ हव्य॒वाह॒नोऽग्ने॑ र॒थीर॑ध्व॒राणा॑म् स॒जूर॒श्विभ्या॑मु॒षसा॑ सु॒वीर्य॑म॒स्मे धे॑हि॒ श्रवो॑ बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: júṣṭo hí dūtó ási havyavā́hanaḥ-  -ágne rathī́r adhvarā́ṇām  sajū́r aśvíbhyām uṣásā suvī́ryam  asmé dhehi śrávo br̥hád

translation.text: For thou art offering-bearer and loved messenger, the charioteer of sacrifice: Accordant with the Aṣvins and with Dawn grant us heroic strength and lofty fame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्या दू॒तं वृ॑णीमहे॒ वसु॑म॒ग्निं पु॑रुप्रि॒यम् धू॒मके॑तुं॒ भाऋ॑जीकं॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु य॒ज्ञाना॑मध्वर॒श्रिय॑म्
verses.transliteration: adyā́ dūtáṃ vr̥ṇīmahe  vásum agním purupriyám  dhūmáketum bhā́r̥jīkaṃ vyùṣṭiṣu  yajñā́nām adhvaraśríyam

translation.text: As messenger we choose to-day Agni the good whom many love, Smoke-bannered spreader of the light, at break of day glory of sacrificial rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रेष्ठं॒ यवि॑ष्ठ॒मति॑थिं॒ स्वा॑हुतं॒ जुष्टं॒ जना॑य दा॒शुषे॑ दे॒वाँ अच्छा॒ यात॑वे जा॒तवे॑दसम॒ग्निमी॑ळे॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु
verses.transliteration: śréṣṭhaṃ yáviṣṭham átithiṃ svā̀hutaṃ  júṣṭaṃ jánāya dāśúṣe  devā́m̐ áchā yā́tave jātávedasam  agním īḷe vyùṣṭiṣu

translation.text: Him noblest and most youthful, richly worshipped guest, dear to the men who offer gifts, Him, Agni Jâtavedas, I beseech at dawn that he may bring the Gods to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्त॒वि॒ष्यामि॒ त्वाम॒हं विश्व॑स्यामृत भोजन अग्ने॑ त्रा॒तार॑म॒मृतं॑ मियेध्य॒ यजि॑ष्ठं हव्यवाहन
verses.transliteration: staviṣyā́mi tvā́m aháṃ  víśvasyāmr̥ta bhojana  ágne trātā́ram amŕ̥tam miyedhya  yájiṣṭhaṃ havyavāhana

translation.text: Thee, Agni, will I glorify, deathless nourisher of the world, Immortal, offering-bearer, meet for sacred food, preserver, best at sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒शंसो॑ बोधि गृण॒ते य॑विष्ठ्य॒ मधु॑जिह्वः॒ स्वा॑हुतः प्रस्क॑ण्वस्य प्रति॒रन्नायु॑र्जी॒वसे॑ नम॒स्या दैव्यं॒ जन॑म्
verses.transliteration: suśáṃso bodhi gr̥ṇaté yaviṣṭhya  mádhujihvaḥ svā̀hutaḥ  práskaṇvasya pratiránn ā́yur jīváse  namasyā́ daívyaṃ jánam

translation.text: Tell good things to thy praiser, O most youthful God, as richly worshipped, honey-tongued, And, granting to Praskaṇva lengthened days of life, show honour to the Heavenly Host.

verses.sanskrit_deva: होता॑रं वि॒श्ववे॑दसं॒ सं हि त्वा॒ विश॑ इ॒न्धते॑ स आ व॑ह पुरुहूत॒ प्रचे॑त॒सोऽग्ने॑ दे॒वाँ इ॒ह द्र॒वत्
verses.transliteration: hótāraṃ viśvávedasam  sáṃ hí tvā víśa indháte  sá ā́ vaha puruhūta prácetasaḥ-  -ágne devā́m̐ ihá dravát

translation.text: For the men, Agni, kindle thee as all possessor and as Priest; So Agni, much-invoked, bring hither with all speed the Gods, the excellently wise,

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒वि॒तार॑मु॒षस॑म॒श्विना॒ भग॑म॒ग्निं व्यु॑ष्टिषु॒ क्षपः॑ कण्वा॑सस्त्वा सु॒तसो॑मास इन्धते हव्य॒वाहं॑ स्वध्वर
verses.transliteration: savitā́ram uṣásam aśvínā  bhágam agníṃ vyùṣṭiṣu kṣápaḥ  káṇvāsas tvā sutásomāsa indhate  havyavā́haṃ svadhvara

translation.text: At dawn of day, at night, Ushas and Savitar, the Aṣvins, Bhaga, Agni's self: Skilled in fair rites, with Soma poured, the Kaṇvas light thee, the oblation-wafting God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पति॒र्ह्य॑ध्व॒राणा॒मग्ने॑ दू॒तो वि॒शामसि॑ उ॒ष॒र्बुध॒ आ व॑ह॒ सोम॑पीतये दे॒वाँ अ॒द्य स्व॒र्दृशः॑
verses.transliteration: pátir hy àdhvarā́ṇām  ágne dūtó viśā́m ási  uṣarbúdha ā́ vaha sómapītaye  devā́m̐ adyá svardŕ̥śaḥ

translation.text: For, Agni, Lord of sacrifice and messenger of men art thou: Bring thou the Gods who wake at dawn who see the light, this day to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ पूर्वा॒ अनू॒षसो॑ विभावसो दी॒देथ॑ वि॒श्वद॑र्शतः असि॒ ग्रामे॑ष्ववि॒ता पु॒रोहि॒तोऽसि॑ य॒ज्ञेषु॒ मानु॑षः
verses.transliteration: ágne pū́rvā ánūṣáso vibhāvaso  dīdétha viśvádarśataḥ  ási grā́meṣv avitā́ puróhitaḥ-  -ási yajñéṣu mā́nuṣaḥ

translation.text: Thou shonest forth, O Agni, after former dawns, all visible, O rich in light. Thou art our help in battle-strife, the Friend of inan, the great high priest in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि त्वा॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॒ साध॑न॒मग्ने॒ होता॑रमृ॒त्विज॑म् म॒नु॒ष्वद्दे॑व धीमहि॒ प्रचे॑तसं जी॒रं दू॒तमम॑र्त्यम्
verses.transliteration: ní tvā yajñásya sā́dhanam  ágne hótāram r̥tvíjam  manuṣvád deva dhīmahi prácetasaṃ  jīráṃ dūtám ámartyam

translation.text: Like Manu, we will stablish thee, Agni, performer of the rite, Invoker, ministering Priest, exceeding wise, the swift immortal messenger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्दे॒वानां॑ मित्रमहः पु॒रोहि॒तोऽन्त॑रो॒ यासि॑ दू॒त्य॑म् सिन्धो॑रिव॒ प्रस्व॑नितास ऊ॒र्मयो॒ऽग्नेर्भ्रा॑जन्ते अ॒र्चयः॑
verses.transliteration: yád devā́nām mitramahaḥ puróhitaḥ-  -ántaro yā́si dūtyàm  síndhor iva prásvanitāsa ūrmáyo  -agnér bhrājante arcáyaḥ

translation.text: When as the Gods' High Priest, by many loved, thou dost their mission as their nearest Friend, Then, like the far-resounding billows of the flood, thy flames, O Agni, roar aloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒धि श्रु॑त्कर्ण॒ वह्नि॑भिर्दे॒वैर॑ग्ने स॒याव॑भिः आ सी॑दन्तु ब॒र्हिषि॑ मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा प्रा॑त॒र्यावा॑णो अध्व॒रम्
verses.transliteration: śrudhí śrutkarṇa váhnibhir  devaír agne sayā́vabhiḥ  ā́ sīdantu barhíṣi mitró aryamā́  prātaryā́vāṇo adhvarám

translation.text: Heat-, Agni, who hast ears to hear, with all thy train of escort Gods; Let Mitra, Aryaman,– seeking betimes our rite, seat them upon the sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शृ॒ण्वन्तु॒ स्तोमं॑ म॒रुतः॑ सु॒दान॑वोऽग्निजि॒ह्वा ऋ॑ता॒वृधः॑ पिब॑तु॒ सोमं॒ वरु॑णो धृ॒तव्र॑तो॒ऽश्विभ्या॑मु॒षसा॑ स॒जूः
verses.transliteration: śr̥ṇvántu stómam marútaḥ sudā́navo  -agnijihvā́ r̥tāvŕ̥dhaḥ  píbatu sómaṃ váruṇo dhr̥távrato  -aśvíbhyām uṣásā sajū́ḥ

translation.text: Let those who strengthen Law, who bountifully give, the life-tongued Maruts, hear our praise. May Law-supporting Varuṇa with the Aṣvins twain and Ushas, drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ वसूँ॑रि॒ह रु॒द्राँ आ॑दि॒त्याँ उ॒त यजा॑ स्वध्व॒रं जनं॒ मनु॑जातं घृत॒प्रुष॑म्
verses.transliteration: tvám agne vásūm̐r ihá  rudrā́m̐ ādityā́m̐ utá  yájā svadhvaráṃ jánam  mánujātaṃ ghr̥taprúṣam

translation.text: WORSHIP the Vasus, Agni! here, the Rudras, the Âdityas, all Who spring from Manu, those who know fair rites, who pour their blessings down.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒ष्टी॒वानो॒ हि दा॒शुषे॑ दे॒वा अ॑ग्ने॒ विचे॑तसः तान्रो॑हिदश्व गिर्वण॒स्त्रय॑स्त्रिंशत॒मा व॑ह
verses.transliteration: śruṣṭīvā́no hí dāśúṣe  devā́ agne vícetasaḥ  tā́n rohidaśva girvaṇas  tráyastriṃśatam ā́ vaha

translation.text: Agni, the Gods who understand give ear unto the worshipper: Lord of Red Steeds, who lovest song, bring thou those Three-and-Thirty Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रि॒य॒मे॒ध॒वद॑त्रि॒वज्जात॑वेदो विरूप॒वत् अ॒ङ्गि॒र॒स्वन्म॑हिव्रत॒ प्रस्क॑ण्वस्य श्रुधी॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: priyamedhavád atriváj  jā́tavedo virūpavát  aṅgirasván mahivrata  práskaṇvasya śrudhī hávam

translation.text: O Jâtavedas, great in act, hearken thou to Praskaṇva's call, As Priyamedha erst was heard, Atri, Virûpa, Angiras.

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॑केरव ऊ॒तये॑ प्रि॒यमे॑धा अहूषत राज॑न्तमध्व॒राणा॑म॒ग्निं शु॒क्रेण॑ शो॒चिषा॑
verses.transliteration: máhikerava ūtáye  priyámedhā ahūṣata  rā́jantam adhvarā́ṇāṃ  agníṃ śukréṇa śocíṣā

translation.text: The sons of Priyamedha skilled in lofty praise have called for help On Agni who with fulgent flame is Ruler of all holy rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृता॑हवन सन्त्ये॒मा उ॒ षु श्रु॑धी॒ गिरः॑ याभिः॒ कण्व॑स्य सू॒नवो॒ हव॒न्तेऽव॑से त्वा
verses.transliteration: ghŕ̥tāhavana santya-  imā́ u ṣú śrudhī gíraḥ  yā́bhiḥ káṇvasya sūnávo  hávanté 'vase tvā

translation.text: Hear thou, invoked withholy oil, bountiful giver of rewards, These eulogies, whereby the sons of Kaṇva call thee to their aid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां चि॑त्रश्रवस्तम॒ हव॑न्ते वि॒क्षु ज॒न्तवः॑ शो॒चिष्के॑शं पुरुप्रि॒याग्ने॑ ह॒व्याय॒ वोळ्ह॑वे
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ citraśravastama  hávante vikṣú jantávaḥ  śocíṣkeśam purupriya-  -ágne havyā́ya vóḷhave

translation.text: O Agni, loved by many, thou of fame most wondrous, in their homes Men call on thee whose hair is flame, to be the bearer of their gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि त्वा॒ होता॑रमृ॒त्विजं॑ दधि॒रे व॑सु॒वित्त॑मम् श्रुत्क॑र्णं स॒प्रथ॑स्तमं॒ विप्रा॑ अग्ने॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु
verses.transliteration: ní tvā hótāram r̥tvíjaṃ  dadhiré vasuvíttamam  śrútkarṇaṃ sapráthastamaṃ  víprā agne díviṣṭiṣu

translation.text: Thee, Agni, best to find out wealth, most widely famous, quick to hear, Singers have stablished in their rites Herald and ministering Priest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॒ विप्रा॑ अचुच्यवुः सु॒तसो॑मा अ॒भि प्रयः॑ बृ॒हद्भा बिभ्र॑तो ह॒विरग्ने॒ मर्ता॑य दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvā víprā acucyavuḥ  sutásomā abhí práyaḥ  br̥hád bhā́ bíbhrato havír  ágne mártāya dāśúṣe

translation.text: Singers with Soma pressed have made thee, Agni, hasten to the feast, Great light to mortal worshipper, what time they bring the sacred gift.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒त॒र्याव्णः॑ सहस्कृत सोम॒पेया॑य सन्त्य इ॒हाद्य दैव्यं॒ जनं॑ ब॒र्हिरा सा॑दया वसो
verses.transliteration: prātaryā́vṇaḥ sahaskr̥ta  somapéyāya santya  ihā́dyá daívyaṃ jánam  barhír ā́ sādayā vaso

translation.text: Good, bounteous, Son of Strength, this day seat here on sacred grass the Gods Who come at early morn, the host of heaven, to drink the Soma juice

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वाञ्चं॒ दैव्यं॒ जन॒मग्ने॒ यक्ष्व॒ सहू॑तिभिः अ॒यं सोमः॑ सुदानव॒स्तं पा॑त ति॒रोअ॑ह्न्यम्
verses.transliteration: arvā́ñcaṃ daívyaṃ jánam  ágne yákṣva sáhūtibhiḥ  ayáṃ sómaḥ sudānavas  tám pāta tiróahnyam

translation.text: Bring with joint invocations thou, O Agni, the celestial host: Here stands the Soma, bounteous Gods drink this expressed ere yesterday.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षो उ॒षा अपू॑र्व्या॒ व्यु॑च्छति प्रि॒या दि॒वः स्तु॒षे वा॑मश्विना बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: eṣó uṣā́ ápūrvyā  vy ùchati priyā́ diváḥ  stuṣé vām aśvinā br̥hát

translation.text: Now Morning with her earliest light shines forth, dear Daughter of the Sky: High, Aṣvins, I extol your praise,

verses.sanskrit_deva: या द॒स्रा सिन्धु॑मातरा मनो॒तरा॑ रयी॒णाम् धि॒या दे॒वा व॑सु॒विदा॑
verses.transliteration: yā́ dasrā́ síndhumātarā  manotárā rayīṇā́m  dhiyā́ devā́ vasuvídā

translation.text: Sons of the Sea, mighty to save discoverers of riches, ye Gods with deep thought who find out wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒च्यन्ते॑ वां ककु॒हासो॑ जू॒र्णाया॒मधि॑ वि॒ष्टपि॑ यद्वां॒ रथो॒ विभि॒ष्पता॑त्
verses.transliteration: vacyánte vāṃ kakuhā́so  jūrṇā́yām ádhi viṣṭápi  yád vāṃ rátho víbhiṣ pátāt

translation.text: Your giant coursers hasten on over the region all in flames, – When your car flies with winged steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह॒विषा॑ जा॒रो अ॒पां पिप॑र्ति॒ पपु॑रिर्नरा पि॒ता कुट॑स्य चर्ष॒णिः
verses.transliteration: havíṣā jāró apā́m  píparti pápurir narā  pitā́ kúṭasya carṣaṇíḥ

translation.text: He, liberal, lover of the flood, Lord of the House, the vigilant, Chiefs! with oblations feeds you full.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒दा॒रो वां॑ मती॒नां नास॑त्या मतवचसा पा॒तं सोम॑स्य धृष्णु॒या
verses.transliteration: ādāró vām matīnā́ṃ  nā́satyā matavacasā  pātáṃ sómasya dhr̥ṣṇuyā́

translation.text: Ye have regard unto our hymns, Nâsatyas, thinking of our words: Drink boldly of the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या नः॒ पीप॑रदश्विना॒ ज्योति॑ष्मती॒ तम॑स्ति॒रः ताम॒स्मे रा॑साथा॒मिष॑म्
verses.transliteration: yā́ naḥ pī́parad aśvinā  jyótiṣmatī támas tiráḥ  tā́m asmé rāsāthām íṣam

translation.text: Vouchsafe to us, O Aṣvin Pair, such strength as, with attendant light, May through the darkness carry us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ ना॒वा म॑ती॒नां या॒तं पा॒राय॒ गन्त॑वे यु॒ञ्जाथा॑मश्विना॒ रथ॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no nāvā́ matīnā́ṃ  yātám pārā́ya gántave  yuñjā́thām aśvinā rátham

translation.text: Come in the ship of these our hymns to bear you to the hither shore O Aṣvins, harness ye the car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒रित्रं॑ वां दि॒वस्पृ॒थु ती॒र्थे सिन्धू॑नां॒ रथः॑ धि॒या यु॑युज्र॒ इन्द॑वः
verses.transliteration: arítraṃ vāṃ divás pr̥thú  tīrthé síndhūnāṃ ráthaḥ  dhiyā́ yuyujra índavaḥ

translation.text: The heaven's wide vessel is your own on the flood's shore your chariot waits Drops, with the hymn, have been prepared.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वस्क॑ण्वास॒ इन्द॑वो॒ वसु॒ सिन्धू॑नां प॒दे स्वं व॒व्रिं कुह॑ धित्सथः
verses.transliteration: divás kaṇvāsa índavo  vásu síndhūnām padé  sváṃ vavríṃ kúha dhitsathaḥ

translation.text: Kaṇvas, the drops are in the heaven; the wealth is at the waters' place: Where will ye manifest your form?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभू॑दु॒ भा उ॑ अं॒शवे॒ हिर॑ण्यं॒ प्रति॒ सूर्यः॑ व्य॑ख्यज्जि॒ह्वयासि॑तः
verses.transliteration: ábhūd u bhā́ u aṃśáve  híraṇyam práti sū́ryaḥ  vy àkhyaj jihváyā́sitaḥ

translation.text: Light came to lighten up the branch, the Sun appeared as it were gold: And with its-tongue shone forth the dark.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभू॑दु पा॒रमेत॑वे॒ पन्था॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ साधु॒या अद॑र्शि॒ वि स्रु॒तिर्दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: ábhūd u pārám étave  pánthā r̥tásya sādhuyā́  ádarśi ví srutír diváḥ

translation.text: The path of sacrifice was made to travel to the farther goal: The road of heaven was manifest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्त॒दिद॒श्विनो॒रवो॑ जरि॒ता प्रति॑ भूषति मदे॒ सोम॑स्य॒ पिप्र॑तोः
verses.transliteration: tát-tad íd aśvínor ávo  jaritā́ práti bhūṣati  máde sómasya pípratoḥ

translation.text: The singer of their praise awaits whatever grace the Aṣvins give, who save when Soma gladdens them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒व॒सा॒ना वि॒वस्व॑ति॒ सोम॑स्य पी॒त्या गि॒रा म॒नु॒ष्वच्छ॑म्भू॒ आ ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: vāvasānā́ vivásvati  sómasya pītyā́ girā́  manuṣvác chambhū ā́ gatam

translation.text: Ye dwellers with Vivasvan come, auspicious, as to Manu erst; come to the Soma and our praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वोरु॒षा अनु॒ श्रियं॒ परि॑ज्मनोरु॒पाच॑रत् ऋ॒ता व॑नथो अ॒क्तुभिः॑
verses.transliteration: yuvór uṣā́ ánu śríyam  párijmanor upā́carat  r̥tā́ vanatho aktúbhiḥ

translation.text: O circumambient Aṣvins, Dawn follows the brightness of your way: Approve with beams our solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भा पि॑बतमश्विनो॒भा नः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतम् अ॒वि॒द्रि॒याभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: ubhā́ pibatam aśvinā-  -ubhā́ naḥ śárma yachatam  avidriyā́bhir ūtíbhiḥ

translation.text: Drink ye of our libations, grant protection, O ye Aṣvins Twain, With aids which none may interrupt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं वां॒ मधु॑मत्तमः सु॒तः सोम॑ ऋतावृधा तम॑श्विना पिबतं ति॒रोअ॑ह्न्यं ध॒त्तं रत्ना॑नि दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ vām mádhumattamaḥ  sutáḥ sóma r̥tāvr̥dhā  tám aśvinā pibataṃ tiróahnyaṃ  dhattáṃ rátnāni dāśúṣe

translation.text: ASVINS, for you who strengthen Law this sweetest Soma hath been shed. Drink this expressed ere yesterday and give riches to him who offers it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒व॒न्धु॒रेण॑ त्रि॒वृता॑ सु॒पेश॑सा॒ रथे॒ना या॑तमश्विना कण्वा॑सो वां॒ ब्रह्म॑ कृण्वन्त्यध्व॒रे तेषां॒ सु शृ॑णुतं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: trivandhuréṇa trivŕ̥tā supéśasā  ráthenā́ yātam aśvinā  káṇvāso vām bráhma kr̥ṇvanty adhvaré  téṣāṃ sú śr̥ṇutaṃ hávam

translation.text: Come, O ye Aṣvins, mounted on your triple car three-seated, beautiful of form To you at sacrifice the Kaṇvas send the prayer: graciously listen to their call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वि॑ना॒ मधु॑मत्तमं पा॒तं सोम॑मृतावृधा अथा॒द्य द॑स्रा॒ वसु॒ बिभ्र॑ता॒ रथे॑ दा॒श्वांस॒मुप॑ गच्छतम्
verses.transliteration: áśvinā mádhumattamam  pātáṃ sómam r̥tāvr̥dhā  áthādyá dasrā vásu bíbhratā ráthe  dāśvā́ṃsam úpa gachatam

translation.text: O Aṣvins, ye who strengthen Law, drink ye this sweetest Soma juice. Borne on your wealth-fraught car come ye this day to him who offers, ye of wondrous deeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒ष॒ध॒स्थे ब॒र्हिषि॑ विश्ववेदसा॒ मध्वा॑ य॒ज्ञं मि॑मिक्षतम् कण्वा॑सो वां सु॒तसो॑मा अ॒भिद्य॑वो यु॒वां ह॑वन्ते अश्विना
verses.transliteration: triṣadhasthé barhíṣi viśvavedasā  mádhvā yajñám mimikṣatam  káṇvāso vāṃ sutásomā abhídyavo  yuvā́ṃ havante aśvinā

translation.text: Omniscient Aṣvins, on the thrice-heaped grass bedew with the sweet juice the sacrifice. The sons of Kaṇva, striving heavenward, call on you with draughts of Soma juice out-poured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ कण्व॑म॒भिष्टि॑भिः॒ प्राव॑तं यु॒वम॑श्विना ताभिः॒ ष्व१॒॑स्माँ अ॑वतं शुभस्पती पा॒तं सोम॑मृतावृधा
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ káṇvam abhíṣṭibhiḥ  prā́vataṃ yuvám aśvinā  tā́bhiḥ ṣv àsmā́m̐ avataṃ śubhas patī  pātáṃ sómam r̥tāvr̥dhā

translation.text: O Aṣvins, with those aids wherewith ye guarded Kaṇva carefully, Keep us, O hords of Splendour: drink the Soma juice, ye strengtheners of holy law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒दासे॑ दस्रा॒ वसु॒ बिभ्र॑ता॒ रथे॒ पृक्षो॑ वहतमश्विना र॒यिं स॑मु॒द्रादु॒त वा॑ दि॒वस्पर्य॒स्मे ध॑त्तं पुरु॒स्पृह॑म्
verses.transliteration: sudā́se dasrā vásu bíbhratā ráthe  pŕ̥kṣo vahatam aśvinā  rayíṃ samudrā́d utá vā divás pári-  asmé dhattam puruspŕ̥ham

translation.text: O Mighty Ones, ye gave Sudâs abundant food, brought on your treasure-laden car; So now vouchsafe to us the wealth which many crave, either from heaven or from the sea.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यन्ना॑सत्या परा॒वति॒ यद्वा॒ स्थो अधि॑ तु॒र्वशे॑ अतो॒ रथे॑न सु॒वृता॑ न॒ आ ग॑तं सा॒कं सूर्य॑स्य र॒श्मिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: yán nāsatyā parāváti  yád vā sthó ádhi turváśe  áto ráthena suvŕ̥tā na ā́ gataṃ  sākáṃ sū́ryasya raśmíbhiḥ

translation.text: Nâsatyas, whether ye be far away or close to Turvaṣa, Borne on your lightly-rolling chariot come to us, together with the sunbeams come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वाञ्चा॑ वां॒ सप्त॑योऽध्वर॒श्रियो॒ वह॑न्तु॒ सव॒नेदुप॑ इषं॑ पृ॒ञ्चन्ता॑ सु॒कृते॑ सु॒दान॑व॒ आ ब॒र्हिः सी॑दतं नरा
verses.transliteration: arvā́ñcā vāṃ sáptayo 'dhvaraśríyo  váhantu sávanéd úpa  íṣam pr̥ñcántā sukŕ̥te sudā́navaḥ-  ā́ barhíḥ sīdataṃ narā

translation.text: So let your coursers, ornaments of sacrifice, bring you to our libations here. Bestowing food on him who acts and gives aright, sit, Chiefs, upon the sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तेन॑ नास॒त्या ग॑तं॒ रथे॑न॒ सूर्य॑त्वचा येन॒ शश्व॑दू॒हथु॑र्दा॒शुषे॒ वसु॒ मध्वः॒ सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: téna nāsatyā́ gataṃ  ráthena sū́ryatvacā  yéna śáśvad ūháthur dāśúṣe vásu  mádhvaḥ sómasya pītáye

translation.text: Come, O Nâsatyas, on your car decked with a sunbright canopy, Whereon ye ever bring wealth to the worshipper, to drink the Soma's pleasant juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्थेभि॑र॒र्वागव॑से पुरू॒वसू॑ अ॒र्कैश्च॒ नि ह्व॑यामहे शश्व॒त्कण्वा॑नां॒ सद॑सि प्रि॒ये हि कं॒ सोमं॑ प॒पथु॑रश्विना
verses.transliteration: ukthébhir arvā́g ávase purūvásū  arkaíś ca ní hvayāmahe  śáśvat káṇvānāṃ sádasi priyé hí kaṃ  sómam papáthur aśvinā

translation.text: With lauds and songs of praise we call them down to us, that they, most rich, may succour us; For ye have ever in the Kaṇvas' well-loved house, O Aṣvins, drunk the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒ह वा॒मेन॑ न उषो॒ व्यु॑च्छा दुहितर्दिवः स॒ह द्यु॒म्नेन॑ बृह॒ता वि॑भावरि रा॒या दे॑वि॒ दास्व॑ती
verses.transliteration: sahá vāména na uṣo  vy ùchā duhitar divaḥ  sahá dyumnéna br̥hatā́ vibhāvari  rāyā́ devi dā́svatī

translation.text: DAWN on us with prosperity, O Ushas, Daughter of the Sky, Dawn with great glory, Goddess, Lady of the Light, dawn thou with riches, Bounteous One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॑वती॒र्गोम॑तीर्विश्वसु॒विदो॒ भूरि॑ च्यवन्त॒ वस्त॑वे उदी॑रय॒ प्रति॑ मा सू॒नृता॑ उष॒श्चोद॒ राधो॑ म॒घोना॑म्
verses.transliteration: áśvāvatīr gómatīr viśvasuvído  bhū́ri cyavanta vástave  úd īraya práti mā sūnŕ̥tā uṣaś  códa rā́dho maghónām

translation.text: They, bringing steeds and kine, boon-givers of all wealth, have oft sped forth to lighten us. O Ushas, waken up for me the sounds of joy: send us the riches of the great.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒वासो॒षा उ॒च्छाच्च॒ नु दे॒वी जी॒रा रथा॑नाम् ये अ॑स्या आ॒चर॑णेषु दध्रि॒रे स॑मु॒द्रे न श्र॑व॒स्यवः॑
verses.transliteration: uvā́soṣā́ uchā́c ca nú  devī́ jīrā́ ráthānām  yé asyā ācáraṇeṣu dadhriré  samudré ná śravasyávaḥ

translation.text: Ushas hath dawned, and now shall dawn, the Goddess, driver forth of cars Which, as she cometh nigh, have fixed their thought on her, like glory-seekers on the flood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उषो॒ ये ते॒ प्र यामे॑षु यु॒ञ्जते॒ मनो॑ दा॒नाय॑ सू॒रयः॑ अत्राह॒ तत्कण्व॑ एषां॒ कण्व॑तमो॒ नाम॑ गृणाति नृ॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: úṣo yé te prá yā́meṣu yuñjáte  máno dānā́ya sūráyaḥ  átrā́ha tát káṇva eṣāṃ káṇvatamo  nā́ma gr̥ṇāti nr̥ṇā́m

translation.text: Here Kaṇva, chief of Kaṇva's race, sings forth aloud the glories of the heroes' names,– The. princes who, O Ushas, as thou comest near, direct their thoughts to liberal gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ घा॒ योषे॑व सू॒नर्यु॒षा या॑ति प्रभुञ्ज॒ती ज॒रय॑न्ती॒ वृज॑नं प॒द्वदी॑यत॒ उत्पा॑तयति प॒क्षिणः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ ghā yóṣeva sūnárī-  uṣā́ yāti prabhuñjatī́  jaráyantī vŕ̥janam padvád īyate-  út pātayati pakṣíṇaḥ

translation.text: Like a good matron Ushas comes carefully tending everything: Rousing all life she stirs all creatures that have feet, and makes the birds of air fly up.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि या सृ॒जति॒ सम॑नं॒ व्य१॒॑र्थिनः॑ प॒दं न वे॒त्योद॑ती वयो॒ नकि॑ष्टे पप्ति॒वांस॑ आसते॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ वाजिनीवति
verses.transliteration: ví yā́ sr̥játi sámanaṃ vy àrthínaḥ  padáṃ ná vety ódatī  váyo nákiṣ ṭe paptivā́ṃsa āsate  vyùṣṭau vājinīvati

translation.text: She sends the busy forth, each man to his pursuit: delay she knows not as she springs. O rich in opulence, after thy dawning birds that have flown forth no longer rest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षायु॑क्त परा॒वतः॒ सूर्य॑स्यो॒दय॑ना॒दधि॑ श॒तं रथे॑भिः सु॒भगो॒षा इ॒यं वि या॑त्य॒भि मानु॑षान्
verses.transliteration: eṣā́yukta parāvátaḥ  sū́ryasyodáyanād ádhi  śatáṃ ráthebhiḥ subhágoṣā́ iyáṃ  ví yāty abhí mā́nuṣān

translation.text: This Dawn hath yoked her steeds afar, beyond the rising of the Sun: Borne on a hundred chariots she, auspicious Dawn, advances on her way to Men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्व॑मस्या नानाम॒ चक्ष॑से॒ जग॒ज्ज्योति॑ष्कृणोति सू॒नरी॑ अप॒ द्वेषो॑ म॒घोनी॑ दुहि॒ता दि॒व उ॒षा उ॑च्छ॒दप॒ स्रिधः॑
verses.transliteration: víśvam asyā nānāma cákṣase jágaj  jyótiṣ kr̥ṇoti sūnárī  ápa dvéṣo maghónī duhitā́ diváḥ-  uṣā́ uchad ápa srídhaḥ

translation.text: To meet her glance all living creatures bend them down: Excellent One, she makes the light. Ushas, the Daughter of the Sky, the opulent, shines foes and enmities away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उष॒ आ भा॑हि भा॒नुना॑ च॒न्द्रेण॑ दुहितर्दिवः आ॒वह॑न्ती॒ भूर्य॒स्मभ्यं॒ सौभ॑गं व्यु॒च्छन्ती॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु
verses.transliteration: úṣa ā́ bhāhi bhānúnā  candréṇa duhitar divaḥ  āváhantī bhū́ry asmábhyaṃ saúbhagaṃ  vyuchántī díviṣṭiṣu

translation.text: Shine on us with thy radiant light, O Ushas, Daughter of the Sky, Bringing to us great store of high felicity, and bearning on our solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्व॑स्य॒ हि प्राण॑नं॒ जीव॑नं॒ त्वे वि यदु॒च्छसि॑ सूनरि सा नो॒ रथे॑न बृह॒ता वि॑भावरि श्रु॒धि चि॑त्रामघे॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: víśvasya hí prā́ṇanaṃ jī́vanaṃ tvé  ví yád uchási sūnari  sā́ no ráthena br̥hatā́ vibhāvari  śrudhí citrāmaghe hávam

translation.text: For in thee is each living creature's breath and life, when, Excellent! thou dawnest forth. Borne on thy lofty car, O Lady of the Light, hear, thou of wondrous wealth, our call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उषो॒ वाजं॒ हि वंस्व॒ यश्चि॒त्रो मानु॑षे॒ जने॑ तेना व॑ह सु॒कृतो॑ अध्व॒राँ उप॒ ये त्वा॑ गृ॒णन्ति॒ वह्न॑यः
verses.transliteration: úṣo vā́jaṃ hí váṃsva  yáś citró mā́nuṣe jáne  ténā́ vaha sukŕ̥to adhvarā́m̐ úpa  yé tvā gr̥ṇánti váhnayaḥ

translation.text: O Ushas, win thyself the strength which among men is wonderful. Bring thou thereby the pious unto holy rites, those who as priests sing praise to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑न्दे॒वाँ आ व॑ह॒ सोम॑पीतये॒ऽन्तरि॑क्षादुष॒स्त्वम् सास्मासु॑ धा॒ गोम॒दश्वा॑वदु॒क्थ्य१॒॑मुषो॒ वाजं॑ सु॒वीर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: víśvān devā́m̐ ā́ vaha sómapītaye  -antárikṣād uṣas tvám  sā́smā́su dhā gómad áśvāvad ukthyàm  úṣo vā́jaṃ suvī́ryam

translation.text: Bring from the firmament, O Ushas, all the Gods, that they may drink our Soma juice, And, being what thou art, vouchsafe us kine and steeds, strength meet for praist and hero might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्या॒ रुश॑न्तो अ॒र्चयः॒ प्रति॑ भ॒द्रा अदृ॑क्षत सा नो॑ र॒यिं वि॒श्ववा॑रं सु॒पेश॑समु॒षा द॑दातु॒ सुग्म्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: yásyā rúśanto arcáyaḥ  práti bhadrā́ ádr̥kṣata  sā́ no rayíṃ viśvávāraṃ supéśasam  uṣā́ dadātu súgmyam

translation.text: May Ushas whose auspicious rays are seen resplendent round about, Grant us great riches, fair in form, of all good things, wealth which light labour may attain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये चि॒द्धि त्वामृष॑यः॒ पूर्व॑ ऊ॒तये॑ जुहू॒रेऽव॑से महि सा नः॒ स्तोमाँ॑ अ॒भि गृ॑णीहि॒ राध॒सोषः॑ शु॒क्रेण॑ शो॒चिषा॑
verses.transliteration: yé cid dhí tvā́m ŕ̥ṣayaḥ pū́rva ūtáye  juhūré 'vase mahi  sā́ na stómām̐ abhí gr̥ṇīhi rā́dhasā-  -úṣaḥ śukréṇa śocíṣā

translation.text: Mighty One, whom the R̥ishis of old time invoked for their protection and their help, O Ushas, graciously answer our songs of praise with bounty and with brilliant light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उषो॒ यद॒द्य भा॒नुना॒ वि द्वारा॑वृ॒णवो॑ दि॒वः प्र नो॑ यच्छतादवृ॒कं पृ॒थु च्छ॒र्दिः प्र दे॑वि॒ गोम॑ती॒रिषः॑
verses.transliteration: úṣo yád adyá bhānúnā  ví dvā́rāv r̥ṇávo diváḥ  prá no yachatād avr̥kám pr̥thú chardíḥ  prá devi gómatīr íṣaḥ

translation.text: Ushas, as thou with light to day hast opened the twin doors of heaven, So grant thou us a dwelling wide and free from foes. O Goddess, give us food with kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं नो॑ रा॒या बृ॑ह॒ता वि॒श्वपे॑शसा मिमि॒क्ष्वा समिळा॑भि॒रा सं द्यु॒म्नेन॑ विश्व॒तुरो॑षो महि॒ सं वाजै॑र्वाजिनीवति
verses.transliteration: sáṃ no rāyā́ br̥hatā́ viśvápeśasā  mimikṣvā́ sám íḷābhir ā́  sáṃ dyumnéna viśvatúroṣo mahi  sáṃ vā́jair vājinīvati

translation.text: Bring us to wealth abundant, sent in every shape, to plentiful refreshing food, To all-subduing splendour, Ushas, Mighty One, to strength, thou rich in spoil and wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उषो॑ भ॒द्रेभि॒रा ग॑हि दि॒वश्चि॑द्रोच॒नादधि॑ वह॑न्त्वरु॒णप्स॑व॒ उप॑ त्वा सो॒मिनो॑ गृ॒हम्
verses.transliteration: úṣo bhadrébhir ā́ gahi  diváś cid rocanā́d ádhi  váhantv aruṇápsavaḥ-  úpa tvā somíno gr̥hám

translation.text: E'EN from above the sky's bright realm come, Ushas, by auspicious ways: Let red steeds bear thee to the house of him who pours the Soma, juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒पेश॑सं सु॒खं रथं॒ यम॒ध्यस्था॑ उष॒स्त्वम् तेना॑ सु॒श्रव॑सं॒ जनं॒ प्रावा॒द्य दु॑हितर्दिवः
verses.transliteration: supéśasaṃ sukháṃ ráthaṃ  yám adhyásthā uṣas tvám  ténā suśrávasaṃ jánam  prā́vādyá duhitar divaḥ

translation.text: The chariot which thou mountest, fair of shape, O Ushas light to move,– Therewith, O Daughter of the Sky, aid men of noble fame today.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वय॑श्चित्ते पत॒त्रिणो॑ द्वि॒पच्चतु॑ष्पदर्जुनि उषः॒ प्रार॑न्नृ॒तूँरनु॑ दि॒वो अन्ते॑भ्य॒स्परि॑
verses.transliteration: váyaś cit te patatríṇo  dvipác cátuṣpad arjuni  úṣaḥ prā́rann r̥tū́m̐r ánu  divó ántebhyas pári

translation.text: Bright Ushas, when thy times return, all quadrupeds and bipeds stir, And round about flock winged birds from all theboundaries of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्यु॒च्छन्ती॒ हि र॒श्मिभि॒र्विश्व॑मा॒भासि॑ रोच॒नम् तां त्वामु॑षर्वसू॒यवो॑ गी॒र्भिः कण्वा॑ अहूषत
verses.transliteration: vyuchántī hí raśmíbhir  víśvam ābhā́si rocanám  tā́ṃ tvā́m uṣar vasūyávo  gīrbhíḥ káṇvā ahūṣata

translation.text: Thou dawning with thy beams of light illumest all the radiant realm. Thee, as thou art, the Kaṇvas, fain for wealth, have called with sacred songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ त्यं जा॒तवे॑दसं दे॒वं व॑हन्ति के॒तवः॑ दृ॒शे विश्वा॑य॒ सूर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: úd u tyáṃ jātávedasaṃ  deváṃ vahanti ketávaḥ  dr̥śé víśvāya sū́ryam

translation.text: HIS bright rays bear him up aloft, the God who knoweth all that lives, Sûrya, that all may look on him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॒ त्ये ता॒यवो॑ यथा॒ नक्ष॑त्रा यन्त्य॒क्तुभिः॑ सूरा॑य वि॒श्वच॑क्षसे
verses.transliteration: ápa tyé tāyávo yathā  nákṣatrā yanty aktúbhiḥ  sū́rāya viśvácakṣase

translation.text: The constellations pass away, like thieves, together with their beams, Before the all-beholding Sun'

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदृ॑श्रमस्य के॒तवो॒ वि र॒श्मयो॒ जनाँ॒ अनु॑ भ्राज॑न्तो अ॒ग्नयो॑ यथा
verses.transliteration: ádr̥śram asya ketávo  ví raśmáyo jánām̐ ánu  bhrā́janto agnáyo yathā

translation.text: His herald rays are seen afar refulgent o'er the world of men, Like flames of fire that burn and blaze.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त॒रणि॑र्वि॒श्वद॑र्शतो ज्योति॒ष्कृद॑सि सूर्य विश्व॒मा भा॑सि रोच॒नम्
verses.transliteration: taráṇir viśvádarśato  jyotiṣkŕ̥d asi sūrya  víśvam ā́ bhāsi rocanám

translation.text: Swift and all beautiful art thou, O Sûrya, maker of the light, Illuming all the radiant realm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒त्यङ्दे॒वानां॒ विशः॑ प्र॒त्यङ्ङुदे॑षि॒ मानु॑षान् प्र॒त्यङ्विश्वं॒ स्व॑र्दृ॒शे
verses.transliteration: pratyáṅ devā́nāṃ víśaḥ  pratyáṅṅ úd eṣi mā́nuṣān  pratyáṅ víśvaṃ svàr dr̥śé

translation.text: Thou goest to the hosts of Gods, thou comest hither to mankind, Hither all light to be belield.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येना॑ पावक॒ चक्ष॑सा भुर॒ण्यन्तं॒ जनाँ॒ अनु॑ त्वं व॑रुण॒ पश्य॑सि
verses.transliteration: yénā pāvaka cákṣasā  bhuraṇyántaṃ jánām̐ ánu  tváṃ varuṇa páśyasi

translation.text: With that same eye of thine wherewith thou lookest brilliant Varuṇa, Upon the busy race of men,

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि द्यामे॑षि॒ रज॑स्पृ॒थ्वहा॒ मिमा॑नो अ॒क्तुभिः॑ पश्य॒ञ्जन्मा॑नि सूर्य
verses.transliteration: ví dyā́m eṣi rájas pr̥thú-  áhā mímāno aktúbhiḥ  páśyañ jánmāni sūrya

translation.text: traversing sky and wide mid-air, thou metest with thy beams our days, Sun, seeing all things that have birth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त त्वा॑ ह॒रितो॒ रथे॒ वह॑न्ति देव सूर्य शो॒चिष्के॑शं विचक्षण
verses.transliteration: saptá tvā haríto ráthe  váhanti deva sūrya  śocíṣkeśaṃ vicakṣaṇa

translation.text: Seven Bay Steeds harnessed to thy car bear thee, O thou farseeing One, God, Sûrya, with the radiant hair.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अयु॑क्त स॒प्त शु॒न्ध्युवः॒ सूरो॒ रथ॑स्य न॒प्त्यः॑ ताभि॑र्याति॒ स्वयु॑क्तिभिः
verses.transliteration: áyukta saptá śundhyúvaḥ  sū́ro ráthasya naptyàḥ  tā́bhir yāti sváyuktibhiḥ

translation.text: Sûrya hath yoked the pure bright Seven, the daughters of the car; with these, His own dear team, he goeth forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्व॒यं तम॑स॒स्परि॒ ज्योति॒ष्पश्य॑न्त॒ उत्त॑रम् दे॒वं दे॑व॒त्रा सूर्य॒मग॑न्म॒ ज्योति॑रुत्त॒मम्
verses.transliteration: úd vayáṃ támasas pári  jyótiṣ páśyanta úttaram  deváṃ devatrā́ sū́ryam  áganma jyótir uttamám

translation.text: Looking upon the loftier light above the darkness we have come To Sûrya, God among the Gods, the light that is most excellent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒द्यन्न॒द्य मि॑त्रमह आ॒रोह॒न्नुत्त॑रां॒ दिव॑म् हृ॒द्रो॒गं मम॑ सूर्य हरि॒माणं॑ च नाशय
verses.transliteration: udyánn adyá mitramahaḥ-  āróhann úttarāṃ dívam  hr̥drogám máma sūrya  harimā́ṇaṃ ca nāśaya

translation.text: Rising this day, O rich in friends, ascending to the loftier heaven, Sûrya remove my heart's disease, take from me this my yellow hue.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुके॑षु मे हरि॒माणं॑ रोप॒णाका॑सु दध्मसि अथो॑ हारिद्र॒वेषु॑ मे हरि॒माणं॒ नि द॑ध्मसि
verses.transliteration: śúkeṣu me harimā́ṇaṃ  ropaṇā́kāsu dadhmasi  átho hāridravéṣu me  harimā́ṇaṃ ní dadhmasi

translation.text: To parrots and to starlings let us give away my yellowness, Or this my yellowness let us transfer to Haritâla trees.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॑गाद॒यमा॑दि॒त्यो विश्वे॑न॒ सह॑सा स॒ह द्वि॒षन्तं॒ मह्यं॑ र॒न्धय॒न्मो अ॒हं द्वि॑ष॒ते र॑धम्
verses.transliteration: úd agād ayám ādityó  víśvena sáhasā sahá  dviṣántam máhyaṃ randháyan  mó aháṃ dviṣaté radham

translation.text: With all his conquering vigour this Âditya hath gone up on high, Giving my foe into mine hand: let me not be my foeman's prey.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्यं मे॒षं पु॑रुहू॒तमृ॒ग्मिय॒मिन्द्रं॑ गी॒र्भिर्म॑दता॒ वस्वो॑ अर्ण॒वम् यस्य॒ द्यावो॒ न वि॒चर॑न्ति॒ मानु॑षा भु॒जे मंहि॑ष्ठम॒भि विप्र॑मर्चत
verses.transliteration: abhí tyám meṣám puruhūtám r̥gmíyam  índraṃ gīrbhír madatā vásvo arṇavám  yásya dyā́vo ná vicáranti mā́nuṣā  bhujé máṃhiṣṭham abhí vípram arcata

translation.text: MAKE glad with songs that Ram whom many men invoke, worthy of songs of praise, Indra, the sea of wealth; Whose gracious deeds for men spread like the heavens abroad: sing praise to him the Sage, most liberal for our good.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भीम॑वन्वन्त्स्वभि॒ष्टिमू॒तयो॑ऽन्तरिक्ष॒प्रां तवि॑षीभि॒रावृ॑तम् इन्द्रं॒ दक्षा॑स ऋ॒भवो॑ मद॒च्युतं॑ श॒तक्र॑तुं॒ जव॑नी सू॒नृतारु॑हत्
verses.transliteration: abhī́m avanvan svabhiṣṭím ūtáyo  -antarikṣaprā́ṃ táviṣībhir ā́vr̥tam  índraṃ dákṣāsa r̥bhávo madacyútaṃ  śatákratuṃ jávanī sūnŕ̥tā́ruhat

translation.text: As aids the skilful R̥ibhus yearned to Indra strong to save, who fills mid-air, encompassed round with might, Rushing in rapture; and -o'er Ṣatakratu came the gladdening shout that urged him on to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं गो॒त्रमङ्गि॑रोभ्योऽवृणो॒रपो॒तात्र॑ये श॒तदु॑रेषु गातु॒वित् स॒सेन॑ चिद्विम॒दाया॑वहो॒ वस्वा॒जावद्रिं॑ वावसा॒नस्य॑ न॒र्तय॑न्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ gotrám áṅgirobhyo 'vr̥ṇor ápa-  -utā́traye śatádureṣu gātuvít  saséna cid vimadā́yāvaho vásu-  ājā́v ádriṃ vāvasānásya nartáyan

translation.text: Thou hast disclosed the kine's stall for the Angirases, and made a way for Atri by a hundred doors. On Vimada thou hast bestowed both food and wealth, making thy bolt dance in the sacrificer's fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॒पाम॑पि॒धाना॑वृणो॒रपाधा॑रयः॒ पर्व॑ते॒ दानु॑म॒द्वसु॑ वृ॒त्रं यदि॑न्द्र॒ शव॒साव॑धी॒रहि॒मादित्सूर्यं॑ दि॒व्यारो॑हयो दृ॒शे
verses.transliteration: tvám apā́m apidhā́nāvr̥ṇor ápa-  -ádhārayaḥ párvate dā́numad vásu  vr̥tráṃ yád indra śávasā́vadhīr áhim  ā́d ít sū́ryaṃ divy ā́rohayo dr̥śé

translation.text: Thou hast unclosed the prisons of the waters; thou hast in the mountain seized the treasure rich in gifts. When thou hadst slain with might the dragon Vr̥itra, thou, Indra, didst raise the Sun in heaven for all to see.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं मा॒याभि॒रप॑ मा॒यिनो॑ऽधमः स्व॒धाभि॒र्ये अधि॒ शुप्ता॒वजु॑ह्वत त्वं पिप्रो॑र्नृमणः॒ प्रारु॑जः॒ पुरः॒ प्र ऋ॒जिश्वा॑नं दस्यु॒हत्ये॑ष्वाविथ
verses.transliteration: tvám māyā́bhir ápa māyíno 'dhamaḥ  svadhā́bhir yé ádhi śúptāv ájuhvata  tvám pípror nr̥maṇaḥ prā́rujaḥ púraḥ  prá r̥jíśvānaṃ dasyuhátyeṣv āvitha

translation.text: With wondrous might thou blewest enchanter fiends away, with powers celestial those who called on thee in jest. Thou, hero-hearted, hast broken down Pipru's forts, and helped R̥ijiṣvan when the Dasyus were struck dead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं कुत्सं॑ शुष्ण॒हत्ये॑ष्वावि॒थार॑न्धयोऽतिथि॒ग्वाय॒ शम्ब॑रम् म॒हान्तं॑ चिदर्बु॒दं नि क्र॑मीः प॒दा स॒नादे॒व द॑स्यु॒हत्या॑य जज्ञिषे
verses.transliteration: tváṃ kútsaṃ śuṣṇahátyeṣv āvitha-  -árandhayo 'tithigvā́ya śámbaram  mahā́ntaṃ cid arbudáṃ ní kramīḥ padā́  sanā́d evá dasyuhátyāya jajñiṣe

translation.text: Thou savedst Kutsa when Ṣushṇa was smitten down; to Âtithigva gavest Ṣambara for a prey. E'en mighty Arbuda thou troddest under foot: thou from of old wast born to strike the Dasyus dead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे विश्वा॒ तवि॑षी स॒ध्र्य॑ग्घि॒ता तव॒ राधः॑ सोमपी॒थाय॑ हर्षते तव॒ वज्र॑श्चिकिते बा॒ह्वोर्हि॒तो वृ॒श्चा शत्रो॒रव॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ वृष्ण्या॑
verses.transliteration: tvé víśvā táviṣī sadhryàg ghitā́  táva rā́dhaḥ somapīthā́ya harṣate  táva vájraś cikite bāhvór hitó  vr̥ścā́ śátror áva víśvāni vŕ̥ṣṇyā

translation.text: All power and might is closely gathered up in thee; thy bounteous spirit joys in drinking Soma juice. Known is the thunderbolt that lies within thine arms: rend off therewith all manly prowess of our foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि जा॑नी॒ह्यार्या॒न्ये च॒ दस्य॑वो ब॒र्हिष्म॑ते रन्धया॒ शास॑दव्र॒तान् शाकी॑ भव॒ यज॑मानस्य चोदि॒ता विश्वेत्ता ते॑ सध॒मादे॑षु चाकन
verses.transliteration: ví jānīhy ā́ryān yé ca dásyavo  barhíṣmate randhayā śā́sad avratā́n  śā́kī bhava yájamānasya coditā́  víśvét tā́ te sadhamā́deṣu cākana

translation.text: Discern thou well Aryas and Dasyus; punishing the lawless give them up to him whose grass is strewn. Be thou the sacrificer's strong encourager all these thy deeds are my delight at festivals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑व्रताय र॒न्धय॒न्नप॑व्रताना॒भूभि॒रिन्द्रः॑ श्न॒थय॒न्नना॑भुवः वृ॒द्धस्य॑ चि॒द्वर्ध॑तो॒ द्यामिन॑क्षतः॒ स्तवा॑नो व॒म्रो वि ज॑घान सं॒दिहः॑
verses.transliteration: ánuvratāya randháyann ápavratān  ābhū́bhir índraḥ śnatháyann ánābhuvaḥ  vr̥ddhásya cid várdhato dyā́m ínakṣataḥ-  stávāno vamró ví jaghāna saṃdíhaḥ

translation.text: Indra gives up the lawless to the pious man, destroying by the Strong Ones those who have no strength. Vamra when glorified destroyed the gathered piles of the still waxing great one who would reach the heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तक्ष॒द्यत्त॑ उ॒शना॒ सह॑सा॒ सहो॒ वि रोद॑सी म॒ज्मना॑ बाधते॒ शवः॑ आ त्वा॒ वात॑स्य नृमणो मनो॒युज॒ आ पूर्य॑माणमवहन्न॒भि श्रवः॑
verses.transliteration: tákṣad yát ta uśánā sáhasā sáho  ví ródasī majmánā bādhate śávaḥ  ā́ tvā vā́tasya nr̥maṇo manoyújaḥ-  ā́ pū́ryamāṇam avahann abhí śrávaḥ

translation.text: The might which Uṣanâ hath formed for thee with might rends in its greatness and with strength both worlds apart. O Hero-souled, the steeds of Vâta, yoked by thought, have carried thee to fame while thou art filled with power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मन्दि॑ष्ट॒ यदु॒शने॑ का॒व्ये सचाँ॒ इन्द्रो॑ व॒ङ्कू व॑ङ्कु॒तराधि॑ तिष्ठति उ॒ग्रो य॒यिं निर॒पः स्रोत॑सासृज॒द्वि शुष्ण॑स्य दृंहि॒ता ऐ॑रय॒त्पुरः॑
verses.transliteration: mándiṣṭa yád uśáne kāvyé sácām̐  índro vaṅkū́ vaṅkutárā́dhi tiṣṭhati  ugró yayíṃ nír apáḥ srótasāsr̥jad  ví śúṣṇasya dr̥ṃhitā́ airayat púraḥ

translation.text: When Indra hath rejoiced with Kâvya Uṣanâ, he mounts his steeds who swerve wider and wider yet. The Strong hath loosed his bolt with the swift rush of rain, and he hath rent in pieces Ṣushṇa's firmbuilt forts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ स्मा॒ रथं॑ वृष॒पाणे॑षु तिष्ठसि शार्या॒तस्य॒ प्रभृ॑ता॒ येषु॒ मन्द॑से इन्द्र॒ यथा॑ सु॒तसो॑मेषु चा॒कनो॑ऽन॒र्वाणं॒ श्लोक॒मा रो॑हसे दि॒वि
verses.transliteration: ā́ smā ráthaṃ vr̥ṣapā́ṇeṣu tiṣṭhasi  śāryātásya prábhr̥tā yéṣu mándase  índra yáthā sutásomeṣu cākáno  -anarvā́ṇaṃ ślókam ā́ rohase diví

translation.text: Thou mountest on thy car amid strong Soma draughts: Ṣâryâta brought thee those in which thou hast delight. Indra, when thou art pleased with men whose Soma flows thou risest to unchallenged glory in the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद॑दा॒ अर्भां॑ मह॒ते व॑च॒स्यवे॑ क॒क्षीव॑ते वृच॒यामि॑न्द्र सुन्व॒ते मेना॑भवो वृषण॒श्वस्य॑ सुक्रतो॒ विश्वेत्ता ते॒ सव॑नेषु प्र॒वाच्या॑
verses.transliteration: ádadā árbhām mahaté vacasyáve  kakṣī́vate vr̥cayā́m indra sunvaté  ménābhavo vr̥ṣaṇaśvásya sukrato  víśvét tā́ te sávaneṣu pravā́cyā

translation.text: To old Kaksivin, Soma-presser, skilled in song, O Indra, thou didst give the youthful Vr̥ichayâ. Thou, very wise, wast Menâ, Vrishaṇaṣva's child: those deeds of thine must all be told at Soma feasts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ अश्रायि सु॒ध्यो॑ निरे॒के प॒ज्रेषु॒ स्तोमो॒ दुर्यो॒ न यूपः॑ अ॒श्व॒युर्ग॒व्यू र॑थ॒युर्व॑सू॒युरिन्द्र॒ इद्रा॒यः क्ष॑यति प्रय॒न्ता
verses.transliteration: índro aśrāyi sudhyò nireké  pajréṣu stómo dúryo ná yū́paḥ  aśvayúr gavyū́ rathayúr vasūyúr  índra íd rāyáḥ kṣayati prayantā́

translation.text: The good man's refuge in his need is Indra, firm as a doorpost, praised among the Pajras. Indra alone is Lord of wealth, the Giver, lover of riches, chariots, kine, and horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं नमो॑ वृष॒भाय॑ स्व॒राजे॑ स॒त्यशु॑ष्माय त॒वसे॑ऽवाचि अ॒स्मिन्नि॑न्द्र वृ॒जने॒ सर्व॑वीराः॒ स्मत्सू॒रिभि॒स्तव॒ शर्म॑न्त्स्याम
verses.transliteration: idáṃ námo vr̥ṣabhā́ya svarā́je  satyáśuṣmāya taváse 'vāci  asmínn indra vr̥jáne sárvavīrāḥ  smát sūríbhis táva śárman syāma

translation.text: To him the Mighty One, the self-resplendent, verily strong and great, this praise is uttered. May we and all the heroes, with the princes, be, in this fray, O Indra, in thy keeping.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्यं सु मे॒षं म॑हया स्व॒र्विदं॑ श॒तं यस्य॑ सु॒भ्वः॑ सा॒कमीर॑ते अत्यं॒ न वाजं॑ हवन॒स्यदं॒ रथ॒मेन्द्रं॑ ववृत्या॒मव॑से सुवृ॒क्तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: tyáṃ sú meṣám mahayā svarvídaṃ  śatáṃ yásya subhvàḥ sākám ī́rate  átyaṃ ná vā́jaṃ havanasyádaṃ rátham  éndraṃ vavr̥tyām ávase suvr̥ktíbhiḥ

translation.text: I GLORIFY that Ram who finds the light of heaven, whose hundred nobly-natured ones go forth with him. With hymns may I turn hither Indra to mine aid,– the Car which like a strong steed hasteth to the call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स पर्व॑तो॒ न ध॒रुणे॒ष्वच्यु॑तः स॒हस्र॑मूति॒स्तवि॑षीषु वावृधे इन्द्रो॒ यद्वृ॒त्रमव॑धीन्नदी॒वृत॑मु॒ब्जन्नर्णां॑सि॒ जर्हृ॑षाणो॒ अन्ध॑सा
verses.transliteration: sá párvato ná dharúṇeṣv ácyutaḥ  sahásramūtis táviṣīṣu vāvr̥dhe  índro yád vr̥trám ávadhīn nadīvŕ̥tam  ubjánn árṇāṃsi járhr̥ṣāṇo ándhasā

translation.text: Like as a mountain on firm basis, unremoved, he, thousandfold protector, waxed in mighty strength, When Indra, joying in the draughts of Soma juice, forced the clouds, slaying Vr̥itra stayer of their flow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि द्व॒रो द्व॒रिषु॑ व॒व्र ऊध॑नि च॒न्द्रबु॑ध्नो॒ मद॑वृद्धो मनी॒षिभिः॑ इन्द्रं॒ तम॑ह्वे स्वप॒स्यया॑ धि॒या मंहि॑ष्ठरातिं॒ स हि पप्रि॒रन्ध॑सः
verses.transliteration: sá hí dvaró dvaríṣu vavrá ū́dhani  candrábudhno mádavr̥ddho manīṣíbhiḥ  índraṃ tám ahve svapasyáyā dhiyā́  máṃhiṣṭharātiṃ sá hí páprir ándhasaḥ

translation.text: For he stays e'en the stayers, spread o'er laden cloud, rooted in light, strengthened in rapture by the wise. Indra with thought, with skilled activity, I call, most liberal giver, for he sates him with the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यं पृ॒णन्ति॑ दि॒वि सद्म॑बर्हिषः समु॒द्रं न सु॒भ्व१॒॑ः स्वा अ॒भिष्ट॑यः तं वृ॑त्र॒हत्ये॒ अनु॑ तस्थुरू॒तयः॒ शुष्मा॒ इन्द्र॑मवा॒ता अह्रु॑तप्सवः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yám pr̥ṇánti diví sádmabarhiṣaḥ  samudráṃ ná subhvàḥ svā́ abhíṣṭayaḥ  táṃ vr̥trahátye ánu tasthur ūtáyaḥ  śúṣmā índram avātā́ áhrutapsavaḥ

translation.text: Whom those that flow in heaven on sacred grass, his own assistants, nobly-natured, fill full like the sea,– Beside that Indra when he smote down Vr̥itra stood his helpers, straight in form, mighty, invincible.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि स्ववृ॑ष्टिं॒ मदे॑ अस्य॒ युध्य॑तो र॒घ्वीरि॑व प्रव॒णे स॑स्रुरू॒तयः॑ इन्द्रो॒ यद्व॒ज्री धृ॒षमा॑णो॒ अन्ध॑सा भि॒नद्व॒लस्य॑ परि॒धीँरि॑व त्रि॒तः
verses.transliteration: abhí svávr̥ṣṭim máde asya yúdhyato  raghvī́r iva pravaṇé sasrur ūtáyaḥ  índro yád vajrī́ dhr̥ṣámāṇo ándhasā  bhinád valásya paridhī́m̐r iva tritáḥ

translation.text: To him, as in wild joy he fought with him who stayed the rain, his helpers sped like swift streams down a slope, When Indra, thunder-armed, made bold by Soma draughts, as Trita cleaveth Vala's fences, cleft him through.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परीं॑ घृ॒णा च॑रति तित्वि॒षे शवो॒ऽपो वृ॒त्वी रज॑सो बु॒ध्नमाश॑यत् वृ॒त्रस्य॒ यत्प्र॑व॒णे दु॒र्गृभि॑श्वनो निज॒घन्थ॒ हन्वो॑रिन्द्र तन्य॒तुम्
verses.transliteration: párīṃ ghr̥ṇā́ carati titviṣé śávo  -apó vr̥tvī́ rájaso budhnám ā́śayat  vr̥trásya yát pravaṇé durgŕ̥bhiśvano  nijaghántha hánvor indra tanyatúm

translation.text: Splendour encompassed thee, forth shone thy warrior might: the rain-obstructer lay in mid-air's lowest deep, What time, O Indra, thou didst cast thy thunder down upon the jaws of Vritra hard to be restrained.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह्र॒दं न हि त्वा॑ न्यृ॒षन्त्यू॒र्मयो॒ ब्रह्मा॑णीन्द्र॒ तव॒ यानि॒ वर्ध॑ना त्वष्टा॑ चित्ते॒ युज्यं॑ वावृधे॒ शव॑स्त॒तक्ष॒ वज्र॑म॒भिभू॑त्योजसम्
verses.transliteration: hradáṃ ná hí tvā nyr̥ṣánty ūrmáyo  bráhmāṇīndra táva yā́ni várdhanā  tváṣṭā cit te yújyaṃ vāvr̥dhe śávas  tatákṣa vájram abhíbhūtyojasam

translation.text: The hymns which magnify thee, Indra, reach to thee even as water-brooks flow down and fill the lake. Tvashṭar gave yet more force to thine appropriate strength, and forged thy thunderbolt of overpowering might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒घ॒न्वाँ उ॒ हरि॑भिः सम्भृतक्रत॒विन्द्र॑ वृ॒त्रं मनु॑षे गातु॒यन्न॒पः अय॑च्छथा बा॒ह्वोर्वज्र॑माय॒समधा॑रयो दि॒व्या सूर्यं॑ दृ॒शे
verses.transliteration: jaghanvā́m̐ u háribhiḥ sambhr̥takratav  índra vr̥trám mánuṣe gātuyánn apáḥ  áyachathā bāhvór vájram āyasám  ádhārayo divy ā́ sū́ryaṃ dr̥śé

translation.text: When, Indra, thou whose power is linked with thy Bay Steeds hadst smitten Vr̥itra, causing floods to flow for man, Thou heldst in thine arms the metal thunderbolt, and settest in the heaven the Sun for all to see.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हत्स्वश्च॑न्द्र॒मम॑व॒द्यदु॒क्थ्य१॒॑मकृ॑ण्वत भि॒यसा॒ रोह॑णं दि॒वः यन्मानु॑षप्रधना॒ इन्द्र॑मू॒तयः॒ स्व॑र्नृ॒षाचो॑ म॒रुतोऽम॑द॒न्ननु॑
verses.transliteration: br̥hát sváścandram ámavad yád ukthyàm  ákr̥ṇvata bhiyásā róhaṇaṃ diváḥ  yán mā́nuṣapradhanā índram ūtáyaḥ  svàr nr̥ṣā́co marútó 'madann ánu

translation.text: In fear they raised the lofty self-resplendent hymn, praise giving and effectual, leading up to heaven, When Indra's helpers fighting for the good of men, the Maruts, faithful to mankind, joyed in the light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यौश्चि॑द॒स्याम॑वाँ॒ अहेः॑ स्व॒नादयो॑यवीद्भि॒यसा॒ वज्र॑ इन्द्र ते वृ॒त्रस्य॒ यद्ब॑द्बधा॒नस्य॑ रोदसी॒ मदे॑ सु॒तस्य॒ शव॒साभि॑न॒च्छिरः॑
verses.transliteration: dyaúś cid asyā́mavām̐ áheḥ svanā́d  áyoyavīd bhiyásā vájra indra te  vr̥trásya yád badbadhānásya ródasī*  máde sutásya śávasā́bhinac chíraḥ

translation.text: Then Heaven himself, the mighty, at that Dragon's roar reeled back in terror when, Indra, thy thunderbolt In the wild joy of Soma had struck off with might the head of Vr̥itra, tyrant of the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदिन्न्वि॑न्द्र पृथि॒वी दश॑भुजि॒रहा॑नि॒ विश्वा॑ त॒तन॑न्त कृ॒ष्टयः॑ अत्राह॑ ते मघव॒न्विश्रु॑तं॒ सहो॒ द्यामनु॒ शव॑सा ब॒र्हणा॑ भुवत्
verses.transliteration: yád ín nv ìndra pr̥thivī́ dáśabhujir  áhāni víśvā tatánanta kr̥ṣṭáyaḥ  átrā́ha te maghavan víśrutaṃ sáho  dyā́m ánu śávasā barháṇā bhuvat

translation.text: O Indra, were this earth extended forth tenfold, and men who dwell therein multiplied day by day, Still here thy conquering might, Maghavan, would be famed: it hath waxed vast as heaven in majesty and power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॒स्य पा॒रे रज॑सो॒ व्यो॑मनः॒ स्वभू॑त्योजा॒ अव॑से धृषन्मनः च॒कृ॒षे भूमिं॑ प्रति॒मान॒मोज॑सो॒ऽपः स्वः॑ परि॒भूरे॒ष्या दिव॑म्
verses.transliteration: tvám asyá pāré rájaso vyòmanaḥ  svábhūtyojā ávase dhr̥ṣanmanaḥ  cakr̥ṣé bhū́mim pratimā́nam ójaso  -apáḥ svàḥ paribhū́r eṣy ā́ dívam

translation.text: Thou, bold of heart, in thine own native might, for help, upon the limit of this mid-air and of heaven, Hast made the earth to be the pattern of thy strength: embracing flood and light thou reachest to the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं भु॑वः प्रति॒मानं॑ पृथि॒व्या ऋ॒ष्ववी॑रस्य बृह॒तः पति॑र्भूः विश्व॒माप्रा॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षं महि॒त्वा स॒त्यम॒द्धा नकि॑र॒न्यस्त्वावा॑न्
verses.transliteration: tvám bhuvaḥ pratimā́nam pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  r̥ṣvávīrasya br̥hatáḥ pátir bhūḥ  víśvam ā́ prā antárikṣam mahitvā́  satyám addhā́ nákir anyás tvā́vān

translation.text: Thou art the counterpart of earth, the Master of lofty heaven with all its mighty Heroes: Thou hast filled all the region with thy greatness: yea, of a truth there is none other like thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यस्य॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अनु॒ व्यचो॒ न सिन्ध॑वो॒ रज॑सो॒ अन्त॑मान॒शुः नोत स्ववृ॑ष्टिं॒ मदे॑ अस्य॒ युध्य॑त॒ एको॑ अ॒न्यच्च॑कृषे॒ विश्व॑मानु॒षक्
verses.transliteration: ná yásya dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ánu vyáco  ná síndhavo rájaso ántam ānaśúḥ  nótá svávr̥ṣṭim máde asya yúdhyataḥ-  éko anyác cakr̥ṣe víśvam ānuṣák

translation.text: Whose amplitude the heaven and earth have not attained, whose bounds the waters of mid-air have never reached,– Not, when in joy he fights the stayer of the rain: thou, and none else, hast made all things in order due.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आर्च॒न्नत्र॑ म॒रुतः॒ सस्मि॑न्ना॒जौ विश्वे॑ दे॒वासो॑ अमद॒न्ननु॑ त्वा वृ॒त्रस्य॒ यद्भृ॑ष्टि॒मता॑ व॒धेन॒ नि त्वमि॑न्द्र॒ प्रत्या॒नं ज॒घन्थ॑
verses.transliteration: ā́rcann átra marútaḥ sásminn ājaú  víśve devā́so amadann ánu tvā  vr̥trásya yád bhr̥ṣṭimátā vadhéna  ní tvám indra práty ānáṃ jaghántha

translation.text: The Maruts sang thy praise in this encounter, and in thee all the Deities delighted, What time thou, Indra, with thy spiky weapon, thy deadly bolt, smotest the face of Vr̥itra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न्यू॒३॒॑ षु वाचं॒ प्र म॒हे भ॑रामहे॒ गिर॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ सद॑ने वि॒वस्व॑तः नू चि॒द्धि रत्नं॑ सस॒तामि॒वावि॑द॒न्न दु॑ष्टु॒तिर्द्र॑विणो॒देषु॑ शस्यते
verses.transliteration: ny ū̀ ṣú vā́cam prá mahé bharāmahe  gíra índrāya sádane vivásvataḥ  nū́ cid dhí rátnaṃ sasatā́m ivā́vidat-  ná duṣṭutír draviṇodéṣu śasyate

translation.text: WE will present fair praise unto the Mighty One, our hymns to Indra in Vivasvdn's dwelling-place; For he hath ne'er found wealth in those who seem to sleep: those who give wealth to men accept no paltry praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दु॒रो अश्व॑स्य दु॒र इ॑न्द्र॒ गोर॑सि दु॒रो यव॑स्य॒ वसु॑न इ॒नस्पतिः॑ शि॒क्षा॒न॒रः प्र॒दिवो॒ अका॑मकर्शनः॒ सखा॒ सखि॑भ्य॒स्तमि॒दं गृ॑णीमसि
verses.transliteration: duró áśvasya durá indra gór asi  duró yávasya vásuna inás pátiḥ  śikṣānaráḥ pradívo ákāmakarśanaḥ  sákhā sákhibhyas tám idáṃ gr̥ṇīmasi

translation.text: Giver of horses, Indra, giver, thou, of kine, giver of barley, thou art Lord and guard of wealth: Man's helper from of old, not disappointing hope, Friend of our friends, to thee ,as such we sing this praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शची॑व इन्द्र पुरुकृद्द्युमत्तम॒ तवेदि॒दम॒भित॑श्चेकिते॒ वसु॑ अतः॑ सं॒गृभ्या॑भिभूत॒ आ भ॑र॒ मा त्वा॑य॒तो ज॑रि॒तुः काम॑मूनयीः
verses.transliteration: śácīva indra purukr̥d dyumattama  távéd idám abhítaś cekite vásu  átaḥ saṃgŕ̥bhyābhibhūta ā́ bhara  mā́ tvāyató jaritúḥ kā́mam ūnayīḥ

translation.text: Indra, most splendid, powerful, rich in mighty deeds, this treasure spread around is known to be thine own. Gather therefrom, O Conqueror, and bring to us: fail not the hope of him who loves and sings to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒भिर्द्युभिः॑ सु॒मना॑ ए॒भिरिन्दु॑भिर्निरुन्धा॒नो अम॑तिं॒ गोभि॑र॒श्विना॑ इन्द्रे॑ण॒ दस्युं॑ द॒रय॑न्त॒ इन्दु॑भिर्यु॒तद्वे॑षसः॒ समि॒षा र॑भेमहि
verses.transliteration: ebhír dyúbhiḥ sumánā ebhír índubhir  nirundhānó ámatiṃ góbhir aśvínā  índreṇa dásyuṃ daráyanta índubhir  yutádveṣasaḥ sám iṣā́ rabhemahi

translation.text: Well pleased with these bright flames and with these Soma drops, take thou away our poverty with seeds and kine. With Indra scattering the Dasyu through these drops, freed from their hate may we obtain abundant food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑न्द्र रा॒या समि॒षा र॑भेमहि॒ सं वाजे॑भिः पुरुश्च॒न्द्रैर॒भिद्यु॑भिः सं दे॒व्या प्रम॑त्या वी॒रशु॑ष्मया॒ गोअ॑ग्र॒याश्वा॑वत्या रभेमहि
verses.transliteration: sám indra rāyā́ sám iṣā́ rabhemahi  sáṃ vā́jebhiḥ puruścandraír abhídyubhiḥ  sáṃ devyā́ prámatyā vīráśuṣmayā  góagrayā́śvāvatyā rabhemahi

translation.text: Let us obtain, O Indra, plenteous wealth and food, with strength exceeding glorious, shining to the sky: May we obtain the Goddess Providence, the strength of heroes, special source of cattle, rich in steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते त्वा॒ मदा॑ अमद॒न्तानि॒ वृष्ण्या॒ ते सोमा॑सो वृत्र॒हत्ये॑षु सत्पते यत्का॒रवे॒ दश॑ वृ॒त्राण्य॑प्र॒ति ब॒र्हिष्म॑ते॒ नि स॒हस्रा॑णि ब॒र्हयः॑
verses.transliteration: té tvā mádā amadan tā́ni vŕ̥ṣṇyā  té sómāso vr̥trahátyeṣu satpate  yát kāráve dáśa vr̥trā́ṇy apratí  barhíṣmate ní sahásrāṇi barháyaḥ

translation.text: These our libations strength-inspiring, Soma draughts, gladdened thee in the fight with Vr̥itra, Hero Lord, What time thou slewest for the singer with trimmed grass ten thousand Vr̥itras, thou resistless in thy might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒धा युध॒मुप॒ घेदे॑षि धृष्णु॒या पु॒रा पुरं॒ समि॒दं हं॒स्योज॑सा नम्या॒ यदि॑न्द्र॒ सख्या॑ परा॒वति॑ निब॒र्हयो॒ नमु॑चिं॒ नाम॑ मा॒यिन॑म्
verses.transliteration: yudhā́ yúdham úpa ghéd eṣi dhr̥ṣṇuyā́  purā́ púraṃ sám idáṃ haṃsy ójasā  námyā yád indra sákhyā parāváti  nibarháyo námuciṃ nā́ma māyínam

translation.text: Thou goest on from fight to fight intrepidly, destroying castle after castle here with strength. Thou, Indra, with thy friend who makes the foe bow down, slewest from far away the guileful Namuci.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं कर॑ञ्जमु॒त प॒र्णयं॑ वधी॒स्तेजि॑ष्ठयातिथि॒ग्वस्य॑ वर्त॒नी त्वं श॒ता वङ्गृ॑दस्याभिन॒त्पुरो॑ऽनानु॒दः परि॑षूता ऋ॒जिश्व॑ना
verses.transliteration: tváṃ kárañjam utá parṇáyaṃ vadhīs  téjiṣṭhayātithigvásya vartanī́  tváṃ śatā́ váṅgr̥dasyābhinat púro  -anānudáḥ páriṣūtā r̥jíśvanā

translation.text: Thou hast struck down in death Karanja, Parṇaya, in Âtithigva's very glorious going forth. Unyielding, when R̥ijiṣvan compassed them with siege, thou hast destroyed the hundred forts of Vangr̥ida.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमे॒ताञ्ज॑न॒राज्ञो॒ द्विर्दशा॑ब॒न्धुना॑ सु॒श्रव॑सोपज॒ग्मुषः॑ ष॒ष्टिं स॒हस्रा॑ नव॒तिं नव॑ श्रु॒तो नि च॒क्रेण॒ रथ्या॑ दु॒ष्पदा॑वृणक्
verses.transliteration: tvám etā́ñ janarā́jño dvír dáśa-  -abandhúnā suśrávasopajagmúṣaḥ  ṣaṣṭíṃ sahásrā navatíṃ náva śrutó  ní cakréṇa ráthyā duṣpádāvr̥ṇak

translation.text: With all-outstripping chariot-wheel, O Indra, thou far-famed, hast overthrown the twice ten Kings of men, With sixty thousand nine-and-ninety followers, who came in arms to fight with friendless Suṣravâs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमा॑विथ सु॒श्रव॑सं॒ तवो॒तिभि॒स्तव॒ त्राम॑भिरिन्द्र॒ तूर्व॑याणम् त्वम॑स्मै॒ कुत्स॑मतिथि॒ग्वमा॒युं म॒हे राज्ञे॒ यूने॑ अरन्धनायः
verses.transliteration: tvám āvitha suśrávasaṃ távotíbhis  táva trā́mabhir indra tū́rvayāṇam  tvám asmai kútsam atithigvám āyúm  mahé rā́jñe yū́ne arandhanāyaḥ

translation.text: Thou hast protected Suṣravâs with succour, and Tûrvayâṇa with thine aid, O Indra. Thou madest Kutsa, Âtithigva, Âyu, subject unto this King, the young, the mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य उ॒दृची॑न्द्र दे॒वगो॑पाः॒ सखा॑यस्ते शि॒वत॑मा॒ असा॑म त्वां स्तो॑षाम॒ त्वया॑ सु॒वीरा॒ द्राघी॑य॒ आयुः॑ प्रत॒रं दधा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: yá udŕ̥cīndra devágopāḥ  sákhāyas te śivátamā ásāma  tvā́ṃ stoṣāma tváyā suvī́rāḥ-  drā́ghīya ā́yuḥ prataráṃ dádhānāḥ

translation.text: May we protected by the Gods hereafter remain thy very prosperous friends, O Indra. Thee we extol, enjoying through thy favour life long and joyful and with store of heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ अ॒स्मिन्म॑घवन्पृ॒त्स्वंह॑सि न॒हि ते॒ अन्तः॒ शव॑सः परी॒णशे॑ अक्र॑न्दयो न॒द्यो॒३॒॑ रोरु॑व॒द्वना॑ क॒था न क्षो॒णीर्भि॒यसा॒ समा॑रत
verses.transliteration: mā́ no asmín maghavan pr̥tsv áṃhasi  nahí te ántaḥ śávasaḥ parīṇáśe  ákrandayo nadyò róruvad vánā  kathā́ ná kṣoṇī́r bhiyásā sám ārata

translation.text: URGE us not, Maghavan, to this distressful fight, for none may comprehend the limit of thy strength. Thou with fierce shout hast made the woods and rivers roar: did not men run in crowds together in their fear?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्चा॑ श॒क्राय॑ शा॒किने॒ शची॑वते शृ॒ण्वन्त॒मिन्द्रं॑ म॒हय॑न्न॒भि ष्टु॑हि यो धृ॒ष्णुना॒ शव॑सा॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे वृषा॑ वृष॒त्वा वृ॑ष॒भो न्यृ॒ञ्जते॑
verses.transliteration: árcā śakrā́ya śākíne śácīvate  śr̥ṇvántam índram maháyann abhí ṣṭuhi  yó dhr̥ṣṇúnā śávasā ródasī ubhé  vŕ̥ṣā vr̥ṣatvā́ vr̥ṣabhó nyr̥ñjáte

translation.text: Sing hymns of praise to Ṣakra, Lord of power and might; laud thou and magnify Indra who hearcth thee, Who with his daring might, a Bull exceeding strong in strength, maketh him master of the heaven and earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्चा॑ दि॒वे बृ॑ह॒ते शू॒ष्यं१॒॑ वचः॒ स्वक्ष॑त्रं॒ यस्य॑ धृष॒तो धृ॒षन्मनः॑ बृ॒हच्छ्र॑वा॒ असु॑रो ब॒र्हणा॑ कृ॒तः पु॒रो हरि॑भ्यां वृष॒भो रथो॒ हि षः
