verses.transliteration: árcā divé br̥haté śūṣyàṃ vácaḥ  svákṣatraṃ yásya dhr̥ṣató dhr̥ṣán mánaḥ  br̥hácchravā ásuro barháṇā kr̥táḥ  puró háribhyāṃ vr̥ṣabhó rátho hí ṣáḥ

translation.text: Sing forth to lofty Dyaus a strength-bestowing song, the Bold, whose resolute mind hath independent sway. High glory hath the Asura, compact of strength, drawn on by two Bay Steeds: a Bull, a Car is he.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तः सानु॑ कोप॒योऽव॒ त्मना॑ धृष॒ता शम्ब॑रं भिनत् यन्मा॒यिनो॑ व्र॒न्दिनो॑ म॒न्दिना॑ धृ॒षच्छि॒तां गभ॑स्तिम॒शनिं॑ पृत॒न्यसि॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ divó br̥hatáḥ sā́nu kopayaḥ-  -áva tmánā dhr̥ṣatā́ śámbaram bhinat  yán māyíno vrandíno mandínā dhr̥ṣác  -śitā́ṃ gábhastim aśánim pr̥tanyási

translation.text: The ridges of the lofty heaven thou madest shake; thou, daring, of thyself smotest through Ṣambara, When bold with gladdening juice, thou warredst with thy bolt, sharp and twoedged, against the banded sorcerers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि यद्वृ॒णक्षि॑ श्वस॒नस्य॑ मू॒र्धनि॒ शुष्ण॑स्य चिद्व्र॒न्दिनो॒ रोरु॑व॒द्वना॑ प्रा॒चीने॑न॒ मन॑सा ब॒र्हणा॑वता॒ यद॒द्या चि॑त्कृ॒णवः॒ कस्त्वा॒ परि॑
verses.transliteration: ní yád vr̥ṇákṣi śvasanásya mūrdháni  śúṣṇasya cid vrandíno róruvad vánā  prācī́nena mánasā barháṇāvatā  yád adyā́ cit kr̥ṇávaḥ kás tvā pári

translation.text: When with a roar that fills the woods, thou forcest down on wind's head the stores which 8usga kept confined, Who shall have power to stay thee firm and eager-souled from doing still this day what thou of old hast done?

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमा॑विथ॒ नर्यं॑ तु॒र्वशं॒ यदुं॒ त्वं तु॒र्वीतिं॑ व॒य्यं॑ शतक्रतो त्वं रथ॒मेत॑शं॒ कृत्व्ये॒ धने॒ त्वं पुरो॑ नव॒तिं द॑म्भयो॒ नव॑
verses.transliteration: tvám āvitha náryaṃ turváśaṃ yáduṃ  tváṃ turvī́tiṃ vayyàṃ śatakrato  tváṃ rátham étaśaṃ kŕ̥tvye dháne  tvám púro navatíṃ dambhayo náva

translation.text: Thou helpest Narya, Turvaṣa, and Yadu, and Vayya's son Turvîti, Ṣatakratu! Thou helpest horse and car in final battle thou breakest down the nine-and-ninety castles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स घा॒ राजा॒ सत्प॑तिः शूशुव॒ज्जनो॑ रा॒तह॑व्यः॒ प्रति॒ यः शास॒मिन्व॑ति उ॒क्था वा॒ यो अ॑भिगृ॒णाति॒ राध॑सा॒ दानु॑रस्मा॒ उप॑रा पिन्वते दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: sá ghā rā́jā sátpatiḥ śūśuvaj jáno  rātáhavyaḥ práti yáḥ śā́sam ínvati  ukthā́ vā yó abhigr̥ṇā́ti rā́dhasā  dā́nur asmā úparā pinvate diváḥ

translation.text: A hero-lord is he, King of a mighty folk, who offers free oblations and promotes the Law, Who with a bounteous guerdon welcomes hymns of praise: for him flows down the abundant stream below the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॑मं क्ष॒त्रमस॑मा मनी॒षा प्र सो॑म॒पा अप॑सा सन्तु॒ नेमे॑ ये त॑ इन्द्र द॒दुषो॑ व॒र्धय॑न्ति॒ महि॑ क्ष॒त्रं स्थवि॑रं॒ वृष्ण्यं॑ च
verses.transliteration: ásamaṃ kṣatrám ásamā manīṣā́  prá somapā́ ápasā santu néme  yé ta indra dadúṣo vardháyanti  máhi kṣatráṃ stháviraṃ vŕ̥ṣṇyaṃ ca

translation.text: His power is matchless, matchless is his wisdom; chief, through their work, be some who drink the Soma, Those, Indra, who increase the lordly power, the firm heroic strength of thee the Giver.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्येदे॒ते ब॑हु॒ला अद्रि॑दुग्धाश्चमू॒षद॑श्चम॒सा इ॑न्द्र॒पानाः॑ व्य॑श्नुहि त॒र्पया॒ काम॑मेषा॒मथा॒ मनो॑ वसु॒देया॑य कृष्व
verses.transliteration: túbhyéd eté bahulā́ ádridugdhāś  camūṣádaś camasā́ indrapā́nāḥ  vy àśnuhi tarpáyā kā́mam eṣām  áthā máno vasudéyāya kr̥ṣva

translation.text: Therefore for thee are these abundant beakers Indra's drink, stone-pressed juices held in ladles. Quaff them and satisfy therewith thy longing; then fix thy mind upon bestowing treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पाम॑तिष्ठद्ध॒रुण॑ह्वरं॒ तमो॒ऽन्तर्वृ॒त्रस्य॑ ज॒ठरे॑षु॒ पर्व॑तः अ॒भीमिन्द्रो॑ न॒द्यो॑ व॒व्रिणा॑ हि॒ता विश्वा॑ अनु॒ष्ठाः प्र॑व॒णेषु॑ जिघ्नते
verses.transliteration: apā́m atiṣṭhad dharúṇahvaraṃ támo  -antár vr̥trásya jaṭháreṣu párvataḥ  abhī́m índro nadyò vavríṇā hitā́ḥ-  víśvā anuṣṭhā́ḥ pravaṇéṣu jighnate

translation.text: There darkness stood, the vault that stayed the waters' flow: in Vr̥itra's hollow side the rain-cloud lay concealed. But Indra smote the rivers which the obstructer stayed, flood following after flood, down steep declivitics.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स शेवृ॑ध॒मधि॑ धा द्यु॒म्नम॒स्मे महि॑ क्ष॒त्रं ज॑ना॒षाळि॑न्द्र॒ तव्य॑म् रक्षा॑ च नो म॒घोनः॑ पा॒हि सू॒रीन्रा॒ये च॑ नः स्वप॒त्या इ॒षे धाः॑
verses.transliteration: sá śévr̥dham ádhi dhā dyumnám asmé  máhi kṣatráṃ janāṣā́ḷ indra távyam  rákṣā ca no maghónaḥ pāhí sūrī́n  rāyé ca naḥ svapatyā́ iṣé dhāḥ

translation.text: So give us, Indra, bliss-increasing glory give us great sway and strength that conquers people. Preserve our wealthy patrons, save our princes; vouchsafe us wealth and food with noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वश्चि॑दस्य वरि॒मा वि प॑प्रथ॒ इन्द्रं॒ न म॒ह्ना पृ॑थि॒वी च॒न प्रति॑ भी॒मस्तुवि॑ष्माञ्चर्ष॒णिभ्य॑ आत॒पः शिशी॑ते॒ वज्रं॒ तेज॑से॒ न वंस॑गः
verses.transliteration: diváś cid asya varimā́ ví paprathe-  índraṃ ná mahnā́ pr̥thivī́ caná práti  bhīmás túviṣmāñ carṣaṇíbhya ātapáḥ  śíśīte vájraṃ téjase ná váṃsagaḥ

translation.text: THOUGH e'en this heaven's wide space and earth have spread them out, nor heaven nor earth may be in greatness Indra's match. Awful and very mighty, causing woe to men, he whets his thunderbolt for sharpness, as a bull.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सो अ॑र्ण॒वो न न॒द्यः॑ समु॒द्रियः॒ प्रति॑ गृभ्णाति॒ विश्रि॑ता॒ वरी॑मभिः इन्द्रः॒ सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॑ वृषायते स॒नात्स यु॒ध्म ओज॑सा पनस्यते
verses.transliteration: só arṇavó ná nadyàḥ samudríyaḥ  práti gr̥bhṇāti víśritā várīmabhiḥ  índraḥ sómasya pītáye vr̥ṣāyate  sanā́t sá yudhmá ójasā panasyate

translation.text: Like as the watery ocean, so doth he receive the rivers spread on all sides in their ample width. He bears him like a bull to drink of Soma juice, and will, as Warrior from of old, be praised for might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं तमि॑न्द्र॒ पर्व॑तं॒ न भोज॑से म॒हो नृ॒म्णस्य॒ धर्म॑णामिरज्यसि प्र वी॒र्ये॑ण दे॒वताति॑ चेकिते॒ विश्व॑स्मा उ॒ग्रः कर्म॑णे पु॒रोहि॑तः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tám indra párvataṃ ná bhójase  mahó nr̥mṇásya dhármaṇām irajyasi  prá vīryèṇa devátā́ti cekite  víśvasmā ugráḥ kármaṇe puróhitaḥ

translation.text: Thou swayest, Indra, all kinds of great manly power, so as to bend, as't were, even that famed mountain down. Foremost among the Gods is he through hero might, set in the van, the Strong One, for each arduous deed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इद्वने॑ नम॒स्युभि॑र्वचस्यते॒ चारु॒ जने॑षु प्रब्रुवा॒ण इ॑न्द्रि॒यम् वृषा॒ छन्दु॑र्भवति हर्य॒तो वृषा॒ क्षेमे॑ण॒ धेनां॑ म॒घवा॒ यदिन्व॑ति
verses.transliteration: sá íd váne namasyúbhir vacasyate  cā́ru jáneṣu prabruvāṇá indriyám  vŕ̥ṣā chándur bhavati haryató vŕ̥ṣā  kṣémeṇa dhénām maghávā yád ínvati

translation.text: He only in the wood is praised by worshippers, when he shows forth to men his own fair Indrapower. A friendly Bull is he, a Bull to be desired when Maghavan auspiciously sends forth his voice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इन्म॒हानि॑ समि॒थानि॑ म॒ज्मना॑ कृ॒णोति॑ यु॒ध्म ओज॑सा॒ जने॑भ्यः अधा॑ च॒न श्रद्द॑धति॒ त्विषी॑मत॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ वज्रं॑ नि॒घनि॑घ्नते व॒धम्
verses.transliteration: sá ín mahā́ni samithā́ni majmánā  kr̥ṇóti yudhmá ójasā jánebhyaḥ  ádhā caná śrád dadhati tvíṣīmate-  índrāya vájraṃ nighánighnate vadhám

translation.text: Yet verily the Warrior in his vigorous strength stirreth up with his might great battles for mankind; And men have faith in Indra, the respIendent One, what time he hurleth down his bolt, his dart of death.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि श्र॑व॒स्युः सद॑नानि कृ॒त्रिमा॑ क्ष्म॒या वृ॑धा॒न ओज॑सा विना॒शय॑न् ज्योतीं॑षि कृ॒ण्वन्न॑वृ॒काणि॒ यज्य॒वेऽव॑ सु॒क्रतुः॒ सर्त॒वा अ॒पः सृ॑जत्
verses.transliteration: sá hí śravasyúḥ sádanāni kr̥trímā  kṣmayā́ vr̥dhāná ójasā vināśáyan  jyótīṃṣi kr̥ṇvánn avr̥kā́ṇi yájyave-  -áva sukrátuḥ sártavā́ apáḥ sr̥jat

translation.text: Though, fain for glory, and with strength increased on earth, he with great might destroys the dwellings made with art, He makes the lights of heaven shine forth secure, he bids, exceeding wise, the floods flow for his worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दा॒नाय॒ मनः॑ सोमपावन्नस्तु ते॒ऽर्वाञ्चा॒ हरी॑ वन्दनश्रु॒दा कृ॑धि यमि॑ष्ठासः॒ सार॑थयो॒ य इ॑न्द्र ते॒ न त्वा॒ केता॒ आ द॑भ्नुवन्ति॒ भूर्ण॑यः
verses.transliteration: dānā́ya mánaḥ somapāvann astu te  -arvā́ñcā hárī vandanaśrud ā́ kr̥dhi  yámiṣṭhāsaḥ sā́rathayo yá indra te  ná tvā kétā ā́ dabhnuvanti bhū́rṇayaḥ

translation.text: Drinker of Soma, let thy heart incline to give; bring thy Bays hitherward, O thou who hearest praise. Those charioteers of' thine, best skilled to draw the rein, the rapid sunbeams, Indra, lead thee not astray.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप्र॑क्षितं॒ वसु॑ बिभर्षि॒ हस्त॑यो॒रषा॑ळ्हं॒ सह॑स्त॒न्वि॑ श्रु॒तो द॑धे आवृ॑तासोऽव॒तासो॒ न क॒र्तृभि॑स्त॒नूषु॑ ते॒ क्रत॑व इन्द्र॒ भूर॑यः
verses.transliteration: áprakṣitaṃ vásu bibharṣi hástayor  áṣāḷhaṃ sáhas tanvì śrutó dadhe  ā́vr̥tāso 'vatā́so ná kartŕ̥bhis  tanū́ṣu te krátava indra bhū́rayaḥ

translation.text: Thou bearest in both hands treasure that never fails; the famed One in his body holds unvanquished might. O Indra, in thy members many powers abide, like wells surrounded by the ministering priests.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष प्र पू॒र्वीरव॒ तस्य॑ च॒म्रिषोऽत्यो॒ न योषा॒मुद॑यंस्त भु॒र्वणिः॑ दक्षं॑ म॒हे पा॑ययते हिर॒ण्ययं॒ रथ॑मा॒वृत्या॒ हरि॑योग॒मृभ्व॑सम्
verses.transliteration: eṣá prá pūrvī́r áva tásya camríṣaḥ-  -átyo ná yóṣām úd ayaṃsta bhurváṇiḥ  dákṣam mahé pāyayate hiraṇyáyaṃ  rátham āvŕ̥tyā háriyogam ŕ̥bhvasam

translation.text: FOR this man's full libations held in ladles, he hath roused him, eager, as a horse to meet the mare. He stays his golden car, yoked with Bay Horses, swift, and drinks the Soma juice which strengthens for great deeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं गू॒र्तयो॑ नेम॒न्निषः॒ परी॑णसः समु॒द्रं न सं॒चर॑णे सनि॒ष्यवः॑ पतिं॒ दक्ष॑स्य वि॒दथ॑स्य॒ नू सहो॑ गि॒रिं न वे॒ना अधि॑ रोह॒ तेज॑सा
verses.transliteration: táṃ gūrtáyo nemanníṣaḥ párīṇasaḥ  samudráṃ ná saṃcáraṇe saniṣyávaḥ  pátiṃ dákṣasya vidáthasya nū́ sáho  giríṃ ná venā́ ádhi roha téjasā

translation.text: To him the guidance-following songs of praise flow full, as those who seek gain go in company to the flood. To him the Lord of power, the holy synod's might, as to a hill, with speed, ascend the loving ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स तु॒र्वणि॑र्म॒हाँ अ॑रे॒णु पौंस्ये॑ गि॒रेर्भृ॒ष्टिर्न भ्रा॑जते तु॒जा शवः॑ येन॒ शुष्णं॑ मा॒यिन॑माय॒सो मदे॑ दु॒ध्र आ॒भूषु॑ रा॒मय॒न्नि दाम॑नि
verses.transliteration: sá turváṇir mahā́m̐ areṇú paúṃsye  girér bhr̥ṣṭír ná bhrājate tujā́ śávaḥ  yéna śúṣṇam māyínam āyasó máde  dudhrá ābhū́ṣu rāmáyan ní dā́mani

translation.text: Victorious, great is he; in manly battle shines, unstained with dust, his might, as shines a mountain peak; Wherewith the iron one, fierce e'en against the strong, in rapture, fettered wily Sushna fast in bonds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वी यदि॒ तवि॑षी॒ त्वावृ॑धो॒तय॒ इन्द्रं॒ सिष॑क्त्यु॒षसं॒ न सूर्यः॑ यो धृ॒ष्णुना॒ शव॑सा॒ बाध॑ते॒ तम॒ इय॑र्ति रे॒णुं बृ॒हद॑र्हरि॒ष्वणिः॑
verses.transliteration: devī́ yádi táviṣī tvā́vr̥dhotáye-  índraṃ síṣakty uṣásaṃ ná sū́ryaḥ  yó dhr̥ṣṇúnā śávasā bā́dhate támaḥ-  íyarti reṇúm br̥hád arhariṣváṇiḥ

translation.text: When Strength the Goddess, made more strong for help by thee, waits upon Indra as the Sun attends the Dawn, Then. he who with his might unflinching kills the gloom stirs up the dust aloft, with joy and triumphing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि यत्ति॒रो ध॒रुण॒मच्यु॑तं॒ रजोऽति॑ष्ठिपो दि॒व आता॑सु ब॒र्हणा॑ स्व॑र्मीळ्हे॒ यन्मद॑ इन्द्र॒ हर्ष्याह॑न्वृ॒त्रं निर॒पामौ॑ब्जो अर्ण॒वम्
verses.transliteration: ví yát tiró dharúṇam ácyutaṃ rájaḥ-  -átiṣṭhipo divá ā́tāsu barháṇā  svàrmīḷhe yán máda indra hárṣyā-  -áhan vr̥tráṃ nír apā́m aubjo arṇavám

translation.text: When thou with might, upon the framework of the heaven, didst fix, across, air's region firmly, unremoved, In the light-winning war, Indra, in rapturous joy, thou smotest Vr̥itra dead and broughtest floods of rain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं दि॒वो ध॒रुणं॑ धिष॒ ओज॑सा पृथि॒व्या इ॑न्द्र॒ सद॑नेषु॒ माहि॑नः त्वं सु॒तस्य॒ मदे॑ अरिणा अ॒पो वि वृ॒त्रस्य॑ स॒मया॑ पा॒ष्या॑रुजः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ divó dharúṇaṃ dhiṣa ójasā  pr̥thivyā́ indra sádaneṣu mā́hinaḥ  tváṃ sutásya máde ariṇā apó  ví vr̥trásya samáyā pāṣyā̀rujaḥ

translation.text: Thou with thy might didst grasp,the holder-up of heaven, thou who art mighty also in the seats of earth. Thou, gladdened by the juice, hast set the waters free, and broken Vr̥itra's stony fences through and through.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र मंहि॑ष्ठाय बृह॒ते बृ॒हद्र॑ये स॒त्यशु॑ष्माय त॒वसे॑ म॒तिं भ॑रे अ॒पामि॑व प्रव॒णे यस्य॑ दु॒र्धरं॒ राधो॑ वि॒श्वायु॒ शव॑से॒ अपा॑वृतम्
verses.transliteration: prá máṃhiṣṭhāya br̥haté br̥hádraye  satyáśuṣmāya taváse matím bhare  apā́m iva pravaṇé yásya durdháraṃ  rā́dho viśvā́yu śávase ápāvr̥tam

translation.text: To him most liberal, lofty Lord of lofty wealth, verily powerful and strong, I bring my hymn,– Whose checkless bounty, as of waters down a slope, is spread abroad for all that live, to give them strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॑ ते॒ विश्व॒मनु॑ हासदि॒ष्टय॒ आपो॑ नि॒म्नेव॒ सव॑ना ह॒विष्म॑तः यत्पर्व॑ते॒ न स॒मशी॑त हर्य॒त इन्द्र॑स्य॒ वज्रः॒ श्नथि॑ता हिर॒ण्ययः॑
verses.transliteration: ádha te víśvam ánu hāsad iṣṭáye-  ā́po nimnéva sávanā havíṣmataḥ  yát párvate ná samáśīta haryatáḥ-  índrasya vájraḥ śnáthitā hiraṇyáyaḥ

translation.text: Now all this world, for worship, shall come after thee-the offerer's libations like floods to the depth, When the well-loved one seems to rest upon the hill, the thunderbolt of Indra, shatterer wrought of gold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मै भी॒माय॒ नम॑सा॒ सम॑ध्व॒र उषो॒ न शु॑भ्र॒ आ भ॑रा॒ पनी॑यसे यस्य॒ धाम॒ श्रव॑से॒ नामे॑न्द्रि॒यं ज्योति॒रका॑रि ह॒रितो॒ नाय॑से
verses.transliteration: asmaí bhīmā́ya námasā sám adhvaré-  úṣo ná śubhra ā́ bharā pánīyase  yásya dhā́ma śrávase nā́mendriyáṃ  jyótir ákāri haríto nā́yase

translation.text: To him the terrible, most meet for lofty praise, like bright Dawn, now bring gifts with reverence in this rite, Whose being, for renown, yea, Indra-power and light, have been created, like bay steeds, to move with speed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे त॑ इन्द्र॒ ते व॒यं पु॑रुष्टुत॒ ये त्वा॒रभ्य॒ चरा॑मसि प्रभूवसो न॒हि त्वद॒न्यो गि॑र्वणो॒ गिरः॒ सघ॑त्क्षो॒णीरि॑व॒ प्रति॑ नो हर्य॒ तद्वचः॑
verses.transliteration: imé ta indra té vayám puruṣṭuta  yé tvārábhya cárāmasi prabhūvaso  nahí tvád anyó girvaṇo gíraḥ sághat  kṣoṇī́r iva práti no harya tád vácaḥ

translation.text: Thine, Indra, praised by many, excellently rich! are we who trusting in thy help draw near to thee. Lover of praise, none else but thou receives our laud: as earth loves all her creatures, love thou this our hymn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरि॑ त इन्द्र वी॒र्यं१॒॑ तव॑ स्मस्य॒स्य स्तो॒तुर्म॑घव॒न्काम॒मा पृ॑ण अनु॑ ते॒ द्यौर्बृ॑ह॒ती वी॒र्यं॑ मम इ॒यं च॑ ते पृथि॒वी ने॑म॒ ओज॑से
verses.transliteration: bhū́ri ta indra vīryàṃ táva smasi-  asyá stotúr maghavan kā́mam ā́ pr̥ṇa  ánu te dyaúr br̥hatī́ vīryàm mame-  iyáṃ ca te pr̥thivī́ nema ójase

translation.text: Great is thy power, O Indra, we are thine. Fulfil, O Maghavan, the wish of this thy worshipper. After thee lofty heaven hath measured out its strength: to thee and to thy power this earth hath bowed itself.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं तमि॑न्द्र॒ पर्व॑तं म॒हामु॒रुं वज्रे॑ण वज्रिन्पर्व॒शश्च॑कर्तिथ अवा॑सृजो॒ निवृ॑ताः॒ सर्त॒वा अ॒पः स॒त्रा विश्वं॑ दधिषे॒ केव॑लं॒ सहः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tám indra párvatam mahā́m urúṃ  vájreṇa vajrin parvaśáś cakartitha  ávāsr̥jo nívr̥tāḥ sártavā́ apáḥ  satrā́ víśvaṃ dadhiṣe kévalaṃ sáhaḥ

translation.text: Thou, who hast thunder for thy weapon, with thy bolt hast shattered into pieces this broad massive cloud. Thou hast sent down the obstructed floods that they may flow: thou hast, thine own for ever, all victorious might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू चि॑त्सहो॒जा अ॒मृतो॒ नि तु॑न्दते॒ होता॒ यद्दू॒तो अभ॑वद्वि॒वस्व॑तः वि साधि॑ष्ठेभिः प॒थिभी॒ रजो॑ मम॒ आ दे॒वता॑ता ह॒विषा॑ विवासति
verses.transliteration: nū́ cit sahojā́ amŕ̥to ní tundate  hótā yád dūtó ábhavad vivásvataḥ  ví sā́dhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathíbhī rájo mame-  ā́ devátātā havíṣā vivāsati

translation.text: NE'ER waxeth faint the Immortal, Son of Strength, since he, the Herald, hath become Vivasvan's messenger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ स्वमद्म॑ यु॒वमा॑नो अ॒जर॑स्तृ॒ष्व॑वि॒ष्यन्न॑त॒सेषु॑ तिष्ठति अत्यो॒ न पृ॒ष्ठं प्रु॑षि॒तस्य॑ रोचते दि॒वो न सानु॑ स्त॒नय॑न्नचिक्रदत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ svám ádma yuvámāno ajáras  tr̥ṣv àviṣyánn ataséṣu tiṣṭhati  átyo ná pr̥ṣṭhám pruṣitásya rocate  divó ná sā́nu stanáyann acikradat

translation.text: Never decaying, seizing his appropriate food, rapidly, eagerly through the dry wood he spreads. His back, as he is sprinkled, glistens like a horse: loud hath he roared and shouted like the heights of heaven?

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्रा॒णा रु॒द्रेभि॒र्वसु॑भिः पु॒रोहि॑तो॒ होता॒ निष॑त्तो रयि॒षाळम॑र्त्यः रथो॒ न वि॒क्ष्वृ॑ञ्जसा॒न आ॒युषु॒ व्या॑नु॒षग्वार्या॑ दे॒व ऋ॑ण्वति
verses.transliteration: krāṇā́ rudrébhir vásubhiḥ puróhito  hótā níṣatto rayiṣā́ḷ ámartyaḥ  rátho ná vikṣv r̥̀ñjasāná āyúṣu  vy ā̀nuṣág vā́ryā devá r̥ṇvati

translation.text: Set high in place o'er all that Vasus, Rudras do, immortal, Lord of riches, seated as High Priest; Hastening like a car to men, to those who live, the God without delay gives boons to be desired.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि वात॑जूतो अत॒सेषु॑ तिष्ठते॒ वृथा॑ जु॒हूभिः॒ सृण्या॑ तुवि॒ष्वणिः॑ तृ॒षु यद॑ग्ने व॒निनो॑ वृषा॒यसे॑ कृ॒ष्णं त॒ एम॒ रुश॑दूर्मे अजर
verses.transliteration: ví vā́tajūto ataséṣu tiṣṭhate  vŕ̥thā juhū́bhiḥ sŕ̥ṇyā tuviṣváṇiḥ  tr̥ṣú yád agne vaníno vr̥ṣāyáse  kr̥ṣṇáṃ ta éma rúśadūrme ajara

translation.text: Urged by the wind be spreads through dry wood as he lists, armed with his tongues for sickles, with a mighty roar. Black is thy path, Agni, changeless, with glittering waves! when like a bull thou rushest eager to the trees.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तपु॑र्जम्भो॒ वन॒ आ वात॑चोदितो यू॒थे न सा॒ह्वाँ अव॑ वाति॒ वंस॑गः अ॒भि॒व्रज॒न्नक्षि॑तं॒ पाज॑सा॒ रजः॑ स्था॒तुश्च॒रथं॑ भयते पत॒त्रिणः॑
verses.transliteration: tápurjambho vána ā́ vā́tacodito  yūthé ná sāhvā́m̐ áva vāti váṃsagaḥ  abhivrájann ákṣitam pā́jasā rájaḥ-  sthātúś carátham bhayate patatríṇaḥ

translation.text: With teeth of flame, wind-driven, through the wood he speeds, triumphant like a bull among the herd of cows, With bright strength roaming to the everlasting air: things fixed, things moving quake before him as he flies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒धुष्ट्वा॒ भृग॑वो॒ मानु॑षे॒ष्वा र॒यिं न चारुं॑ सु॒हवं॒ जने॑भ्यः होता॑रमग्ने॒ अति॑थिं॒ वरे॑ण्यं मि॒त्रं न शेवं॑ दि॒व्याय॒ जन्म॑ने
verses.transliteration: dadhúṣ ṭvā bhŕ̥gavo mā́nuṣeṣv~ā́  rayíṃ ná cā́ruṃ suhávaṃ jánebhyaḥ  hótāram agne átithiṃ váreṇyam  mitráṃ ná śévaṃ divyā́ya jánmane

translation.text: The Bhr̥igus established thee among mankind for men, like as a treasure, beauteous, easy to invoke; Thee, Agni, as a herald and choice-worthy guest, as an auspicious Friend to the Celestial Race.

verses.sanskrit_deva: होता॑रं स॒प्त जु॒ह्वो॒३॒॑ यजि॑ष्ठं॒ यं वा॒घतो॑ वृ॒णते॑ अध्व॒रेषु॑ अ॒ग्निं विश्वे॑षामर॒तिं वसू॑नां सप॒र्यामि॒ प्रय॑सा॒ यामि॒ रत्न॑म्
verses.transliteration: hótāraṃ saptá juhvò yájiṣṭhaṃ  yáṃ vāgháto vr̥ṇáte adhvaréṣu  agníṃ víśveṣām aratíṃ vásūnāṃ  saparyā́mi práyasā yā́mi rátnam

translation.text: Agni, the seven tongues' deftest Sacrificer, him whom the priests elect at solemn worship, The Herald, messenger of all the Vasus, I serve with dainty food, I ask for riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छि॑द्रा सूनो सहसो नो अ॒द्य स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ मित्रमहः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छ अग्ने॑ गृ॒णन्त॒मंह॑स उरु॒ष्योर्जो॑ नपात्पू॒र्भिराय॑सीभिः
verses.transliteration: áchidrā sūno sahaso no adyá  stotŕ̥bhyo mitramahaḥ śárma yacha  ágne gr̥ṇántam áṃhasa uruṣya-  -ū́rjo napāt pūrbhír ā́yasībhiḥ

translation.text: Grant, Son of Strength, thou rich in friends, a refuge without a flaw this day to us thy praisers. O Agni, Son of Strength, with forts of iron preserve thou from distress the man who lauds thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भवा॒ वरू॑थं गृण॒ते वि॑भावो॒ भवा॑ मघवन्म॒घव॑द्भ्यः॒ शर्म॑ उ॒रु॒ष्याग्ने॒ अंह॑सो गृ॒णन्तं॑ प्रा॒तर्म॒क्षू धि॒याव॑सुर्जगम्यात्
verses.transliteration: bhávā várūthaṃ gr̥ṇaté vibhāvo  bhávā maghavan maghávadbhyaḥ śárma  uruṣyā́gne áṃhaso gr̥ṇántam  prātár makṣū́ dhiyā́vasur jagamyāt

translation.text: Be thou a refuge, Bright One, to the singer, a shelter, Bounteous Lord, to those who worship. Preserve the singer from distress, O Agni. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒या इद॑ग्ने अ॒ग्नय॑स्ते अ॒न्ये त्वे विश्वे॑ अ॒मृता॑ मादयन्ते वैश्वा॑नर॒ नाभि॑रसि क्षिती॒नां स्थूणे॑व॒ जनाँ॑ उप॒मिद्य॑यन्थ
verses.transliteration: vayā́ íd agne agnáyas te anyé  tvé víśve amŕ̥tā mādayante  vaíśvānara nā́bhir asi kṣitīnā́ṃ  sthū́ṇeva jánām̐ upamíd yayantha

translation.text: THE other fires are, verily, thy branches; the Immortals all rejoice in thee, O Agni. Centre art thou, Vaigvdnara, of the people, sustaining men like a deep-founded pillar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मू॒र्धा दि॒वो नाभि॑र॒ग्निः पृ॑थि॒व्या अथा॑भवदर॒ती रोद॑स्योः तं त्वा॑ दे॒वासो॑ऽजनयन्त दे॒वं वैश्वा॑नर॒ ज्योति॒रिदार्या॑य
verses.transliteration: mūrdhā́ divó nā́bhir agníḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  áthābhavad aratī́ ródasyoḥ  táṃ tvā devā́so (')janayanta deváṃ  vaíśvānara jyótir íd ā́ryāya

translation.text: The forehead of the sky, earth's centre, Agni became the messenger of earth and heaven. Vaiṣvânara, the Deities produced thee, a God, to be a light unto the Ârya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ सूर्ये॒ न र॒श्मयो॑ ध्रु॒वासो॑ वैश्वान॒रे द॑धिरे॒ऽग्ना वसू॑नि या पर्व॑ते॒ष्वोष॑धीष्व॒प्सु या मानु॑षे॒ष्वसि॒ तस्य॒ राजा॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ sū́rye ná raśmáyo dhruvā́so  vaiśvānaré dadhire 'gnā́ vásūni  yā́ párvateṣv óṣadhīṣv apsú  yā́ mā́nuṣeṣv ási tásya rā́jā

translation.text: As in the Sun firm rays are set for ever, treasures are in Vaiṣvânara, in Agni. Of all the riches in the hills, the waters, the herbs, among mankind, thou art the Sovran.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒ह॒ती इ॑व सू॒नवे॒ रोद॑सी॒ गिरो॒ होता॑ मनु॒ष्यो॒३॒॑ न दक्षः॑ स्व॑र्वते स॒त्यशु॑ष्माय पू॒र्वीर्वै॑श्वान॒राय॒ नृत॑माय य॒ह्वीः
verses.transliteration: br̥hatī́ iva sūnáve ródasī  gíro hótā manuṣyò ná dákṣaḥ  svàrvate satyáśuṣmāya pūrvī́r  vaiśvānarā́ya nŕ̥tamāya yahvī́ḥ

translation.text: As the great World-halves, so are their Son's praises; skilled, as a man, to act, is he the Herald. Vaiṣvânara, celestial, truly mighty, most manly One, hath many a youthful consort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वश्चि॑त्ते बृह॒तो जा॑तवेदो॒ वैश्वा॑नर॒ प्र रि॑रिचे महि॒त्वम् राजा॑ कृष्टी॒नाम॑सि॒ मानु॑षीणां यु॒धा दे॒वेभ्यो॒ वरि॑वश्चकर्थ
verses.transliteration: diváś cit te br̥ható jātavedo  vaíśvānara prá ririce mahitvám  rā́jā kr̥ṣṭīnā́m asi mā́nuṣīṇāṃ  yudhā́ devébhyo várivaś cakartha

translation.text: Even the lofty heaven, O Jâtavedas Vaiṣvânara, hath not attained thy greatness. Thou art the King of lands where men are settled, thou hast brought comfort to the Gods in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र नू म॑हि॒त्वं वृ॑ष॒भस्य॑ वोचं॒ यं पू॒रवो॑ वृत्र॒हणं॒ सच॑न्ते वै॒श्वा॒न॒रो दस्यु॑म॒ग्निर्ज॑घ॒न्वाँ अधू॑नो॒त्काष्ठा॒ अव॒ शम्ब॑रं भेत्
verses.transliteration: prá nū́ mahitváṃ vr̥ṣabhásya vocaṃ  yám pūrávo vr̥traháṇaṃ sácante  vaiśvānaró dásyum agnír jaghanvā́m̐  ádhūnot kā́ṣṭhā áva śámbaram bhet

translation.text: Now will I tell the greatness of the Hero whom Prarti's sons follow as Vr̥itra's slayer: Agni Vaiṣvânara struck down the Dasyu, cleave Ṣambara through and shattered down his fences.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रो म॑हि॒म्ना वि॒श्वकृ॑ष्टिर्भ॒रद्वा॑जेषु यज॒तो वि॒भावा॑ शा॒त॒व॒ने॒ये श॒तिनी॑भिर॒ग्निः पु॑रुणी॒थे ज॑रते सू॒नृता॑वान्
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānaró mahimnā́ viśvákr̥ṣṭir  bharádvājeṣu yajató vibhā́vā  śātavaneyé śatínībhir agníḥ  puruṇīthé jarate sūnŕ̥tāvān

translation.text: Vaiṣvânara, dwelling by his might with all men, far-shining, holy mid the Bharadvâjas, Is lauded, excellent, with hundred praises by Purunîtha, son of Ṣatavani.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वह्निं॑ य॒शसं॑ वि॒दथ॑स्य के॒तुं सु॑प्रा॒व्यं॑ दू॒तं स॒द्योअ॑र्थम् द्वि॒जन्मा॑नं र॒यिमि॑व प्रश॒स्तं रा॒तिं भ॑र॒द्भृग॑वे मात॒रिश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: váhniṃ yaśásaṃ vidáthasya ketúṃ  suprāvyàṃ dūtáṃ sadyóartham  dvijánmānaṃ rayím iva praśastáṃ  rātím bharad bhŕ̥gave mātaríśvā

translation.text: As 'twere Some goodly treasure Mâtariṣvan brought, as a gift, the glorious Priest to Bhr̥igu, Banner of sacrifice, the good Protector, child of two births, the swiftly moving envoy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य शासु॑रु॒भया॑सः सचन्ते ह॒विष्म॑न्त उ॒शिजो॒ ये च॒ मर्ताः॑ दि॒वश्चि॒त्पूर्वो॒ न्य॑सादि॒ होता॒पृच्छ्यो॑ वि॒श्पति॑र्वि॒क्षु वे॒धाः
verses.transliteration: asyá śā́sur ubháyāsaḥ sacante  havíṣmanta uśíjo yé ca mártāḥ  diváś cit pū́rvo ny àsādi hótā-  -āpŕ̥chyo viśpátir vikṣú vedhā́ḥ

translation.text: Both Gods and men obey this Ruler's order, Gods who are worshipped, men who yearn and worship. As Priest he takes his seat ere break of morning, House-Lord, adorable with men, Ordainer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं नव्य॑सी हृ॒द आ जाय॑मानम॒स्मत्सु॑की॒र्तिर्मधु॑जिह्वमश्याः यमृ॒त्विजो॑ वृ॒जने॒ मानु॑षासः॒ प्रय॑स्वन्त आ॒यवो॒ जीज॑नन्त
verses.transliteration: táṃ návyasī hr̥dá ā́ jā́yamānam  asmát sukīrtír mádhujihvam aśyāḥ  yám r̥tvíjo vr̥jáne mā́nuṣāsaḥ  práyasvanta āyávo jī́jananta

translation.text: May our fair praise, heart-born, most recent, reach him whose tongue, e'en at his birth, is sweet as honey; Whom mortal priests, men, with their strong endeavour, supplied with dainty viands, have created.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒शिक्पा॑व॒को वसु॒र्मानु॑षेषु॒ वरे॑ण्यो॒ होता॑धायि वि॒क्षु दमू॑ना गृ॒हप॑ति॒र्दम॒ आँ अ॒ग्निर्भु॑वद्रयि॒पती॑ रयी॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: uśík pāvakó vásur mā́nuṣeṣu  váreṇyo hótādhāyi vikṣú  dámūnā gr̥hápatir dáma ā́m̐  agnír bhuvad rayipátī rayīṇā́m

translation.text: Good to mankind, the yearning Purifier hath among men been placed as Priest choice-worthy. May Agni be our Friend, Lord of the Household, protector of the riches in the dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ व॒यं पति॑मग्ने रयी॒णां प्र शं॑सामो म॒तिभि॒र्गोत॑मासः आ॒शुं न वा॑जम्भ॒रं म॒र्जय॑न्तः प्रा॒तर्म॒क्षू धि॒याव॑सुर्जगम्यात्
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā vayám pátim agne rayīṇā́m  prá śaṃsāmo matíbhir gótamāsaḥ  āśúṃ ná vājambharám marjáyantaḥ  prātár makṣū́ dhiyā́vasur jagamyāt

translation.text: As such we Gotamas with hymns extol thee, O Agni, as the guardian Lord of riches, Decking thee like a horse, the swift prizewinner. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मा इदु॒ प्र त॒वसे॑ तु॒राय॒ प्रयो॒ न ह॑र्मि॒ स्तोमं॒ माहि॑नाय ऋची॑षमा॒याध्रि॑गव॒ ओह॒मिन्द्रा॑य॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि रा॒तत॑मा
verses.transliteration: asmā́ íd u prá taváse turā́ya  práyo ná harmi stómam mā́hināya  ŕ̥cīṣamāyā́dhrigava óham  índrāya bráhmāṇi rātátamā

translation.text: EVEN to him, swift, strong and high. exalted, I bring my song of praise as dainty viands, My thought to him resistless, praise-deserving, prayers offered most especially to Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मा इदु॒ प्रय॑ इव॒ प्र यं॑सि॒ भरा॑म्याङ्गू॒षं बाधे॑ सुवृ॒क्ति इन्द्रा॑य हृ॒दा मन॑सा मनी॒षा प्र॒त्नाय॒ पत्ये॒ धियो॑ मर्जयन्त
verses.transliteration: asmā́ íd u práya iva prá yaṃsi  bhárāmy āṅgūṣám bā́dhe suvr̥ktí  índrāya hr̥dā́ mánasā manīṣā́  pratnā́ya pátye dhíyo marjayanta

translation.text: Praise, like oblation, I present, and utter aloud my song, my fair hymn to the Victor. For Indra, who is Lord of old, the singers have decked their lauds with heart and mind and spirit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मा इदु॒ त्यमु॑प॒मं स्व॒र्षां भरा॑म्याङ्गू॒षमा॒स्ये॑न मंहि॑ष्ठ॒मच्छो॑क्तिभिर्मती॒नां सु॑वृ॒क्तिभिः॑ सू॒रिं वा॑वृ॒धध्यै॑
verses.transliteration: asmā́ íd u tyám upamáṃ svarṣā́m  bhárāmy āṅgūṣám āsyèna  máṃhiṣṭham áchoktibhir matīnā́ṃ  suvr̥ktíbhiḥ sūríṃ vāvr̥dhádhyai

translation.text: To him then with my lips mine adoration, winning heaven's light, most excellent, I offer, To magnify with songs of invocation and with fair hymns the Lord, most bounteous Giver.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मा इदु॒ स्तोमं॒ सं हि॑नोमि॒ रथं॒ न तष्टे॑व॒ तत्सि॑नाय गिर॑श्च॒ गिर्वा॑हसे सुवृ॒क्तीन्द्रा॑य विश्वमि॒न्वं मेधि॑राय
verses.transliteration: asmā́ íd u stómaṃ sáṃ hinomi  ráthaṃ ná táṣṭeva tátsināya  gíraś ca gírvāhase suvr̥ktí-  -índrāya viśvaminvám médhirāya

translation.text: Even for him I frame a laud, as fashions the wright a chariot for the man who needs it,– Praises to him who gladly hears our praises, a hymn well-formed, all-moving, to wise Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मा इदु॒ सप्ति॑मिव श्रव॒स्येन्द्रा॑या॒र्कं जु॒ह्वा॒३॒॑ सम॑ञ्जे वी॒रं दा॒नौक॑सं व॒न्दध्यै॑ पु॒रां गू॒र्तश्र॑वसं द॒र्माण॑म्
verses.transliteration: asmā́ íd u sáptim iva śravasyā́-  -índrāyārkáṃ juhvā̀ sám añje  vīráṃ dānaúkasaṃ vandádhyai  purā́ṃ gūrtáśravasaṃ darmā́ṇam

translation.text: So with my tongue I deck, to please that Indra, my hymn, as 'twere a horse, through love of glory, To reverence the Hero, bounteous Giver, famed far and wide, destroyer of the castles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मा इदु॒ त्वष्टा॑ तक्ष॒द्वज्रं॒ स्वप॑स्तमं स्व॒र्यं१॒॑ रणा॑य वृ॒त्रस्य॑ चिद्वि॒दद्येन॒ मर्म॑ तु॒जन्नीशा॑नस्तुज॒ता कि॑ये॒धाः
verses.transliteration: asmā́ íd u tváṣṭā takṣad vájraṃ  svápastamaṃ svaryàṃ ráṇāya  vr̥trásya cid vidád yéna márma  tujánn ī́śānas tujatā́ kiyedhā́ḥ

translation.text: Even for him hath Tvashṭar forged the thunder, most deftly wrought, celestial, for the battle, Wherewith he reached the vital parts of Vr̥itra, striking-the vast, the mighty with the striker.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्येदु॑ मा॒तुः सव॑नेषु स॒द्यो म॒हः पि॒तुं प॑पि॒वाञ्चार्वन्ना॑ मु॒षा॒यद्विष्णुः॑ पच॒तं सही॑या॒न्विध्य॑द्वरा॒हं ति॒रो अद्रि॒मस्ता॑
verses.transliteration: asyéd u mātúḥ sávaneṣu sadyó  maháḥ pitúm papivā́ñ cā́rv ánnā  muṣāyád víṣṇuḥ pacatáṃ sáhīyān  vídhyad varāháṃ tiró ádrim ástā

translation.text: As soon as, at libations of his mother, great Vishṇu had drunk up the draught, he plundered. The dainty cates, the cooked mess; but One stronger transfixed the wild boar, shooting through the mountain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मा इदु॒ ग्नाश्चि॑द्दे॒वप॑त्नी॒रिन्द्रा॑या॒र्कम॑हि॒हत्य॑ ऊवुः परि॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी ज॑भ्र उ॒र्वी नास्य॒ ते म॑हि॒मानं॒ परि॑ ष्टः
verses.transliteration: asmā́ íd u gnā́ś cid devápatnīr  índrāyārkám ahihátya ūvuḥ  pári dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ jabhra urvī́  nā́sya té mahimā́nam pári ṣṭaḥ

translation.text: To him, to Indra, when he slew the Dragon, the Dames, too, Consorts of the Goda, wove praises. The mighty heaven and earth hath he encompassed: thy greatness heaven and earth, combined, exceed not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्येदे॒व प्र रि॑रिचे महि॒त्वं दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्याः पर्य॒न्तरि॑क्षात् स्व॒राळिन्द्रो॒ दम॒ आ वि॒श्वगू॑र्तः स्व॒रिरम॑त्रो ववक्षे॒ रणा॑य
verses.transliteration: asyéd evá prá ririce mahitváṃ  divás pr̥thivyā́ḥ páry antárikṣāt  svarā́ḷ índro dáma ā́ viśvágūrtaḥ  svarír ámatro vavakṣe ráṇāya

translation.text: Yea, of a truth, his magnitude surpasseth the magnitude of earth, mid-air, and heaven. Indra, approved by all men, self-resplendent, waxed in his home, loud-voiced and strong for battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्येदे॒व शव॑सा शु॒षन्तं॒ वि वृ॑श्च॒द्वज्रे॑ण वृ॒त्रमिन्द्रः॑ गा न व्रा॒णा अ॒वनी॑रमुञ्चद॒भि श्रवो॑ दा॒वने॒ सचे॑ताः
verses.transliteration: asyéd evá śávasā śuṣántaṃ  ví vr̥ścad vájreṇa vr̥trám índraḥ  gā́ ná vrāṇā́ avánīr amuñcad  abhí śrávo dāváne sácetāḥ

translation.text: Through his own strength Indra with bolt of thunder cut piece-meal Vr̥itra, drier up of waters. He let the floods go free, like cows imprisoned, for glory, with a heart inclined to bounty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्येदु॑ त्वे॒षसा॑ रन्त॒ सिन्ध॑वः॒ परि॒ यद्वज्रे॑ण सी॒मय॑च्छत् ई॒शा॒न॒कृद्दा॒शुषे॑ दश॒स्यन्तु॒र्वीत॑ये गा॒धं तु॒र्वणिः॑ कः
verses.transliteration: asyéd u tveṣásā ranta síndhavaḥ  pári yád vájreṇa sīm áyachat  īśānakŕ̥d dāśúṣe daśasyán  turvī́taye gādháṃ turváṇiḥ kaḥ

translation.text: The rivers played, through his impetuous splendour, since with his bolt he compassed them on all sides. Using his might and favouring him who worshipped, he made a ford, victorious, for Turvîti.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मा इदु॒ प्र भ॑रा॒ तूतु॑जानो वृ॒त्राय॒ वज्र॒मीशा॑नः किये॒धाः गोर्न पर्व॒ वि र॑दा तिर॒श्चेष्य॒न्नर्णां॑स्य॒पां च॒रध्यै॑
verses.transliteration: asmā́ íd u prá bharā tū́tujāno  vr̥trā́ya vájram ī́śānaḥ kiyedhā́ḥ  gór ná párva ví radā tiraścā́-  -íṣyann árṇāṃsy apā́ṃ carádhyai

translation.text: Vast, with thine ample power, with eager movement, against this Vr̥itra cast thy bolt of thunder. Rend thou his joints, as of an ox, dissevered, with bolt oblique, that floods of rain may follow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्येदु॒ प्र ब्रू॑हि पू॒र्व्याणि॑ तु॒रस्य॒ कर्मा॑णि॒ नव्य॑ उ॒क्थैः यु॒धे यदि॑ष्णा॒न आयु॑धान्यृघा॒यमा॑णो निरि॒णाति॒ शत्रू॑न्
verses.transliteration: asyéd u prá brūhi pūrvyā́ṇi  turásya kármāṇi návya ukthaíḥ  yudhé yád iṣṇāná ā́yudhāni-  r̥ghāyámāṇo niriṇā́ti śátrūn

translation.text: Sing with new lauds his exploits wrought aforetime, the deeds of him, yea, him who moveth swiftly, When, hurling forth his weapons in the battle, he with impetuous wrath lays low the foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्येदु॑ भि॒या गि॒रय॑श्च दृ॒ळ्हा द्यावा॑ च॒ भूमा॑ ज॒नुष॑स्तुजेते उपो॑ वे॒नस्य॒ जोगु॑वान ओ॒णिं स॒द्यो भु॑वद्वी॒र्या॑य नो॒धाः
verses.transliteration: asyéd u bhiyā́ giráyaś ca dr̥ḷhā́ḥ-  dyā́vā ca bhū́mā janúṣas tujete  úpo venásya jóguvāna oṇíṃ  sadyó bhuvad vīryā̀ya nodhā́ḥ

translation.text: When he, yea, he, comes forth the firm. Set mountains and the whole heaven and earth, tremble for terror. May Nodhas, ever praising the protection of that dear Friend, gain quickly strength heroic.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मा इदु॒ त्यदनु॑ दाय्येषा॒मेको॒ यद्व॒व्ने भूरे॒रीशा॑नः प्रैत॑शं॒ सूर्ये॑ पस्पृधा॒नं सौव॑श्व्ये॒ सुष्वि॑माव॒दिन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: asmā́ íd u tyád ánu dāyy eṣām  éko yád vavné bhū́rer ī́śānaḥ  praítaśaṃ sū́rye paspr̥dhānáṃ  saúvaśvye súṣvim āvad índraḥ

translation.text: Now unto him of these things hath been given what he who rules alone o'er much, electeth. Indra hath helped Etaṣa, Soma-presser, contending in the race of steeds with Sarya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा ते॑ हारियोजना सुवृ॒क्तीन्द्र॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ गोत॑मासो अक्रन् ऐषु॑ वि॒श्वपे॑शसं॒ धियं॑ धाः प्रा॒तर्म॒क्षू धि॒याव॑सुर्जगम्यात्
verses.transliteration: evā́ te hāriyojanā suvr̥ktí-  -índra bráhmāṇi gótamāso akran  aíṣu viśvápeśasaṃ dhíyaṃ dhāḥ  prātár makṣū́ dhiyā́vasur jagamyāt

translation.text: Thus to thee, Indra, yoker of Bay Coursers, the Gotamas have brought their prayers to please thee. Bestow upon them thought, decked with all beauty. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र म॑न्महे शवसा॒नाय॑ शू॒षमा॑ङ्गू॒षं गिर्व॑णसे अङ्गिर॒स्वत् सु॒वृ॒क्तिभिः॑ स्तुव॒त ऋ॑ग्मि॒यायार्चा॑मा॒र्कं नरे॒ विश्रु॑ताय
verses.transliteration: prá manmahe śavasānā́ya śūṣám  āṅgūṣáṃ gírvaṇase aṅgirasvát  suvr̥ktíbhi stuvatá r̥gmiyā́ya-  -árcāmārkáṃ náre víśrutāya

translation.text: LIKE Angiras a gladdening laud we ponder to him who loveth song, exceeding mighty. Let us sing glory to the far-famed Hero who must be praised with fair hymns by the singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ म॒हे महि॒ नमो॑ भरध्वमाङ्गू॒ष्यं॑ शवसा॒नाय॒ साम॑ येना॑ नः॒ पूर्वे॑ पि॒तरः॑ पद॒ज्ञा अर्च॑न्तो॒ अङ्गि॑रसो॒ गा अवि॑न्दन्
verses.transliteration: prá vo mahé máhi námo bharadhvam  āṅgūṣyàṃ śavasānā́ya sā́ma  yénā naḥ pū́rve pitáraḥ padajñā́ḥ-  árcanto áṅgiraso gā́ ávindan

translation.text: Unto the great bring ye great adoration, a chant with praise to him exceeding mighty, Through whom our sires, Angirases, singing praises and knowing well the places, found the cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒स्याङ्गि॑रसां चे॒ष्टौ वि॒दत्स॒रमा॒ तन॑याय धा॒सिम् बृह॒स्पति॑र्भि॒नदद्रिं॑ वि॒दद्गाः समु॒स्रिया॑भिर्वावशन्त॒ नरः॑
verses.transliteration: índrasyā́ṅgirasāṃ ceṣṭaú  vidát sarámā tánayāya dhāsím  bŕ̥haspátir bhinád ádriṃ vidád gā́ḥ  sám usríyābhir vāvaśanta náraḥ

translation.text: When Indra and the Angirases desired it, Saramâ found provision for her offspring. Br̥ihaspati cleft the mountain, found the cattle: the heroes shouted with the kine in triumph.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सु॒ष्टुभा॒ स स्तु॒भा स॒प्त विप्रैः॑ स्व॒रेणाद्रिं॑ स्व॒र्यो॒३॒॑ नव॑ग्वैः स॒र॒ण्युभिः॑ फलि॒गमि॑न्द्र शक्र व॒लं रवे॑ण दरयो॒ दश॑ग्वैः
verses.transliteration: sá suṣṭúbhā sá stubhā́ saptá vípraiḥ  svaréṇā́driṃ svaryò návagvaiḥ  saraṇyúbhiḥ phaligám indra śakra  valáṃ ráveṇa darayo dáśagvaiḥ

translation.text: Mid shout, loud shout, and roar, with the Navagvas, seven singers, hast thou, heavenly, rent the mountain; Thou hast, with speeders, with Daṣagvas, Indra, Ṣakra, with thunder rent obstructive Vala.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गृ॒णा॒नो अङ्गि॑रोभिर्दस्म॒ वि व॑रु॒षसा॒ सूर्ये॑ण॒ गोभि॒रन्धः॑ वि भूम्या॑ अप्रथय इन्द्र॒ सानु॑ दि॒वो रज॒ उप॑रमस्तभायः
verses.transliteration: gr̥ṇānó áṅgirobhir dasma ví var  uṣásā sū́ryeṇa góbhir ándhaḥ  ví bhū́myā aprathaya indra sā́nu  divó rája úparam astabhāyaḥ

translation.text: Praised by Angirases, thou, foe-destroyer, hast, with the Dawn, Sun, rays, dispellcd the darkness. Thou Indra, hast spread out the earths high ridges, and firmly fixed the region under heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदु॒ प्रय॑क्षतममस्य॒ कर्म॑ द॒स्मस्य॒ चारु॑तममस्ति॒ दंसः॑ उ॒प॒ह्व॒रे यदुप॑रा॒ अपि॑न्व॒न्मध्व॑र्णसो न॒द्य१॒॑श्चत॑स्रः
verses.transliteration: tád u práyakṣatamam asya kárma  dasmásya cā́rutamam asti dáṃsaḥ  upahvaré yád úparā ápinvat-  mádhvarṇaso nadyàś cátasraḥ

translation.text: This is the deed most worthy of all honour, the fairest marvel of the Wonder-Worker, That, nigh where heaven bends down, he made four rivers flow full with waves that carry down sweet water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वि॒ता वि व॑व्रे स॒नजा॒ सनी॑ळे अ॒यास्यः॒ स्तव॑मानेभिर॒र्कैः भगो॒ न मेने॑ पर॒मे व्यो॑म॒न्नधा॑रय॒द्रोद॑सी सु॒दंसाः॑
verses.transliteration: dvitā́ ví vavre sanájā sánīḷe  ayā́sya stávamānebhir arkaíḥ  bhágo ná méne paramé vyòmann  ádhārayad ródasī sudáṃsāḥ

translation.text: Unwearied, won with lauding hymns, he parted of old the ancient Pair, united ever. In highest sky like Bhaga, he the doer of marvels set both Dames and earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒नाद्दिवं॒ परि॒ भूमा॒ विरू॑पे पुन॒र्भुवा॑ युव॒ती स्वेभि॒रेवैः॑ कृ॒ष्णेभि॑र॒क्तोषा रुश॑द्भि॒र्वपु॑र्भि॒रा च॑रतो अ॒न्यान्या॑
verses.transliteration: sanā́d dívam pári bhū́mā vírūpe  punarbhúvā yuvatī́ svébhir évaiḥ  kr̥ṣṇébhir aktóṣā́ rúśadbhir  vápurbhir ā́ carato anyā́nyā

translation.text: Still born afresh, young Dames, each in her manner, unlike in hue, the Pair in alternation Round heaven and earth from ancient time have travelled, Night with her dark limbs, Dawn with limbs of splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सने॑मि स॒ख्यं स्व॑प॒स्यमा॑नः सू॒नुर्दा॑धार॒ शव॑सा सु॒दंसाः॑ आ॒मासु॑ चिद्दधिषे प॒क्वम॒न्तः पयः॑ कृ॒ष्णासु॒ रुश॒द्रोहि॑णीषु
verses.transliteration: sánemi sakhyáṃ svapasyámānaḥ  sūnúr dādhāra śávasā sudáṃsāḥ  āmā́su cid dadhiṣe pakvám antáḥ  páyaḥ kr̥ṣṇā́su rúśad róhiṇīṣu

translation.text: Rich in good actions, skilled in operation, the Son with might maintains his perfect friendship. Thou in the raw cows, black of hue or ruddy, storest the ripe milk glossy white in colour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒नात्सनी॑ळा अ॒वनी॑रवा॒ता व्र॒ता र॑क्षन्ते अ॒मृताः॒ सहो॑भिः पु॒रू स॒हस्रा॒ जन॑यो॒ न पत्नी॑र्दुव॒स्यन्ति॒ स्वसा॑रो॒ अह्र॑याणम्
verses.transliteration: sanā́t sánīḷā avánīr avātā́ḥ-  vratā́ rakṣante amŕ̥tāḥ sáhobhiḥ  purū́ sahásrā jánayo ná pátnīr  duvasyánti svásāro áhrayāṇam

translation.text: Their paths, of old connected, rest uninjured; they with great might preserve the immortal statutes. For many thousand holy works the Sisters wait on the haughty Lord like wives and matrons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒ना॒युवो॒ नम॑सा॒ नव्यो॑ अ॒र्कैर्व॑सू॒यवो॑ म॒तयो॑ दस्म दद्रुः पतिं॒ न पत्नी॑रुश॒तीरु॒शन्तं॑ स्पृ॒शन्ति॑ त्वा शवसावन्मनी॒षाः
verses.transliteration: sanāyúvo námasā návyo arkaír  vasūyávo matáyo dasma dadruḥ  pátiṃ ná pátnīr uśatī́r uśántaṃ  spr̥śánti tvā śavasāvan manīṣā́ḥ

translation.text: Thoughts ancient, seeking wealth, with adoration, with newest lauds have sped to thee, O Mighty. As yearning wives cleave to their yearning husband, so cleave our hymns to thee, O Lord most potent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒नादे॒व तव॒ रायो॒ गभ॑स्तौ॒ न क्षीय॑न्ते॒ नोप॑ दस्यन्ति दस्म द्यु॒माँ अ॑सि॒ क्रतु॑माँ इन्द्र॒ धीरः॒ शिक्षा॑ शचीव॒स्तव॑ नः॒ शची॑भिः
verses.transliteration: sanā́d evá táva rā́yo gábhastau  ná kṣī́yante nópa dasyanti dasma  dyumā́m̐ asi krátumām̐ indra dhī́raḥ  śíkṣā śacīvas táva naḥ śácībhiḥ

translation.text: Strong God, the riches which thy hands have holden from days of old have perished not nor wasted. Splendid art thou, O Indra, wise, unbending:strengthen us with might, O Lord of Power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒ना॒य॒ते गोत॑म इन्द्र॒ नव्य॒मत॑क्ष॒द्ब्रह्म॑ हरि॒योज॑नाय सु॒नी॒थाय॑ नः शवसान नो॒धाः प्रा॒तर्म॒क्षू धि॒याव॑सुर्जगम्यात्
verses.transliteration: sanāyaté gótama indra návyam  átakṣad bráhma hariyójanāya  sunīthā́ya naḥ śavasāna nodhā́ḥ  prātár makṣū́ dhiyā́vasur jagamyāt

translation.text: O mighty Indra, Gotama's son Nodhas hath fashioned this new prayer to thee Eternal, Sure leader, yoker of the Tawny Coursers. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं म॒हाँ इ॑न्द्र॒ यो ह॒ शुष्मै॒र्द्यावा॑ जज्ञा॒नः पृ॑थि॒वी अमे॑ धाः यद्ध॑ ते॒ विश्वा॑ गि॒रय॑श्चि॒दभ्वा॑ भि॒या दृ॒ळ्हासः॑ कि॒रणा॒ नैज॑न्
verses.transliteration: tvám mahā́m̐ indra yó ha śúṣmair  dyā́vā jajñānáḥ pr̥thivī́ áme dhāḥ  yád dha te víśvā giráyaś cid ábhvā  bhiyā́ dr̥ḷhā́saḥ kiráṇā naíjan

translation.text: THOU art the Mighty One; when born, O Indra, with power thou tcrrifiedst earth and heaven – When, in their fear of thee, all firm-set mountains and monstrous creatures shook like dust before thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यद्धरी॑ इन्द्र॒ विव्र॑ता॒ वेरा ते॒ वज्रं॑ जरि॒ता बा॒ह्वोर्धा॑त् येना॑विहर्यतक्रतो अ॒मित्रा॒न्पुर॑ इ॒ष्णासि॑ पुरुहूत पू॒र्वीः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yád dhárī indra vívratā vér  ā́ te vájraṃ jaritā́ bāhvór dhāt  yénāviharyatakrato amítrān  púra iṣṇā́si puruhūta pūrvī́ḥ

translation.text: When thy two wandering Bays thou drawest hither, thy praiser laid within thine arms the thunder, Wherewith, O Much-invoked, in will resistless, thou smitest foemen down and many a castle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं स॒त्य इ॑न्द्र धृ॒ष्णुरे॒तान्त्वमृ॑भु॒क्षा नर्य॒स्त्वं षाट् त्वं शुष्णं॑ वृ॒जने॑ पृ॒क्ष आ॒णौ यूने॒ कुत्सा॑य द्यु॒मते॒ सचा॑हन्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ satyá indra dhr̥ṣṇúr etā́n  tvám r̥bhukṣā́ náryas tváṃ ṣā́ṭ  tváṃ śúṣṇaṃ vr̥jáne pr̥kṣá āṇaú  yū́ne kútsāya dyumáte sácā han

translation.text: Faithful art thou, these thou defiest, Indra; thou art the R̥ibhus' Lord, heroic, victor. Thou, by his side, for young and glorious Kutsa, with steed and car in battle slewest Ṣushṇa,

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ह॒ त्यदि॑न्द्र चोदीः॒ सखा॑ वृ॒त्रं यद्व॑ज्रिन्वृषकर्मन्नु॒भ्नाः यद्ध॑ शूर वृषमणः परा॒चैर्वि दस्यूँ॒र्योना॒वकृ॑तो वृथा॒षाट्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ ha tyád indra codīḥ sákhā  vr̥tráṃ yád vajrin vr̥ṣakarmann ubhnā́ḥ  yád dha śūra vr̥ṣamaṇaḥ parācaír  ví dásyūm̐r yónāv ákr̥to vr̥thāṣā́ṭ

translation.text: That, as a friend, thou furtheredst, O Indra, when, Thunderer, strong in act, thou crushedst Vr̥itra; When, Hero, thou, great-souled, with easy conquest didst rend the Dasyus in their distant dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ह॒ त्यदि॒न्द्रारि॑षण्यन्दृ॒ळ्हस्य॑ चि॒न्मर्ता॑ना॒मजु॑ष्टौ व्य१॒॑स्मदा काष्ठा॒ अर्व॑ते वर्घ॒नेव॑ वज्रिञ्छ्नथिह्य॒मित्रा॑न्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ ha tyád indrā́riṣaṇyan  dr̥ḷhásya cin mártānām ájuṣṭau  vy àsmád ā́ kā́ṣṭhā árvate var  ghanéva vajriñ chnathihy amítrān

translation.text: This doest thou, and art not harmed, O Indra, e'en in the anger of the strongest mortal. Lay thou the race-course open for our horses: as with a club, slay, Thunderarmed! our foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां ह॒ त्यदि॒न्द्रार्ण॑सातौ॒ स्व॑र्मीळ्हे॒ नर॑ आ॒जा ह॑वन्ते तव॑ स्वधाव इ॒यमा स॑म॒र्य ऊ॒तिर्वाजे॑ष्वत॒साय्या॑ भूत्
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ ha tyád indrā́rṇasātau  svàrmīḷhe nára ājā́ havante  táva svadhāva iyám ā́ samaryé-  ūtír vā́jeṣv atasā́yyā bhūt

translation.text: Hence men invoke thee, Indra, in the tumult of battle, in the light-bestowing conflict. This aid of thine, O Godlike One, was ever to be implored in deeds of might in combat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ह॒ त्यदि॑न्द्र स॒प्त युध्य॒न्पुरो॑ वज्रिन्पुरु॒कुत्सा॑य दर्दः ब॒र्हिर्न यत्सु॒दासे॒ वृथा॒ वर्गं॒हो रा॑ज॒न्वरि॑वः पू॒रवे॑ कः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ ha tyád indra saptá yúdhyan  púro vajrin purukútsāya dardaḥ  barhír ná yát sudā́se vŕ̥thā várg  aṃhó rājan várivaḥ pūráve kaḥ

translation.text: Warring for Pûrukutsa thou, O Indra, Thunder-armed I breakest down the seven castles; Easily, for Sudis, like grass didst rend them, and out of need, King, broughtest gain to Pûru.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं त्यां न॑ इन्द्र देव चि॒त्रामिष॒मापो॒ न पी॑पयः॒ परि॑ज्मन् यया॑ शूर॒ प्रत्य॒स्मभ्यं॒ यंसि॒ त्मन॒मूर्जं॒ न वि॒श्वध॒ क्षर॑ध्यै
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tyā́ṃ na indra deva citrā́m  íṣam ā́po ná pīpayaḥ párijman  yáyā śūra práty asmábhyaṃ yáṃsi  tmánam ū́rjaṃ ná viśvádha kṣáradhyai

translation.text: O Indra, God who movest round about us, feed us with varied food plenteous as water- Food wherewithal, O Hero, thou bestowest vigour itself to flow to us for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अका॑रि त इन्द्र॒ गोत॑मेभि॒र्ब्रह्मा॒ण्योक्ता॒ नम॑सा॒ हरि॑भ्याम् सु॒पेश॑सं॒ वाज॒मा भ॑रा नः प्रा॒तर्म॒क्षू धि॒याव॑सुर्जगम्यात्
verses.transliteration: ákāri ta indra gótamebhir  bráhmāṇy óktā námasā háribhyām  supéśasaṃ vā́jam ā́ bharā naḥ  prātár makṣū́ dhiyā́vasur jagamyāt

translation.text: Prayers have been made by Gotamas, O Indra, addressed to thee, with laud for thy Bay Horses. Bring us in noble shape abundant riches. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृष्णे॒ शर्धा॑य॒ सुम॑खाय वे॒धसे॒ नोधः॑ सुवृ॒क्तिं प्र भ॑रा म॒रुद्भ्यः॑ अ॒पो न धीरो॒ मन॑सा सु॒हस्त्यो॒ गिरः॒ सम॑ञ्जे वि॒दथे॑ष्वा॒भुवः॑
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣṇe śárdhāya súmakhāya vedháse  nódhaḥ suvr̥ktím prá bharā marúdbhyaḥ  apó ná dhī́ro mánasā suhástyo  gíraḥ sám añje vidátheṣv ābhúvaḥ

translation.text: BRING for the manly host, wise and majestical, O Nodhas, for the Maruts bring thou a pure gift. I deck my songs as one deft-handed, wise in mind prepares the water that hath power in solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते ज॑ज्ञिरे दि॒व ऋ॒ष्वास॑ उ॒क्षणो॑ रु॒द्रस्य॒ मर्या॒ असु॑रा अरे॒पसः॑ पा॒व॒कासः॒ शुच॑यः॒ सूर्या॑ इव॒ सत्वा॑नो॒ न द्र॒प्सिनो॑ घो॒रव॑र्पसः
verses.transliteration: té jajñire divá r̥ṣvā́sa ukṣáṇo  rudrásya máryā ásurā arepásaḥ  pāvakā́saḥ śúcayaḥ sū́ryā iva  sátvāno ná drapsíno ghorávarpasaḥ

translation.text: They spring to birth, the lofty Ones, the Bulls of Heaven, divine, the youths of Rudra, free from spot and stain; The purifiers, shining brightly even as suns, awful of form like giants, scattering rain-drops down.

verses.sanskrit_deva: युवा॑नो रु॒द्रा अ॒जरा॑ अभो॒ग्घनो॑ वव॒क्षुरध्रि॑गावः॒ पर्व॑ता इव दृ॒ळ्हा चि॒द्विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि॒ पार्थि॑वा॒ प्र च्या॑वयन्ति दि॒व्यानि॑ म॒ज्मना॑
verses.transliteration: yúvāno rudrā́ ajárā abhoggháno  vavakṣúr ádhrigāvaḥ párvatā iva  dr̥ḷhā́ cid víśvā bhúvanāni pā́rthivā  prá cyāvayanti divyā́ni majmánā

translation.text: Young Rudras, demon-slayers, never growing old, they have waxed, even as mountains, irresistible. They make all beings tremble with their mighty strength, even the very strongest, both of earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चि॒त्रैर॒ञ्जिभि॒र्वपु॑षे॒ व्य॑ञ्जते॒ वक्षः॑सु रु॒क्माँ अधि॑ येतिरे शु॒भे अंसे॑ष्वेषां॒ नि मि॑मृक्षुर्ऋ॒ष्टयः॑ सा॒कं ज॑ज्ञिरे स्व॒धया॑ दि॒वो नरः॑
verses.transliteration: citraír añjíbhir vápuṣe vy àñjate  vákṣassu rukmā́m̐ ádhi yetire śubhé  áṃseṣv eṣāṃ ní mimikṣur* r̥ṣṭáyaḥ  sākáṃ jajñire svadháyā divó náraḥ

translation.text: With glittering ornaments they deck them forth for show; for beauty on their breasts they bind their chains of gold. The lances on their shoulders pound to pieces; they were born together, of themselves, the Men of Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒शा॒न॒कृतो॒ धुन॑यो रि॒शाद॑सो॒ वाता॑न्वि॒द्युत॒स्तवि॑षीभिरक्रत दु॒हन्त्यूध॑र्दि॒व्यानि॒ धूत॑यो॒ भूमिं॑ पिन्वन्ति॒ पय॑सा॒ परि॑ज्रयः
verses.transliteration: īśānakŕ̥to dhúnayo riśā́daso  vā́tān vidyútas táviṣībhir akrata  duhánty ū́dhar divyā́ni dhū́tayo  bhū́mim pinvanti páyasā párijrayaḥ

translation.text: Loud roarers, giving strength, devourers of the foe, they make the winds, they make the lightnings with their powers. The restless shakers drain the udders of the sky, and ever wandering round fill the earth full with milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिन्व॑न्त्य॒पो म॒रुतः॑ सु॒दान॑वः॒ पयो॑ घृ॒तव॑द्वि॒दथे॑ष्वा॒भुवः॑ अत्यं॒ न मि॒हे वि न॑यन्ति वा॒जिन॒मुत्सं॑ दुहन्ति स्त॒नय॑न्त॒मक्षि॑तम्
verses.transliteration: pínvanty apó marútaḥ sudā́navaḥ  páyo ghr̥távad vidátheṣv ābhúvaḥ  átyaṃ ná mihé ví nayanti vājínam  útsaṃ duhanti stanáyantam ákṣitam

translation.text: The bounteous Maruts with the fatness dropping milk fill full the waters which avail in solenm rites. They lead, as 'twere, the Strong Horse forth, that it may rain: they milk the thundering, the neverfailing spring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हि॒षासो॑ मा॒यिन॑श्चि॒त्रभा॑नवो गि॒रयो॒ न स्वत॑वसो रघु॒ष्यदः॑ मृ॒गा इ॑व ह॒स्तिनः॑ खादथा॒ वना॒ यदारु॑णीषु॒ तवि॑षी॒रयु॑ग्ध्वम्
verses.transliteration: mahiṣā́so māyínaś citrábhānavo  giráyo ná svátavaso raghuṣyádaḥ  mr̥gā́ iva hastínaḥ khādathā vánā  yád ā́ruṇīṣu táviṣīr áyugdhvam

translation.text: Mighty, with wondrous power and marvellously bright, selfstrong like mountains, ye glide swiftly on your way. Like the wild elephants ye eat the forests up when ye assume your strength among the bright red flames.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सिं॒हा इ॑व नानदति॒ प्रचे॑तसः पि॒शा इ॑व सु॒पिशो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दसः क्षपो॒ जिन्व॑न्तः॒ पृष॑तीभिर्ऋ॒ष्टिभिः॒ समित्स॒बाधः॒ शव॒साहि॑मन्यवः
verses.transliteration: siṃhā́ iva nānadati prácetasaḥ  piśā́ iva supíśo viśvávedasaḥ  kṣápo jínvantaḥ pŕ̥ṣatībhir r̥ṣṭíbhiḥ  sám ít sabā́dhaḥ śávasā́himanyavaḥ

translation.text: Exceeding wise they roar like lions mightily, they, all-possessing, are beauteous as antelopes; Stirring the darkness with lances and spotted deer, combined as priests, with serpents' fury through their might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रोद॑सी॒ आ व॑दता गणश्रियो॒ नृषा॑चः शूराः॒ शव॒साहि॑मन्यवः आ व॒न्धुरे॑ष्व॒मति॒र्न द॑र्श॒ता वि॒द्युन्न त॑स्थौ मरुतो॒ रथे॑षु वः
verses.transliteration: ródasī ā́ vadatā gaṇaśriyo  nŕ̥ṣācaḥ śūrāḥ śávasā́himanyavaḥ  ā́ vandhúreṣv amátir ná darśatā́  vidyún ná tasthau maruto rátheṣu vaḥ

translation.text: Heroes who march in companies, befriending man, with serpents' ire through strength, ye greet the earth and heaven. Upon the seats, O Maruts, of your chariots, upon the cars stands lightning visible as light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्ववे॑दसो र॒यिभिः॒ समो॑कसः॒ सम्मि॑श्लास॒स्तवि॑षीभिर्विर॒प्शिनः॑ अस्ता॑र॒ इषुं॑ दधिरे॒ गभ॑स्त्योरन॒न्तशु॑ष्मा॒ वृष॑खादयो॒ नरः॑
verses.transliteration: viśvávedaso rayíbhiḥ sámokasaḥ  sámmiślāsas táviṣībhir virapśínaḥ  ástāra íṣuṃ dadhire gábhastyor  anantáśuṣmā vŕ̥ṣakhādayo náraḥ

translation.text: Lords of all riches, dwelling in the home of wealth, endowed with mighty vigour, singers loud of voice, Heroes, of powers infinite, armed with strong men's rings, the archers, they have laid the arrow on their arms.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒र॒ण्यये॑भिः प॒विभिः॑ पयो॒वृध॒ उज्जि॑घ्नन्त आप॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ न पर्व॑तान् म॒खा अ॒यासः॑ स्व॒सृतो॑ ध्रुव॒च्युतो॑ दुध्र॒कृतो॑ म॒रुतो॒ भ्राज॑दृष्टयः
verses.transliteration: hiraṇyáyebhiḥ pavíbhiḥ payovŕ̥dhaḥ-  új jighnanta āpathyò ná párvatān  makhā́ ayā́saḥ svasŕ̥to dhruvacyúto  dudhrakŕ̥to marúto bhrā́jadr̥ṣṭayaḥ

translation.text: They who with golden fellies make the rain increase drive forward the big clouds like wanderers on the way. Self-moving, brisk, unwearied, they o'erthrow the firm; the Maruts with bright lances make all things to reel.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृषुं॑ पाव॒कं व॒निनं॒ विच॑र्षणिं रु॒द्रस्य॑ सू॒नुं ह॒वसा॑ गृणीमसि र॒ज॒स्तुरं॑ त॒वसं॒ मारु॑तं ग॒णमृ॑जी॒षिणं॒ वृष॑णं सश्चत श्रि॒ये
verses.transliteration: ghŕ̥ṣum pāvakáṃ vanínaṃ vícarṣaṇiṃ  rudrásya sūnúṃ havásā gr̥ṇīmasi  rajastúraṃ tavásam mā́rutaṃ gaṇám  r̥jīṣíṇaṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ saścata śriyé

translation.text: The progeny of Rudra we invoke with prayer, the brisk, the bright, the worshipful, the active Ones To the strong band of Maruts cleave for happiness, the chasers of the sky, impetuous, vigorous.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र नू स मर्तः॒ शव॑सा॒ जनाँ॒ अति॑ त॒स्थौ व॑ ऊ॒ती म॑रुतो॒ यमाव॑त अर्व॑द्भि॒र्वाजं॑ भरते॒ धना॒ नृभि॑रा॒पृच्छ्यं॒ क्रतु॒मा क्षे॑ति॒ पुष्य॑ति
verses.transliteration: prá nū́ sá mártaḥ śávasā jánām̐ áti  tasthaú va ūtī́ maruto yám ā́vata  árvadbhir vā́jam bharate dhánā nŕ̥bhir  āpŕ̥chyaṃ krátum ā́ kṣeti púṣyati

translation.text: Maruts, the man whom ye have guarded with your help, he verily in strength surpasseth all mankind. Spoil with his steeds he gaineth, treasure with his men; he winneth honourable strength and prospereth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒र्कृत्यं॑ मरुतः पृ॒त्सु दु॒ष्टरं॑ द्यु॒मन्तं॒ शुष्मं॑ म॒घव॑त्सु धत्तन ध॒न॒स्पृत॑मु॒क्थ्यं॑ वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिं तो॒कं पु॑ष्येम॒ तन॑यं श॒तं हिमाः॑
verses.transliteration: carkŕ̥tyam marutaḥ pr̥tsú duṣṭáraṃ  dyumántaṃ śúṣmam maghávatsu dhattana  dhanaspŕ̥tam ukthyàṃ viśvácarṣaṇiṃ  tokám puṣyema tánayaṃ śatáṃ hímāḥ

translation.text: O Maruts, to the worshippers give glorious strength invincible in battle, brilliant, bringing wealth, Praiseworthy, known to all men. May we foster well, during a hundred winters, son and progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू ष्ठि॒रं म॑रुतो वी॒रव॑न्तमृती॒षाहं॑ र॒यिम॒स्मासु॑ धत्त स॒ह॒स्रिणं॑ श॒तिनं॑ शूशु॒वांसं॑ प्रा॒तर्म॒क्षू धि॒याव॑सुर्जगम्यात्
verses.transliteration: nū́ ṣṭhirám maruto vīrávantam  r̥tīṣā́haṃ rayím asmā́su dhatta  sahasríṇaṃ śatínaṃ śūśuvā́ṃsam  prātár makṣū́ dhiyā́vasur jagamyāt

translation.text: Will ye then, O ye Maruts, grant us riches, durable, rich in men, defying onslaught. A hundred, thousandfold, ever increasing? May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒श्वा न ता॒युं गुहा॒ चत॑न्तं॒ नमो॑ युजा॒नं नमो॒ वह॑न्तम्
verses.transliteration: paśvā́ ná tāyúṃ gúhā cátantaṃ  námo yujānáṃ námo váhantam

translation.text: ONE-MINDED, wise, they tracked thee like a thief lurking in dark cave with a stolen cow; Thee claiming worship, bearing it to Gods : there nigh to thee sate all the Holy Ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒जोषा॒ धीराः॑ प॒दैरनु॑ ग्म॒न्नुप॑ त्वा सीद॒न्विश्वे॒ यज॑त्राः
verses.transliteration: sajóṣā dhī́rāḥ padaír ánu gmann  úpa tvā sīdan víśve yájatrāḥ

translation.text: ONE-MINDED, wise, they tracked thee like a thief lurking in dark cave with a stolen cow; Thee claiming worship, bearing it to Gods : there nigh to thee sate all the Holy Ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॑ दे॒वा अनु॑ व्र॒ता गु॒र्भुव॒त्परि॑ष्टि॒र्द्यौर्न भूम॑
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya devā́ ánu vratā́ gur  bhúvat páriṣṭir dyaúr ná bhū́ma

translation.text: The Gods approached the ways of holy Law; there was a gathering vast as heaven itself.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वर्ध॑न्ती॒मापः॑ प॒न्वा सुशि॑श्विमृ॒तस्य॒ योना॒ गर्भे॒ सुजा॑तम्
verses.transliteration: várdhantīm ā́paḥ panvā́ súśiśvim  r̥tásya yónā gárbhe sújātam

translation.text: The waters feed with praise the growing Babe, born nobly in the womb, the seat of Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒ष्टिर्न र॒ण्वा क्षि॒तिर्न पृ॒थ्वी गि॒रिर्न भुज्म॒ क्षोदो॒ न श॒म्भु
verses.transliteration: puṣṭír ná raṇvā́ kṣitír ná pr̥thvī́  girír ná bhújma kṣódo ná śambhú

translation.text: Like grateful food, like some wide dwelling place, like a fruit-bearing hill, a wholesome stream.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्यो॒ नाज्म॒न्त्सर्ग॑प्रतक्तः॒ सिन्धु॒र्न क्षोदः॒ क ईं॑ वराते
verses.transliteration: átyo nā́jman sárgaprataktaḥ  síndhur ná kṣódaḥ ká īṃ varāte

translation.text: Like a steed urged to run in swift career, rushing like Sindhu, who may check his course?

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒मिः सिन्धू॑नां॒ भ्राते॑व॒ स्वस्रा॒मिभ्या॒न्न राजा॒ वना॑न्यत्ति
verses.transliteration: jāmíḥ síndhūnām bhrā́teva svásrām  íbhyān ná rā́jā vánāny atti

translation.text: Kin as a brother to his sister floods, he eats the woods as a King eats the rich.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वात॑जूतो॒ वना॒ व्यस्था॑द॒ग्निर्ह॑ दाति॒ रोमा॑ पृथि॒व्याः
verses.transliteration: yád vā́tajūto vánā vy ásthād  agnír ha dāti rómā pr̥thivyā́ḥ

translation.text: When through the forest, urged by wind, he spreads, verily Agni shears the hair of earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्वसि॑त्य॒प्सु हं॒सो न सीद॒न्क्रत्वा॒ चेति॑ष्ठो वि॒शामु॑ष॒र्भुत्
verses.transliteration: śvásity apsú haṃsó ná sī́dan  krátvā cétiṣṭho viśā́m uṣarbhút

translation.text: Like a swan sitting in the floods he pants wisest in mind mid men he wakes at morn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमो॒ न वे॒धा ऋ॒तप्र॑जातः प॒शुर्न शिश्वा॑ वि॒भुर्दू॒रेभाः॑
verses.transliteration: sómo ná vedhā́ r̥táprajātaḥ  paśúr ná śíśvā vibhúr dūrébhāḥ

translation.text: A Sage like Soma, sprung from Law, he grew like some young creature, mighty, shining far.

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒यिर्न चि॒त्रा सूरो॒ न सं॒दृगायु॒र्न प्रा॒णो नित्यो॒ न सू॒नुः
verses.transliteration: rayír ná citrā́ sū́ro ná saṃdŕ̥g  ā́yur ná prāṇó nítyo ná sūnúḥ

translation.text: LIKE the Sun's glance, like wealth of varied sort, like breath which is the life, like one's own son,

verses.sanskrit_deva: तक्वा॒ न भूर्णि॒र्वना॑ सिषक्ति॒ पयो॒ न धे॒नुः शुचि॑र्वि॒भावा॑
verses.transliteration: tákvā ná bhū́rṇir vánā siṣakti  páyo ná dhenúḥ śúcir vibhā́vā

translation.text: Like a swift bird, a cow who yields her milk, pure and refulgent to the wood he speeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दा॒धार॒ क्षेम॒मोको॒ न र॒ण्वो यवो॒ न प॒क्वो जेता॒ जना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: dādhā́ra kṣémam óko ná raṇvó  yávo ná pakvó jétā jánānām

translation.text: He offers safety like a pleasant home, like ripened corn, the Conqueror of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋषि॒र्न स्तुभ्वा॑ वि॒क्षु प्र॑श॒स्तो वा॒जी न प्री॒तो वयो॑ दधाति
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥ṣir ná stúbhvā vikṣú praśastó  vājī́ ná prītó váyo dadhāti

translation.text: Like a Seer lauding, famed among the folk; like a steed friendly he vouchsafes us power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दु॒रोक॑शोचिः॒ क्रतु॒र्न नित्यो॑ जा॒येव॒ योना॒वरं॒ विश्व॑स्मै
verses.transliteration: durókaśociḥ krátur ná nítyo  jāyéva yónāv áraṃ víśvasmai

translation.text: With flame insatiate, like eternal might; caring for each one like a dame at home;

verses.sanskrit_deva: चि॒त्रो यदभ्रा॑ट् छ्वे॒तो न वि॒क्षु रथो॒ न रु॒क्मी त्वे॒षः स॒मत्सु॑
verses.transliteration: citró yád ábhrāṭ chvetó ná vikṣú  rátho ná rukmī́ tveṣáḥ samátsu

translation.text: Bright when he shines forth, whitish mid the folk, like a car, gold-decked, thundering to the fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सेने॑व सृ॒ष्टामं॑ दधा॒त्यस्तु॒र्न दि॒द्युत्त्वे॒षप्र॑तीका
verses.transliteration: séneva sr̥ṣṭā́maṃ dadhāti-  ástur ná didyút tveṣápratīkā

translation.text: He strikes with terror like a dart shot forth, e'en like an archer's arrow tipped with flame;

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒मो ह॑ जा॒तो य॒मो जनि॑त्वं जा॒रः क॒नीनां॒ पति॒र्जनी॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: yamó ha jātó yamó jánitvaṃ  jāráḥ kanī́nām pátir jánīnām

translation.text: Master of present and of future life, the maidens' lover and the matrons' Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं व॑श्च॒राथा॑ व॒यं व॑स॒त्यास्तं॒ न गावो॒ नक्ष॑न्त इ॒द्धम्
verses.transliteration: táṃ vaś carā́thā vayáṃ vasatyā́-  -ástaṃ ná gā́vo nákṣanta iddhám

translation.text: To him lead all your ways: may we attain the kindled God as cows their home at eve.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सिन्धु॒र्न क्षोदः॒ प्र नीची॑रैनो॒न्नव॑न्त॒ गावः॒ स्व१॒॑र्दृशी॑के
verses.transliteration: síndhur ná kṣódaḥ prá nī́cīr ainot-  návanta gā́vaḥ svàr dŕ̥śīke

translation.text: He drives the flames below as floods their swell: the rays rise up to the fair place of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वने॑षु जा॒युर्मर्ते॑षु मि॒त्रो वृ॑णी॒ते श्रु॒ष्टिं राजे॑वाजु॒र्यम्
verses.transliteration: váneṣu jāyúr márteṣu mitró  vr̥ṇīté śruṣṭíṃ rā́jevājuryám

translation.text: VICTORIOUS in the wood, Friend among men, ever he claims obedience as a King.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्षेमो॒ न सा॒धुः क्रतु॒र्न भ॒द्रो भुव॑त्स्वा॒धीर्होता॑ हव्य॒वाट्
verses.transliteration: kṣémo ná sādhúḥ krátur ná bhadró  bhúvat svādhī́r hótā havyavā́ṭ

translation.text: Gracious like peace, blessing like mental power, Priest was he, offering-bearer, full of thought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हस्ते॒ दधा॑नो नृ॒म्णा विश्वा॒न्यमे॑ दे॒वान्धा॒द्गुहा॑ नि॒षीद॑न्
verses.transliteration: háste dádhāno nr̥mṇā́ víśvāni-  áme devā́n dhād gúhā niṣī́dan

translation.text: He, bearing in his hand all manly might, crouched in the cavern, struck the Gods with fear.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒दन्ती॒मत्र॒ नरो॑ धियं॒धा हृ॒दा यत्त॒ष्टान्मन्त्राँ॒ अशं॑सन्
verses.transliteration: vidántīm átra náro dhiyaṃdhā́ḥ-  hr̥dā́ yát taṣṭā́n mántrām̐ áśaṃsan

translation.text: Men filled with understanding find him there, when they have sting prayers formed within their heart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒जो न क्षां दा॒धार॑ पृथि॒वीं त॒स्तम्भ॒ द्यां मन्त्रे॑भिः स॒त्यैः
verses.transliteration: ajó ná kṣā́ṃ dādhā́ra pr̥thivī́ṃ  tastámbha dyā́m mántrebhiḥ satyaíḥ

translation.text: He, like the Unborn, holds the broad earth up; and with effective utterance fixed the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रि॒या प॒दानि॑ प॒श्वो नि पा॑हि वि॒श्वायु॑रग्ने गु॒हा गुहं॑ गाः
verses.transliteration: priyā́ padā́ni paśvó ní pāhi  viśvā́yur agne guhā́ gúhaṃ gāḥ

translation.text: O Agni, guard the spots which cattle love: thou, life of all, hast gone from lair to lair.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ईं॑ चि॒केत॒ गुहा॒ भव॑न्त॒मा यः स॒साद॒ धारा॑मृ॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yá īṃ cikéta gúhā bhávantam  ā́ yáḥ sasā́da dhā́rām r̥tásya

translation.text: Whoso hath known him dwelling in his lair, and hath approached the stream of holy Law,–

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि ये चृ॒तन्त्यृ॒ता सप॑न्त॒ आदिद्वसू॑नि॒ प्र व॑वाचास्मै
verses.transliteration: ví yé cr̥tánty r̥tā́ sápantaḥ-  ā́d íd vásūni prá vavācāsmai

translation.text: They who release him, paying sacred rites, -truly to such doth he announce great wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि यो वी॒रुत्सु॒ रोध॑न्महि॒त्वोत प्र॒जा उ॒त प्र॒सूष्व॒न्तः
verses.transliteration: ví yó vīrútsu ródhan mahitvā́-  -utá prajā́ utá prasū́ṣv antáḥ

translation.text: He who grows mightily in herbs, within each fruitful mother and each babe she bears,

verses.sanskrit_deva: चित्ति॑र॒पां दमे॑ वि॒श्वायुः॒ सद्मे॑व॒ धीराः॑ स॒म्माय॑ चक्रुः
verses.transliteration: cíttir apā́ṃ dáme viśvā́yuḥ  sádmeva dhī́rāḥ sammā́ya cakruḥ

translation.text: Wise, life of all men, in the waters' home,– for him have sages built as 'twere a seat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्री॒णन्नुप॑ स्था॒द्दिवं॑ भुर॒ण्युः स्था॒तुश्च॒रथ॑म॒क्तून्व्यू॑र्णोत्
verses.transliteration: śrīṇánn úpa sthād dívam bhuraṇyúḥ-  sthātúś carátham aktū́n vy ū̀rṇot

translation.text: COMMINGLING, restless, he ascends the sky, unveiling nights and all that stands or moves,

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ यदे॑षा॒मेको॒ विश्वे॑षां॒ भुव॑द्दे॒वो दे॒वानां॑ महि॒त्वा
verses.transliteration: pári yád eṣām éko víśveṣām  bhúvad devó devā́nām mahitvā́

translation.text: As he the sole God is preeminent in greatness among all these other Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदित्ते॒ विश्वे॒ क्रतुं॑ जुषन्त॒ शुष्का॒द्यद्दे॑व जी॒वो जनि॑ष्ठाः
verses.transliteration: ā́d ít te víśve krátuṃ juṣanta  śúṣkād yád deva jīvó jániṣṭhāḥ

translation.text: All men are joyful in thy power, O God, that living from the dry wood thou art born.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भज॑न्त॒ विश्वे॑ देव॒त्वं नाम॑ ऋ॒तं सप॑न्तो अ॒मृत॒मेवैः॑
verses.transliteration: bhájanta víśve devatváṃ nā́ma  r̥táṃ sápanto amŕ̥tam évaiḥ

translation.text: All truly share thy Godhead while they keep, in their accustomed ways, eternal Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॒ प्रेषा॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ धी॒तिर्वि॒श्वायु॒र्विश्वे॒ अपां॑सि चक्रुः
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya préṣā r̥tásya dhītír  viśvā́yur víśve ápāṃsi cakruḥ

translation.text: Strong is the thought of Law, the Law's behest; all works have they performed; he quickens all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्तुभ्यं॒ दाशा॒द्यो वा॑ ते॒ शिक्षा॒त्तस्मै॑ चिकि॒त्वान्र॒यिं द॑यस्व
verses.transliteration: yás túbhyaṃ dā́śād yó vā te śíkṣāt  tásmai cikitvā́n rayíṃ dayasva

translation.text: Whoso will bring oblation, gifts to thee, to him, bethinking thee, vouchsafe thou wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: होता॒ निष॑त्तो॒ मनो॒रप॑त्ये॒ स चि॒न्न्वा॑सां॒ पती॑ रयी॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: hótā níṣatto mánor ápatye  sá cin nv ā̀sām pátī rayīṇā́m

translation.text: Seated as Priest with Manu's progeny, of all these treasures he alone is Lord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒च्छन्त॒ रेतो॑ मि॒थस्त॒नूषु॒ सं जा॑नत॒ स्वैर्दक्षै॒रमू॑राः
verses.transliteration: ichánta réto mithás tanū́ṣu  sáṃ jānata svaír dákṣair ámūrāḥ

translation.text: Men yearn for children to prolong their line, and are not disappointed in their hope.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒तुर्न पु॒त्राः क्रतुं॑ जुषन्त॒ श्रोष॒न्ये अ॑स्य॒ शासं॑ तु॒रासः॑
verses.transliteration: pitúr ná putrā́ḥ krátuṃ juṣanta  śróṣan yé asya śā́saṃ turā́saḥ

translation.text: Eagerly they who hear his word fulfil his wish as sons obey their sire's behest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि राय॑ और्णो॒द्दुरः॑ पुरु॒क्षुः पि॒पेश॒ नाकं॒ स्तृभि॒र्दमू॑नाः
verses.transliteration: ví rā́ya aurṇod dúraḥ purukṣúḥ  pipéśa nā́kaṃ stŕ̥bhir dámūnāḥ

translation.text: He, rich in food, unbars his wealth like doors: he, the House-Friend, bath decked heaven's vault with stars.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒क्रः शु॑शु॒क्वाँ उ॒षो न जा॒रः प॒प्रा स॑मी॒ची दि॒वो न ज्योतिः॑
verses.transliteration: śukráḥ śuśukvā́m̐ uṣó ná jāráḥ  paprā́ samīcī́ divó ná jyótiḥ

translation.text: BRIGHT, splendid, like Dawn's lover, he bath filled the two joined worlds as with the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॒ प्रजा॑तः॒ क्रत्वा॑ बभूथ॒ भुवो॑ दे॒वानां॑ पि॒ता पु॒त्रः सन्
verses.transliteration: pári prájātaḥ krátvā babhūtha  bhúvo devā́nām pitā́ putráḥ sán

translation.text: When born, with might thou hast encompassed them: Father of Gods, and yet their Son wast thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वे॒धा अदृ॑प्तो अ॒ग्निर्वि॑जा॒नन्नूध॒र्न गोनां॒ स्वाद्मा॑ पितू॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: vedhā́ ádr̥pto agnír vijānánn  ū́dhar ná gónāṃ svā́dmā pitūnā́m

translation.text: Agni, the Sage, the humble, who discerns like the cow's udder, the sweet taste of food,

verses.sanskrit_deva: जने॒ न शेव॑ आ॒हूर्यः॒ सन्मध्ये॒ निष॑त्तो र॒ण्वो दु॑रो॒णे
verses.transliteration: jáne ná śéva āhū́ryaḥ sán  mádhye níṣatto raṇvó duroṇé

translation.text: Like a bliss-giver to be drawn to men, sits gracious in the middle of the house.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒त्रो न जा॒तो र॒ण्वो दु॑रो॒णे वा॒जी न प्री॒तो विशो॒ वि ता॑रीत्
verses.transliteration: putró ná jātó raṇvó duroṇé  vājī́ ná prītó víśo ví tārīt

translation.text: Born in the dwelling like a lovely son, pleased, like a strong steed, he bears on the folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विशो॒ यदह्वे॒ नृभिः॒ सनी॑ळा अ॒ग्निर्दे॑व॒त्वा विश्वा॑न्यश्याः
verses.transliteration: víśo yád áhve nŕ̥bhiḥ sánīḷāḥ-  agnír devatvā́ víśvāny aśyāḥ

translation.text: What time the men and I, with heroes, call, may Agni then gain all through Godlike power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नकि॑ष्ट ए॒ता व्र॒ता मि॑नन्ति॒ नृभ्यो॒ यदे॒भ्यः श्रु॒ष्टिं च॒कर्थ॑
verses.transliteration: nákiṣ ṭa etā́ vratā́ minanti  nŕ̥bhyo yád ebhyáḥ śruṣṭíṃ cakártha

translation.text: None breaks these holy laws of thine when thou hast granted audience to these chieftains here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्तु ते॒ दंसो॒ यदह॑न्त्समा॒नैर्नृभि॒र्यद्यु॒क्तो वि॒वे रपां॑सि
verses.transliteration: tát tú te dáṃso yád áhan samānaír  nŕ̥bhir yád yuktó vivér ápāṃsi

translation.text: This is thy boast, thou smotest with thy peers, and joined with heroes dravest off disgrace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒षो न जा॒रो वि॒भावो॒स्रः संज्ञा॑तरूप॒श्चिके॑तदस्मै
verses.transliteration: uṣó ná jāró vibhā́vosráḥ  sáṃjñātarūpaś cíketad asmai

translation.text: Like the Dawn's lover, spreading light, well-known as hued like morn, may he remember me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्मना॒ वह॑न्तो॒ दुरो॒ व्यृ॑ण्व॒न्नव॑न्त॒ विश्वे॒ स्व१॒॑र्दृशी॑के
verses.transliteration: tmánā váhanto dúro vy r̥̀ṇvan  návanta víśve svàr dŕ̥śīke

translation.text: They, bearing of themselves, unbar the doors: they all ascend to the fair place of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒नेम॑ पू॒र्वीर॒र्यो म॑नी॒षा अ॒ग्निः सु॒शोको॒ विश्वा॑न्यश्याः
verses.transliteration: vanéma pūrvī́r aryó manīṣā́  agníḥ suśóko víśvāny aśyāḥ

translation.text: MAY we, the pious, win much food by prayer, may Agni with fair light pervade each act,–

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ दैव्या॑नि व्र॒ता चि॑कि॒त्वाना मानु॑षस्य॒ जन॑स्य॒ जन्म॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ daívyāni vratā́ cikitvā́n  ā́ mā́nuṣasya jánasya jánma

translation.text: He the observer of the heavenly laws of Gods, and of the race of mortal man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गर्भो॒ यो अ॒पां गर्भो॒ वना॑नां॒ गर्भ॑श्च स्था॒तां गर्भ॑श्च॒रथा॑म्
verses.transliteration: gárbho yó apā́ṃ gárbho vánānāṃ  gárbhaś ca sthātā́ṃ gárbhaś caráthām

translation.text: He who is germ of waters, germ of woods, germ of all things that move not and that move,–

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद्रौ॑ चिदस्मा अ॒न्तर्दु॑रो॒णे वि॒शां न विश्वो॑ अ॒मृतः॑ स्वा॒धीः
verses.transliteration: ádrau cid asmā antár duroṇé  viśā́ṃ ná víśvo amŕ̥taḥ svādhī́ḥ

translation.text: To him even in the rock and in the house: Immortal One, he cares for all mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि क्ष॒पावाँ॑ अ॒ग्नी र॑यी॒णां दाश॒द्यो अ॑स्मा॒ अरं॑ सू॒क्तैः
verses.transliteration: sá hí kṣapā́vām̐ agnī́ rayīṇā́ṃ  dā́śad yó asmā áraṃ sūktaíḥ

translation.text: Agni is Lord of riches for the man who serves him readily with sacred songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता चि॑कित्वो॒ भूमा॒ नि पा॑हि दे॒वानां॒ जन्म॒ मर्ताँ॑श्च वि॒द्वान्
verses.transliteration: etā́ cikitvo bhū́mā ní pāhi  devā́nāṃ jánma mártāṃś ca vidvā́n

translation.text: Protect these beings thou with careful thought, knowing the races both of Gods and men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वर्धा॒न्यं पू॒र्वीः क्ष॒पो विरू॑पाः स्था॒तुश्च॒ रथ॑मृ॒तप्र॑वीतम्
verses.transliteration: várdhān yám pūrvī́ḥ kṣapó vírūpāḥ-  sthātúś carátham r̥tápravītam

translation.text: Whom many dawns and nights, unlike, make strong, whom, born in Law, all things that move and stand,–

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरा॑धि॒ होता॒ स्व१॒॑र्निष॑त्तः कृ॒ण्वन्विश्वा॒न्यपां॑सि स॒त्या
verses.transliteration: árādhi hótā svàr níṣattaḥ  kr̥ṇván víśvāny ápāṃsi satyā́

translation.text: He bath been won, Herald who sits in light, making effectual all our holy works.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोषु॒ प्रश॑स्तिं॒ वने॑षु धिषे॒ भर॑न्त॒ विश्वे॑ ब॒लिं स्व॑र्णः
verses.transliteration: góṣu práśastiṃ váneṣu dhiṣe  bháranta víśve balíṃ svàr ṇaḥ

translation.text: Thou settest value on our cows and woods: all shall bring tribute to us, to the light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि त्वा॒ नरः॑ पुरु॒त्रा स॑पर्यन्पि॒तुर्न जिव्रे॒र्वि वेदो॑ भरन्त
verses.transliteration: ví tvā náraḥ purutrā́ saparyan  pitúr ná jívrer ví védo bharanta

translation.text: Men have served thee in many and sundry spots, parting, as 'twere, an aged father's wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒धुर्न गृ॒ध्नुरस्ते॑व॒ शूरो॒ याते॑व भी॒मस्त्वे॒षः स॒मत्सु॑
verses.transliteration: sādhúr ná gr̥dhnúr ásteva śū́ro  yā́teva bhīmás tveṣáḥ samátsu

translation.text: Like a brave archer, like one skilled and bold, a fierce avenger, so he shines in fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॒ प्र जि॑न्वन्नुश॒तीरु॒शन्तं॒ पतिं॒ न नित्यं॒ जन॑यः॒ सनी॑ळाः स्वसा॑रः॒ श्यावी॒मरु॑षीमजुष्रञ्चि॒त्रमु॒च्छन्ती॑मु॒षसं॒ न गावः॑
verses.transliteration: úpa prá jinvann uśatī́r uśántam  pátiṃ ná nítyaṃ jánayaḥ sánīḷāḥ  svásāraḥ śyā́vīm áruṣīm ajuṣrañ  citrám uchántīm uṣásaṃ ná gā́vaḥ

translation.text: LOVING the loving One, as wives their husband, the sisters of one home have urged him forward, Bright-coloured, even, as the cows love morning, dark, breaking forth to view, and redly beaming.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वी॒ळु चि॑द्दृ॒ळ्हा पि॒तरो॑ न उ॒क्थैरद्रिं॑ रुज॒न्नङ्गि॑रसो॒ रवे॑ण च॒क्रुर्दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तो गा॒तुम॒स्मे अहः॒ स्व॑र्विविदुः के॒तुमु॒स्राः
verses.transliteration: vīḷú cid dr̥ḷhā́ pitáro na ukthaír  ádriṃ rujann áṅgiraso ráveṇa  cakrúr divó br̥ható gātúm asmé  áhaḥ svàr vividuḥ ketúm usrā́ḥ

translation.text: Our sires with lauds burst e'en the firmset fortress, yea, the Angirases, with roar, the mountain. They made for us a way to reach high heaven, they found us day, light, day's sign, beams of morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दध॑न्नृ॒तं ध॒नय॑न्नस्य धी॒तिमादिद॒र्यो दि॑धि॒ष्वो॒३॒॑ विभृ॑त्राः अतृ॑ष्यन्तीर॒पसो॑ य॒न्त्यच्छा॑ दे॒वाञ्जन्म॒ प्रय॑सा व॒र्धय॑न्तीः
verses.transliteration: dádhann r̥táṃ dhanáyann asya dhītím  ā́d íd aryó didhiṣvò víbhr̥trāḥ  átr̥ṣyantīr apáso yanty áchā  devā́ñ jánma práyasā vardháyantīḥ

translation.text: They stablished order, made his service fruitful; then parting them among the longing faithful, Not thirsting after aught, they come, most active, while with sweet food the race of Gods they strengthen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मथी॒द्यदीं॒ विभृ॑तो मात॒रिश्वा॑ गृ॒हेगृ॑हे श्ये॒तो जेन्यो॒ भूत् आदीं॒ राज्ञे॒ न सही॑यसे॒ सचा॒ सन्ना दू॒त्यं१॒॑ भृग॑वाणो विवाय
verses.transliteration: máthīd yád īṃ víbhr̥to mātaríśvā  gr̥hé-gr̥he śyetó jényo bhū́t  ā́d īṃ rā́jñe ná sáhīyase sácā sánn  ā́ dūtyàm bhŕ̥gavāṇo vivāya

translation.text: Since Mâtariṣvan, far-diffused, bath stirred him, and he in every house grown bright and noble, He, Bhr̥igu-like I hath gone as his companion, as on commission to a greater Sovran.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हे यत्पि॒त्र ईं॒ रसं॑ दि॒वे करव॑ त्सरत्पृश॒न्य॑श्चिकि॒त्वान् सृ॒जदस्ता॑ धृष॒ता दि॒द्युम॑स्मै॒ स्वायां॑ दे॒वो दु॑हि॒तरि॒ त्विषिं॑ धात्
verses.transliteration: mahé yát pitrá īṃ rásaṃ divé kár  áva tsarat pr̥śanyàś cikitvā́n  sr̥jád ástā dhr̥ṣatā́ didyúm asmai  svā́yāṃ devó duhitári tvíṣiṃ dhāt

translation.text: When man poured juice to Heaven, the mighty Father, he knew and freed himself from close embracement. The archer boldly shot at him his arrow, and the God threw his splendour on his Daughter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व आ यस्तुभ्यं॒ दम॒ आ वि॒भाति॒ नमो॑ वा॒ दाशा॑दुश॒तो अनु॒ द्यून् वर्धो॑ अग्ने॒ वयो॑ अस्य द्वि॒बर्हा॒ यास॑द्रा॒या स॒रथं॒ यं जु॒नासि॑
verses.transliteration: svá ā́ yás túbhyaṃ dáma ā́ vibhā́ti  námo vā dā́śād uśató ánu dyū́n  várdho agne váyo asya dvibárhāḥ-  yā́sad rāyā́ saráthaṃ yáṃ junā́si

translation.text: Whoso, bath flames for thee within his dwelling, or brings the worship which thou lovest daily, Do thou of double might increase his substance: may he whom thou incitest meet with riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं विश्वा॑ अ॒भि पृक्षः॑ सचन्ते समु॒द्रं न स्र॒वतः॑ स॒प्त य॒ह्वीः न जा॒मिभि॒र्वि चि॑किते॒ वयो॑ नो वि॒दा दे॒वेषु॒ प्रम॑तिं चिकि॒त्वान्
verses.transliteration: agníṃ víśvā abhí pŕ̥kṣaḥ sacante  samudráṃ ná sravátaḥ saptá yahvī́ḥ  ná jāmíbhir ví cikite váyo no  vidā́ devéṣu prámatiṃ cikitvā́n

translation.text: All sacrificial viands wait on Agni as the Seven mighty Rivers seek the ocean. Not by our brethren was our food discovered: find with the Gods care for us, thou who knowest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यदि॒षे नृ॒पतिं॒ तेज॒ आन॒ट् छुचि॒ रेतो॒ निषि॑क्तं॒ द्यौर॒भीके॑ अ॒ग्निः शर्ध॑मनव॒द्यं युवा॑नं स्वा॒ध्यं॑ जनयत्सू॒दय॑च्च
verses.transliteration: ā́ yád iṣé nr̥pátiṃ téja ā́naṭ  -śúci réto níṣiktaṃ dyaúr abhī́ke  agníḥ śárdham anavadyáṃ yúvānaṃ  svādhyàṃ janayat sūdáyac ca

translation.text: When light bath filled the Lord of men for increase, straight from the heaven descends the limpid moisture. Agni bath brought to light and filled with spirit the youthful host blameless and well providing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मनो॒ न योऽध्व॑नः स॒द्य एत्येकः॑ स॒त्रा सूरो॒ वस्व॑ ईशे राजा॑ना मि॒त्रावरु॑णा सुपा॒णी गोषु॑ प्रि॒यम॒मृतं॒ रक्ष॑माणा
verses.transliteration: máno ná yó 'dhvanaḥ sadyá éti-  ékaḥ satrā́ sū́ro vásva īśe  rā́jānā mitrā́váruṇā supāṇī́  góṣu priyám amŕ̥taṃ rákṣamāṇā

translation.text: He who like thought goes swiftly on his journey, the Sun, alone is ever Lord of riches. The Kings with fair hands, Varuṇa and Mitra, protect the precious nectar in our cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ अग्ने स॒ख्या पित्र्या॑णि॒ प्र म॑र्षिष्ठा अ॒भि वि॒दुष्क॒विः सन् नभो॒ न रू॒पं ज॑रि॒मा मि॑नाति पु॒रा तस्या॑ अ॒भिश॑स्ते॒रधी॑हि
verses.transliteration: mā́ no agne sakhyā́ pítryāṇi  prá marṣiṣṭhā abhí vidúṣ kavíḥ sán  nábho ná rūpáṃ jarimā́ mināti  purā́ tásyā abhíśaster ádhīhi

translation.text: O Agni, break not our ancestral friendship, Sage as thou art, endowed with deepest knowledge. Old age, like gathering cloud, impairs the body: before that evil be come nigh protect me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि काव्या॑ वे॒धसः॒ शश्व॑तस्क॒र्हस्ते॒ दधा॑नो॒ नर्या॑ पु॒रूणि॑ अ॒ग्निर्भु॑वद्रयि॒पती॑ रयी॒णां स॒त्रा च॑क्रा॒णो अ॒मृता॑नि॒ विश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: ní kā́vyā vedhásaḥ śáśvatas kar  háste dádhāno náryā purū́ṇi  agnír bhuvad rayipátī rayīṇā́m  satrā́ cakrāṇó amŕ̥tāni víśvā

translation.text: THOUGH holding many gifts for men, he humbleth the higher powers of each wise ordainer. Agni is now the treasure-lord of treasures, for ever granting all immortal bounties.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे व॒त्सं परि॒ षन्तं॒ न वि॑न्दन्नि॒च्छन्तो॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒मृता॒ अमू॑राः श्र॒म॒युवः॑ पद॒व्यो॑ धियं॒धास्त॒स्थुः प॒दे प॑र॒मे चार्व॒ग्नेः
verses.transliteration: asmé vatsám pári ṣántaṃ ná vindann  ichánto víśve amŕ̥tā ámūrāḥ  śramayúvaḥ padavyò dhiyaṃdhā́s  tasthúḥ padé paramé cā́rv agnéḥ

translation.text: The Gods infallible all searching found not him, the dear Babe who still is round about us. Worn weary, following his track, devoted, they reached the lovely highest home of Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒स्रो यद॑ग्ने श॒रद॒स्त्वामिच्छुचिं॑ घृ॒तेन॒ शुच॑यः सप॒र्यान् नामा॑नि चिद्दधिरे य॒ज्ञिया॒न्यसू॑दयन्त त॒न्व१॒॑ः सुजा॑ताः
verses.transliteration: tisró yád agne śarádas tvā́m íc  -śúciṃ ghr̥téna śúcayaḥ saparyā́n  nā́māni cid dadhire yajñíyāni-  ásūdayanta tanvàḥ sújātāḥ

translation.text: Because with holy oil the pure Ones, Agni, served thee the very pure three autumn seasons, Therefore they won them holy names for worship, and nobly born they dignified their bodies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ रोद॑सी बृह॒ती वेवि॑दानाः॒ प्र रु॒द्रिया॑ जभ्रिरे य॒ज्ञिया॑सः वि॒दन्मर्तो॑ ने॒मधि॑ता चिकि॒त्वान॒ग्निं प॒दे प॑र॒मे त॑स्थि॒वांस॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ ródasī br̥hatī́ vévidānāḥ  prá rudríyā jabhrire yajñíyāsaḥ  vidán márto nemádhitā cikitvā́n  agním padé paramé tasthivā́ṃsam

translation.text: Making them known to spacious earth and heaven, the holy Ones revealed the powers of Rudra. The mortal band, discerning in the distance, found Agni standing in the loftiest station.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं॒जा॒ना॒ना उप॑ सीदन्नभि॒ज्ञु पत्नी॑वन्तो नम॒स्यं॑ नमस्यन् रि॒रि॒क्वांस॑स्त॒न्वः॑ कृण्वत॒ स्वाः सखा॒ सख्यु॑र्नि॒मिषि॒ रक्ष॑माणाः
verses.transliteration: saṃjānānā́ úpa sīdann abhijñú  pátnīvanto namasyàṃ namasyan  ririkvā́ṃsas tanvàḥ kr̥ṇvata svā́ḥ  sákhā sákhyur nimíṣi rákṣamāṇāḥ

translation.text: Nigh they approached, one-minded, with their spouses, kneeling to him adorable paid worship. Friend finding in his own friend's eye protection, they made their own the bodies which they chastened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिः स॒प्त यद्गुह्या॑नि॒ त्वे इत्प॒दावि॑द॒न्निहि॑ता य॒ज्ञिया॑सः तेभी॑ रक्षन्ते अ॒मृतं॑ स॒जोषाः॑ प॒शूञ्च॑ स्था॒तॄञ्च॒रथं॑ च पाहि
verses.transliteration: tríḥ saptá yád gúhyāni tvé ít  padā́vidan níhitā yajñíyāsaḥ  tébhī rakṣante amŕ̥taṃ sajóṣāḥ  paśū́ñ ca sthātr̥̄́ñ caráthaṃ ca pāhi

translation.text: Soon as the holy beings had discovered the thrice-seven mystic things contained within thee, With these, one-minded., they preserve the Amrit: guard thou the life of all their plants and cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्वाँ अ॑ग्ने व॒युना॑नि क्षिती॒नां व्या॑नु॒षक्छु॒रुधो॑ जी॒वसे॑ धाः अ॒न्त॒र्वि॒द्वाँ अध्व॑नो देव॒याना॒नत॑न्द्रो दू॒तो अ॑भवो हवि॒र्वाट्
verses.transliteration: vidvā́m̐ agne vayúnāni kṣitīnā́ṃ  vy ā̀nuṣák churúdho jīváse dhāḥ  antarvidvā́m̐ ádhvano devayā́nān  átandro dūtó abhavo havirvā́ṭ

translation.text: Thou, Agni, knower of men's works, hast sent us good food in constant course for our subsistence: Thou deeply skilled in paths of Gods becamest an envoy never wearied, offeringbearer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒ध्यो॑ दि॒व आ स॒प्त य॒ह्वी रा॒यो दुरो॒ व्यृ॑त॒ज्ञा अ॑जानन् वि॒दद्गव्यं॑ स॒रमा॑ दृ॒ळ्हमू॒र्वं येना॒ नु कं॒ मानु॑षी॒ भोज॑ते॒ विट्
verses.transliteration: svādhyò divá ā́ saptá yahvī́ḥ-  rāyó dúro vy r̥̀tajñā́ ajānan  vidád gávyaṃ sarámā dr̥ḷhám ūrváṃ  yénā nú kam mā́nuṣī bhójate víṭ
