translation.text: Knowing the Law, the seven strong floods from heaven, full of good thought, discerned the doors of riches. Saramâ found the cattle's firm-built prison whereby the race of man is still supported.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ये विश्वा॑ स्वप॒त्यानि॑ त॒स्थुः कृ॑ण्वा॒नासो॑ अमृत॒त्वाय॑ गा॒तुम् म॒ह्ना म॒हद्भिः॑ पृथि॒वी वि त॑स्थे मा॒ता पु॒त्रैरदि॑ति॒र्धाय॑से॒ वेः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yé víśvā svapatyā́ni tasthúḥ  kr̥ṇvānā́so amr̥tatvā́ya gātúm  mahnā́ mahádbhiḥ pr̥thivī́ ví tasthe  mātā́ putraír áditir dhā́yase véḥ

translation.text: They who approached all noble operations making a path that leads to life immortal, To be the Bird's support, the spacious mother, Aditi, and her great Sons stood in power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॒ श्रियं॒ नि द॑धु॒श्चारु॑मस्मिन्दि॒वो यद॒क्षी अ॒मृता॒ अकृ॑ण्वन् अध॑ क्षरन्ति॒ सिन्ध॑वो॒ न सृ॒ष्टाः प्र नीची॑रग्ने॒ अरु॑षीरजानन्
verses.transliteration: ádhi śríyaṃ ní dadhuś cā́rum asmin  divó yád akṣī́ amŕ̥tā ákr̥ṇvan  ádha kṣaranti síndhavo ná sr̥ṣṭā́ḥ  prá nī́cīr agne áruṣīr ajānan

translation.text: When Gods immortal made both eyes of heaven, they gave to him the gift of beauteous glory. Now they flow forth like rivers set in motion: they knew the Red Steeds coming down, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒यिर्न यः पि॑तृवि॒त्तो व॑यो॒धाः सु॒प्रणी॑तिश्चिकि॒तुषो॒ न शासुः॑ स्यो॒न॒शीरति॑थि॒र्न प्री॑णा॒नो होते॑व॒ सद्म॑ विध॒तो वि ता॑रीत्
verses.transliteration: rayír ná yáḥ pitr̥vittó vayodhā́ḥ  supráṇītiś cikitúṣo ná śā́suḥ  syonaśī́r átithir ná prīṇānó  hóteva sádma vidható ví tārīt

translation.text: HE who gives food, like patrimonial riches and guides aright like some wise man's instruction, Loved like a guest who lies in pleasant lodging, – may he, as Priest, prosper his servant's dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वो न यः स॑वि॒ता स॒त्यम॑न्मा॒ क्रत्वा॑ नि॒पाति॑ वृ॒जना॑नि॒ विश्वा॑ पु॒रु॒प्र॒श॒स्तो अ॒मति॒र्न स॒त्य आ॒त्मेव॒ शेवो॑ दिधि॒षाय्यो॑ भूत्
verses.transliteration: devó ná yáḥ savitā́ satyámanmā  krátvā nipā́ti vr̥jánāni víśvā  purupraśastó amátir ná satyáḥ-  ātméva śévo didhiṣā́yyo bhūt

translation.text: He who like Savitar the God, true-minded protecteth with his power. all acts of vigour, Truthful, like splendourr, glorified by many, like breath joy-giving,– all must strive to win him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वो न यः पृ॑थि॒वीं वि॒श्वधा॑या उप॒क्षेति॑ हि॒तमि॑त्रो॒ न राजा॑ पु॒रः॒सदः॑ शर्म॒सदो॒ न वी॒रा अ॑नव॒द्या पति॑जुष्टेव॒ नारी॑
verses.transliteration: devó ná yáḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ viśvádhāyāḥ-  upakṣéti hitámitro ná rā́jā  puraḥsádaḥ śarmasádo ná vīrā́ḥ-  anavadyā́ pátijuṣṭeva nā́rī

translation.text: He who on earth dwells like a king surrounded by faithful friends, like a God all-sustaining, Like heroes who preside, who sit in safety: like as a blameless dame dear to her husband.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॒ नरो॒ दम॒ आ नित्य॑मि॒द्धमग्ने॒ सच॑न्त क्षि॒तिषु॑ ध्रु॒वासु॑ अधि॑ द्यु॒म्नं नि द॑धु॒र्भूर्य॑स्मि॒न्भवा॑ वि॒श्वायु॑र्ध॒रुणो॑ रयी॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā náro dáma ā́ nítyam iddhám  ágne sácanta kṣitíṣu dhruvā́su  ádhi dyumnáṃ ní dadhur bhū́ry asmin  bhávā viśvā́yur dharúṇo rayīṇā́m

translation.text: Thee, such, in settlements secure, O Agni, our men serve ever kindled in each dwelling. On him have they laid splendour in abundance: dear to all men, bearer be he of riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि पृक्षो॑ अग्ने म॒घवा॑नो अश्यु॒र्वि सू॒रयो॒ दद॑तो॒ विश्व॒मायुः॑ स॒नेम॒ वाजं॑ समि॒थेष्व॒र्यो भा॒गं दे॒वेषु॒ श्रव॑से॒ दधा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: ví pŕ̥kṣo agne maghávāno aśyur  ví sūráyo dádato víśvam ā́yuḥ  sanéma vā́jaṃ samithéṣv aryó  bhāgáṃ devéṣu śrávase dádhānāḥ

translation.text: May thy rich worshippers win food, O Agni, and princes gain long life who bring oblation. May we get booty from jur foe in battle, presenting to the Gods their share for glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॒ हि धे॒नवो॑ वावशा॒नाः स्मदू॑ध्नीः पी॒पय॑न्त॒ द्युभ॑क्ताः प॒रा॒वतः॑ सुम॒तिं भिक्ष॑माणा॒ वि सिन्ध॑वः स॒मया॑ सस्रु॒रद्रि॑म्
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya hí dhenávo vāvaśānā́ḥ  smádūdhnīḥ pīpáyanta dyúbhaktāḥ  parāvátaḥ sumatím bhíkṣamāṇāḥ-  ví síndhavaḥ samáyā sasrur ádrim

translation.text: The cows of holy law, sent us by Heaven, have swelled with laden udders, loudly lowing; Soliciting his favour, from a distance the rivers to the rock have flowed together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे अ॑ग्ने सुम॒तिं भिक्ष॑माणा दि॒वि श्रवो॑ दधिरे य॒ज्ञिया॑सः नक्ता॑ च च॒क्रुरु॒षसा॒ विरू॑पे कृ॒ष्णं च॒ वर्ण॑मरु॒णं च॒ सं धुः॑
verses.transliteration: tvé agne sumatím bhíkṣamāṇāḥ-  diví śrávo dadhire yajñíyāsaḥ  náktā ca cakrúr uṣásā vírūpe  kr̥ṣṇáṃ ca várṇam aruṇáṃ ca sáṃ dhuḥ

translation.text: Agni, with thee, soliciting thy favour, the holy Ones have gained glory in heaven. They made the Night and Dawn of different colours, and set the black and purple hues together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यान्रा॒ये मर्ता॒न्त्सुषू॑दो अग्ने॒ ते स्या॑म म॒घवा॑नो व॒यं च॑ छा॒येव॒ विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं सिसक्ष्यापप्रि॒वान्रोद॑सी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षम्
verses.transliteration: yā́n rāyé mártān súṣūdo agne  té syāma maghávāno vayáṃ ca  chāyéva víśvam bhúvanaṃ sisakṣi-  āpaprivā́n ródasī antárikṣam

translation.text: May we and those who worship be the mortals whom thou, O Agni, leadest on to riches. Thou hast filled earth and heaven and air's mid-region, and followest the whole world like a shadow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्व॑द्भिरग्ने॒ अर्व॑तो॒ नृभि॒र्नॄन्वी॒रैर्वी॒रान्व॑नुयामा॒ त्वोताः॑ ई॒शा॒नासः॑ पितृवि॒त्तस्य॑ रा॒यो वि सू॒रयः॑ श॒तहि॑मा नो अश्युः
verses.transliteration: árvadbhir agne árvato nŕ̥bhir nr̥̄́n  vīraír vīrā́n vanuyāmā tvótāḥ  īśānā́saḥ pitr̥vittásya rāyó  ví sūráyaḥ śatáhimā no aśyuḥ

translation.text: Aided by thee, O Agni, may we conquer steeds with steeds, men with men, heroes with heroes, Lords of the wealth transmitted by our fathers: and may our princes live a hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता ते॑ अग्न उ॒चथा॑नि वेधो॒ जुष्टा॑नि सन्तु॒ मन॑से हृ॒दे च॑ श॒केम॑ रा॒यः सु॒धुरो॒ यमं॒ तेऽधि॒ श्रवो॑ दे॒वभ॑क्तं॒ दधा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: etā́ te agna ucáthāni vedho  júṣṭāni santu mánase hr̥dé ca  śakéma rāyáḥ sudhúro yámaṃ te-  -ádhi śrávo devábhaktaṃ dádhānāḥ

translation.text: May these our hymns of praise, Agni, Ordainer, be pleasant to thee in thy heart and spirit. May we have power to hold thy steeds of riches, laying on thee the God-sent gift of glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒प॒प्र॒यन्तो॑ अध्व॒रं मन्त्रं॑ वोचेमा॒ग्नये॑ आ॒रे अ॒स्मे च॑ शृण्व॒ते
verses.transliteration: upaprayánto adhvarám  mántraṃ vocemāgnáye  āré asmé ca śr̥ṇvaté

translation.text: As forth to sacrifice we go, a hymn to a hymn let us say, Who hears us even when afar;

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः स्नीहि॑तीषु पू॒र्व्यः सं॑जग्मा॒नासु॑ कृ॒ष्टिषु॑ अर॑क्षद्दा॒शुषे॒ गय॑म्
verses.transliteration: yáḥ snī́hitīṣu pūrvyáḥ  saṃjagmānā́su kr̥ṣṭíṣu  árakṣad dāśúṣe gáyam

translation.text: Who, from of old, in carnage, when the people gathered, hath preserved His household for the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त ब्रु॑वन्तु ज॒न्तव॒ उद॒ग्निर्वृ॑त्र॒हाज॑नि ध॒नं॒ज॒यो रणे॑रणे
verses.transliteration: utá bruvantu jantávaḥ-  úd agnír vr̥trahā́jani  dhanaṃjayó ráṇe-raṇe

translation.text: And let men say, Agni is born, e'en he who slayeth Vr̥itra, he Who winneth wealth in every fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ दू॒तो असि॒ क्षये॒ वेषि॑ ह॒व्यानि॑ वी॒तये॑ द॒स्मत्कृ॒णोष्य॑ध्व॒रम्
verses.transliteration: yásya dūtó ási kṣáye  véṣi havyā́ni vītáye  dasmát kr̥ṇóṣy adhvarám

translation.text: Him in whose house an envoy thou lovest to taste his offered gifts, And strengthenest his sacrifice,

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमित्सु॑ह॒व्यम॑ङ्गिरः सुदे॒वं स॑हसो यहो जना॑ आहुः सुब॒र्हिष॑म्
verses.transliteration: tám ít suhavyám aṅgiraḥ  sudeváṃ sahaso yaho  jánā āhuḥ subarhíṣam

translation.text: Him, Angiras, thou Son of Strength, all men call happy in his God, His offerings, and his sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ च॒ वहा॑सि॒ ताँ इ॒ह दे॒वाँ उप॒ प्रश॑स्तये ह॒व्या सु॑श्चन्द्र वी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ ca váhāsi tā́m̐ ihá  devā́m̐ úpa práśastaye  havyā́ suścandra vītáye

translation.text: Hitherward shalt thou bring these Gods to our laudation and to taste. These offered gifts, fair-shining One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न योरु॑प॒ब्दिरश्व्यः॑ शृ॒ण्वे रथ॑स्य॒ कच्च॒न यद॑ग्ने॒ यासि॑ दू॒त्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ná yór upabdír áśvyaḥ  śr̥ṇvé ráthasya kác caná  yád agne yā́si dūtyàm

translation.text: When, Agni, on thine embassage thou goest not a sound is heard of steed or straining of thy car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वोतो॑ वा॒ज्यह्र॑यो॒ऽभि पूर्व॑स्मा॒दप॑रः प्र दा॒श्वाँ अ॑ग्ने अस्थात्
verses.transliteration: tvóto vājy áhrayo  -abhí pū́rvasmād áparaḥ  prá dāśvā́m̐ agne asthāt

translation.text: Aided by thee uninjured, strong, one after other, goes he forth: Agni, the ofterer forward steps.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त द्यु॒मत्सु॒वीर्यं॑ बृ॒हद॑ग्ने विवाससि दे॒वेभ्यो॑ देव दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: utá dyumát suvī́ryam  br̥hád agne vivāsasi  devébhyo deva dāśúṣe

translation.text: And splendid strength, heroic, high, Agni, thou grantest from the Gods, Thou God, to him who offers gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जु॒षस्व॑ स॒प्रथ॑स्तमं॒ वचो॑ दे॒वप्स॑रस्तमम् ह॒व्या जुह्वा॑न आ॒सनि॑
verses.transliteration: juṣásva sapráthastamaṃ  váco devápsarastamam  havyā́ júhvāna āsáni

translation.text: ACCEPT our loudest-sounding hymn, food most delightful to the Gods, Pouring our offerings in thy mouth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अथा॑ ते अङ्गिरस्त॒माग्ने॑ वेधस्तम प्रि॒यम् वो॒चेम॒ ब्रह्म॑ सान॒सि
verses.transliteration: áthā te aṅgirastama-  -ágne vedhastama priyám  vocéma bráhma sānasí

translation.text: Now, Agni, will we say to thee, O wisest and best Afigiras, Our precious, much-availing prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कस्ते॑ जा॒मिर्जना॑ना॒मग्ने॒ को दा॒श्व॑ध्वरः को ह॒ कस्मि॑न्नसि श्रि॒तः
verses.transliteration: kás te jāmír jánānām  ágne kó dāśvàdhvaraḥ  kó ha kásminn asi śritáḥ

translation.text: Who, Agni, is thy kin, of men? who is thy worthy worshipper? On whom dependent? who art thou?

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं जा॒मिर्जना॑ना॒मग्ने॑ मि॒त्रो अ॑सि प्रि॒यः सखा॒ सखि॑भ्य॒ ईड्यः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ jāmír jánānām  ágne mitró asi priyáḥ  sákhā sákhibhya ī́ḍyaḥ

translation.text: The kinsman, Agni, of mankind, their well beloved Friend art thou, A Friend whom friends may supplicate.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यजा॑ नो मि॒त्रावरु॑णा॒ यजा॑ दे॒वाँ ऋ॒तं बृ॒हत् अग्ने॒ यक्षि॒ स्वं दम॑म्
verses.transliteration: yájā no mitrā́váruṇā  yájā devā́m̐ r̥tám br̥hát  ágne yákṣi sváṃ dámam

translation.text: Bring to us Mitra, Varuṇa, bring the Gods to mighty sacrifice. Bring them, O Agni, to thine home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: का त॒ उपे॑ति॒र्मन॑सो॒ वरा॑य॒ भुव॑दग्ने॒ शंत॑मा॒ का म॑नी॒षा को वा॑ य॒ज्ञैः परि॒ दक्षं॑ त आप॒ केन॑ वा ते॒ मन॑सा दाशेम
verses.transliteration: kā́ ta úpetir mánaso várāya  bhúvad agne śáṃtamā kā́ manīṣā́  kó vā yajñaíḥ pári dákṣaṃ ta āpa  kéna vā te mánasā dāśema

translation.text: How may the mind draw nigh to please thee, Agni? What hymn of praise shall bring us greatest blessing? Or who hath gained thy power by sacrifices? or with what mind shall we bring thee oblations?

verses.sanskrit_deva: एह्य॑ग्न इ॒ह होता॒ नि षी॒दाद॑ब्धः॒ सु पु॑रए॒ता भ॑वा नः अव॑तां त्वा॒ रोद॑सी विश्वमि॒न्वे यजा॑ म॒हे सौ॑मन॒साय॑ दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: éhy agna ihá hótā ní ṣīda-  -ádabdhaḥ sú puraetā́ bhavā naḥ  ávatāṃ tvā ródasī viśvaminvé  yájā mahé saumanasā́ya devā́n

translation.text: Come hither, Agni; sit thee down as Hotar; be thou who never wast deceived our leader. May Heaven and Earth, the all-pervading, love thee: worship the Gods to win for us their favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सु विश्वा॑न्र॒क्षसो॒ धक्ष्य॑ग्ने॒ भवा॑ य॒ज्ञाना॑मभिशस्ति॒पावा॑ अथा व॑ह॒ सोम॑पतिं॒ हरि॑भ्यामाति॒थ्यम॑स्मै चकृमा सु॒दाव्ने॑
verses.transliteration: prá sú víśvān rakṣáso dhákṣy agne  bhávā yajñā́nām abhiśastipā́vā  áthā́ vaha sómapatiṃ háribhyām  ātithyám asmai cakr̥mā sudā́vne

translation.text: Burn thou up all the Riksasas, O Agni; ward thou off curses from our sacrifices. Bring hither with his Bays the Lord of Soma: here is glad welcome for the Bounteous Giver.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒जाव॑ता॒ वच॑सा॒ वह्नि॑रा॒सा च॑ हु॒वे नि च॑ सत्सी॒ह दे॒वैः वेषि॑ हो॒त्रमु॒त पो॒त्रं य॑जत्र बो॒धि प्र॑यन्तर्जनित॒र्वसू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: prajā́vatā vácasā váhnir āsā́-  -ā́ ca huvé ní ca satsīhá devaíḥ  véṣi hotrám utá potráṃ yajatra  bodhí prayantar janitar vásūnām

translation.text: Thou Priest with lip and voice that bring us children hast been invoked. Here with the Gods be seated. Thine is the task of Cleanser and Presenter: waken us, Wealth-bestower and Producer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॒ विप्र॑स्य॒ मनु॑षो ह॒विर्भि॑र्दे॒वाँ अय॑जः क॒विभिः॑ क॒विः सन् ए॒वा हो॑तः सत्यतर॒ त्वम॒द्याग्ने॑ म॒न्द्रया॑ जु॒ह्वा॑ यजस्व
verses.transliteration: yáthā víprasya mánuṣo havírbhir  devā́m̐ áyajaḥ kavíbhiḥ kavíḥ sán  evā́ hotaḥ satyatara tvám adyá-  -ágne mandráyā juhvā̀ yajasva

translation.text: As with oblations of the priestly Manus thou worshippedst the Gods, a Sage with sages, So now, O truthfullest Invoker Agni, worship this day with joy-bestowing ladle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒था दा॑शेमा॒ग्नये॒ कास्मै॑ दे॒वजु॑ष्टोच्यते भा॒मिने॒ गीः यो मर्त्ये॑ष्व॒मृत॑ ऋ॒तावा॒ होता॒ यजि॑ष्ठ॒ इत्कृ॒णोति॑ दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: kathā́ dāśemāgnáye kā́smai  devájuṣṭocyate bhāmíne gī́ḥ  yó mártyeṣv amŕ̥ta r̥tā́vā  hótā yájiṣṭha ít kr̥ṇóti devā́n

translation.text: How shall we pay oblation unto Agni? What hymn, Godloved, is said to him refulgent? Who, deathless, true to Law, mid men a herald, bringeth the Gods as best of sacrificers?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॑ध्व॒रेषु॒ शंत॑म ऋ॒तावा॒ होता॒ तमू॒ नमो॑भि॒रा कृ॑णुध्वम् अ॒ग्निर्यद्वेर्मर्ता॑य दे॒वान्त्स चा॒ बोधा॑ति॒ मन॑सा यजाति
verses.transliteration: yó adhvaréṣu śáṃtama r̥tā́vā  hótā tám ū námobhir ā́ kr̥ṇudhvam  agnír yád vér mártāya devā́n  sá cā bódhāti mánasā yajāti

translation.text: Bring him with reverence hither, most propitious in sacrifices, true to Law, the herald; For Agni, when he seeks the Gods for mortals, knows them full well and worships them in spirit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि क्रतुः॒ स मर्यः॒ स सा॒धुर्मि॒त्रो न भू॒दद्भु॑तस्य र॒थीः तं मेधे॑षु प्रथ॒मं दे॑व॒यन्ती॒र्विश॒ उप॑ ब्रुवते द॒स्ममारीः॑
verses.transliteration: sá hí krátuḥ sá máryaḥ sá sādhúr  mitró ná bhūd ádbhutasya rathī́ḥ  tám médheṣu prathamáṃ devayántīr  víśa úpa bruvate dasmám ā́rīḥ

translation.text: For he is mental power, a man, and perfect; he is the bringer, friend-,like, of the wondrous. The pious Aryan tribes at sacrifices address them first to him who doeth marvels.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ नृ॒णां नृत॑मो रि॒शादा॑ अ॒ग्निर्गिरोऽव॑सा वेतु धी॒तिम् तना॑ च॒ ये म॒घवा॑नः॒ शवि॑ष्ठा॒ वाज॑प्रसूता इ॒षय॑न्त॒ मन्म॑
verses.transliteration: sá no nr̥ṇā́ṃ nŕ̥tamo riśā́dāḥ-  agnír gíró 'vasā vetu dhītím  tánā ca yé maghávānaḥ śáviṣṭhāḥ-  vā́japrasūtā iṣáyanta mánma

translation.text: May Agni, foe-destroyer, manliest Hero, accept with love our hymns and our devotion. So may the liberal lords whose strength is strongest, urged by their riches, stir our thoughts with vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वाग्निर्गोत॑मेभिर्ऋ॒तावा॒ विप्रे॑भिरस्तोष्ट जा॒तवे॑दाः स ए॑षु द्यु॒म्नं पी॑पय॒त्स वाजं॒ स पु॒ष्टिं या॑ति॒ जोष॒मा चि॑कि॒त्वान्
verses.transliteration: evā́gnír gótamebhir r̥tā́vā  víprebhir astoṣṭa jātávedāḥ  sá eṣu dyumnám pīpayat sá vā́jaṃ  sá puṣṭíṃ yāti jóṣam ā́ cikitvā́n

translation.text: Thus Agni Jâtavedas, true to Order, hath by the priestly Gotamas been lauded. May he augment in them splendour and vigour: observant, as he lists, he gathers increase.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्वा॒ गोत॑मा गि॒रा जात॑वेदो॒ विच॑र्षणे द्यु॒म्नैर॒भि प्र णो॑नुमः
verses.transliteration: abhí tvā gótamā girā́  jā́tavedo vícarṣaṇe  dyumnaír abhí prá ṇonumaḥ

translation.text: O JâtavEDAS, keen and swift, we Gotamas with sacred song exalt thee for thy glories' sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ त्वा॒ गोत॑मो गि॒रा रा॒यस्का॑मो दुवस्यति द्यु॒म्नैर॒भि प्र णो॑नुमः
verses.transliteration: tám u tvā gótamo girā́  rāyáskāmo duvasyati  dyumnaír abhí prá ṇonumaḥ

translation.text: Thee, as thou art, desiring wealth Gotama worships with his song: We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ त्वा वाज॒सात॑ममङ्गिर॒स्वद्ध॑वामहे द्यु॒म्नैर॒भि प्र णो॑नुमः
verses.transliteration: tám u tvā vājasā́tamam  aṅgirasvád dhavāmahe  dyumnaír abhí prá ṇonumaḥ

translation.text: As such, like Angiras we call on thee best winner of the spoil: We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ त्वा वृत्र॒हन्त॑मं॒ यो दस्यूँ॑रवधूनु॒षे द्यु॒म्नैर॒भि प्र णो॑नुमः
verses.transliteration: tám u tvā vr̥trahántamaṃ  yó dásyūm̐r avadhūnuṣé  dyumnaír abhí prá ṇonumaḥ

translation.text: Thee, best of Vr̥itra-slayers, thee who shakest off our Dasyu foes: We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवो॑चाम॒ रहू॑गणा अ॒ग्नये॒ मधु॑म॒द्वचः॑ द्यु॒म्नैर॒भि प्र णो॑नुमः
verses.transliteration: ávocāma ráhūgaṇāḥ-  agnáye mádhumad vácaḥ  dyumnaír abhí prá ṇonumaḥ

translation.text: A pleasant song to Agni we, sons of Rahûgaṇa, have sung: We laud thee for thy glories' sake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यकेशो॒ रज॑सो विसा॒रेऽहि॒र्धुनि॒र्वात॑ इव॒ ध्रजी॑मान् शुचि॑भ्राजा उ॒षसो॒ नवे॑दा॒ यश॑स्वतीरप॒स्युवो॒ न स॒त्याः
verses.transliteration: híraṇyakeśo rájaso visāré  -áhir dhúnir vā́ta iva dhrájīmān  śúcibhrājā uṣáso návedāḥ-  yáśasvatīr apasyúvo ná satyā́ḥ

translation.text: HE in mid-air's expanse hath golden tresses; a raging serpent, like the rushing tempest: Purely refulgent, knowing well the morn. ing; like honourable dames, true, active workers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॑ सुप॒र्णा अ॑मिनन्तँ॒ एवैः॑ कृ॒ष्णो नो॑नाव वृष॒भो यदी॒दम् शि॒वाभि॒र्न स्मय॑मानाभि॒रागा॒त्पत॑न्ति॒ मिहः॑ स्त॒नय॑न्त्य॒भ्रा
verses.transliteration: ā́ te suparṇā́ aminantam̐ évaiḥ  kr̥ṣṇó nonāva vr̥ṣabhó yádīdám  śivā́bhir ná smáyamānābhir ā́gāt  pátanti míha stanáyanty abhrā́

translation.text: Thy well-winged flashes strengthen in their manner, when the black Bull hath bellowed round about us. With drops that bless and seem to smile he cometh: the waters fall, the clouds utter their thunder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदी॑मृ॒तस्य॒ पय॑सा॒ पिया॑नो॒ नय॑न्नृ॒तस्य॑ प॒थिभी॒ रजि॑ष्ठैः अ॒र्य॒मा मि॒त्रो वरु॑णः॒ परि॑ज्मा॒ त्वचं॑ पृञ्च॒न्त्युप॑रस्य॒ योनौ॑
verses.transliteration: yád īm r̥tásya páyasā píyāno  náyann r̥tásya pathíbhī rájiṣṭhaiḥ  aryamā́ mitró váruṇaḥ párijmā  tvácam pr̥ñcanty úparasya yónau

translation.text: When he comes streaming with the milk of worship, conducting by directest paths of Order Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa, Parijman fill the hide full where lies the nether press-stone.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ वाज॑स्य॒ गोम॑त॒ ईशा॑नः सहसो यहो अ॒स्मे धे॑हि जातवेदो॒ महि॒ श्रवः॑
verses.transliteration: ágne vā́jasya gómataḥ-  ī́śānaḥ sahaso yaho  asmé dhehi jātavedo máhi śrávaḥ

translation.text: O Agni, thou who art the lord of wealth in kine, thou Son of Strength, Vouchsafe to us, O Jâtavetlas, high renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इ॑धा॒नो वसु॑ष्क॒विर॒ग्निरी॒ळेन्यो॑ गि॒रा रे॒वद॒स्मभ्यं॑ पुर्वणीक दीदिहि
verses.transliteration: sá idhānó vásuṣ kavír  agnír īḷényo girā́  revád asmábhyam purvaṇīka dīdihi

translation.text: He, Agni, kindled, good and wise, must be exalted in our song: Shine, thou of many forms, shine radiantly on us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्ष॒पो रा॑जन्नु॒त त्मनाग्ने॒ वस्तो॑रु॒तोषसः॑ स ति॑ग्मजम्भ र॒क्षसो॑ दह॒ प्रति॑
verses.transliteration: kṣapó rājann utá tmánā-  -ágne vástor utóṣásaḥ  sá tigmajambha rakṣáso daha práti

translation.text: O Agni, shining of thyself by night and when the morning breaks, Burn, thou whose teeth are sharp, against the Raksasas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवा॑ नो अग्न ऊ॒तिभि॑र्गाय॒त्रस्य॒ प्रभ॑र्मणि विश्वा॑सु धी॒षु व॑न्द्य
verses.transliteration: ávā no agna ūtíbhir  gāyatrásya prábharmaṇi  víśvāsu dhīṣú vandya

translation.text: Adorable in all our rites, favour us, Agni, with thine.aid, When the great hymn is chanted forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ अग्ने र॒यिं भ॑र सत्रा॒साहं॒ वरे॑ण्यम् विश्वा॑सु पृ॒त्सु दु॒ष्टर॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no agne rayím bhara  satrāsā́haṃ váreṇyam  víśvāsu pr̥tsú duṣṭáram

translation.text: Bring to us ever-conquering wealth, wealth, Agni, worthy of our choice, In all our frays invincible.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ अग्ने सुचे॒तुना॑ र॒यिं वि॒श्वायु॑पोषसम् मा॒र्डी॒कं धे॑हि जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ no agne sucetúnā  rayíṃ viśvā́yupoṣasam  mārḍīkáṃ dhehi jīváse

translation.text: Give us, O Agni, through thy grace wealth that supporteth all our life, Thy favour so that we may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र पू॒तास्ति॒ग्मशो॑चिषे॒ वाचो॑ गोतमा॒ग्नये॑ भर॑स्व सुम्न॒युर्गिरः॑
verses.transliteration: prá pūtā́s tigmáśociṣe  vā́co gotamāgnáye  bhárasva sumnayúr gíraḥ

translation.text: O Gotama, desiring bliss present thy songs composed with care To Agni of the pointed flames.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो नो॑ अग्नेऽभि॒दास॒त्यन्ति॑ दू॒रे प॑दी॒ष्ट सः अ॒स्माक॒मिद्वृ॒धे भ॑व
verses.transliteration: yó no agne 'bhidā́sati-  ánti dūré padīṣṭá sáḥ  asmā́kam íd vr̥dhé bhava

translation.text: May the man fall, O Agni, who near or afar assaileth us: Do thou increase and prosper us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒ह॒स्रा॒क्षो विच॑र्षणिर॒ग्नी रक्षां॑सि सेधति होता॑ गृणीत उ॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: sahasrākṣó vícarṣaṇir  agnī́ rákṣāṃsi sedhati  hótā gr̥ṇīta ukthyàḥ

translation.text: Keen and swift Agni, thousand-eyed, chaseth the Raksasas afar: He singeth, herald meet for lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒त्था हि सोम॒ इन्मदे॑ ब्र॒ह्मा च॒कार॒ वर्ध॑नम् शवि॑ष्ठ वज्रि॒न्नोज॑सा पृथि॒व्या निः श॑शा॒ अहि॒मर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: itthā́ hí sóma ín máde  brahmā́ cakā́ra várdhanam  śáviṣṭha vajrinn ójasā  pr̥thivyā́ níḥ śaśā áhim  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: THUS in the Soma, in wild joy the Brahman hath exalted thee: Thou, mightiest It thunder-armed, hast driven by force he Dragon from the earth, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स त्वा॑मद॒द्वृषा॒ मदः॒ सोमः॑ श्ये॒नाभृ॑तः सु॒तः येना॑ वृ॒त्रं निर॒द्भ्यो ज॒घन्थ॑ वज्रि॒न्नोज॒सार्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá tvāmadad vŕ̥ṣā mádaḥ  sómaḥ śyenā́bhr̥taḥ sutáḥ  yénā vr̥tráṃ nír adbhyó  jaghántha vajrinn ójasā́-  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: The mighty flowing Soma-draught, brought by the Hawk, hath gladdened thee, That in thy strength, O Thunderer, thou hast struck down Vr̥itra from the floods, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेह्य॒भी॑हि धृष्णु॒हि न ते॒ वज्रो॒ नि यं॑सते इन्द्र॑ नृ॒म्णं हि ते॒ शवो॒ हनो॑ वृ॒त्रं जया॑ अ॒पोऽर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: préhy abhī̀hi dhr̥ṣṇuhí  ná te vájro ní yaṃsate  índra nr̥mṇáṃ hí te śávo  háno vr̥tráṃ jáyā apó  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: Go forward, meet the foe, be bold; thy bolt of thunder is not checked. Manliness, Indra, is thy might: stay Vr̥itra, make the waters thine, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निरि॑न्द्र॒ भूम्या॒ अधि॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॑घन्थ॒ निर्दि॒वः सृ॒जा म॒रुत्व॑ती॒रव॑ जी॒वध॑न्या इ॒मा अ॒पोऽर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: nír indra bhū́myā ádhi  vr̥tráṃ jaghantha nír diváḥ  sr̥jā́ marútvatīr áva  jīvádhanyā imā́ apó  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: Thou smotest Vr̥itra from the earth, smotest him, Indra, from the sky. Let these life-fostering waters flow attended by the Marut host, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्रस्य॒ दोध॑तः॒ सानुं॒ वज्रे॑ण हीळि॒तः अ॒भि॒क्रम्याव॑ जिघ्नते॒ऽपः सर्मा॑य चो॒दय॒न्नर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: índro vr̥trásya dódhataḥ  sā́nuṃ vájreṇa hīḷitáḥ  abhikrámyā́va jighnate  -apáḥ sármāya codáyann  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: The wrathful Indra with his bolt of thunder rushing on the foe, Smote fierce on trembling Vr̥itra's back, and loosed the waters free to run, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॒ सानौ॒ नि जि॑घ्नते॒ वज्रे॑ण श॒तप॑र्वणा म॒न्दा॒न इन्द्रो॒ अन्ध॑सः॒ सखि॑भ्यो गा॒तुमि॑च्छ॒त्यर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ádhi sā́nau ní jighnate  vájreṇa śatáparvaṇā  mandāná índro ándhasaḥ  sákhibhyo gātúm ichati-  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: With hundred-jointed thunderbolt Indra hath struck him on the back, And, while rejoicing in the juice, seeketh prosperity for friends, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ तुभ्य॒मिद॑द्रि॒वोऽनु॑त्तं वज्रिन्वी॒र्य॑म् यद्ध॒ त्यं मा॒यिनं॑ मृ॒गं तमु॒ त्वं मा॒यया॑वधी॒रर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: índra túbhyam íd adrivaḥ-  -ánuttaṃ vajrin vīryàm  yád dha tyám māyínam mr̥gáṃ  tám u tvám māyáyāvadhīr  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: Indra, unconquered might is thine, Thunderer, Caster of the Stone; For thou with thy surpassing power smotest to death the guileful beast, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि ते॒ वज्रा॑सो अस्थिरन्नव॒तिं ना॒व्या॒३॒॑ अनु॑ म॒हत्त॑ इन्द्र वी॒र्यं॑ बा॒ह्वोस्ते॒ बलं॑ हि॒तमर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ví te vájrāso asthiran  navatíṃ nāvyā̀ ánu  mahát ta indra vīryàm  bāhvós te bálaṃ hitám  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: Far over ninety spacious floods thy thunderbolts were cast abroad: Great, Indra, is thy hero might, and strength is seated in thine arms, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्रं॑ सा॒कम॑र्चत॒ परि॑ ष्टोभत विंश॒तिः श॒तैन॒मन्व॑नोनवु॒रिन्द्रा॑य॒ ब्रह्मोद्य॑त॒मर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: sahásraṃ sākám arcata  pári ṣṭobhata viṃśatíḥ  śataínam ánv anonavur  índrāya bráhmódyatam  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: Laud him a thousand all at once, shout twenty forth the hymn of praise. Hundreds have sung aloud to him, to Indra hath the prayer been raised, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्रस्य॒ तवि॑षीं॒ निर॑ह॒न्त्सह॑सा॒ सहः॑ म॒हत्तद॑स्य॒ पौंस्यं॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॑घ॒न्वाँ अ॑सृज॒दर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: índro vr̥trásya táviṣīṃ  nír ahan sáhasā sáhaḥ  mahát tád asya paúṃsyaṃ  vr̥tráṃ jaghanvā́m̐ asr̥jad  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: Indra hath smitten down the power of Vr̥itra,– might with stronger might. This was his manly exploit, he slew Vr̥itra and let loose the floods, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे चि॒त्तव॑ म॒न्यवे॒ वेपे॑ते भि॒यसा॑ म॒ही यदि॑न्द्र वज्रि॒न्नोज॑सा वृ॒त्रं म॒रुत्वाँ॒ अव॑धी॒रर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: imé cit táva manyáve  vépete bhiyásā mahī́  yád indra vajrinn ójasā  vr̥trám marútvām̐ ávadhīr  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: Yea, even this great Pair of Worlds trembled in terror at thy wrath, When, Indra, Thunderer, Marut-girt, thou slewest Vr̥itra in thy strength, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न वेप॑सा॒ न त॑न्य॒तेन्द्रं॑ वृ॒त्रो वि बी॑भयत् अ॒भ्ये॑नं॒ वज्र॑ आय॒सः स॒हस्र॑भृष्टिराय॒तार्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ná vépasā ná tanyata-  -índraṃ vr̥tró ví bībhayat  abhy ènaṃ vájra āyasáḥ  sahásrabhr̥ṣṭir āyata-  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: But Vr̥itra scared not Indra with his shaking or his thunder roar. On him that iron thunderbolt fell fiercely with its thousand points, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वृ॒त्रं तव॑ चा॒शनिं॒ वज्रे॑ण स॒मयो॑धयः अहि॑मिन्द्र॒ जिघां॑सतो दि॒वि ते॑ बद्बधे॒ शवोऽर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: yád vr̥tráṃ táva cāśániṃ  vájreṇa samáyodhayaḥ  áhim indra jíghāṃsato  diví te badbadhe śávaḥ-  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: Whenwith the thunder thou didst make thy dart and Vr̥itra meet in war, Thy might, O Indra, fain to slay the Dragon, was set firm in heaven, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि॒ष्ट॒ने ते॑ अद्रिवो॒ यत्स्था जग॑च्च रेजते त्वष्टा॑ चि॒त्तव॑ म॒न्यव॒ इन्द्र॑ वेवि॒ज्यते॑ भि॒यार्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: abhiṣṭané te adrivo  yát sthā́ jágac ca rejate  tváṣṭā cit táva manyáve-  índra vevijyáte bhiyā́-  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: When at thy shout, O Thunder-armed, each thing both fixed and moving shook, E'en Tvashṭar trembled at thy wrath and quaked with fear because of thee, lauding thine own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि नु याद॑धी॒मसीन्द्रं॒ को वी॒र्या॑ प॒रः तस्मि॑न्नृ॒म्णमु॒त क्रतुं॑ दे॒वा ओजां॑सि॒ सं द॑धु॒रर्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: nahí nú yā́d adhīmási-  -índraṃ kó vīryā̀ paráḥ  tásmin nr̥mṇám utá krátuṃ  devā́ ójāṃsi sáṃ dadhur  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: There is not, in our knowledge, one who passeth Indra in his strength: In him the Deities have stored manliness, insight, power and might, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यामथ॑र्वा॒ मनु॑ष्पि॒ता द॒ध्यङ्धिय॒मत्न॑त तस्मि॒न्ब्रह्मा॑णि पू॒र्वथेन्द्र॑ उ॒क्था सम॑ग्म॒तार्च॒न्ननु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: yā́m átharvā mánuṣ pitā́  dadhyáṅ dhíyam átnata  tásmin bráhmāṇi pūrvátha-  -índra ukthā́ sám agmata-  árcann ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: Still as of old, whatever rite Atharvan, Manus sire of all, Dadhyach performed, their prayer and praise united in that Indra meet, lauding his own imperial sway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒ मदा॑य वावृधे॒ शव॑से वृत्र॒हा नृभिः॑ तमिन्म॒हत्स्वा॒जिषू॒तेमर्भे॑ हवामहे॒ स वाजे॑षु॒ प्र नो॑ऽविषत्
verses.transliteration: índro mádāya vāvr̥dhe  śávase vr̥trahā́ nŕ̥bhiḥ  tám ín mahátsv ājíṣu-  -utém árbhe havāmahe  sá vā́jeṣu prá no 'viṣat

translation.text: THE men have lifted Indra up, the Vr̥itra slayer, to joy and strength: Him, verily, we invocate in battles whether great or small: be he our aid in deeds of might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असि॒ हि वी॑र॒ सेन्योऽसि॒ भूरि॑ पराद॒दिः असि॑ द॒भ्रस्य॑ चिद्वृ॒धो यज॑मानाय शिक्षसि सुन्व॒ते भूरि॑ ते॒ वसु॑
verses.transliteration: ási hí vīra sényaḥ-  -ási bhū́ri parādadíḥ  ási dabhrásya cid vr̥dhó  yájamānāya śikṣasi  sunvaté bhū́ri te vásu

translation.text: Thou, Hero, art a warrior, thou art giver of abundant spoil. Strengthening e'en the feeble, thou aidest the sacrificer, thou givest the offerer ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदु॒दीर॑त आ॒जयो॑ धृ॒ष्णवे॑ धीयते॒ धना॑ यु॒क्ष्वा म॑द॒च्युता॒ हरी॒ कं हनः॒ कं वसौ॑ दधो॒ऽस्माँ इ॑न्द्र॒ वसौ॑ दधः
verses.transliteration: yád udī́rata ājáyo  dhr̥ṣṇáve dhīyate dhánā  yukṣvā́ madacyútā hárī  káṃ hánaḥ káṃ vásau dadho  -asmā́m̐ indra vásau dadhaḥ

translation.text: When war and battles are on foot, booty is laid before the bold. Yoke thou thy wildly-rushing Bays. Whom wilt thou slay and whom enrich? Do thou, O Indra, make us rich.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्रत्वा॑ म॒हाँ अ॑नुष्व॒धं भी॒म आ वा॑वृधे॒ शवः॑ श्रि॒य ऋ॒ष्व उ॑पा॒कयो॒र्नि शि॒प्री हरि॑वान्दधे॒ हस्त॑यो॒र्वज्र॑माय॒सम्
verses.transliteration: krátvā mahā́m̐ anuṣvadhám  bhīmá ā́ vāvr̥dhe śávaḥ  śriyá r̥ṣvá upākáyor  ní śiprī́ hárivān dadhe  hástayor vájram āyasám

translation.text: Mighty through wisdom, as he lists, terrible, he hath waxed in strength. Lord of Bay Steeds, strong-jawed, sublime, he in joined hands for glory's sake hath grasped his iron thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प॑प्रौ॒ पार्थि॑वं॒ रजो॑ बद्ब॒धे रो॑च॒ना दि॒वि न त्वावाँ॑ इन्द्र॒ कश्च॒न न जा॒तो न ज॑निष्य॒तेऽति॒ विश्वं॑ ववक्षिथ
verses.transliteration: ā́ paprau pā́rthivaṃ rájo  badbadhé rocanā́ diví  ná tvā́vām̐ indra káś caná  ná jātó ná janiṣyate-  -áti víśvaṃ vavakṣitha

translation.text: He filled the earthly atmosphere and pressed against the lights in heaven. None like thee ever hath been born, none, Indra, will be born like thee. Thou hast waxed mighty over all.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॒र्यो म॑र्त॒भोज॑नं परा॒ददा॑ति दा॒शुषे॑ इन्द्रो॑ अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ शिक्षतु॒ वि भ॑जा॒ भूरि॑ ते॒ वसु॑ भक्षी॒य तव॒ राध॑सः
verses.transliteration: yó aryó martabhójanam  parādádāti dāśúṣe  índro asmábhyaṃ śikṣatu  ví bhajā bhū́ri te vásu  bhakṣīyá táva rā́dhasaḥ

translation.text: May he who to the offerer gives the foeman's man-sustaining food, May Indra lend his aid to us. Deal forth-abundant is thy wealth-that in thy bounty I may share.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मदे॑मदे॒ हि नो॑ द॒दिर्यू॒था गवा॑मृजु॒क्रतुः॑ सं गृ॑भाय पु॒रू श॒तोभ॑याह॒स्त्या वसु॑ शिशी॒हि रा॒य आ भ॑र
verses.transliteration: máde-made hí no dadír  yūthā́ gávām r̥jukrátuḥ  sáṃ gr̥bhāya purū́ śatā́-  -ubhayāhastyā́ vásu  śiśīhí rāyá ā́ bhara

translation.text: He, righteous-hearted, at each time of rapture gives us herds of kine. Gather in both thy hands for us treasures of many hundred sorts. Sharpen thou us, and bring us wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा॒दय॑स्व सु॒ते सचा॒ शव॑से शूर॒ राध॑से वि॒द्मा हि त्वा॑ पुरू॒वसु॒मुप॒ कामा॑न्त्ससृ॒ज्महेऽथा॑ नोऽवि॒ता भ॑व
verses.transliteration: mādáyasva suté sácā  śávase śūra rā́dhase  vidmā́ hí tvā purūvásum  úpa kā́mān sasr̥jmáhe-  -áthā no 'vitā́ bhava

translation.text: Refresh thee, Hero, with the juice outpoured for bounty and for strength. We know thee Lord of ample store, to thee have sent our hearts' desires: be therefore our Protector thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ते त॑ इन्द्र ज॒न्तवो॒ विश्वं॑ पुष्यन्ति॒ वार्य॑म् अ॒न्तर्हि ख्यो जना॑नाम॒र्यो वेदो॒ अदा॑शुषां॒ तेषां॑ नो॒ वेद॒ आ भ॑र
verses.transliteration: eté ta indra jantávo  víśvam puṣyanti vā́ryam  antár hí khyó jánānām  aryó védo ádāśuṣāṃ  téṣāṃ no véda ā́ bhara

translation.text: These people, Indra, keep for thee all that is worthy of thy choice. Discover thou, as Lord, the wealth of men who offer up no gifts: bring thou to us this wealth of theirs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपो॒ षु शृ॑णु॒ही गिरो॒ मघ॑व॒न्मात॑था इव य॒दा नः॑ सू॒नृता॑वतः॒ कर॒ आद॒र्थया॑स॒ इद्योजा॒ न्वि॑न्द्र ते॒ हरी॑
verses.transliteration: úpo ṣú śr̥ṇuhī́ gíro  mághavan mā́tathā iva  yadā́ naḥ sūnŕ̥tāvataḥ  kára ā́d artháyāsa íd  yójā nv ìndra te hárī

translation.text: GRACIOUSLY listen to our songs, Maghavan, be not negligent. As thou hast made us full of joy and lettest us solicit thee, now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अक्ष॒न्नमी॑मदन्त॒ ह्यव॑ प्रि॒या अ॑धूषत अस्तो॑षत॒ स्वभा॑नवो॒ विप्रा॒ नवि॑ष्ठया म॒ती योजा॒ न्वि॑न्द्र ते॒ हरी॑
verses.transliteration: ákṣann ámīmadanta hí-  áva priyā́ adhūṣata  ástoṣata svábhānavo  víprā náviṣṭhayā matī́  yójā nv ìndra te hárī

translation.text: Well have they eaten and rejoiced; the friends have risen and passed away. The sages luminous in themselves have. praised thee with their latest hymn. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒सं॒दृशं॑ त्वा व॒यं मघ॑वन्वन्दिषी॒महि॑ प्र नू॒नं पू॒र्णव॑न्धुरः स्तु॒तो या॑हि॒ वशाँ॒ अनु॒ योजा॒ न्वि॑न्द्र ते॒ हरी॑
verses.transliteration: susaṃdŕ̥śaṃ tvā vayám  mághavan vandiṣīmáhi  prá nūnám pūrṇávandhuraḥ-  stutó yāhi váśām̐ ánu  yójā nv ìndra te hárī

translation.text: Maghavan, we will reverence thee who art so fair to look upon. Thus praised, according to our wish come now with richly laden car. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स घा॒ तं वृष॑णं॒ रथ॒मधि॑ तिष्ठाति गो॒विद॑म् यः पात्रं॑ हारियोज॒नं पू॒र्णमि॑न्द्र॒ चिके॑तति॒ योजा॒ न्वि॑न्द्र ते॒ हरी॑
verses.transliteration: sá ghā táṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ rátham  ádhi tiṣṭhāti govídam  yáḥ pā́traṃ hāriyojanám  pūrṇám indra cíketati  yójā nv ìndra te hárī

translation.text: He will in very truth ascend the powerful car that finds the kine, Who thinks upon the well-filled bowl, the Tawny Coursers' harnesser. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒क्तस्ते॑ अस्तु॒ दक्षि॑ण उ॒त स॒व्यः श॑तक्रतो तेन॑ जा॒यामुप॑ प्रि॒यां म॑न्दा॒नो या॒ह्यन्ध॑सो॒ योजा॒ न्वि॑न्द्र ते॒ हरी॑
verses.transliteration: yuktás te astu dákṣiṇaḥ-  utá savyáḥ śatakrato  téna jāyā́m úpa priyā́m  mandānó yāhy ándhaso  yójā nv ìndra te hárī

translation.text: Let, Lord of Hundred Powers, thy Steeds be harnessed on the right and left. Therewith in rapture of the juice, draw near to thy beloved Spouse. Now, Indra, yoke thy two Bay Steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒नज्मि॑ ते॒ ब्रह्म॑णा के॒शिना॒ हरी॒ उप॒ प्र या॑हि दधि॒षे गभ॑स्त्योः उत्त्वा॑ सु॒तासो॑ रभ॒सा अ॑मन्दिषुः पूष॒ण्वान्व॑ज्रि॒न्त्समु॒ पत्न्या॑मदः
verses.transliteration: yunájmi te bráhmaṇā keśínā hárī  úpa prá yāhi dadhiṣé gábhastyoḥ  út tvā sutā́so rabhasā́ amandiṣuḥ  pūṣaṇvā́n vajrin sám u pátnyāmadaḥ

translation.text: With holy prayer I yoke thy long-maned pair of Bays: come hitherward; thou holdest them in both thy hands. The stirring draughts of juice outpoured have made thee glad: thou, Thunderer, hast rejoiced with Pûshan and thy Spouse.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॑वति प्रथ॒मो गोषु॑ गच्छति सुप्रा॒वीरि॑न्द्र॒ मर्त्य॒स्तवो॒तिभिः॑ तमित्पृ॑णक्षि॒ वसु॑ना॒ भवी॑यसा॒ सिन्धु॒मापो॒ यथा॒भितो॒ विचे॑तसः
verses.transliteration: áśvāvati prathamó góṣu gachati  suprāvī́r indra mártyas távotíbhiḥ  tám ít pr̥ṇakṣi vásunā bhávīyasā  síndhum ā́po yáthābhíto vícetasaḥ

translation.text: INDRA, the mortal man well guarded by thine aid goes foremost in the wealth of horses and of kine. With amplest wealth thou fillest him, as round about the waters clearly seen afar fill Sindhu full.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपो॒ न दे॒वीरुप॑ यन्ति हो॒त्रिय॑म॒वः प॑श्यन्ति॒ वित॑तं॒ यथा॒ रजः॑ प्रा॒चैर्दे॒वासः॒ प्र ण॑यन्ति देव॒युं ब्र॑ह्म॒प्रियं॑ जोषयन्ते व॒रा इ॑व
verses.transliteration: ā́po ná devī́r úpa yanti hotríyam  aváḥ paśyanti vítataṃ yáthā rájaḥ  prācaír devā́saḥ prá ṇayanti devayúm  brahmapríyaṃ joṣayante varā́ iva

translation.text: The heavenly Waters come not nigh the priestly bowl: they but look down and see how far mid-air is spread: The Deities conduct the pious man to them: like suitors they delight in him who loveth prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॒ द्वयो॑रदधा उ॒क्थ्यं१॒॑ वचो॑ य॒तस्रु॑चा मिथु॒ना या स॑प॒र्यतः॑ असं॑यत्तो व्र॒ते ते॑ क्षेति॒ पुष्य॑ति भ॒द्रा श॒क्तिर्यज॑मानाय सुन्व॒ते
verses.transliteration: ádhi dváyor adadhā ukthyàṃ váco  yatásrucā mithunā́ yā́ saparyátaḥ  ásaṃyatto vraté te kṣeti púṣyati  bhadrā́ śaktír yájamānāya sunvaté

translation.text: Praiseworthy blessing hast thou laid upon the pair who with uplifted ladle serve thee, man and wife. Unchecked he dwells and prospers in thy law: thy power brings blessing to the sacrificer pouring gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदङ्गि॑राः प्रथ॒मं द॑धिरे॒ वय॑ इ॒द्धाग्न॑यः॒ शम्या॒ ये सु॑कृ॒त्यया॑ सर्वं॑ प॒णेः सम॑विन्दन्त॒ भोज॑न॒मश्वा॑वन्तं॒ गोम॑न्त॒मा प॒शुं नरः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́d áṅgirāḥ prathamáṃ dadhire váyaḥ-  iddhā́gnayaḥ śámyā yé sukr̥tyáyā  sárvam paṇéḥ sám avindanta bhójanam  áśvāvantaṃ gómantam ā́ paśúṃ náraḥ

translation.text: First the Angirases won themselves vital power, whose fires were kindled through good deeds and sacrifice. The men together found the Paṇi's hoarded wealth, the cattle, and the wealth in horses and in kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञैरथ॑र्वा प्रथ॒मः प॒थस्त॑ते॒ ततः॒ सूर्यो॑ व्रत॒पा वे॒न आज॑नि आ गा आ॑जदु॒शना॑ का॒व्यः सचा॑ य॒मस्य॑ जा॒तम॒मृतं॑ यजामहे
verses.transliteration: yajñaír átharvā prathamáḥ pathás tate  tátaḥ sū́ryo vratapā́ vená ā́jani  ā́ gā́ ājad uśánā kāvyáḥ sácā  yamásya jātám amŕ̥taṃ yajāmahe

translation.text: Atharvan first by sacrifices laid the paths then, guardian of the Law, sprang up the loving Sun. Uṣanâ Kâvya straightway hither drove the kine. Let us with offerings honour Yama's deathless birth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब॒र्हिर्वा॒ यत्स्व॑प॒त्याय॑ वृ॒ज्यते॒ऽर्को वा॒ श्लोक॑मा॒घोष॑ते दि॒वि ग्रावा॒ यत्र॒ वद॑ति का॒रुरु॒क्थ्य१॒॑स्तस्येदिन्द्रो॑ अभिपि॒त्वेषु॑ रण्यति
verses.transliteration: barhír vā yát svapatyā́ya vr̥jyáte  -arkó vā ślókam āghóṣate diví  grā́vā yátra vádati kārúr ukthyàs  tásyéd índro abhipitvéṣu raṇyati

translation.text: When sacred grass is trimmed to aid the auspicious work, or the hymn makes its voice of praise sound to the sky. Where the stone rings as'twere a singer skilled in laud, --Indra in truth delights when these come near to him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असा॑वि॒ सोम॑ इन्द्र ते॒ शवि॑ष्ठ धृष्ण॒वा ग॑हि आ त्वा॑ पृणक्त्विन्द्रि॒यं रजः॒ सूर्यो॒ न र॒श्मिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: ásāvi sóma indra te  śáviṣṭha dhr̥ṣṇav ā́ gahi  ā́ tvā pr̥ṇaktv indriyáṃ  rájaḥ sū́ryo ná raśmíbhiḥ

translation.text: The Soma hath been pressed for thee, O Indra; mightiest, bold One, come. May Indra-vigour fill thee full, as the Sun fills mid-air with rays.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒मिद्धरी॑ वह॒तोऽप्र॑तिधृष्टशवसम् ऋषी॑णां च स्तु॒तीरुप॑ य॒ज्ञं च॒ मानु॑षाणाम्
verses.transliteration: índram íd dhárī vahataḥ-  ápratidhr̥ṣṭaśavasam  ŕ̥ṣīṇāṃ ca stutī́r úpa  yajñáṃ ca mā́nuṣāṇām

translation.text: His pair of Tawny Coursers bring Indra of unresisted might Hither to R̥ishis' songs of praise and sacrifice performed by men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ति॑ष्ठ वृत्रह॒न्रथं॑ यु॒क्ता ते॒ ब्रह्म॑णा॒ हरी॑ अ॒र्वा॒चीनं॒ सु ते॒ मनो॒ ग्रावा॑ कृणोतु व॒ग्नुना॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ tiṣṭha vr̥trahan ráthaṃ  yuktā́ te bráhmaṇā hárī  arvācī́naṃ sú te máno  grā́vā kr̥ṇotu vagnúnā

translation.text: Slayer of Vr̥itra, mount thy car; thy Bay Steeds have been yoked by prayer. May, with its voice, the pressing-stone draw thine attention hitherward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ममि॑न्द्र सु॒तं पि॑ब॒ ज्येष्ठ॒मम॑र्त्यं॒ मद॑म् शु॒क्रस्य॑ त्वा॒भ्य॑क्षर॒न्धारा॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ साद॑ने
verses.transliteration: imám indra sutám piba  jyéṣṭham ámartyam mádam  śukrásya tvābhy àkṣaran  dhā́rā r̥tásya sā́dane

translation.text: This poured libation, Indra, drink, immortal, gladdening, excellent. Streams of the bright have flowed to thee here at the seat of holy Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य नू॒नम॑र्चतो॒क्थानि॑ च ब्रवीतन सु॒ता अ॑मत्सु॒रिन्द॑वो॒ ज्येष्ठं॑ नमस्यता॒ सहः॑
verses.transliteration: índrāya nūnám arcata-  -ukthā́ni ca bravītana  sutā́ amatsur índavo  jyéṣṭhaṃ namasyatā sáhaḥ

translation.text: Sing glory now to Indra, say to him your solemn eulogies. The drops poured forth have made him glad: pay reverence to his might supreme.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नकि॒ष्ट्वद्र॒थीत॑रो॒ हरी॒ यदि॑न्द्र॒ यच्छ॑से नकि॒ष्ट्वानु॑ म॒ज्मना॒ नकिः॒ स्वश्व॑ आनशे
verses.transliteration: nákiṣ ṭvád rathī́taro  hárī yád indra yáchase  nákiṣ ṭvā́nu majmánā  nákiḥ sváśva ānaśe

translation.text: When, Indra, thou dost yoke thy Steeds, there is no better charioteer: None hath surpassed thee in thy might, none with good steeds o'ertaken thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य एक॒ इद्वि॒दय॑ते॒ वसु॒ मर्ता॑य दा॒शुषे॑ ईशा॑नो॒ अप्र॑तिष्कुत॒ इन्द्रो॑ अ॒ङ्ग
verses.transliteration: yá éka íd vidáyate  vásu mártāya dāśúṣe  ī́śāno ápratiṣkutaḥ  índro aṅgá

translation.text: He who alone bestoweth on mortal man who offereth gifts, The ruler of resistless power, is Indra, sure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒दा मर्त॑मरा॒धसं॑ प॒दा क्षुम्प॑मिव स्फुरत् क॒दा नः॑ शुश्रव॒द्गिर॒ इन्द्रो॑ अ॒ङ्ग
verses.transliteration: kadā́ mártam arādhásam  padā́ kṣúmpam iva sphurat  kadā́ naḥ śuśravad gíraḥ-  índro aṅgá

translation.text: When will he trample, like a weed, the man who hath no gift for him? When, verily, will Indra hear our songs of praise?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यश्चि॒द्धि त्वा॑ ब॒हुभ्य॒ आ सु॒तावाँ॑ आ॒विवा॑सति उ॒ग्रं तत्प॑त्यते॒ शव॒ इन्द्रो॑ अ॒ङ्ग
verses.transliteration: yáś cid dhí tvā bahúbhya~ā́  sutā́vām̐ āvívāsati  ugráṃ tát patyate śávaḥ-  índro aṅgá

translation.text: He who with Soma juice prepared amid the many honours thee,– Verily Indra gains thereby tremendous might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒दोरि॒त्था वि॑षू॒वतो॒ मध्वः॑ पिबन्ति गौ॒र्यः॑ या इन्द्रे॑ण स॒याव॑री॒र्वृष्णा॒ मद॑न्ति शो॒भसे॒ वस्वी॒रनु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: svādór itthā́ viṣūváto  mádhvaḥ pibanti gauryàḥ  yā́ índreṇa sayā́varīr  vŕ̥ṣṇā mádanti śobháse  vásvīr ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: The juice of Soma thus diffused, sweet to the taste, the bright cows drink, Who for the sake of splendour close to mighty Indra's side rejoice, good in their own supremacy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता अ॑स्य पृशना॒युवः॒ सोमं॑ श्रीणन्ति॒ पृश्न॑यः प्रि॒या इन्द्र॑स्य धे॒नवो॒ वज्रं॑ हिन्वन्ति॒ साय॑कं॒ वस्वी॒रनु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: tā́ asya pr̥śanāyúvaḥ  sómaṃ śrīṇanti pŕ̥śnayaḥ  priyā́ índrasya dhenávo  vájraṃ hinvanti sā́yakaṃ  vásvīr ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: Craving his touch the dappled kine mingle the Soma with their milk. The milch-kine dear to Indra send forth his death-dealing thunderbolt, good in their own supremacy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता अ॑स्य॒ नम॑सा॒ सहः॑ सप॒र्यन्ति॒ प्रचे॑तसः व्र॒तान्य॑स्य सश्चिरे पु॒रूणि॑ पू॒र्वचि॑त्तये॒ वस्वी॒रनु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: tā́ asya námasā sáhaḥ  saparyánti prácetasaḥ  vratā́ny asya saścire  purū́ṇi pūrvácittaye  vásvīr ánu svarā́jyam

translation.text: With veneration, passing wise, honouring his victorious might, They follow close his many laws to win them due preeminence, good in their own supremacy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ दधी॒चो अ॒स्थभि॑र्वृ॒त्राण्यप्र॑तिष्कुतः ज॒घान॑ नव॒तीर्नव॑
verses.transliteration: índro dadhīcó asthábhir  vr̥trā́ṇy ápratiṣkutaḥ  jaghā́na navatī́r náva

translation.text: With bones of Dadhyac for his arms, Indra, resistless in attack, Struck nine-and-ninety Vr̥itras dead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒च्छन्नश्व॑स्य॒ यच्छिरः॒ पर्व॑ते॒ष्वप॑श्रितम् तद्वि॑दच्छर्य॒णाव॑ति
verses.transliteration: ichánn áśvasya yác chíraḥ  párvateṣv ápaśritam  tád vidac charyaṇā́vati

translation.text: He, searching for the horse's head, removed among the mountains, found At Ṣaryaṇâvân what he sought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्राह॒ गोर॑मन्वत॒ नाम॒ त्वष्टु॑रपी॒च्य॑म् इ॒त्था च॒न्द्रम॑सो गृ॒हे
verses.transliteration: átrā́ha gór amanvata  nā́ma tváṣṭur apīcyàm  itthā́ candrámaso gr̥hé

translation.text: Then verily they recognized the essential form of Tvashṭar's Bull, Here in the mansion of the Moon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को अ॒द्य यु॑ङ्क्ते धु॒रि गा ऋ॒तस्य॒ शिमी॑वतो भा॒मिनो॑ दुर्हृणा॒यून् आ॒सन्नि॑षून्हृ॒त्स्वसो॑ मयो॒भून्य ए॑षां भृ॒त्यामृ॒णध॒त्स जी॑वात्
verses.transliteration: kó adyá yuṅkte dhurí gā́ r̥tásya  śímīvato bhāmíno durhr̥ṇāyū́n  āsánniṣūn hr̥tsváso mayobhū́n  yá eṣām bhr̥tyā́m r̥ṇádhat sá jīvāt

translation.text: Who yokes to-day unto the pole of Order the strong and passionate steers of checkless spirit, With shaft-armed mouths, heart-piercing, health-bestowing? Long shall he live who richly pays their service.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क ई॑षते तु॒ज्यते॒ को बि॑भाय॒ को मं॑सते॒ सन्त॒मिन्द्रं॒ को अन्ति॑ कस्तो॒काय॒ क इभा॑यो॒त रा॒येऽधि॑ ब्रवत्त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ को जना॑य
verses.transliteration: ká īṣate tujyáte kó bibhāya  kó maṃsate sántam índraṃ kó ánti  kás tokā́ya ká íbhāyotá rāyé  -ádhi bravat tanvè kó jánāya

translation.text: Who fleeth forth? who suffereth? who feareth? Who knoweth Indra present, Indra near us? Who sendeth benediction on his offspring, his household, wealth and person, and the People?

verses.sanskrit_deva: को अ॒ग्निमी॑ट्टे ह॒विषा॑ घृ॒तेन॑ स्रु॒चा य॑जाता ऋ॒तुभि॑र्ध्रु॒वेभिः॑ कस्मै॑ दे॒वा आ व॑हाना॒शु होम॒ को मं॑सते वी॒तिहो॑त्रः सुदे॒वः
verses.transliteration: kó agním īṭṭe havíṣā ghr̥téna  srucā́ yajātā r̥túbhir dhruvébhiḥ  kásmai devā́ ā́ vahān āśú hóma  kó maṃsate vītíhotraḥ sudeváḥ

translation.text: Who with poured oil and offering honours Agni, with ladle worships at appointed seasons? To whom to the Gods bring oblation quickly? What offerer, God-favoured, knows him thoroughly?

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॒ङ्ग प्र शं॑सिषो दे॒वः श॑विष्ठ॒ मर्त्य॑म् न त्वद॒न्यो म॑घवन्नस्ति मर्डि॒तेन्द्र॒ ब्रवी॑मि ते॒ वचः॑
verses.transliteration: tvám aṅgá prá śaṃsiṣo  deváḥ śaviṣṭha mártyam  ná tvád anyó maghavann asti marḍita-  -índra brávīmi te vácaḥ

translation.text: Thou as a God, O Mightiest, verily blessest mortal man. O Maghavan, there is no comforter but thou: Indra, I speak my words to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा ते॒ राधां॑सि॒ मा त॑ ऊ॒तयो॑ वसो॒ऽस्मान्कदा॑ च॒ना द॑भन् विश्वा॑ च न उपमिमी॒हि मा॑नुष॒ वसू॑नि चर्ष॒णिभ्य॒ आ
verses.transliteration: mā́ te rā́dhāṃsi mā́ ta ūtáyo vaso  -asmā́n kádā canā́ dabhan  víśvā ca na upamimīhí mānuṣa  vásūni carṣaṇíbhya ā́

translation.text: Let not thy bounteous gifts, let not thy saving help fail us, good Lord, at any time; And measure out to us, thou lover of mankind, all riches hitherward from men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ये शुम्भ॑न्ते॒ जन॑यो॒ न सप्त॑यो॒ याम॑न्रु॒द्रस्य॑ सू॒नवः॑ सु॒दंस॑सः रोद॑सी॒ हि म॒रुत॑श्चक्रि॒रे वृ॒धे मद॑न्ति वी॒रा वि॒दथे॑षु॒ घृष्व॑यः
verses.transliteration: prá yé śúmbhante jánayo ná sáptayo  yā́man rudrásya sūnávaḥ sudáṃsasaḥ  ródasī hí marútaś cakriré vr̥dhé  mádanti vīrā́ vidátheṣu ghŕ̥ṣvayaḥ

translation.text: THEY who are glancing forth, like women, on their way, doers of mighty deeds, swift racers, Rudra's Sons, The Maruts have made heaven and earth increase and grow: in sacrifices they delight, the strong and wild.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त उ॑क्षि॒तासो॑ महि॒मान॑माशत दि॒वि रु॒द्रासो॒ अधि॑ चक्रिरे॒ सदः॑ अर्च॑न्तो अ॒र्कं ज॒नय॑न्त इन्द्रि॒यमधि॒ श्रियो॑ दधिरे॒ पृश्नि॑मातरः
verses.transliteration: tá ukṣitā́so mahimā́nam āśata  diví rudrā́so ádhi cakrire sádaḥ  árcanto arkáṃ janáyanta indriyám  ádhi śríyo dadhire pŕ̥śnimātaraḥ

translation.text: Grown to their perfect strength greatness have they attained; the Rudras have established their abode in heaven. Singing their song of praise and generating might, they have put glory on, the Sons whom Prani bare.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोमा॑तरो॒ यच्छु॒भय॑न्ते अ॒ञ्जिभि॑स्त॒नूषु॑ शु॒भ्रा द॑धिरे वि॒रुक्म॑तः बाध॑न्ते॒ विश्व॑मभिमा॒तिन॒मप॒ वर्त्मा॑न्येषा॒मनु॑ रीयते घृ॒तम्
verses.transliteration: gómātaro yác chubháyante añjíbhis  tanū́ṣu śubhrā́ dadhire virúkmataḥ  bā́dhante víśvam abhimātínam ápa  vártmāny eṣām ánu rīyate ghr̥tám

translation.text: When, Children of the Cow, they shine in bright attire, and on their fair limbs lay their golden ornaments, They drive away each adversary from their path, and, following their traces, fatness floweth down,

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि ये भ्राज॑न्ते॒ सुम॑खास ऋ॒ष्टिभिः॑ प्रच्या॒वय॑न्तो॒ अच्यु॑ता चि॒दोज॑सा म॒नो॒जुवो॒ यन्म॑रुतो॒ रथे॒ष्वा वृष॑व्रातासः॒ पृष॑ती॒रयु॑ग्ध्वम्
verses.transliteration: ví yé bhrā́jante súmakhāsa r̥ṣṭíbhiḥ  pracyāváyanto ácyutā cid ójasā  manojúvo yán maruto rátheṣv~ā́  vŕ̥ṣavrātāsaḥ pŕ̥ṣatīr áyugdhvam

translation.text: When, mighty Warriors, ye who glitter with your spears, o'erthrowing with your strength e'en what is ne'er o'erthrown, When, O ye Maruts, ye the host that send the rain, had harnessed to your cars the thought-fleet spotted deer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यद्रथे॑षु॒ पृष॑ती॒रयु॑ग्ध्वं॒ वाजे॒ अद्रिं॑ मरुतो रं॒हय॑न्तः उ॒तारु॒षस्य॒ वि ष्य॑न्ति॒ धारा॒श्चर्मे॑वो॒दभि॒र्व्यु॑न्दन्ति॒ भूम॑
verses.transliteration: prá yád rátheṣu pŕ̥ṣatīr áyugdhvaṃ  vā́je ádrim maruto raṃháyantaḥ  utā́ruṣásya ví ṣyanti dhā́rāś  cármevodábhir vy ùndanti bhū́ma

translation.text: When ye have harnessed to your cars the spotted deer, urging the thunderbolt, O Maruts, to the fray, Forth rush the torrents of the dark red stormy cloud, and moisten, like a skin, the earth with waterfloods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वो॑ वहन्तु॒ सप्त॑यो रघु॒ष्यदो॑ रघु॒पत्वा॑नः॒ प्र जि॑गात बा॒हुभिः॑ सीद॒ता ब॒र्हिरु॒रु वः॒ सद॑स्कृ॒तं मा॒दय॑ध्वं मरुतो॒ मध्वो॒ अन्ध॑सः
verses.transliteration: ā́ vo vahantu sáptayo raghuṣyádo  raghupátvānaḥ prá jigāta bāhúbhiḥ  sī́datā́ barhír urú vaḥ sádas kr̥tám  mādáyadhvam maruto mádhvo ándhasaḥ

translation.text: Let your swift-gliding coursers bear you hitherward with their fleet pinions. Come ye forward with your arms. Sit on the grass; a wide scat hath been made for you: delight yourselves, O Maruts, in the pleasant food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते॑ऽवर्धन्त॒ स्वत॑वसो महित्व॒ना नाकं॑ त॒स्थुरु॒रु च॑क्रिरे॒ सदः॑ विष्णु॒र्यद्धाव॒द्वृष॑णं मद॒च्युतं॒ वयो॒ न सी॑द॒न्नधि॑ ब॒र्हिषि॑ प्रि॒ये
verses.transliteration: tè 'vardhanta svátavaso mahitvanā́  nā́kaṃ tasthúr urú cakrire sádaḥ  víṣṇur yád dhā́vad vŕ̥ṣaṇam madacyútaṃ  váyo ná sīdann ádhi barhíṣi priyé

translation.text: Strong in their native strength to greatness have they grown, stepped to the firmament and made their dwelling wide. When Vishṇu saved the Soma bringing wild delight, the Maruts sate like birds on their dear holy grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शूरा॑ इ॒वेद्युयु॑धयो॒ न जग्म॑यः श्रव॒स्यवो॒ न पृत॑नासु येतिरे भय॑न्ते॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना म॒रुद्भ्यो॒ राजा॑न इव त्वे॒षसं॑दृशो॒ नरः॑
verses.transliteration: śū́rā ivéd yúyudhayo ná jágmayaḥ  śravasyávo ná pŕ̥tanāsu yetire  bháyante víśvā bhúvanā marúdbhyo  rā́jāna iva tveṣásaṃdr̥śo náraḥ

translation.text: In sooth like heroes fain for fight they rush about, like combatants fame-seeking have they striven in war. Before the Maruts every creature is afraid: the men are like to Kings, terrible to behold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वष्टा॒ यद्वज्रं॒ सुकृ॑तं हिर॒ण्ययं॑ स॒हस्र॑भृष्टिं॒ स्वपा॒ अव॑र्तयत् ध॒त्त इन्द्रो॒ नर्यपां॑सि॒ कर्त॒वेऽह॑न्वृ॒त्रं निर॒पामौ॑ब्जदर्ण॒वम्
verses.transliteration: tváṣṭā yád vájraṃ súkr̥taṃ hiraṇyáyaṃ  sahásrabhr̥ṣṭiṃ svápā ávartayat  dhattá índro náry ápāṃsi kártave-  -áhan vr̥tráṃ nír apā́m aubjad arṇavám

translation.text: When Tyastar deft of hand had turned the thunderbolt, golden, with thousand edges, fashioned more skilfully, Indra received it to perform heroic deeds. Vr̥itra he slew, and forced the flood of water forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वं नु॑नुद्रेऽव॒तं त ओज॑सा दादृहा॒णं चि॑द्बिभिदु॒र्वि पर्व॑तम् धम॑न्तो वा॒णं म॒रुतः॑ सु॒दान॑वो॒ मदे॒ सोम॑स्य॒ रण्या॑नि चक्रिरे
verses.transliteration: ūrdhváṃ nunudre 'vatáṃ tá ójasā  dādr̥hāṇáṃ cid bibhidur ví párvatam  dhámanto vāṇám marútaḥ sudā́navo  máde sómasya ráṇyāni cakrire

translation.text: They with their vigorous strength pushed the well up on high, and clove the cloud in twain though it was passing strong. The Maruts, bounteous Givers, sending forth their voice, in the wild joy of Soma wrought their glorious deeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जि॒ह्मं नु॑नुद्रेऽव॒तं तया॑ दि॒शासि॑ञ्च॒न्नुत्सं॒ गोत॑माय तृ॒ष्णजे॑ आ ग॑च्छन्ती॒मव॑सा चि॒त्रभा॑नवः॒ कामं॒ विप्र॑स्य तर्पयन्त॒ धाम॑भिः
verses.transliteration: jihmáṃ nunudre 'vatáṃ táyā diśā́-  -asiñcann útsaṃ gótamāya tr̥ṣṇáje  ā́ gachantīm ávasā citrábhānavaḥ  kā́maṃ víprasya tarpayanta dhā́mabhiḥ

translation.text: They drave the cloud transverse directed hitherward, and poured the fountain forth for thirsting Gotama. Shining with varied light they come to him with help: they with their might fulfilled the longing of the sage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या वः॒ शर्म॑ शशमा॒नाय॒ सन्ति॑ त्रि॒धातू॑नि दा॒शुषे॑ यच्छ॒ताधि॑ अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तानि॑ मरुतो॒ वि य॑न्त र॒यिं नो॑ धत्त वृषणः सु॒वीर॑म्
verses.transliteration: yā́ vaḥ śárma śaśamānā́ya sánti  tridhā́tūni dāśúṣe yachatā́dhi  asmábhyaṃ tā́ni maruto ví yanta  rayíṃ no dhatta vr̥ṣaṇaḥ suvī́ram

translation.text: The shelters which ye have for him who lauds you, bestow them threefold on the man who offers. Extend the same boons unto us, ye Maruts. Give us, O Heroes, wealth with noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मरु॑तो॒ यस्य॒ हि क्षये॑ पा॒था दि॒वो वि॑महसः स सु॑गो॒पात॑मो॒ जनः॑
verses.transliteration: máruto yásya hí kṣáye  pāthā́ divó vimahasaḥ  sá sugopā́tamo jánaḥ

translation.text: THE best of guardians hath that man within whose dwelling place ye drink, O Maruts, giants of the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञैर्वा॑ यज्ञवाहसो॒ विप्र॑स्य वा मती॒नाम् मरु॑तः शृणु॒ता हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: yajñaír vā yajñavāhaso  víprasya vā matīnā́m  márutaḥ śr̥ṇutā́ hávam

translation.text: Honoured with sacrifice or with the worship of the sages' hymns, O Maruts, listen to the call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त वा॒ यस्य॑ वा॒जिनोऽनु॒ विप्र॒मत॑क्षत स गन्ता॒ गोम॑ति व्र॒जे
verses.transliteration: utá vā yásya vājínaḥ-  -ánu vípram átakṣata  sá gántā gómati vrajé

translation.text: Yea, the strong man to whom ye have vouchsafed to give a sage, shall move Into a stable rich in kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य वी॒रस्य॑ ब॒र्हिषि॑ सु॒तः सोमो॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु उ॒क्थं मद॑श्च शस्यते
verses.transliteration: asyá vīrásya barhíṣi  sutáḥ sómo díviṣṭiṣu  ukthám mádaś ca śasyate

translation.text: Upon this hero's sacred grass Soma is poured in daily rites: Praise and delight are sung aloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य श्रो॑ष॒न्त्वा भुवो॒ विश्वा॒ यश्च॑र्ष॒णीर॒भि सूरं॑ चित्स॒स्रुषी॒रिषः॑
verses.transliteration: asyá śroṣantv ā́ bhúvo  víśvā yáś carṣaṇī́r abhí  sū́raṃ cit sasrúṣīr íṣaḥ

translation.text: Let the strong Maruts hear him, him surpassing all men: strength be his That reaches even to the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒र्वीभि॒र्हि द॑दाशि॒म श॒रद्भि॑र्मरुतो व॒यम् अवो॑भिश्चर्षणी॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: pūrvī́bhir hí dadāśimá  śarádbhir maruto vayám  ávobhiś carṣaṇīnā́m

translation.text: For, through the swift Gods' loving help, in many an autumn, Maruts, we Have offered up our sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒भगः॒ स प्र॑यज्यवो॒ मरु॑तो अस्तु॒ मर्त्यः॑ यस्य॒ प्रयां॑सि॒ पर्ष॑थ
verses.transliteration: subhágaḥ sá prayajyavo  máruto astu mártyaḥ  yásya práyāṃsi párṣatha

translation.text: Fortunate shall that mortal be, O Maruts most adorable, Whose offerings ye bear away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒श॒मा॒नस्य॑ वा नरः॒ स्वेद॑स्य सत्यशवसः वि॒दा काम॑स्य॒ वेन॑तः
verses.transliteration: śaśamānásya vā naraḥ  svédasya satyaśavasaḥ  vidā́ kā́masya vénataḥ

translation.text: O Heroes truly strong, ye know the toil of him who sings your praise, The heart's desire of him who loves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं तत्स॑त्यशवस आ॒विष्क॑र्त महित्व॒ना विध्य॑ता वि॒द्युता॒ रक्षः॑
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ tát satyaśavasaḥ-  āvíṣ karta mahitvanā́  vídhyatā vidyútā rákṣaḥ

translation.text: O ye of true strength, make this thing manifest by your greatness – strike The demon with your thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गूह॑ता॒ गुह्यं॒ तमो॒ वि या॑त॒ विश्व॑म॒त्रिण॑म् ज्योति॑ष्कर्ता॒ यदु॒श्मसि॑
verses.transliteration: gū́hatā gúhyaṃ támo  ví yāta víśvam atríṇam  jyótiṣ kartā yád uśmási

translation.text: Conceal the horrid darkness, drive far from us each devouring fiend. Create the light for which we long.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्व॑क्षसः॒ प्रत॑वसो विर॒प्शिनोऽना॑नता॒ अवि॑थुरा ऋजी॒षिणः॑ जुष्ट॑तमासो॒ नृत॑मासो अ॒ञ्जिभि॒र्व्या॑नज्रे॒ के चि॑दु॒स्रा इ॑व॒ स्तृभिः॑
verses.transliteration: prátvakṣasaḥ prátavaso virapśínaḥ-  -ánānatā ávithurā r̥jīṣíṇaḥ  júṣṭatamāso nŕ̥tamāso añjíbhir  vy ā̀najre ké cid usrā́ iva stŕ̥bhiḥ

translation.text: LOUD Singers, never humbled, active, full of strength, immovable, impetuous, manliest, bestbeloved, They have displayed themselves with glittering ornaments, a few in number only, like the heavens with stars.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒प॒ह्व॒रेषु॒ यदचि॑ध्वं य॒यिं वय॑ इव मरुतः॒ केन॑ चित्प॒था श्चोत॑न्ति॒ कोशा॒ उप॑ वो॒ रथे॒ष्वा घृ॒तमु॑क्षता॒ मधु॑वर्ण॒मर्च॑ते
verses.transliteration: upahvaréṣu yád ácidhvaṃ yayíṃ  váya iva marutaḥ kéna cit pathā́  ścótanti kóśā úpa vo rátheṣv~ā́  ghr̥tám ukṣatā mádhuvarṇam árcate

translation.text: When, Maruts, on the steeps ye pile the moving cloud, ye are like birds on whatsoever path it be. Clouds everywhere shed forth the rain upon your cars. Drop fatness, honey-hued, for him who sings your praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रैषा॒मज्मे॑षु विथु॒रेव॑ रेजते॒ भूमि॒र्यामे॑षु॒ यद्ध॑ यु॒ञ्जते॑ शु॒भे ते क्री॒ळयो॒ धुन॑यो॒ भ्राज॑दृष्टयः स्व॒यं म॑हि॒त्वं प॑नयन्त॒ धूत॑यः
verses.transliteration: praíṣām ájmeṣu vithuréva rejate  bhū́mir yā́meṣu yád dha yuñjáte śubhé  té krīḷáyo dhúnayo bhrā́jadr̥ṣṭayaḥ  svayám mahitvám panayanta dhū́tayaḥ

translation.text: Earth at their racings trembles as if weak and worn, when on their ways they yoke their cars for victory. They, sportive, loudly roaring, armed with glittering spears, shakers of all, themselves admire their mightiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि स्व॒सृत्पृष॑दश्वो॒ युवा॑ ग॒णो॒३॒॑ऽया ई॑शा॒नस्तवि॑षीभि॒रावृ॑तः असि॑ स॒त्य ऋ॑ण॒यावाने॑द्यो॒ऽस्या धि॒यः प्रा॑वि॒ताथा॒ वृषा॑ ग॒णः
verses.transliteration: sá hí svasŕ̥t pŕ̥ṣadaśvo yúvā gaṇáḥ-  -ayā́ īśānás táviṣībhir ā́vr̥taḥ  ási satyá r̥ṇayā́vā́nedyo  -asyā́ dhiyáḥ prāvitā́thā vŕ̥ṣā gaṇáḥ

translation.text: Self-moving is that youthful band, with spotted steeds; thus it hath lordly sway, endued with power and might. Truthful art thou, and blameless, searcher out of sin: so thou, Strong Host, wilt be protector of this prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒तुः प्र॒त्नस्य॒ जन्म॑ना वदामसि॒ सोम॑स्य जि॒ह्वा प्र जि॑गाति॒ चक्ष॑सा यदी॒मिन्द्रं॒ शम्यृक्वा॑ण॒ आश॒तादिन्नामा॑नि य॒ज्ञिया॑नि दधिरे
verses.transliteration: pitúḥ pratnásya jánmanā vadāmasi  sómasya jihvā́ prá jigāti cákṣasā  yád īm índraṃ śámy ŕ̥kvāṇa ā́śata-  -ā́d ín nā́māni yajñíyāni dadhire

translation.text: We speak by our descent from our primeval Sire; our tongue, when we behold the Soma, stirs itself. When, shouting, they had joined Indra in toil of fight, then only they obtained their sacrificial names.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रि॒यसे॒ कं भा॒नुभिः॒ सं मि॑मिक्षिरे॒ ते र॒श्मिभि॒स्त ऋक्व॑भिः सुखा॒दयः॑ ते वाशी॑मन्त इ॒ष्मिणो॒ अभी॑रवो वि॒द्रे प्रि॒यस्य॒ मारु॑तस्य॒ धाम्नः॑
verses.transliteration: śriyáse kám bhānúbhiḥ sám mimikṣire  té raśmíbhis tá ŕ̥kvabhiḥ sukhādáyaḥ  té vā́śīmanta iṣmíṇo ábhīravo  vidré priyásya mā́rutasya dhā́mnaḥ

translation.text: Splendours they gained for glory, they who wear bright rings; rays they obtained, and men to celebrate their praise. Armed with their swords, impetuous and fearing naught, they have possessed the Maruts' own beloved home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वि॒द्युन्म॑द्भिर्मरुतः स्व॒र्कै रथे॑भिर्यात ऋष्टि॒मद्भि॒रश्व॑पर्णैः आ वर्षि॑ष्ठया न इ॒षा वयो॒ न प॑प्तता सुमायाः
verses.transliteration: ā́ vidyúnmadbhir marutaḥ svarkaíḥ-  ráthebhir yāta r̥ṣṭimádbhir áśvaparṇaiḥ  ā́ várṣiṣṭhayā na iṣā́  váyo ná paptatā sumāyāḥ

translation.text: COME hither, Maruts, on your lightning laden cars, sounding with sweet songs, armed with lances, winged with steeds. Fly unto us with noblest food, like birds, O ye of mighty power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते॑ऽरु॒णेभि॒र्वर॒मा पि॒शङ्गैः॑ शु॒भे कं या॑न्ति रथ॒तूर्भि॒रश्वैः॑ रु॒क्मो न चि॒त्रः स्वधि॑तीवान्प॒व्या रथ॑स्य जङ्घनन्त॒ भूम॑
verses.transliteration: tè 'ruṇébhir váram ā́ piśáṅgaiḥ  śubhé káṃ yānti rathatū́rbhir áśvaiḥ  rukmó ná citráḥ svádhitīvān  pavyā́ ráthasya jaṅghananta bhū́ma

translation.text: With their red-hued or, haply, tawny coursers which speed their chariots on, they come for glory. Brilliant like gold is he who holds the thunder. Earth have they smitten with the chariot's felly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रि॒ये कं वो॒ अधि॑ त॒नूषु॒ वाशी॑र्मे॒धा वना॒ न कृ॑णवन्त ऊ॒र्ध्वा यु॒ष्मभ्यं॒ कं म॑रुतः सुजातास्तुविद्यु॒म्नासो॑ धनयन्ते॒ अद्रि॑म्
verses.transliteration: śriyé káṃ vo ádhi tanū́ṣu vā́śīr  medhā́ vánā ná kr̥ṇavanta ūrdhvā́  yuṣmábhyaṃ kám marutaḥ sujātās  tuvidyumnā́so dhanayante ádrim

translation.text: For beauty ye have swords upon your bodies. As they stir woods so may they stir our spirits. For your sake, O ye Maruts very mighty and well-born, have they set the stone, in motion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अहा॑नि॒ गृध्राः॒ पर्या व॒ आगु॑रि॒मां धियं॑ वार्का॒र्यां च॑ दे॒वीम् ब्रह्म॑ कृ॒ण्वन्तो॒ गोत॑मासो अ॒र्कैरू॒र्ध्वं नु॑नुद्र उत्स॒धिं पिब॑ध्यै
verses.transliteration: áhāni gŕ̥dhrāḥ páry ā́ va ā́gur  imā́ṃ dhíyaṃ vārkāryā́ṃ ca devī́m  bráhma kr̥ṇvánto gótamāso arkaír  ūrdhváṃ nunudra utsadhím píbadhyai

translation.text: The days went round you and came back O yearners, back, to this prayer and to this solemn worship. The Gotamas making their prayer with singing have pushed the well's lid up to drink the water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तत्त्यन्न योज॑नमचेति स॒स्वर्ह॒ यन्म॑रुतो॒ गोत॑मो वः पश्य॒न्हिर॑ण्यचक्रा॒नयो॑दंष्ट्रान्वि॒धाव॑तो व॒राहू॑न्
verses.transliteration: etát tyán ná yójanam aceti  sasvár ha yán maruto gótamo vaḥ  páśyan híraṇyacakrān  áyodaṃṣṭrān vidhā́vato varā́hūn

translation.text: No hymn way ever known like this aforetime which Gotama sang forth for you, O Maruts, What time upon your golden wheels he saw you, wild boars rushing about with tusks of iron.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा स्या वो॑ मरुतोऽनुभ॒र्त्री प्रति॑ ष्टोभति वा॒घतो॒ न वाणी॑ अस्तो॑भय॒द्वृथा॑सा॒मनु॑ स्व॒धां गभ॑स्त्योः
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ syā́ vo maruto 'nubhartrī́  práti ṣṭobhati vāgháto ná vā́ṇī  ástobhayad vŕ̥thāsām  ánu svadhā́ṃ gábhastyoḥ

translation.text: To you this freshening draught of Soma rusheth, O Maruts, like the voice of one who prayeth. It rusheth freely from our hands as these. libations wont to flow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ भ॒द्राः क्रत॑वो यन्तु वि॒श्वतोऽद॑ब्धासो॒ अप॑रीतास उ॒द्भिदः॑ दे॒वा नो॒ यथा॒ सद॒मिद्वृ॒धे अस॒न्नप्रा॑युवो रक्षि॒तारो॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे
verses.transliteration: ā́ no bhadrā́ḥ krátavo yantu viśvátaḥ-  -ádabdhāso áparītāsa udbhídaḥ  devā́ no yáthā sádam íd vr̥dhé ásann  áprāyuvo rakṣitā́ro divé-dive

translation.text: MAY powers auspicious come to us from every side, never deceived, unhindered, and victorious, That the Gods ever may be with us for our gain, our guardians day by day unceasing in their care.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वानां॑ भ॒द्रा सु॑म॒तिर्ऋ॑जूय॒तां दे॒वानां॑ रा॒तिर॒भि नो॒ नि व॑र्तताम् दे॒वानां॑ स॒ख्यमुप॑ सेदिमा व॒यं दे॒वा न॒ आयुः॒ प्र ति॑रन्तु जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: devā́nām bhadrā́ sumatír r̥jūyatā́ṃ  devā́nāṃ rātír abhí no ní vartatām  devā́nāṃ sakhyám úpa sedimā vayáṃ  devā́ na ā́yuḥ prá tirantu jīváse

translation.text: May the auspicious favour of the Gods be ours, on us descend the bounty of the righteous Gods. The friendship of the Gods have we devoutly sought: so may the Gods extend our life that we may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तान्पूर्व॑या नि॒विदा॑ हूमहे व॒यं भगं॑ मि॒त्रमदि॑तिं॒ दक्ष॑म॒स्रिध॑म् अ॒र्य॒मणं॒ वरु॑णं॒ सोम॑म॒श्विना॒ सर॑स्वती नः सु॒भगा॒ मय॑स्करत्
verses.transliteration: tā́n pū́rvayā nivídā hūmahe vayám  bhágam mitrám áditiṃ dákṣam asrídham  aryamáṇaṃ váruṇaṃ sómam aśvínā  sárasvatī naḥ subhágā máyas karat

translation.text: We call them hither with a hymn of olden time, Bhaga, the friendly Daksha, Mitra, Aditi, Aryaman, Varuṇa, Soma, the Aṣvins. May Sarasvatî, auspicious, grant felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्नो॒ वातो॑ मयो॒भु वा॑तु भेष॒जं तन्मा॒ता पृ॑थि॒वी तत्पि॒ता द्यौः तद्ग्रावा॑णः सोम॒सुतो॑ मयो॒भुव॒स्तद॑श्विना शृणुतं धिष्ण्या यु॒वम्
verses.transliteration: tán no vā́to mayobhú vātu bheṣajáṃ  tán mātā́ pr̥thivī́ tát pitā́ dyaúḥ  tád grā́vāṇaḥ somasúto mayobhúvas  tád aśvinā śr̥ṇutaṃ dhiṣṇyā yuvám

translation.text: May the Wind waft to us that pleasant medicine, may Earth our Mother give it, and our Father Heaven, And the joy-giving stones that press the Soma's juice. Aṣvins, may ye, for whom our spirits long, hear this.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमीशा॑नं॒ जग॑तस्त॒स्थुष॒स्पतिं॑ धियंजि॒न्वमव॑से हूमहे व॒यम् पू॒षा नो॒ यथा॒ वेद॑सा॒मस॑द्वृ॒धे र॑क्षि॒ता पा॒युरद॑ब्धः स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: tám ī́śānaṃ jágatas tasthúṣas pátiṃ  dhiyaṃjinvám ávase hūmahe vayám  pūṣā́ no yáthā védasām ásad vr̥dhé  rakṣitā́ pāyúr ádabdhaḥ svastáye

translation.text: Him we invoke for aid who reigns supreme, the Lord of all that stands or moves, inspirer of the soul, That Pûshan may promote the increase of our wealth, our keeper and our guard infallible for our good.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒स्ति न॒ इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒द्धश्र॑वाः स्व॒स्ति नः॑ पू॒षा वि॒श्ववे॑दाः स्व॒स्ति न॒स्तार्क्ष्यो॒ अरि॑ष्टनेमिः स्व॒स्ति नो॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र्दधातु
verses.transliteration: svastí na índro vr̥ddháśravāḥ  svastí naḥ pūṣā́ viśvávedāḥ  svastí nas tā́rkṣyo áriṣṭanemiḥ  svastí no bŕ̥haspátir dadhātu

translation.text: Illustrious far and wide, may Indra prosper us: may Pûshan prosper us, the Master of all wealth. May Târkshya with uninjured fellies prosper us: Br̥ihaspati vouchsafe to us prosperity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृष॑दश्वा म॒रुतः॒ पृश्नि॑मातरः शुभं॒यावा॑नो वि॒दथे॑षु॒ जग्म॑यः अ॒ग्नि॒जि॒ह्वा मन॑वः॒ सूर॑चक्षसो॒ विश्वे॑ नो दे॒वा अव॒सा ग॑मन्नि॒ह
verses.transliteration: pŕ̥ṣadaśvā marútaḥ pŕ̥śnimātaraḥ  śubhaṃyā́vāno vidátheṣu jágmayaḥ  agnijihvā́ mánavaḥ sū́racakṣaso  víśve no devā́ ávasā́ gamann ihá

translation.text: The Maruts, Sons of Prani, borne by spotted steeds, moving in glory, oft visiting holy rites, Sages whose tongue is Agni, brilliant as the Sun,– hither let all the Gods for our protection come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रं कर्णे॑भिः शृणुयाम देवा भ॒द्रं प॑श्येमा॒क्षभि॑र्यजत्राः स्थि॒रैरङ्गै॑स्तुष्टु॒वांस॑स्त॒नूभि॒र्व्य॑शेम दे॒वहि॑तं॒ यदायुः॑
verses.transliteration: bhadráṃ kárṇebhiḥ śr̥ṇuyāma devāḥ-  bhadrám paśyemākṣábhir yajatrāḥ  sthiraír áṅgais tuṣṭuvā́ṃsas tanū́bhir  vy àśema deváhitaṃ yád ā́yuḥ

translation.text: Gods, may we with our ears listen to what is good, and with our eyes see what is good, ye Holy Ones. With limbs and bodies firm may we extolling you attain the term of life appointed by the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तमिन्नु श॒रदो॒ अन्ति॑ देवा॒ यत्रा॑ नश्च॒क्रा ज॒रसं॑ त॒नूना॑म् पु॒त्रासो॒ यत्र॑ पि॒तरो॒ भव॑न्ति॒ मा नो॑ म॒ध्या री॑रिष॒तायु॒र्गन्तोः॑
verses.transliteration: śatám ín nú śarádo ánti devāḥ-  yátrā naś cakrā́ jarásaṃ tanū́nām  putrā́so yátra pitáro bhávanti  mā́ no madhyā́ rīriṣatā́yur gántoḥ

translation.text: A hundred autumns stand before us, O ye Gods, within whose space ye bring our bodies to decay; Within whose space our sons become fathers in turn. Break ye not in the midst our course of fleeting life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदि॑ति॒र्द्यौरदि॑तिर॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒मदि॑तिर्मा॒ता स पि॒ता स पु॒त्रः विश्वे॑ दे॒वा अदि॑तिः॒ पञ्च॒ जना॒ अदि॑तिर्जा॒तमदि॑ति॒र्जनि॑त्वम्
verses.transliteration: áditir dyaúr áditir antárikṣam  áditir mātā́ sá pitā́ sá putráḥ  víśve devā́ áditiḥ páñca jánāḥ-  áditir jātám áditir jánitvam

translation.text: Aditi is the heaven, Aditi is mid-air, Aditi is the Mother and the Sire and Son. Aditi is all Gods, Aditi five-classed men, Aditi all that hath been bom and shall be born.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒जु॒नी॒ती नो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो न॑यतु वि॒द्वान् अ॒र्य॒मा दे॒वैः स॒जोषाः॑
verses.transliteration: r̥junītī́ no váruṇo  mitró nayatu vidvā́n  aryamā́ devaíḥ sajóṣāḥ

translation.text: MAY Varuṇa with guidance straight, and Mitra lead us, he who knows, And Aryaman in accord with Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि वस्वो॒ वस॑वाना॒स्ते अप्र॑मूरा॒ महो॑भिः व्र॒ता र॑क्षन्ते वि॒श्वाहा॑
verses.transliteration: té hí vásvo vásavānās  té ápramūrā máhobhiḥ  vratā́ rakṣante viśvā́hā

translation.text: For they are dealers forth of wealth, and, not deluded, with their might Guard evermore the holy laws.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ शर्म॑ यंसन्न॒मृता॒ मर्त्ये॑भ्यः बाध॑माना॒ अप॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: té asmábhyaṃ śárma yaṃsann  amŕ̥tā mártyebhyaḥ  bā́dhamānā ápa dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: Shelter may they vouchsafe to us, Immortal Gods to mortal men, Chasing our enemies away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि नः॑ प॒थः सु॑वि॒ताय॑ चि॒यन्त्विन्द्रो॑ म॒रुतः॑ पू॒षा भगो॒ वन्द्या॑सः
verses.transliteration: ví naḥ patháḥ suvitā́ya  ciyántv índro marútaḥ  pūṣā́ bhágo vándyāsaḥ

translation.text: May they mark out our paths to bliss, Indra, the Maruts, Pûshan, and Bhaga, the Gods to be adored.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॒ धियो॒ गोअ॑ग्राः॒ पूष॒न्विष्ण॒वेव॑यावः कर्ता॑ नः स्वस्ति॒मतः॑
verses.transliteration: utá no dhíyo góagrāḥ  pū́ṣan víṣṇav évayāvaḥ  kártā naḥ svastimátaḥ

translation.text: Yea, Pûshan, Vishṇu, ye who run your course, enrich our hymns with kine; Bless us with all prosperity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मधु॒ वाता॑ ऋताय॒ते मधु॑ क्षरन्ति॒ सिन्ध॑वः माध्वी॑र्नः स॒न्त्वोष॑धीः
verses.transliteration: mádhu vā́tā r̥tāyaté  mádhu kṣaranti síndhavaḥ  mā́dhvīr naḥ santv óṣadhīḥ

translation.text: The winds waft sweets, the rivers pour sweets for the man who keeps the Law So may the plants be sweet for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मधु॒ नक्त॑मु॒तोषसो॒ मधु॑म॒त्पार्थि॑वं॒ रजः॑ मधु॒ द्यौर॑स्तु नः पि॒ता
verses.transliteration: mádhu náktam utóṣáso  mádhumat pā́rthivaṃ rájaḥ  mádhu dyaúr astu naḥ pitā́

translation.text: Sweet be the night and sweet the dawns, sweet the terrestrial atmosphere; Sweet be our Father Heaven to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मधु॑मान्नो॒ वन॒स्पति॒र्मधु॑माँ अस्तु॒ सूर्यः॑ माध्वी॒र्गावो॑ भवन्तु नः
verses.transliteration: mádhumān no vánaspátir  mádhumām̐ astu sū́ryaḥ  mā́dhvīr gā́vo bhavantu naḥ

translation.text: May the tall tree be full of sweets for us, and full of sweets the Sun: May our milch-kine be sweet for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शं नो॑ मि॒त्रः शं वरु॑णः॒ शं नो॑ भवत्वर्य॒मा शं न॒ इन्द्रो॒ बृह॒स्पतिः॒ शं नो॒ विष्णु॑रुरुक्र॒मः
verses.transliteration: śáṃ no mitráḥ śáṃ váruṇaḥ  śáṃ no bhavatv aryamā́  śáṃ na índro bŕ̥haspátiḥ  śáṃ no víṣṇur urukramáḥ

translation.text: Be Mitra gracious unto us, and Varuṇa and Aryaman: Indra, Br̥ihaspati be kind, and Vishṇu of the mighty stride.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सो॑म॒ प्र चि॑कितो मनी॒षा त्वं रजि॑ष्ठ॒मनु॑ नेषि॒ पन्था॑म् तव॒ प्रणी॑ती पि॒तरो॑ न इन्दो दे॒वेषु॒ रत्न॑मभजन्त॒ धीराः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ soma prá cikito manīṣā́  tváṃ rájiṣṭham ánu neṣi pánthām  táva práṇītī pitáro na indo  devéṣu rátnam abhajanta dhī́rāḥ

translation.text: Thou, Soma, art preeminent for wisdom; along the straightest path thou art our leader. Our wise forefathers by thy guidance, Indu, dealt out among the Gods their share of treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सो॑म॒ क्रतु॑भिः सु॒क्रतु॑र्भू॒स्त्वं दक्षैः॑ सु॒दक्षो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दाः त्वं वृषा॑ वृष॒त्वेभि॑र्महि॒त्वा द्यु॒म्नेभि॑र्द्यु॒म्न्य॑भवो नृ॒चक्षाः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ soma krátubhiḥ sukrátur bhūs  tváṃ dákṣaiḥ sudákṣo viśvávedāḥ  tváṃ vŕ̥ṣā vr̥ṣatvébhir mahitvā́  dyumnébhir dyumny àbhavo nr̥cákṣāḥ

translation.text: Thou by thine insight art most wise, O Soma, strong by thine energies and all possessing, Mighty art thou by all thy powers and greatness, by glories art thou glorious, guide of mortals.

verses.sanskrit_deva: राज्ञो॒ नु ते॒ वरु॑णस्य व्र॒तानि॑ बृ॒हद्ग॑भी॒रं तव॑ सोम॒ धाम॑ शुचि॒ष्ट्वम॑सि प्रि॒यो न मि॒त्रो द॒क्षाय्यो॑ अर्य॒मेवा॑सि सोम
verses.transliteration: rā́jño nú te váruṇasya vratā́ni  br̥hád gabhīráṃ táva soma dhā́ma  śúciṣ ṭvám asi priyó ná mitró  dakṣā́yyo aryamévāsi soma

translation.text: Thine are King Varuṇa's eternal statutes, lofty and deep, O Soma, is thy glory. All-pure art thou like Mitra the beloved, adorable, like Aryaman, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ते॒ धामा॑नि दि॒वि या पृ॑थि॒व्यां या पर्व॑ते॒ष्वोष॑धीष्व॒प्सु तेभि॑र्नो॒ विश्वैः॑ सु॒मना॒ अहे॑ळ॒न्राज॑न्त्सोम॒ प्रति॑ ह॒व्या गृ॑भाय
verses.transliteration: yā́ te dhā́māni diví yā́ pr̥thivyā́ṃ  yā́ párvateṣv óṣadhīṣv apsú  tébhir no víśvaiḥ sumánā áheḷan  rā́jan soma práti havyā́ gr̥bhāya

translation.text: With all thy glories on the earth, in heaven, on mountains, in the plants, and in the waters,– With all of these, well-pleased and not in anger, accept, O royal Soma, our oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सो॑मासि॒ सत्प॑ति॒स्त्वं राजो॒त वृ॑त्र॒हा त्वं भ॒द्रो अ॑सि॒ क्रतुः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ somāsi sátpatis  tváṃ rā́jotá vr̥trahā́  tvám bhadró asi krátuḥ

translation.text: Thou, Soma, art the Lord of heroes, King, yea, Vr̥itra-slayer thou: Thou art auspicious energy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं च॑ सोम नो॒ वशो॑ जी॒वातुं॒ न म॑रामहे प्रि॒यस्तो॑त्रो॒ वन॒स्पतिः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ ca soma no váśo  jīvā́tuṃ ná marāmahe  priyástotro vánaspátiḥ

translation.text: And, Soma, let it be thy wish that we may live and may not die: Praise-loving Lord of plants art thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सो॑म म॒हे भगं॒ त्वं यून॑ ऋताय॒ते दक्षं॑ दधासि जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ soma mahé bhágaṃ  tváṃ yū́na r̥tāyaté  dákṣaṃ dadhāsi jīváse

translation.text: To him who keeps the law, both old and young, thou givest happiness, And energy that he may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नः॑ सोम वि॒श्वतो॒ रक्षा॑ राजन्नघाय॒तः न रि॑ष्ये॒त्त्वाव॑तः॒ सखा॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ naḥ soma viśváto  rákṣā rājann aghāyatáḥ  ná riṣyet tvā́vataḥ sákhā

translation.text: Guard us, King Soma, on all sides from him who threatens us: never let The friend of one like thee be harmed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॒ यास्ते॑ मयो॒भुव॑ ऊ॒तयः॒ सन्ति॑ दा॒शुषे॑ ताभि॑र्नोऽवि॒ता भ॑व
verses.transliteration: sóma yā́s te mayobhúvaḥ-  ūtáyaḥ sánti dāśúṣe  tā́bhir no 'vitā́ bhava

translation.text: With those delightful aids which thou hast, Soma, for the worshipper,– Even with those protect thou us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं य॒ज्ञमि॒दं वचो॑ जुजुषा॒ण उ॒पाग॑हि सोम॒ त्वं नो॑ वृ॒धे भ॑व
verses.transliteration: imáṃ yajñám idáṃ vácaḥ  jujuṣāṇá upā́gahi  sóma tváṃ no vr̥dhé bhava

translation.text: Accepting this our sacrifice and this our praise, O Soma, come, And be thou nigh to prosper us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॑ गी॒र्भिष्ट्वा॑ व॒यं व॒र्धया॑मो वचो॒विदः॑ सु॒मृ॒ळी॒को न॒ आ वि॑श
verses.transliteration: sóma gīrbhíṣ ṭvā vayáṃ  vardháyāmo vacovídaḥ  sumr̥ḷīkó na ā́ viśa

translation.text: Well-skilled in speech we magnify thee, Soma, with our sacred songs: Come thou to us, most gracious One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग॒य॒स्फानो॑ अमीव॒हा व॑सु॒वित्पु॑ष्टि॒वर्ध॑नः सु॒मि॒त्रः सो॑म नो भव
verses.transliteration: gayasphā́no amīvahā́  vasuvít puṣṭivárdhanaḥ  sumitráḥ soma no bhava

translation.text: Enricher, healer of disease, wealth-finder, prospering our store, Be, Soma, a good Friend to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॑ रार॒न्धि नो॑ हृ॒दि गावो॒ न यव॑से॒ष्वा मर्य॑ इव॒ स्व ओ॒क्ये॑
verses.transliteration: sóma rārandhí no hr̥dí  gā́vo ná yávaseṣv ā́  márya iva svá okyè

translation.text: Soma, be happy in our heart, as milch-kine in the grassy meads, As a young man in his own house.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः सो॑म स॒ख्ये तव॑ रा॒रण॑द्देव॒ मर्त्यः॑ तं दक्षः॑ सचते क॒विः
verses.transliteration: yáḥ soma sakhyé táva  rāráṇad deva mártyaḥ  táṃ dákṣaḥ sacate kavíḥ

translation.text: O Soma, God, the mortal man who in thy friendship hath delight, Him doth the mighty Sage befriend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रु॒ष्या णो॑ अ॒भिश॑स्तेः॒ सोम॒ नि पा॒ह्यंह॑सः सखा॑ सु॒शेव॑ एधि नः
verses.transliteration: uruṣyā́ ṇo abhíśasteḥ  sóma ní pāhy áṃhasaḥ  sákhā suśéva edhi naḥ

translation.text: Save us from slanderous reproach, keep us., O Soma, from distress: Be unto us a gracious Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प्या॑यस्व॒ समे॑तु ते वि॒श्वतः॑ सोम॒ वृष्ण्य॑म् भवा॒ वाज॑स्य संग॒थे
verses.transliteration: ā́ pyāyasva sám etu te  viśvátaḥ soma vŕ̥ṣṇyam  bhávā vā́jasya saṃgathé

translation.text: Soma, wax great. From every side may vigorous powers unite in thee: Be in the gathering-place of strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प्या॑यस्व मदिन्तम॒ सोम॒ विश्वे॑भिरं॒शुभिः॑ भवा॑ नः सु॒श्रव॑स्तमः॒ सखा॑ वृ॒धे
verses.transliteration: ā́ pyāyasva madintama  sóma víśvebhir aṃśúbhiḥ  bhávā naḥ suśrávastamaḥ sákhā vr̥dhé

translation.text: Wax, O most gladdening Soma, great through all thy rays of light, and be A Friend of most illustrious fame t6 prosper us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं ते॒ पयां॑सि॒ समु॑ यन्तु॒ वाजाः॒ सं वृष्ण्या॑न्यभिमाति॒षाहः॑ आ॒प्याय॑मानो अ॒मृता॑य सोम दि॒वि श्रवां॑स्युत्त॒मानि॑ धिष्व
verses.transliteration: sáṃ te páyāṃsi sám u yantu vā́jāḥ  sáṃ vŕ̥ṣṇyāny abhimātiṣā́haḥ  āpyā́yamāno amŕ̥tāya soma  diví śrávāṃsy uttamā́ni dhiṣva

translation.text: In thee be juicy nutriments united, and powers and mighty foe-subduing vigour, Waxing to immortality, O Soma: win highest glories for thyself in heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ते॒ धामा॑नि ह॒विषा॒ यज॑न्ति॒ ता ते॒ विश्वा॑ परि॒भूर॑स्तु य॒ज्ञम् ग॒य॒स्फानः॑ प्र॒तर॑णः सु॒वीरोऽवी॑रहा॒ प्र च॑रा सोम॒ दुर्या॑न्
verses.transliteration: yā́ te dhā́māni havíṣā yájanti  tā́ te víśvā paribhū́r astu yajñám  gayasphā́naḥ pratáraṇaḥ suvī́raḥ-  -ávīrahā prá carā soma dúryān

translation.text: Such of thy glories as with poured oblations men honour, may they all invest our worship. Wealth-giver, furtherer with troops of heroes, sparing the brave, come, Soma, to our houses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमो॑ धे॒नुं सोमो॒ अर्व॑न्तमा॒शुं सोमो॑ वी॒रं क॑र्म॒ण्यं॑ ददाति सा॒द॒न्यं॑ विद॒थ्यं॑ स॒भेयं॑ पितृ॒श्रव॑णं॒ यो ददा॑शदस्मै
verses.transliteration: sómo dhenúṃ sómo árvantam āśúṃ  sómo vīráṃ karmaṇyàṃ dadāti  sādanyàṃ vidathyàṃ sabhéyam  pitr̥śrávaṇaṃ yó dádāśad asmai

translation.text: To him who worships Soma gives the milchcow, a fleet steed and a man of active knowledge, Skilled in home duties, meet for holy synod, for council meet, a glory to his father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अषा॑ळ्हं यु॒त्सु पृत॑नासु॒ पप्रिं॑ स्व॒र्षाम॒प्सां वृ॒जन॑स्य गो॒पाम् भ॒रे॒षु॒जां सु॑क्षि॒तिं सु॒श्रव॑सं॒ जय॑न्तं॒ त्वामनु॑ मदेम सोम
verses.transliteration: áṣāḷhaṃ yutsú pŕ̥tanāsu pápriṃ  svarṣā́m apsā́ṃ vr̥jánasya gopā́m  bhareṣujā́ṃ sukṣitíṃ suśrávasaṃ  jáyantaṃ tvā́m ánu madema soma

translation.text: Invincible in fight, saver in battles, guard of our camp, winner of light and water, Born amid hymns, well-housed, exceeding famous, victor, in thee will we rejoice, O Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमि॒मा ओष॑धीः सोम॒ विश्वा॒स्त्वम॒पो अ॑जनय॒स्त्वं गाः त्वमा त॑तन्थो॒र्व१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षं॒ त्वं ज्योति॑षा॒ वि तमो॑ ववर्थ
verses.transliteration: tvám imā́ óṣadhīḥ soma víśvās  tvám apó ajanayas tváṃ gā́ḥ  tvám ā́ tatanthorv àntárikṣaṃ  tváṃ jyótiṣā ví támo vavartha

translation.text: These herbs, these milch-kine, and these running waters, all these, O Soma, thou hast generated. The spacious firmament bast thou expanded, and with the light thou hast dispelled the darkness.
