verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वेन॑ नो॒ मन॑सा देव सोम रा॒यो भा॒गं स॑हसावन्न॒भि यु॑ध्य मा त्वा त॑न॒दीशि॑षे वी॒र्य॑स्यो॒भये॑भ्यः॒ प्र चि॑कित्सा॒ गवि॑ष्टौ
verses.transliteration: devéna no mánasā deva soma  rāyó bhāgáṃ sahasāvann abhí yudhya  mā́ tvā́ tanad ī́śiṣe vīryàsya-  -ubháyebhyaḥ prá cikitsā gáviṣṭau

translation.text: Do thou, God Soma, with thy Godlike spirit, victorious, win for us a share of riches. Let none prevent thee: thou art Lord of valour. Provide for both sides in the fray for booty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ता उ॒ त्या उ॒षसः॑ के॒तुम॑क्रत॒ पूर्वे॒ अर्धे॒ रज॑सो भा॒नुम॑ञ्जते नि॒ष्कृ॒ण्वा॒ना आयु॑धानीव धृ॒ष्णवः॒ प्रति॒ गावोऽरु॑षीर्यन्ति मा॒तरः॑
verses.transliteration: etā́ u tyā́ uṣásaḥ ketúm akrata  pū́rve árdhe rájaso bhānúm añjate  niṣkr̥ṇvānā́ ā́yudhānīva dhr̥ṣṇávaḥ  práti gā́vó 'ruṣīr yanti mātáraḥ

translation.text: THESE Dawns have raised their banner; in the eastern half of the mid-air they spread abroad their shinine light. Like heroes who prepare their weapons for the war, onward they come bright red in hue, the Mother Cows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॑पप्तन्नरु॒णा भा॒नवो॒ वृथा॑ स्वा॒युजो॒ अरु॑षी॒र्गा अ॑युक्षत अक्र॑न्नु॒षासो॑ व॒युना॑नि पू॒र्वथा॒ रुश॑न्तं भा॒नुमरु॑षीरशिश्रयुः
verses.transliteration: úd apaptann aruṇā́ bhānávo vŕ̥thā  svāyújo áruṣīr gā́ ayukṣata  ákrann uṣā́so vayúnāni pūrváthā  rúśantam bhānúm áruṣīr aśiśrayuḥ

translation.text: Readily have the purple beams of light shot up; the Red Cows have they harnessed, easy to be yoked. The Dawns have brought distinct perception as before: red-hued, they have attained their fulgent brilliancy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्च॑न्ति॒ नारी॑र॒पसो॒ न वि॒ष्टिभिः॑ समा॒नेन॒ योज॑ने॒ना प॑रा॒वतः॑ इषं॒ वह॑न्तीः सु॒कृते॑ सु॒दान॑वे॒ विश्वेदह॒ यज॑मानाय सुन्व॒ते
verses.transliteration: árcanti nā́rīr apáso ná viṣṭíbhiḥ  samānéna yójanenā́ parāvátaḥ  íṣaṃ váhantīḥ sukŕ̥te sudā́nave  víśvéd áha yájamānāya sunvaté

translation.text: They sing their song like women active in their tasks, along their common path hither from far away, Bringing refreshment to the liberal devotee, yea, all things to the worshipper who pours the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॒ पेशां॑सि वपते नृ॒तूरि॒वापो॑र्णुते॒ वक्ष॑ उ॒स्रेव॒ बर्ज॑हम् ज्योति॒र्विश्व॑स्मै॒ भुव॑नाय कृण्व॒ती गावो॒ न व्र॒जं व्यु१॒॑षा आ॑व॒र्तमः॑
verses.transliteration: ádhi péśāṃsi vapate nr̥tū́r iva-  -áporṇute vákṣa usréva bárjaham  jyótir víśvasmai bhúvanāya kr̥ṇvatī́  gā́vo ná vrajáṃ vy ùṣā́ āvar támaḥ

translation.text: She, like a dancer, puts her broidered garments on: as a cow yields her udder so she bares her breast. Creating light for all the world of life, the Dawn hath laid the darkness open as the cows their stall.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्य॒र्ची रुश॑दस्या अदर्शि॒ वि ति॑ष्ठते॒ बाध॑ते कृ॒ष्णमभ्व॑म् स्वरुं॒ न पेशो॑ वि॒दथे॑ष्व॒ञ्जञ्चि॒त्रं दि॒वो दु॑हि॒ता भा॒नुम॑श्रेत्
verses.transliteration: práty arcī́ rúśad asyā adarśi  ví tiṣṭhate bā́dhate kr̥ṣṇám ábhvam  sváruṃ ná péśo vidátheṣv añjáñ  citráṃ divó duhitā́ bhānúm aśret

translation.text: We have beheld the brightness of her shining; it spreads and drives away the darkiorne monster. Like tints that deck the Post at sacrifices, Heaven's Daughter hath attained her wondrous splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अता॑रिष्म॒ तम॑सस्पा॒रम॒स्योषा उ॒च्छन्ती॑ व॒युना॑ कृणोति श्रि॒ये छन्दो॒ न स्म॑यते विभा॒ती सु॒प्रती॑का सौमन॒साया॑जीगः
verses.transliteration: átāriṣma támasas pārám asyá-  -uṣā́ uchántī vayúnā kr̥ṇoti  śriyé chándo ná smayate vibhātī́  suprátīkā saumanasā́yājīgaḥ

translation.text: We have o'erpast the limit of this darkness; Dawn breaking forth again brings clear perception. She like a flatterer smiles in light for glory, and fair of face hath wakened to rejoice us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भास्व॑ती ने॒त्री सू॒नृता॑नां दि॒वः स्त॑वे दुहि॒ता गोत॑मेभिः प्र॒जाव॑तो नृ॒वतो॒ अश्व॑बुध्या॒नुषो॒ गोअ॑ग्राँ॒ उप॑ मासि॒ वाजा॑न्
verses.transliteration: bhā́svatī netrī́ sūnŕ̥tānāṃ  divá stave duhitā́ gótamebhiḥ  prajā́vato nr̥váto áśvabudhyān  úṣo góagrām̐ úpa māsi vā́jān

translation.text: The Gotamas have praised Heaven's radiant Daughter, the leader of the charm of pleasant voices. Dawn, thou conferrest on us strength with offspring and men, conspicuous with kine and horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उष॒स्तम॑श्यां य॒शसं॑ सु॒वीरं॑ दा॒सप्र॑वर्गं र॒यिमश्व॑बुध्यम् सु॒दंस॑सा॒ श्रव॑सा॒ या वि॒भासि॒ वाज॑प्रसूता सुभगे बृ॒हन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: úṣas tám aśyāṃ yaśásaṃ suvī́raṃ  dāsápravargaṃ rayím áśvabudhyam  sudáṃsasā śrávasā yā́ vibhā́si  vā́japrasūtā subhage br̥hántam

translation.text: O thou who shinest forth in wondrous glory, urged onward by thy strength, auspicious Lady, Dawn, may I gain that wealth, renowned and ample, in brave sons, troops of slaves, far-famed for horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑नि दे॒वी भुव॑नाभि॒चक्ष्या॑ प्रती॒ची चक्षु॑रुर्वि॒या वि भा॑ति विश्वं॑ जी॒वं च॒रसे॑ बो॒धय॑न्ती॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ वाच॑मविदन्मना॒योः
verses.transliteration: víśvāni devī́ bhúvanābhicákṣyā  pratīcī́ cákṣur urviyā́ ví bhāti  víśvaṃ jīváṃ caráse bodháyantī  víśvasya vā́cam avidan manāyóḥ

translation.text: Bending her looks on all the world, the Goddess shines, widely spreading with her bright eye westward. Waking to motion every living creature, she understands the voice of each adorer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुनः॑पुन॒र्जाय॑माना पुरा॒णी स॑मा॒नं वर्ण॑म॒भि शुम्भ॑माना श्व॒घ्नीव॑ कृ॒त्नुर्विज॑ आमिना॒ना मर्त॑स्य दे॒वी ज॒रय॒न्त्यायुः॑
verses.transliteration: púnaḥ-punar jā́yamānā purāṇī́  samānáṃ várṇam abhí śúmbhamānā  śvaghnī́va kr̥tnúr víja āminānā́  mártasya devī́ jaráyanty ā́yuḥ

translation.text: Ancient of days, again again born newly, decking her beauty with the self-same raiment. The Goddess wastes away the life of mortals, like a skilled hunter cutting birds in pieces.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्यू॒र्ण्व॒ती दि॒वो अन्ताँ॑ अबो॒ध्यप॒ स्वसा॑रं सनु॒तर्यु॑योति प्र॒मि॒न॒ती म॑नु॒ष्या॑ यु॒गानि॒ योषा॑ जा॒रस्य॒ चक्ष॑सा॒ वि भा॑ति
verses.transliteration: vyūrṇvatī́ divó ántām̐ abodhi-  ápa svásāraṃ sanutár yuyoti  praminatī́ manuṣyā̀ yugā́ni  yóṣā jārásya cákṣasā ví bhāti

translation.text: She hath appeared discovering heaven's borders: to the far distance she drives off her Sister. Diminishing the days of human creatures, the Lady shines with all her lover's splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒शून्न चि॒त्रा सु॒भगा॑ प्रथा॒ना सिन्धु॒र्न क्षोद॑ उर्वि॒या व्य॑श्वैत् अमि॑नती॒ दैव्या॑नि व्र॒तानि॒ सूर्य॑स्य चेति र॒श्मिभि॑र्दृशा॒ना
verses.transliteration: paśū́n ná citrā́ subhágā prathānā́  síndhur ná kṣóda urviyā́ vy àśvait  áminatī daívyāni vratā́ni  sū́ryasya ceti raśmíbhir dr̥śānā́

translation.text: The bright, the blessed One shines forth extending her rays like kine, as a flood rolls his waters. Never transgressing the divine commandments, she is beheld visible with the sunbeams.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उष॒स्तच्चि॒त्रमा भ॑रा॒स्मभ्यं॑ वाजिनीवति येन॑ तो॒कं च॒ तन॑यं च॒ धाम॑हे
verses.transliteration: úṣas tác citrám ā́ bhara-  -asmábhyaṃ vājinīvati  yéna tokáṃ ca tánayaṃ ca dhā́mahe

translation.text: O Dawn enriched with ample wealth, bestow on us the wondrous gift Wherewith we may support children and children's sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उषो॑ अ॒द्येह गो॑म॒त्यश्वा॑वति विभावरि रे॒वद॒स्मे व्यु॑च्छ सूनृतावति
verses.transliteration: úṣo adyéhá gomati-  áśvāvati vibhāvari  revád asmé vy ùcha sūnr̥tāvati

translation.text: Thou radiant mover of sweet sounds, with wealth of horses and of kine Shine thou on us this day, O Dawn auspiciously.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒क्ष्वा हि वा॑जिनीव॒त्यश्वाँ॑ अ॒द्यारु॒णाँ उ॑षः अथा॑ नो॒ विश्वा॒ सौभ॑गा॒न्या व॑ह
verses.transliteration: yukṣvā́ hí vājinīvati-  áśvām̐ adyā́ruṇā́m̐ uṣaḥ  áthā no víśvā saúbhagāny ā́ vaha

translation.text: O Dawn enriched with holy rites, yoke to thy car thy purple steeds, And then bring thou unto us all felicities.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वि॑ना व॒र्तिर॒स्मदा गोम॑द्दस्रा॒ हिर॑ण्यवत् अ॒र्वाग्रथं॒ सम॑नसा॒ नि य॑च्छतम्
verses.transliteration: áśvinā vartír asmád~ā́  gómad dasrā híraṇyavat  arvā́g ráthaṃ sámanasā ní yachatam

translation.text: O Aṣvins wonderful in act, do ye unanimous direct Your chariot to our home wealthy in kine and gold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यावि॒त्था श्लोक॒मा दि॒वो ज्योति॒र्जना॑य च॒क्रथुः॑ आ न॒ ऊर्जं॑ वहतमश्विना यु॒वम्
verses.transliteration: yā́v itthā́ ślókam ā́ divó  jyótir jánāya cakráthuḥ  ā́ na ū́rjaṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvám

translation.text: Ye who brought down the hymn from heaven, a light that giveth light to man, Do ye, O Aṣvius, bring strength bither unto us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एह दे॒वा म॑यो॒भुवा॑ द॒स्रा हिर॑ण्यवर्तनी उ॒ष॒र्बुधो॑ वहन्तु॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: éhá devā́ mayobhúvā  dasrā́ híraṇyavartanī  uṣarbúdho vahantu sómapītaye

translation.text: Hither may they who wake at dawn bring, to drink Soma both the Gods Health-givers Wonder-Workers, borne on paths of gold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नी॑षोमावि॒मं सु मे॑ शृणु॒तं वृ॑षणा॒ हव॑म् प्रति॑ सू॒क्तानि॑ हर्यतं॒ भव॑तं दा॒शुषे॒ मयः॑
verses.transliteration: ágnīṣomāv imáṃ sú me  śr̥ṇutáṃ vr̥ṣaṇā hávam  práti sūktā́ni haryatam  bhávataṃ dāśúṣe máyaḥ

translation.text: AGNI and Soma, mighty Pair, graciously hearken to my call, Accept in friendly wise my hymn, and prosper him who offers gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नी॑षोमा॒ यो अ॒द्य वा॑मि॒दं वचः॑ सप॒र्यति॑ तस्मै॑ धत्तं सु॒वीर्यं॒ गवां॒ पोषं॒ स्वश्व्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ágnīṣomā yó adyá vām  idáṃ vácaḥ saparyáti  tásmai dhattaṃ suvī́ryaṃ  gávām póṣaṃ sváśvyam

translation.text: The man who honours you to-day, Agni and Soma, with this hymn, Bestow on him heroic strength, increase of kine, and noble steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नी॑षोमा॒ य आहु॑तिं॒ यो वां॒ दाशा॑द्ध॒विष्कृ॑तिम् स प्र॒जया॑ सु॒वीर्यं॒ विश्व॒मायु॒र्व्य॑श्नवत्
verses.transliteration: ágnīṣomā yá ā́hutiṃ  yó vāṃ dā́śād dhavíṣkr̥tim  sá prajáyā suvī́ryaṃ  víśvam ā́yur vy àśnavat

translation.text: The man who offers holy oil and burnt oblations unto you, Agni and Soma, shall enjoy great strength, with offspring, all his life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नी॑षोमा॒ चेति॒ तद्वी॒र्यं॑ वां॒ यदमु॑ष्णीतमव॒सं प॒णिं गाः अवा॑तिरतं॒ बृस॑यस्य॒ शेषोऽवि॑न्दतं॒ ज्योति॒रेकं॑ ब॒हुभ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: ágnīṣomā céti tád vīryàṃ vāṃ  yád ámuṣṇītam avasám paṇíṃ gā́ḥ  ávātiratam bŕ̥sayasya śéṣaḥ-  -ávindataṃ jyótir ékam bahúbhyaḥ

translation.text: Agni and Soma, famed is that your prowess wherewith ye stole the kine, his food, from Paṇi. Ye caused the brood of Br̥isaya to perish; ye found the light, the single light for many.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वमे॒तानि॑ दि॒वि रो॑च॒नान्य॒ग्निश्च॑ सोम॒ सक्र॑तू अधत्तम् यु॒वं सिन्धूँ॑र॒भिश॑स्तेरव॒द्यादग्नी॑षोमा॒वमु॑ञ्चतं गृभी॒तान्
verses.transliteration: yuvám etā́ni diví rocanā́ni-  agníś ca soma sákratū adhattam  yuváṃ síndhūm̐r abhíśaster avadyā́d  ágnīṣomāv ámuñcataṃ gr̥bhītā́n

translation.text: Agni and Soma, joined in operation ye have set up the shining lights in heaven. From curse and from reproach, Agni and Soma, ye freed the rivers that were bound in fetters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आन्यं दि॒वो मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑ जभा॒राम॑थ्नाद॒न्यं परि॑ श्ये॒नो अद्रेः॑ अग्नी॑षोमा॒ ब्रह्म॑णा वावृधा॒नोरुं य॒ज्ञाय॑ चक्रथुरु लो॒कम्
verses.transliteration: ā́nyáṃ divó mātaríśvā jabhāra-  -ámathnād anyám pári śyenó ádreḥ  ágnīṣomā bráhmaṇā vāvr̥dhānā́-  -urúṃ yajñā́ya cakrathur ulokám

translation.text: One of you Mitarisvan brought from heaven, the Falcon rent the other from the mountain. Strengthened by holy prayer Agni and Soma have made us ample room for sacrificing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नी॑षोमा ह॒विषः॒ प्रस्थि॑तस्य वी॒तं हर्य॑तं वृषणा जु॒षेथा॑म् सु॒शर्मा॑णा॒ स्वव॑सा॒ हि भू॒तमथा॑ धत्तं॒ यज॑मानाय॒ शं योः
verses.transliteration: ágnīṣomā havíṣaḥ prásthitasya  vītáṃ háryataṃ vr̥ṣaṇā juṣéthām  suśármāṇā svávasā hí bhūtám  áthā dhattaṃ yájamānāya śáṃ yóḥ

translation.text: Taste, Agni, Soma, this prepared oblation; accept it, Mighty Ones, and let it please you. Vouchsafe us good protection and kind favour: grant to the sacrificer health and riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॒ग्नीषोमा॑ ह॒विषा॑ सप॒र्याद्दे॑व॒द्रीचा॒ मन॑सा॒ यो घृ॒तेन॑ तस्य॑ व्र॒तं र॑क्षतं पा॒तमंह॑सो वि॒शे जना॑य॒ महि॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतम्
verses.transliteration: yó agnī́ṣómā havíṣā saparyā́d  devadrī́cā mánasā yó ghr̥téna  tásya vratáṃ rakṣatam pātám áṃhaso  viśé jánāya máhi śárma yachatam

translation.text: Whoso with oil and poured oblation honours, with God-devoted heart, Agni and Soma,– Protect his sacrifice, preserve him from distress, grant to the sacrificer great felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नी॑षोमा॒ सवे॑दसा॒ सहू॑ती वनतं॒ गिरः॑ सं दे॑व॒त्रा ब॑भूवथुः
verses.transliteration: ágnīṣomā sávedasā  sáhūtī vanataṃ gíraḥ  sáṃ devatrā́ babhūvathuḥ

translation.text: Invoked together, mates in wealth, AgniSoma, accept our hymns: Together be among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नी॑षोमाव॒नेन॑ वां॒ यो वां॑ घृ॒तेन॒ दाश॑ति तस्मै॑ दीदयतं बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: ágnīṣomāv anéna vāṃ  yó vāṃ ghr̥téna dā́śati  tásmai dīdayatam br̥hát

translation.text: Agni and Soma, unto him who worships you with holy oil Shine forth an ample recompense.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नी॑षोमावि॒मानि॑ नो यु॒वं ह॒व्या जु॑जोषतम् आ या॑त॒मुप॑ नः॒ सचा॑
verses.transliteration: ágnīṣomāv imā́ni no  yuváṃ havyā́ jujoṣatam  ā́ yātam úpa naḥ sácā

translation.text: Agni and Sonia, be ye pleased with these oblations brought to you, And come, together, nigh to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नी॑षोमा पिपृ॒तमर्व॑तो न॒ आ प्या॑यन्तामु॒स्रिया॑ हव्य॒सूदः॑ अ॒स्मे बला॑नि म॒घव॑त्सु धत्तं कृणु॒तं नो॑ अध्व॒रं श्रु॑ष्टि॒मन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: ágnīṣomā pipr̥tám árvato naḥ-  ā́ pyāyantām usríyā havyasū́daḥ  asmé bálāni maghávatsu dhattaṃ  kr̥ṇutáṃ no adhvaráṃ śruṣṭimántam

translation.text: Agni and Soma, cherish well our horses, and let our cows be fat who yield oblations. Grant power to us and to our wealthy patrons, and cause our holy rites to be successful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं स्तोम॒मर्ह॑ते जा॒तवे॑दसे॒ रथ॑मिव॒ सं म॑हेमा मनी॒षया॑ भ॒द्रा हि नः॒ प्रम॑तिरस्य सं॒सद्यग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: imáṃ stómam árhate jātávedase  rátham iva sám mahemā manīṣáyā  bhadrā́ hí naḥ prámatir asya saṃsádi-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: FOR Jâtavedas worthy of our praise will we frame with our mind this eulogy as 'twere a car. For good, in his assembly, is this care of ours. Let us not, in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मै॒ त्वमा॒यज॑से॒ स सा॑धत्यन॒र्वा क्षे॑ति॒ दध॑ते सु॒वीर्य॑म् स तू॑ताव॒ नैन॑मश्नोत्यंह॒तिरग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: yásmai tvám āyájase sá sādhati-  anarvā́ kṣeti dádhate suvī́ryam  sá tūtāva naínam aśnoty aṃhatír  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: The man for whom thou sacrificest prospereth, dwelleth without a foe, gaineth heroic might. He waxeth strong, distress never approacheth him. Let us riot, in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒केम॑ त्वा स॒मिधं॑ सा॒धया॒ धिय॒स्त्वे दे॒वा ह॒विर॑द॒न्त्याहु॑तम् त्वमा॑दि॒त्याँ आ व॑ह॒ तान्ह्यु१॒॑श्मस्यग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: śakéma tvā samídhaṃ sādháyā dhíyas  tvé devā́ havír adanty ā́hutam  tvám ādityā́m̐ ā́ vaha tā́n hy ùśmási-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: May we have power to kindle thee. Fulfil our thoughts. In thee the Gods eat the presented offering, Bring hither the Âdityas, for we long for them. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भरा॑मे॒ध्मं कृ॒णवा॑मा ह॒वींषि॑ ते चि॒तय॑न्तः॒ पर्व॑णापर्वणा व॒यम् जी॒वात॑वे प्रत॒रं सा॑धया॒ धियोऽग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: bhárāmedhmáṃ kr̥ṇávāmā havī́ṃṣi te  citáyantaḥ párvaṇā-parvaṇā vayám  jīvā́tave prataráṃ sādhayā dhíyaḥ-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: We will bring fuel and prepare burnt offerings, reminding thee at each successive festival. Fulfil our thought that so we may prolong our lives. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒शां गो॒पा अ॑स्य चरन्ति ज॒न्तवो॑ द्वि॒पच्च॒ यदु॒त चतु॑ष्पद॒क्तुभिः॑ चि॒त्रः प्र॑के॒त उ॒षसो॑ म॒हाँ अ॒स्यग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: viśā́ṃ gopā́ asya caranti jantávo  dvipác ca yád utá cátuṣpad aktúbhiḥ  citráḥ praketá uṣáso mahā́m̐ asi-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: His ministers move forth, the guardians of the folk, protecting quadruped and biped with their rays. Mighty art thou, the wondrous herald of the Dawn. Let us not in thy friend. ship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ध्व॒र्युरु॒त होता॑सि पू॒र्व्यः प्र॑शा॒स्ता पोता॑ ज॒नुषा॑ पु॒रोहि॑तः विश्वा॑ वि॒द्वाँ आर्त्वि॑ज्या धीर पुष्य॒स्यग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: tvám adhvaryúr utá hótāsi pūrvyáḥ  praśāstā́ pótā janúṣā puróhitaḥ  víśvā vidvā́m̐ ā́rtvijyā dhīra puṣyasi-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: Thou art Presenter and the chief Invoker, thou Director, Purifier, great High Priest by birth. Knowing all priestly work thou perfectest it, Sage. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वि॒श्वतः॑ सु॒प्रती॑कः स॒दृङ्ङसि॑ दू॒रे चि॒त्सन्त॒ळिदि॒वाति॑ रोचसे रात्र्या॑श्चि॒दन्धो॒ अति॑ देव पश्य॒स्यग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: yó viśvátaḥ suprátīkaḥ sadŕ̥ṅṅ ási  dūré cit sán taḷíd ivā́ti rocase  rā́tryāś cid ándho áti deva paśyasi-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: Lovely of form art thou, alike on every side; though far, thou shinest brightly as if close at hand. O God, thou seest through even the dark of night. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पूर्वो॑ देवा भवतु सुन्व॒तो रथो॒ऽस्माकं॒ शंसो॑ अ॒भ्य॑स्तु दू॒ढ्यः॑ तदा जा॑नीतो॒त पु॑ष्यता॒ वचोऽग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: pū́rvo devā bhavatu sunvató rátho  -asmā́kaṃ śáṃso abhy àstu dūḍhyàḥ  tád ā́ jānītotá puṣyatā vácaḥ-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: Gods, foremost he his car who pours libations out, and let our hymn prevail o'er evil-hearted men. Attend to this our speech and make it prosper well. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒धैर्दुः॒शंसाँ॒ अप॑ दू॒ढ्यो॑ जहि दू॒रे वा॒ ये अन्ति॑ वा॒ के चि॑द॒त्रिणः॑ अथा॑ य॒ज्ञाय॑ गृण॒ते सु॒गं कृ॒ध्यग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: vadhaír duḥśáṃsām̐ ápa dūḍhyò jahi  dūré vā yé ánti vā ké cid atríṇaḥ  áthā yajñā́ya gr̥ṇaté sugáṃ kr̥dhi-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: Smite with thy weapons those of evil speech and thought, devouring demons, whether near or tar away. Then to the singer give free way for sacrifice. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदयु॑क्था अरु॒षा रोहि॑ता॒ रथे॒ वात॑जूता वृष॒भस्ये॑व ते॒ रवः॑ आदि॑न्वसि व॒निनो॑ धू॒मके॑तु॒नाग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: yád áyukthā aruṣā́ róhitā ráthe  vā́tajūtā vr̥ṣabhásyeva te rávaḥ  ā́d invasi vaníno dhūmáketunā-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: When to thy chariot thou hadst yoked two red steeds and two ruddy steeds, wind-sped, thy roar was like a bull's. Thou with smoke-bannered flame attackest forest trees. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॑ स्व॒नादु॒त बि॑भ्युः पत॒त्रिणो॑ द्र॒प्सा यत्ते॑ यव॒सादो॒ व्यस्थि॑रन् सु॒गं तत्ते॑ ताव॒केभ्यो॒ रथे॒भ्योऽग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: ádha svanā́d utá bibhyuḥ patatríṇo  drapsā́ yát te yavasā́do vy ásthiran  sugáṃ tát te tāvakébhyo ráthebhyaḥ-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: Then at thy roar the very birds are terrified, when, eating-up the grass, thy sparks fly forth abroad. Then is it easy for thee and thy car to pass. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ धाय॑सेऽवया॒तां म॒रुतां॒ हेळो॒ अद्भु॑तः मृ॒ळा सु नो॒ भूत्वे॑षां॒ मनः॒ पुन॒रग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: ayám mitrásya váruṇasya dhā́yase  -avayātā́m marútāṃ héḷo ádbhutaḥ  mr̥ḷā́ sú no bhū́tv eṣām mánaḥ púnar  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: He hath the Power to soothe Mitra and Varuṇa: wonderful is the Maruts' wrath when they descend. Be gracious; let their hearts he turned to us again. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वो दे॒वाना॑मसि मि॒त्रो अद्भु॑तो॒ वसु॒र्वसू॑नामसि॒ चारु॑रध्व॒रे शर्म॑न्त्स्याम॒ तव॑ स॒प्रथ॑स्त॒मेऽग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: devó devā́nām asi mitró ádbhuto  vásur vásūnām asi cā́rur adhvaré  śárman syāma táva sapráthastame-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: Thou art a God, thou art the wondrous Friend of Gods, the Vasu of the Vasus, fair in sacrifice. Under, thine own most wide protection may we dwell. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्ते॑ भ॒द्रं यत्समि॑द्धः॒ स्वे दमे॒ सोमा॑हुतो॒ जर॑से मृळ॒यत्त॑मः दधा॑सि॒ रत्नं॒ द्रवि॑णं च दा॒शुषेऽग्ने॑ स॒ख्ये मा रि॑षामा व॒यं तव॑
verses.transliteration: tát te bhadráṃ yát sámiddhaḥ své dáme  sómāhuto járase mr̥ḷayáttamaḥ  dádhāsi rátnaṃ dráviṇaṃ ca dāśúṣe-  ágne sakhyé mā́ riṣāmā vayáṃ táva

translation.text: This is thy grace that, kindled in thine own abode, invoked with Soma thou soundest forth most benign, Thou givest wealth and treasure to the worshipper. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मै॒ त्वं सु॑द्रविणो॒ ददा॑शोऽनागा॒स्त्वम॑दिते स॒र्वता॑ता यं भ॒द्रेण॒ शव॑सा चो॒दया॑सि प्र॒जाव॑ता॒ राध॑सा॒ ते स्या॑म
verses.transliteration: yásmai tváṃ sudraviṇo dádāśo  -anāgāstvám adite sarvátātā  yám bhadréṇa śávasā codáyāsi  prajā́vatā rā́dhasā té syāma

translation.text: To whom thou, Lord of goodly riches, grantest freedom from every sin with perfect wholeness, Whom with good strength thou quikenest, with children and wealth-may we be they, Eternal Being.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स त्वम॑ग्ने सौभग॒त्वस्य॑ वि॒द्वान॒स्माक॒मायुः॒ प्र ति॑रे॒ह दे॑व तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: sá tvám agne saubhagatvásya vidvā́n  asmā́kam ā́yuḥ prá tirehá deva  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Such, Agni, thou who knowest all good fortune, God, lengthen here the days of our existence. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वे विरू॑पे चरतः॒ स्वर्थे॑ अ॒न्यान्या॑ व॒त्समुप॑ धापयेते हरि॑र॒न्यस्यां॒ भव॑ति स्व॒धावा॑ञ्छु॒क्रो अ॒न्यस्यां॑ ददृशे सु॒वर्चाः॑
verses.transliteration: dvé vírūpe carataḥ svárthe  anyā́nyā vatsám úpa dhāpayete  hárir anyásyām bhávati svadhā́vāñ  -śukró anyásyāṃ dadr̥śe suvárcāḥ

translation.text: To fair goals travel Two unlike in semblance: each in succession nourishes an infant. One bears a Godlike Babe of golden colour; bright and fair-shining, is he with the other.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दशे॒मं त्वष्टु॑र्जनयन्त॒ गर्भ॒मत॑न्द्रासो युव॒तयो॒ विभृ॑त्रम् ति॒ग्मानी॑कं॒ स्वय॑शसं॒ जने॑षु वि॒रोच॑मानं॒ परि॑ षीं नयन्ति
verses.transliteration: dáśemáṃ tváṣṭur janayanta gárbham  átandrāso yuvatáyo víbhr̥tram  tigmā́nīkaṃ sváyaśasaṃ jáneṣu  virócamānam pári ṣīṃ nayanti

translation.text: Tvashṭar's ten daughters, vigilant and youthful, produced this Infant borne to sundry quarters. They bear around him whose long flames are pointed, fulgent among mankind with native splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रीणि॒ जाना॒ परि॑ भूषन्त्यस्य समु॒द्र एकं॑ दि॒व्येक॑म॒प्सु पूर्वा॒मनु॒ प्र दिशं॒ पार्थि॑वानामृ॒तून्प्र॒शास॒द्वि द॑धावनु॒ष्ठु
verses.transliteration: trī́ṇi jā́nā pári bhūṣanty asya  samudrá ékaṃ divy ékam apsú  pū́rvām ánu prá díśam pā́rthivānām  r̥tū́n praśā́sad ví dadhāv anuṣṭhú

translation.text: Three several places of his birth they honour, in mid-air, in the heaven, and in the waters. Governing in the cast of earthly regions, the seasons hath he stablished in their order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क इ॒मं वो॑ नि॒ण्यमा चि॑केत व॒त्सो मा॒तॄर्ज॑नयत स्व॒धाभिः॑ ब॒ह्वी॒नां गर्भो॑ अ॒पसा॑मु॒पस्था॑न्म॒हान्क॒विर्निश्च॑रति स्व॒धावा॑न्
verses.transliteration: ká imáṃ vo niṇyám ā́ ciketa  vatsó mātr̥̄́r janayata svadhā́bhiḥ  bahvīnā́ṃ gárbho apásām upásthāt-  mahā́n kavír níś carati svadhā́vān

translation.text: Who of you knows this secret One? The Infant by his own nature hath brought forth his Mothers. The germ of many, from the waters' bosom he goes forth, wise and great, of Godlike nature.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒विष्ट्यो॑ वर्धते॒ चारु॑रासु जि॒ह्माना॑मू॒र्ध्वः स्वय॑शा उ॒पस्थे॑ उ॒भे त्वष्टु॑र्बिभ्यतु॒र्जाय॑मानात्प्रती॒ची सिं॒हं प्रति॑ जोषयेते
verses.transliteration: āvíṣṭyo vardhate cā́rur āsu  jihmā́nām ūrdhváḥ sváyaśā upásthe  ubhé tváṣṭur bibhyatur jā́yamānāt  pratīcī́ siṃhám práti joṣayete

translation.text: Visible, fair, he grows in native brightness uplifted in the lap of waving waters. When he was born both Tvashṭar's worlds were frightened: they turn to him and reverence the Lion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भे भ॒द्रे जो॑षयेते॒ न मेने॒ गावो॒ न वा॒श्रा उप॑ तस्थु॒रेवैः॑ स दक्षा॑णां॒ दक्ष॑पतिर्बभूवा॒ञ्जन्ति॒ यं द॑क्षिण॒तो ह॒विर्भिः॑
verses.transliteration: ubhé bhadré joṣayete ná méne  gā́vo ná vāśrā́ úpa tasthur évaiḥ  sá dákṣāṇāṃ dákṣapatir babhūva-  -añjánti yáṃ dakṣiṇató havírbhiḥ

translation.text: The Two auspicious Ones, like women, tend him: like lowing cows they seek him in their manner. He is the Lord of Might among the mighty; him, on the right, they balm with their oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्यं॑यमीति सवि॒तेव॑ बा॒हू उ॒भे सिचौ॑ यतते भी॒म ऋ॒ञ्जन् उच्छु॒क्रमत्क॑मजते सि॒मस्मा॒न्नवा॑ मा॒तृभ्यो॒ वस॑ना जहाति
verses.transliteration: úd yaṃyamīti savitéva bāhū́  ubhé sícau yatate bhīmá r̥ñján  úc chukrám átkam ajate simásmāt-  návā mātŕ̥bhyo vásanā jahāti

translation.text: Like Savitar his arms with might he stretches; awful, he strives grasping the world's two borders. He forces out from all a brilliant vesture, yea, from his Mothers draws he forth new raiment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे॒षं रू॒पं कृ॑णुत॒ उत्त॑रं॒ यत्स॑म्पृञ्चा॒नः सद॑ने॒ गोभि॑र॒द्भिः क॒विर्बु॒ध्नं परि॑ मर्मृज्यते॒ धीः सा दे॒वता॑ता॒ समि॑तिर्बभूव
verses.transliteration: tveṣáṃ rūpáṃ kr̥ṇuta úttaraṃ yát  sampr̥ñcānáḥ sádane góbhir adbhíḥ  kavír budhnám pári marmr̥jyate dhī́ḥ  sā́ devátātā sámitir babhūva

translation.text: He makes him a most noble form of splendour, decking him in his home with milk and waters. The Sage adorns the depths of air with wisdom . this is the meeting where the Gods are worshipped.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रु ते॒ ज्रयः॒ पर्ये॑ति बु॒ध्नं वि॒रोच॑मानं महि॒षस्य॒ धाम॑ विश्वे॑भिरग्ने॒ स्वय॑शोभिरि॒द्धोऽद॑ब्धेभिः पा॒युभिः॑ पाह्य॒स्मान्
verses.transliteration: urú te jráyaḥ páry eti budhnáṃ  virócamānam mahiṣásya dhā́ma  víśvebhir agne sváyaśobhir iddhó  -ádabdhebhiḥ pāyúbhiḥ pāhy asmā́n

translation.text: Wide through the firmament spreads forth triumphant the far-resplendent strength of' thee the Mighty. Kindled by us do thou preserve us, Agni, with all thy self-bright undiminished succours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धन्व॒न्त्स्रोतः॑ कृणुते गा॒तुमू॒र्मिं शु॒क्रैरू॒र्मिभि॑र॒भि न॑क्षति॒ क्षाम् विश्वा॒ सना॑नि ज॒ठरे॑षु धत्ते॒ऽन्तर्नवा॑सु चरति प्र॒सूषु॑
verses.transliteration: dhánvan srótaḥ kr̥ṇute gātúm ūrmíṃ  śukraír ūrmíbhir abhí nakṣati kṣā́m  víśvā sánāni jaṭháreṣu dhatte  -antár návāsu carati prasū́ṣu

translation.text: In dry spots he makes stream, and course, and torrent, and inundates the earth with floods that glisten. All ancient things within his maw he gathers, and moves among the new fresh-sprouting grasses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा नो॑ अग्ने स॒मिधा॑ वृधा॒नो रे॒वत्पा॑वक॒ श्रव॑से॒ वि भा॑हि तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: evā́ no agne samídhā vr̥dhānó  revát pāvaka śrávase ví bhāhi  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Fed with our fuel, purifying Agni, so blaze to us auspiciously for glory. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स प्र॒त्नथा॒ सह॑सा॒ जाय॑मानः स॒द्यः काव्या॑नि॒ बळ॑धत्त॒ विश्वा॑ आप॑श्च मि॒त्रं धि॒षणा॑ च साधन्दे॒वा अ॒ग्निं धा॑रयन्द्रविणो॒दाम्
verses.transliteration: sá pratnáthā sáhasā jā́yamānaḥ  sadyáḥ kā́vyāni báḷ adhatta víśvā  ā́paś ca mitráṃ dhiṣáṇā ca sādhan  devā́ agníṃ dhārayan draviṇodā́m

translation.text: HE in the ancient way by strength engendered, lo! straight hath taken to himself all wisdom. The waters and the bowl have made him friendly. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स पूर्व॑या नि॒विदा॑ क॒व्यता॒योरि॒माः प्र॒जा अ॑जनय॒न्मनू॑नाम् वि॒वस्व॑ता॒ चक्ष॑सा॒ द्याम॒पश्च॑ दे॒वा अ॒ग्निं धा॑रयन्द्रविणो॒दाम्
verses.transliteration: sá pū́rvayā nivídā kavyátāyór  imā́ḥ prajā́ ajanayan mánūnām  vivásvatā cákṣasā dyā́m apáś ca  devā́ agníṃ dhārayan draviṇodā́m

translation.text: At Âyu's ancient call he by his wisdom gave all this progeny of men their being, And, by refulgent light, heaven and the waters. The Gods possessed the wealth. bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमी॑ळत प्रथ॒मं य॑ज्ञ॒साधं॒ विश॒ आरी॒राहु॑तमृञ्जसा॒नम् ऊ॒र्जः पु॒त्रं भ॑र॒तं सृ॒प्रदा॑नुं दे॒वा अ॒ग्निं धा॑रयन्द्रविणो॒दाम्
verses.transliteration: tám īḷata prathamáṃ yajñasā́dhaṃ  víśa ā́rīr ā́hutam r̥ñjasānám  ūrjáḥ putrám bharatáṃ sr̥prádānuṃ  devā́ agníṃ dhārayan draviṇodā́m

translation.text: Praise him, ye Aryan folk, as chief performer of sacrifice adored and ever toiling, Well-tended, Son of Strength, the Constant Giver. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑ पुरु॒वार॑पुष्टिर्वि॒दद्गा॒तुं तन॑याय स्व॒र्वित् वि॒शां गो॒पा ज॑नि॒ता रोद॑स्योर्दे॒वा अ॒ग्निं धा॑रयन्द्रविणो॒दाम्
verses.transliteration: sá mātaríśvā puruvā́rapuṣṭir  vidád gātúṃ tánayāya svarvít  viśā́ṃ gopā́ janitā́ ródasyor  devā́ agníṃ dhārayan draviṇodā́m

translation.text: That Mâtariṣvan rich in wealth and treasure, light-winner, finds a pathway for his offispring. Guard of our folk, Father of earth and heaven. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नक्तो॒षासा॒ वर्ण॑मा॒मेम्या॑ने धा॒पये॑ते॒ शिशु॒मेकं॑ समी॒ची द्यावा॒क्षामा॑ रु॒क्मो अ॒न्तर्वि भा॑ति दे॒वा अ॒ग्निं धा॑रयन्द्रविणो॒दाम्
verses.transliteration: náktoṣā́sā várṇam āmémyāne  dhāpáyete śíśum ékaṃ samīcī́  dyā́vākṣā́mā rukmó antár ví bhāti  devā́ agníṃ dhārayan draviṇodā́m

translation.text: Night and Dawn, changing each the other's colour, meeting together suckle one same Infant: Golden between the heaven and earth he shineth. The Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रा॒यो बु॒ध्नः सं॒गम॑नो॒ वसू॑नां य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुर्म॑न्म॒साध॑नो॒ वेः अ॒मृ॒त॒त्वं रक्ष॑माणास एनं दे॒वा अ॒ग्निं धा॑रयन्द्रविणो॒दाम्
verses.transliteration: rāyó budhnáḥ saṃgámano vásūnāṃ  yajñásya ketúr manmasā́dhano véḥ  amr̥tatváṃ rákṣamāṇāsa enaṃ  devā́ agníṃ dhārayan draviṇodā́m

translation.text: Root of wealth, gathering-place of treasures, banner of sacrifice, who grants the suppliant's wishes: Preserving him as their own life immortal, the Gods possessed the wealth-bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू च॑ पु॒रा च॒ सद॑नं रयी॒णां जा॒तस्य॑ च॒ जाय॑मानस्य च॒ क्षाम् स॒तश्च॑ गो॒पां भव॑तश्च॒ भूरे॑र्दे॒वा अ॒ग्निं धा॑रयन्द्रविणो॒दाम्
verses.transliteration: nū́ ca purā́ ca sádanaṃ rayīṇā́ṃ  jātásya ca jā́yamānasya ca kṣā́m  satáś ca gopā́m bhávataś ca bhū́rer  devā́ agníṃ dhārayan draviṇodā́m

translation.text: Now and of old the home of wealth, the mansion of what is born and what was born aforetime, Guard of what is and what will be hereafter,– the Gods possessed the wealth bestowing Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्र॒वि॒णो॒दा द्रवि॑णसस्तु॒रस्य॑ द्रविणो॒दाः सन॑रस्य॒ प्र यं॑सत् द्र॒वि॒णो॒दा वी॒रव॑ती॒मिषं॑ नो द्रविणो॒दा रा॑सते दी॒र्घमायुः॑
verses.transliteration: draviṇodā́ dráviṇasas turásya  draviṇodā́ḥ sánarasya prá yaṃsat  draviṇodā́ vīrávatīm íṣaṃ no  draviṇodā́ rāsate dīrghám ā́yuḥ

translation.text: May the Wealth-Giver grant us conquering riches; may the Wealth-Giver grant us wealth with heroes. May the Wealth-Giver grant us food with offspring, and length of days may the Wealth-Giver send us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा नो॑ अग्ने स॒मिधा॑ वृधा॒नो रे॒वत्पा॑वक॒ श्रव॑से॒ वि भा॑हि तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: evā́ no agne samídhā vr̥dhānó  revát pāvaka śrávase ví bhāhi  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Fed with our fuel, purifying Agni, so blaze to us auspiciously for glory. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॑ नः॒ शोशु॑चद॒घमग्ने॑ शुशु॒ग्ध्या र॒यिम् अप॑ नः॒ शोशु॑चद॒घम्
verses.transliteration: ápa naḥ śóśucad aghám  ágne śuśugdhy ā́ rayím  ápa naḥ śóśucad aghám

translation.text: CHASING with light our sin away, O Agni, shine thou wealth on us. May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒क्षे॒त्रि॒या सु॑गातु॒या व॑सू॒या च॑ यजामहे अप॑ नः॒ शोशु॑चद॒घम्
verses.transliteration: sukṣetriyā́ sugātuyā́  vasūyā́ ca yajāmahe  ápa naḥ śóśucad aghám

translation.text: For goodly fields, for pleasant homes, for wealth we sacrifice to thee. May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यद्भन्दि॑ष्ठ एषां॒ प्रास्माका॑सश्च सू॒रयः॑ अप॑ नः॒ शोशु॑चद॒घम्
verses.transliteration: prá yád bhándiṣṭha eṣām  prā́smā́kāsaś ca sūráyaḥ  ápa naḥ śóśucad aghám

translation.text: Best praiser of all these be he; foremost, our chiefs who sacrifice. May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यत्ते॑ अग्ने सू॒रयो॒ जाये॑महि॒ प्र ते॑ व॒यम् अप॑ नः॒ शोशु॑चद॒घम्
verses.transliteration: prá yát te agne sūráyo  jā́yemahi prá te vayám  ápa naḥ śóśucad aghám

translation.text: So that thy worshippers and we, thine, Agni, in our sons may live. May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यद॒ग्नेः सह॑स्वतो वि॒श्वतो॒ यन्ति॑ भा॒नवः॑ अप॑ नः॒ शोशु॑चद॒घम्
verses.transliteration: prá yád agnéḥ sáhasvato  viśváto yánti bhānávaḥ  ápa naḥ śóśucad aghám

translation.text: As ever- conquering Agni's beams of splendour go to every side, May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं हि वि॑श्वतोमुख वि॒श्वतः॑ परि॒भूरसि॑ अप॑ नः॒ शोशु॑चद॒घम्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ hí viśvatomukha  viśvátaḥ paribhū́r ási  ápa naḥ śóśucad aghám

translation.text: To every side thy face is turned, thou art triumphant everywhere. May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्विषो॑ नो विश्वतोमु॒खाति॑ ना॒वेव॑ पारय अप॑ नः॒ शोशु॑चद॒घम्
verses.transliteration: dvíṣo no viśvatomukha-  -áti nāvéva pāraya  ápa naḥ śóśucad aghám

translation.text: O thou whose face looks every way, bear us past foes as in a ship. May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नः॒ सिन्धु॑मिव ना॒वयाति॑ पर्षा स्व॒स्तये॑ अप॑ नः॒ शोशु॑चद॒घम्
verses.transliteration: sá naḥ síndhum iva nāváyā-  -áti parṣā svastáye  ápa naḥ śóśucad aghám

translation.text: As in a ship, convey thou us for our advantage o'er the flood. May his light chase our sin away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वै॒श्वा॒न॒रस्य॑ सुम॒तौ स्या॑म॒ राजा॒ हि कं॒ भुव॑नानामभि॒श्रीः इ॒तो जा॒तो विश्व॑मि॒दं वि च॑ष्टे वैश्वान॒रो य॑तते॒ सूर्ये॑ण
verses.transliteration: vaiśvānarásya sumataú syāma  rā́jā hí kam bhúvanānām abhiśrī́ḥ  itó jātó víśvam idáṃ ví caṣṭe  vaiśvānaró yatate sū́ryeṇa

translation.text: STILL in Vaiṣvânara's grace may we continue: yea, he is King supreme o'er all things living. Sprung hence to life upon this All he looketh. Vaiṣvânara hath rivalry with Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒ष्टो दि॒वि पृ॒ष्टो अ॒ग्निः पृ॑थि॒व्यां पृ॒ष्टो विश्वा॒ ओष॑धी॒रा वि॑वेश वै॒श्वा॒न॒रः सह॑सा पृ॒ष्टो अ॒ग्निः स नो॒ दिवा॒ स रि॒षः पा॑तु॒ नक्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: pr̥ṣṭó diví pr̥ṣṭó agníḥ pr̥thivyā́m  pr̥ṣṭó víśvā óṣadhīr ā́ viveśa  vaiśvānaráḥ sáhasā pr̥ṣṭó agníḥ  sá no dívā sá riṣáḥ pātu náktam

translation.text: Present in heaven, in earth, all-present Agni,– all plants that grow on ground hath he pervaded. May Agni, may Vaiṣvânara with vigour, present, preserve us day and night from foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वैश्वा॑नर॒ तव॒ तत्स॒त्यम॑स्त्व॒स्मान्रायो॑ म॒घवा॑नः सचन्ताम् तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: vaíśvānara táva tát satyám astu-  asmā́n rā́yo maghávānaḥ sacantām  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Be this thy truth, Vaiṣvânara, to us-ward: let wealth in rich abundance gather round us. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒तवे॑दसे सुनवाम॒ सोम॑मरातीय॒तो नि द॑हाति॒ वेदः॑ स नः॑ पर्ष॒दति॑ दु॒र्गाणि॒ विश्वा॑ ना॒वेव॒ सिन्धुं॑ दुरि॒तात्य॒ग्निः
verses.transliteration: jātávedase sunavāma sómam  arātīyató ní dahāti védaḥ  sá naḥ parṣad áti durgā́ṇi víśvā  nāvéva síndhuṃ duritā́ty agníḥ

translation.text: FOR Jâtavedas let us press the Soma: may he consume the wealth of the malignant. May Agni carry us through all our troubles, through grief as in a boat across the river.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स यो वृषा॒ वृष्ण्ये॑भिः॒ समो॑का म॒हो दि॒वः पृ॑थि॒व्याश्च॑ स॒म्राट् स॒ती॒नस॑त्वा॒ हव्यो॒ भरे॑षु म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: sá yó vŕ̥ṣā vŕ̥ṣṇyebhiḥ sámokāḥ-  mahó diváḥ pr̥thivyā́ś ca samrā́ṭ  satīnásatvā hávyo bháreṣu  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: MAY he who hath his home with strength, the Mighty, the King supreme of earth and spacious heaven, Lord of true power, to he invoked in battles,– may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्याना॑प्तः॒ सूर्य॑स्येव॒ यामो॒ भरे॑भरे वृत्र॒हा शुष्मो॒ अस्ति॑ वृष॑न्तमः॒ सखि॑भिः॒ स्वेभि॒रेवै॑र्म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: yásyā́nāptaḥ sū́ryasyeva yā́mo  bháre-bhare vr̥trahā́ śúṣmo ásti  vŕ̥ṣantamaḥ sákhibhiḥ svébhir évair  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: Whose way is unattainable like Sûrya's: he in each fight is the strong Vr̥itra-slayer, Mightiest with his Friends in his own courses. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो न यस्य॒ रेत॑सो॒ दुघा॑नाः॒ पन्था॑सो॒ यन्ति॒ शव॒साप॑रीताः त॒रद्द्वे॑षाः सास॒हिः पौंस्ये॑भिर्म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: divó ná yásya rétaso dúghānāḥ  pánthāso yánti śávasā́parītāḥ  taráddveṣāḥ sāsahíḥ paúṃsyebhir  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: Whose paths go forth in their great might resistless, forthmilking, as it were, heaven's genial moisture. With manly strength triumphant, foe-subduer,– may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सो अङ्गि॑रोभि॒रङ्गि॑रस्तमो भू॒द्वृषा॒ वृष॑भिः॒ सखि॑भिः॒ सखा॒ सन् ऋ॒ग्मिभि॑र्ऋ॒ग्मी गा॒तुभि॒र्ज्येष्ठो॑ म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: só áṅgirobhir áṅgirastamo bhūd  vŕ̥ṣā vŕ̥ṣabhiḥ sákhibhiḥ sákhā sán  r̥gmíbhir r̥gmī́ gātúbhir jyéṣṭho  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: Among Angirases he was the chiefest, a Friend with friends, mighty amid the mighty. Praiser mid praisers, honoured most of singers. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सू॒नुभि॒र्न रु॒द्रेभि॒र्ऋभ्वा॑ नृ॒षाह्ये॑ सास॒ह्वाँ अ॒मित्रा॑न् सनी॑ळेभिः श्रव॒स्या॑नि॒ तूर्व॑न्म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: sá sūnúbhir ná rudrébhir ŕ̥bhvā  nr̥ṣā́hye sāsahvā́m̐ amítrān  sánīḷebhiḥ śravasyā̀ni tū́rvan  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: Strong with the Rudras as with his own children, in manly battle conquering his foemen ' With his close comrades doing deeds of glory,– may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स म॑न्यु॒मीः स॒मद॑नस्य क॒र्तास्माके॑भि॒र्नृभिः॒ सूर्यं॑ सनत् अ॒स्मिन्नह॒न्त्सत्प॑तिः पुरुहू॒तो म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: sá manyumī́ḥ samádanasya kartā́-  -asmā́kebhir nŕ̥bhiḥ sū́ryaṃ sanat  asmínn áhan sátpatiḥ puruhūtó  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: Humbler of pride, exciter of the conflict, the Lord of heroes, God invoked of many, May he this day gain with our men the sunlight. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be oursuccour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमू॒तयो॑ रणय॒ञ्छूर॑सातौ॒ तं क्षेम॑स्य क्षि॒तयः॑ कृण्वत॒ त्राम् स विश्व॑स्य क॒रुण॑स्येश॒ एको॑ म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: tám ūtáyo raṇayañ chū́rasātau  táṃ kṣémasya kṣitáyaḥ kr̥ṇvata trā́m  sá víśvasya karúṇasyeśa éko  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: His help hath made him cheerer in the battle, the folk have made him guardian of their comfort. Sole Lord is he of every holy service. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॑प्सन्त॒ शव॑स उत्स॒वेषु॒ नरो॒ नर॒मव॑से॒ तं धना॑य सो अ॒न्धे चि॒त्तम॑सि॒ ज्योति॑र्विदन्म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: tám apsanta śávasa utsavéṣu  náro náram ávase táṃ dhánāya  só andhé cit támasi jyótir vidat-  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: To him the Hero, on high days of prowess, heroes for help and booty shall betake them. He hath found light even in the blinding darkness. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स स॒व्येन॑ यमति॒ व्राध॑तश्चि॒त्स द॑क्षि॒णे संगृ॑भीता कृ॒तानि॑ स की॒रिणा॑ चि॒त्सनि॑ता॒ धना॑नि म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: sá savyéna yamati vrā́dhataś cit  sá dakṣiṇé sáṃgr̥bhītā kr̥tā́ni  sá kīríṇā cit sánitā dhánāni  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: He with his left hand checketh even the mighty, and with his righthand gathereth up the booty. Even with the humble he acquireth riches. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स ग्रामे॑भिः॒ सनि॑ता॒ स रथे॑भिर्वि॒दे विश्वा॑भिः कृ॒ष्टिभि॒र्न्व१॒॑द्य स पौंस्ये॑भिरभि॒भूरश॑स्तीर्म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: sá grā́mebhiḥ sánitā sá ráthebhir  vidé víśvābhiḥ kr̥ṣṭíbhir nv àdyá  sá paúṃsyebhir abhibhū́r áśastīr  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: With hosts on foot and cars he winneth treasures: well is he known this day by all the people. With manly might he conquereth those who hate him. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स जा॒मिभि॒र्यत्स॒मजा॑ति मी॒ळ्हेऽजा॑मिभिर्वा पुरुहू॒त एवैः॑ अ॒पां तो॒कस्य॒ तन॑यस्य जे॒षे म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: sá jāmíbhir yát samájāti mīḷhé  -ájāmibhir vā puruhūtá évaiḥ  apā́ṃ tokásya tánayasya jeṣé  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: When in his ways with kinsmen or with strangers he speedeth to the fight, invoked of many, For gain of waters, and of sons and grandsons, may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स व॑ज्र॒भृद्द॑स्यु॒हा भी॒म उ॒ग्रः स॒हस्र॑चेताः श॒तनी॑थ॒ ऋभ्वा॑ च॒म्री॒षो न शव॑सा॒ पाञ्च॑जन्यो म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: sá vajrabhŕ̥d dasyuhā́ bhīmá ugráḥ  sahásracetāḥ śatánītha ŕ̥bhvā  camrīṣó ná śávasā pā́ñcajanyo  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: Awful and fierce, fiend-slayer, thunder-wielder, with boundless knowledge, hymned by hundreds, mighty, In strength like Soma, guard of the Five Peoples, may Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्य॒ वज्रः॑ क्रन्दति॒ स्मत्स्व॒र्षा दि॒वो न त्वे॒षो र॒वथः॒ शिमी॑वान् तं स॑चन्ते स॒नय॒स्तं धना॑नि म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: tásya vájraḥ krandati smát svarṣā́ḥ-  divó ná tveṣó raváthaḥ śímīvān  táṃ sacante sanáyas táṃ dhánāni  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: Winning the light, hitherward roars his thunder like the terrific mighty voice of Heaven. Rich gifts and treasures evermore attend him. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्याज॑स्रं॒ शव॑सा॒ मान॑मु॒क्थं प॑रिभु॒जद्रोद॑सी वि॒श्वतः॑ सीम् स पा॑रिष॒त्क्रतु॑भिर्मन्दसा॒नो म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: yásyā́jasraṃ śávasā mā́nam ukthám  paribhujád ródasī viśvátaḥ sīm  sá pāriṣat krátubhir mandasānó  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: Whose home eternal through his strength surrounds him on every side, his laud, the earth and heaven, May he, delighted with our service, save us. May Indra, girt by Maruts, be our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यस्य॑ दे॒वा दे॒वता॒ न मर्ता॒ आप॑श्च॒न शव॑सो॒ अन्त॑मा॒पुः स प्र॒रिक्वा॒ त्वक्ष॑सा॒ क्ष्मो दि॒वश्च॑ म॒रुत्वा॑न्नो भव॒त्विन्द्र॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: ná yásya devā́ devátā ná mártāḥ-  ā́paś caná śávaso ántam āpúḥ  sá praríkvā tvákṣasā kṣmó diváś ca  marútvān no bhavatv índra ūtī́

translation.text: The limit of whose power not Gods by Godhead, nor mortal men have reached, nor yet the Waters. Both Earth and Heaven in vigour he surpasseth. May Indra, girt by Maruts, he our succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रो॒हिच्छ्या॒वा सु॒मदं॑शुर्लला॒मीर्द्यु॒क्षा रा॒य ऋ॒ज्राश्व॑स्य वृष॑ण्वन्तं॒ बिभ्र॑ती धू॒र्षु रथं॑ म॒न्द्रा चि॑केत॒ नाहु॑षीषु वि॒क्षु
verses.transliteration: rohíc chyāvā́ sumádaṃśur lalāmī́r  dyukṣā́ rāyá r̥jrā́śvasya  vŕ̥ṣaṇvantam bíbhratī dhūrṣú rátham  mandrā́ ciketa nā́huṣīṣu vikṣú

translation.text: The red and tawny mare, blaze-marked, high standing, celestial who, to bring R̥ijrâṣva riches, Drew at the pole the chariot yoked with stallions, joyous, among the hosts of men was noted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तत्त्यत्त॑ इन्द्र॒ वृष्ण॑ उ॒क्थं वा॑र्षागि॒रा अ॒भि गृ॑णन्ति॒ राधः॑ ऋ॒ज्राश्वः॒ प्रष्टि॑भिरम्ब॒रीषः॑ स॒हदे॑वो॒ भय॑मानः सु॒राधाः॑
verses.transliteration: etát tyát ta indra vŕ̥ṣṇa uktháṃ  vārṣāgirā́ abhí gr̥ṇanti rā́dhaḥ  r̥jrā́śvaḥ práṣṭibhir ambarī́ṣaḥ  sahádevo bháyamānaḥ surā́dhāḥ

translation.text: The Vârshâgiras unto thee, O Indra, the Mighty One, sing forth this laud to please thee, R̥ijrâṣva with his fellows, Ambarîsha, Surâdhâs, Sahadeva, Bhayamâna.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दस्यू॒ञ्छिम्यूँ॑श्च पुरुहू॒त एवै॑र्ह॒त्वा पृ॑थि॒व्यां शर्वा॒ नि ब॑र्हीत् सन॒त्क्षेत्रं॒ सखि॑भिः श्वि॒त्न्येभिः॒ सन॒त्सूर्यं॒ सन॑द॒पः सु॒वज्रः॑
verses.transliteration: dásyūñ chímyūṃś ca puruhūtá évair  hatvā́ pr̥thivyā́ṃ śárvā ní barhīt  sánat kṣétraṃ sákhibhiḥ śvitnyébhiḥ  sánat sū́ryaṃ sánad apáḥ suvájraḥ

translation.text: He, much invoked, hath slain Dasyus and Ṣimyus, after his wont, and laid them low with arrows. The mighty Thunderer with his fair-complexioned friends won the land, the sunlight, and the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्वाहेन्द्रो॑ अधिव॒क्ता नो॑ अ॒स्त्वप॑रिह्वृताः सनुयाम॒ वाज॑म् तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: viśvā́héndro adhivaktā́ no astu-  áparihvr̥tāḥ sanuyāma vā́jam  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: May Indra evermore be our protector, and unimperilled may we win the booty. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र म॒न्दिने॑ पितु॒मद॑र्चता॒ वचो॒ यः कृ॒ष्णग॑र्भा नि॒रह॑न्नृ॒जिश्व॑ना अ॒व॒स्यवो॒ वृष॑णं॒ वज्र॑दक्षिणं म॒रुत्व॑न्तं स॒ख्याय॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: prá mandíne pitumád arcatā váco  yáḥ kr̥ṣṇágarbhā niráhann r̥jíśvanā  avasyávo vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vájradakṣiṇam  marútvantaṃ sakhyā́ya havāmahe

translation.text: SING, with oblation, praise to him who maketh glad, who with R̥ijiṣvan drove the dusky brood away. Fain for help, him the strong whose right hand wields the bolt, him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो व्यं॑सं जाहृषा॒णेन॑ म॒न्युना॒ यः शम्ब॑रं॒ यो अह॒न्पिप्रु॑मव्र॒तम् इन्द्रो॒ यः शुष्ण॑म॒शुषं॒ न्यावृ॑णङ्म॒रुत्व॑न्तं स॒ख्याय॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: yó vyàṃsaṃ jāhr̥ṣāṇéna manyúnā  yáḥ śámbaraṃ yó áhan píprum avratám  índro yáḥ śúṣṇam aśúṣaṃ ny ā́vr̥ṇak-  marútvantaṃ sakhyā́ya havāmahe

translation.text: Indra, who with triumphant wrath smote Vyansa down, and Ṣambara, and Pipru the unrighteous one; Who extirpated Ṣushṇa the insatiate, him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी पौंस्यं॑ म॒हद्यस्य॑ व्र॒ते वरु॑णो॒ यस्य॒ सूर्यः॑ यस्येन्द्र॑स्य॒ सिन्ध॑वः॒ सश्च॑ति व्र॒तं म॒रुत्व॑न्तं स॒ख्याय॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: yásya dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ paúṃsyam mahád  yásya vraté váruṇo yásya sū́ryaḥ  yásyéndrasya síndhavaḥ sáścati vratám  marútvantaṃ sakhyā́ya havāmahe

translation.text: He whose great work of manly might is heaven and earth, and Varuṇa and Sûrya keep his holy law; Indra, whose law the rivers follow as they flow,– him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अश्वा॑नां॒ यो गवां॒ गोप॑तिर्व॒शी य आ॑रि॒तः कर्म॑णिकर्मणि स्थि॒रः वी॒ळोश्चि॒दिन्द्रो॒ यो असु॑न्वतो व॒धो म॒रुत्व॑न्तं स॒ख्याय॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: yó áśvānāṃ yó gávāṃ gópatir vaśī́  yá āritáḥ kármaṇi-karmaṇi sthiráḥ  vīḷóś cid índro yó ásunvato vadhó  marútvantaṃ sakhyā́ya havāmahe

translation.text: He who is Lord and Master of the steeds and kine, honoured -the firm and sure- at every holy act; Stayer even of the strong who pours no offering out, -him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो विश्व॑स्य॒ जग॑तः प्राण॒तस्पति॒र्यो ब्र॒ह्मणे॑ प्रथ॒मो गा अवि॑न्दत् इन्द्रो॒ यो दस्यूँ॒रध॑राँ अ॒वाति॑रन्म॒रुत्व॑न्तं स॒ख्याय॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: yó víśvasya jágataḥ prāṇatás pátir  yó brahmáṇe prathamó gā́ ávindat  índro yó dásyūm̐r ádharām̐ avā́tirat-  marútvantaṃ sakhyā́ya havāmahe

translation.text: He who is Lord of all the world that moves and breathes, who for the Brahman first before all found the Cows; Indra who cast the Dasyus down beneath his feet,– him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः शूरे॑भि॒र्हव्यो॒ यश्च॑ भी॒रुभि॒र्यो धाव॑द्भिर्हू॒यते॒ यश्च॑ जि॒ग्युभिः॑ इन्द्रं॒ यं विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना॒भि सं॑द॒धुर्म॒रुत्व॑न्तं स॒ख्याय॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: yáḥ śū́rebhir hávyo yáś ca bhīrúbhir  yó dhā́vadbhir hūyáte yáś ca jigyúbhiḥ  índraṃ yáṃ víśvā bhúvanābhí saṃdadhúr  marútvantaṃ sakhyā́ya havāmahe

translation.text: Whom cowards must invoke and valiant men of war, invoked by those who conquer and by those who flee; Indra, to whom all beings turn their constant thought,– him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रु॒द्राणा॑मेति प्र॒दिशा॑ विचक्ष॒णो रु॒द्रेभि॒र्योषा॑ तनुते पृ॒थु ज्रयः॑ इन्द्रं॑ मनी॒षा अ॒भ्य॑र्चति श्रु॒तं म॒रुत्व॑न्तं स॒ख्याय॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: rudrā́ṇām eti pradíśā vicakṣaṇó  rudrébhir yóṣā tanute pr̥thú jráyaḥ  índram manīṣā́ abhy àrcati śrutám  marútvantaṃ sakhyā́ya havāmahe

translation.text: Refulgent in the Rudras' region he proceeds, and with the Rudras through the wide space speeds the Dame. The hymn of praise extols Indra the far-renowned: him girt by Maruts we invoke to be our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वा॑ मरुत्वः पर॒मे स॒धस्थे॒ यद्वा॑व॒मे वृ॒जने॑ मा॒दया॑से अत॒ आ या॑ह्यध्व॒रं नो॒ अच्छा॑ त्वा॒या ह॒विश्च॑कृमा सत्यराधः
verses.transliteration: yád vā marutvaḥ paramé sadhásthe  yád vāvamé vr̥jáne mādáyāse  áta ā́ yāhy adhvaráṃ no áchā  tvāyā́ havíś cakr̥mā satyarādhaḥ

translation.text: O girt by Maruts, whether thou delight thee in loftiest gathering-place or lowly dwelling, Come thence unto our rite, true boon-best-ower: through love of thee have we prepared oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वा॒येन्द्र॒ सोमं॑ सुषुमा सुदक्ष त्वा॒या ह॒विश्च॑कृमा ब्रह्मवाहः अधा॑ नियुत्वः॒ सग॑णो म॒रुद्भि॑र॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे ब॒र्हिषि॑ मादयस्व
verses.transliteration: tvāyéndra sómaṃ suṣumā sudakṣa  tvāyā́ havíś cakr̥mā brahmavāhaḥ  ádhā niyutvaḥ ságaṇo marúdbhir  asmín yajñé barhíṣi mādayasva

translation.text: We, fain for thee, strong Indra, have pressed Soma, and, O thou sought with prayer, have made oblations. Now at this sacrifice, with all thy Maruts, on sacred grass, O team-borne God, rejoice thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा॒दय॑स्व॒ हरि॑भि॒र्ये त॑ इन्द्र॒ वि ष्य॑स्व॒ शिप्रे॒ वि सृ॑जस्व॒ धेने॑ आ त्वा॑ सुशिप्र॒ हर॑यो वहन्तू॒शन्ह॒व्यानि॒ प्रति॑ नो जुषस्व
verses.transliteration: mādáyasva háribhir yé ta indra  ví ṣyasva śípre ví sr̥jasva dhéne  ā́ tvā suśipra hárayo vahantu-  -uśán havyā́ni práti no juṣasva

translation.text: Rejoice thee with thine own Bay Steeds, O Indra, unclose thy jaws and let thy lips be open. Thou with the fair cheek, let thy Bay Steeds bring thee: gracious to us, he pleased with our oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒रुत्स्तो॑त्रस्य वृ॒जन॑स्य गो॒पा व॒यमिन्द्रे॑ण सनुयाम॒ वाज॑म् तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: marútstotrasya vr̥jánasya gopā́ḥ-  vayám índreṇa sanuyāma vā́jam  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Guards of the camp whose praisers are the Maruts, may we through Indra, get ourselves the booty. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां ते॒ धियं॒ प्र भ॑रे म॒हो म॒हीम॒स्य स्तो॒त्रे धि॒षणा॒ यत्त॑ आन॒जे तमु॑त्स॒वे च॑ प्रस॒वे च॑ सास॒हिमिन्द्रं॑ दे॒वासः॒ शव॑सामद॒न्ननु॑
verses.transliteration: imā́ṃ te dhíyam prá bhare mahó mahī́m  asyá stotré dhiṣáṇā yát ta ānajé  tám utsavé ca prasavé ca sāsahím  índraṃ devā́saḥ śávasāmadann ánu

translation.text: To thee the Mighty One I bring this mighty hymn, for thy desire hath been gratified by my laud. In Indra, yea in him victorious through his strength, the Gods have joyed at feast and when the Soma flowed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य श्रवो॑ न॒द्यः॑ स॒प्त बि॑भ्रति॒ द्यावा॒क्षामा॑ पृथि॒वी द॑र्श॒तं वपुः॑ अ॒स्मे सू॑र्याचन्द्र॒मसा॑भि॒चक्षे॑ श्र॒द्धे कमि॑न्द्र चरतो वितर्तु॒रम्
verses.transliteration: asyá śrávo nadyàḥ saptá bibhrati  dyā́vākṣā́mā pr̥thivī́ darśatáṃ vápuḥ  asmé sūryācandramásābhicákṣe  śraddhé kám indra carato vitarturám

translation.text: The Seven Rivers bear his glory far and wide, and heaven and sky and earth display his comely form. The Sun and Moon in change alternate run their course, that we, O Indra, may behold and may have faith.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं स्मा॒ रथं॑ मघव॒न्प्राव॑ सा॒तये॒ जैत्रं॒ यं ते॑ अनु॒मदा॑म संग॒मे आ॒जा न॑ इन्द्र॒ मन॑सा पुरुष्टुत त्वा॒यद्भ्यो॑ मघव॒ञ्छर्म॑ यच्छ नः
verses.transliteration: táṃ smā rátham maghavan prā́va sātáye  jaítraṃ yáṃ te anumádāma saṃgamé  ājā́ na indra mánasā puruṣṭuta  tvāyádbhyo maghavañ chárma yacha naḥ

translation.text: Maghavan, grant us that same car to bring us spoil, thy conquering car in which we joy in shock of fight. Thou, Indra, whom our hearts praise highly in the war, grant shelter, Maghavan, to us who love thee well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं ज॑येम॒ त्वया॑ यु॒जा वृत॑म॒स्माक॒मंश॒मुद॑वा॒ भरे॑भरे अ॒स्मभ्य॑मिन्द्र॒ वरि॑वः सु॒गं कृ॑धि॒ प्र शत्रू॑णां मघव॒न्वृष्ण्या॑ रुज
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ jayema tváyā yujā́ vŕ̥tam  asmā́kam áṃśam úd avā bháre-bhare  asmábhyam indra várivaḥ sugáṃ kr̥dhi  prá śátrūṇām maghavan vŕ̥ṣṇyā ruja

translation.text: Encourage thou our side in every fight: may we, with thee for our ally, conquer the foeman's host. Indra, bestow on us joy and felicity break down, O Maghavan, the vigour of our foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाना॒ हि त्वा॒ हव॑माना॒ जना॑ इ॒मे धना॑नां धर्त॒रव॑सा विप॒न्यवः॑ अ॒स्माकं॑ स्मा॒ रथ॒मा ति॑ष्ठ सा॒तये॒ जैत्रं॒ ही॑न्द्र॒ निभृ॑तं॒ मन॒स्तव॑
verses.transliteration: nā́nā hí tvā hávamānā jánā imé  dhánānāṃ dhartar ávasā vipanyávaḥ  asmā́kaṃ smā rátham ā́ tiṣṭha sātáye  jaítraṃ hī̀ndra níbhr̥tam mánas táva

translation.text: For here in divers ways these men invoking thee, holder of treasures, sing hymns to win thine aid. Ascend the car that thou mayest bring spoil to us, for, Indra, thy fixt winneth the victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गो॒जिता॑ बा॒हू अमि॑तक्रतुः सि॒मः कर्म॑न्कर्मञ्छ॒तमू॑तिः खजंक॒रः अ॒क॒ल्प इन्द्रः॑ प्रति॒मान॒मोज॒साथा॒ जना॒ वि ह्व॑यन्ते सिषा॒सवः॑
verses.transliteration: gojítā bāhū́ ámitakratuḥ simáḥ  kárman-karmañ chatámūtiḥ khajaṃkaráḥ  akalpá índraḥ pratimā́nam ójasā-  -áthā jánā ví hvayante siṣāsávaḥ

translation.text: His arms win kine, his power is boundless in each act best, with a hundred helps waker of battle's din Is Indra: none may rival him in mighty strength. Hence, eager for the spoil the people call on him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्ते॑ श॒तान्म॑घव॒न्नुच्च॒ भूय॑स॒ उत्स॒हस्रा॑द्रिरिचे कृ॒ष्टिषु॒ श्रवः॑ अ॒मा॒त्रं त्वा॑ धि॒षणा॑ तित्विषे म॒ह्यधा॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ जिघ्नसे पुरंदर
verses.transliteration: út te śatā́n maghavann úc ca bhū́yasaḥ-  út sahásrād ririce kr̥ṣṭíṣu śrávaḥ  amātráṃ tvā dhiṣáṇā titviṣe mahī́-  ádhā vr̥trā́ṇi jighnase puraṃdara

translation.text: Thy glory, Maghavan, exceeds a hundred yea, more than a hundred, than a thousand mid the folk, The great bowl hath inspirited thee boundlessly: so mayst thou slay the Vr̥itras breaker-down of forts!

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒वि॒ष्टि॒धातु॑ प्रति॒मान॒मोज॑सस्ति॒स्रो भूमी॑र्नृपते॒ त्रीणि॑ रोच॒ना अती॒दं विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं ववक्षिथाश॒त्रुरि॑न्द्र ज॒नुषा॑ स॒नाद॑सि
verses.transliteration: triviṣṭidhā́tu pratimā́nam ójasas  tisró bhū́mīr nr̥pate trī́ṇi rocanā́  átīdáṃ víśvam bhúvanaṃ vavakṣitha-  -aśatrúr indra janúṣā sanā́d asi

translation.text: Of thy great might there is a three counterpart, the three earths, Lord men and the three realms of light. Above this whole world, Indra, thou hast waxen great: without a foe art thou, nature, from of old.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां दे॒वेषु॑ प्रथ॒मं ह॑वामहे॒ त्वं ब॑भूथ॒ पृत॑नासु सास॒हिः सेमं नः॑ का॒रुमु॑पम॒न्युमु॒द्भिद॒मिन्द्रः॑ कृणोतु प्रस॒वे रथं॑ पु॒रः
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ devéṣu prathamáṃ havāmahe  tvám babhūtha pŕ̥tanāsu sāsahíḥ  sémáṃ naḥ kārúm upamanyúm udbhídam  índraḥ kr̥ṇotu prasavé rátham puráḥ

translation.text: We invocate thee first among the Deities: thou hast become a mighty Conquer in fight. May Indra fill with spirit this our singer's heart, and make our car impetuous, foremost in attack.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं जि॑गेथ॒ न धना॑ रुरोधि॒थार्भे॑ष्वा॒जा म॑घवन्म॒हत्सु॑ च त्वामु॒ग्रमव॑से॒ सं शि॑शीम॒स्यथा॑ न इन्द्र॒ हव॑नेषु चोदय
verses.transliteration: tváṃ jigetha ná dhánā rurodhitha-  -árbheṣv ājā́ maghavan mahátsu ca  tvā́m ugrám ávase sáṃ śiśīmasi-  áthā na indra hávaneṣu codaya

translation.text: Thou hast prevailed, and hast not kept the booty back, in trifling battles in those of great account. We make thee keen, the Mighty One, succour us: inspire us, Maghavan, when we defy the foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्वाहेन्द्रो॑ अधिव॒क्ता नो॑ अ॒स्त्वप॑रिह्वृताः सनुयाम॒ वाज॑म् तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: viśvā́héndro adhivaktā́ no astu-  áparihvr̥tāḥ sanuyāma vā́jam  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: May Indra evermore be our Protector, and unimperilled may we win the booty. This prayer of ours may Vartuna grant and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्त॑ इन्द्रि॒यं प॑र॒मं प॑रा॒चैरधा॑रयन्त क॒वयः॑ पु॒रेदम् क्ष॒मेदम॒न्यद्दि॒व्य१॒॑न्यद॑स्य॒ समी॑ पृच्यते सम॒नेव॑ के॒तुः
verses.transliteration: tát ta indriyám paramám parācaír  ádhārayanta kaváyaḥ purédám  kṣamédám anyád divy ànyád asya  sám ī pr̥cyate samanéva ketúḥ

translation.text: THAT highest Indra-power of thine is distant: that which is here sages possessed aforetime. This one is on the earth, in heaven the other, and both unite as flag with flag in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स धा॑रयत्पृथि॒वीं प॒प्रथ॑च्च॒ वज्रे॑ण ह॒त्वा निर॒पः स॑सर्ज अह॒न्नहि॒मभि॑नद्रौहि॒णं व्यह॒न्व्यं॑सं म॒घवा॒ शची॑भिः
verses.transliteration: sá dhārayat pr̥thivī́m papráthac ca  vájreṇa hatvā́ nír apáḥ sasarja  áhann áhim ábhinad rauhiṇáṃ ví-  áhan vyàṃsam maghávā śácībhiḥ

translation.text: He spread the wide earth out and firmly fixed it, smote with his thunderbolt and loosed the waters. Maghavan with his puissance struck down Ahi, rent Rauhiṇa to death and slaughtered Vyansa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स जा॒तूभ॑र्मा श्र॒द्दधा॑न॒ ओजः॒ पुरो॑ विभि॒न्दन्न॑चर॒द्वि दासीः॑ वि॒द्वान्व॑ज्रि॒न्दस्य॑वे हे॒तिम॒स्यार्यं॒ सहो॑ वर्धया द्यु॒म्नमि॑न्द्र
verses.transliteration: sá jātū́bharmā śraddádhāna ójaḥ  púro vibhindánn acarad ví dā́sīḥ  vidvā́n vajrin dásyave hetím asya-  -ā́ryaṃ sáho vardhayā dyumnám indra

translation.text: Armed with his bolt and trusting in his prowess he wandered shattering the forts of Dâsas. Cast thy dart, knowing, Thunderer, at the Dasyu; increase the Arya's might and glory, Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदू॒चुषे॒ मानु॑षे॒मा यु॒गानि॑ की॒र्तेन्यं॑ म॒घवा॒ नाम॒ बिभ्र॑त् उ॒प॒प्र॒यन्द॑स्यु॒हत्या॑य व॒ज्री यद्ध॑ सू॒नुः श्रव॑से॒ नाम॑ द॒धे
verses.transliteration: tád ūcúṣe mā́nuṣemā́ yugā́ni  kīrtényam maghávā nā́ma bíbhrat  upaprayán dasyuhátyāya vajrī́  yád dha sūnúḥ śrávase nā́ma dadhé

translation.text: For him who thus hath taught these human races, Maghavan, bearing a fame-worthy title, Thunderer, drawing nigh to slay the Dasyus, hath given himself the name of Son for glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद॑स्ये॒दं प॑श्यता॒ भूरि॑ पु॒ष्टं श्रदिन्द्र॑स्य धत्तन वी॒र्या॑य स गा अ॑विन्द॒त्सो अ॑विन्द॒दश्वा॒न्त्स ओष॑धीः॒ सो अ॒पः स वना॑नि
verses.transliteration: tád asyedám paśyatā bhū́ri puṣṭáṃ  śrád índrasya dhattana vīryā̀ya  sá gā́ avindat só avindad áśvān  sá óṣadhīḥ só apáḥ sá vánāni

translation.text: See this abundant wealth that he possesses, and put your trust in Indra's hero vigour. He found the cattle, and he found the horses, he found the plants, the forests and the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरि॑कर्मणे वृष॒भाय॒ वृष्णे॑ स॒त्यशु॑ष्माय सुनवाम॒ सोम॑म् य आ॒दृत्या॑ परिप॒न्थीव॒ शूरोऽय॑ज्वनो वि॒भज॒न्नेति॒ वेदः॑
verses.transliteration: bhū́rikarmaṇe vr̥ṣabhā́ya vŕ̥ṣṇe  satyáśuṣmāya sunavāma sómam  yá ādŕ̥tyā paripanthī́va śū́raḥ-  -áyajvano vibhájann éti védaḥ

translation.text: To him the truly strong, whose deeds are many, to him the strong Bull let us pour the Soma. The Hero, watching like a thief in ambush, goes parting the possessions of the godless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदि॑न्द्र॒ प्रेव॑ वी॒र्यं॑ चकर्थ॒ यत्स॒सन्तं॒ वज्रे॒णाबो॑ध॒योऽहि॑म् अनु॑ त्वा॒ पत्नी॑र्हृषि॒तं वय॑श्च॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वासो॑ अमद॒न्ननु॑ त्वा
verses.transliteration: tád indra préva vīryàṃ cakartha  yát sasántaṃ vájreṇā́bodhayó 'him  ánu tvā pátnīr hr̥ṣitáṃ váyaś ca  víśve devā́so amadann ánu tvā

translation.text: Well didst thou do that hero deed, O Indra, in waking with thy bolt the slumbering Ahi. in thee, delighted, Dames divine rejoiced them, the flying Maruts and all Gods were joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुष्णं॒ पिप्रुं॒ कुय॑वं वृ॒त्रमि॑न्द्र य॒दाव॑धी॒र्वि पुरः॒ शम्ब॑रस्य तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: śúṣṇam pípruṃ kúyavaṃ vr̥trám indra  yadā́vadhīr ví púraḥ śámbarasya  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: As thou hast smitten Ṣushṇa, Pipru, Vr̥itra and Kuyava, and Ṣambara's forts O Indra. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: योनि॑ष्ट इन्द्र नि॒षदे॑ अकारि॒ तमा नि षी॑द स्वा॒नो नार्वा॑ वि॒मुच्या॒ वयो॑ऽव॒सायाश्वा॑न्दो॒षा वस्तो॒र्वही॑यसः प्रपि॒त्वे
verses.transliteration: yóniṣ ṭa indra niṣáde akāri  tám ā́ ní ṣīda svānó nā́rvā  vimúcyā váyo 'vasā́yā́śvān  doṣā́ vástor váhīyasaḥ prapitvé

translation.text: THE altar hath been made for thee to rest on: come like a panting courser and be seated. Loosen thy flying Steeds, set free thy Horses who bear thee swiftly nigh at eve and morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ त्ये नर॒ इन्द्र॑मू॒तये॑ गु॒र्नू चि॒त्तान्त्स॒द्यो अध्व॑नो जगम्यात् दे॒वासो॑ म॒न्युं दास॑स्य श्चम्न॒न्ते न॒ आ व॑क्षन्त्सुवि॒ताय॒ वर्ण॑म्
verses.transliteration: ó tyé nára índram ūtáye gur  nū́ cit tā́n sadyó ádhvano jagamyāt  devā́so manyúṃ dā́sasya ścamnan  té na ā́ vakṣan suvitā́ya várṇam

translation.text: These men have come to Indra for assistance: shall he not quickly come upon these pathways? May the Gods quell the fury of the Dâsa, and may they lead our folk to happy fortune.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॒ त्मना॑ भरते॒ केत॑वेदा॒ अव॒ त्मना॑ भरते॒ फेन॑मु॒दन् क्षी॒रेण॑ स्नातः॒ कुय॑वस्य॒ योषे॑ ह॒ते ते स्या॑तां प्रव॒णे शिफा॑याः
verses.transliteration: áva tmánā bharate kétavedāḥ-  áva tmánā bharate phénam udán  kṣīréṇa snātaḥ kúyavasya yóṣe  haté té syātām pravaṇé śíphāyāḥ

translation.text: He who hath only wish as his possession casts on himself, casts foam amid the waters. Both wives of Kuyava in milk have bathed them: may they be drowned within the depth of Ṣiphâ.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒योप॒ नाभि॒रुप॑रस्या॒योः प्र पूर्वा॑भिस्तिरते॒ राष्टि॒ शूरः॑ अ॒ञ्ज॒सी कु॑लि॒शी वी॒रप॑त्नी॒ पयो॑ हिन्वा॒ना उ॒दभि॑र्भरन्ते
verses.transliteration: yuyópa nā́bhir úparasyāyóḥ  prá pū́rvābhis tirate rā́ṣṭi śū́raḥ  añjasī́ kuliśī́ vīrápatnī  páyo hinvānā́ udábhir bharante

translation.text: This hath his kinship checked who lives beside us: with ancient streams forth speeds and rules the Hero, Anjasî, Kuliṣî, and Vîrapatnî, delighting him, bear milk upon their waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॒ यत्स्या नीथाद॑र्शि॒ दस्यो॒रोको॒ नाच्छा॒ सद॑नं जान॒ती गा॑त् अध॑ स्मा नो मघवञ्चर्कृ॒तादिन्मा नो॑ म॒घेव॑ निष्ष॒पी परा॑ दाः
verses.transliteration: práti yát syā́ nī́thā́darśi dásyor  óko nā́chā sádanaṃ jānatī́ gāt  ádha smā no maghavañ carkr̥tā́d ít-  mā́ no maghéva niṣṣapī́ párā dāḥ

translation.text: Soon as this Dasyu's traces were discovered, as she who knows her home, he sought the dwelling. Now think thou of us, Maghavan, nor cast us away as doth a profligate his treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स त्वं न॑ इन्द्र॒ सूर्ये॒ सो अ॒प्स्व॑नागा॒स्त्व आ भ॑ज जीवशं॒से मान्त॑रां॒ भुज॒मा री॑रिषो नः॒ श्रद्धि॑तं ते मह॒त इ॑न्द्रि॒याय॑
verses.transliteration: sá tváṃ na indra sū́rye só apsú-  -anāgāstvá ā́ bhaja jīvaśaṃsé  mā́ntarām bhújam ā́ rīriṣo naḥ  śráddhitaṃ te mahatá indriyā́ya

translation.text: Indra, as such, give us a share of sunlight, of waters, sinlessness, and reputation. Do thou no harm to our yet unborn offspring: our trust is in thy mighty Indra-power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑ मन्ये॒ श्रत्ते॑ अस्मा अधायि॒ वृषा॑ चोदस्व मह॒ते धना॑य मा नो॒ अकृ॑ते पुरुहूत॒ योना॒विन्द्र॒ क्षुध्य॑द्भ्यो॒ वय॑ आसु॒तिं दाः॑
verses.transliteration: ádhā manye śrát te asmā adhāyi  vŕ̥ṣā codasva mahaté dhánāya  mā́ no ákr̥te puruhūta yónāv  índra kṣúdhyadbhyo váya āsutíṃ dāḥ

translation.text: Now we, I think, in thee as such have trusted: lead us on, Mighty One, to ample riches. In no unready house give us, O Indra invoked of many, food and drink when hungry.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ वधीरिन्द्र॒ मा परा॑ दा॒ मा नः॑ प्रि॒या भोज॑नानि॒ प्र मो॑षीः आ॒ण्डा मा नो॑ मघवञ्छक्र॒ निर्भे॒न्मा नः॒ पात्रा॑ भेत्स॒हजा॑नुषाणि
verses.transliteration: mā́ no vadhīr indra mā́ párā dāḥ-  mā́ naḥ priyā́ bhójanāni prá moṣīḥ  āṇḍā́ mā́ no maghavañ chakra nír bhet-  mā́ naḥ pā́trā bhet sahájānuṣāṇi

translation.text: Slay us not, Indra; do not thou forsake us: steal not away the joys which we delight in. Rend not our unborn brood, strong Lord of Bounty! our vessels with the life that is within them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वाङेहि॒ सोम॑कामं त्वाहुर॒यं सु॒तस्तस्य॑ पिबा॒ मदा॑य उ॒रु॒व्यचा॑ ज॒ठर॒ आ वृ॑षस्व पि॒तेव॑ नः शृणुहि हू॒यमा॑नः
verses.transliteration: arvā́ṅ éhi sómakāmaṃ tvāhur  ayáṃ sutás tásya pibā mádāya  uruvyácā jaṭhára ā́ vr̥ṣasva  pitéva naḥ śr̥ṇuhi hūyámānaḥ

translation.text: Come to us; they have called thee Soma-lover: here is the pressed juice. Drink thereof for rapture. Widely-capacious, pour it down within thee, and, invocated, hear us like a Father.

suktas.deity: All the Gods (Trita in the Well)

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒न्द्रमा॑ अ॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तरा सु॑प॒र्णो धा॑वते दि॒वि न वो॑ हिरण्यनेमयः प॒दं वि॑न्दन्ति विद्युतो वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: candrámā apsv àntár~ā́  suparṇó dhāvate diví  ná vo hiraṇyanemayaḥ  padáṃ vindanti vidyuto  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: WITHIN the waters runs the Moon, he with the beauteous wings in heaven. Ye lightnings with your golden wheels, men find not your abiding-place. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्थ॒मिद्वा उ॑ अ॒र्थिन॒ आ जा॒या यु॑वते॒ पति॑म् तु॒ञ्जाते॒ वृष्ण्यं॒ पयः॑ परि॒दाय॒ रसं॑ दुहे वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: ártham íd vā́ u arthínaḥ-  ā́ jāyā́ yuvate pátim  tuñjā́te vŕ̥ṣṇyam páyaḥ  paridā́ya rásaṃ duhe  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: Surely men crave and gain their wish. Close to her husband clings the wife. And, in embraces intertwined, both give and take the bliss of love. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मो षु दे॑वा अ॒दः स्व१॒॑रव॑ पादि दि॒वस्परि॑ मा सो॒म्यस्य॑ श॒म्भुवः॒ शूने॑ भूम॒ कदा॑ च॒न वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: mó ṣú devā adáḥ svàr  áva pādi divás pári  mā́ somyásya śambhúvaḥ  śū́ne bhūma kádā caná  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: O never may that light , ye Gods, fall from its station in the sky. Ne'er fail us one like Soma sweet, the spring of our felicity. Mark this my woe ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञं पृ॑च्छाम्यव॒मं स तद्दू॒तो वि वो॑चति क्व॑ ऋ॒तं पू॒र्व्यं ग॒तं कस्तद्बि॑भर्ति॒ नूत॑नो वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: yajñám pr̥chāmy avamáṃ  sá tád dūtó ví vocati  kvà r̥tám pūrvyáṃ gatáṃ  kás tád bibharti nū́tano  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: I ask the last of sacrifice. As envoy he shall tell it forth. Where is the ancient law divine? Who is its new diffuser now? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒मी ये दे॑वाः॒ स्थन॑ त्रि॒ष्वा रो॑च॒ने दि॒वः कद्व॑ ऋ॒तं कदनृ॑तं॒ क्व॑ प्र॒त्ना व॒ आहु॑तिर्वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: amī́ yé devā sthána  triṣv ā́ rocané diváḥ  kád va r̥táṃ kád ánr̥taṃ  kvà pratnā́ va ā́hutir  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: Ye Gods who yonder have your home in the three lucid realms of heaven, What count ye truth and what untruth? Where is mine ancient call on you? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कद्व॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ धर्ण॒सि कद्वरु॑णस्य॒ चक्ष॑णम् कद॑र्य॒म्णो म॒हस्प॒थाति॑ क्रामेम दू॒ढ्यो॑ वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: kád va r̥tásya dharṇasí  kád váruṇasya cákṣaṇam  kád aryamṇó mahás pathā́-  -áti krāmema dūḍhyò  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: What is your firm support of Law? What Varuṇa's observant eye? How may we pass the wicked on the path of mighty Aryaman? Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं सो अ॑स्मि॒ यः पु॒रा सु॒ते वदा॑मि॒ कानि॑ चित् तं मा॑ व्यन्त्या॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ वृको॒ न तृ॒ष्णजं॑ मृ॒गं वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: aháṃ só asmi yáḥ purā́  suté vádāmi kā́ni cit  tám mā vyanty ādhyò  vŕ̥ko ná tr̥ṣṇájam mr̥gáṃ  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: I am the man who sang of old full many a laud when Soma flowed. Yet torturing cares consume me as the wolf assails the thirsty deer. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं मा॑ तपन्त्य॒भितः॑ स॒पत्नी॑रिव॒ पर्श॑वः मूषो॒ न शि॒श्ना व्य॑दन्ति मा॒ध्यः॑ स्तो॒तारं॑ ते शतक्रतो वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: sám mā tapanty abhítaḥ  sapátnīr iva párśavaḥ  mū́ṣo ná śiśnā́ vy àdanti mādhyàḥ-  stotā́raṃ te śatakrato  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: Like rival wives on every side enclosing ribs oppress me sore. O Ṣatakratu, biting cares devour me, singer of thy praise, as rats devour the weaver's threads. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒मी ये स॒प्त र॒श्मय॒स्तत्रा॑ मे॒ नाभि॒रात॑ता त्रि॒तस्तद्वे॑दा॒प्त्यः स जा॑मि॒त्वाय॑ रेभति वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: amī́ yé saptá raśmáyas  tátrā me nā́bhir ā́tatā  tritás tád vedāptyáḥ  sá jāmitvā́ya rebhati  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: Where those seven rays are shining, thence my home and family extend. This Trita Âptya knoweth well, and speaketh out for brotherhood. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒मी ये पञ्चो॒क्षणो॒ मध्ये॑ त॒स्थुर्म॒हो दि॒वः दे॒व॒त्रा नु प्र॒वाच्यं॑ सध्रीची॒ना नि वा॑वृतुर्वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: amī́ yé páñcokṣáṇo  mádhye tasthúr mahó diváḥ  devatrā́ nú pravā́cyaṃ  sadhrīcīnā́ ní vāvr̥tur  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: May those five Bulls which stand on high full in the midst of mighty heaven, Having together swiftly borne my praises to the Gods, return. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒प॒र्णा ए॒त आ॑सते॒ मध्य॑ आ॒रोध॑ने दि॒वः ते से॑धन्ति प॒थो वृकं॒ तर॑न्तं य॒ह्वती॑र॒पो वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: suparṇā́ etá āsate  mádhya āródhane diváḥ  té sedhanti pathó vŕ̥kaṃ  tárantaṃ yahvátīr apó  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: High in the mid ascent of heaven those Birds of beauteous pinion sit. Back from his path they drive the wolf as he would cross the restless floods. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नव्यं॒ तदु॒क्थ्यं॑ हि॒तं देवा॑सः सुप्रवाच॒नम् ऋ॒तम॑र्षन्ति॒ सिन्ध॑वः स॒त्यं ता॑तान॒ सूर्यो॑ वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: návyaṃ tád ukthyàṃ hitáṃ  dévāsaḥ supravācanám  r̥tám arṣanti síndhavaḥ  satyáṃ tātāna sū́ryo  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: Firm is this new-wrought hymn of praise, and meet to be told forth, O Gods. The flowing of the floods is Law, Truth is the Sun's extended light. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ तव॒ त्यदु॒क्थ्यं॑ दे॒वेष्व॒स्त्याप्य॑म् स नः॑ स॒त्तो म॑नु॒ष्वदा दे॒वान्य॑क्षि वि॒दुष्ट॑रो वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: ágne táva tyád ukthyàṃ  devéṣv asty ā́pyam  sá naḥ sattó manuṣvád~ā́  devā́n yakṣi vidúṣṭaro  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: Worthy of laud, O Agni, is that kinship which thou hast with Gods. Here seat thee like a man: most wise, bring thou the Gods for sacrifice. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्तो होता॑ मनु॒ष्वदा दे॒वाँ अच्छा॑ वि॒दुष्ट॑रः अ॒ग्निर्ह॒व्या सु॑षूदति दे॒वो दे॒वेषु॒ मेधि॑रो वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: sattó hótā manuṣvád~ā́  devā́m̐ áchā vidúṣṭaraḥ  agnír havyā́ suṣūdati  devó devéṣu médhiro  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: Here seated, man-like as a priest shall wisest Agni to the Gods Speed onward our oblations, God among the Gods, intelligent. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रह्मा॑ कृणोति॒ वरु॑णो गातु॒विदं॒ तमी॑महे व्यू॑र्णोति हृ॒दा म॒तिं नव्यो॑ जायतामृ॒तं वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: bráhmā kr̥ṇoti váruṇo  gātuvídaṃ tám īmahe  vy ū̀rṇoti hr̥dā́ matíṃ  návyo jāyatām r̥táṃ  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: Varuṇa makes the holy prayer. To him who finds the path we pray. He in the heart reveals his thought. Let sacred worship rise anew. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒सौ यः पन्था॑ आदि॒त्यो दि॒वि प्र॒वाच्यं॑ कृ॒तः न स दे॑वा अति॒क्रमे॒ तं म॑र्तासो॒ न प॑श्यथ वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: asaú yáḥ pánthā ādityó  diví pravā́cyaṃ kr̥táḥ  ná sá devā atikráme  tám martāso ná paśyatha  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: That pathway of the Sun in heaven, made to be highly glorified, Is not to be transgressed, O Gods. O mortals, ye behold it not. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒तः कूपेऽव॑हितो दे॒वान्ह॑वत ऊ॒तये॑ तच्छु॑श्राव॒ बृह॒स्पतिः॑ कृ॒ण्वन्नं॑हूर॒णादु॒रु वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: tritáḥ kū́pé 'vahito  devā́n havata ūtáye  tác chuśrāva bŕ̥haspátiḥ  kr̥ṇvánn aṃhūraṇā́d urú  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: Trita, when buried in the well, calls on the Gods to succour him. That call of his Br̥ihaspati heard and released him from distress. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒रु॒णो मा॑ स॒कृद्वृकः॑ प॒था यन्तं॑ द॒दर्श॒ हि उज्जि॑हीते नि॒चाय्या॒ तष्टे॑व पृष्ट्याम॒यी वि॒त्तं मे॑ अ॒स्य रो॑दसी
verses.transliteration: aruṇó mā sakŕ̥d vŕ̥kaḥ  pathā́ yántaṃ dadárśa hí  új jihīte nicā́yyā  táṣṭeva pr̥ṣṭyāmayī́  vittám me asyá rodasī

translation.text: A ruddy wolf beheld me once, as I was faring on my path. He, like a carpenter whose back is aching crouched and slunk away. Mark this my woe, ye Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒नाङ्गू॒षेण॑ व॒यमिन्द्र॑वन्तो॒ऽभि ष्या॑म वृ॒जने॒ सर्व॑वीराः तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: enā́ṅgūṣéṇa vayám índravanto  -abhí ṣyāma vr̥jáne sárvavīrāḥ  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Through this our song may we, allied with Indra, with all our heroes conquer in the battle. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॑ मि॒त्रं वरु॑णम॒ग्निमू॒तये॒ मारु॑तं॒ शर्धो॒ अदि॑तिं हवामहे रथं॒ न दु॒र्गाद्व॑सवः सुदानवो॒ विश्व॑स्मान्नो॒ अंह॑सो॒ निष्पि॑पर्तन
verses.transliteration: índram mitráṃ váruṇam agním ūtáye  mā́rutaṃ śárdho áditiṃ havāmahe  ráthaṃ ná durgā́d vasavaḥ sudānavo  víśvasmān no áṃhaso níṣ pipartana

translation.text: CALL we for aid on Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa and Agni and the Marut host and Aditi. Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त आ॑दित्या॒ आ ग॑ता स॒र्वता॑तये भू॒त दे॑वा वृत्र॒तूर्ये॑षु श॒म्भुवः॑ रथं॒ न दु॒र्गाद्व॑सवः सुदानवो॒ विश्व॑स्मान्नो॒ अंह॑सो॒ निष्पि॑पर्तन
verses.transliteration: tá ādityā ā́ gatā sarvátātaye  bhūtá devā vr̥tratū́ryeṣu śambhúvaḥ  ráthaṃ ná durgā́d vasavaḥ sudānavo  víśvasmān no áṃhaso níṣ pipartana

translation.text: Come ye Âdityas for our full prosperity, in conquests of the foe, ye Gods, bring joy to us. Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑न्तु नः पि॒तरः॑ सुप्रवाच॒ना उ॒त दे॒वी दे॒वपु॑त्रे ऋता॒वृधा॑ रथं॒ न दु॒र्गाद्व॑सवः सुदानवो॒ विश्व॑स्मान्नो॒ अंह॑सो॒ निष्पि॑पर्तन
verses.transliteration: ávantu naḥ pitáraḥ supravācanā́ḥ-  utá devī́ deváputre r̥tāvŕ̥dhā  ráthaṃ ná durgā́d vasavaḥ sudānavo  víśvasmān no áṃhaso níṣ pipartana

translation.text: May the most glorious Fathers aid us, and the two Goddesses, Mothers of the Gods, who strengthen Law. Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नरा॒शंसं॑ वा॒जिनं॑ वा॒जय॑न्नि॒ह क्ष॒यद्वी॑रं पू॒षणं॑ सु॒म्नैरी॑महे रथं॒ न दु॒र्गाद्व॑सवः सुदानवो॒ विश्व॑स्मान्नो॒ अंह॑सो॒ निष्पि॑पर्तन
verses.transliteration: nárāśáṃsaṃ vājínaṃ vājáyann ihá  kṣayádvīram pūṣáṇaṃ sumnaír īmahe  ráthaṃ ná durgā́d vasavaḥ sudānavo  víśvasmān no áṃhaso níṣ pipartana

translation.text: To mighty Narâṣansa, strengthening his might, to Pûshan, ruler over men, we pray with hymns. Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॑स्पते॒ सद॒मिन्नः॑ सु॒गं कृ॑धि॒ शं योर्यत्ते॒ मनु॑र्हितं॒ तदी॑महे रथं॒ न दु॒र्गाद्व॑सवः सुदानवो॒ विश्व॑स्मान्नो॒ अंह॑सो॒ निष्पि॑पर्तन
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspate sádam ín naḥ sugáṃ kr̥dhi  śáṃ yór yát te mánurhitaṃ tád īmahe  ráthaṃ ná durgā́d vasavaḥ sudānavo  víśvasmān no áṃhaso níṣ pipartana

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati, make us evermore an easy path: we crave what boon thou hast for men in rest and stir. Like as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॒ कुत्सो॑ वृत्र॒हणं॒ शची॒पतिं॑ का॒टे निबा॑ळ्ह॒ ऋषि॑रह्वदू॒तये॑ रथं॒ न दु॒र्गाद्व॑सवः सुदानवो॒ विश्व॑स्मान्नो॒ अंह॑सो॒ निष्पि॑पर्तन
verses.transliteration: índraṃ kútso vr̥traháṇaṃ śácīpátiṃ  kāṭé níbāḷha ŕ̥ṣir ahvad ūtáye  ráthaṃ ná durgā́d vasavaḥ sudānavo  víśvasmān no áṃhaso níṣ pipartana

translation.text: Sunk in the pit the R̥ishi Kutsa called, to aid, Indra the Vr̥itra-slayer, Lord of power and might. Even as a chariot from a difficult ravine, bountiful Vasus, rescue us from all distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वैर्नो॑ दे॒व्यदि॑ति॒र्नि पा॑तु दे॒वस्त्रा॒ता त्रा॑यता॒मप्र॑युच्छन् तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: devaír no devy áditir ní pātu  devás trātā́ trāyatām áprayuchan  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: May Aditi the Goddess guard us with the Gods: may the protecting God keep us with ceaseless care. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञो दे॒वानां॒ प्रत्ये॑ति सु॒म्नमादि॑त्यासो॒ भव॑ता मृळ॒यन्तः॑ आ वो॒ऽर्वाची॑ सुम॒तिर्व॑वृत्यादं॒होश्चि॒द्या व॑रिवो॒वित्त॒रास॑त्
verses.transliteration: yajñó devā́nām práty eti sumnám  ā́dityāso bhávatā mr̥ḷayántaḥ  ā́ vo 'rvā́cī sumatír vavr̥tyād  aṃhóś cid yā́ varivovíttarā́sat

translation.text: THE sacrifice obtains the Gods' acceptance: be graciously inclined to us, Âdityas. Hitherward let your favour be directed, and be our best deliverer from trouble.
