verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ नो दे॒वा अव॒सा ग॑म॒न्त्वङ्गि॑रसां॒ साम॑भिः स्तू॒यमा॑नाः इन्द्र॑ इन्द्रि॒यैर्म॒रुतो॑ म॒रुद्भि॑रादि॒त्यैर्नो॒ अदि॑तिः॒ शर्म॑ यंसत्
verses.transliteration: úpa no devā́ ávasā́ gamantu-  áṅgirasāṃ sā́mabhi stūyámānāḥ  índra indriyaír marúto marúdbhir  ādityaír no áditiḥ śárma yaṃsat

translation.text: By praise-songs of Angirases exalted, may!he Gods come to us with their protection. May Indra with his powers, Maruts with Maruts, Aditi with Âdityas grant us shelter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्न॒ इन्द्र॒स्तद्वरु॑ण॒स्तद॒ग्निस्तद॑र्य॒मा तत्स॑वि॒ता चनो॑ धात् तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: tán na índras tád váruṇas tád agnís  tád aryamā́ tát savitā́ cáno dhāt  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: This laud of ours may Varuṇa and Indra, Aryaman Agni, Savitar find pleasant. This prayer' of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॑न्द्राग्नी चि॒त्रत॑मो॒ रथो॑ वाम॒भि विश्वा॑नि॒ भुव॑नानि॒ चष्टे॑ तेना या॑तं स॒रथं॑ तस्थि॒वांसाथा॒ सोम॑स्य पिबतं सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yá indrāgnī citrátamo rátho vām  abhí víśvāni bhúvanāni cáṣṭe  ténā́ yātaṃ saráthaṃ tasthivā́ṃsā-  -áthā sómasya pibataṃ sutásya

translation.text: ON that most wondrous car of yours, O Indra and Agni, which looks round on all things living, Take ye your stand and come to us together, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याव॑दि॒दं भुव॑नं॒ विश्व॒मस्त्यु॑रु॒व्यचा॑ वरि॒मता॑ गभी॒रम् तावाँ॑ अ॒यं पात॑वे॒ सोमो॑ अ॒स्त्वर॑मिन्द्राग्नी॒ मन॑से यु॒वभ्या॑म्
verses.transliteration: yā́vad idám bhúvanaṃ víśvam ásti-  uruvyácā varimátā gabhīrám  tā́vām̐ ayám pā́tave sómo astu-  áram indrāgnī mánase yuvábhyām

translation.text: As vast as all this world is in its compass, deep as it is, with its far-stretching surface, So let this Soma be, Indra and Agni, made for your drinking till your soul be sated.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒क्राथे॒ हि स॒ध्र्य१॒॑ङ्नाम॑ भ॒द्रं स॑ध्रीची॒ना वृ॑त्रहणा उ॒त स्थः॑ तावि॑न्द्राग्नी स॒ध्र्य॑ञ्चा नि॒षद्या॒ वृष्णः॒ सोम॑स्य वृष॒णा वृ॑षेथाम्
verses.transliteration: cakrā́the hí sadhryàṅ nā́ma bhadráṃ  sadhrīcīnā́ vr̥trahaṇā utá sthaḥ  tā́v indrāgnī sadhryàñcā niṣádyā  vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ sómasya vr̥ṣaṇā́ vr̥ṣethām

translation.text: For ye have won a blessed name together: yea, with one aim ye strove, O Vr̥itra-slayers. So Indra-Agni, seated here together, pour in, ye Mighty Ones, the mighty Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑द्धेष्व॒ग्निष्वा॑नजा॒ना य॒तस्रु॑चा ब॒र्हिरु॑ तिस्तिरा॒णा ती॒व्रैः सोमैः॒ परि॑षिक्तेभिर॒र्वागेन्द्रा॑ग्नी सौमन॒साय॑ यातम्
verses.transliteration: sámiddheṣv agníṣv ānajānā́  yatásrucā barhír u tistirāṇā́  tīvraíḥ sómaiḥ páriṣiktebhir arvā́g  éndrāgnī saumanasā́ya yātam

translation.text: Both stand adorned, when fires are duly kindled, spreading the sacred grass, with lifted ladles. Drawn by strong Soma juice poured forth around us, come, Indra-Agni, and display your favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यानी॑न्द्राग्नी च॒क्रथु॑र्वी॒र्या॑णि॒ यानि॑ रू॒पाण्यु॒त वृष्ण्या॑नि या वां॑ प्र॒त्नानि॑ स॒ख्या शि॒वानि॒ तेभिः॒ सोम॑स्य पिबतं सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yā́nīndrāgnī cakráthur vīryā̀ṇi  yā́ni rūpā́ṇy utá vŕ̥ṣṇyāni  yā́ vām pratnā́ni sakhyā́ śivā́ni  tébhiḥ sómasya pibataṃ sutásya

translation.text: The brave deeds ye have done, Indra and Agni, the forms ye have displayed and mighty exploits, The ancient and auspicious bonds of friendship,– for sake of these drink of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदब्र॑वं प्रथ॒मं वां॑ वृणा॒नो॒३॒॑ऽयं सोमो॒ असु॑रैर्नो वि॒हव्यः॑ तां स॒त्यां श्र॒द्धाम॒भ्या हि या॒तमथा॒ सोम॑स्य पिबतं सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yád ábravam prathamáṃ vāṃ vr̥ṇānáḥ-  -ayáṃ sómo ásurair no vihávyaḥ  tā́ṃ satyā́ṃ śraddhā́m abhy ā́ hí yātám  -áthā sómasya pibataṃ sutásya

translation.text: As first I said when choosing you, in battle we must contend with Asuras for this Soma. So came ye unto this my true conviction, and drank libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्राग्नी॒ मद॑थः॒ स्वे दु॑रो॒णे यद्ब्र॒ह्मणि॒ राज॑नि वा यजत्रा अतः॒ परि॑ वृषणा॒वा हि या॒तमथा॒ सोम॑स्य पिबतं सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yád indrāgnī mádathaḥ své duroṇé  yád brahmáṇi rā́jani vā yajatrā  átaḥ pári vr̥ṣaṇāv ā́ hí yātám  -áthā sómasya pibataṃ sutásya

translation.text: If in your dwelling, or with prince or Brahman, ye, Indra-Agni, Holy Ones, rejoice you, Even frorn thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libation of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्राग्नी॒ यदु॑षु तु॒र्वशे॑षु॒ यद्द्रु॒ह्युष्वनु॑षु पू॒रुषु॒ स्थः अतः॒ परि॑ वृषणा॒वा हि या॒तमथा॒ सोम॑स्य पिबतं सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yád indrāgnī yáduṣu turváśeṣu  yád druhyúṣv ánuṣu pūrúṣu stháḥ  átaḥ pári vr̥ṣaṇāv ā́ hí yātám  -áthā sómasya pibataṃ sutásya

translation.text: If with, the Yadus, Turvaṣas, ye sojourn, with Druhyus, Anus, Pûrus, Indra-Agni! Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्राग्नी अव॒मस्यां॑ पृथि॒व्यां म॑ध्य॒मस्यां॑ पर॒मस्या॑मु॒त स्थः अतः॒ परि॑ वृषणा॒वा हि या॒तमथा॒ सोम॑स्य पिबतं सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yád indrāgnī avamásyām pr̥thivyā́m  madhyamásyām paramásyām utá stháḥ  átaḥ pári vr̥ṣaṇāv ā́ hí yātám  -áthā sómasya pibataṃ sutásya

translation.text: Whether, O Indra-Agni, ye be dwelling in lowest earth, in central, or in highest. Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्राग्नी पर॒मस्यां॑ पृथि॒व्यां म॑ध्य॒मस्या॑मव॒मस्या॑मु॒त स्थः अतः॒ परि॑ वृषणा॒वा हि या॒तमथा॒ सोम॑स्य पिबतं सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yád indrāgnī paramásyām pr̥thivyā́m  madhyamásyām avamásyām utá stháḥ  átaḥ pári vr̥ṣaṇāv ā́ hí yātám  -áthā sómasya pibataṃ sutásya

translation.text: Whether, O Indra-Agni, ye be dwelling in highest earth, in central, or in lowest, Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्राग्नी दि॒वि ष्ठो यत्पृ॑थि॒व्यां यत्पर्व॑ते॒ष्वोष॑धीष्व॒प्सु अतः॒ परि॑ वृषणा॒वा हि या॒तमथा॒ सोम॑स्य पिबतं सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yád indrāgnī diví ṣṭhó yát pr̥thivyā́ṃ  yát párvateṣv óṣadhīṣv apsú  átaḥ pári vr̥ṣaṇāv ā́ hí yātám  -áthā sómasya pibataṃ sutásya

translation.text: Whether ye be in heaven, O Indra-Agni, on earth, on mountains, in the herbs, or waters, Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्राग्नी॒ उदि॑ता॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ मध्ये॑ दि॒वः स्व॒धया॑ मा॒दये॑थे अतः॒ परि॑ वृषणा॒वा हि या॒तमथा॒ सोम॑स्य पिबतं सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yád indrāgnī úditā sū́ryasya  mádhye diváḥ svadháyā mādáyethe  átaḥ pári vr̥ṣaṇāv ā́ hí yātám  -áthā sómasya pibataṃ sutásya

translation.text: If, when the Sun to the mid-heaven hath mounted, ye take delight in food, O Indra-Agni, Even from thence, ye mighty Lords, come hither, and drink libations of the flowing Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वेन्द्रा॑ग्नी पपि॒वांसा॑ सु॒तस्य॒ विश्वा॒स्मभ्यं॒ सं ज॑यतं॒ धना॑नि तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: evéndrāgnī papivā́ṃsā sutásya  víśvāsmábhyaṃ sáṃ jayataṃ dhánāni  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Thus having drunk your fill of our libation, win us all kinds of wealth, Indra and Agni. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि ह्यख्यं॒ मन॑सा॒ वस्य॑ इ॒च्छन्निन्द्रा॑ग्नी ज्ञा॒स उ॒त वा॑ सजा॒तान् नान्या यु॒वत्प्रम॑तिरस्ति॒ मह्यं॒ स वां॒ धियं॑ वाज॒यन्ती॑मतक्षम्
verses.transliteration: ví hy ákhyam mánasā vásya ichánn  índrāgnī jñāsá utá vā sajātā́n  nā́nyā́ yuvát prámatir asti máhyaṃ  sá vāṃ dhíyaṃ vājayántīm atakṣam

translation.text: LONGING for weal I looked around, in spirit, for kinsmen, Indra-Agni, or for brothers. No providence but yours alone is with me so have I wrought for you this hymn for succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्र॑वं॒ हि भू॑रि॒दाव॑त्तरा वां॒ विजा॑मातुरु॒त वा॑ घा स्या॒लात् अथा॒ सोम॑स्य॒ प्रय॑ती यु॒वभ्या॒मिन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ स्तोमं॑ जनयामि॒ नव्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: áśravaṃ hí bhūridā́vattarā vāṃ  víjāmātur utá vā ghā syālā́t  áthā sómasya práyatī yuvábhyām  índrāgnī stómaṃ janayāmi návyam

translation.text: For I have heard that ye give wealth more freely than worthless son-in-law or spouse's brother. So offering to you this draught of Soma, I make you this new hymn, Indra and Agni,

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा च्छे॑द्म र॒श्मीँरिति॒ नाध॑मानाः पितॄ॒णां श॒क्तीर॑नु॒यच्छ॑मानाः इ॒न्द्रा॒ग्निभ्यां॒ कं वृष॑णो मदन्ति॒ ता ह्यद्री॑ धि॒षणा॑या उ॒पस्थे॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ chedma raśmī́m̐r íti nā́dhamānāḥ  pitr̥̄ṇā́ṃ śaktī́r anuyáchamānāḥ  indrāgníbhyāṃ káṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇo madanti  tā́ hy ádrī dhiṣáṇāyā upásthe

translation.text: Let us not break the cords: with this petition we strive to gain the powers of our forefathers. For Indra-Agni the strong drops are joyful-, for here in the bowl's lap are both the press-stones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वाभ्यां॑ दे॒वी धि॒षणा॒ मदा॒येन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ सोम॑मुश॒ती सु॑नोति ताव॑श्विना भद्रहस्ता सुपाणी॒ आ धा॑वतं॒ मधु॑ना पृ॒ङ्क्तम॒प्सु
verses.transliteration: yuvā́bhyāṃ devī́ dhiṣáṇā mádāya-  -índrāgnī sómam uśatī́ sunoti  tā́v aśvinā bhadrahastā supāṇī  ā́ dhāvatam mádhunā pr̥ṅktám apsú

translation.text: For you the bowl divine, Indra and Agni, presses the Soma gladly to delight you. With hands auspicious and fair arms, ye Aṣvins, haste, sprinkle it with sweetness in the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वामि॑न्द्राग्नी॒ वसु॑नो विभा॒गे त॒वस्त॑मा शुश्रव वृत्र॒हत्ये॑ तावा॒सद्या॑ ब॒र्हिषि॑ य॒ज्ञे अ॒स्मिन्प्र च॑र्षणी मादयेथां सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: yuvā́m indrāgnī vásuno vibhāgé  tavástamā śuśrava vr̥trahátye  tā́v āsádyā barhíṣi yajñé asmín  prá carṣaṇī mādayethāṃ sutásya

translation.text: You, I have heard, were mightiest, Indra-Agni, when Vr̥itra fell and when the spoil was parted. Sit at this sacrifice, ye ever active, on the strewn grass, and with the juice delight you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र च॑र्ष॒णिभ्यः॑ पृतना॒हवे॑षु॒ प्र पृ॑थि॒व्या रि॑रिचाथे दि॒वश्च॑ प्र सिन्धु॑भ्यः॒ प्र गि॒रिभ्यो॑ महि॒त्वा प्रेन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॒नात्य॒न्या
verses.transliteration: prá carṣaṇíbhyaḥ pr̥tanāháveṣu  prá pr̥thivyā́ riricāthe diváś ca  prá síndhubhyaḥ prá giríbhyo mahitvā́  préndrāgnī víśvā bhúvanā́ty anyā́

translation.text: Surpassing all men where they shout for battle, ye Twain exceed the earth and heaven in greatness. Greater are ye than rivers and than mountains, O Indra-Agni, and all things beside them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ भ॑रतं॒ शिक्ष॑तं वज्रबाहू अ॒स्माँ इ॑न्द्राग्नी अवतं॒ शची॑भिः इ॒मे नु ते र॒श्मयः॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ येभिः॑ सपि॒त्वं पि॒तरो॑ न॒ आस॑न्
verses.transliteration: ā́ bharataṃ śíkṣataṃ vajrabāhū  asmā́m̐ indrāgnī avataṃ śácībhiḥ  imé nú té raśmáyaḥ sū́ryasya  yébhiḥ sapitvám pitáro na ā́san

translation.text: Bring wealth and give it, ye whose arms wield thunder: Indra and Agni, with your powers protect us. Now of a truth these be the very sunbeams wherewith our fathers were of old united.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुरं॑दरा॒ शिक्ष॑तं वज्रहस्ता॒स्माँ इ॑न्द्राग्नी अवतं॒ भरे॑षु तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: púraṃdarā śíkṣataṃ vajrahastā-  -asmā́m̐ indrāgnī avatam bháreṣu  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Give, ye who shatter forts, whose hands wield thunder: Indra and Agni, save us in our battles. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त॒तं मे॒ अप॒स्तदु॑ तायते॒ पुनः॒ स्वादि॑ष्ठा धी॒तिरु॒चथा॑य शस्यते अ॒यं स॑मु॒द्र इ॒ह वि॒श्वदे॑व्यः॒ स्वाहा॑कृतस्य॒ समु॑ तृप्णुत ऋभवः
verses.transliteration: tatám me ápas tád u tāyate púnaḥ  svā́diṣṭhā dhītír ucáthāya śasyate  ayáṃ samudrá ihá viśvádevyaḥ  svā́hākr̥tasya sám u tr̥pṇuta r̥bhavaḥ

translation.text: THE holy work I wrought before is wrought again: my sweetest hymn is sung to celebrate your praise. Here, O ye R̥ibhus, is this sea for all the Gods: sate you with Soma offered with the hallowing word.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒भो॒गयं॒ प्र यदि॒च्छन्त॒ ऐत॒नापा॑काः॒ प्राञ्चो॒ मम॒ के चि॑दा॒पयः॑ सौध॑न्वनासश्चरि॒तस्य॑ भू॒मनाग॑च्छत सवि॒तुर्दा॒शुषो॑ गृ॒हम्
verses.transliteration: ābhogáyam prá yád ichánta aítana-  -ápākāḥ prā́ñco máma ké cid āpáyaḥ  saúdhanvanāsaś caritásya bhūmánā-  -ágachata savitúr dāśúṣo gr̥hám

translation.text: When, seeking your enjoyment onward from afar, ye, certain of my kinsmen, wandered on your way, Sons of Sudhanvan, after your long journeying, ye came unto the home of liberal Savitar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्स॑वि॒ता वो॑ऽमृत॒त्वमासु॑व॒दगो॑ह्यं॒ यच्छ्र॒वय॑न्त॒ ऐत॑न त्यं चि॑च्चम॒समसु॑रस्य॒ भक्ष॑ण॒मेकं॒ सन्त॑मकृणुता॒ चतु॑र्वयम्
verses.transliteration: tát savitā́ vo 'mr̥tatvám ā́suvad  ágohyaṃ yác chraváyanta aítana  tyáṃ cic camasám ásurasya bhákṣaṇam  ékaṃ sántam akr̥ṇutā cáturvayam

translation.text: Savitar therefore gave you immortality, because ye came proclaiming him whom naught can hide; And this the drinking-chalice of the Asura, which till that time was one, ye made to be fourfold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒ष्ट्वी शमी॑ तरणि॒त्वेन॑ वा॒घतो॒ मर्ता॑सः॒ सन्तो॑ अमृत॒त्वमा॑नशुः सौ॒ध॒न्व॒ना ऋ॒भवः॒ सूर॑चक्षसः संवत्स॒रे सम॑पृच्यन्त धी॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: viṣṭvī́ śámī taraṇitvéna vāgháto  mártāsaḥ sánto amr̥tatvám ānaśuḥ  saudhanvanā́ r̥bhávaḥ sū́racakṣasaḥ  saṃvatsaré sám apr̥cyanta dhītíbhiḥ

translation.text: When they had served with zeal at sacrifice as priests, they, mortal as they were, gained immortality. The R̥ibhus, children of Sudhanvan, bright as suns, were in a year's course made associate with prayers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्षेत्र॑मिव॒ वि म॑मु॒स्तेज॑नेनँ॒ एकं॒ पात्र॑मृ॒भवो॒ जेह॑मानम् उप॑स्तुता उप॒मं नाध॑माना॒ अम॑र्त्येषु॒ श्रव॑ इ॒च्छमा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: kṣétram iva ví mamus téjanenam̐  ékam pā́tram r̥bhávo jéhamānam  úpastutā upamáṃ nā́dhamānāḥ-  ámartyeṣu śráva ichámānāḥ

translation.text: The R̥ibhus, with a rod measured, as 'twere a field, the single sacrificial chalice. wide of mouth, Lauded of all who saw, praying for what is best, desiring glorious fame among Immortal Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ म॑नी॒षाम॒न्तरि॑क्षस्य॒ नृभ्यः॑ स्रु॒चेव॑ घृ॒तं जु॑हवाम वि॒द्मना॑ त॒र॒णि॒त्वा ये पि॒तुर॑स्य सश्चि॒र ऋ॒भवो॒ वाज॑मरुहन्दि॒वो रजः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ manīṣā́m antárikṣasya nŕ̥bhyaḥ  srucéva ghr̥táṃ juhavāma vidmánā  taraṇitvā́ yé pitúr asya saściré-  r̥bhávo vā́jam aruhan divó rájaḥ

translation.text: As oil in ladles, we through knowledge will present unto the Heroes of the firmament our hymn,– The R̥ibhus who came near with this great Father's speed, and rose to heaven's high sphere to cat the strengthening food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒भुर्न॒ इन्द्रः॒ शव॑सा॒ नवी॑यानृ॒भुर्वाजे॑भि॒र्वसु॑भि॒र्वसु॑र्द॒दिः यु॒ष्माकं॑ देवा॒ अव॒साह॑नि प्रि॒ये॒३॒॑ऽभि ति॑ष्ठेम पृत्सु॒तीरसु॑न्वताम्
verses.transliteration: r̥bhúr na índraḥ śávasā návīyān  r̥bhúr vā́jebhir vásubhir vásur dadíḥ  yuṣmā́kaṃ devā ávasā́hani priyé-  -abhí tiṣṭhema pr̥tsutī́r ásunvatām

translation.text: R̥ibhu to us is Indra freshest in his might, R̥ibhu with powers and wealth is giver of rich gifts. Gods, through your favour may we on the happy day quell the attacks of those who pour no offerings forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निश्चर्म॑ण ऋभवो॒ गाम॑पिंशत॒ सं व॒त्सेना॑सृजता मा॒तरं॒ पुनः॑ सौध॑न्वनासः स्वप॒स्यया॑ नरो॒ जिव्री॒ युवा॑ना पि॒तरा॑कृणोतन
verses.transliteration: níś cármaṇa r̥bhavo gā́m apiṃśata  sáṃ vatsénāsr̥jatā mātáram púnaḥ  saúdhanvanāsaḥ svapasyáyā naro  jívrī yúvānā pitárākr̥ṇotana

translation.text: Out of a skin, O R̥ibhus, once ye formed a cow, and brought the mother close unto her calf again. Sons of Sudhanvan, Heroes, with surpassing skill ye made your aged Parents youthful as before.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वाजे॑भिर्नो॒ वाज॑सातावविड्ढ्यृभु॒माँ इ॑न्द्र चि॒त्रमा द॑र्षि॒ राधः॑ तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: vā́jebhir no vā́jasātāv aviḍḍhi-  r̥bhumā́m̐ indra citrám ā́ darṣi rā́dhaḥ  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Help us with strength where spoil is won, O Indra: joined with the gbhus give us varied bounty. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तक्ष॒न्रथं॑ सु॒वृतं॑ विद्म॒नाप॑स॒स्तक्ष॒न्हरी॑ इन्द्र॒वाहा॒ वृष॑ण्वसू तक्ष॑न्पि॒तृभ्या॑मृ॒भवो॒ युव॒द्वय॒स्तक्ष॑न्व॒त्साय॑ मा॒तरं॑ सचा॒भुव॑म्
verses.transliteration: tákṣan ráthaṃ suvŕ̥taṃ vidmanā́pasas  tákṣan hárī indravā́hā vŕ̥ṣaṇvasū  tákṣan pitŕ̥bhyām r̥bhávo yúvad váyas  tákṣan vatsā́ya mātáraṃ sacābhúvam

translation.text: WORKING with skill they wrought the lightly rolling car: they wrought the Bays who bear Indra and bring great gifts. The R̥ibhus for their Parents made life young again; and fashioned for the calf a mother by its side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ य॒ज्ञाय॑ तक्षत ऋभु॒मद्वयः॒ क्रत्वे॒ दक्षा॑य सुप्र॒जाव॑ती॒मिष॑म् यथा॒ क्षया॑म॒ सर्व॑वीरया वि॒शा तन्नः॒ शर्धा॑य धासथा॒ स्वि॑न्द्रि॒यम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no yajñā́ya takṣata r̥bhumád váyaḥ  krátve dákṣāya suprajā́vatīm íṣam  yáthā kṣáyāma sárvavīrayā viśā́  tán naḥ śárdhāya dhāsathā sv ìndriyám

translation.text: For sacrifice make for us active vital power for skill and wisdom food with noble progeny. Grant to our company this power most excellent, that with a family all-heroic we may dwell.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त॑क्षत सा॒तिम॒स्मभ्य॑मृभवः सा॒तिं रथा॑य सा॒तिमर्व॑ते नरः सा॒तिं नो॒ जैत्रीं॒ सं म॑हेत वि॒श्वहा॑ जा॒मिमजा॑मिं॒ पृत॑नासु स॒क्षणि॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ takṣata sātím asmábhyam r̥bhavaḥ  sātíṃ ráthāya sātím árvate naraḥ  sātíṃ no jaítrīṃ sám maheta viśváhā  jāmím ájāmim pŕ̥tanāsu sakṣáṇim

translation.text: Do ye, O R̥ibhus, make prosperity for us, prosperity for car, ye Heroes, and for steed. Grant us prosperity victorious evermore, conquering foes in battle, strangers or akin.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒भु॒क्षण॒मिन्द्र॒मा हु॑व ऊ॒तय॑ ऋ॒भून्वाजा॑न्म॒रुतः॒ सोम॑पीतये उ॒भा मि॒त्रावरु॑णा नू॒नम॒श्विना॒ ते नो॑ हिन्वन्तु सा॒तये॑ धि॒ये जि॒षे
verses.transliteration: r̥bhukṣáṇam índram ā́ huva ūtáyaḥ-  r̥bhū́n vā́jān marútaḥ sómapītaye  ubhā́ mitrā́váruṇā nūnám aśvínā  té no hinvantu sātáye dhiyé jiṣé

translation.text: Indra, the R̥ibhus' Lord, I invocate for aid, the R̥ibhus, Vâjas, Maruts to the Soma draught. Varuṇa, Mitra, both, yea, and the Aṣvins Twain: let them speed us to wealth, wisdom, and victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒भुर्भरा॑य॒ सं शि॑शातु सा॒तिं स॑मर्य॒जिद्वाजो॑ अ॒स्माँ अ॑विष्टु तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: r̥bhúr bhárāya sáṃ śiśātu sātíṃ  samaryajíd vā́jo asmā́m̐ aviṣṭu  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: May R̥ibhu send prosperity for battle, may Vâja conquering in the fight protect us. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ईळे॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी पू॒र्वचि॑त्तये॒ऽग्निं घ॒र्मं सु॒रुचं॒ याम॑न्नि॒ष्टये॑ याभि॒र्भरे॑ का॒रमंशा॑य॒ जिन्व॑थ॒स्ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: ī́ḷe dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ pūrvácittaye  -agníṃ gharmáṃ surúcaṃ yā́mann iṣṭáye  yā́bhir bháre kārám áṃśāya jínvathas  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: To give first thought to them, I worship Heaven and Earth, and Agni, fair bright glow, to hasten their approach. Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids wherewith in fight ye speed the war-cry to the spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वोर्दा॒नाय॑ सु॒भरा॑ अस॒श्चतो॒ रथ॒मा त॑स्थुर्वच॒सं न मन्त॑वे याभि॒र्धियोऽव॑थः॒ कर्म॑न्नि॒ष्टये॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yuvór dānā́ya subhárā asaścáto  rátham ā́ tasthur vacasáṃ ná mántave  yā́bhir dhíyó 'vathaḥ kármann iṣṭáye  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Ample, unfailing, they have mounted as it were an eloquent car that ye may think of us and give. Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids wherewith ye help our thoughts to further holy acts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं तासां॑ दि॒व्यस्य॑ प्र॒शास॑ने वि॒शां क्ष॑यथो अ॒मृत॑स्य म॒ज्मना॑ याभि॑र्धे॒नुम॒स्वं१॒॑ पिन्व॑थो नरा॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ tā́sāṃ divyásya praśā́sane  viśā́ṃ kṣayatho amŕ̥tasya majmánā  yā́bhir dhenúm asvàm pínvatho narā  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Ye by the might which heavenly nectar giveth you are in supreme dominion Lords of all these folk. Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids wherewith ye, Heroes, made the barren cow give milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ परि॑ज्मा॒ तन॑यस्य म॒ज्मना॑ द्विमा॒ता तू॒र्षु त॒रणि॑र्वि॒भूष॑ति याभि॑स्त्रि॒मन्तु॒रभ॑वद्विचक्ष॒णस्ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ párijmā tánayasya majmánā  dvimātā́ tūrṣú taráṇir vibhū́ṣati  yā́bhis trimántur ábhavad vicakṣaṇás  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: The aids wherewith the Wanderer through his offspring's might, or the Two-Mothered Son shows swiftest mid the swift; Wherewith the sapient one acquired his triple lore,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभी॑ रे॒भं निवृ॑तं सि॒तम॒द्भ्य उद्वन्द॑न॒मैर॑यतं॒ स्व॑र्दृ॒शे याभिः॒ कण्वं॒ प्र सिषा॑सन्त॒माव॑तं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhī rebháṃ nívr̥taṃ sitám adbhyáḥ-  úd vándanam aírayataṃ svàr dr̥śé  yā́bhiḥ káṇvam prá síṣāsantam ā́vataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye raised from waters, prisoned and fast bound, Rebha, and Vandana to look upon the light; Wherewith ye succoured Kaṇva as he strove to win,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभि॒रन्त॑कं॒ जस॑मान॒मार॑णे भु॒ज्युं याभि॑रव्य॒थिभि॑र्जिजि॒न्वथुः॑ याभिः॑ क॒र्कन्धुं॑ व॒य्यं॑ च॒ जिन्व॑थ॒स्ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhir ántakaṃ jásamānam ā́raṇe  bhujyúṃ yā́bhir avyathíbhir jijinváthuḥ  yā́bhiḥ karkándhuṃ vayyàṃ ca jínvathas  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye rescued Antaka when languishing deep in the pit, and Bhujyu with unfailing help. And comforted Karkandhu, Vayya, in their woe,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॑ शुच॒न्तिं ध॑न॒सां सु॑षं॒सदं॑ त॒प्तं घ॒र्ममो॒म्याव॑न्त॒मत्र॑ये याभिः॒ पृश्नि॑गुं पुरु॒कुत्स॒माव॑तं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ śucantíṃ dhanasā́ṃ suṣaṃsádaṃ  taptáṃ gharmám omyā́vantam átraye  yā́bhiḥ pŕ̥śnigum purukútsam ā́vataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye gave Ṣuchanti wealth and happy home, and made the fiery pit friendly for Atri's sake; Wherewith ye guarded Purukutsa, Pr̥iṣnigu, -Come hither unto us, O Agvin;, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ शची॑भिर्वृषणा परा॒वृजं॒ प्रान्धं श्रो॒णं चक्ष॑स॒ एत॑वे कृ॒थः याभि॒र्वर्ति॑कां ग्रसि॒ताममु॑ञ्चतं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ śácībhir vr̥ṣaṇā parāvŕ̥jam  prā́ndháṃ śroṇáṃ cákṣasa étave kr̥tháḥ  yā́bhir vártikāṃ grasitā́m ámuñcataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Mighty Ones, with what powers ye gave Paravrj aid what time ye made the blind and lame to see and walk; Wherewith ye set at liberty the swallowed quail,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ सिन्धुं॒ मधु॑मन्त॒मस॑श्चतं॒ वसि॑ष्ठं॒ याभि॑रजरा॒वजि॑न्वतम् याभिः॒ कुत्सं॑ श्रु॒तर्यं॒ नर्य॒माव॑तं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ síndhum mádhumantam ásaścataṃ  vásiṣṭhaṃ yā́bhir ajarāv ájinvatam  yā́bhiḥ kútsaṃ śrutáryaṃ náryam ā́vataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye quickened the most sweet exhaustless flood, and comforted Vasishṭha, ye who ne'er decay; And to Ṣrutarya, Kutsa, Narya gave your help,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभि॑र्वि॒श्पलां॑ धन॒साम॑थ॒र्व्यं॑ स॒हस्र॑मीळ्ह आ॒जावजि॑न्वतम् याभि॒र्वश॑म॒श्व्यं प्रे॒णिमाव॑तं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhir viśpálāṃ dhanasā́m atharvyàṃ  sahásramīḷha ājā́v ájinvatam  yā́bhir váśam aśvyám preṇím ā́vataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye helped, in battle of a thousand spoils, Vispala seeking booty, powerless to move. Wherewith ye guarded friendly Vaga, Aṣva's son,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॑ सुदानू औशि॒जाय॑ व॒णिजे॑ दी॒र्घश्र॑वसे॒ मधु॒ कोशो॒ अक्ष॑रत् क॒क्षीव॑न्तं स्तो॒तारं॒ याभि॒राव॑तं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ sudānū auśijā́ya vaṇíje  dīrgháśravase mádhu kóśo ákṣarat  kakṣī́vantaṃ stotā́raṃ yā́bhir ā́vataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Whereby the cloud, ye Bounteous Givers, shed sweet rain for Dîrghaṣravas, for the merchant Auṣija, Wherewith ye helped Kakshîvân, singer of your praise,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभी॑ र॒सां क्षोद॑सो॒द्नः पि॑पि॒न्वथु॑रन॒श्वं याभी॒ रथ॒माव॑तं जि॒षे याभि॑स्त्रि॒शोक॑ उ॒स्रिया॑ उ॒दाज॑त॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhī rasā́ṃ kṣódasodnáḥ pipinváthur  anaśváṃ yā́bhī rátham ā́vataṃ jiṣé  yā́bhis triśóka usríyā udā́jata  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye made Rasâ swell full with water-floods, and urged to victory the car without a horse; Wherewith Triṣoka drove forth his recovered cows,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ सूर्यं॑ परिया॒थः प॑रा॒वति॑ मन्धा॒तारं॒ क्षैत्र॑पत्ये॒ष्वाव॑तम् याभि॒र्विप्रं॒ प्र भ॒रद्वा॑ज॒माव॑तं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ sū́ryam pariyātháḥ parāváti  mandhātā́raṃ kṣaítrapatyeṣv ā́vatam  yā́bhir vípram prá bharádvājam ā́vataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye, compass round the Sun when far away, strengthened Mandhâtar in his tasks as lord of lands, And to sage Bharadvâja gave protecting help,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभि॑र्म॒हाम॑तिथि॒ग्वं क॑शो॒जुवं॒ दिवो॑दासं शम्बर॒हत्य॒ आव॑तम् याभिः॑ पू॒र्भिद्ये॑ त्र॒सद॑स्यु॒माव॑तं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhir mahā́m atithigváṃ kaśojúvaṃ  dívodāsaṃ śambarahátya ā́vatam  yā́bhiḥ pūrbhídye trasádasyum ā́vataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith, when Ṣambara was slain, ye guarded well great Âtithigva, Divodisa, Kaṣoju, And Trasadasyu when the forts were shattered down,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभि॑र्व॒म्रं वि॑पिपा॒नमु॑पस्तु॒तं क॒लिं याभि॑र्वि॒त्तजा॑निं दुव॒स्यथः॑ याभि॒र्व्य॑श्वमु॒त पृथि॒माव॑तं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhir vamráṃ vipipānám upastutáṃ  kalíṃ yā́bhir vittájāniṃ duvasyáthaḥ  yā́bhir vyàśvam utá pŕ̥thim ā́vataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye honoured the great drinker Vamra, and Upastuta and Kali when he gained his wife, And lent to Vyaṣva and to Pr̥ithi favouring help,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभि॑र्नरा श॒यवे॒ याभि॒रत्र॑ये॒ याभिः॑ पु॒रा मन॑वे गा॒तुमी॒षथुः॑ याभिः॒ शारी॒राज॑तं॒ स्यूम॑रश्मये॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhir narā śayáve yā́bhir átraye  yā́bhiḥ purā́ mánave gātúm īṣáthuḥ  yā́bhiḥ śā́rīr ā́jataṃ syū́maraśmaye  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith, O Heroes, ye vouchsafed deliverance to Ṣayu, Atri, and to Manu long ago; Wherewith ye shot your shafts in Syûmaraṣmi's cause.-Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ पठ॑र्वा॒ जठ॑रस्य म॒ज्मना॒ग्निर्नादी॑देच्चि॒त इ॒द्धो अज्म॒न्ना याभिः॒ शर्या॑त॒मव॑थो महाध॒ने ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ páṭharvā jáṭharasya majmánā-  -agnír nā́dīdec citá iddhó ájmann ā́  yā́bhiḥ śáryātam ávatho mahādhané  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith Paṭharvâ, in his majesty of form, shone in his course like to a gathered kindled fire; Wherewith ye helped Ṣaryâta in the mighty fray,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभि॑रङ्गिरो॒ मन॑सा निर॒ण्यथोऽग्रं॒ गच्छ॑थो विव॒रे गोअ॑र्णसः याभि॒र्मनुं॒ शूर॑मि॒षा स॒माव॑तं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhir aṅgiro mánasā niraṇyáthaḥ-  -ágraṃ gáchatho vivaré góarṇasaḥ  yā́bhir mánuṃ śū́ram iṣā́ samā́vataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith, Angirases! ye triumphed in your heart, and onward went to liberate the flood of milk; Wherewith ye helped the hero Manu with new strength,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ पत्नी॑र्विम॒दाय॑ न्यू॒हथु॒रा घ॑ वा॒ याभि॑ररु॒णीरशि॑क्षतम् याभिः॑ सु॒दास॑ ऊ॒हथुः॑ सुदे॒व्यं१॒॑ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ pátnīr vimadā́ya nyūháthur  ā́ gha vā yā́bhir aruṇī́r áśikṣatam  yā́bhiḥ sudā́sa ūháthuḥ sudevyàṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye brought awife for Vimada to wed, wherewith ye freely gave the ruddy cows away; Wherewith ye brought the host of kind Gods to Sudâs-Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ शंता॑ती॒ भव॑थो ददा॒शुषे॑ भु॒ज्युं याभि॒रव॑थो॒ याभि॒रध्रि॑गुम् ओ॒म्याव॑तीं सु॒भरा॑मृत॒स्तुभं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ śáṃtātī bhávatho dadāśúṣe  bhujyúṃ yā́bhir ávatho yā́bhir ádhrigum  omyā́vatīṃ subhárām r̥tastúbhaṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye bring great bliss to him who offers gifts, wherewith ye have protected Bhujyu, Adhrigu, And good and gracious Subhara and R̥itastup,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॑ कृ॒शानु॒मस॑ने दुव॒स्यथो॑ ज॒वे याभि॒र्यूनो॒ अर्व॑न्त॒माव॑तम् मधु॑ प्रि॒यं भ॑रथो॒ यत्स॒रड्भ्य॒स्ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ kr̥śā́num ásane duvasyátho  javé yā́bhir yū́no árvantam ā́vatam  mádhu priyám bharatho yát saráḍbhyas  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye served Kr̥iṣânu where the shafts were shot, and helped the young man's horse to swiftness in the race; Wherewith ye bring delicious honey to the bees,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभि॒र्नरं॑ गोषु॒युधं॑ नृ॒षाह्ये॒ क्षेत्र॑स्य सा॒ता तन॑यस्य॒ जिन्व॑थः याभी॒ रथाँ॒ अव॑थो॒ याभि॒रर्व॑त॒स्ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhir náraṃ goṣuyúdhaṃ nr̥ṣā́hye  kṣétrasya sātā́ tánayasya jínvathaḥ  yā́bhī ráthām̐ ávatho yā́bhir árvatas  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye speed the hero as he fights for kine in hero battle, in the strife for land and sons, Wherewith ye safely guard his horses and his car,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: याभिः॒ कुत्स॑मार्जुने॒यं श॑तक्रतू॒ प्र तु॒र्वीतिं॒ प्र च॑ द॒भीति॒माव॑तम् याभि॑र्ध्व॒सन्तिं॑ पुरु॒षन्ति॒माव॑तं॒ ताभि॑रू॒ षु ऊ॒तिभि॑रश्वि॒ना ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́bhiḥ kútsam ārjuneyáṃ śatakratū  prá turvī́tim prá ca dabhī́tim ā́vatam  yā́bhir dhvasántim puruṣántim ā́vataṃ  tā́bhir ū ṣú ūtíbhir aśvinā́ gatam

translation.text: Wherewith ye, Lords of Hundred Powers, helped Kutsa, son of Aduni, gave Turvîti and Dabhîti strength, Favoured Dhvasanti and lent Purushanti help,– Come hither unto us, O Aṣvins, with those aids.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप्न॑स्वतीमश्विना॒ वाच॑म॒स्मे कृ॒तं नो॑ दस्रा वृषणा मनी॒षाम् अ॒द्यू॒त्येऽव॑से॒ नि ह्व॑ये वां वृ॒धे च॑ नो भवतं॒ वाज॑सातौ
verses.transliteration: ápnasvatīm aśvinā vā́cam asmé  kr̥táṃ no dasrā vr̥ṣaṇā manīṣā́m  adyūtyé 'vase ní hvaye vāṃ  vr̥dhé ca no bhavataṃ vā́jasātau

translation.text: Make ye our speech effectual, O ye Aṣvins, and this our hymn, ye mighty Wonder-Workers. In luckless game I call on you for succour . strengthen us also on the field of battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्युभि॑र॒क्तुभिः॒ परि॑ पातम॒स्मानरि॑ष्टेभिरश्विना॒ सौभ॑गेभिः तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: dyúbhir aktúbhiḥ pári pātam asmā́n  áriṣṭebhir aśvinā saúbhagebhiḥ  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: With, undiminished blessings, O ye Aṣvins, for evermore both night and day protect us. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं श्रेष्ठं॒ ज्योति॑षां॒ ज्योति॒रागा॑च्चि॒त्रः प्र॑के॒तो अ॑जनिष्ट॒ विभ्वा॑ यथा॒ प्रसू॑ता सवि॒तुः स॒वायँ॑ ए॒वा रात्र्यु॒षसे॒ योनि॑मारैक्
verses.transliteration: idáṃ śréṣṭhaṃ jyótiṣāṃ jyótir ā́gāc  citráḥ praketó ajaniṣṭa víbhvā  yáthā prásūtā savitúḥ savā́yam̐  evā́ rā́try uṣáse yónim āraik

translation.text: This light is come, amid all lights the fairest; born is the brilliant, far-extending brightness. Night, sent away for Savitar's uprising, hath yielded up a birth-place for the Morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रुश॑द्वत्सा॒ रुश॑ती श्वे॒त्यागा॒दारै॑गु कृ॒ष्णा सद॑नान्यस्याः स॒मा॒नब॑न्धू अ॒मृते॑ अनू॒ची द्यावा॒ वर्णं॑ चरत आमिना॒ने
verses.transliteration: rúśadvatsā rúśatī śvetyā́gād  ā́raig u kr̥ṣṇā́ sádanāny asyāḥ  samānábandhū amŕ̥te anūcī́  dyā́vā várṇaṃ carata āmināné

translation.text: The Fair, the Bright is come with her white offspring; to her the Dark One hath resigned her dwelling. Akin, immortal, following each other, changing their colours both the heavens move onward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नो अध्वा॒ स्वस्रो॑रन॒न्तस्तम॒न्यान्या॑ चरतो दे॒वशि॑ष्टे न मे॑थेते॒ न त॑स्थतुः सु॒मेके॒ नक्तो॒षासा॒ सम॑नसा॒ विरू॑पे
verses.transliteration: samānó ádhvā svásror anantás  tám anyā́nyā carato deváśiṣṭe  ná methete ná tasthatuḥ suméke  náktoṣā́sā sámanasā vírūpe

translation.text: Common, unending is the Sisters' pathway; taught by the Gods, alternately they travel. Fair-formed, of different hues and yet one-minded, Night and Dawn clash not, neither do they travel.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भास्व॑ती ने॒त्री सू॒नृता॑ना॒मचे॑ति चि॒त्रा वि दुरो॑ न आवः प्रार्प्या॒ जग॒द्व्यु॑ नो रा॒यो अ॑ख्यदु॒षा अ॑जीग॒र्भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: bhā́svatī netrī́ sūnŕ̥tānāṃ  áceti citrā́ ví dúro na āvaḥ  prā́rpyā jágad vy ù no rāyó akhyad  uṣā́ ajīgar bhúvanāni víśvā

translation.text: Bright leader of glad sounds, our eyes behold her; splendid in hue she hath unclosed the portals. She, stirring up the world, hath shown us riches: Dawn hath awakened every living creature.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जि॒ह्म॒श्ये॒३॒॑ चरि॑तवे म॒घोन्या॑भो॒गय॑ इ॒ष्टये॑ रा॒य उ॑ त्वम् द॒भ्रं पश्य॑द्भ्य उर्वि॒या वि॒चक्ष॑ उ॒षा अ॑जीग॒र्भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: jihmaśyè cáritave maghónī-  ābhogáya iṣṭáye rāyá u tvam  dabhrám páśyadbhya urviyā́ vicákṣe-  uṣā́ ajīgar bhúvanāni víśvā

translation.text: Rich Dawn, she sets afoot the coiled-up sleeper, one for enjoyment, one for wealth or worship, Those who saw little for extended vision. All living creatures hath the Dawn awakened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्ष॒त्राय॑ त्वं॒ श्रव॑से त्वं मही॒या इ॒ष्टये॑ त्व॒मर्थ॑मिव त्वमि॒त्यै विस॑दृशा जीवि॒ताभि॑प्र॒चक्ष॑ उ॒षा अ॑जीग॒र्भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: kṣatrā́ya tvaṃ śrávase tvam mahīyaí-  iṣṭáye tvam ártham iva tvam ityaí  vísadr̥śā jīvitā́bhipracákṣe-  uṣā́ ajīgar bhúvanāni víśvā

translation.text: One to high sway, one to exalted glory, one to pursue his gain, and one his labour: All to regard their different vocations, all moving creatures hath the Dawn awakened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा दि॒वो दु॑हि॒ता प्रत्य॑दर्शि व्यु॒च्छन्ती॑ युव॒तिः शु॒क्रवा॑साः विश्व॒स्येशा॑ना॒ पार्थि॑वस्य॒ वस्व॒ उषो॑ अ॒द्येह सु॑भगे॒ व्यु॑च्छ
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ divó duhitā́ práty adarśi  vyuchántī yuvatíḥ śukrávāsāḥ  víśvasyéśānā pā́rthivasya vásvaḥ-  úṣo adyéhá subhage vy ùcha

translation.text: We see her there, the Child of Heaven apparent, the young Maid, flushing in her shining raiment. Thou soyran Lady of all earthly treasure, flush on us here, auspicious Dawn, this morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रा॒य॒ती॒नामन्वे॑ति॒ पाथ॑ आयती॒नां प्र॑थ॒मा शश्व॑तीनाम् व्यु॒च्छन्ती॑ जी॒वमु॑दी॒रय॑न्त्यु॒षा मृ॒तं कं च॒न बो॒धय॑न्ती
verses.transliteration: parāyatīnā́m ánv eti pā́thaḥ-  āyatīnā́m prathamā́ śáśvatīnām  vyuchántī jīvám udīráyanti-  uṣā́ mr̥táṃ káṃ caná bodháyantī

translation.text: She first of endless morns to come hereafter, follows the path of morns that have departed. Dawn, at her rising, urges forth the living him who is dead she wakes not from his slumber.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उषो॒ यद॒ग्निं स॒मिधे॑ च॒कर्थ॒ वि यदाव॒श्चक्ष॑सा॒ सूर्य॑स्य यन्मानु॑षान्य॒क्ष्यमा॑णाँ॒ अजी॑ग॒स्तद्दे॒वेषु॑ चकृषे भ॒द्रमप्नः॑
verses.transliteration: úṣo yád agníṃ samídhe cakártha  ví yád ā́vaś cákṣasā sū́ryasya  yán mā́nuṣān yakṣyámāṇām̐ ájīgas  tád devéṣu cakr̥ṣe bhadrám ápnaḥ

translation.text: As thou, Dawn, hast caused Agni to be kindled, and with the Sun's eye hast revealed creation. And hast awakened men to offer worship, thou hast performed, for Gods, a noble service.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किया॒त्या यत्स॒मया॒ भवा॑ति॒ या व्यू॒षुर्याश्च॑ नू॒नं व्यु॒च्छान् अनु॒ पूर्वाः॑ कृपते वावशा॒ना प्र॒दीध्या॑ना॒ जोष॑म॒न्याभि॑रेति
verses.transliteration: kíyāty ā́ yát samáyā bhávāti  yā́ vyūṣúr yā́ś ca nūnáṃ vyuchā́n  ánu pū́rvāḥ kr̥pate vāvaśānā́  pradī́dhyānā jóṣam anyā́bhir eti

translation.text: How long a time, and they shall be together,– Dawns that have shone and Dawns to shine hereafter? She yearns for former Dawns with eager longing, and goes forth gladly shining with the others.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒युष्टे ये पूर्व॑तरा॒मप॑श्यन्व्यु॒च्छन्ती॑मु॒षसं॒ मर्त्या॑सः अ॒स्माभि॑रू॒ नु प्र॑ति॒चक्ष्या॑भू॒दो ते य॑न्ति॒ ये अ॑प॒रीषु॒ पश्या॑न्
verses.transliteration: īyúṣ ṭé yé pū́rvatarām ápaśyan  vyuchántīm uṣásam mártyāsaḥ  asmā́bhir ū nú praticákṣyābhūd  ó té yanti yé aparī́ṣu páśyān

translation.text: Gone are the men who in the days before us looked on the rising of the earlier Morning. We, we the living, now behold her brightness and they come nigh who shall hereafter see her.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या॒व॒यद्द्वे॑षा ऋत॒पा ऋ॑ते॒जाः सु॑म्ना॒वरी॑ सू॒नृता॑ ई॒रय॑न्ती सु॒म॒ङ्ग॒लीर्बिभ्र॑ती दे॒ववी॑तिमि॒हाद्योषः॒ श्रेष्ठ॑तमा॒ व्यु॑च्छ
verses.transliteration: yāvayáddveṣā r̥tapā́ r̥tejā́ḥ  sumnāvárī sūnŕ̥tā īráyantī  sumaṅgalī́r bíbhratī devávītim  ihā́dyóṣaḥ śréṣṭhatamā vy ùcha

translation.text: Foe-chaser, born of Law, the Law's protectress, joy-giver waker of all pleasant voices, Auspicious, bringing food for Gods' enjoyment, shine on us here, most bright, O Dawn, this morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शश्व॑त्पु॒रोषा व्यु॑वास दे॒व्यथो॑ अ॒द्येदं व्या॑वो म॒घोनी॑ अथो॒ व्यु॑च्छा॒दुत्त॑राँ॒ अनु॒ द्यून॒जरा॒मृता॑ चरति स्व॒धाभिः॑
verses.transliteration: śáśvat puróṣā́ vy ùvāsa devī́-  átho adyédáṃ vy ā̀vo maghónī  átho vy ùchād úttarām̐ ánu dyū́n  ajárāmŕ̥tā carati svadhā́bhiḥ

translation.text: From days eternal hath Dawn shone, the Goddess, and shows this light to-day, endowed with riches. So will she shine on days to come immortal she moves on in her own strength, undecaying.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्य१॒॑ञ्जिभि॑र्दि॒व आता॑स्वद्यौ॒दप॑ कृ॒ष्णां नि॒र्णिजं॑ दे॒व्या॑वः प्र॒बो॒धय॑न्त्यरु॒णेभि॒रश्वै॒रोषा या॑ति सु॒युजा॒ रथे॑न
verses.transliteration: vy àñjíbhir divá ā́tāsv adyaud  ápa kr̥ṣṇā́ṃ nirṇíjaṃ devy ā̀vaḥ  prabodháyanty aruṇébhir áśvair  óṣā́ yāti suyújā ráthena

translation.text: In the sky's borders hath she shone in splendour: the Goddess hath thrown off the veil of darkness. Awakening the world with purple horses, on her well-harnessed chariot Dawn approaches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒वह॑न्ती॒ पोष्या॒ वार्या॑णि चि॒त्रं के॒तुं कृ॑णुते॒ चेकि॑ताना ई॒युषी॑णामुप॒मा शश्व॑तीनां विभाती॒नां प्र॑थ॒मोषा व्य॑श्वैत्
verses.transliteration: āváhantī póṣyā vā́ryāṇi  citráṃ ketúṃ kr̥ṇute cékitānā  īyúṣīṇām upamā́ śáśvatīnāṃ  vibhātīnā́m prathamóṣā́ vy àśvait

translation.text: Bringing all life-sustaining blessings with her, showing herself she sends forth brilliant lustre. Last of the countless mornings that have vanished, first of bright morns to come hath Dawn arisen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदी॑र्ध्वं जी॒वो असु॑र्न॒ आगा॒दप॒ प्रागा॒त्तम॒ आ ज्योति॑रेति आरै॒क्पन्थां॒ यात॑वे॒ सूर्या॒याग॑न्म॒ यत्र॑ प्रति॒रन्त॒ आयुः॑
verses.transliteration: úd īrdhvaṃ jīvó ásur na ā́gād  ápa prā́gāt táma ā́ jyótir eti  ā́raik pánthāṃ yā́tave sū́ryāya-  -áganma yátra pratiránta ā́yuḥ

translation.text: Arise! the breath, the life, again hath reached us: darkness hath passed away and light approacheth. She for the Sun hath left a path to travel we have arrived where men prolong existence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्यूम॑ना वा॒च उदि॑यर्ति॒ वह्निः॒ स्तवा॑नो रे॒भ उ॒षसो॑ विभा॒तीः अ॒द्या तदु॑च्छ गृण॒ते म॑घोन्य॒स्मे आयु॒र्नि दि॑दीहि प्र॒जाव॑त्
verses.transliteration: syū́manā vācá úd iyarti váhniḥ-  stávāno rebhá uṣáso vibhātī́ḥ  adyā́ tád ucha gr̥ṇaté maghoni-  asmé ā́yur ní didīhi prajā́vat

translation.text: Singing the praises of refulgent Mornings with his hymn's web the priest, the poet rises. Shine then to-day, rich Maid, on him who lauds thee, shine down on us the gift of life and offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या गोम॑तीरु॒षसः॒ सर्व॑वीरा व्यु॒च्छन्ति॑ दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य वा॒योरि॑व सू॒नृता॑नामुद॒र्के ता अ॑श्व॒दा अ॑श्नवत्सोम॒सुत्वा॑
verses.transliteration: yā́ gómatīr uṣásaḥ sárvavīrāḥ-  vyuchánti dāśúṣe mártyāya  vāyór iva sūnŕ̥tānām udarké  tā́ aśvadā́ aśnavat somasútvā

translation.text: Dawns giving sons all heroes, kine and horses, shining upon the man who brings oblations,– These let the Soma-presser gain when ending his glad songs louder than the voice of Vâyu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा॒ता दे॒वाना॒मदि॑ते॒रनी॑कं य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुर्बृ॑ह॒ती वि भा॑हि प्र॒श॒स्ति॒कृद्ब्रह्म॑णे नो॒ व्यु१॒॑च्छा नो॒ जने॑ जनय विश्ववारे
verses.transliteration: mātā́ devā́nām áditer ánīkaṃ  yajñásya ketúr br̥hatī́ ví bhāhi  praśastikŕ̥d bráhmaṇe no vy ùcha-  -ā́ no jáne janaya viśvavāre

translation.text: Mother of Gods, Aditi's forui of glory, ensign of sacrifice, shine forth exalted. Rise up, bestowing praise on our devotion all-bounteous, niake us chief among the people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्चि॒त्रमप्न॑ उ॒षसो॒ वह॑न्तीजा॒नाय॑ शशमा॒नाय॑ भ॒द्रम् तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: yác citrám ápna uṣáso váhanti-  -ījānā́ya śaśamānā́ya bhadrám  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: Whatever splendid wealth the Dawns bring with them to bless the man who offers praise and worship, Even that may Mitra, Varuṇa vouchsafe us, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा रु॒द्राय॑ त॒वसे॑ कप॒र्दिने॑ क्ष॒यद्वी॑राय॒ प्र भ॑रामहे म॒तीः यथा॒ शमस॑द्द्वि॒पदे॒ चतु॑ष्पदे॒ विश्वं॑ पु॒ष्टं ग्रामे॑ अ॒स्मिन्न॑नातु॒रम्
verses.transliteration: imā́ rudrā́ya taváse kapardíne  kṣayádvīrāya prá bharāmahe matī́ḥ  yáthā śám ásad dvipáde cátuṣpade  víśvam puṣṭáṃ grā́me asmínn anāturám

translation.text: To the strong Rudra bring we these our songs of praise, to him the Lord of Heros with the braided hair, That it be well with all our cattle and our men, that in this village all he healthy and well-fed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मृ॒ळा नो॑ रुद्रो॒त नो॒ मय॑स्कृधि क्ष॒यद्वी॑राय॒ नम॑सा विधेम ते यच्छं च॒ योश्च॒ मनु॑राये॒जे पि॒ता तद॑श्याम॒ तव॑ रुद्र॒ प्रणी॑तिषु
verses.transliteration: mr̥ḷā́ no rudrotá no máyas kr̥dhi  kṣayádvīrāya námasā vidhema te  yác cháṃ ca yóś ca mánur āyejé pitā́  tád aśyāma táva rudra práṇītiṣu

translation.text: Be gracious unto us, O Rudra, bring us joy: thee, Lord of Heroes, thee with reverence will we serve. Whatever health and strength our father Manu won by sacrifice may we, under thy guidance, gain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒श्याम॑ ते सुम॒तिं दे॑वय॒ज्यया॑ क्ष॒यद्वी॑रस्य॒ तव॑ रुद्र मीढ्वः सु॒म्ना॒यन्निद्विशो॑ अ॒स्माक॒मा च॒रारि॑ष्टवीरा जुहवाम ते ह॒विः
verses.transliteration: aśyā́ma te sumatíṃ devayajyáyā  kṣayádvīrasya táva rudra mīḍhvaḥ  sumnāyánn íd víśo asmā́kam ā́ cara-  -áriṣṭavīrā juhavāma te havíḥ

translation.text: By worship of the Gods may we, O Bounteous One, O Rudra, gain thy grace, Ruler of valiant men. Come to our families, bringing them bliss: may we, whose heroes are uninjured, bring thee sacred gifts,

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे॒षं व॒यं रु॒द्रं य॑ज्ञ॒साधं॑ व॒ङ्कुं क॒विमव॑से॒ नि ह्व॑यामहे आ॒रे अ॒स्मद्दैव्यं॒ हेळो॑ अस्यतु सुम॒तिमिद्व॒यम॒स्या वृ॑णीमहे
verses.transliteration: tveṣáṃ vayáṃ rudráṃ yajñasā́dhaṃ  vaṅkúṃ kavím ávase ní hvayāmahe  āré asmád daívyaṃ héḷo asyatu  sumatím íd vayám asyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Hither we call for aid the wise, the wanderer, impetuous Rudra, perfecter of sacri fice. May he repel from us the anger of the Gods: verily we desire his favourable grace.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो व॑रा॒हम॑रु॒षं क॑प॒र्दिनं॑ त्वे॒षं रू॒पं नम॑सा॒ नि ह्व॑यामहे हस्ते॒ बिभ्र॑द्भेष॒जा वार्या॑णि॒ शर्म॒ वर्म॑ च्छ॒र्दिर॒स्मभ्यं॑ यंसत्
verses.transliteration: divó varāhám aruṣáṃ kapardínaṃ  tveṣáṃ rūpáṃ námasā ní hvayāmahe  háste bíbhrad bheṣajā́ vā́ryāṇi  śárma várma chardír asmábhyaṃ yaṃsat

translation.text: Him with the braided hair we call with reverence down, the wild-boar of the sky, the red, the dazzling shape. May he, his hand filled full of sovran medicines, grant us protection, shelter, and a home secure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं पि॒त्रे म॒रुता॑मुच्यते॒ वचः॑ स्वा॒दोः स्वादी॑यो रु॒द्राय॒ वर्ध॑नम् रास्वा॑ च नो अमृत मर्त॒भोज॑नं॒ त्मने॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय मृळ
verses.transliteration: idám pitré marútām ucyate vácaḥ  svādóḥ svā́dīyo rudrā́ya várdhanam  rā́svā ca no amr̥ta martabhójanaṃ  tmáne tokā́ya tánayāya mr̥ḷa

translation.text: To him the Maruts' Father is this hymn addressed, to strengthen Rudra's might, a song more sweet than sweet. Grant us, Immortal One, the food which mortals eat: be gracious unto me, my seed, my progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ म॒हान्त॑मु॒त मा नो॑ अर्भ॒कं मा न॒ उक्ष॑न्तमु॒त मा न॑ उक्षि॒तम् मा नो॑ वधीः पि॒तरं॒ मोत मा॒तरं॒ मा नः॑ प्रि॒यास्त॒न्वो॑ रुद्र रीरिषः
verses.transliteration: mā́ no mahā́ntam utá mā́ no arbhakám  mā́ na úkṣantam utá mā́ na ukṣitám  mā́ no vadhīḥ pitáram mótá mātáram  mā́ naḥ priyā́s tanvò rudra rīriṣaḥ

translation.text: O Rudra, harm not either great or small of us, harm not the growing boy, harm not the full-grown man. Slay not a sire among us, slay no mother here, and to our own dear bodies, Rudra, do not harm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा न॑स्तो॒के तन॑ये॒ मा न॑ आ॒यौ मा नो॒ गोषु॒ मा नो॒ अश्वे॑षु रीरिषः वी॒रान्मा नो॑ रुद्र भामि॒तो व॑धीर्ह॒विष्म॑न्तः॒ सद॒मित्त्वा॑ हवामहे
verses.transliteration: mā́ nas toké tánaye mā́ na āyaú  mā́ no góṣu mā́ no áśveṣu rīriṣaḥ  vīrā́n mā́ no rudra bhāmitó vadhīr  havíṣmantaḥ sádam ít tvā havāmahe

translation.text: Harm us not, Rudra, in our seed and progeny, harm us not in the living, nor in cows or steeds, Slay not our heroes in the fury of thy wrath. Bringing oblations evermore we call to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ ते॒ स्तोमा॑न्पशु॒पा इ॒वाक॑रं॒ रास्वा॑ पितर्मरुतां सु॒म्नम॒स्मे भ॒द्रा हि ते॑ सुम॒तिर्मृ॑ळ॒यत्त॒माथा॑ व॒यमव॒ इत्ते॑ वृणीमहे
verses.transliteration: úpa te stómān paśupā́ ivā́karaṃ  rā́svā pitar marutāṃ sumnám asmé  bhadrā́ hí te sumatír mr̥ḷayáttamā-  -áthā vayám áva ít te vr̥ṇīmahe

translation.text: Even as a herdsman I have brought thee hymns of praise: O Father of the Maruts, give us happiness, Blessed is thy most favouring benevolence, so, verily, do we desire thy saving help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒रे ते॑ गो॒घ्नमु॒त पू॑रुष॒घ्नं क्षय॑द्वीर सु॒म्नम॒स्मे ते॑ अस्तु मृ॒ळा च॑ नो॒ अधि॑ च ब्रूहि दे॒वाधा॑ च नः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छ द्वि॒बर्हाः॑
verses.transliteration: āré te goghnám utá pūruṣaghnáṃ  kṣáyadvīra sumnám asmé te astu  mr̥ḷā́ ca no ádhi ca brūhi deva-  -ádhā ca naḥ śárma yacha dvibárhāḥ

translation.text: Far be thy dart that killeth men or cattle: thy bliss be with us, O thou Lord of Heroes. Be gracious unto us, O God, and bless us, and then vouchsafe us doubly-strong protection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवो॑चाम॒ नमो॑ अस्मा अव॒स्यवः॑ शृ॒णोतु॑ नो॒ हवं॑ रु॒द्रो म॒रुत्वा॑न् तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: ávocāma námo asmā avasyávaḥ  śr̥ṇótu no hávaṃ rudró marútvān  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: We, seeking help, have spoken and adored him: may Rudra, girt by Maruts, hear our calling. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चि॒त्रं दे॒वाना॒मुद॑गा॒दनी॑कं॒ चक्षु॑र्मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्या॒ग्नेः आप्रा॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षं॒ सूर्य॑ आ॒त्मा जग॑तस्त॒स्थुष॑श्च
verses.transliteration: citráṃ devā́nām úd agād ánīkaṃ  cákṣur mitrásya váruṇasyāgnéḥ  ā́prā dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ antárikṣaṃ  sū́rya ātmā́ jágatas tasthúṣaś ca

translation.text: THE brilliant presence of the Gods hath risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuṇa and Agni. The soul of all that moveth not or moveth, the Sun hath filled the air and earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सूर्यो॑ दे॒वीमु॒षसं॒ रोच॑मानां॒ मर्यो॒ न योषा॑म॒भ्ये॑ति प॒श्चात् यत्रा॒ नरो॑ देव॒यन्तो॑ यु॒गानि॑ वितन्व॒ते प्रति॑ भ॒द्राय॑ भ॒द्रम्
verses.transliteration: sū́ryo devī́m uṣásaṃ rócamānām  máryo ná yóṣām abhy èti paścā́t  yátrā náro devayánto yugā́ni  vitanvaté práti bhadrā́ya bhadrám

translation.text: Like as a young man followeth a maiden, so doth the Sun the Dawn, refulgent Goddess: Where pious men extend their generations, before the Auspicious One for happy fortune.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रा अश्वा॑ ह॒रितः॒ सूर्य॑स्य चि॒त्रा एत॑ग्वा अनु॒माद्या॑सः न॒म॒स्यन्तो॑ दि॒व आ पृ॒ष्ठम॑स्थुः॒ परि॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी य॑न्ति स॒द्यः
verses.transliteration: bhadrā́ áśvā harítaḥ sū́ryasya  citrā́ étagvā anumā́dyāsaḥ  namasyánto divá ā́ pr̥ṣṭhám asthuḥ  pári dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ yanti sadyáḥ

translation.text: Auspicious are the Sun's Bay-coloured Horses, bright, changing hues, meet for our shouts of triumph. Bearing our prayers, die sky's ridge have they mounted, and in a moment speed round earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्सूर्य॑स्य देव॒त्वं तन्म॑हि॒त्वं म॒ध्या कर्तो॒र्वित॑तं॒ सं ज॑भार य॒देदयु॑क्त ह॒रितः॑ स॒धस्था॒दाद्रात्री॒ वास॑स्तनुते सि॒मस्मै॑
verses.transliteration: tát sū́ryasya devatváṃ tán mahitvám  madhyā́ kártor vítataṃ sáṃ jabhāra  yadéd áyukta harítaḥ sadhásthād  ā́d rā́trī vā́sas tanute simásmai

translation.text: This is the Godhead, this might of Sûrya: he hath withdrawn what spread o'er work unfinished. When he hath loosed his Horses from their station, straight over all Night spreadeth out her garment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्याभि॒चक्षे॒ सूर्यो॑ रू॒पं कृ॑णुते॒ द्योरु॒पस्थे॑ अ॒न॒न्तम॒न्यद्रुश॑दस्य॒ पाजः॑ कृ॒ष्णम॒न्यद्ध॒रितः॒ सं भ॑रन्ति
verses.transliteration: tán mitrásya váruṇasyābhicákṣe  sū́ryo rūpáṃ kr̥ṇute dyór upásthe  anantám anyád rúśad asya pā́jaḥ  kr̥ṣṇám anyád dharítaḥ sám bharanti

translation.text: In the sky's lap the Sun this form assumeth that Varuṇa and Mitra may behold it. His Bay Steeds well maintain his power eternal, at one time bright and darksome at another.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्या दे॑वा॒ उदि॑ता॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ निरंह॑सः पिपृ॒ता निर॑व॒द्यात् तन्नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो मामहन्ता॒मदि॑तिः॒ सिन्धुः॑ पृथि॒वी उ॒त द्यौः
verses.transliteration: adyā́ devā úditā sū́ryasya  nír áṃhasaḥ pipr̥tā́ nír avadyā́t  tán no mitró váruṇo māmahantām  áditiḥ síndhuḥ pr̥thivī́ utá dyaúḥ

translation.text: This day, O Gods, while Sûrya is ascending, deliver us from trouble and dishonour. This prayer of ours may Varuṇa grant, and Mitra, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: नास॑त्याभ्यां ब॒र्हिरि॑व॒ प्र वृ॑ञ्जे॒ स्तोमाँ॑ इयर्म्य॒भ्रिये॑व॒ वातः॑ यावर्भ॑गाय विम॒दाय॑ जा॒यां से॑ना॒जुवा॑ न्यू॒हतू॒ रथे॑न
verses.transliteration: nā́satyābhyām barhír iva prá vr̥ñje  stómām̐ iyarmy abhríyeva vā́taḥ  yā́v árbhagāya vimadā́ya jāyā́ṃ  senājúvā nyūhátū ráthena

translation.text: I TRIM like grass my song for the Nâsatyas and send their lauds forth as the wind drives rainclouds, Who, in a chariot rapid as an arrow, brought to the youthful Vimada a consort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वी॒ळु॒पत्म॑भिराशु॒हेम॑भिर्वा दे॒वानां॑ वा जू॒तिभिः॒ शाश॑दाना तद्रास॑भो नासत्या स॒हस्र॑मा॒जा य॒मस्य॑ प्र॒धने॑ जिगाय
verses.transliteration: vīḷupátmabhir āśuhémabhir vā  devā́nāṃ vā jūtíbhiḥ śā́śadānā  tád rā́sabho nāsatyā sahásram  ājā́ yamásya pradháne jigāya

translation.text: Borne on by rapid steeds of mighty pinion, or proudly trusting in the Gods' incitements. That stallion ass of yours won, O Nâsatyas, that thousand in the race, in Yama's contest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुग्रो॑ ह भु॒ज्युम॑श्विनोदमे॒घे र॒यिं न कश्चि॑न्ममृ॒वाँ अवा॑हाः तमू॑हथुर्नौ॒भिरा॑त्म॒न्वती॑भिरन्तरिक्ष॒प्रुद्भि॒रपो॑दकाभिः
verses.transliteration: túgro ha bhujyúm aśvinodameghé  rayíṃ ná káś cin mamr̥vā́m̐ ávāhāḥ  tám ūhathur naubhír ātmanvátībhir  antarikṣaprúdbhir ápodakābhiḥ

translation.text: Yea, Aṣvins, as a dead man leaves his riches, Tugra left Bhujyu in the cloud of waters. Ye brought him back in animated vessels, traversing air, unwetted by the billows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒स्रः क्षप॒स्त्रिरहा॑ति॒व्रज॑द्भि॒र्नास॑त्या भु॒ज्युमू॑हथुः पतं॒गैः स॒मु॒द्रस्य॒ धन्व॑न्ना॒र्द्रस्य॑ पा॒रे त्रि॒भी रथैः॑ श॒तप॑द्भिः॒ षळ॑श्वैः
verses.transliteration: tisráḥ kṣápas trír áhātivrájadbhir  nā́satyā bhujyúm ūhathuḥ pataṃgaíḥ  samudrásya dhánvann ārdrásya pāré  tribhī́ ráthaiḥ śatápadbhiḥ ṣáḷaśvaiḥ

translation.text: Bhujyu ye bore with winged things, Nâsatyas, which for three nights, three days full swiftly travelled, To the sea's farther shore, the strand of ocean, in three cars, hundred-footed, with six horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ना॒र॒म्भ॒णे तद॑वीरयेथामनास्था॒ने अ॑ग्रभ॒णे स॑मु॒द्रे यद॑श्विना ऊ॒हथु॑र्भु॒ज्युमस्तं॑ श॒तारि॑त्रां॒ नाव॑मातस्थि॒वांस॑म्
verses.transliteration: anārambhaṇé tád avīrayethām  anāsthāné agrabhaṇé samudré  yád aśvinā ūháthur bhujyúm ástaṃ  śatā́ritrāṃ nā́vam ātasthivā́ṃsam

translation.text: Ye wrought that hero exploit in the ocean which giveth no support, or hold or station, What time ye carried Bhujyu to his dwelling, borne in a ship with hundred oars, O Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यम॑श्विना द॒दथुः॑ श्वे॒तमश्व॑म॒घाश्वा॑य॒ शश्व॒दित्स्व॒स्ति तद्वां॑ दा॒त्रं महि॑ की॒र्तेन्यं॑ भूत्पै॒द्वो वा॒जी सद॒मिद्धव्यो॑ अ॒र्यः
verses.transliteration: yám aśvinā dadáthuḥ śvetám áśvam  aghā́śvāya śáśvad ít svastí  tád vāṃ dātrám máhi kīrtényam bhūt  paidvó vājī́ sádam íd dhávyo aryáḥ

translation.text: The white horse which of old ye gave Aghasva, Aṣvins, a gift to be his wealth for ever,– Still to be praised is that your glorious present, still to be famed is the braye horse of Pedu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं न॑रा स्तुव॒ते प॑ज्रि॒याय॑ क॒क्षीव॑ते अरदतं॒ पुरं॑धिम् का॒रो॒त॒राच्छ॒फादश्व॑स्य॒ वृष्णः॑ श॒तं कु॒म्भाँ अ॑सिञ्चतं॒ सुरा॑याः
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ narā stuvaté pajriyā́ya  kakṣī́vate aradatam púraṃdhim  kārotarā́c chaphā́d áśvasya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ  śatáṃ kumbhā́m̐ asiñcataṃ súrāyāḥ

translation.text: O Heroes, ye gave wisdom to Kakshîvân who sprang from Pajra's line, who sang your praises. Ye poured forth from the hoof of your strong charger a hundred jars of wine as from a strainer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒मेना॒ग्निं घ्रं॒सम॑वारयेथां पितु॒मती॒मूर्ज॑मस्मा अधत्तम् ऋ॒बीसे॒ अत्रि॑मश्वि॒नाव॑नीत॒मुन्नि॑न्यथुः॒ सर्व॑गणं स्व॒स्ति
verses.transliteration: himénāgníṃ ghraṃsám avārayethām  pitumátīm ū́rjam asmā adhattam  r̥bī́se átrim aśvinā́vanītam  ún ninyathuḥ sárvagaṇaṃ svastí

translation.text: Ye warded off with cold the fire's fierce burning; food very rich in nouripliment ye furnished. Atri, cast downward in the cavern, Aṣvins ye brought, with all his people, forth to comfort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॑व॒तं ना॑सत्यानुदेथामु॒च्चाबु॑ध्नं चक्रथुर्जि॒ह्मबा॑रम् क्षर॒न्नापो॒ न पा॒यना॑य रा॒ये स॒हस्रा॑य॒ तृष्य॑ते॒ गोत॑मस्य
verses.transliteration: párāvatáṃ nāsatyānudethām  uccā́budhnaṃ cakrathur jihmábāram  kṣárann ā́po ná pāyánāya rāyé  sahásrāya tŕ̥ṣyate gótamasya

translation.text: Ye lifted up the well, O ye Nâsatyas, and set the base on high to open downward. Streams flowed for folk of Gotama who thirsted, like rain to bring forth thousandfold abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जु॒जु॒रुषो॑ नासत्यो॒त व॒व्रिं प्रामु॑ञ्चतं द्रा॒पिमि॑व॒ च्यवा॑नात् प्राति॑रतं जहि॒तस्यायु॑र्द॒स्रादित्पति॑मकृणुतं क॒नीना॑म्
verses.transliteration: jujurúṣo nāsatyotá vavrím  prā́muñcataṃ drāpím iva cyávānāt  prā́tirataṃ jahitásyā́yur dasrā-  -ā́d ít pátim akr̥ṇutaṃ kanī́nām

translation.text: Ye from the old Chyavâna, O Nâsatyas, stripped, as 'twere mail, the skin upon his body, Lengthened his life when all had left him helpless, Dasras! and made him lord of youthful maidens.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वां॑ नरा॒ शंस्यं॒ राध्यं॑ चाभिष्टि॒मन्ना॑सत्या॒ वरू॑थम् यद्वि॒द्वांसा॑ नि॒धिमि॒वाप॑गूळ्ह॒मुद्द॑र्श॒तादू॒पथु॒र्वन्द॑नाय
verses.transliteration: tád vāṃ narā śáṃsyaṃ rā́dhyaṃ ca-  -abhiṣṭimán nāsatyā várūtham  yád vidvā́ṃsā nidhím ivā́pagūḷham  úd darśatā́d ūpáthur vándanāya

translation.text: Worthy of praise and worth the winning, Heroes, is that your favouring succour O Nâsatyas, What time ye, knowing well his case, delivered Vandana trom the pit like hidden treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वां॑ नरा स॒नये॒ दंस॑ उ॒ग्रमा॒विष्कृ॑णोमि तन्य॒तुर्न वृ॒ष्टिम् द॒ध्यङ्ह॒ यन्मध्वा॑थर्व॒णो वा॒मश्व॑स्य शी॒र्ष्णा प्र यदी॑मु॒वाच॑
verses.transliteration: tád vāṃ narā sanáye dáṃsa ugrám  āvíṣ kr̥ṇomi tanyatúr ná vr̥ṣṭím  dadhyáṅ ha yán mádhv ātharvaṇó vām  áśvasya śīrṣṇā́ prá yád īm uvā́ca

translation.text: That mighty deed of yours, for gain, O Heroes, as thunder heraldeth the rain, I publish, When, by the horse's head, Atharvan's offspring Dadhyac made known to you the Soma's sweetness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अजो॑हवीन्नासत्या क॒रा वां॑ म॒हे याम॑न्पुरुभुजा॒ पुरं॑धिः श्रु॒तं तच्छासु॑रिव वध्रिम॒त्या हिर॑ण्यहस्तमश्विनावदत्तम्
verses.transliteration: ájohavīn nāsatyā karā́ vām  mahé yā́man purubhujā púraṃdhiḥ  śrutáṃ tác chā́sur iva vadhrimatyā́ḥ-  híraṇyahastam aśvināv adattam

translation.text: In the great rite the wise dame called, Nâsatyas, you, Lords of many treasures, to assist her. Ye heard the weakling's wife, as 'twere an order, and gave to her a son Hiraṇyahasta.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒स्नो वृक॑स्य॒ वर्ति॑काम॒भीके॑ यु॒वं न॑रा नासत्यामुमुक्तम् उ॒तो क॒विं पु॑रुभुजा यु॒वं ह॒ कृप॑माणमकृणुतं वि॒चक्षे॑
verses.transliteration: āsnó vŕ̥kasya vártikām abhī́ke  yuváṃ narā nāsatyāmumuktam  utó kavím purubhujā yuváṃ ha  kŕ̥pamāṇam akr̥ṇutaṃ vicákṣe

translation.text: Ye from the wolf's jaws, as ye stood together, set free the quail, O Heroes, O Nâsatyas. Ye, Lords of many treasures, gave the poet his perfect vision as he mourned his trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒रित्रं॒ हि वेरि॒वाच्छे॑दि प॒र्णमा॒जा खे॒लस्य॒ परि॑तक्म्यायाम् स॒द्यो जङ्घा॒माय॑सीं वि॒श्पला॑यै॒ धने॑ हि॒ते सर्त॑वे॒ प्रत्य॑धत्तम्
verses.transliteration: carítraṃ hí vér ivā́chedi parṇám  ājā́ khelásya páritakmyāyām  sadyó jáṅghām ā́yasīṃ viśpálāyai  dháne hité sártave práty adhattam

translation.text: When in the time of night, in Khela's battle, a leg was severed like a wild bird's pinion, Straight ye gave Vispali a leg of iron that she might move what time the conflict opened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं मे॒षान्वृ॒क्ये॑ चक्षदा॒नमृ॒ज्राश्वं॒ तं पि॒तान्धं च॑कार तस्मा॑ अ॒क्षी ना॑सत्या वि॒चक्ष॒ आध॑त्तं दस्रा भिषजावन॒र्वन्
verses.transliteration: śatám meṣā́n vr̥kyè cakṣadānám  r̥jrā́śvaṃ tám pitā́ndháṃ cakāra  tásmā akṣī́ nāsatyā vicákṣe-  ā́dhattaṃ dasrā bhiṣajāv anarván

translation.text: His father robbed R̥ijrâṣva of his eyesight who for the she-wolf slew a hundred wethers. Ye gave him eyes, Nâsatyas, Wonder-Workers, Physicians, that he saw with sight uninjured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ रथं॑ दुहि॒ता सूर्य॑स्य॒ कार्ष्मे॑वातिष्ठ॒दर्व॑ता॒ जय॑न्ती विश्वे॑ दे॒वा अन्व॑मन्यन्त हृ॒द्भिः समु॑ श्रि॒या ना॑सत्या सचेथे
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ ráthaṃ duhitā́ sū́ryasya  kā́rṣmevātiṣṭhad árvatā jáyantī  víśve devā́ ánv amanyanta hr̥dbhíḥ  sám u śriyā́ nāsatyā sacethe

translation.text: The Daughter of the Sun your car ascended, first reaching as it were the goal with coursers. All Deities within their hearts assented, and ye, Nâsatyas, are close linked with glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदया॑तं॒ दिवो॑दासाय व॒र्तिर्भ॒रद्वा॑जायाश्विना॒ हय॑न्ता रे॒वदु॑वाह सच॒नो रथो॑ वां वृष॒भश्च॑ शिंशु॒मार॑श्च यु॒क्ता
verses.transliteration: yád áyātaṃ dívodāsāya vartír  bharádvājāyāśvinā háyantā  revád uvāha sacanó rátho vāṃ  vr̥ṣabháś ca śiṃśumā́raś ca yuktā́

translation.text: When to his house ye came, to Divodâsa, hasting to Bharadvâja, O ye Aṣvins, The car that came with you brought splendid riches: a porpoise and a bull were yoked together.

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒यिं सु॑क्ष॒त्रं स्व॑प॒त्यमायुः॑ सु॒वीर्यं॑ नासत्या॒ वह॑न्ता आ ज॒ह्नावीं॒ सम॑न॒सोप॒ वाजै॒स्त्रिरह्नो॑ भा॒गं दध॑तीमयातम्
verses.transliteration: rayíṃ sukṣatráṃ svapatyám ā́yuḥ  suvī́ryaṃ nāsatyā váhantā  ā́ jahnā́vīṃ sámanasópa vā́jais  trír áhno bhāgáṃ dádhatīm ayātam

translation.text: Ye, bringing wealth with rule, and life with offspring, life rich in noble heroes; O Nâsatyas, Accordant came with strength to Jahnu's children who offered you thrice every day your portion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑विष्टं जाहु॒षं वि॒श्वतः॑ सीं सु॒गेभि॒र्नक्त॑मूहथू॒ रजो॑भिः वि॒भि॒न्दुना॑ नासत्या॒ रथे॑न॒ वि पर्व॑ताँ अजर॒यू अ॑यातम्
verses.transliteration: páriviṣṭaṃ jāhuṣáṃ viśvátaḥ sīṃ  sugébhir náktam ūhathū rájobhiḥ  vibhindúnā nāsatyā ráthena  ví párvatām̐ ajarayū́ ayātam

translation.text: Ye bore away at night by easy pathways Jâhusha compassed round on every quarter, And, with your car that cleaves the toe asunder, Nâsatyas never decaying! rent the mountains.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एक॑स्या॒ वस्तो॑रावतं॒ रणा॑य॒ वश॑मश्विना स॒नये॑ स॒हस्रा॑ निर॑हतं दु॒च्छुना॒ इन्द्र॑वन्ता पृथु॒श्रव॑सो वृषणा॒वरा॑तीः
verses.transliteration: ékasyā vástor āvataṃ ráṇāya  váśam aśvinā sanáye sahásrā  nír ahataṃ duchúnā índravantā  pr̥thuśrávaso vr̥ṣaṇāv árātīḥ

translation.text: One morn ye strengthened Vaga for the battle, to gather spoils that might be told in thousands. With Indra joined ye drove away misfortunes, yea foes of Pr̥ithuṣravas, O ye mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒रस्य॑ चिदार्च॒त्कस्या॑व॒तादा नी॒चादु॒च्चा च॑क्रथुः॒ पात॑वे॒ वाः श॒यवे॑ चिन्नासत्या॒ शची॑भि॒र्जसु॑रये स्त॒र्यं॑ पिप्यथु॒र्गाम्
verses.transliteration: śarásya cid ārcatkásyāvatā́d~ā́  nīcā́d uccā́ cakrathuḥ pā́tave vā́ḥ  śayáve cin nāsatyā śácībhir  jásuraye staryàm pipyathur gā́m

translation.text: From the deep well ye raised on high the water, so that R̥ichatka's son, Ṣara, should drink it; And with your might, to help the weary Ṣayu, ye made the barren cow yield milk, Nâsatyas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒व॒स्य॒ते स्तु॑व॒ते कृ॑ष्णि॒याय॑ ऋजूय॒ते ना॑सत्या॒ शची॑भिः प॒शुं न न॒ष्टमि॑व॒ दर्श॑नाय विष्णा॒प्वं॑ ददथु॒र्विश्व॑काय
verses.transliteration: avasyaté stuvaté kr̥ṣṇiyā́ya  r̥jūyaté nāsatyā śácībhiḥ  paśúṃ ná naṣṭám iva dárśanāya  viṣṇāpvàṃ dadathur víśvakāya

translation.text: To Viṣvaka, Nâsatyas! son of Kr̥ishṇa, the righteous man who sought your aid and praised you, Ye with your powers restored, like some lost creature, his son Vishṇâpû for his eyes to look on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दश॒ रात्री॒रशि॑वेना॒ नव॒ द्यूनव॑नद्धं श्नथि॒तम॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तः विप्रु॑तं रे॒भमु॒दनि॒ प्रवृ॑क्त॒मुन्नि॑न्यथुः॒ सोम॑मिव स्रु॒वेण॑
verses.transliteration: dáśa rā́trīr áśivenā náva dyū́n  ávanaddhaṃ śnathitám apsv àntáḥ  víprutaṃ rebhám udáni právr̥ktam  ún ninyathuḥ sómam iva sruvéṇa

translation.text: Aṣvins, ye raised, like Soma in a ladle Rebha, who for ten days and ten nights, fettered. Had lain in cruel bonds, immersed and wounded, suffering sore affliction, in the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वां॒ दंसां॑स्यश्विनाववोचम॒स्य पतिः॑ स्यां सु॒गवः॑ सु॒वीरः॑ उ॒त पश्य॑न्नश्नु॒वन्दी॒र्घमायु॒रस्त॑मि॒वेज्ज॑रि॒माणं॑ जगम्याम्
verses.transliteration: prá vāṃ dáṃsāṃsy aśvināv avocam  asyá pátiḥ syāṃ sugávaḥ suvī́raḥ  utá páśyann aśnuván dīrghám ā́yur  ástam ivéj jarimā́ṇaṃ jagamyām

translation.text: I have declared your wondrous deeds, O Aṣvins: may this be mine, and many kine and heroes. May I, enjoying lengthened life, still seeing, enter old age as 'twere the house I live in.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: मध्वः॒ सोम॑स्याश्विना॒ मदा॑य प्र॒त्नो होता वि॑वासते वाम् ब॒र्हिष्म॑ती रा॒तिर्विश्रि॑ता॒ गीरि॒षा या॑तं नास॒त्योप॒ वाजैः॑
verses.transliteration: mádhvaḥ sómasyāśvinā mádāya  pratnó hótā́ vivāsate vām  barhíṣmatī rātír víśritā gī́r  iṣā́ yātaṃ nāsatyópa vā́jaiḥ

translation.text: ASVINS, your ancient priest invites you hither to gladden you with draughts of meath of Soma. Our gift is on the grass, our song apportioned: with food and strength come hither, O Nâsatyas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वा॑मश्विना॒ मन॑सो॒ जवी॑या॒न्रथः॒ स्वश्वो॒ विश॑ आ॒जिगा॑ति येन॒ गच्छ॑थः सु॒कृतो॑ दुरो॒णं तेन॑ नरा व॒र्तिर॒स्मभ्यं॑ यातम्
verses.transliteration: yó vām aśvinā mánaso jávīyān  ráthaḥ sváśvo víśa ājígāti  yéna gáchathaḥ sukŕ̥to duroṇáṃ  téna narā vartír asmábhyaṃ yātam

translation.text: That car of yours, swifter than thought, O Aṣvins, which drawn by brave steeds cometh to the people, Whereon ye seek the dwelling of the pious,– come ye thereon to our abode, O Heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋषिं॑ नरा॒वंह॑सः॒ पाञ्च॑जन्यमृ॒बीसा॒दत्रिं॑ मुञ्चथो ग॒णेन॑ मि॒नन्ता॒ दस्यो॒रशि॑वस्य मा॒या अ॑नुपू॒र्वं वृ॑षणा चो॒दय॑न्ता
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥ṣiṃ narāv áṃhasaḥ pā́ñcajanyam  r̥bī́sād átrim muñcatho gaṇéna  minántā dásyor áśivasya māyā́ḥ-  anupūrváṃ vr̥ṣaṇā codáyantā

translation.text: Ye freed sage Atri, whom the Five Tribes honoured, from the strait pit, ye Heroes with his people, Baffling the guiles of the malignant Dasyu, repelling them, ye Mighty in succession.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वं॒ न गू॒ळ्हम॑श्विना दु॒रेवै॒र्ऋषिं॑ नरा वृषणा रे॒भम॒प्सु सं तं रि॑णीथो॒ विप्रु॑तं॒ दंसो॑भि॒र्न वां॑ जूर्यन्ति पू॒र्व्या कृ॒तानि॑
verses.transliteration: áśvaṃ ná gūḷhám aśvinā durévair  ŕ̥ṣiṃ narā vr̥ṣaṇā rebhám apsú  sáṃ táṃ riṇītho víprutaṃ dáṃsobhir  ná vāṃ jūryanti pūrvyā́ kr̥tā́ni

translation.text: Rebha the sage, ye mighty Heroes, Aṣvins! whom, like a horse, vile men had sunk in water,– Him, wounded, with your wondrous power ye rescued: your exploits of old time endure for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒षु॒प्वांसं॒ न निर्ऋ॑तेरु॒पस्थे॒ सूर्यं॒ न द॑स्रा॒ तम॑सि क्षि॒यन्त॑म् शु॒भे रु॒क्मं न द॑र्श॒तं निखा॑त॒मुदू॑पथुरश्विना॒ वन्द॑नाय
verses.transliteration: suṣupvā́ṃsaṃ ná nírr̥ter upásthe  sū́ryaṃ ná dasrā támasi kṣiyántam  śubhé rukmáṃ ná darśatáṃ níkhātam  úd ūpathur aśvinā vándanāya

translation.text: Ye brought forth Vandana, ye Wonder-Workers, for triumph, like fair gold that hath been buried, Like one who slumbered in destruction's bosom, or like the Sun when dwelling in the darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वां॑ नरा॒ शंस्यं॑ पज्रि॒येण॑ क॒क्षीव॑ता नासत्या॒ परि॑ज्मन् श॒फादश्व॑स्य वा॒जिनो॒ जना॑य श॒तं कु॒म्भाँ अ॑सिञ्चतं॒ मधू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: tád vāṃ narā śáṃsyam pajriyéṇa  kakṣī́vatā nāsatyā párijman  śaphā́d áśvasya vājíno jánāya  śatáṃ kumbhā́m̐ asiñcatam mádhūnām

translation.text: Kakshîvân, Pajra's son, must laud that exploit of yours, Nâsatyas, Heroes, ye who wander! When from the hoof of your strong horse ye showered a hundred jars of honey for the people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं न॑रा स्तुव॒ते कृ॑ष्णि॒याय॑ विष्णा॒प्वं॑ ददथु॒र्विश्व॑काय घोषा॑यै चित्पितृ॒षदे॑ दुरो॒णे पतिं॒ जूर्य॑न्त्या अश्विनावदत्तम्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ narā stuvaté kr̥ṣṇiyā́ya  viṣṇāpvàṃ dadathur víśvakāya  ghóṣāyai cit pitr̥ṣáde duroṇé  pátiṃ jū́ryantyā aśvināv adattam

translation.text: To Kr̥ishṇa's son, to Viṣvaka who praised you, O Heroes, ye restored his son Vishṇâpû. To Ghoshâ, living in her father's dwelling, stricken in years, ye gave a husband, Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं श्यावा॑य॒ रुश॑तीमदत्तं म॒हः क्षो॒णस्या॑श्विना॒ कण्वा॑य प्र॒वाच्यं॒ तद्वृ॑षणा कृ॒तं वां॒ यन्ना॑र्ष॒दाय॒ श्रवो॑ अ॒ध्यध॑त्तम्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ śyā́vāya rúśatīm adattam  maháḥ kṣoṇásyāśvinā káṇvāya  pravā́cyaṃ tád vr̥ṣaṇā kr̥táṃ vāṃ  yán nārṣadā́ya śrávo adhyádhattam

translation.text: Rusati, of the mighty people, Aṣvins, ye gave to Ṣyâva of the line of Kaṇva. This deed of yours, ye Strong Ones should be published, that ye gave glory to the son of Nr̥ishad.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रू वर्पां॑स्यश्विना॒ दधा॑ना॒ नि पे॒दव॑ ऊहथुरा॒शुमश्व॑म् स॒ह॒स्र॒सां वा॒जिन॒मप्र॑तीतमहि॒हनं॑ श्रव॒स्यं१॒॑ तरु॑त्रम्
verses.transliteration: purū́ várpāṃsy aśvinā dádhānā  ní pedáva ūhathur āśúm áśvam  sahasrasā́ṃ vājínam ápratītam  ahihánaṃ śravasyàṃ tárutram

translation.text: O Aṣvins, wearing many forms at pleasure, on Pedu ye bestowed a fleet-foot courser, Strong, winner of a thousand spoils, resistless the serpent slayer, glorious, triumphant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तानि॑ वां श्रव॒स्या॑ सुदानू॒ ब्रह्मा॑ङ्गू॒षं सद॑नं॒ रोद॑स्योः यद्वां॑ प॒ज्रासो॑ अश्विना॒ हव॑न्ते या॒तमि॒षा च॑ वि॒दुषे॑ च॒ वाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: etā́ni vāṃ śravasyā̀ sudānū  bráhmāṅgūṣáṃ sádanaṃ ródasyoḥ  yád vām pajrā́so aśvinā hávante  yātám iṣā́ ca vidúṣe ca vā́jam

translation.text: These glorious things are yours, ye Bounteous Givers; prayer, praise in both worlds are your habitation. O Aṣvins, when the sons of Paira call you, send strength with nourishment to him who knoweth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सू॒नोर्माने॑नाश्विना गृणा॒ना वाजं॒ विप्रा॑य भुरणा॒ रद॑न्ता अ॒गस्त्ये॒ ब्रह्म॑णा वावृधा॒ना सं वि॒श्पलां॑ नासत्यारिणीतम्
verses.transliteration: sūnór mā́nenāśvinā gr̥ṇānā́  vā́jaṃ víprāya bhuraṇā rádantā  agástye bráhmaṇā vāvr̥dhānā́  sáṃ viśpálāṃ nāsatyāriṇītam

translation.text: Hymned with the reverence of a son, O Aṣvins ye Swift Ones giving booty to the singer, Glorified by Agastya with devotion, established Vispala again, Nâsatyas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कुह॒ यान्ता॑ सुष्टु॒तिं का॒व्यस्य॒ दिवो॑ नपाता वृषणा शयु॒त्रा हिर॑ण्यस्येव क॒लशं॒ निखा॑त॒मुदू॑पथुर्दश॒मे अ॑श्वि॒नाह॑न्
verses.transliteration: kúha yā́ntā suṣṭutíṃ kāvyásya  dívo napātā vr̥ṣaṇā śayutrā́  híraṇyasyeva kaláśaṃ níkhātam  úd ūpathur daśamé aśvinā́han

translation.text: Ye Sons of Heaven, ye Mighty, whither went ye, sought ye, for his fair praise the home of Kdvya. When, like a pitcher full of gold, O Aṣvins, on the tenth day ye lifted up the buried?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं च्यवा॑नमश्विना॒ जर॑न्तं॒ पुन॒र्युवा॑नं चक्रथुः॒ शची॑भिः यु॒वो रथं॑ दुहि॒ता सूर्य॑स्य स॒ह श्रि॒या ना॑सत्यावृणीत
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ cyávānam aśvinā járantam  púnar yúvānaṃ cakrathuḥ śácībhiḥ  yuvó ráthaṃ duhitā́ sū́ryasya  sahá śriyā́ nāsatyāvr̥ṇīta

translation.text: Ye with the aid of your great powers, O Aṣvins, restored to youth the ancient man Chyavâna. The Daughter of the Sun with all her glory, O ye Nâsatyas, chose your car to bear her.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं तुग्रा॑य पू॒र्व्येभि॒रेवैः॑ पुनर्म॒न्याव॑भवतं युवाना यु॒वं भु॒ज्युमर्ण॑सो॒ निः स॑मु॒द्राद्विभि॑रूहथुर्ऋ॒ज्रेभि॒रश्वैः॑
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ túgrāya pūrvyébhir évaiḥ  punarmanyā́v abhavataṃ yuvānā  yuvám bhujyúm árṇaso níḥ samudrā́d  víbhir ūhathur r̥jrébhir áśvaiḥ

translation.text: Ye, ever-youthful Ones, again remembered Tugra, according to your ancient manner: With horses brown of hue that flew with swift wings ye brought back Bhujyu from the sea of billows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अजो॑हवीदश्विना तौ॒ग्र्यो वां॒ प्रोळ्हः॑ समु॒द्रम॑व्य॒थिर्ज॑ग॒न्वान् निष्टमू॑हथुः सु॒युजा॒ रथे॑न॒ मनो॑जवसा वृषणा स्व॒स्ति
verses.transliteration: ájohavīd aśvinā taugryó vām  próḷhaḥ samudrám avyathír jaganvā́n  níṣ ṭám ūhathuḥ suyújā ráthena  mánojavasā vr̥ṣaṇā svastí

translation.text: The son of Tugra had invoked you, Aṣvins; borne on he went uninjured through the ocean. Ye with your chariot swift as thought, well-harnessed, carried him off, O Mighty Ones, to safety.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अजो॑हवीदश्विना॒ वर्ति॑का वामा॒स्नो यत्सी॒ममु॑ञ्चतं॒ वृक॑स्य वि ज॒युषा॑ ययथुः॒ सान्वद्रे॑र्जा॒तं वि॒ष्वाचो॑ अहतं वि॒षेण॑
verses.transliteration: ájohavīd aśvinā vártikā vām  āsnó yát sīm ámuñcataṃ vŕ̥kasya  ví jayúṣā yayathuḥ sā́nv ádrer  jātáṃ viṣvā́co ahataṃ viṣéṇa

translation.text: The quail had invocated you, O Aṣvins, when from the wolf's devouring jaws ye freed her. With conquering car ye cleft the mountain's ridges: the offspring of Viṣvâch ye killed with poison.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं मे॒षान्वृ॒क्ये॑ मामहा॒नं तमः॒ प्रणी॑त॒मशि॑वेन पि॒त्रा आक्षी ऋ॒ज्राश्वे॑ अश्विनावधत्तं॒ ज्योति॑र॒न्धाय॑ चक्रथुर्वि॒चक्षे॑
verses.transliteration: śatám meṣā́n vr̥kyè māmahānáṃ  támaḥ práṇītam áśivena pitrā́  ā́kṣī́ r̥jrā́śve aśvināv adhattaṃ  jyótir andhā́ya cakrathur vicákṣe

translation.text: He whom for furnishing a hundred wethers to the she-wolf, his wicked father blinded, To him, R̥ijrâṣva, gave ye eyes, O Aṣvins; light to the blind ye sent for perfect vision.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒नम॒न्धाय॒ भर॑मह्वय॒त्सा वृ॒कीर॑श्विना वृषणा॒ नरेति॑ जा॒रः क॒नीन॑ इव चक्षदा॒न ऋ॒ज्राश्वः॑ श॒तमेकं॑ च मे॒षान्
verses.transliteration: śunám andhā́ya bháram ahvayat sā́  vr̥kī́r aśvinā vr̥ṣaṇā náréti  jāráḥ kanī́na iva cakṣadānáḥ-  r̥jrā́śvaḥ śatám ékaṃ ca meṣā́n

translation.text: To bring the blind man joy thus cried the she-wolf: O Aṣvins, O ye Mighty Ones, O Heroes, For me R̥ijrâṣva, like a youthful lover, hath. cut piecemeal one and a hundred wethers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒ही वा॑मू॒तिर॑श्विना मयो॒भूरु॒त स्रा॒मं धि॑ष्ण्या॒ सं रि॑णीथः अथा॑ यु॒वामिद॑ह्वय॒त्पुरं॑धि॒राग॑च्छतं सीं वृषणा॒ववो॑भिः
verses.transliteration: mahī́ vām ūtír aśvinā mayobhū́r  utá srāmáṃ dhiṣṇyā sáṃ riṇīthaḥ  áthā yuvā́m íd ahvayat púraṃdhir  ā́gachataṃ sīṃ vr̥ṣaṇāv ávobhiḥ

translation.text: Great and weal-giving is your aid, O Aṣvins, ye, objects of all thought, made whole the cripple. Purandhi also for this cause invoked you, and ye, O mighty, came to her with succours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधे॑नुं दस्रा स्त॒र्यं१॒॑ विष॑क्ता॒मपि॑न्वतं श॒यवे॑ अश्विना॒ गाम् यु॒वं शची॑भिर्विम॒दाय॑ जा॒यां न्यू॑हथुः पुरुमि॒त्रस्य॒ योषा॑म्
verses.transliteration: ádhenuṃ dasrā staryàṃ víṣaktām  ápinvataṃ śayáve aśvinā gā́m  yuváṃ śácībhir vimadā́ya jāyā́ṃ  ny ū̀hathuḥ purumitrásya yóṣām

translation.text: Ye, Wonder-Workers, filled with milk for Ṣayu the milkless cow, emaciated, barren; And by your powers the child of Purumitra ye brought to Vimada to be his consort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यवं॒ वृके॑णाश्विना॒ वप॒न्तेषं॑ दु॒हन्ता॒ मनु॑षाय दस्रा अ॒भि दस्युं॒ बकु॑रेणा॒ धम॑न्तो॒रु ज्योति॑श्चक्रथु॒रार्या॑य
verses.transliteration: yávaṃ vŕ̥keṇāśvinā vápantā-  -íṣaṃ duhántā mánuṣāya dasrā  abhí dásyum bákureṇā dhámantā-  -urú jyótiś cakrathur ā́ryāya

translation.text: Ploughing and sowing barley, O ye Aṣvins, milking out food for men, ye Wonder-Workers, Blasting away the Dasyu with your trumpet, ye gave far-spreading light unto the Ârya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒थ॒र्व॒णाया॑श्विना दधी॒चेऽश्व्यं॒ शिरः॒ प्रत्यै॑रयतम् स वां॒ मधु॒ प्र वो॑चदृता॒यन्त्वा॒ष्ट्रं यद्द॑स्रावपिक॒क्ष्यं॑ वाम्
verses.transliteration: ātharvaṇā́yāśvinā dadhīcé  -áśvyaṃ śíraḥ práty airayatam  sá vām mádhu prá vocad r̥tāyán  tvāṣṭráṃ yád dasrāv apikakṣyàṃ vām

translation.text: Ye brought the horse's head, Aṣvins, and gave it unto Dadhyac the offspring of Atharvan. True, he revealed to you, O WonderWorkers, sweet Soma, Tvashṭar's secret, as your girdle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सदा॑ कवी सुम॒तिमा च॑के वां॒ विश्वा॒ धियो॑ अश्विना॒ प्राव॑तं मे अ॒स्मे र॒यिं ना॑सत्या बृ॒हन्त॑मपत्य॒साचं॒ श्रुत्यं॑ रराथाम्
verses.transliteration: sádā kavī sumatím ā́ cake vāṃ  víśvā dhíyo aśvinā prā́vatam me  asmé rayíṃ nāsatyā br̥hántam  apatyasā́caṃ śrútyaṃ rarāthām

translation.text: O Sages, evermore I crave your favour: be gracious unto all my prayers, O Aṣvins. Grant me, Nâsatyas, riches in abundance, wealth famous and accompanied with children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यहस्तमश्विना॒ ररा॑णा पु॒त्रं न॑रा वध्रिम॒त्या अ॑दत्तम् त्रिधा॑ ह॒ श्याव॑मश्विना॒ विक॑स्त॒मुज्जी॒वस॑ ऐरयतं सुदानू
verses.transliteration: híraṇyahastam aśvinā rárāṇā  putráṃ narā vadhrimatyā́ adattam  trídhā ha śyā́vam aśvinā víkastam  új jīvása airayataṃ sudānū

translation.text: With liberal bounty to the weakling's consorts ye, Heroes, gave a son Hiraṇyahasta; And Ṣyâva, cut into three several pieces, ye brougnt to life again, O bounteous Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तानि॑ वामश्विना वी॒र्या॑णि॒ प्र पू॒र्व्याण्या॒यवो॑ऽवोचन् ब्रह्म॑ कृ॒ण्वन्तो॑ वृषणा यु॒वभ्यां॑ सु॒वीरा॑सो वि॒दथ॒मा व॑देम
verses.transliteration: etā́ni vām aśvinā vīryā̀ṇi  prá pūrvyā́ṇy āyávo 'vocan  bráhma kr̥ṇvánto vr̥ṣaṇā yuvábhyāṃ  suvī́rāso vidátham ā́ vadema

translation.text: These your heroic exploits, O ye Aṣvins, done in the days. of old, have men related. May we, addressing prayer to you, ye Mighty, speak with brave sons about us to. the synod.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ रथो॑ अश्विना श्ये॒नप॑त्वा सुमृळी॒कः स्ववाँ॑ यात्व॒र्वाङ् यो मर्त्य॑स्य॒ मन॑सो॒ जवी॑यान्त्रिवन्धु॒रो वृ॑षणा॒ वात॑रंहाः
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ rátho aśvinā śyenápatvā  sumr̥ḷīkáḥ svávām̐ yātv arvā́ṅ  yó mártyasya mánaso jávīyān  trivandhuró vr̥ṣaṇā vā́taraṃhāḥ

translation.text: FLYING, with falcons, may your chariot, Aṣvins, most gracious, bringing friendly help, come hither,– Your chariot, swifter than the mind of mortal, fleet as the wind, three-seated O ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒व॒न्धु॒रेण॑ त्रि॒वृता॒ रथे॑न त्रिच॒क्रेण॑ सु॒वृता या॑तम॒र्वाक् पिन्व॑तं॒ गा जिन्व॑त॒मर्व॑तो नो व॒र्धय॑तमश्विना वी॒रम॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: trivandhuréṇa trivŕ̥tā ráthena  tricakréṇa suvŕ̥tā́ yātam arvā́k  pínvataṃ gā́ jínvatam árvato no  vardháyatam aśvinā vīrám asmé

translation.text: Come to us with your chariot triple seated, three-wheeled, of triple form, that rolleth lightly. Fill full our cows, give mettle to our horses, and make each hero son grow strong, O Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒वद्या॑मना सु॒वृता॒ रथे॑न॒ दस्रा॑वि॒मं शृ॑णुतं॒ श्लोक॒मद्रेः॑ किम॒ङ्ग वां॒ प्रत्यव॑र्तिं॒ गमि॑ष्ठा॒हुर्विप्रा॑सो अश्विना पुरा॒जाः
verses.transliteration: pravádyāmanā suvŕ̥tā ráthena  dásrāv imáṃ śr̥ṇutaṃ ślókam ádreḥ  kím aṅgá vām práty ávartiṃ gámiṣṭhā-  -āhúr víprāso aśvinā purājā́ḥ

translation.text: With your well-rolling car, descending swiftly, hear this the press-stone's song, ye Wonder- Workers. How then have ancient sages said, O Aṣvins, that ye most swiftly come to stay affliction?

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॑ श्ये॒नासो॑ अश्विना वहन्तु॒ रथे॑ यु॒क्तास॑ आ॒शवः॑ पतं॒गाः ये अ॒प्तुरो॑ दि॒व्यासो॒ न गृध्रा॑ अ॒भि प्रयो॑ नासत्या॒ वह॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ śyenā́so aśvinā vahantu  ráthe yuktā́sa āśávaḥ pataṃgā́ḥ  yé aptúro divyā́so ná gŕ̥dhrāḥ-  abhí práyo nāsatyā váhanti

translation.text: O Aṣvins, let your falcons bear you hither, yoked to your chariot, swift, with flying pinions, Which, ever active, like the airy eagles, carry you, O Nâsatyas, to the banquet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ रथं॑ युव॒तिस्ति॑ष्ठ॒दत्र॑ जु॒ष्ट्वी न॑रा दुहि॒ता सूर्य॑स्य परि॑ वा॒मश्वा॒ वपु॑षः पतं॒गा वयो॑ वहन्त्वरु॒षा अ॒भीके॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ ráthaṃ yuvatís tiṣṭhad átra  juṣṭvī́ narā duhitā́ sū́ryasya  pári vām áśvā vápuṣaḥ pataṃgā́ḥ-  váyo vahantv aruṣā́ abhī́ke

translation.text: The youthful Daughter of the Sun, delighting in you, ascended there your chariot, Heroes. Borne on their swift wings let your beauteous horses, your birds of ruddy hue, convey you near us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद्वन्द॑नमैरतं दं॒सना॑भि॒रुद्रे॒भं द॑स्रा वृषणा॒ शची॑भिः निष्टौ॒ग्र्यं पा॑रयथः समु॒द्रात्पुन॒श्च्यवा॑नं चक्रथु॒र्युवा॑नम्
verses.transliteration: úd vándanam airataṃ daṃsánābhir  úd rebháṃ dasrā vr̥ṣaṇā śácībhiḥ  níṣ ṭaugryám pārayathaḥ samudrā́t  púnaś cyávānaṃ cakrathur yúvānam

translation.text: Ye raised up Vandana, strong WonderWorkers! with great might, and with power ye rescued Rebha. From out the sea ye saved the son of Tugra, and gave his youth again unto Chyavâna.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वमत्र॒येऽव॑नीताय त॒प्तमूर्ज॑मो॒मान॑मश्विनावधत्तम् यु॒वं कण्वा॒यापि॑रिप्ताय॒ चक्षुः॒ प्रत्य॑धत्तं सुष्टु॒तिं जु॑जुषा॒णा
verses.transliteration: yuvám átrayé 'vanītāya taptám  ū́rjam omā́nam aśvināv adhattam  yuváṃ káṇvāyā́piriptāya cákṣuḥ  práty adhattaṃ suṣṭutíṃ jujuṣāṇā́
