translation.text: To Atri, cast down to the fire that scorched him, ye gave, O Aṣvins, strengthening food and favour. Accepting his fair praises with approval, ye gave his eyes again to blinded Kaṇva.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं धे॒नुं श॒यवे॑ नाधि॒तायापि॑न्वतमश्विना पू॒र्व्याय॑ अमु॑ञ्चतं॒ वर्ति॑का॒मंह॑सो॒ निः प्रति॒ जङ्घां॑ वि॒श्पला॑या अधत्तम्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ dhenúṃ śayáve nādhitā́ya-  -ápinvatam aśvinā pūrvyā́ya  ámuñcataṃ vártikām áṃhaso níḥ  práti jáṅghāṃ viśpálāyā adhattam

translation.text: For ancient Sayti in his sore affliction ye caused his cow to swell with milk, O Aṣvins. The quail from her great misery ye delivered, and a new leg for Vispala provided.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं श्वे॒तं पे॒दव॒ इन्द्र॑जूतमहि॒हन॑मश्विनादत्त॒मश्व॑म् जो॒हूत्र॑म॒र्यो अ॒भिभू॑तिमु॒ग्रं स॑हस्र॒सां वृष॑णं वी॒ड्व॑ङ्गम्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ śvetám pedáva índrajūtam  ahihánam aśvinādattam áśvam  johū́tram aryó abhíbhūtim ugráṃ  sahasrasā́ṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vīḍvàṅgam

translation.text: A white horse, Aṣvins, ye bestowed on Pedu, a serpent-slaying steed sent down by Indra, Loud-neighing, conquering the foe, highmettled, firm-limbed and vigorous, winning thousand treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वां॑ नरा॒ स्वव॑से सुजा॒ता हवा॑महे अश्विना॒ नाध॑मानाः आ न॒ उप॒ वसु॑मता॒ रथे॑न॒ गिरो॑ जुषा॒णा सु॑वि॒ताय॑ यातम्
verses.transliteration: tā́ vāṃ narā sv ávase sujātā́  hávāmahe aśvinā nā́dhamānāḥ  ā́ na úpa vásumatā ráthena  gíro juṣāṇā́ suvitā́ya yātam

translation.text: Such as ye are, O nobly horn, O Heroes, we in our trouble call on you for succour. Accepting these our songs, for our wellbeing come to us on your chariot treasure-laden.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ श्ये॒नस्य॒ जव॑सा॒ नूत॑नेना॒स्मे या॑तं नासत्या स॒जोषाः॑ हवे॒ हि वा॑मश्विना रा॒तह॑व्यः शश्वत्त॒माया॑ उ॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ
verses.transliteration: ā́ śyenásya jávasā nū́tanena-  -asmé yātaṃ nāsatyā sajóṣāḥ  háve hí vām aśvinā rātáhavyaḥ  śaśvattamā́yā uṣáso vyùṣṭau

translation.text: Come unto us combined in love, Nâsatyas come with the fresh swift vigour of the falcon. Bearing oblations I invoke you, Aṣvins, at the first break of everlasting morning.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ रथं॑ पुरुमा॒यं म॑नो॒जुवं॑ जी॒राश्वं॑ य॒ज्ञियं॑ जी॒वसे॑ हुवे स॒हस्र॑केतुं व॒निनं॑ श॒तद्व॑सुं श्रुष्टी॒वानं॑ वरिवो॒धाम॒भि प्रयः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ rátham purumāyám manojúvaṃ  jīrā́śvaṃ yajñíyaṃ jīváse huve  sahásraketuṃ vanínaṃ śatádvasuṃ  śruṣṭīvā́naṃ varivodhā́m abhí práyaḥ

translation.text: HITHER, that I may live, I call unto the feast your wondrous car, thought-swift, borne on by rapid steeds. With thousand banners, hundred treasures, pouring gifts, promptly obedient, bestowing ample room.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वा धी॒तिः प्रत्य॑स्य॒ प्रया॑म॒न्यधा॑यि॒ शस्म॒न्त्सम॑यन्त॒ आ दिशः॑ स्वदा॑मि घ॒र्मं प्रति॑ यन्त्यू॒तय॒ आ वा॑मू॒र्जानी॒ रथ॑मश्विनारुहत्
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvā́ dhītíḥ práty asya práyāmani-  ádhāyi śásman sám ayanta ā́ díśaḥ  svádāmi gharmám práti yanty ūtáyaḥ-  ā́ vām ūrjā́nī rátham aśvinā ruhat

translation.text: Even as it moveth near my hymn is lifted up, and all the regions come together to sing praise. I sweeten the oblations; now the helpers come. Urjânî hath, O Aṣvins, mounted on your car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं यन्मि॒थः प॑स्पृधा॒नासो॒ अग्म॑त शु॒भे म॒खा अमि॑ता जा॒यवो॒ रणे॑ यु॒वोरह॑ प्रव॒णे चे॑किते॒ रथो॒ यद॑श्विना॒ वह॑थः सू॒रिमा वर॑म्
verses.transliteration: sáṃ yán mitháḥ paspr̥dhānā́so ágmata  śubhé makhā́ ámitā jāyávo ráṇe  yuvór áha pravaṇé cekite rátho  yád aśvinā váhathaḥ sūrím ā́ váram

translation.text: When striving man with man for glory they have met, brisk, measurcIess, eager for victory in fight, Then verily your car is seen upon the slope when ye, O Aṣvins, bring some choice boon to the prince.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं भु॒ज्युं भु॒रमा॑णं॒ विभि॑र्ग॒तं स्वयु॑क्तिभिर्नि॒वह॑न्ता पि॒तृभ्य॒ आ या॒सि॒ष्टं व॒र्तिर्वृ॑षणा विजे॒न्यं१॒॑ दिवो॑दासाय॒ महि॑ चेति वा॒मवः॑
verses.transliteration: yuvám bhujyúm bhurámāṇaṃ víbhir gatáṃ  sváyuktibhir niváhantā pitŕ̥bhya ā́  yāsiṣṭáṃ vartír vr̥ṣaṇā vijenyàṃ  dívodāsāya máhi ceti vām ávaḥ

translation.text: Ye came to Bhujyu while he struggled in the flood, with flying birds, self-yoked, ye bore him to his sires. Ye went to the far-distant home, O Mighty Ones; and famed is your great aid to Divodisa given.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वोर॑श्विना॒ वपु॑षे युवा॒युजं॒ रथं॒ वाणी॑ येमतुरस्य॒ शर्ध्य॑म् आ वां॑ पति॒त्वं स॒ख्याय॑ ज॒ग्मुषी॒ योषा॑वृणीत॒ जेन्या॑ यु॒वां पती॑
verses.transliteration: yuvór aśvinā vápuṣe yuvāyújaṃ  ráthaṃ vā́ṇī yematur asya śárdhyam  ā́ vām patitváṃ sakhyā́ya jagmúṣī  yóṣāvr̥ṇīta jényā yuvā́m pátī

translation.text: Aṣvins, the car which you had yoked for glorious show your own two voices urged directed to its goal. Then she who came for friendship, Maid of noble birth, elected you as Husbands, you to be her Lords.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं रे॒भं परि॑षूतेरुरुष्यथो हि॒मेन॑ घ॒र्मं परि॑तप्त॒मत्र॑ये यु॒वं श॒योर॑व॒सं पि॑प्यथु॒र्गवि॒ प्र दी॒र्घेण॒ वन्द॑नस्ता॒र्यायु॑षा
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ rebhám páriṣūter uruṣyatho  hiména gharmám páritaptam átraye  yuváṃ śayór avasám pipyathur gávi  prá dīrghéṇa vándanas tāry ā́yuṣā

translation.text: Rebha ye saved from tyranny; for Atri's sake ye quenched with cold the fiery pit that compassed him. Ye made the cow of Ṣayu stream refreshing milk, and Vandana was holpen to extended life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं वन्द॑नं॒ निर्ऋ॑तं जर॒ण्यया॒ रथं॒ न द॑स्रा कर॒णा समि॑न्वथः क्षेत्रा॒दा विप्रं॑ जनथो विप॒न्यया॒ प्र वा॒मत्र॑ विध॒ते दं॒सना॑ भुवत्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ vándanaṃ nírr̥taṃ jaraṇyáyā  ráthaṃ ná dasrā karaṇā́ sám invathaḥ  kṣétrād ā́ vípraṃ janatho vipanyáyā  prá vām átra vidhaté daṃsánā bhuvat

translation.text: Doers of marvels, skilful workers, ye restored Vandana, like a car, worn out with length of days. From earth ye brought the sage to life in wondrous mode; be your great deeds done here for him who honours you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग॑च्छतं॒ कृप॑माणं परा॒वति॑ पि॒तुः स्वस्य॒ त्यज॑सा॒ निबा॑धितम् स्व॑र्वतीरि॒त ऊ॒तीर्यु॒वोरह॑ चि॒त्रा अ॒भीके॑ अभवन्न॒भिष्ट॑यः
verses.transliteration: ágachataṃ kŕ̥pamāṇam parāváti  pitúḥ svásya tyájasā níbādhitam  svàrvatīr itá ūtī́r yuvór áha  citrā́ abhī́ke abhavann abhíṣṭayaḥ

translation.text: Ye went to him who mourned in a far distant place, him who was left forlorn by treachery of his sire. Rich with the light ofheaven was then the help ye gave, and marvellous your succour when ye stood by him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्या वां॒ मधु॑म॒न्मक्षि॑कारप॒न्मदे॒ सोम॑स्यौशि॒जो हु॑वन्यति यु॒वं द॑धी॒चो मन॒ आ वि॑वास॒थोऽथा॒ शिरः॒ प्रति॑ वा॒मश्व्यं॑ वदत्
verses.transliteration: utá syā́ vām mádhuman mákṣikārapat-  máde sómasyauśijó huvanyati  yuváṃ dadhīcó mána ā́ vivāsathaḥ-  -áthā śíraḥ práti vām áśvyaṃ vadat

translation.text: To you in praise of sweetness sang the honey-bee: Auṣija calleth you in Soma's rapturous joy. Ye drew unto yourselves the spirit of Dadhyac, and then the horse's head uttered his words to you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं पे॒दवे॑ पुरु॒वार॑मश्विना स्पृ॒धां श्वे॒तं त॑रु॒तारं॑ दुवस्यथः शर्यै॑र॒भिद्युं॒ पृत॑नासु दु॒ष्टरं॑ च॒र्कृत्य॒मिन्द्र॑मिव चर्षणी॒सह॑म्
verses.transliteration: yuvám pedáve puruvā́ram aśvinā  spr̥dhā́ṃ śvetáṃ tarutā́raṃ duvasyathaḥ  śáryair abhídyum pŕ̥tanāsu duṣṭáraṃ  carkŕ̥tyam índram iva carṣaṇīsáham

translation.text: A horse did ye provide for Pedu, excellent, white, O ye Aṣvins, conqueror of combatants, Invincible in war by arrows, seeking heaven worthy of fame, like Indra, vanquisher of men.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: का रा॑ध॒द्धोत्रा॑श्विना वां॒ को वां॒ जोष॑ उ॒भयोः॑ क॒था वि॑धा॒त्यप्र॑चेताः
verses.transliteration: kā́ rādhad dhótrāśvinā vāṃ  kó vāṃ jóṣa ubháyoḥ  kathā́ vidhāty ápracetāḥ

translation.text: ASVINS, what praise may win your grace? Who may be pleasing to you both? How shall the ignorant worship you?

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्वांसा॒विद्दुरः॑ पृच्छे॒दवि॑द्वानि॒त्थाप॑रो अचे॒ताः नू चि॒न्नु मर्ते॒ अक्रौ॑
verses.transliteration: vidvā́ṃsāv íd dúraḥ pr̥ched ávidvān  itthā́paro acetā́ḥ  nū́ cin nú márte ákrau

translation.text: Here let the ignorant ask the means of you who know-for none beside you knoweth aught – Not of a spiritless mortal man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वि॒द्वांसा॑ हवामहे वां॒ ता नो॑ वि॒द्वांसा॒ मन्म॑ वोचेतम॒द्य प्रार्च॒द्दय॑मानो यु॒वाकुः॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ vidvā́ṃsā havāmahe vāṃ  tā́ no vidvā́ṃsā mánma vocetam adyá  prā́rcad dáyamāno yuvā́kuḥ

translation.text: Such as ye: are, all-wise, we call you. Ye wise, declare to us this day accepted prayer. Loving you well your servant lauds you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि पृ॑च्छामि पा॒क्या॒३॒॑ न दे॒वान्वष॑ट्कृतस्याद्भु॒तस्य॑ दस्रा पा॒तं च॒ सह्य॑सो यु॒वं च॒ रभ्य॑सो नः
verses.transliteration: ví pr̥chāmi pākyā̀ ná devā́n  váṣaṭkr̥tasyādbhutásya dasrā  pātáṃ ca sáhyaso yuváṃ ca rábhyaso naḥ

translation.text: Simply, ye Mighty Ones, I ask the Gods of that wondrous oblation hallowed by the mystic word. Save us from what is stronger, fiercer than ourselves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र या घोषे॒ भृग॑वाणे॒ न शोभे॒ यया॑ वा॒चा यज॑ति पज्रि॒यो वा॑म् प्रैष॒युर्न वि॒द्वान्
verses.transliteration: prá yā́ ghóṣe bhŕ̥gavāṇe ná śóbhe  yáyā vācā́ yájati pajriyó vām  praíṣayúr ná vidvā́n

translation.text: Forth go the hymn that shone in Ghosha Bhr̥igu's like, the song wherewith the son of Pajra worships you, Like some wise minister.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒तं गा॑य॒त्रं तक॑वानस्या॒हं चि॒द्धि रि॒रेभा॑श्विना वाम् आक्षी शु॑भस्पती॒ दन्
verses.transliteration: śrutáṃ gāyatráṃ tákavānasya-  -aháṃ cid dhí rirébhāśvinā vām  ā́kṣī́ śubhas patī dán

translation.text: Hear ye the song of him who hastens speedily. O Aṣvins, I am he who sang your praise. Hither, ye Lords of Splendour, hither turn your eyes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं ह्यास्तं॑ म॒हो रन्यु॒वं वा॒ यन्नि॒रत॑तंसतम् ता नो॑ वसू सुगो॒पा स्या॑तं पा॒तं नो॒ वृका॑दघा॒योः
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ hy ā́stam mahó rán  yuváṃ vā yán nirátataṃsatam  tā́ no vasū sugopā́ syātam  pātáṃ no vŕ̥kād aghāyóḥ

translation.text: For ye were ever nigh to deal forth ample wealth, to give the wealth that ye had gathered up. As such, ye Vasus, guard us well, and keep us safely from the wicked wolf.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा कस्मै॑ धातम॒भ्य॑मि॒त्रिणे॑ नो॒ माकुत्रा॑ नो गृ॒हेभ्यो॑ धे॒नवो॑ गुः स्त॒ना॒भुजो॒ अशि॑श्वीः
verses.transliteration: mā́ kásmai dhātam abhy àmitríṇe no  mā́kútrā no gr̥hébhyo dhenávo guḥ  stanābhújo áśiśvīḥ

translation.text: Give us not up to any man who hateth us, nor let our milch-cows stray, whose udders give us food, Far from our homes without their calves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दु॒ही॒यन्मि॒त्रधि॑तये यु॒वाकु॑ रा॒ये च॑ नो मिमी॒तं वाज॑वत्यै इ॒षे च॑ नो मिमीतं धेनु॒मत्यै॑
verses.transliteration: duhīyán mitrádhitaye yuvā́ku  rāyé ca no mimītáṃ vā́javatyai  iṣé ca no mimītaṃ dhenumátyai

translation.text: May they who love you gain you for their Friends. Prepare ye us for opulence with strengthening food, Prepare us for the food that floweth from our cows

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒श्विनो॑रसनं॒ रथ॑मन॒श्वं वा॒जिनी॑वतोः तेना॒हं भूरि॑ चाकन
verses.transliteration: aśvínor asanaṃ rátham  anaśváṃ vājínīvatoḥ  ténāhám bhū́ri cākana

translation.text: I have obtained the horseless car of Aṣvins rich in sacrifice, And I am well content therewith.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं स॑मह मा तनू॒ह्याते॒ जनाँ॒ अनु॑ सो॒म॒पेयं॑ सु॒खो रथः॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ samaha mā tanu-  -ūhyā́te jánām̐ ánu  somapéyaṃ sukhó ráthaḥ

translation.text: May it convey me evermore: may the light chariot pass from men To men unto the Soma draught.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ स्वप्न॑स्य॒ निर्वि॒देऽभु॑ञ्जतश्च रे॒वतः॑ उ॒भा ता बस्रि॑ नश्यतः
verses.transliteration: ádha svápnasya nír vide-  -ábhuñjataś ca revátaḥ  ubhā́ tā́ básri naśyataḥ

translation.text: It holdeth slumber in contempt. and the rich who enjoyeth not: Both vanish quickly and are lost.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: कदि॒त्था नॄँः पात्रं॑ देवय॒तां श्रव॒द्गिरो॒ अङ्गि॑रसां तुर॒ण्यन् प्र यदान॒ड्विश॒ आ ह॒र्म्यस्यो॒रु क्रं॑सते अध्व॒रे यज॑त्रः
verses.transliteration: kád itthā́ nr̥̄́m̐ḥ pā́traṃ devayatā́ṃ  śrávad gíro áṅgirasāṃ turaṇyán  prá yád ā́naḍ víśa ā́ harmyásya-  -urú kraṃsate adhvaré yájatraḥ

translation.text: WHEN Will men's guardians hasting hear with favour the song of Angiras's pious childern? When to the people of the home he cometh he strideth to the sacrifice, the Holy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तम्भी॑द्ध॒ द्यां स ध॒रुणं॑ प्रुषायदृ॒भुर्वाजा॑य॒ द्रवि॑णं॒ नरो॒ गोः अनु॑ स्व॒जां म॑हि॒षश्च॑क्षत॒ व्रां मेना॒मश्व॑स्य॒ परि॑ मा॒तरं॒ गोः
verses.transliteration: stámbhīd dha dyā́ṃ sá dharúṇam pruṣāyad  r̥bhúr vā́jāya dráviṇaṃ náro góḥ  ánu svajā́m mahiṣáś cakṣata vrā́m  ménām áśvasya pári mātáraṃ góḥ

translation.text: He stablished heaven; he poured forth, skilful worker, the wealth of kine, for strength, that nurtures heroes. The Mighty One his self-born host regarded, the horse's mate, the mother of the heifer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नक्ष॒द्धव॑मरु॒णीः पू॒र्व्यं राट् तु॒रो वि॒शामङ्गि॑रसा॒मनु॒ द्यून् तक्ष॒द्वज्रं॒ नियु॑तं त॒स्तम्भ॒द्द्यां चतु॑ष्पदे॒ नर्या॑य द्वि॒पादे॑
verses.transliteration: nákṣad dhávam aruṇī́ḥ pūrvyáṃ rā́ṭ  turó viśā́m áṅgirasām ánu dyū́n  tákṣad vájraṃ níyutaṃ tastámbhad dyā́ṃ  cátuṣpade náryāya dvipā́de

translation.text: Lord of red dawns, he came victorious, daily to the Angirases' former invocation. His bolt and team hath he prepared, and stablished the heaven for quadrupeds and men two-footed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य मदे॑ स्व॒र्यं॑ दा ऋ॒तायापी॑वृतमु॒स्रिया॑णा॒मनी॑कम् यद्ध॑ प्र॒सर्गे॑ त्रिक॒कुम्नि॒वर्त॒दप॒ द्रुहो॒ मानु॑षस्य॒ दुरो॑ वः
verses.transliteration: asyá máde svaryàṃ dā r̥tā́ya-  -ápīvr̥tam usríyāṇām ánīkam  yád dha prasárge trikakúṃ nivártad  ápa drúho mā́nuṣasya dúro vaḥ

translation.text: In joy of this thou didst restore, for worship, the lowing company of hidden cattle. When the three-pointed one descends with onslaught he opens wide the doors that cause man trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्यं॒ पयो॒ यत्पि॒तरा॒वनी॑तां॒ राधः॑ सु॒रेत॑स्तु॒रणे॑ भुर॒ण्यू शुचि॒ यत्ते॒ रेक्ण॒ आय॑जन्त सब॒र्दुघा॑याः॒ पय॑ उ॒स्रिया॑याः
verses.transliteration: túbhyam páyo yát pitárāv ánītāṃ  rā́dhaḥ surétas turáṇe bhuraṇyū́  śúci yát te rékṇa ā́yajanta  sabardúghāyāḥ páya usríyāyāḥ

translation.text: Thine is that milk which thy swift-moving Parents brought down, a strengthening genial gift for conquest; When the pure treasure unto thee they offered, the milk shed from the cow who streameth nectar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ प्र ज॑ज्ञे त॒रणि॑र्ममत्तु॒ प्र रो॑च्य॒स्या उ॒षसो॒ न सूरः॑ इन्दु॒र्येभि॒राष्ट॒ स्वेदु॑हव्यैः स्रु॒वेण॑ सि॒ञ्चञ्ज॒रणा॒भि धाम॑
verses.transliteration: ádha prá jajñe taráṇir mamattu  prá rocy asyā́ uṣáso ná sū́raḥ  índur yébhir ā́ṣṭa svéduhavyaiḥ  sruvéṇa siñcáñ jaráṇābhí dhā́ma

translation.text: There is he born. May the Swift give us rapture, and like the Sun shine forth from yonder dawning, Indu, even us who drank, whose toils are offerings, poured from the spoon, with praise, upon the altar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वि॒ध्मा यद्व॒नधि॑तिरप॒स्यात्सूरो॑ अध्व॒रे परि॒ रोध॑ना॒ गोः यद्ध॑ प्र॒भासि॒ कृत्व्याँ॒ अनु॒ द्यूनन॑र्विशे प॒श्विषे॑ तु॒राय॑
verses.transliteration: svidhmā́ yád vanádhitir apasyā́t  sū́ro adhvaré pári ródhanā góḥ  yád dha prabhā́si kŕ̥tvyām̐ ánu dyū́n  ánarviśe paśvíṣe turā́ya

translation.text: When the wood-pile, made of good logs, is ready, at the Sun's worship to bind fast the Bullock, Then when thou shinest forth through days of action for the Car-borne, the Swift, tile Cattle-seeker.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ष्टा म॒हो दि॒व आदो॒ हरी॑ इ॒ह द्यु॑म्ना॒साह॑म॒भि यो॑धा॒न उत्स॑म् हरिं॒ यत्ते॑ म॒न्दिनं॑ दु॒क्षन्वृ॒धे गोर॑भस॒मद्रि॑भिर्वा॒ताप्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: aṣṭā́ mahó divá ā́do hárī ihá  dyumnāsā́ham abhí yodhāná útsam  háriṃ yát te mandínaṃ dukṣán vr̥dhé  górabhasam ádribhir vātā́pyam

translation.text: Eight steeds thou broughtest down from mighty heaven, when fighting for the well that giveth splendour, That men might press with stones the gladdening yellow, strengthened with milk, fermenting, to exalt thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमा॑य॒सं प्रति॑ वर्तयो॒ गोर्दि॒वो अश्मा॑न॒मुप॑नीत॒मृभ्वा॑ कुत्सा॑य॒ यत्र॑ पुरुहूत व॒न्वञ्छुष्ण॑मन॒न्तैः प॑रि॒यासि॑ व॒धैः
verses.transliteration: tvám āyasám práti vartayo gór  divó áśmānam úpanītam ŕ̥bhvā  kútsāya yátra puruhūta vanváñ  -śúṣṇam anantaíḥ pariyā́si vadhaíḥ

translation.text: Thou hurledst forth from heaven the iron missile, brought by the Skilful, from the sling of leather, When thou, O Much-invoked, assisting Kutsa with endless deadly darts didst compass Ṣushṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रा यत्सूर॒स्तम॑सो॒ अपी॑ते॒स्तम॑द्रिवः फलि॒गं हे॒तिम॑स्य शुष्ण॑स्य चि॒त्परि॑हितं॒ यदोजो॑ दि॒वस्परि॒ सुग्र॑थितं॒ तदादः॑
verses.transliteration: purā́ yát sū́ras támaso ápītes  tám adrivaḥ phaligáṃ hetím asya  śúṣṇasya cit párihitaṃ yád ójo  divás pári súgrathitaṃ tád ā́ daḥ

translation.text: Bolt-armed, ere darkness overtook the sunlight, thou castest at the veiling cloud thy weapon, Thou rentest, out of heaven, though firmly knotted, the might of Ṣushṇa that was thrown around him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑ त्वा म॒ही पाज॑सी अच॒क्रे द्यावा॒क्षामा॑ मदतामिन्द्र॒ कर्म॑न् त्वं वृ॒त्रमा॒शया॑नं सि॒रासु॑ म॒हो वज्रे॑ण सिष्वपो व॒राहु॑म्
verses.transliteration: ánu tvā mahī́ pā́jasī acakré  dyā́vākṣā́mā madatām indra kárman  tváṃ vr̥trám āśáyānaṃ sirā́su  mahó vájreṇa siṣvapo varā́hum

translation.text: The mighty Heaven and Earth, those bright expanses that have no wheels, joyed, Indra, at thine exploit. Vr̥itra, the boar who lay amid the waters, to sleep thou sentest with thy mighty thunder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमि॑न्द्र॒ नर्यो॒ याँ अवो॒ नॄन्तिष्ठा॒ वात॑स्य सु॒युजो॒ वहि॑ष्ठान् यं ते॑ का॒व्य उ॒शना॑ म॒न्दिनं॒ दाद्वृ॑त्र॒हणं॒ पार्यं॑ ततक्ष॒ वज्र॑म्
verses.transliteration: tvám indra náryo yā́m̐ ávo nr̥̄́n  tíṣṭhā vā́tasya suyújo váhiṣṭhān  yáṃ te kāvyá uśánā mandínaṃ dā́d  vr̥traháṇam pā́ryaṃ tatakṣa vájram

translation.text: Mount Indra, lover of the men thou guardest, the well-yoked horses of the wind, best bearers. The bolt which Kâvya Uṣanâ erst gave thee, strong, gladdening, Vr̥itra-slaying, hath he fashioned.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं सूरो॑ ह॒रितो॑ रामयो॒ नॄन्भर॑च्च॒क्रमेत॑शो॒ नायमि॑न्द्र प्रास्य॑ पा॒रं न॑व॒तिं ना॒व्या॑ना॒मपि॑ क॒र्तम॑वर्त॒योऽय॑ज्यून्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ sū́ro haríto rāmayo nr̥̄́n  bhárac cakrám étaśo nā́yám indra  prā́sya pāráṃ navatíṃ nāvyā̀nām  ápi kartám avartayó 'yajyūn

translation.text: The strong Bay Horses of the Sun thou stayedst: this Etaṣa drew not the wheel, O Indra. Casting them forth beyond the ninety rivers thou dravest down into the pit the godless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ अ॒स्या इ॑न्द्र दु॒र्हणा॑याः पा॒हि व॑ज्रिवो दुरि॒ताद॒भीके॑ प्र नो॒ वाजा॑न्र॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ अश्व॑बुध्यानि॒षे य॑न्धि॒ श्रव॑से सू॒नृता॑यै
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no asyā́ indra durháṇāyāḥ  pāhí vajrivo duritā́d abhī́ke  prá no vā́jān rathyò áśvabudhyān  iṣé yandhi śrávase sūnŕ̥tāyai

translation.text: Indra, preserve thou us from this affliction Thunder-armed, save us from the misery near us. Vouchsafe us affluence in chariots, founded on horses, for our food and fame and gladness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा सा ते॑ अ॒स्मत्सु॑म॒तिर्वि द॑स॒द्वाज॑प्रमहः॒ समिषो॑ वरन्त आ नो॑ भज मघव॒न्गोष्व॒र्यो मंहि॑ष्ठास्ते सध॒मादः॑ स्याम
verses.transliteration: mā́ sā́ te asmát sumatír ví dasad  vā́japramahaḥ sám íṣo varanta  ā́ no bhaja maghavan góṣv aryó  máṃhiṣṭhās te sadhamā́daḥ syāma

translation.text: Never may this thy loving-kindness fail us; mighty in strength, may plenteous food surround us. Maghavan, make us share the foeman's cattle: may we be thy most liberal feast companions.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वः॒ पान्तं॑ रघुमन्य॒वोऽन्धो॑ य॒ज्ञं रु॒द्राय॑ मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ भरध्वम् दि॒वो अ॑स्तो॒ष्यसु॑रस्य वी॒रैरि॑षु॒ध्येव॑ म॒रुतो॒ रोद॑स्योः
verses.transliteration: prá vaḥ pā́ntaṃ raghumanyavó 'ndho  yajñáṃ rudrā́ya mīḷhúṣe bharadhvam  divó astoṣy ásurasya vīraír  iṣudhyéva marúto ródasyoḥ

translation.text: SAY, bringing sacrifice to bounteous Rudra, This juice for drink to you whose wrath is fleeting! With Dyaus the Asura's Heroes I have lauded the Maruts as with prayer to Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पत्नी॑व पू॒र्वहू॑तिं वावृ॒धध्या॑ उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ पुरु॒धा विदा॑ने स्त॒रीर्नात्कं॒ व्यु॑तं॒ वसा॑ना॒ सूर्य॑स्य श्रि॒या सु॒दृशी॒ हिर॑ण्यैः
verses.transliteration: pátnīva pūrváhūtiṃ vāvr̥dhádhyaí-  uṣā́sānáktā purudhā́ vídāne  starī́r nā́tkaṃ vyùtaṃ vásānā  sū́ryasya śriyā́ sudŕ̥śī híraṇyaiḥ

translation.text: Strong to exalt the early invocation are Night and Dawn who show with varied aspect. The Barren clothes her in wide-woven raiment, and fair Morn shines with Sûrya's golden splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒मत्तु॑ नः॒ परि॑ज्मा वस॒र्हा म॒मत्तु॒ वातो॑ अ॒पां वृष॑ण्वान् शि॒शी॒तमि॑न्द्रापर्वता यु॒वं न॒स्तन्नो॒ विश्वे॑ वरिवस्यन्तु दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: mamáttu naḥ párijmā vasarhā́  mamáttu vā́to apā́ṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇvān  śiśītám indrāparvatā yuváṃ nas  tán no víśve varivasyantu devā́ḥ

translation.text: Cheer us the Roamer round, who strikes at morning, the Wind delight us, pourer forth of waters! Sharpen our wits, O Parvata and Indra. May all the Gods vouchsafe to us this favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्या मे॑ य॒शसा॑ श्वेत॒नायै॒ व्यन्ता॒ पान्तौ॑शि॒जो हु॒वध्यै॑ प्र वो॒ नपा॑तम॒पां कृ॑णुध्वं॒ प्र मा॒तरा॑ रास्पि॒नस्या॒योः
verses.transliteration: utá tyā́ me yaśásā śvetanā́yai  vyántā pā́ntauśijó huvádhyai  prá vo nápātam apā́ṃ kr̥ṇudhvam  prá mātárā rāspinásyāyóḥ

translation.text: And Auṣija shall call for me that famous Pair who enjoy and drink, who come to brighten. Set ye the Offspring of the Floods before you; both Mothers of the Living One who beameth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वो॑ रुव॒ण्युमौ॑शि॒जो हु॒वध्यै॒ घोषे॑व॒ शंस॒मर्जु॑नस्य॒ नंशे॑ प्र वः॑ पू॒ष्णे दा॒वन॒ आँ अच्छा॑ वोचेय व॒सुता॑तिम॒ग्नेः
verses.transliteration: ā́ vo ruvaṇyúm auśijó huvádhyai  ghóṣeva śáṃsam árjunasya náṃśe  prá vaḥ pūṣṇé dāvána ā́m̐  áchā voceya vasútātim agnéḥ

translation.text: For you shall Auṣija call him who thunders, as, to win Arjuna's assent, cried Ghosha. I will invoke, that Pûshan may be bounteous to you, the rich munificence of Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒तं मे॑ मित्रावरुणा॒ हवे॒मोत श्रु॑तं॒ सद॑ने वि॒श्वतः॑ सीम् श्रोतु॑ नः॒ श्रोतु॑रातिः सु॒श्रोतुः॑ सु॒क्षेत्रा॒ सिन्धु॑र॒द्भिः
verses.transliteration: śrutám me mitrāvaruṇā hávemā́-  -utá śrutaṃ sádane viśvátaḥ sīm  śrótu naḥ śróturātiḥ suśrótuḥ  sukṣétrā síndhur adbhíḥ

translation.text: Hear, Mitra-Varuṇa, these mine invocations, hear them from all men in the hall of worship. Giver of famous gifts, kind hearer, Sindhu who gives fair fields, listen with all his waters!

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तु॒षे सा वां॑ वरुण मित्र रा॒तिर्गवां॑ श॒ता पृ॒क्षया॑मेषु प॒ज्रे श्रु॒तर॑थे प्रि॒यर॑थे॒ दधा॑नाः स॒द्यः पु॒ष्टिं नि॑रुन्धा॒नासो॑ अग्मन्
verses.transliteration: stuṣé sā́ vāṃ varuṇa mitra rātír  gávāṃ śatā́ pr̥kṣáyāmeṣu pajré  śrutárathe priyárathe dádhānāḥ  sadyáḥ puṣṭíṃ nirundhānā́so agman

translation.text: Praised, Mitra, Varuṇa! is your gift, a hundred cows to the Pr̥ikshayâmas and the Pajra. Presented by car-famous Priyaratha, supplying nourishment, they came directly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य स्तु॑षे॒ महि॑मघस्य॒ राधः॒ सचा॑ सनेम॒ नहु॑षः सु॒वीराः॑ जनो॒ यः प॒ज्रेभ्यो॑ वा॒जिनी॑वा॒नश्वा॑वतो र॒थिनो॒ मह्यं॑ सू॒रिः
verses.transliteration: asyá stuṣe máhimaghasya rā́dhaḥ  sácā sanema náhuṣaḥ suvī́rāḥ  jáno yáḥ pajrébhyo vājínīvān  áśvāvato rathíno máhyaṃ sūríḥ

translation.text: Praised is the gift of him the very wealthy: may we enjoy it, men with hero children: His who hath many gifts to give the Pajras, a chief who makes me rich in cars and horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जनो॒ यो मि॑त्रावरुणावभि॒ध्रुग॒पो न वां॑ सु॒नोत्य॑क्ष्णया॒ध्रुक् स्व॒यं स यक्ष्मं॒ हृद॑ये॒ नि ध॑त्त॒ आप॒ यदीं॒ होत्रा॑भिर्ऋ॒तावा॑
verses.transliteration: jáno yó mitrāvaruṇāv abhidhrúg  apó ná vāṃ sunóty akṣṇayādhrúk  svayáṃ sá yákṣmaṃ hŕ̥daye ní dhatte-  ā́pa yád īṃ hótrābhir r̥tā́vā

translation.text: The folk, O Mitra-Varuṇa, who hate you, who sinfully hating pour you no libations, Lay in their hearts, themselves, a wasting sickness, whereas the righteous gaineth all by worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स व्राध॑तो॒ नहु॑षो॒ दंसु॑जूतः॒ शर्ध॑स्तरो न॒रां गू॒र्तश्र॑वाः विसृ॑ष्टरातिर्याति बाळ्ह॒सृत्वा॒ विश्वा॑सु पृ॒त्सु सद॒मिच्छूरः॑
verses.transliteration: sá vrā́dhato náhuṣo dáṃsujūtaḥ  śárdhastaro narā́ṃ gūrtáśravāḥ  vísr̥ṣṭarātir yāti bāḷhasŕ̥tvā  víśvāsu pr̥tsú sádam íc chū́raḥ

translation.text: That man, most puissant, wondrously urged onward, famed among heroes, liberal in giving, Moveth a warrior, evermore undaunted in all encounters even with the mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ ग्मन्ता॒ नहु॑षो॒ हवं॑ सू॒रेः श्रोता॑ राजानो अ॒मृत॑स्य मन्द्राः न॒भो॒जुवो॒ यन्नि॑र॒वस्य॒ राधः॒ प्रश॑स्तये महि॒ना रथ॑वते
verses.transliteration: ádha gmántā náhuṣo hávaṃ sūréḥ  śrótā rājāno amŕ̥tasya mandrāḥ  nabhojúvo yán niravásya rā́dhaḥ  práśastaye mahinā́ ráthavate

translation.text: Come to the man's, the sacrificer's calling: hear, Kings of Immortality, joy-givers! While ye who speed through clouds decree your bounty largely, for fame, to him the chariot rider.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तं शर्धं॑ धाम॒ यस्य॑ सू॒रेरित्य॑वोच॒न्दश॑तयस्य॒ नंशे॑ द्यु॒म्नानि॒ येषु॑ व॒सुता॑ती रा॒रन्विश्वे॑ सन्वन्तु प्रभृ॒थेषु॒ वाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: etáṃ śárdhaṃ dhāma yásya sūrér  íty avocan dáśatayasya náṃśe  dyumnā́ni yéṣu vasútātī rārán  víśve sanvantu prabhr̥théṣu vā́jam

translation.text: Vigour will we bestow on that adorer whose tenfold draught we come to taste, so spake they. May all in whom rest splendour and great riches obtain refreshment in these sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मन्दा॑महे॒ दश॑तयस्य धा॒सेर्द्विर्यत्पञ्च॒ बिभ्र॑तो॒ यन्त्यन्ना॑ किमि॒ष्टाश्व॑ इ॒ष्टर॑श्मिरे॒त ई॑शा॒नास॒स्तरु॑ष ऋञ्जते॒ नॄन्
verses.transliteration: mándāmahe dáśatayasya dhāsér  dvír yát páñca bíbhrato yánty ánnā  kím iṣṭā́śva iṣṭáraśmir eté-  īśānā́sas táruṣa r̥ñjate nr̥̄́n

translation.text: We will rejoice to drink the tenfold present when the twicefive come bearing sacred viands. What can he do whose steeds and reins are choicest? These, the all-potent, urge brave men to conquest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यकर्णं मणिग्रीव॒मर्ण॒स्तन्नो॒ विश्वे॑ वरिवस्यन्तु दे॒वाः अ॒र्यो गिरः॑ स॒द्य आ ज॒ग्मुषी॒रोस्राश्चा॑कन्तू॒भये॑ष्व॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: híraṇyakarṇam maṇigrīvam árṇas  tán no víśve varivasyantu devā́ḥ  aryó gíraḥ sadyá ā́ jagmúṣīr ā́-  -usrā́ś cākantūbháyeṣv asmé

translation.text: The sea and all the Deities shall give us him with the golden car and neck bejewelled. Dawns, hasting to the praises otthe pious, be pleased with us. both offerers and singers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒त्वारो॑ मा मश॒र्शार॑स्य॒ शिश्व॒स्त्रयो॒ राज्ञ॒ आय॑वसस्य जि॒ष्णोः रथो॑ वां मित्रावरुणा दी॒र्घाप्साः॒ स्यूम॑गभस्तिः॒ सूरो॒ नाद्यौ॑त्
verses.transliteration: catvā́ro mā maśarśā́rasya śíśvas  tráyo rā́jña ā́yavasasya jiṣṇóḥ  rátho vām mitrāvaruṇā dīrghā́psāḥ  syū́magabhastiḥ sū́ro nā́dyaut

translation.text: Four youthful sons of Maṣarṣâra vex me, three, of the king, the conquering Âyavasa. Now like the Sun, O Varuṇa and Mitra, your car hath shone, long-shaped and reined with splendour.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒थू रथो॒ दक्षि॑णाया अयो॒ज्यैनं॑ दे॒वासो॑ अ॒मृता॑सो अस्थुः कृ॒ष्णादुद॑स्थाद॒र्या॒३॒॑ विहा॑या॒श्चिकि॑त्सन्ती॒ मानु॑षाय॒ क्षया॑य
verses.transliteration: pr̥thū́ rátho dákṣiṇāyā ayoji-  aínaṃ devā́so amŕ̥tāso asthuḥ  kr̥ṣṇā́d úd asthād aryā̀ víhāyāś  cíkitsantī mā́nuṣāya kṣáyāya

translation.text: THE Dakshina's broad chariot hath been harnessed: this car the Gods Immortal have ascended. Fain to bring light to homes of men the noble and active Goddess hath emerged from darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पूर्वा॒ विश्व॑स्मा॒द्भुव॑नादबोधि॒ जय॑न्ती॒ वाजं॑ बृह॒ती सनु॑त्री उ॒च्चा व्य॑ख्यद्युव॒तिः पु॑न॒र्भूरोषा अ॑गन्प्रथ॒मा पू॒र्वहू॑तौ
verses.transliteration: pū́rvā víśvasmād bhúvanād abodhi  jáyantī vā́jam br̥hatī́ sánutrī  uccā́ vy àkhyad yuvatíḥ punarbhū́r  óṣā́ agan prathamā́ pūrváhūtau

translation.text: She before all the living world hath wakened, the Lofty One who wins and gathers treasure. Revived and ever young on high she glances. Dawn hath come first unto our morning worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒द्य भा॒गं वि॒भजा॑सि॒ नृभ्य॒ उषो॑ देवि मर्त्य॒त्रा सु॑जाते दे॒वो नो॒ अत्र॑ सवि॒ता दमू॑ना॒ अना॑गसो वोचति॒ सूर्या॑य
verses.transliteration: yád adyá bhāgáṃ vibhájāsi nŕ̥bhyaḥ-  úṣo devi martyatrā́ sujāte  devó no átra savitā́ dámūnāḥ-  ánāgaso vocati sū́ryāya

translation.text: If, Dawn, thou Goddess nobly born, thou dealest fortune this day to all the race of mortals, May Savitar the God, Friend of the homestead, declare before the Sun that we are sinless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गृ॒हंगृ॑हमह॒ना या॒त्यच्छा॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ अधि॒ नामा॒ दधा॑ना सिषा॑सन्ती द्योत॒ना शश्व॒दागा॒दग्र॑मग्र॒मिद्भ॑जते॒ वसू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: gr̥háṃ-gr̥ham ahanā́ yāty áchā  divé-dive ádhi nā́mā dádhānā  síṣāsantī dyotanā́ śáśvad ā́gād  ágram-agram íd bhajate vásūnām

translation.text: Showing her wonted form each day that passeth, spreading the light she visiteth each dwelling. Eager for conquest, with bright sheen she cometh. Her portion is the best of goodly treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भग॑स्य॒ स्वसा॒ वरु॑णस्य जा॒मिरुषः॑ सूनृते प्रथ॒मा ज॑रस्व प॒श्चा स द॑घ्या॒ यो अ॒घस्य॑ धा॒ता जये॑म॒ तं दक्षि॑णया॒ रथे॑न
verses.transliteration: bhágasya svásā váruṇasya jāmír  úṣaḥ sūnr̥te prathamā́ jarasva  paścā́ sá daghyā yó aghásya dhātā́  jáyema táṃ dákṣiṇayā ráthena

translation.text: Sister of Varuṇa, sister of Bhaga, first among all sing forth, O joyous Morning. Weak be the strength of him who worketh evil – may we subdue him with our car the guerdon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदी॑रतां सू॒नृता॒ उत्पुरं॑धी॒रुद॒ग्नयः॑ शुशुचा॒नासो॑ अस्थुः स्पा॒र्हा वसू॑नि॒ तम॒साप॑गूळ्हा॒विष्कृ॑ण्वन्त्यु॒षसो॑ विभा॒तीः
verses.transliteration: úd īratāṃ sūnŕ̥tā út púraṃdhīr  úd agnáyaḥ śuśucānā́so asthuḥ  spārhā́ vásūni támasā́pagūḷhā-  -āvíṣ kr̥ṇvanty uṣáso vibhātī́ḥ

translation.text: Let our glad hymns and holy thoughts rise upward, for the flames brightly burning have ascended. The far-refulgent Mornings make apparent the lovely treasures which the darkness covered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपा॒न्यदेत्य॒भ्य१॒॑न्यदे॑ति॒ विषु॑रूपे॒ अह॑नी॒ सं च॑रेते प॒रि॒क्षितो॒स्तमो॑ अ॒न्या गुहा॑क॒रद्यौ॑दु॒षाः शोशु॑चता॒ रथे॑न
verses.transliteration: ápānyád éty abhy ànyád eti  víṣurūpe áhanī sáṃ carete  parikṣítos támo anyā́ gúhākar  ádyaud uṣā́ḥ śóśucatā ráthena

translation.text: The one departeth and the other cometh: unlike in hue day's, halves march on successive. One hides the gloom of the surrounding Parents. Dawn on her shining chariot is resplendent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒दृशी॑र॒द्य स॒दृशी॒रिदु॒ श्वो दी॒र्घं स॑चन्ते॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ धाम॑ अ॒न॒व॒द्यास्त्रिं॒शतं॒ योज॑ना॒न्येकै॑का॒ क्रतुं॒ परि॑ यन्ति स॒द्यः
verses.transliteration: sadŕ̥śīr adyá sadŕ̥śīr íd u śvó  dīrgháṃ sacante váruṇasya dhā́ma  anavadyā́s triṃśátaṃ yójanāni-  ékaikā krátum pári yanti sadyáḥ

translation.text: The same in form to-day, the same tomorrow, they still keep Varuṇa's eternal statute. Blameless, in turn they traverse thirty regions, and dart across the spirit in a moment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जा॒न॒त्यह्नः॑ प्रथ॒मस्य॒ नाम॑ शु॒क्रा कृ॒ष्णाद॑जनिष्ट श्विती॒ची ऋ॒तस्य॒ योषा॒ न मि॑नाति॒ धामाह॑रहर्निष्कृ॒तमा॒चर॑न्ती
verses.transliteration: jānaty áhnaḥ prathamásya nā́ma  śukrā́ kr̥ṣṇā́d ajaniṣṭa śvitīcī́  r̥tásya yóṣā ná mināti dhā́ma-  -áhar-ahar niṣkr̥tám ācárantī

translation.text: She who hath knowledge Of the first day's nature is born refulgent white from out the darkness. The Maiden breaketh not the law of Order, day by day coming to the place appointed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒न्ये॑व त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ शाश॑दानाँ॒ एषि॑ देवि दे॒वमिय॑क्षमाणम् सं॒स्मय॑माना युव॒तिः पु॒रस्ता॑दा॒विर्वक्षां॑सि कृणुषे विभा॒ती
verses.transliteration: kanyèva tanvā̀ śā́śadānām̐  éṣi devi devám íyakṣamāṇam  saṃsmáyamānā yuvatíḥ purástād  āvír vákṣāṃsi kr̥ṇuṣe vibhātī́

translation.text: In pride of beauty like a maid thou goest, O Goddess, to the God who longs to win thee, And smiling youthful, as thou shinest brightly, before him thou discoverest thy bosom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒सं॒का॒शा मा॒तृमृ॑ष्टेव॒ योषा॒विस्त॒न्वं॑ कृणुषे दृ॒शे कम् भ॒द्रा त्वमु॑षो वित॒रं व्यु॑च्छ॒ न तत्ते॑ अ॒न्या उ॒षसो॑ नशन्त
verses.transliteration: susaṃkāśā́ mātŕ̥mr̥ṣṭeva yóṣā-  -āvís tanvàṃ kr̥ṇuṣe dr̥śé kám  bhadrā́ tvám uṣo vitaráṃ vy ùcha  ná tát te anyā́ uṣáso naśanta

translation.text: Fair as a bride embellished by her mother thou showest forth thy form that all may see it. Blessed art thou O Dawn. Shine yet more widely. No other Dawns have reached what thou attainest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॑वती॒र्गोम॑तीर्वि॒श्ववा॑रा॒ यत॑माना र॒श्मिभिः॒ सूर्य॑स्य परा॑ च॒ यन्ति॒ पुन॒रा च॑ यन्ति भ॒द्रा नाम॒ वह॑माना उ॒षासः॑
verses.transliteration: áśvāvatīr gómatīr viśvávārāḥ-  yátamānā raśmíbhiḥ sū́ryasya  párā ca yánti púnar ā́ ca yanti  bhadrā́ nā́ma váhamānā uṣā́saḥ

translation.text: Rich in kine, horses, and all goodly treasures, in constant operation with the sunbeams, The Dawns depart and come again again assuming their wonted forms that promise happy fortune.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॑ र॒श्मिम॑नु॒यच्छ॑माना भ॒द्रम्भ॑द्रं॒ क्रतु॑म॒स्मासु॑ धेहि उषो॑ नो अ॒द्य सु॒हवा॒ व्यु॑च्छा॒स्मासु॒ रायो॑ म॒घव॑त्सु च स्युः
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya raśmím anuyáchamānā  bhadrám-bhadraṃ krátum asmā́su dhehi  úṣo no adyá suhávā vy ùcha-  -asmā́su rā́yo maghávatsu ca syuḥ

translation.text: Obedient to the rein of Law Eternal give us each thought that more and more shall bless us. Shine thou on us to-day, Dawn, swift to listen. With us be riches and with chiefs who worship.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒षा उ॒च्छन्ती॑ समिधा॒ने अ॒ग्ना उ॒द्यन्त्सूर्य॑ उर्वि॒या ज्योति॑रश्रेत् दे॒वो नो॒ अत्र॑ सवि॒ता न्वर्थं॒ प्रासा॑वीद्द्वि॒पत्प्र चतु॑ष्पदि॒त्यै
verses.transliteration: uṣā́ uchántī samidhāné agnaú-  udyán sū́rya urviyā́ jyótir aśret  devó no átra savitā́ nv ártham  prā́sāvīd dvipát prá cátuṣpad ityaí

translation.text: THE Dawn refulgent when the fire is kindled, and the Sun rising, far diffuse their brightness. Savitar, God, hath sentus forth to labour, each quadruped, each biped, to be active.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अमि॑नती॒ दैव्या॑नि व्र॒तानि॑ प्रमिन॒ती म॑नु॒ष्या॑ यु॒गानि॑ ई॒युषी॑णामुप॒मा शश्व॑तीनामायती॒नां प्र॑थ॒मोषा व्य॑द्यौत्
verses.transliteration: áminatī daívyāni vratā́ni  praminatī́ manuṣyā̀ yugā́ni  īyúṣīṇām upamā́ śáśvatīnāṃ  āyatīnā́m prathamóṣā́ vy àdyaut

translation.text: Not interrupting heavenly ordinances, although she minisheth human generations. The last of endless morns that have departed, the first of those that come, Dawn brightly shineth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा दि॒वो दु॑हि॒ता प्रत्य॑दर्शि॒ ज्योति॒र्वसा॑ना सम॒ना पु॒रस्ता॑त् ऋ॒तस्य॒ पन्था॒मन्वे॑ति सा॒धु प्र॑जान॒तीव॒ न दिशो॑ मिनाति
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ divó duhitā́ práty adarśi  jyótir vásānā samanā́ purástāt  r̥tásya pánthām ánv eti sādhú  prajānatī́va ná díśo mināti

translation.text: There in the eastern region she, Heaven's Daughter, arrayed in garments all of light, appeareth. Truly she followeth the path of Order, nor faileth, knowing well, the heavenly quarters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपो॑ अदर्शि शु॒न्ध्युवो॒ न वक्षो॑ नो॒धा इ॑वा॒विर॑कृत प्रि॒याणि॑ अ॒द्म॒सन्न स॑स॒तो बो॒धय॑न्ती शश्वत्त॒मागा॒त्पुन॑रे॒युषी॑णाम्
verses.transliteration: úpo adarśi śundhyúvo ná vákṣo  nodhā́ ivāvír akr̥ta priyā́ṇi  admasán ná sasató bodháyantī  śaśvattamā́gāt púnar eyúṣīṇām

translation.text: Near is she seen, as 'twere the Bright One's bosom: she showeth sweet things like a new songsinger. She cometh like a fly awaking sleepers, of all. returning dames most true and constant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पूर्वे॒ अर्धे॒ रज॑सो अ॒प्त्यस्य॒ गवां॒ जनि॑त्र्यकृत॒ प्र के॒तुम् व्यु॑ प्रथते वित॒रं वरी॑य॒ ओभा पृ॒णन्ती॑ पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्था॑
verses.transliteration: pū́rve árdhe rájaso aptyásya  gávāṃ jánitry akr̥ta prá ketúm  vy ù prathate vitaráṃ várīyaḥ-  óbhā́ pr̥ṇántī pitrór upásthā

translation.text: There in the east half of the watery region the Mother of the Cows hath shown her ensign. Wider and wider still she spreadeth onward, and filleth full the laps of both heir Parents.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वेदे॒षा पु॑रु॒तमा॑ दृ॒शे कं नाजा॑मिं॒ न परि॑ वृणक्ति जा॒मिम् अ॒रे॒पसा॑ त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ शाश॑दाना॒ नार्भा॒दीष॑ते॒ न म॒हो वि॑भा॒ती
verses.transliteration: evéd eṣā́ purutámā dr̥śé káṃ  nā́jāmiṃ ná pári vr̥ṇakti jāmím  arepásā tanvā̀ śā́śadānā  nā́rbhād ī́ṣate ná mahó vibhātī́

translation.text: She, verily, exceeding vast to look on debarreth from her light nor kin nor stranger. Proud of her spotless form she, brightly shiming, turneth not from the high nor froom the humble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भ्रा॒तेव॑ पुं॒स ए॑ति प्रती॒ची ग॑र्ता॒रुगि॑व स॒नये॒ धना॑नाम् जा॒येव॒ पत्य॑ उश॒ती सु॒वासा॑ उ॒षा ह॒स्रेव॒ नि रि॑णीते॒ अप्सः॑
verses.transliteration: abhrātéva puṃsá eti pratīcī́  gartārúg iva sanáye dhánānām  jāyéva pátya uśatī́ suvā́sāḥ-  uṣā́ hasréva ní riṇīte ápsaḥ

translation.text: She seeketh men, as she who hath no brother, mounting her car, as 'twere to gather riches. Dawn, like a loving matron for her husband, smiling and well attired, unmasks her beauty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वसा॒ स्वस्रे॒ ज्याय॑स्यै॒ योनि॑मारै॒गपै॑त्यस्याः प्रति॒चक्ष्ये॑व व्यु॒च्छन्ती॑ र॒श्मिभिः॒ सूर्य॑स्या॒ञ्ज्य॑ङ्क्ते समन॒गा इ॑व॒ व्राः
verses.transliteration: svásā svásre jyā́yasyai yónim āraig  ápaity asyāḥ praticákṣyeva  vyuchántī raśmíbhiḥ sū́ryasya-  -añjy àṅkte samanagā́ iva vrā́ḥ

translation.text: The Sister quitteth, for the elder Sister, her place, and having looked on her departeth. She decks her beauty, shining forth with sunbeams, like women trooping to the festal meeting.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒सां पूर्वा॑सा॒मह॑सु॒ स्वसॄ॑णा॒मप॑रा॒ पूर्वा॑म॒भ्ये॑ति प॒श्चात् ताः प्र॑त्न॒वन्नव्य॑सीर्नू॒नम॒स्मे रे॒वदु॑च्छन्तु सु॒दिना॑ उ॒षासः॑
verses.transliteration: āsā́m pū́rvāsām áhasu svásr̥̄ṇām  áparā pū́rvām abhy èti paścā́t  tā́ḥ pratnaván návyasīr nūnám asmé  revád uchantu sudínā uṣā́saḥ

translation.text: To all these Sisters who ere now have vanished a later one each day in course succeedeth. So, like the past, with days of happy fortune, may the new Dawns shine forth on us with riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र बो॑धयोषः पृण॒तो म॑घो॒न्यबु॑ध्यमानाः प॒णयः॑ ससन्तु रे॒वदु॑च्छ म॒घव॑द्भ्यो मघोनि रे॒वत्स्तो॒त्रे सू॑नृते जा॒रय॑न्ती
verses.transliteration: prá bodhayoṣaḥ pr̥ṇató maghoni-  ábudhyamānāḥ paṇáyaḥ sasantu  revád ucha maghávadbhyo maghoni  revát stotré sūnr̥te jāráyantī

translation.text: Rouse up, O Wealthy One, the liberal givers; let niggard traffickers sleep on unwakened: Shine richly, Wealthy One, on those who worship, richly, glad. Dawn while wasting, on the singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवे॒यम॑श्वैद्युव॒तिः पु॒रस्ता॑द्यु॒ङ्क्ते गवा॑मरु॒णाना॒मनी॑कम् वि नू॒नमु॑च्छा॒दस॑ति॒ प्र के॒तुर्गृ॒हंगृ॑ह॒मुप॑ तिष्ठाते अ॒ग्निः
verses.transliteration: áveyám aśvaid yuvatíḥ purástād  yuṅkté gávām aruṇā́nām ánīkam  ví nūnám uchād ásati prá ketúr  gr̥háṃ-gr̥ham úpa tiṣṭhāte agníḥ

translation.text: This young Maid from the east hath shone upon us; she harnesseth her team of bright red oxen. She will beam forth, the light will hasten hither, and Agni will be present in each dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्ते॒ वय॑श्चिद्वस॒तेर॑पप्त॒न्नर॑श्च॒ ये पि॑तु॒भाजो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ अ॒मा स॒ते व॑हसि॒ भूरि॑ वा॒ममुषो॑ देवि दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य
verses.transliteration: út te váyaś cid vasatér apaptan  náraś ca yé pitubhā́jo vyùṣṭau  amā́ saté vahasi bhū́ri vāmám  úṣo devi dāśúṣe mártyāya

translation.text: As the birds fly forth from their resting places, so men with store of food rise at thy dawning. Yea, to the liberal mortal who remaineth at home, O Goddess Dawn, much good thou bringest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्तो॑ढ्वं स्तोम्या॒ ब्रह्म॑णा॒ मेऽवी॑वृधध्वमुश॒तीरु॑षासः यु॒ष्माकं॑ देवी॒रव॑सा सनेम सह॒स्रिणं॑ च श॒तिनं॑ च॒ वाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: ástoḍhvaṃ stomyā bráhmaṇā me-  -ávīvr̥dhadhvam uśatī́r uṣāsaḥ  yuṣmā́kaṃ devīr ávasā sanema  sahasríṇaṃ ca śatínaṃ ca vā́jam

translation.text: Praised through my prayer be ye who should be lauded. Ye have increased our wealth, ye Dawns who love us. Goddesses, may we win by your good favour wealth to be told by hundreds and by thousands.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒ता रत्नं॑ प्रात॒रित्वा॑ दधाति॒ तं चि॑कि॒त्वान्प्र॑ति॒गृह्या॒ नि ध॑त्ते तेन॑ प्र॒जां व॒र्धय॑मान॒ आयू॑ रा॒यस्पोषे॑ण सचते सु॒वीरः॑
verses.transliteration: prātā́ rátnam prātarítvā dadhāti  táṃ cikitvā́n pratigŕ̥hyā ní dhatte  téna prajā́ṃ vardháyamāna ā́yuḥ-  rāyás póṣeṇa sacate suvī́raḥ

translation.text: COMING at early morn he gives his treasure; the prudent one receives and entertains him. Thereby increasing still his life and offspring, he comes with brave sons to abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒गुर॑सत्सुहिर॒ण्यः स्वश्वो॑ बृ॒हद॑स्मै॒ वय॒ इन्द्रो॑ दधाति यस्त्वा॒यन्तं॒ वसु॑ना प्रातरित्वो मु॒क्षीज॑येव॒ पदि॑मुत्सि॒नाति॑
verses.transliteration: sugúr asat suhiraṇyáḥ sváśvo  br̥hád asmai váya índro dadhāti  yás tvāyántaṃ vásunā prātaritvo  mukṣī́jayeva pádim utsinā́ti

translation.text: Rich shall he be in gold and kine and horses. Indra bestows on him great vital power, Who stays thee, as thou comest, with his treasure, like game caught in the net, O early comer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आय॑म॒द्य सु॒कृतं॑ प्रा॒तरि॒च्छन्नि॒ष्टेः पु॒त्रं वसु॑मता॒ रथे॑न अं॒शोः सु॒तं पा॑यय मत्स॒रस्य॑ क्ष॒यद्वी॑रं वर्धय सू॒नृता॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ā́yam adyá sukŕ̥tam prātár ichánn  iṣṭéḥ putráṃ vásumatā ráthena  aṃśóḥ sutám pāyaya matsarásya  kṣayádvīraṃ vardhaya sūnŕ̥tābhiḥ

translation.text: Longing, I came this morning to the pious, the son of sacrifice, with car wealth. laden. Give him to drink juice of the stalk that gladdens; prosper with pleasant hymns the Lord of Heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ क्षरन्ति॒ सिन्ध॑वो मयो॒भुव॑ ईजा॒नं च॑ य॒क्ष्यमा॑णं च धे॒नवः॑ पृ॒णन्तं॑ च॒ पपु॑रिं च श्रव॒स्यवो॑ घृ॒तस्य॒ धारा॒ उप॑ यन्ति वि॒श्वतः॑
verses.transliteration: úpa kṣaranti síndhavo mayobhúvaḥ-  ījānáṃ ca yakṣyámāṇaṃ ca dhenávaḥ  pr̥ṇántaṃ ca pápuriṃ ca śravasyávo  ghr̥tásya dhā́rā úpa yanti viśvátaḥ

translation.text: Health-bringing streams, as milch-cows, flow to profit him who hath worshipped, him who now will worship. To him who freely gives and fills on all sides full streams of fatness flow and make him famous.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नाक॑स्य पृ॒ष्ठे अधि॑ तिष्ठति श्रि॒तो यः पृ॒णाति॒ स ह॑ दे॒वेषु॑ गच्छति तस्मा॒ आपो॑ घृ॒तम॑र्षन्ति॒ सिन्ध॑व॒स्तस्मा॑ इ॒यं दक्षि॑णा पिन्वते॒ सदा॑
verses.transliteration: nā́kasya pr̥ṣṭhé ádhi tiṣṭhati śritó  yáḥ pr̥ṇā́ti sá ha devéṣu gachati  tásmā ā́po ghr̥tám arṣanti síndhavas  tásmā iyáṃ dákṣiṇā pinvate sádā

translation.text: On the high ridge of heaven he stands exalted, yea, to the Gods he goes, the liberal giver. The streams, the waters flow for him with fatness: to him this guerdon ever yields abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दक्षि॑णावता॒मिदि॒मानि॑ चि॒त्रा दक्षि॑णावतां दि॒वि सूर्या॑सः दक्षि॑णावन्तो अ॒मृतं॑ भजन्ते॒ दक्षि॑णावन्तः॒ प्र ति॑रन्त॒ आयुः॑
verses.transliteration: dákṣiṇāvatām íd imā́ni citrā́  dákṣiṇāvatāṃ diví sū́ryāsaḥ  dákṣiṇāvanto amŕ̥tam bhajante  dákṣiṇāvantaḥ prá tiranta ā́yuḥ

translation.text: For those who give rich meeds are all these splendours, for those who give rich meeds suns shine in heaven. The givers of rich meeds are made immortal; the givers of rich fees prolong their lifetime.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा पृ॒णन्तो॒ दुरि॑त॒मेन॒ आर॒न्मा जा॑रिषुः सू॒रयः॑ सुव्र॒तासः॑ अ॒न्यस्तेषां॑ परि॒धिर॑स्तु॒ कश्चि॒दपृ॑णन्तम॒भि सं य॑न्तु॒ शोकाः॑
verses.transliteration: mā́ pr̥ṇánto dúritam éna ā́ran  mā́ jāriṣuḥ sūráyaḥ suvratā́saḥ  anyás téṣām paridhír astu káś cid  ápr̥ṇantam abhí sáṃ yantu śókāḥ

translation.text: Let not the liberal sink to sin and sorrow, never decay the pious -chiefs who worship! Let every man besides be their protection, and let affliction fall upon the niggard.

suktas.rsi: Kaksivat, the Son of Dirghatamas and Usij

verses.sanskrit_deva: अम॑न्दा॒न्त्स्तोमा॒न्प्र भ॑रे मनी॒षा सिन्धा॒वधि॑ क्षिय॒तो भा॒व्यस्य॑ यो मे॑ स॒हस्र॒ममि॑मीत स॒वान॒तूर्तो॒ राजा॒ श्रव॑ इ॒च्छमा॑नः
verses.transliteration: ámandān stómān prá bhare manīṣā́  síndhāv ádhi kṣiyató bhāvyásya  yó me sahásram ámimīta savā́n  atū́rto rā́jā śráva ichámānaḥ

translation.text: WITH wisdom I present these lively praises of Bhâvya dweller on the bank of Sindhu; For he, unconquered King, desiring glory, hath furnished me a thousand sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं राज्ञो॒ नाध॑मानस्य नि॒ष्काञ्छ॒तमश्वा॒न्प्रय॑तान्त्स॒द्य आद॑म् श॒तं क॒क्षीवाँ॒ असु॑रस्य॒ गोनां॑ दि॒वि श्रवो॒ऽजर॒मा त॑तान
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ rā́jño nā́dhamānasya niṣkā́ñ  -śatám áśvān práyatān sadyá ā́dam  śatáṃ kakṣī́vām̐ ásurasya gónāṃ  diví śrávo 'járam ā́ tatāna

translation.text: A hundred necklets from the King, beseeching, a hundred gift-steeds I at once accepted; Of the lord's cows a thousand, I Kakshîvân. His deathless glory hath he spread to heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ मा श्या॒वाः स्व॒नये॑न द॒त्ता व॒धूम॑न्तो॒ दश॒ रथा॑सो अस्थुः ष॒ष्टिः स॒हस्र॒मनु॒ गव्य॒मागा॒त्सन॑त्क॒क्षीवाँ॑ अभिपि॒त्वे अह्ना॑म्
verses.transliteration: úpa mā śyāvā́ḥ svanáyena dattā́ḥ-  vadhū́manto dáśa ráthāso asthuḥ  ṣaṣṭíḥ sahásram ánu gávyam ā́gāt  sánat kakṣī́vām̐ abhipitvé áhnām

translation.text: Horses of dusky colour stood beside me, ten chariots, Svanaya's gift, with mares to draw them. Kine numbering sixty thousand followed after. Kakshîvân gained them when the days were closing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒त्वा॒रिं॒शद्दश॑रथस्य॒ शोणाः॑ स॒हस्र॒स्याग्रे॒ श्रेणिं॑ नयन्ति म॒द॒च्युतः॑ कृश॒नाव॑तो॒ अत्या॑न्क॒क्षीव॑न्त॒ उद॑मृक्षन्त प॒ज्राः
verses.transliteration: catvāriṃśád dáśarathasya śóṇāḥ  sahásrasyā́gre śréṇiṃ nayanti  madacyútaḥ kr̥śanā́vato átyān  kakṣī́vanta úd amr̥kṣanta pajrā́ḥ

translation.text: Forty bay horses of the ten cars' master before a thousand lead the long procession. Reeling in joy Kakshîvân's sons and Pajra's have grounded the coursers decked with pearly trappings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पूर्वा॒मनु॒ प्रय॑ति॒मा द॑दे व॒स्त्रीन्यु॒क्ताँ अ॒ष्टाव॒रिधा॑यसो॒ गाः सु॒बन्ध॑वो॒ ये वि॒श्या॑ इव॒ व्रा अन॑स्वन्तः॒ श्रव॒ ऐष॑न्त प॒ज्राः
verses.transliteration: pū́rvām ánu práyatim ā́ dade vas  trī́n yuktā́m̐ aṣṭā́v arídhāyaso gā́ḥ  subándhavo yé viśyā̀ iva vrā́ḥ-  ánasvantaḥ śráva aíṣanta pajrā́ḥ

translation.text: An earlier gift for you have I accepted eight cows, good milkers, and tree harnessed horses, Pajras, who with your wains with your great kinsman, like troops of subjects, have been fain for glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आग॑धिता॒ परि॑गधिता॒ या क॑शी॒केव॒ जङ्ग॑हे ददा॑ति॒ मह्यं॒ यादु॑री॒ याशू॑नां भो॒ज्या॑ श॒ता
verses.transliteration: ā́gadhitā párigadhitā  yā́ kaśīkéva jáṅgahe  dádāti máhyaṃ yā́durī  yā́śūnām bhojyā̀ śatā́

translation.text: [Ille loquitur]. Adhaerens, arcte adhaerens, illa quac mustelae similis se abdidit, multum humorem effundens, dat mihi complexuum centum gaudia.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपो॑प मे॒ परा॑ मृश॒ मा मे॑ द॒भ्राणि॑ मन्यथाः सर्वा॒हम॑स्मि रोम॒शा ग॒न्धारी॑णामिवावि॒का
verses.transliteration: úpopa me párā mr̥śa  mā́ me dabhrā́ṇi manyathāḥ  sárvāhám asmi romaśā́  gandhā́rīṇām ivāvikā́

translation.text: [Illa loquitur]. Prope, prope accede; molliter me tange. Ne putes pilos corporis mei-paucos esse: tota sum villosa sicut Gandharidum ovis.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं होता॑रं मन्ये॒ दास्व॑न्तं॒ वसुं॑ सू॒नुं सह॑सो जा॒तवे॑दसं॒ विप्रं॒ न जा॒तवे॑दसम् य ऊ॒र्ध्वया॑ स्वध्व॒रो दे॒वो दे॒वाच्या॑ कृ॒पा घृ॒तस्य॒ विभ्रा॑ष्टि॒मनु॑ वष्टि शो॒चिषा॒जुह्वा॑नस्य स॒र्पिषः॑
verses.transliteration: agníṃ hótāram manye dā́svantaṃ  vásuṃ sūnúṃ sáhaso jātávedasaṃ  vípraṃ ná jātávedasam  yá ūrdhváyā svadhvaró  devó devā́cyā kr̥pā́  ghr̥tásya víbhrāṣṭim ánu vaṣṭi śocíṣā-  -ājúhvānasya sarpíṣaḥ

translation.text: AGNI I hold as herald, the munificent, the gracious, Son of Strength, who knoweth all that live, as holy Singer, knowing all, Lord of fair rites, a God with form erected turning to the Gods, He, when the flame hath sprung forth from the holy oil, the offered fatness, longeth for it with his glow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यजि॑ष्ठं त्वा॒ यज॑माना हुवेम॒ ज्येष्ठ॒मङ्गि॑रसां विप्र॒ मन्म॑भि॒र्विप्रे॑भिः शुक्र॒ मन्म॑भिः परि॑ज्मानमिव॒ द्यां होता॑रं चर्षणी॒नाम् शो॒चिष्के॑शं॒ वृष॑णं॒ यमि॒मा विशः॒ प्राव॑न्तु जू॒तये॒ विशः॑
verses.transliteration: yájiṣṭhaṃ tvā yájamānā huvema  jyéṣṭham áṅgirasāṃ vipra mánmabhir  víprebhiḥ śukra mánmabhiḥ  párijmānam iva dyā́ṃ  hótāraṃ carṣaṇīnā́m  śocíṣkeśaṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ yám imā́ víśaḥ  prā́vantu jūtáye víśaḥ

translation.text: We, sacrificing, call on thee best worshipper, the eldest of Angirases, Singer, with hymns, thee, brilliant One! with singers' hymns; Thee, wandering round as 't were the sky, who art the invoking Priest of men, Whom, Bull with hair of flame the people must observe, the people that he speed them on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि पु॒रू चि॒दोज॑सा वि॒रुक्म॑ता॒ दीद्या॑नो॒ भव॑ति द्रुहंत॒रः प॑र॒शुर्न द्रु॑हंत॒रः वी॒ळु चि॒द्यस्य॒ समृ॑तौ॒ श्रुव॒द्वने॑व॒ यत्स्थि॒रम् निः॒षह॑माणो यमते॒ नाय॑ते धन्वा॒सहा॒ नाय॑ते
verses.transliteration: sá hí purū́ cid ójasā virúkmatā  dī́dyāno bhávati druhaṃtaráḥ  paraśúr ná druhaṃtaráḥ  vīḷú cid yásya sámr̥tau  śrúvad váneva yát sthirám  niḥṣáhamāṇo yamate nā́yate  dhanvāsáhā nā́yate

translation.text: He with his shining glory blazing far and wide, he verily it is who slayeth demon foes, slayeth the demons like an axe: At whose close touch things solid shake, and what is stable yields like trees. Subduing all, he keeps his ground and flinches not, from the skilled archer flinches not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दृ॒ळ्हा चि॑दस्मा॒ अनु॑ दु॒र्यथा॑ वि॒दे तेजि॑ष्ठाभिर॒रणि॑भिर्दा॒ष्ट्यव॑से॒ऽग्नये॑ दा॒ष्ट्यव॑से प्र यः पु॒रूणि॒ गाह॑ते॒ तक्ष॒द्वने॑व शो॒चिषा॑ स्थि॒रा चि॒दन्ना॒ नि रि॑णा॒त्योज॑सा॒ नि स्थि॒राणि॑ चि॒दोज॑सा
verses.transliteration: dr̥ḷhā́ cid asmā ánu dur yáthā vidé  téjiṣṭhābhir aráṇibhir dāṣṭy ávase  -agnáye dāṣṭy ávase  prá yáḥ purū́ṇi gā́hate  tákṣad váneva śocíṣā  sthirā́ cid ánnā ní riṇāty ójasā  ní sthirā́ṇi cid ójasā

translation.text: To him, as one who knows, even things solid yield: unrough fire-sticks heated hot he gives his gifts to aid. Men offer Agni gifts for aid. He deeply piercing many a thing hews it like wood with fervent glow. Even hard and solid food he crunches with his might, yea, hard and solid food with might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॑स्य पृ॒क्षमुप॑रासु धीमहि॒ नक्तं॒ यः सु॒दर्श॑तरो॒ दिवा॑तरा॒दप्रा॑युषे॒ दिवा॑तरात् आद॒स्यायु॒र्ग्रभ॑णवद्वी॒ळु शर्म॒ न सू॒नवे॑ भ॒क्तमभ॑क्त॒मवो॒ व्यन्तो॑ अ॒जरा॑ अ॒ग्नयो॒ व्यन्तो॑ अ॒जराः॑
verses.transliteration: tám asya pr̥kṣám úparāsu dhīmahi  náktaṃ yáḥ sudárśataro dívātarād  áprāyuṣe dívātarāt  ā́d asyā́yur grábhaṇavad  vīḷú śárma ná sūnáve  bhaktám ábhaktam ávo vyánto ajárāḥ-  agnáyo vyánto ajárāḥ

translation.text: Here near we place the sacrificial food for him who shines forth fairer in the night than in the day, with life then stronger than by day. His life gives sure and firm defence as that one giveth to a son. The during fires enjoy things given and things not given, the during fires enjoy as food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि शर्धो॒ न मारु॑तं तुवि॒ष्वणि॒रप्न॑स्वतीषू॒र्वरा॑स्वि॒ष्टनि॒रार्त॑नास्वि॒ष्टनिः॑ आद॑द्ध॒व्यान्या॑द॒दिर्य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुर॒र्हणा॑ अध॑ स्मास्य॒ हर्ष॑तो॒ हृषी॑वतो॒ विश्वे॑ जुषन्त॒ पन्थां॒ नरः॑ शु॒भे न पन्था॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá hí śárdho ná mā́rutaṃ tuviṣváṇir  ápnasvatīṣūrvárāsv iṣṭánir  ā́rtanāsv iṣṭániḥ  ā́dad dhavyā́ny ādadír  yajñásya ketúr arháṇā  ádha smāsya hárṣato hŕ̥ṣīvato  víśve juṣanta pánthāṃ  náraḥ śubhé ná pánthām

translation.text: He, roaring very loudly like the Maruts' host, in fertile cultivated fields adorable, in desert spots adorable, Accepts and eats our offered gifts, ensign of sacrifice by desert; So let all, joying, love his path when he is glad, as men pursue a path for bliss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वि॒ता यदीं॑ की॒स्तासो॑ अ॒भिद्य॑वो नम॒स्यन्त॑ उप॒वोच॑न्त॒ भृग॑वो म॒थ्नन्तो॑ दा॒शा भृग॑वः अ॒ग्निरी॑शे॒ वसू॑नां॒ शुचि॒र्यो ध॒र्णिरे॑षाम् प्रि॒याँ अ॑पि॒धीँर्व॑निषीष्ट॒ मेधि॑र॒ आ व॑निषीष्ट॒ मेधि॑रः
verses.transliteration: dvitā́ yád īṃ kīstā́so abhídyavo  namasyánta upavócanta bhŕ̥gavo  mathnánto dāśā́ bhŕ̥gavaḥ  agnír īśe vásūnāṃ  śúcir yó dharṇír eṣām  priyā́m̐ apidhī́m̐r vaniṣīṣṭa médhiraḥ-  ā́ vaniṣīṣṭa médhiraḥ

translation.text: Even as they who sarig forth hymns, addressed to heaven, the Bhr̥igus with their prayer and praise invited him, the Bhr̥igus rubbing, offering gifts. For radiant Agni, Lord of all these treasures, is exceeding strong. May he, the wise, accept the grateful coverings, the wise accept the coverings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑सां त्वा वि॒शां पतिं॑ हवामहे॒ सर्वा॑सां समा॒नं दम्प॑तिं भु॒जे स॒त्यगि॑र्वाहसं भु॒जे अति॑थिं॒ मानु॑षाणां पि॒तुर्न यस्या॑स॒या अ॒मी च॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒मृता॑स॒ आ वयो॑ ह॒व्या दे॒वेष्वा वयः॑
verses.transliteration: víśvāsāṃ tvā viśā́m pátiṃ havāmahe  sárvāsāṃ samānáṃ dámpatim bhujé  satyágirvāhasam bhujé  átithim mā́nuṣāṇām  pitúr ná yásyāsayā́  amī́ ca víśve amŕ̥tāsa ā́ váyo  havyā́ devéṣv ā́ váyaḥ

translation.text: Thee we invoke, the Lord of all our settled homes, common to all, the household's guardian, to enjoy, bearer of true hymns, to enjoy. Thee we invoke, the guest of men, by whose mouth, even as a sire's, All these Immortals come to gain their food of life, oblations come to Gods as food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ सह॑सा॒ सह॑न्तमः शु॒ष्मिन्त॑मो जायसे दे॒वता॑तये र॒यिर्न दे॒वता॑तये शु॒ष्मिन्त॑मो॒ हि ते॒ मदो॑ द्यु॒म्निन्त॑म उ॒त क्रतुः॑ अध॑ स्मा ते॒ परि॑ चरन्त्यजर श्रुष्टी॒वानो॒ नाज॑र
verses.transliteration: tvám agne sáhasā sáhantamaḥ  śuṣmíntamo jāyase devátātaye  rayír ná devátātaye  śuṣmíntamo hí te mádo  dyumníntama utá krátuḥ  ádha smā te pári caranty ajara  śruṣṭīvā́no nā́jara

translation.text: Thou, Agni, most victorious with thy conquering strength, most Mighty One, art born for service of the Gods, like wealth for service of the Gods. Most mighty is thine ecstasy, most splendid is thy mental power. Therefore men wait upon thee, undecaying One, like vassals, undecaying One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ म॒हे सह॑सा॒ सह॑स्वत उष॒र्बुधे॑ पशु॒षे नाग्नये॒ स्तोमो॑ बभूत्व॒ग्नये॑ प्रति॒ यदीं॑ ह॒विष्मा॒न्विश्वा॑सु॒ क्षासु॒ जोगु॑वे अग्रे॑ रे॒भो न ज॑रत ऋषू॒णां जूर्णि॒र्होत॑ ऋषू॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: prá vo mahé sáhasā sáhasvate-  uṣarbúdhe paśuṣé nā́gnáye  stómo babhūtv agnáye  práti yád īṃ havíṣmān  víśvāsu kṣā́su jóguve  ágre rebhó ná jarata r̥ṣūṇā́ṃ  jū́rṇir hóta r̥ṣūṇā́m

translation.text: To him the mighty, conquering with victorious strength, to Agni walking with the dawn, who sendeth kine, be sung your laud, to Agni sung; As he who with oblation comes calls him aloud in every place. Before the brands of fire he shouteth singerlike, the herald, kindler of the brands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॒ नेदि॑ष्ठं॒ ददृ॑शान॒ आ भ॒राग्ने॑ दे॒वेभिः॒ सच॑नाः सुचे॒तुना॑ म॒हो रा॒यः सु॑चे॒तुना॑ महि॑ शविष्ठ नस्कृधि सं॒चक्षे॑ भु॒जे अ॒स्यै महि॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ मघवन्त्सु॒वीर्यं॒ मथी॑रु॒ग्रो न शव॑सा
verses.transliteration: sá no nédiṣṭhaṃ dádr̥śāna ā́ bhara-  -ágne devébhiḥ sácanāḥ sucetúnā  mahó rāyáḥ sucetúnā  máhi śaviṣṭha nas kr̥dhi  saṃcákṣe bhujé asyaí  máhi stotŕ̥bhyo maghavan suvī́ryam  máthīr ugró ná śávasā

translation.text: Agni, beheld by us in nearest neighbourhood, accordant with the Gods, bring us, with gracious love, great riches with thy gracious love. Give us O Mightiest, what is great, to see and to enjoy the earth. As one of awful power, stir up heroic might for those who praise thee, Bounteous Lord!

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं जा॑यत॒ मनु॑षो॒ धरी॑मणि॒ होता॒ यजि॑ष्ठ उ॒शिजा॒मनु॑ व्र॒तम॒ग्निः स्वमनु॑ व्र॒तम् वि॒श्वश्रु॑ष्टिः सखीय॒ते र॒यिरि॑व श्रवस्य॒ते अद॑ब्धो॒ होता॒ नि ष॑ददि॒ळस्प॒दे परि॑वीत इ॒ळस्प॒दे
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ jāyata mánuṣo dhárīmaṇi  hótā yájiṣṭha uśíjām ánu vratám  agníḥ svám ánu vratám  viśváśruṣṭiḥ sakhīyaté  rayír iva śravasyaté  ádabdho hótā ní ṣadad iḷás padé  párivīta iḷás padé

translation.text: By Manu's law was born this Agni, Priest most skilled, born for the holy work of those who yearn therefore, yea, born for his own holy work. All ear to him who seeks his love and wealth to him who strives for fame, Priest ne'er deceived, he sits in Iḷâ's holy place, girt round in Iḷâ's holy place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं य॑ज्ञ॒साध॒मपि॑ वातयामस्यृ॒तस्य॑ प॒था नम॑सा ह॒विष्म॑ता दे॒वता॑ता ह॒विष्म॑ता स न॑ ऊ॒र्जामु॒पाभृ॑त्य॒या कृ॒पा न जू॑र्यति यं मा॑त॒रिश्वा॒ मन॑वे परा॒वतो॑ दे॒वं भाः प॑रा॒वतः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ yajñasā́dham ápi vātayāmasi-  r̥tásya pathā́ námasā havíṣmatā  devátātā havíṣmatā  sá na ūrjā́m upā́bhr̥tī-  ayā́ kr̥pā́ ná jūryati  yám mātaríśvā mánave parāváto  devám bhā́ḥ parāvátaḥ

translation.text: We call that perfecter of worship by the path or sacrifice; with reverence rich in offerings, with worship rich in offerings. Through presentation of our food he grows not old in this his from; The God whom Mâtariṣvan brought from far away, for Manu brought from far away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एवे॑न स॒द्यः पर्ये॑ति॒ पार्थि॑वं मुहु॒र्गी रेतो॑ वृष॒भः कनि॑क्रद॒द्दध॒द्रेतः॒ कनि॑क्रदत् श॒तं चक्षा॑णो अ॒क्षभि॑र्दे॒वो वने॑षु तु॒र्वणिः॑ सदो॒ दधा॑न॒ उप॑रेषु॒ सानु॑ष्व॒ग्निः परे॑षु॒ सानु॑षु
verses.transliteration: évena sadyáḥ páry eti pā́rthivam  muhurgī́ réto vr̥ṣabháḥ kánikradad  dádhad rétaḥ kánikradat  śatáṃ cákṣāṇo akṣábhir  devó váneṣu turváṇiḥ  sádo dádhāna úpareṣu sā́nuṣu-  agníḥ páreṣu sā́nuṣu

translation.text: In ordered course forthwith he traverses the earth, swift-swallowing, bellowing Steer, bearing the genial seed, bearing the seed and bellowing. Observant with a hundred eyes the God is conqueror in the wood: Agni, who hath his seat in broad plains here below, and in the high lands far away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सु॒क्रतुः॑ पु॒रोहि॑तो॒ दमे॑दमे॒ऽग्निर्य॒ज्ञस्या॑ध्व॒रस्य॑ चेतति॒ क्रत्वा॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॑ चेतति क्रत्वा॑ वे॒धा इ॑षूय॒ते विश्वा॑ जा॒तानि॑ पस्पशे यतो॑ घृत॒श्रीरति॑थि॒रजा॑यत॒ वह्नि॑र्वे॒धा अजा॑यत
verses.transliteration: sá sukrátuḥ puróhito dáme-dame  -agnír yajñásyādhvarásya cetati  krátvā yajñásya cetati  krátvā vedhā́ iṣūyaté  víśvā jātā́ni paspaśe  yáto ghr̥taśrī́r átithir ájāyata  váhnir vedhā́ ájāyata

translation.text: That Agni, wise High-Priest, in every house takes thought for sacrifice and holy service, yea, takes thought, with mental power, for sacrifice. Disposer, he with mental power shows all things unto him who strives; Whence he was born a guest enriched with holy oil, born as Ordainer and as Priest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्रत्वा॒ यद॑स्य॒ तवि॑षीषु पृ॒ञ्चते॒ऽग्नेरवे॑ण म॒रुतां॒ न भो॒ज्ये॑षि॒राय॒ न भो॒ज्या॑ स हि ष्मा॒ दान॒मिन्व॑ति॒ वसू॑नां च म॒ज्मना॑ स न॑स्त्रासते दुरि॒ताद॑भि॒ह्रुतः॒ शंसा॑द॒घाद॑भि॒ह्रुतः॑
verses.transliteration: krátvā yád asya táviṣīṣu pr̥ñcáte  -agnér áveṇa marútāṃ ná bhojyā̀-  -iśirā́ya ná bhojyā̀  sá hí ṣmā dā́nam ínvati  vásūnāṃ ca majmánā  sá nas trāsate duritā́d abhihrútaḥ  śáṃsād aghā́d abhihrútaḥ

translation.text: When through his power and in his strong prevailing flames the Maruts' gladdening boons mingle with Agni's roar, boons gladdening for the active One, Then he accelerates the gift, and by the greatness of his wealth, Shall rescue us from overwhelming misery, from curse and overwhelming woe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वो॒ विहा॑या अर॒तिर्वसु॑र्दधे॒ हस्ते॒ दक्षि॑णे त॒रणि॒र्न शि॑श्रथच्छ्रव॒स्यया॒ न शि॑श्रथत् विश्व॑स्मा॒ इदि॑षुध्य॒ते दे॑व॒त्रा ह॒व्यमोहि॑षे विश्व॑स्मा॒ इत्सु॒कृते॒ वार॑मृण्वत्य॒ग्निर्द्वारा॒ व्यृ॑ण्वति
verses.transliteration: víśvo víhāyā aratír vásur dadhe  háste dákṣiṇe taráṇir ná śiśrathac  -śravasyáyā ná śiśrathat  víśvasmā íd iṣudhyaté  devatrā́ havyám óhiṣe  víśvasmā ít sukŕ̥te vā́ram r̥ṇvati-  agnír dvā́rā vy r̥̀ṇvati

translation.text: Vast, universal, good he was made messenger; the speeder with his right hand hath not loosed his hold, through love of fame not loosed his hold. He bears oblations to the Gods for whosoever supplicates. Agni bestows a blessing on each pious man, and opens wide the doors for him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मानु॑षे वृ॒जने॒ शंत॑मो हि॒तो॒३॒॑ऽग्निर्य॒ज्ञेषु॒ जेन्यो॒ न वि॒श्पतिः॑ प्रि॒यो य॒ज्ञेषु॑ वि॒श्पतिः॑ स ह॒व्या मानु॑षाणामि॒ळा कृ॒तानि॑ पत्यते स न॑स्त्रासते॒ वरु॑णस्य धू॒र्तेर्म॒हो दे॒वस्य॑ धू॒र्तेः
verses.transliteration: sá mā́nuṣe vr̥jáne śáṃtamo hitáḥ-  -agnír yajñéṣu jényo ná viśpátiḥ  priyó yajñéṣu viśpátiḥ  sá havyā́ mā́nuṣāṇām  iḷā́ kr̥tā́ni patyate  sá nas trāsate váruṇasya dhūrtér  mahó devásya dhūrtéḥ

translation.text: That Agni hath been set most kind in camp of men, in sacrifice like a Lord victorious, like a dear Lord in sacred rites. His are the oblations of mankind when offered up at Ili's place. He shall preserve us from Varuṇa's chastisement, yea, from the great God's chastisement.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं होता॑रमीळते॒ वसु॑धितिं प्रि॒यं चेति॑ष्ठमर॒तिं न्ये॑रिरे हव्य॒वाहं॒ न्ये॑रिरे वि॒श्वायुं॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दसं॒ होता॑रं यज॒तं क॒विम् दे॒वासो॑ र॒ण्वमव॑से वसू॒यवो॑ गी॒र्भी र॒ण्वं व॑सू॒यवः॑
verses.transliteration: agníṃ hótāram īḷate vásudhitim  priyáṃ cétiṣṭham aratíṃ ny èrire  havyavā́haṃ ny èrire  viśvā́yuṃ viśvávedasaṃ  hótāraṃ yajatáṃ kavím  devā́so raṇvám ávase vasūyávo  gīrbhī́ raṇváṃ vasūyávaḥ

translation.text: Agni the Priest they supplicate to grant them wealth: him, dear, most thoughtful, have they made their messenger, him, offering-bearer have they made, Beloved of all, who knoweth all, the Priest, the Holy one, the Sage- Him, Friend, for help, the Gods when they are fain for wealth, him, Friend, with hymns, when fain for wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं त्वं रथ॑मिन्द्र मे॒धसा॑तयेऽपा॒का सन्त॑मिषिर प्र॒णय॑सि॒ प्रान॑वद्य॒ नय॑सि स॒द्यश्चि॒त्तम॒भिष्ट॑ये॒ करो॒ वश॑श्च वा॒जिन॑म् सास्माक॑मनवद्य तूतुजान वे॒धसा॑मि॒मां वाचं॒ न वे॒धसा॑म्
verses.transliteration: yáṃ tváṃ rátham indra medhásātaye  -apākā́ sántam iṣira praṇáyasi  prā́navadya náyasi  sadyáś cit tám abhíṣṭaye  káro váśaś ca vājínam  sā́smā́kam anavadya tūtujāna vedhásām  imā́ṃ vā́caṃ ná vedhásām

translation.text: THE car which Indra, thou, for service of the Gods though it be far away, O swift One, bringest near, which, Blameless One, thou bringest near, Place swiftly nigh us for our help: be it thy will that it be strong. Blameless and active, hear this speech of orderers, this speech of us like orderers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स श्रु॑धि॒ यः स्मा॒ पृत॑नासु॒ कासु॑ चिद्द॒क्षाय्य॑ इन्द्र॒ भर॑हूतये॒ नृभि॒रसि॒ प्रतू॑र्तये॒ नृभिः॑ यः शूरैः॒ स्व१॒॑ः सनि॑ता॒ यो विप्रै॒र्वाजं॒ तरु॑ता तमी॑शा॒नास॑ इरधन्त वा॒जिनं॑ पृ॒क्षमत्यं॒ न वा॒जिन॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá śrudhi yáḥ smā pŕ̥tanāsu kā́su cid  dakṣā́yya indra bhárahūtaye nŕ̥bhir  ási prátūrtaye nŕ̥bhiḥ  yáḥ śū́raiḥ svàḥ sánitā  yó víprair vā́jaṃ tárutā  tám īśānā́sa iradhanta vājínam  pr̥kṣám átyaṃ ná vājínam

translation.text: Hear, Indra, thou whom men in every fight must call to show thy strength, for cry of battle with the men, with men of war for victory. He who with heroes wins the light, who with the singers gains the prize, Him the rich seek to gain even as a swift strong steed, even as a courser fleet and strong.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒स्मो हि ष्मा॒ वृष॑णं॒ पिन्व॑सि॒ त्वचं॒ कं चि॑द्यावीर॒ररुं॑ शूर॒ मर्त्यं॑ परिवृ॒णक्षि॒ मर्त्य॑म् इन्द्रो॒त तुभ्यं॒ तद्दि॒वे तद्रु॒द्राय॒ स्वय॑शसे मि॒त्राय॑ वोचं॒ वरु॑णाय स॒प्रथः॑ सुमृळी॒काय॑ स॒प्रथः॑
verses.transliteration: dasmó hí ṣmā vŕ̥ṣaṇam pínvasi tvácaṃ  káṃ cid yāvīr aráruṃ śūra mártyam  parivr̥ṇákṣi mártyam  índrotá túbhyaṃ tád divé  tád rudrā́ya sváyaśase  mitrā́ya vocaṃ váruṇāya sapráthaḥ  sumr̥ḷīkā́ya sapráthaḥ

translation.text: Thou, Mighty, pourest forth the hide that holds the rain, thou keepest far away, Hero, the wicked man, thou shuttest out the wicked man. Indra, to thee I sing, to Dyaus, to Rudra glorious in himself, To Mitra, Varuṇa I sing a far-famed hymn to the kind God a far-famed hymn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माकं॑ व॒ इन्द्र॑मुश्मसी॒ष्टये॒ सखा॑यं वि॒श्वायुं॑ प्रा॒सहं॒ युजं॒ वाजे॑षु प्रा॒सहं॒ युज॑म् अ॒स्माकं॒ ब्रह्मो॒तयेऽवा॑ पृ॒त्सुषु॒ कासु॑ चित् न॒हि त्वा॒ शत्रुः॒ स्तर॑ते स्तृ॒णोषि॒ यं विश्वं॒ शत्रुं॑ स्तृ॒णोषि॒ यम्
verses.transliteration: asmā́kaṃ va índram uśmasīṣṭáye  sákhāyaṃ viśvā́yum prāsáhaṃ yújaṃ  vā́jeṣu prāsáhaṃ yújam  asmā́kam bráhmotáye-  -ávā pr̥tsúṣu kā́su cit  nahí tvā śátru stárate str̥ṇóṣi yáṃ  víśvaṃ śátruṃ str̥ṇóṣi yám

translation.text: We. wish our Indra here that he may further you, the Friend, beloved of all, the very strong ally, in wars the very strong ally In all encounters strengthen thou our prayer to be a help to us. No enemy-whom thou smitest downsubdueth thee, no enemy, whom thou smitest down.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि षू न॒माति॑मतिं॒ कय॑स्य चि॒त्तेजि॑ष्ठाभिर॒रणि॑भि॒र्नोतिभि॑रु॒ग्राभि॑रुग्रो॒तिभिः॑ नेषि॑ णो॒ यथा॑ पु॒राने॒नाः शू॑र॒ मन्य॑से विश्वा॑नि पू॒रोरप॑ पर्षि॒ वह्नि॑रा॒सा वह्नि॑र्नो॒ अच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: ní ṣū́ namā́timatiṃ káyasya cit  téjiṣṭhābhir aráṇibhir nótíbhir  ugrā́bhir ugrotíbhiḥ  néṣi ṇo yáthā purā́-  -anenā́ḥ śūra mányase  víśvāni pūrór ápa parṣi váhnir  āsā́ váhnir no ácha

translation.text: Bow down the overweening pride of every foe with succour like to kindling-wood in fiercest flame, with mighty succour, Mighty One. Guide us, thou Hero, as of old, so art thou counted blameless still. Thou drivest, as a Priest, all sins of man away, as Priest, in person, seeking us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तद्वो॑चेयं॒ भव्या॒येन्द॑वे॒ हव्यो॒ न य इ॒षवा॒न्मन्म॒ रेज॑ति रक्षो॒हा मन्म॒ रेज॑ति स्व॒यं सो अ॒स्मदा नि॒दो व॒धैर॑जेत दुर्म॒तिम् अव॑ स्रवेद॒घशं॑सोऽवत॒रमव॑ क्षु॒द्रमि॑व स्रवेत्
verses.transliteration: prá tád voceyam bhávyāyéndave  hávyo ná yá iṣávān mánma réjati  rakṣohā́ mánma réjati  svayáṃ só asmád ā́ nidó  vadhaír ajeta durmatím  áva sraved agháśaṃso 'vatarám  áva kṣudrám iva sravet

translation.text: This may I utter to the present Soma-drop, which, meet to be invoked, with power, awakes the prayer, awakes the demon-slaying prayer. May he himself with darts of death drive far from us the scorner's hate. Far let him flee away who speaketh wickedness and vanish like a mote of dust.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒नेम॒ तद्धोत्र॑या चि॒तन्त्या॑ व॒नेम॑ र॒यिं र॑यिवः सु॒वीर्यं॑ र॒ण्वं सन्तं॑ सु॒वीर्य॑म् दु॒र्मन्मा॑नं सु॒मन्तु॑भि॒रेमि॒षा पृ॑चीमहि आ स॒त्याभि॒रिन्द्रं॑ द्यु॒म्नहू॑तिभि॒र्यज॑त्रं द्यु॒म्नहू॑तिभिः
verses.transliteration: vanéma tád dhótrayā citántyā  vanéma rayíṃ rayivaḥ suvī́ryaṃ  raṇváṃ sántaṃ suvī́ryam  durmánmānaṃ sumántubhir  ém iṣā́ pr̥cīmahi  ā́ satyā́bhir índraṃ dyumnáhūtibhir  yájatraṃ dyumnáhūtibhiḥ

translation.text: By thoughtful invocation this may we obtain, obtain great wealth, O Wealthy One, with Hero sons, wealth that is sweet with hero sons. Him who is wroth we pacify with sacred food and eulogies, Indra the Holy with our calls inspired and true, the Holy One with calls inspired.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रप्रा॑ वो अ॒स्मे स्वय॑शोभिरू॒ती प॑रिव॒र्ग इन्द्रो॑ दुर्मती॒नां दरी॑मन्दुर्मती॒नाम् स्व॒यं सा रि॑ष॒यध्यै॒ या न॑ उपे॒षे अ॒त्रैः ह॒तेम॑स॒न्न व॑क्षति क्षि॒प्ता जू॒र्णिर्न व॑क्षति
verses.transliteration: prá-prā vo asmé sváyaśobhir ūtī́  parivargá índro durmatīnā́ṃ  dárīman durmatīnā́m  svayáṃ sā́ riṣayádhyai  yā́ na upeṣé atraíḥ  hatém asan ná vakṣati  kṣiptā́ jūrṇír ná vakṣati

translation.text: On, for your good and ours, come Indra with the aid of his own lordliness to drive the wicked hence, to rend the evilhearted ones! The weapon which devouring fiends cast at us shall destroy themselves. Struck down, it shall not reach the mark; hurled forth, the fire-brand shall not strike.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं न॑ इन्द्र रा॒या परी॑णसा या॒हि प॒थाँ अ॑ने॒हसा॑ पु॒रो या॑ह्यर॒क्षसा॑ सच॑स्व नः परा॒क आ सच॑स्वास्तमी॒क आ पा॒हि नो॑ दू॒रादा॒राद॒भिष्टि॑भिः॒ सदा॑ पाह्य॒भिष्टि॑भिः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ na indra rāyā́ párīṇasā  yāhí pathā́m̐ anehásā  puró yāhy arakṣásā  sácasva naḥ parāká~ā́  sácasvāstamīká ā́  pāhí no dūrā́d ārā́d abhíṣṭibhiḥ  sádā pāhy abhíṣṭibhiḥ

translation.text: With riches in abundance, Indra, come to us, come by an unobstructed path, come by a path from demons free. Be with us when we stray afar, be with us when our home is nigh. Protect us with thy help both near and far away: protect us ever with thy help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं न॑ इन्द्र रा॒या तरू॑षसो॒ग्रं चि॑त्त्वा महि॒मा स॑क्ष॒दव॑से म॒हे मि॒त्रं नाव॑से ओजि॑ष्ठ॒ त्रात॒रवि॑ता॒ रथं॒ कं चि॑दमर्त्य अ॒न्यम॒स्मद्रि॑रिषेः॒ कं चि॑दद्रिवो॒ रिरि॑क्षन्तं चिदद्रिवः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ na indra rāyā́ tárūṣasā-  -ugráṃ cit tvā mahimā́ sakṣad ávase  mahé mitráṃ nā́vase  ójiṣṭha trā́tar ávitar-  ráthaṃ káṃ cid amartya  anyám asmád ririṣeḥ káṃ cid adrivo  rírikṣantaṃ cid adrivaḥ

translation.text: Thou art our own, O Indra, with victorious wealth: let might accompany thee, the Strong, to give us aid, like Mitra, to give mighty aid. O strongest saviour, helper thou, Immortal! of each warrior's car. Hurt thou another and not us, O Thunderarmed, one who would hurt, O Thunder-armed!

verses.sanskrit_deva: पा॒हि न॑ इन्द्र सुष्टुत स्रि॒धो॑ऽवया॒ता सद॒मिद्दु॑र्मती॒नां दे॒वः सन्दु॑र्मती॒नाम् ह॒न्ता पा॒पस्य॑ र॒क्षस॑स्त्रा॒ता विप्र॑स्य॒ माव॑तः अधा॒ हि त्वा॑ जनि॒ता जीज॑नद्वसो रक्षो॒हणं॑ त्वा॒ जीज॑नद्वसो
verses.transliteration: pāhí na indra suṣṭuta sridháḥ-  -avayātā́ sádam íd durmatīnā́ṃ  deváḥ sán durmatīnā́m  hantā́ pāpásya rakṣásas  trātā́ víprasya mā́vataḥ  ádhā hí tvā janitā́ jī́janad vaso  rakṣoháṇaṃ tvā jī́janad vaso

translation.text: Save us from injury, thou who art well extolled: ever the warder-off art thou of wicked ones, even as a God, of wicked ones; Thou slayer of the evil fiend, saviour of singer such as I. Good Lord, the Father made thee slayer of the fiends, made thee, good Lord, to slay the fiends.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एन्द्र॑ या॒ह्युप॑ नः परा॒वतो॒ नायमच्छा॑ वि॒दथा॑नीव॒ सत्प॑ति॒रस्तं॒ राजे॑व॒ सत्प॑तिः हवा॑महे त्वा व॒यं प्रय॑स्वन्तः सु॒ते सचा॑ पु॒त्रासो॒ न पि॒तरं॒ वाज॑सातये॒ मंहि॑ष्ठं॒ वाज॑सातये
verses.transliteration: éndra yāhy úpa naḥ parāváto  nā́yám áchā vidáthānīva sátpatir  ástaṃ rā́jeva sátpatiḥ  hávāmahe tvā vayám  práyasvantaḥ suté sácā  putrā́so ná pitáraṃ vā́jasātaye  máṃhiṣṭhaṃ vā́jasātaye

translation.text: Come to us, Indra, from afar, conducting us even as a lord of heroes to the gatherings, home, like a King, his heroes' lord. We come with gifts of pleasant food, with juice poured forth, invoking thee, As sons invite a sire, that thou mayst get thee strength thee, bounteousest, to get thee strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिबा॒ सोम॑मिन्द्र सुवा॒नमद्रि॑भिः॒ कोशे॑न सि॒क्तम॑व॒तं न वंस॑गस्तातृषा॒णो न वंस॑गः मदा॑य हर्य॒ताय॑ ते तु॒विष्ट॑माय॒ धाय॑से आ त्वा॑ यच्छन्तु ह॒रितो॒ न सूर्य॒महा॒ विश्वे॑व॒ सूर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: píbā sómam indra suvānám ádribhiḥ  kóśena siktám avatáṃ ná váṃsagas  tātr̥ṣāṇó ná váṃsagaḥ  mádāya haryatā́ya te  tuvíṣṭamāya dhā́yase  ā́ tvā yachantu haríto ná sū́ryam  áhā víśveva sū́ryam

translation.text: O Indra, drink the Soma juice pressed out with stones. poured from the reservoir, as an ox drinks the spring, a very thirsty bull the spring. For the sweet draught that gladdens thee, for mightiest freshening of thy strength. Let thy Bay Horses bring thee hither as the Sun, as every day they bring the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवि॑न्दद्दि॒वो निहि॑तं॒ गुहा॑ नि॒धिं वेर्न गर्भं॒ परि॑वीत॒मश्म॑न्यन॒न्ते अ॒न्तरश्म॑नि व्र॒जं व॒ज्री गवा॑मिव॒ सिषा॑स॒न्नङ्गि॑रस्तमः अपा॑वृणो॒दिष॒ इन्द्रः॒ परी॑वृता॒ द्वार॒ इषः॒ परी॑वृताः
verses.transliteration: ávindad divó níhitaṃ gúhā nidhíṃ  vér ná gárbham párivītam áśmani-  ananté antár áśmani  vrajáṃ vajrī́ gávām iva  síṣāsann áṅgirastamaḥ  ápāvr̥ṇod íṣa índraḥ párīvr̥tāḥ-  dvā́ra íṣaḥ párīvr̥tāḥ

translation.text: He found the treasure brought from heaven that lay concealed, close-hidden, like the nestling of a bird, in rock, enclosed in never-enffing rock. Best Angiras, bolt-armed, he strove to win, as 'twere, the stall of kine; So Indra hath disclosed the food concealed, disclosed the doors, the food that lay concealed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दा॒दृ॒हा॒णो वज्र॒मिन्द्रो॒ गभ॑स्त्योः॒ क्षद्मे॑व ति॒ग्ममस॑नाय॒ सं श्य॑दहि॒हत्या॑य॒ सं श्य॑त् सं॒वि॒व्या॒न ओज॑सा॒ शवो॑भिरिन्द्र म॒ज्मना॑ तष्टे॑व वृ॒क्षं व॒निनो॒ नि वृ॑श्चसि पर॒श्वेव॒ नि वृ॑श्चसि
verses.transliteration: dādr̥hāṇó vájram índro gábhastyoḥ  kṣádmeva tigmám ásanāya sáṃ śyad  ahihátyāya sáṃ śyat  saṃvivyāná ójasā  śávobhir indra majmánā  táṣṭeva vr̥kṣáṃ vaníno ní vr̥ścasi  paraśvéva ní vr̥ścasi

translation.text: Grasping his thunderbolt with both hands, Indra made its edge most keen, for hurling, like a carving-knife for Ahi's slaughter made it keen. Endued with majesty and strength, O Indra, and with lordly might, Thou crashest down the trees, as when a craftsman fells, crashest them down as with an axe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं वृथा॑ न॒द्य॑ इन्द्र॒ सर्त॒वेऽच्छा॑ समु॒द्रम॑सृजो॒ रथाँ॑ इव वाजय॒तो रथाँ॑ इव इ॒त ऊ॒तीर॑युञ्जत समा॒नमर्थ॒मक्षि॑तम् धे॒नूरि॑व॒ मन॑वे वि॒श्वदो॑हसो॒ जना॑य वि॒श्वदो॑हसः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ vŕ̥thā nadyà indra sártave-  -áchā samudrám asr̥jo ráthām̐ iva  vājayató ráthām̐ iva  itá ūtī́r ayuñjata  samānám ártham ákṣitam  dhenū́r iva mánave viśvádohaso  jánāya viśvádohasaḥ

translation.text: Thou, Indra, without effort hast let loose the floods to run their free course down, like chariots, to the sea, like chariots showing forth their strength. They, reaching hence away, have joined their strength for one eternal end, Even as the cows who poured forth every thing for man, Yea, poured forth all thing- for mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां ते॒ वाचं॑ वसू॒यन्त॑ आ॒यवो॒ रथं॒ न धीरः॒ स्वपा॑ अतक्षिषुः सु॒म्नाय॒ त्वाम॑तक्षिषुः शु॒म्भन्तो॒ जेन्यं॑ यथा॒ वाजे॑षु विप्र वा॒जिन॑म् अत्य॑मिव॒ शव॑से सा॒तये॒ धना॒ विश्वा॒ धना॑नि सा॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: imā́ṃ te vā́caṃ vasūyánta āyávo  ráthaṃ ná dhī́raḥ svápā atakṣiṣuḥ  sumnā́ya tvā́m atakṣiṣuḥ  śumbhánto jényaṃ yathā  vā́jeṣu vipra vājínam  átyam iva śávase sātáye dhánā  víśvā dhánāni sātáye

translation.text: Eager for riches, men have formed for thee this song, like as a skilful craftsman fashioneth a car, so have they wrought thee to their bliss; Adorning thee, O Singer, like a generous steed for deeds of might, Yea, like a steed to show his strength and win the prize, that he may bear each prize away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भि॒नत्पुरो॑ नव॒तिमि॑न्द्र पू॒रवे॒ दिवो॑दासाय॒ महि॑ दा॒शुषे॑ नृतो॒ वज्रे॑ण दा॒शुषे॑ नृतो अ॒ति॒थि॒ग्वाय॒ शम्ब॑रं गि॒रेरु॒ग्रो अवा॑भरत् म॒हो धना॑नि॒ दय॑मान॒ ओज॑सा॒ विश्वा॒ धना॒न्योज॑सा
verses.transliteration: bhinát púro navatím indra pūráve  dívodāsāya máhi dāśúṣe nr̥to  vájreṇa dāśúṣe nr̥to  atithigvā́ya śámbaraṃ  girér ugró ávābharat  mahó dhánāni dáyamāna ójasā  víśvā dhánāny ójasā

translation.text: For Pûru thou hast shattered, Indra ninety forts, for Divodâsa thy boon servant with thy bolt, O Dancer, for thy worshipper. For Âtithigva he, the Strong, brought Ṣambara. from the mountain down, Distributing the mighty treasures with his strength, parting all treasures with his strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॑ स॒मत्सु॒ यज॑मान॒मार्यं॒ प्राव॒द्विश्वे॑षु श॒तमू॑तिरा॒जिषु॒ स्व॑र्मीळ्हेष्वा॒जिषु॑ मन॑वे॒ शास॑दव्र॒तान्त्वचं॑ कृ॒ष्णाम॑रन्धयत् दक्ष॒न्न विश्वं॑ ततृषा॒णमो॑षति॒ न्य॑र्शसा॒नमो॑षति
verses.transliteration: índraḥ samátsu yájamānam ā́ryam  prā́vad víśveṣu śatámūtir ājíṣu  svàrmīḷheṣv ājíṣu  mánave śā́sad avratā́n  tvácaṃ kr̥ṣṇā́m arandhayat  dákṣan ná víśvaṃ tatr̥ṣāṇám oṣati  ny àrśasānám oṣati

translation.text: Indra in battles help his Aryan worshipper, he who hath hundred helps at hand in every fray, in frays that win the light of heaven. Plaguing the lawless he gave up to Manu's seed the dusky skin; Blazing, 'twere, he burns each covetous man away, he burns, the tyrannous away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सूर॑श्च॒क्रं प्र वृ॑हज्जा॒त ओज॑सा प्रपि॒त्वे वाच॑मरु॒णो मु॑षायतीशा॒न आ मु॑षायति उ॒शना॒ यत्प॑रा॒वतोऽज॑गन्नू॒तये॑ कवे सु॒म्नानि॒ विश्वा॒ मनु॑षेव तु॒र्वणि॒रहा॒ विश्वे॑व तु॒र्वणिः॑
verses.transliteration: sū́raś cakrám prá vr̥haj jātá ójasā  prapitvé vā́cam aruṇó muṣāyati-  -īśāná ā́ muṣāyati  uśánā yát parāvátaḥ-  -ájagann ūtáye kave  sumnā́ni víśvā mánuṣeva turváṇir  áhā víśveva turváṇiḥ

translation.text: Waxed strong in might at dawn he tore the Sun's wheel off. Bright red, he steals away their speech, the Lord of Power, their speech he steals away from them, As thou with eager speed, O Sage, hast come from far away to hel As winning for thine own all happiness of men, winning all happiness each day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॒ नव्ये॑भिर्वृषकर्मन्नु॒क्थैः पुरां॑ दर्तः पा॒युभिः॑ पाहि श॒ग्मैः दि॒वो॒दा॒सेभि॑रिन्द्र॒ स्तवा॑नो वावृधी॒था अहो॑भिरिव॒ द्यौः
verses.transliteration: sá no návyebhir vr̥ṣakarmann ukthaíḥ  púrāṃ dartaḥ pāyúbhiḥ pāhi śagmaíḥ  divodāsébhir indra stávāno  vāvr̥dhīthā́ áhobhir iva dyaúḥ

translation.text: Lauded with our new hymns, O vigorous in deed, save us with strengthening help, thou Shatterer of the Forts! Thou, Indra, praised by Divodâsa's clansmen, as heaven grows great with days, shalt wax in glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑य॒ हि द्यौरसु॑रो॒ अन॑म्न॒तेन्द्रा॑य म॒ही पृ॑थि॒वी वरी॑मभिर्द्यु॒म्नसा॑ता॒ वरी॑मभिः इन्द्रं॒ विश्वे॑ स॒जोष॑सो दे॒वासो॑ दधिरे पु॒रः इन्द्रा॑य॒ विश्वा॒ सव॑नानि॒ मानु॑षा रा॒तानि॑ सन्तु॒ मानु॑षा
verses.transliteration: índrāya hí dyaúr ásuro ánamnata-  -índrāya mahī́ pr̥thivī́ várīmabhir  dyumnásātā várīmabhiḥ  índraṃ víśve sajóṣaso  devā́so dadhire puráḥ  índrāya víśvā sávanāni mā́nuṣā  rātā́ni santu mā́nuṣā

translation.text: To Indra Dyaus the Asura hath bowed him down, to Indra mighty Earth with wide-extending tracts, to win the light, with wide-spread tracts. All Gods of one accord have set Indra in front preeminent. For Indra all libations must be set apart, all man's libations set apart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑षु॒ हि त्वा॒ सव॑नेषु तु॒ञ्जते॑ समा॒नमेकं॒ वृष॑मण्यवः॒ पृथ॒क्स्वः॑ सनि॒ष्यवः॒ पृथ॑क् तं त्वा॒ नावं॒ न प॒र्षणिं॑ शू॒षस्य॑ धु॒रि धी॑महि इन्द्रं॒ न य॒ज्ञैश्चि॒तय॑न्त आ॒यवः॒ स्तोमे॑भि॒रिन्द्र॑मा॒यवः॑
verses.transliteration: víśveṣu hí tvā sávaneṣu tuñjáte  samānám ékaṃ vŕ̥ṣamaṇyavaḥ pŕ̥thak  svàḥ saniṣyávaḥ pŕ̥thak  táṃ tvā nā́vaṃ ná parṣáṇiṃ  śūṣásya dhurí dhīmahi  índraṃ ná yajñaíś citáyanta āyávaḥ-  stómebhir índram āyávaḥ

translation.text: In all libations men with hero spirit urge the Universal One, each seeking several light, each fain to win the light apart. Thee, furthering like a ship, will we set to the chariot-pole of strength, As men who win with sacrifices Indra's thought, men who win Indra with their lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि त्वा॑ ततस्रे मिथु॒ना अ॑व॒स्यवो॑ व्र॒जस्य॑ सा॒ता गव्य॑स्य निः॒सृजः॒ सक्ष॑न्त इन्द्र निः॒सृजः॑ यद्ग॒व्यन्ता॒ द्वा जना॒ स्व१॒॑र्यन्ता॑ स॒मूह॑सि आ॒विष्करि॑क्र॒द्वृष॑णं सचा॒भुवं॒ वज्र॑मिन्द्र सचा॒भुव॑म्
verses.transliteration: ví tvā tatasre mithunā́ avasyávo  vrajásya sātā́ gávyasya niḥsŕ̥jaḥ  sákṣanta indra niḥsŕ̥jaḥ  yád gavyántā dvā́ jánā  svàr yántā samū́hasi  āvíṣ kárikrad vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ sacābhúvaṃ  vájram indra sacābhúvam

translation.text: Couples desirous of thine aid are storming thee, pouring their presents forth to win a stall of kine, pouring gifts, Indra, seeking thee. When two men seeking spoil or heaven thou bringest face to face in war, Thou showest, Indra, -then the bolt thy constant friend, the Bull that ever waits on thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒दुष्टे॑ अ॒स्य वी॒र्य॑स्य पू॒रवः॒ पुरो॒ यदि॑न्द्र॒ शार॑दीर॒वाति॑रः सासहा॒नो अ॒वाति॑रः शास॒स्तमि॑न्द्र॒ मर्त्य॒मय॑ज्युं शवसस्पते म॒हीम॑मुष्णाः पृथि॒वीमि॒मा अ॒पो म॑न्दसा॒न इ॒मा अ॒पः
verses.transliteration: vidúṣ ṭe asyá vīryàsya pūrávaḥ  púro yád indra śā́radīr avā́tiraḥ  sāsahānó avā́tiraḥ  śā́sas tám indra mártyam  áyajyuṃ śavasas pate  mahī́m amuṣṇāḥ pr̥thivī́m imā́ apó  mandasāná imā́ apáḥ

translation.text: This thine heroic power men of old time have known, wherewith thou breakest down, Indra, autumnal forts, breakest them down with conquering might. Thou hast chastised, O Indra, Lord of Strength, the man who worships not, And made thine own this great earth and these water-floods; with joyous heart these waterfloods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदित्ते॑ अ॒स्य वी॒र्य॑स्य चर्किर॒न्मदे॑षु वृषन्नु॒शिजो॒ यदावि॑थ सखीय॒तो यदावि॑थ च॒कर्थ॑ का॒रमे॑भ्यः॒ पृत॑नासु॒ प्रव॑न्तवे ते अ॒न्याम॑न्यां न॒द्यं॑ सनिष्णत श्रव॒स्यन्तः॑ सनिष्णत
