verses.transliteration: ā́d ít te asyá vīryàsya carkiran  mádeṣu vr̥ṣann uśíjo yád ā́vitha  sakhīyató yád ā́vitha  cakártha kārám ebhyaḥ  pŕ̥tanāsu právantave  té anyā́m-anyāṃ nadyàṃ saniṣṇata  śravasyántaḥ saniṣṇata

translation.text: And they have bruited far this hero-might when thou, O Strong One, in thy joy helpest thy suppliants, who sought to win thee for their Friend. Their battle-cry thou madest sound victorious in the shocks of war. One stream after another have they gained from thee, eager for glory have they gained.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒तो नो॑ अ॒स्या उ॒षसो॑ जु॒षेत॒ ह्य१॒॑र्कस्य॑ बोधि ह॒विषो॒ हवी॑मभिः॒ स्व॑र्षाता॒ हवी॑मभिः यदि॑न्द्र॒ हन्त॑वे॒ मृधो॒ वृषा॑ वज्रि॒ञ्चिके॑तसि आ मे॑ अ॒स्य वे॒धसो॒ नवी॑यसो॒ मन्म॑ श्रुधि॒ नवी॑यसः
verses.transliteration: utó no asyā́ uṣáso juṣéta hí-  -arkásya bodhi havíṣo hávīmabhiḥ  svàrṣātā hávīmabhiḥ  yád indra hántave mŕ̥dho  vŕ̥ṣā vajriñ cíketasi  ā́ me asyá vedháso návīyaso  mánma śrudhi návīyasaḥ

translation.text: Also this morn may he be well inclined to us, mark at our call our offerings and our song of praise, our call that we may win the light. As thou, O Indra Thunder-armed, wilt, as the Strong One, slay the foe, Listen thou to the prayer of me a later sage, hear thou a later sage's prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं तमि॑न्द्र वावृधा॒नो अ॑स्म॒युर॑मित्र॒यन्तं॑ तुविजात॒ मर्त्यं॒ वज्रे॑ण शूर॒ मर्त्य॑म् ज॒हि यो नो॑ अघा॒यति॑ शृणु॒ष्व सु॒श्रव॑स्तमः रि॒ष्टं न याम॒न्नप॑ भूतु दुर्म॒तिर्विश्वाप॑ भूतु दुर्म॒तिः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tám indra vāvr̥dhānó asmayúr  amitrayántaṃ tuvijāta mártyaṃ  vájreṇa śūra mártyam  jahí yó no aghāyáti  śr̥ṇuṣvá suśrávastamaḥ  riṣṭáṃ ná yā́mann ápa bhūtu durmatír  víśvā́pa bhūtu durmatíḥ

translation.text: O Indra, waxen strong and well-inclined to us, thou very mighty, slay the man that is our foe, slay the man, Hero! with thy bolt. Slay thou the man who injures us: hear thou, as readiest, to hear. Far be malignity, like mischief on the march, afar be all malignity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॑ व॒यं म॑घव॒न्पूर्व्ये॒ धन॒ इन्द्र॑त्वोताः सासह्याम पृतन्य॒तो व॑नु॒याम॑ वनुष्य॒तः नेदि॑ष्ठे अ॒स्मिन्नह॒न्यधि॑ वोचा॒ नु सु॑न्व॒ते अ॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे वि च॑येमा॒ भरे॑ कृ॒तं वा॑ज॒यन्तो॒ भरे॑ कृ॒तम्
verses.transliteration: tváyā vayám maghavan pū́rvye dháne-  índratvotāḥ sāsahyāma pr̥tanyató  vanuyā́ma vanuṣyatáḥ  nédiṣṭhe asmínn áhani-  ádhi vocā nú sunvaté  asmín yajñé ví cayemā bháre kr̥táṃ  vājayánto bháre kr̥tám

translation.text: HELPED, Indra Maghavan, by thee in war of old, may we subdue in fight the men who strive with us, conquer the men who war with us. This day that now is close at hand bless him who pours the Soma juice. In this our sacrifice may we divide the spoil, showing our strength, the spoil of war.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒र्जे॒षे भर॑ आ॒प्रस्य॒ वक्म॑न्युष॒र्बुधः॒ स्वस्मि॒न्नञ्ज॑सि क्रा॒णस्य॒ स्वस्मि॒न्नञ्ज॑सि अह॒न्निन्द्रो॒ यथा॑ वि॒दे शी॒र्ष्णाशी॑र्ष्णोप॒वाच्यः॑ अ॒स्म॒त्रा ते॑ स॒ध्र्य॑क्सन्तु रा॒तयो॑ भ॒द्रा भ॒द्रस्य॑ रा॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: svarjeṣé bhára āprásya vákmani-  uṣarbúdhaḥ svásminn áñjasi  krāṇásya svásminn áñjasi  áhann índro yáthā vidé  śīrṣṇā́-śīrṣṇopavā́cyaḥ  asmatrā́ te sadhryàk santu rātáyo  bhadrā́ bhadrásya rātáyaḥ

translation.text: In war which wins the light, at the freegiver's call, at due oblation of the early-rising one, oblation of the active one, Indra slew, even as we know-whom each bowed head must reverence. May all thy bounteous gifts be gathered up for us, yea, the good gifts of thee the Good.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्तु प्रयः॑ प्र॒त्नथा॑ ते शुशुक्व॒नं यस्मि॑न्य॒ज्ञे वार॒मकृ॑ण्वत॒ क्षय॑मृ॒तस्य॒ वार॑सि॒ क्षय॑म् वि तद्वो॑चे॒रध॑ द्वि॒तान्तः प॑श्यन्ति र॒श्मिभिः॑ स घा॑ विदे॒ अन्विन्द्रो॑ ग॒वेष॑णो बन्धु॒क्षिद्भ्यो॑ ग॒वेष॑णः
verses.transliteration: tát tú práyaḥ pratnáthā te śuśukvanáṃ  yásmin yajñé vā́ram ákr̥ṇvata kṣáyam  r̥tásya vā́r asi kṣáyam  ví tád vocer ádha dvitā́-  -antáḥ paśyanti raśmíbhiḥ  sá ghā vide ánv índro gavéṣaṇo  bandhukṣídbhyo gavéṣaṇaḥ

translation.text: This food glows for thee as of old at sacrifice, wherein they made thee chooser of the place , for thou choosest the place of sacrifice. Speak thou and make it known to us they see within with beams of light. Indra, indeed, is found a seeker after spoil, spoil-seeker for his own allies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू इ॒त्था ते॑ पू॒र्वथा॑ च प्र॒वाच्यं॒ यदङ्गि॑रो॒भ्योऽवृ॑णो॒रप॑ व्र॒जमिन्द्र॒ शिक्ष॒न्नप॑ व्र॒जम् ऐभ्यः॑ समा॒न्या दि॒शास्मभ्यं॑ जेषि॒ योत्सि॑ च सु॒न्वद्भ्यो॑ रन्धया॒ कं चि॑दव्र॒तं हृ॑णा॒यन्तं॑ चिदव्र॒तम्
verses.transliteration: nū́ itthā́ te pūrváthā ca pravā́cyaṃ  yád áṅgirobhyó 'vr̥ṇor ápa vrajám  índra śíkṣann ápa vrajám  aíbhyaḥ samānyā́ diśā́-  -asmábhyaṃ jeṣi yótsi ca  sunvádbhyo randhayā káṃ cid avratáṃ  hr̥ṇāyántaṃ cid avratám

translation.text: So now must thy great deed be lauded as of old, when for the Angirases thou openedst the stall, openedst, giving aid, the stall. In the same manner for us here fight thou and be victorious: To him who pours the juice give up the lawless man, the lawless who is wroth with us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं यज्जना॒न्क्रतु॑भिः॒ शूर॑ ई॒क्षय॒द्धने॑ हि॒ते त॑रुषन्त श्रव॒स्यवः॒ प्र य॑क्षन्त श्रव॒स्यवः॑ तस्मा॒ आयुः॑ प्र॒जाव॒दिद्बाधे॑ अर्च॒न्त्योज॑सा इन्द्र॑ ओ॒क्यं॑ दिधिषन्त धी॒तयो॑ दे॒वाँ अच्छा॒ न धी॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: sáṃ yáj jánān krátubhiḥ śū́ra īkṣáyad  dháne hité taruṣanta śravasyávaḥ  prá yakṣanta śravasyávaḥ  tásmā ā́yuḥ prajā́vad íd  bā́dhe arcanty ójasā  índra okyàṃ didhiṣanta dhītáyo  devā́m̐ áchā ná dhītáyaḥ

translation.text: When with wise plan the Hero leads the people forth, they conquer in the ordered battle, seeking fame, press, eager, onward seeking fame. To him in time of need they sing for life with offspring and with strength. Their hymns with Indra find a welcome place of rest: the hynins go forward to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं तमि॑न्द्रापर्वता पुरो॒युधा॒ यो नः॑ पृत॒न्यादप॒ तंत॒मिद्ध॑तं॒ वज्रे॑ण॒ तंत॒मिद्ध॑तम् दू॒रे च॒त्ताय॑ च्छन्त्स॒द्गह॑नं॒ यदिन॑क्षत् अ॒स्माकं॒ शत्रू॒न्परि॑ शूर वि॒श्वतो॑ द॒र्मा द॑र्षीष्ट वि॒श्वतः॑
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ tám indrāparvatā puroyúdhā  yó naḥ pr̥tanyā́d ápa táṃ-tam íd dhataṃ  vájreṇa táṃ-tam íd dhatam  dūré cattā́ya chantsad  gáhanaṃ yád ínakṣat  asmā́kaṃ śátrūn pári śūra viśváto  darmā́ darṣīṣṭa viśvátaḥ

translation.text: Indra and Parvata, our champions in the fight, drive ye away each man who fain would war with us, drive him far from us with the bolt. Welcome to him concealed afar shall he the lair that he hath found. So may the Render rend our foes on every side, rend them, O Hero, everywhere.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भे पु॑नामि॒ रोद॑सी ऋ॒तेन॒ द्रुहो॑ दहामि॒ सं म॒हीर॑नि॒न्द्राः अ॒भि॒व्लग्य॒ यत्र॑ ह॒ता अ॒मित्रा॑ वैलस्था॒नं परि॑ तृ॒ळ्हा अशे॑रन्
verses.transliteration: ubhé punāmi ródasī r̥téna  drúho dahāmi sám mahī́r anindrā́ḥ  abhivlágya yátra hatā́ amítrāḥ-  vailasthānám pári tr̥ḷhā́ áśeran

translation.text: WITH sacrifice I purge both earth and heaven: I burn up great she-fiends who serve not Indra, Where throttled by thy hand the foes were slaughtered, and in the pit of death lay pierced and mangled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि॒व्लग्या॑ चिदद्रिवः शी॒र्षा या॑तु॒मती॑नाम् छि॒न्धि व॑टू॒रिणा॑ प॒दा म॒हाव॑टूरिणा प॒दा
verses.transliteration: abhivlágyā cid adrivaḥ  śīrṣā́ yātumátīnām  chindhí vaṭūríṇā padā́  mahā́vaṭūriṇā padā́

translation.text: O thou who castest forth the stones crushing the sorceresses' heads, Break them with thy wide-spreading foot, with thy wide-spreading mighty foot.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवा॑सां मघवञ्जहि॒ शर्धो॑ यातु॒मती॑नाम् वै॒ल॒स्था॒न॒के अ॑र्म॒के म॒हावै॑लस्थे अर्म॒के
verses.transliteration: ávāsām maghavañ jahi  śárdho yātumátīnām  vailasthānaké armaké  mahā́vailasthe armaké

translation.text: Do thou, O Maghavan, beat off these sorceresses' daring strength. Cast them within the narrow pit. within the deep and narrow pit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यासां॑ ति॒स्रः प॑ञ्चा॒शतो॑ऽभिव्ल॒ङ्गैर॒पाव॑पः तत्सु ते॑ मनायति त॒कत्सु ते॑ मनायति
verses.transliteration: yā́sāṃ tisráḥ pañcāśáto  -abhivlaṅgaír apā́vapaḥ  tát sú te manāyati  takát sú te manāyati

translation.text: Of whom thou hast ere now destroyed thrice-fifty with thy fierce attacks. That deed they count a glorious deed, though small to thee, a glorious deed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒शङ्ग॑भृष्टिमम्भृ॒णं पि॒शाचि॑मिन्द्र॒ सं मृ॑ण सर्वं॒ रक्षो॒ नि ब॑र्हय
verses.transliteration: piśáṅgabhr̥ṣṭim ambhr̥ṇám  piśā́cim indra sám mr̥ṇa  sárvaṃ rákṣo ní barhaya

translation.text: O Indra, crush and bray to bits the fearful fiery-weaponed fiend: Strike every demon to the ground.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वर्म॒ह इ॑न्द्र दादृ॒हि श्रु॒धी नः॑ शु॒शोच॒ हि द्यौः क्षा न भी॒षाँ अ॑द्रिवो घृ॒णान्न भी॒षाँ अ॑द्रिवः शु॒ष्मिन्त॑मो॒ हि शु॒ष्मिभि॑र्व॒धैरु॒ग्रेभि॒रीय॑से अपू॑रुषघ्नो अप्रतीत शूर॒ सत्व॑भिस्त्रिस॒प्तैः शू॑र॒ सत्व॑भिः
verses.transliteration: avár mahá indra dādr̥hí śrudhī́ naḥ  śuśóca hí dyaúḥ kṣā́ ná bhīṣā́m̐ adrivo  ghr̥ṇā́n ná bhīṣā́m̐ adrivaḥ  śuṣmíntamo hí śuṣmíbhir  vadhaír ugrébhir ī́yase  ápūruṣaghno apratīta śūra sátvabhis  trisaptaíḥ śūra sátvabhiḥ

translation.text: Tear down the mighty ones. O Indra, hear thou us. For heaven hath glowed like earth in fear, O nunder-armed, as dreading fierce heat, Thunder-armed! Most Mighty mid the Mighty Ones thou speedest with strong bolts of death, Not slaying men, unconquered Hero with the brave, O Hero, with the thrice-seven brave.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒नोति॒ हि सु॒न्वन्क्षयं॒ परी॑णसः सुन्वा॒नो हि ष्मा॒ यज॒त्यव॒ द्विषो॑ दे॒वाना॒मव॒ द्विषः॑ सु॒न्वा॒न इत्सि॑षासति स॒हस्रा॑ वा॒ज्यवृ॑तः सु॒न्वा॒नायेन्द्रो॑ ददात्या॒भुवं॑ र॒यिं द॑दात्या॒भुव॑म्
verses.transliteration: vanóti hí sunván kṣáyam párīṇasaḥ  sunvānó hí ṣmā yájaty áva dvíṣo  devā́nām áva dvíṣaḥ  sunvāná ít siṣāsati  sahásrā vājy ávr̥taḥ  sunvānā́yéndro dadāty ābhúvaṃ  rayíṃ dadāty ābhúvam

translation.text: The pourer of libations gains the home of wealth, pouring his gift conciliates hostilities, yea, the hostilities of Gods. Pouring, he strives, unchecked and strong, to win him riches thousandfold. Indra gives lasting wealth to him who pours forth gifts, yea, wealth he gives that long shall last.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॒ जुवो॑ रारहा॒णा अ॒भि प्रयो॒ वायो॒ वह॑न्त्वि॒ह पू॒र्वपी॑तये॒ सोम॑स्य पू॒र्वपी॑तये ऊ॒र्ध्वा ते॒ अनु॑ सू॒नृता॒ मन॑स्तिष्ठतु जान॒ती नि॒युत्व॑ता॒ रथे॒ना या॑हि दा॒वने॒ वायो॑ म॒खस्य॑ दा॒वने॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvā júvo rārahāṇā́ abhí práyo  vā́yo váhantv ihá pūrvápītaye  sómasya pūrvápītaye  ūrdhvā́ te ánu sūnŕ̥tā  mánas tiṣṭhatu jānatī́  niyútvatā ráthenā́ yāhi dāváne  vā́yo makhásya dāváne

translation.text: Vâyu, let fleet-foot coursers bring thee speedily to this our feast, to drink first of the juice we pour, to the first draught of Soma juice. May our glad hymn, discerning well, uplifted, gratify thy mind. Come with thy team-drawn car, O Vâyu, to the gift, come to the sacrificer's gift.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मन्द॑न्तु त्वा म॒न्दिनो॑ वाय॒विन्द॑वो॒ऽस्मत्क्रा॒णासः॒ सुकृ॑ता अ॒भिद्य॑वो॒ गोभिः॑ क्रा॒णा अ॒भिद्य॑वः यद्ध॑ क्रा॒णा इ॒रध्यै॒ दक्षं॒ सच॑न्त ऊ॒तयः॑ स॒ध्री॒ची॒ना नि॒युतो॑ दा॒वने॒ धिय॒ उप॑ ब्रुवत ईं॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: mándantu tvā mandíno vāyav índavo  -asmát krāṇā́saḥ súkr̥tā abhídyavo  góbhiḥ krāṇā́ abhídyavaḥ  yád dha krāṇā́ irádhyai  dákṣaṃ sácanta ūtáyaḥ  sadhrīcīnā́ niyúto dāváne dhíyaḥ-  úpa bruvata īṃ dhíyaḥ

translation.text: May the joy-giving drops, O Vâyu gladden thee, effectual, well prepared, directed to the heavens, strong, blent with milk and seeking heaven; That aids, effectual to fulfil, may wait upon our skilful power. Associate teams come hitherward to grant our prayers . they shall address the hymns we sing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒युर्यु॑ङ्क्ते॒ रोहि॑ता वा॒युर॑रु॒णा वा॒यू रथे॑ अजि॒रा धु॒रि वोळ्ह॑वे॒ वहि॑ष्ठा धु॒रि वोळ्ह॑वे प्र बो॑धया॒ पुरं॑धिं जा॒र आ स॑स॒तीमि॑व प्र च॑क्षय॒ रोद॑सी वासयो॒षसः॒ श्रव॑से वासयो॒षसः॑
verses.transliteration: vāyúr yuṅkte róhitā vāyúr aruṇā́  vāyū́ ráthe ajirā́ dhurí vóḷhave  váhiṣṭhā dhurí vóḷhave  prá bodhayā púraṃdhiṃ  jārá ā́ sasatī́m iva  prá cakṣaya ródasī vāsayoṣásaḥ  śrávase vāsayoṣásaḥ

translation.text: Two red steeds Vâyu yokes, Vâyu two purple steeds, swift-footed, to the chariot, to the pole to draw, most able, at the pole, to draw. Wake up intelligence, as when a lover wakes his sleeping love. Illumine heaven and earth, make thou the Dawns to shine, for glory make the Dawns to shine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्य॑मु॒षासः॒ शुच॑यः परा॒वति॑ भ॒द्रा वस्त्रा॑ तन्वते॒ दंसु॑ र॒श्मिषु॑ चि॒त्रा नव्ये॑षु र॒श्मिषु॑ तुभ्यं॑ धे॒नुः स॑ब॒र्दुघा॒ विश्वा॒ वसू॑नि दोहते अज॑नयो म॒रुतो॑ व॒क्षणा॑भ्यो दि॒व आ व॒क्षणा॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: túbhyam uṣā́saḥ śúcayaḥ parāváti  bhadrā́ vástrā tanvate dáṃsu raśmíṣu  citrā́ návyeṣu raśmíṣu  túbhyaṃ dhenúḥ sabardúghā  víśvā vásūni dohate  ájanayo marúto vakṣáṇābhyo  divá ā́ vakṣáṇābhyaḥ

translation.text: For thee the radiant Dawns in the fardistant sky broaden their lovely gannents forth in wondrous beams, bright-coloured in their new-born beams. For thee the nectar-yielding Cow pours all rich treasures forth as milk. The Marut host hast thou engendered from the womb, the Maruts from the womb of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्यं॑ शु॒क्रासः॒ शुच॑यस्तुर॒ण्यवो॒ मदे॑षू॒ग्रा इ॑षणन्त भु॒र्वण्य॒पामि॑षन्त भु॒र्वणि॑ त्वां त्सा॒री दस॑मानो॒ भग॑मीट्टे तक्व॒वीये॑ त्वं विश्व॑स्मा॒द्भुव॑नात्पासि॒ धर्म॑णासु॒र्या॑त्पासि॒ धर्म॑णा
verses.transliteration: túbhyaṃ śukrā́saḥ śúcayas turaṇyávo  mádeṣūgrā́ iṣaṇanta bhurváṇi-  apā́m iṣanta bhurváṇi  tvā́ṃ tsārī́ dásamāno  bhágam īṭṭe takvavī́ye  tváṃ víśvasmād bhúvanāt pāsi dhármaṇā-  -asuryā̀t pāsi dhármaṇā

translation.text: For thee the pure bright quickly-flowing Soma-drops, strong in their heightening power, hasten to mixthemselves, hasten to the water to be mixed. To thee the weary coward prays for luck that he may speed away. Thou by thy law protectest us from every world, yea, from the world of highest Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ वायवेषा॒मपू॑र्व्यः॒ सोमा॑नां प्रथ॒मः पी॒तिम॑र्हसि सु॒तानां॑ पी॒तिम॑र्हसि उ॒तो वि॒हुत्म॑तीनां वि॒शां व॑व॒र्जुषी॑णाम् विश्वा॒ इत्ते॑ धे॒नवो॑ दुह्र आ॒शिरं॑ घृ॒तं दु॑ह्रत आ॒शिर॑म्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no vāyav eṣām ápūrvyaḥ  sómānām prathamáḥ pītím arhasi  sutā́nām pītím arhasi  utó vihútmatīnāṃ  viśā́ṃ vavarjúṣīṇām  víśvā ít te dhenávo duhra āśíraṃ  ghr̥táṃ duhrata āśíram

translation.text: Thou, Vâyu, who hast none before thee, first of all hast right to drink these offerings of Soma juice, hast right to drink the juice out-poured, Yea, poured by all invoking tribes who free themselves from taint of sin, For thee all cows are milked to yield the Soma-milk, to yield the butter and the milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्ती॒र्णं ब॒र्हिरुप॑ नो याहि वी॒तये॑ स॒हस्रे॑ण नि॒युता॑ नियुत्वते श॒तिनी॑भिर्नियुत्वते तुभ्यं॒ हि पू॒र्वपी॑तये दे॒वा दे॒वाय॑ येमि॒रे प्र ते॑ सु॒तासो॒ मधु॑मन्तो अस्थिर॒न्मदा॑य॒ क्रत्वे॑ अस्थिरन्
verses.transliteration: stīrṇám barhír úpa no yāhi vītáye  sahásreṇa niyútā niyutvate  śatínībhir niyutvate  túbhyaṃ hí pūrvápītaye  devā́ devā́ya yemiré  prá te sutā́so mádhumanto asthiran  mádāya krátve asthiran

translation.text: STREWN is the sacred grass; come Vâyu, to our feast, with team of thousands, come, Lord of the harnessed team, with hundreds, Lord of harnessed steeds! The drops divine are lifted up for thee, the God, to drink them first. The juices rich in sweets have raised them for thy joy, have raised themselves to give thee strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्या॒यं सोमः॒ परि॑पूतो॒ अद्रि॑भिः स्पा॒र्हा वसा॑नः॒ परि॒ कोश॑मर्षति शु॒क्रा वसा॑नो अर्षति तवा॒यं भा॒ग आ॒युषु॒ सोमो॑ दे॒वेषु॑ हूयते वह॑ वायो नि॒युतो॑ याह्यस्म॒युर्जु॑षा॒णो या॑ह्यस्म॒युः
verses.transliteration: túbhyāyáṃ sómaḥ páripūto ádribhiḥ-  spārhā́ vásānaḥ pári kóśam arṣati  śukrā́ vásāno arṣati  távāyám bhāgá āyúṣu  sómo devéṣu hūyate  váha vāyo niyúto yāhy asmayúr  juṣāṇó yāhy asmayúḥ

translation.text: Purified by the stones the Soma flows for thee, clothed with its lovely splendours, to the reservoir, flows clad in its refulgent light. For thee the Soma is poured forth, thy portioned share mid. Gods and men. Drive thou thy horses, Vâyu, come to us with love, come well-inclined and loving us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ नि॒युद्भिः॑ श॒तिनी॑भिरध्व॒रं स॑ह॒स्रिणी॑भि॒रुप॑ याहि वी॒तये॒ वायो॑ ह॒व्यानि॑ वी॒तये॑ तवा॒यं भा॒ग ऋ॒त्वियः॒ सर॑श्मिः॒ सूर्ये॒ सचा॑ अ॒ध्व॒र्युभि॒र्भर॑माणा अयंसत॒ वायो॑ शु॒क्रा अ॑यंसत
verses.transliteration: ā́ no niyúdbhiḥ śatínībhir adhvaráṃ  sahasríṇībhir úpa yāhi vītáye  vā́yo havyā́ni vītáye  távāyám bhāgá r̥tvíyaḥ  sáraśmiḥ sū́rye sácā  adhvaryúbhir bháramāṇā ayaṃsata  vā́yo śukrā́ ayaṃsata

translation.text: Come thou with hundreds, come with thousands in thy team to this our solemn rite, to taste the sacred food, Vâyu, to taste the offerings. This is thy seasonable share, that comes co-radiant with the Sun. Brought by attendant priests pure juice is offered up, Vâyu, pure juice is offered up.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ रथो॑ नि॒युत्वा॑न्वक्ष॒दव॑से॒ऽभि प्रयां॑सि॒ सुधि॑तानि वी॒तये॒ वायो॑ ह॒व्यानि॑ वी॒तये॑ पिब॑तं॒ मध्वो॒ अन्ध॑सः पूर्व॒पेयं॒ हि वां॑ हि॒तम् वाय॒वा च॒न्द्रेण॒ राध॒सा ग॑त॒मिन्द्र॑श्च॒ राध॒सा ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ rátho niyútvān vakṣad ávase  -abhí práyāṃsi súdhitāni vītáye  vā́yo havyā́ni vītáye  píbatam mádhvo ándhasaḥ  pūrvapéyaṃ hí vāṃ hitám  vā́yav ā́ candréṇa rā́dhasā́ gatam  índraś ca rā́dhasā́ gatam

translation.text: The chariot with its team of horses bring you both, to guard us and to taste the well-appointed food, Vâyu, to taste the offerings! Drink of the pleasant -flavoured juice the first draught is assigned to you. O Vâyu, with your splendid bounty come ye both, Indra, with bounty come ye both.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ धियो॑ ववृत्युरध्व॒राँ उपे॒ममिन्दुं॑ मर्मृजन्त वा॒जिन॑मा॒शुमत्यं॒ न वा॒जिन॑म् तेषां॑ पिबतमस्म॒यू आ नो॑ गन्तमि॒होत्या इन्द्र॑वायू सु॒ताना॒मद्रि॑भिर्यु॒वं मदा॑य वाजदा यु॒वम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ dhíyo vavr̥tyur adhvarā́m̐ úpa-  -imám índum marmr̥janta vājínam  āśúm átyaṃ ná vājínam  téṣām pibatam asmayū́  ā́ no gantam ihótyā́  índravāyū sutā́nām ádribhir yuvám  mádāya vājadā yuvám

translation.text: May our songs bring you hither to our solemn rites: these drops of mighty vigour have they beauti fied, like a swift veed of mighty strength. Drink of them well-inclined to us, come hitherward to be our help. Drink, Indra-Vâyu, of these Juices pressed with stones, Strength-givers! till they gladden you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे वां॒ सोमा॑ अ॒प्स्वा सु॒ता इ॒हाध्व॒र्युभि॒र्भर॑माणा अयंसत॒ वायो॑ शु॒क्रा अ॑यंसत ए॒ते वा॑म॒भ्य॑सृक्षत ति॒रः प॒वित्र॑मा॒शवः॑ यु॒वा॒यवोऽति॒ रोमा॑ण्य॒व्यया॒ सोमा॑सो॒ अत्य॒व्यया॑
verses.transliteration: imé vāṃ sómā apsv ā́ sutā́ ihá-  adhvaryúbhir bháramāṇā ayaṃsata  vā́yo śukrā́ ayaṃsata  eté vām abhy àsr̥kṣata  tiráḥ pavítram āśávaḥ  yuvāyávó 'ti rómāṇy avyáyā  sómāso áty avyáyā

translation.text: These Soma juices pressed for you in waters here, borne by attendant priests, are oficredup to you: bright, Vâyu, are they offered up. Swift through the strainer have they flowed, and here are shed for both ofyou, Soma-drops, fain for you, over the wether's fleece, Somas over the wether's fleece.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अति॑ वायो सस॒तो या॑हि॒ शश्व॑तो॒ यत्र॒ ग्रावा॒ वद॑ति॒ तत्र॑ गच्छतं गृ॒हमिन्द्र॑श्च गच्छतम् वि सू॒नृता॒ ददृ॑शे॒ रीय॑ते घृ॒तमा पू॒र्णया॑ नि॒युता॑ याथो अध्व॒रमिन्द्र॑श्च याथो अध्व॒रम्
verses.transliteration: áti vāyo sasató yāhi śáśvato  yátra grā́vā vádati tátra gachataṃ  gr̥hám índraś ca gachatam  ví sūnŕ̥tā dádr̥śe rī́yate ghr̥tám  ā́ pūrṇáyā niyútā yātho adhvarám  índraś ca yātho adhvarám

translation.text: O Vâyu, pass thou over all the,slumberers, and where the press-stone rings enter ye both that house, yea, Indra, go ye both within. The joyous Maiden is beheld, the butter flows. With richly laden team come to our solemn rite, yea, Indra, come ye to the rite.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्राह॒ तद्व॑हेथे॒ मध्व॒ आहु॑तिं॒ यम॑श्व॒त्थमु॑प॒तिष्ठ॑न्त जा॒यवो॒ऽस्मे ते स॑न्तु जा॒यवः॑ सा॒कं गावः॒ सुव॑ते॒ पच्य॑ते॒ यवो॒ न ते॑ वाय॒ उप॑ दस्यन्ति धे॒नवो॒ नाप॑ दस्यन्ति धे॒नवः॑
verses.transliteration: átrā́ha tád vahethe mádhva ā́hutiṃ  yám aśvatthám upatíṣṭhanta jāyávo  -asmé té santu jāyávaḥ  sākáṃ gā́vaḥ súvate pácyate yávo  ná te vāya úpa dasyanti dhenávo  nā́pa dasyanti dhenávaḥ

translation.text: Ride hither to the offering of the pleasant juice, the holy Fig-tree which victorious priests surround: victorious be they still for us. At once the cows yield milk, the barleymeal is dressed. For thee, O Vâyu, never shall the cows grow thin, never for thee shall they be dry.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मे ये ते॒ सु वा॑यो बा॒ह्वो॑जसो॒ऽन्तर्न॒दी ते॑ प॒तय॑न्त्यु॒क्षणो॒ महि॒ व्राध॑न्त उ॒क्षणः॑ धन्व॑ञ्चि॒द्ये अ॑ना॒शवो॑ जी॒राश्चि॒दगि॑रौकसः सूर्य॑स्येव र॒श्मयो॑ दुर्नि॒यन्त॑वो॒ हस्त॑योर्दुर्नि॒यन्त॑वः
verses.transliteration: imé yé te sú vāyo bāhvòjaso  -antár nadī́ te patáyanty ukṣáṇo  máhi vrā́dhanta ukṣáṇaḥ  dhánvañ cid yé anāśávo  jīrā́ś cid ágiraukasaḥ  sū́ryasyeva raśmáyo durniyántavo  hástayor durniyántavaḥ

translation.text: These Bulls of thine, O Vâyu with the arm of strength, who swiftly fly within the current of thy stream, the Bulls increasing in their might, Horseless, yet even through the waste swift-moving, whom no shout can stay, Hard to be checked are they, like sunbeams, in their course. hard to be checked by both the hands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सु ज्येष्ठं॑ निचि॒राभ्यां॑ बृ॒हन्नमो॑ ह॒व्यं म॒तिं भ॑रता मृळ॒यद्भ्यां॒ स्वादि॑ष्ठं मृळ॒यद्भ्या॑म् ता स॒म्राजा॑ घृ॒तासु॑ती य॒ज्ञेय॑ज्ञ॒ उप॑स्तुता अथै॑नोः क्ष॒त्रं न कुत॑श्च॒नाधृषे॑ देव॒त्वं नू चि॑दा॒धृषे॑
verses.transliteration: prá sú jyéṣṭhaṃ nicirā́bhyām br̥hán námo  havyám matím bharatā mr̥ḷayádbhyāṃ  svā́diṣṭham mr̥ḷayádbhyām  tā́ samrā́jā ghr̥tā́sutī  yajñé-yajña úpastutā  áthainoḥ kṣatráṃ ná kútaś canā́dhŕ̥ṣe  devatváṃ nū́ cid ādhŕ̥ṣe

translation.text: BRING adoration ample and most excellent, hymn, offierings, to the watchful Twain, the bountiful, your sweetest to the bounteous Ones. Sovrans adored with streams of oil and praised at every sacrifice. Their high imperial might may nowhere be assailed, ne'er may their Godhead be assailed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद॑र्शि गा॒तुरु॒रवे॒ वरी॑यसी॒ पन्था॑ ऋ॒तस्य॒ सम॑यंस्त र॒श्मिभि॒श्चक्षु॒र्भग॑स्य र॒श्मिभिः॑ द्यु॒क्षं मि॒त्रस्य॒ साद॑नमर्य॒म्णो वरु॑णस्य च अथा॑ दधाते बृ॒हदु॒क्थ्यं१॒॑ वय॑ उप॒स्तुत्यं॑ बृ॒हद्वयः॑
verses.transliteration: ádarśi gātúr uráve várīyasī  pánthā r̥tásya sám ayaṃsta raśmíbhiś  cákṣur bhágasya raśmíbhiḥ  dyukṣám mitrásya sā́danam  aryamṇó váruṇasya ca  áthā dadhāte br̥hád ukthyàṃ váyaḥ-  upastútyam br̥hád váyaḥ

translation.text: For the broad Sun was seen a path more widely laid, the path of holy law hath been maintained with rays, the eye with Bhaga's rays of light. Firm-set in heaven is Mitra's home, and Aryaman's and Varuṇa's. Thence they give forth great vital strength which merits praise, high power of life that men shall praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज्योति॑ष्मती॒मदि॑तिं धार॒यत्क्षि॑तिं॒ स्व॑र्वती॒मा स॑चेते दि॒वेदि॑वे जागृ॒वांसा॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे ज्योति॑ष्मत्क्ष॒त्रमा॑शाते आदि॒त्या दानु॑न॒स्पती॑ मि॒त्रस्तयो॒र्वरु॑णो यात॒यज्ज॑नोऽर्य॒मा या॑त॒यज्ज॑नः
verses.transliteration: jyótiṣmatīm áditiṃ dhārayátkṣitiṃ  svàrvatīm ā́ sacete divé-dive  jāgr̥vā́ṃsā divé-dive  jyótiṣmat kṣatrám āśāte  ādityā́ dā́nunas pátī  mitrás táyor váruṇo yātayájjano  -aryamā́ yātayájjanaḥ

translation.text: With Aditi the luminous, the celestial, upholder of the people, come ye day by day, ye who watch sleepless, day by day. Resplendent might have ye obtained, Âdityas, Lords of liberal gifts. Movers of men, mild both, are Mitra, Varuṇa, mover of men is Aryaman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय॒ शंत॑मः॒ सोमो॑ भूत्वव॒पाने॒ष्वाभ॑गो दे॒वो दे॒वेष्वाभ॑गः तं दे॒वासो॑ जुषेरत॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒द्य स॒जोष॑सः तथा॑ राजाना करथो॒ यदीम॑ह॒ ऋता॑वाना॒ यदीम॑हे
verses.transliteration: ayám mitrā́ya váruṇāya śáṃtamaḥ  sómo bhūtv avapā́neṣv ā́bhago  devó devéṣv ā́bhagaḥ  táṃ devā́so juṣerata  víśve adyá sajóṣasaḥ  táthā rājānā karatho yád ī́mahe-  ŕ̥tāvānā yád ī́mahe

translation.text: This Soma be most sweet to Mitra, Varuṇa: he in the drinking-feasts, shall have a share thereof, sharing, a God, among the Gods. May all the Gods of one accord accept it joyfully to-day. Therefore do ye, O Kings, accomplish what we ask, ye Righteous Ones, whate'er we ask.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णा॒यावि॑ध॒ज्जनो॑ऽन॒र्वाणं॒ तं परि॑ पातो॒ अंह॑सो दा॒श्वांसं॒ मर्त॒मंह॑सः तम॑र्य॒माभि र॑क्षत्यृजू॒यन्त॒मनु॑ व्र॒तम् उ॒क्थैर्य ए॑नोः परि॒भूष॑ति व्र॒तं स्तोमै॑रा॒भूष॑ति व्र॒तम्
verses.transliteration: yó mitrā́ya váruṇāyā́vidhaj jáno  -anarvā́ṇaṃ tám pári pāto áṃhaso  dāśvā́ṃsam mártam áṃhasaḥ  tám aryamā́bhí rakṣati-  r̥jūyántam ánu vratám  ukthaír yá enoḥ paribhū́ṣati vratáṃ  stómair ābhū́ṣati vratám

translation.text: Whoso, with worship serves Mitra and VaruiIa, him guard ye carefully, uninjured, from distress, guard from distress the liberal man. Aryaman guards him well who acts uprightly following his law, Who beautifies their service with his lauds, who makes it beautiful with songs of praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नमो॑ दि॒वे बृ॑ह॒ते रोद॑सीभ्यां मि॒त्राय॑ वोचं॒ वरु॑णाय मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ सुमृळी॒काय॑ मी॒ळ्हुषे॑ इन्द्र॑म॒ग्निमुप॑ स्तुहि द्यु॒क्षम॑र्य॒मणं॒ भग॑म् ज्योग्जीव॑न्तः प्र॒जया॑ सचेमहि॒ सोम॑स्यो॒ती स॑चेमहि
verses.transliteration: námo divé br̥haté ródasībhyām  mitrā́ya vocaṃ váruṇāya mīḷhúṣe  sumr̥ḷīkā́ya mīḷhúṣe  índram agním úpa stuhi  dyukṣám aryamáṇam bhágam  jyóg jī́vantaḥ prajáyā sacemahi  sómasyotī́ sacemahi

translation.text: Worship will I proress to lofty Dyaus, to Heaven and Earth, to Mitra and to bounteous Varuṇa, the Bounteous, the Compassionate. Praise Indra, praise thou Agni, praise Bhaga and heavenly Aryaman. Long may we live and have attendant progeny, have progeny with Soma's help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒ती दे॒वानां॑ व॒यमिन्द्र॑वन्तो मंसी॒महि॒ स्वय॑शसो म॒रुद्भिः॑ अ॒ग्निर्मि॒त्रो वरु॑णः॒ शर्म॑ यंस॒न्तद॑श्याम म॒घवा॑नो व॒यं च॑
verses.transliteration: ūtī́ devā́nāṃ vayám índravanto  maṃsīmáhi sváyaśaso marúdbhiḥ  agnír mitró váruṇaḥ śárma yaṃsan  tád aśyāma maghávāno vayáṃ ca

translation.text: With the Gods' help, with Indra still beside us, may we be held self-splendid with the Maruts. May Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa give us shelter this may we gain, we and our wealthy princes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒षु॒मा या॑त॒मद्रि॑भि॒र्गोश्री॑ता मत्स॒रा इ॒मे सोमा॑सो मत्स॒रा इ॒मे आ रा॑जाना दिविस्पृशास्म॒त्रा ग॑न्त॒मुप॑ नः इ॒मे वां॑ मित्रावरुणा॒ गवा॑शिरः॒ सोमाः॑ शु॒क्रा गवा॑शिरः
verses.transliteration: suṣumā́ yātam ádribhir  góśrītā matsarā́ imé  sómāso matsarā́ imé  ā́ rājānā divispr̥śā-  -asmatrā́ gantam úpa naḥ  imé vām mitrāvaruṇā gávāśiraḥ  sómāḥ śukrā́ gávāśiraḥ

translation.text: WITH stones have we pressed out: O come; these gladdening drops are blent with milk, these Soma-drops which gladden you. Come to us, Kings who reach to heaven, approach us, coming hitherward. These milky drops are yours, Mitra and Varuṇa, bright Soma juices blent with milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒म आ या॑त॒मिन्द॑वः॒ सोमा॑सो॒ दध्या॑शिरः सु॒तासो॒ दध्या॑शिरः उ॒त वा॑मु॒षसो॑ बु॒धि सा॒कं सूर्य॑स्य र॒श्मिभिः॑ सु॒तो मि॒त्राय॒ वरु॑णाय पी॒तये॒ चारु॑र्ऋ॒ताय॑ पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: imá ā́ yātam índavaḥ  sómāso dádhyāśiraḥ  sutā́so dádhyāśiraḥ  utá vām uṣáso budhí  sākáṃ sū́ryasya raśmíbhiḥ  sutó mitrā́ya váruṇāya pītáye  cā́rur r̥tā́ya pītáye

translation.text: Here are the droppings; come ye nigh the Soma-droppings blent with curd, juices expressed and blent with curd. Now for the wakening of your Dawn together with the Sun-God's rays, juice waits for Mitra and for Varuṇa to drink, fair juice for drink, for sacrihce.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तां वां॑ धे॒नुं न वा॑स॒रीमं॒शुं दु॑ह॒न्त्यद्रि॑भिः॒ सोमं॑ दुह॒न्त्यद्रि॑भिः अ॒स्म॒त्रा ग॑न्त॒मुप॑ नो॒ऽर्वाञ्चा॒ सोम॑पीतये अ॒यं वां॑ मित्रावरुणा॒ नृभिः॑ सु॒तः सोम॒ आ पी॒तये॑ सु॒तः
verses.transliteration: tā́ṃ vāṃ dhenúṃ ná vāsarī́m  aṃśúṃ duhanty ádribhiḥ  sómaṃ duhanty ádribhiḥ  -asmatrā́ gantam úpa naḥ  -arvā́ñcā sómapītaye  ayáṃ vām mitrāvaruṇā nŕ̥bhiḥ sutáḥ  sóma ā́ pītáye sutáḥ

translation.text: As 'twere a radiant-coloured cow, they milk with stones the stalk for you, with stones they milk the Soma-plant. May ye come nigh us, may ye turn hither to drink the Soma juice. The men pressed out this juice, Mitra and Varuṇa, pressed out this Soma for your drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रप्र॑ पू॒ष्णस्तु॑विजा॒तस्य॑ शस्यते महि॒त्वम॑स्य त॒वसो॒ न त॑न्दते स्तो॒त्रम॑स्य॒ न त॑न्दते अर्चा॑मि सुम्न॒यन्न॒हमन्त्यू॑तिं मयो॒भुव॑म् विश्व॑स्य॒ यो मन॑ आयुयु॒वे म॒खो दे॒व आ॑युयु॒वे म॒खः
verses.transliteration: prá-pra pūṣṇás tuvijātásya śasyate  mahitvám asya taváso ná tandate  stotrám asya ná tandate  árcāmi sumnayánn ahám  ántyūtim mayobhúvam  víśvasya yó mána āyuyuvé makhó  devá āyuyuvé makháḥ

translation.text: STRONG Pûshan's majesty is lauded evermore, the glory of his lordly might is never faint, his song of praise is never faint. Seeking felicity I laud him nigh to help, the source, of bliss, Who, Vigorous one, hath drawn to him the hearts of all, drawn them, the Vigorous One, the God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र हि त्वा॑ पूषन्नजि॒रं न याम॑नि॒ स्तोमे॑भिः कृ॒ण्व ऋ॒णवो॒ यथा॒ मृध॒ उष्ट्रो॒ न पी॑परो॒ मृधः॑ हु॒वे यत्त्वा॑ मयो॒भुवं॑ दे॒वं स॒ख्याय॒ मर्त्यः॑ अ॒स्माक॑माङ्गू॒षान्द्यु॒म्निन॑स्कृधि॒ वाजे॑षु द्यु॒म्निन॑स्कृधि
verses.transliteration: prá hí tvā pūṣann ajiráṃ ná yā́mani  stómebhiḥ kr̥ṇvá r̥ṇávo yáthā mŕ̥dhaḥ-  úṣṭro ná pīparo mŕ̥dhaḥ  huvé yát tvā mayobhúvaṃ  deváṃ sakhyā́ya mártyaḥ  asmā́kam āṅgūṣā́n dyumnínas kr̥dhi  vā́jeṣu dyumnínas kr̥dhi

translation.text: Thee, then, O Pûshan, like a swift one on his way, I urge with lauds that thou mayst make the foemen flee, drive, camel-like, our foes afar. As I, a man, call thee, a God, giver of bliss, to be my Friend, So make our loudly-chanted praises glorious, in battles make them glorious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ ते पूषन्त्स॒ख्ये वि॑प॒न्यवः॒ क्रत्वा॑ चि॒त्सन्तोऽव॑सा बुभुज्रि॒र इति॒ क्रत्वा॑ बुभुज्रि॒रे तामनु॑ त्वा॒ नवी॑यसीं नि॒युतं॑ रा॒य ई॑महे अहे॑ळमान उरुशंस॒ सरी॑ भव॒ वाजे॑वाजे॒ सरी॑ भव
verses.transliteration: yásya te pūṣan sakhyé vipanyávaḥ  krátvā cit sántó 'vasā bubhujriré-  íti krátvā bubhujriré  tā́m ánu tvā návīyasīṃ  niyútaṃ rāyá īmahe  áheḷamāna uruśaṃsa sárī bhava  vā́je-vāje sárī bhava

translation.text: Thou, Pûshan, in whose friendship they who sing forth praise enjoy advantage, even in wisdom, through thy grace, in wisdom even they are advanced. So, after this most recent course, we come to thee with prayers for wealth. Not stirred to anger, O Wide-Ruler, come to us, come thou to us in every fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्या ऊ॒ षु ण॒ उप॑ सा॒तये॑ भु॒वोऽहे॑ळमानो ररि॒वाँ अ॑जाश्व श्रवस्य॒ताम॑जाश्व ओ षु त्वा॑ ववृतीमहि॒ स्तोमे॑भिर्दस्म सा॒धुभिः॑ न॒हि त्वा॑ पूषन्नति॒मन्य॑ आघृणे॒ न ते॑ स॒ख्यम॑पह्नु॒वे
verses.transliteration: asyā́ ū ṣú ṇa úpa sātáye bhuvaḥ-  -áheḷamāno rarivā́m̐ ajāśva  śravasyatā́m ajāśva  ó ṣú tvā vavr̥tīmahi  stómebhir dasma sādhúbhiḥ  nahí tvā pūṣann atimánya āghr̥ṇe  ná te sakhyám apahnuvé

translation.text: Not stirred to anger, come, Free-giver, nigh to us, to take this gift of ours, thou who hast goats for steeds, Goat-borne! their gift who long for fame. So, Wonder-Worker! may we turn thee hither with effectual lauds. I slight thee not, O Pûshan, thou Resplendent One: thy friendship may not be despised.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्तु॒ श्रौष॑ट् पु॒रो अ॒ग्निं धि॒या द॑ध॒ आ नु तच्छर्धो॑ दि॒व्यं वृ॑णीमह इन्द्रवा॒यू वृ॑णीमहे यद्ध॑ क्रा॒णा वि॒वस्व॑ति॒ नाभा॑ सं॒दायि॒ नव्य॑सी अध॒ प्र सू न॒ उप॑ यन्तु धी॒तयो॑ दे॒वाँ अच्छा॒ न धी॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: ástu śraúṣaṭ puró agnī́ṃ dhiyā́ dadhe-  ā́ nú tác chárdho divyáṃ vr̥ṇīmahe-  indravāyū́ vr̥ṇīmahe  yád dha krāṇā́ vivásvati  nā́bhā saṃdā́yi návyasī  ádha prá sū́ na úpa yantu dhītáyo  devā́m̐ áchā ná dhītáyaḥ

translation.text: HEARD be our prayer! In thought I honour Agni first: now straightway we elect this heavenly company, Indra and Vâyu we elect. For when our latest thought is raised and on Vivasvan centred well, Then may our holy songs go forward on their way, our songs as 'twere unto the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्ध॒ त्यन्मि॑त्रावरुणावृ॒तादध्या॑द॒दाथे॒ अनृ॑तं॒ स्वेन॑ म॒न्युना॒ दक्ष॑स्य॒ स्वेन॑ म॒न्युना॑ यु॒वोरि॒त्थाधि॒ सद्म॒स्वप॑श्याम हिर॒ण्यय॑म् धी॒भिश्च॒न मन॑सा॒ स्वेभि॑र॒क्षभिः॒ सोम॑स्य॒ स्वेभि॑र॒क्षभिः॑
verses.transliteration: yád dha tyán mitrāvaruṇāv r̥tā́d ádhi-  ādadā́the ánr̥taṃ svéna manyúnā  dákṣasya svéna manyúnā  yuvór itthā́dhi sádmasu-  ápaśyāma hiraṇyáyam  dhībhíś caná mánasā svébhir akṣábhiḥ  sómasya svébhir akṣábhiḥ

translation.text: As there ye, Mitra, Varuṇa, above the true have taken to yourselves the untrue with your mind, with wisdom's mental energy, So in the seats wherein ye dwell have we beheld the Golden One, Not with our thoughts or spirit, but with these our eyes, yea, with the eyes that Soma gives.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वां स्तोमे॑भिर्देव॒यन्तो॑ अश्विनाश्रा॒वय॑न्त इव॒ श्लोक॑मा॒यवो॑ यु॒वां ह॒व्याभ्या॒३॒॑यवः॑ यु॒वोर्विश्वा॒ अधि॒ श्रियः॒ पृक्ष॑श्च विश्ववेदसा प्रु॒षा॒यन्ते॑ वां प॒वयो॑ हिर॒ण्यये॒ रथे॑ दस्रा हिर॒ण्यये॑
verses.transliteration: yuvā́ṃ stómebhir devayánto aśvinā-  -āśrāváyanta iva ślókam āyávo  yuvā́ṃ havyā́bhy ā̀yávaḥ  yuvór víśvā ádhi śríyaḥ  pŕ̥kṣaś ca viśvavedasā  pruṣāyánte vām paváyo hiraṇyáye  ráthe dasrā hiraṇyáye

translation.text: Aṣvins, the pious call you with their hymns of praise, sounding their loud song forth to you, these living men, to their oblations, living men. All glories and all nourishment, Lords of all wealth! depend on you. The fellies of your golden chariot scatter drops, Mighty Ones! of your golden car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अचे॑ति दस्रा॒ व्यु१॒॑ नाक॑मृण्वथो यु॒ञ्जते॑ वां रथ॒युजो॒ दिवि॑ष्टिष्वध्व॒स्मानो॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु अधि॑ वां॒ स्थाम॑ व॒न्धुरे॒ रथे॑ दस्रा हिर॒ण्यये॑ प॒थेव॒ यन्ता॑वनु॒शास॑ता॒ रजोऽञ्ज॑सा॒ शास॑ता॒ रजः॑
verses.transliteration: áceti dasrā vy ù nā́kam r̥ṇvatho  yuñjáte vāṃ rathayújo díviṣṭiṣu-  adhvasmā́no díviṣṭiṣu  ádhi vāṃ sthā́ma vandhúre  ráthe dasrā hiraṇyáye  pathéva yántāv anuśā́satā rájaḥ-  -áñjasā śā́satā rájaḥ

translation.text: Well is it known, O Mighty Ones: ye open heaven; for you the chariotsteeds are yoked for morning rites, unswerving steeds for morning rites, We set you on the chariot-scat, ye Mighty, on the golden car. Ye seek mid-air as by a path that leads aright, as by a path that leads direct.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शची॑भिर्नः शचीवसू॒ दिवा॒ नक्तं॑ दशस्यतम् मा वां॑ रा॒तिरुप॑ दस॒त्कदा॑ च॒नास्मद्रा॒तिः कदा॑ च॒न
verses.transliteration: śácībhir naḥ śacīvasū  dívā náktaṃ daśasyatam  mā́ vāṃ rātír úpa dasat kádā caná-  -asmád rātíḥ kádā caná

translation.text: O Rich in Strength, through your great power vouchsafe us blessings day and night. The offerings which we bring to you shall never fail, gifts brought by us shall never fail.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृष॑न्निन्द्र वृष॒पाणा॑स॒ इन्द॑व इ॒मे सु॒ता अद्रि॑षुतास उ॒द्भिद॒स्तुभ्यं॑ सु॒तास॑ उ॒द्भिदः॑ ते त्वा॑ मन्दन्तु दा॒वने॑ म॒हे चि॒त्राय॒ राध॑से गी॒र्भिर्गि॑र्वाहः॒ स्तव॑मान॒ आ ग॑हि सुमृळी॒को न॒ आ ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣann indra vr̥ṣapā́ṇāsa índavaḥ-  imé sutā́ ádriṣutāsa udbhídas  túbhyaṃ sutā́sa udbhídaḥ  té tvā mandantu dāváne  mahé citrā́ya rā́dhase  gīrbhír girvāha stávamāna ā́ gahi  sumr̥ḷīkó na ā́ gahi

translation.text: These Soma-drops, strong Indra! drink for heroes, poured, pressed out by pressing-stones, are welling forth for thee, for thee the drops are welling forth. They shall make glad thy heart to give, to give wealth great and wonderful. Thou who acceptest praise come glorified by hymns, come thou to us benevolent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ षू णो॑ अग्ने शृणुहि॒ त्वमी॑ळि॒तो दे॒वेभ्यो॑ ब्रवसि य॒ज्ञिये॑भ्यो॒ राज॑भ्यो य॒ज्ञिये॑भ्यः यद्ध॒ त्यामङ्गि॑रोभ्यो धे॒नुं दे॑वा॒ अद॑त्तन वि तां दु॑ह्रे अर्य॒मा क॒र्तरी॒ सचाँ॑ ए॒ष तां वे॑द मे॒ सचा॑
verses.transliteration: ó ṣū́ ṇo agne śr̥ṇuhi tvám īḷitó  devébhyo bravasi yajñíyebhyo  rā́jabhyo yajñíyebhyaḥ  yád dha tyā́m áṅgirobhyo  dhenúṃ devā ádattana  ví tā́ṃ duhre aryamā́ kartárī sácām̐  eṣá tā́ṃ veda me sácā

translation.text: Quickly, O Agni, hear us: magnified by us thou shalt speck for us to the Gods adorable yea, to the Kings adorable: When, O ye Deities, ye gave that Milch-cow to the Angirases, They milked her: Aryaman, joined with them, did the work: he knoweth her as well as I.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मो षु वो॑ अ॒स्मद॒भि तानि॒ पौंस्या॒ सना॑ भूवन्द्यु॒म्नानि॒ मोत जा॑रिषुर॒स्मत्पु॒रोत जा॑रिषुः यद्व॑श्चि॒त्रं यु॒गेयु॑गे॒ नव्यं॒ घोषा॒दम॑र्त्यम् अ॒स्मासु॒ तन्म॑रुतो॒ यच्च॑ दु॒ष्टरं॑ दिधृ॒ता यच्च॑ दु॒ष्टर॑म्
verses.transliteration: mó ṣú vo asmád abhí tā́ni paúṃsyā  sánā bhūvan dyumnā́ni mótá jāriṣur  asmát purótá jāriṣuḥ  yád vaś citráṃ yugé-yuge  návyaṃ ghóṣād ámartyam  asmā́su tán maruto yác ca duṣṭáraṃ  didhr̥tā́ yác ca duṣṭáram

translation.text: Ne'er may these manly deeds of yours for us grow old, never may your bright glories fall into decay, never before our time decay. What deed of yours, new every age, wondrous, surpassing man, rings forth, Whatever, Maruts! may be difficult to gain, grant us, whate'er is hard to gain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒ध्यङ्ह॑ मे ज॒नुषं॒ पूर्वो॒ अङ्गि॑राः प्रि॒यमे॑धः॒ कण्वो॒ अत्रि॒र्मनु॑र्विदु॒स्ते मे॒ पूर्वे॒ मनु॑र्विदुः तेषां॑ दे॒वेष्वाय॑तिर॒स्माकं॒ तेषु॒ नाभ॑यः तेषां॑ प॒देन॒ मह्या न॑मे गि॒रेन्द्रा॒ग्नी आ न॑मे गि॒रा
verses.transliteration: dadhyáṅ ha me janúṣam pū́rvo áṅgirāḥ  priyámedhaḥ káṇvo átrir mánur vidus  té me pū́rve mánur viduḥ  téṣāṃ devéṣv ā́yatir  asmā́kaṃ téṣu nā́bhayaḥ  téṣām padéna máhy ā́ name girā́-  -indrāgnī́ ā́ name girā́

translation.text: Dadhyac of old, Anigiras, Priyamedha these, and Kaṇva, Atri, Manu knew my birth, yea, those of ancient days and Manu knew. Their long line stretcheth to the Gods, our birth-connexions are with them. To these, for their high station, I bow down with song, to Indra, Agni, bow with song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: होता॑ यक्षद्व॒निनो॑ वन्त॒ वार्यं॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र्यजति वे॒न उ॒क्षभिः॑ पुरु॒वारे॑भिरु॒क्षभिः॑ ज॒गृ॒भ्मा दू॒रआ॑दिशं॒ श्लोक॒मद्रे॒रध॒ त्मना॑ अधा॑रयदर॒रिन्दा॑नि सु॒क्रतुः॑ पु॒रू सद्मा॑नि सु॒क्रतुः॑
verses.transliteration: hótā yakṣad vaníno vanta vā́ryam  bŕ̥haspátir yajati vená ukṣábhiḥ  puruvā́rebhir ukṣábhiḥ  jagr̥bhmā́ dūráādiśaṃ  ślókam ádrer ádha tmánā  ádhārayad araríndāni sukrátuḥ  purū́ sádmāni sukrátuḥ

translation.text: Let the Invoker bless: let offerers bring choice gifts; Br̥ihaspati the Friend doth sacrifice with Steers, Steers that have many an excellence. Now with our ears we catch the sound of the press-stone that rings afar. The very Strong hath gained the waters by himself, the strong gained many a resting-place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये दे॑वासो दि॒व्येका॑दश॒ स्थ पृ॑थि॒व्यामध्येका॑दश॒ स्थ अ॒प्सु॒क्षितो॑ महि॒नैका॑दश॒ स्थ ते दे॑वासो य॒ज्ञमि॒मं जु॑षध्वम्
verses.transliteration: yé devāso divy ékādaśa sthá  pr̥thivyā́m ádhy ékādaśa sthá  apsukṣíto mahinaíkādaśa sthá  té devāso yajñám imáṃ juṣadhvam

translation.text: O ye Eleven Gods whose home is heaven, O ye Eleven who make earth your dwelling, Ye who with might, Eleven, live in waters, accept this sacrifice, O Gods, with pleasure.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: वे॒दि॒षदे॑ प्रि॒यधा॑माय सु॒द्युते॑ धा॒सिमि॑व॒ प्र भ॑रा॒ योनि॑म॒ग्नये॑ वस्त्रे॑णेव वासया॒ मन्म॑ना॒ शुचिं॑ ज्यो॒तीर॑थं शु॒क्रव॑र्णं तमो॒हन॑म्
verses.transliteration: vediṣáde priyádhāmāya sudyúte  dhāsím iva prá bharā yónim agnáye  vástreṇeva vāsayā mánmanā śúciṃ  jyotī́rathaṃ śukrávarṇaṃ tamohánam

translation.text: To splendid Agni seated by the altar, loving well his home, I bring the food as 'twere his place of birth. I clothe the bright One with my hymn as with a robe, him with the car of light, bright-hued, dispelling gloom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि द्वि॒जन्मा॑ त्रि॒वृदन्न॑मृज्यते संवत्स॒रे वा॑वृधे ज॒ग्धमी॒ पुनः॑ अ॒न्यस्या॒सा जि॒ह्वया॒ जेन्यो॒ वृषा॒ न्य१॒॑न्येन॑ व॒निनो॑ मृष्ट वार॒णः
verses.transliteration: abhí dvijánmā trivŕ̥d ánnam r̥jyate  saṃvatsaré vāvr̥dhe jagdhám ī púnaḥ  anyásyāsā́ jihváyā jényo vŕ̥ṣā  ny ànyéna vaníno mr̥ṣṭa vāraṇáḥ

translation.text: Child of a double birth he grasps at triple food; in the year's course what he hath swallowed grows anew. He, by another's mouth and tongue a noble Bull, with other, as an elephant, consumes the trees.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒ष्ण॒प्रुतौ॑ वेवि॒जे अ॑स्य स॒क्षिता॑ उ॒भा त॑रेते अ॒भि मा॒तरा॒ शिशु॑म् प्रा॒चाजि॑ह्वं ध्व॒सय॑न्तं तृषु॒च्युत॒मा साच्यं॒ कुप॑यं॒ वर्ध॑नं पि॒तुः
verses.transliteration: kr̥ṣṇaprútau vevijé asya sakṣítau-  ubhā́ tarete abhí mātárā śíśum  prācā́jihvaṃ dhvasáyantaṃ tr̥ṣucyútam  ā́ sā́cyaṃ kúpayaṃ várdhanam pitúḥ

translation.text: The pair who dwell together, moving in the dark bestir themselves: both parents hasten to the babe, Impetuous-tongued, destroying, springing swiftly forth, one to be watched and cherished, strengthener of his sire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मु॒मु॒क्ष्वो॒३॒॑ मन॑वे मानवस्य॒ते र॑घु॒द्रुवः॑ कृ॒ष्णसी॑तास ऊ॒ जुवः॑ अ॒स॒म॒ना अ॑जि॒रासो॑ रघु॒ष्यदो॒ वात॑जूता॒ उप॑ युज्यन्त आ॒शवः॑
verses.transliteration: mumukṣvò mánave mānavasyaté  raghudrúvaḥ kr̥ṣṇásītāsa ū júvaḥ  asamanā́ ajirā́so raghuṣyádo  vā́tajūtā úpa yujyanta āśávaḥ

translation.text: For man, thou Friend of men, these steeds of thine are yoked, impatient, lightly running, ploughing blackened lines, Discordant-minded, fleet, gliding with easy speed, urged onward by the wind and rapid in their course.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आद॑स्य॒ ते ध्व॒सय॑न्तो॒ वृथे॑रते कृ॒ष्णमभ्वं॒ महि॒ वर्पः॒ करि॑क्रतः यत्सीं॑ म॒हीम॒वनिं॒ प्राभि मर्मृ॑शदभिश्व॒सन्त्स्त॒नय॒न्नेति॒ नान॑दत्
verses.transliteration: ā́d asya té dhvasáyanto vŕ̥therate  kr̥ṣṇám ábhvam máhi várpaḥ kárikrataḥ  yát sīm mahī́m avánim prā́bhí mármr̥śad  abhiśvasán stanáyann éti nā́nadat

translation.text: Dispelling on their way the horror of black gloom , making a glorious show these flames Of his fly forth, When o'er the spacious tract he spreads himself abroad, and rushes panting on with thunder and with roar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूष॒न्न योऽधि॑ ब॒भ्रूषु॒ नम्न॑ते॒ वृषे॑व॒ पत्नी॑र॒भ्ये॑ति॒ रोरु॑वत् ओ॒जा॒यमा॑नस्त॒न्व॑श्च शुम्भते भी॒मो न शृङ्गा॑ दविधाव दु॒र्गृभिः॑
verses.transliteration: bhū́ṣan ná yó 'dhi babhrū́ṣu námnate  vŕ̥ṣeva pátnīr abhy èti róruvat  ojāyámānas tanvàś ca śumbhate  bhīmó ná śŕ̥ṅgā davidhāva durgŕ̥bhiḥ

translation.text: Amid brown plants he stoops as if adorning them, and rushes bellowing like a bull upon his wives. Proving his might, he decks the glory of his form, and shakes his horns like one terrific, bard to stay.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सं॒स्तिरो॑ वि॒ष्टिरः॒ सं गृ॑भायति जा॒नन्ने॒व जा॑न॒तीर्नित्य॒ आ श॑ये पुन॑र्वर्धन्ते॒ अपि॑ यन्ति दे॒व्य॑म॒न्यद्वर्पः॑ पि॒त्रोः कृ॑ण्वते॒ सचा॑
verses.transliteration: sá saṃstíro viṣṭíraḥ sáṃ gr̥bhāyati  jānánn evá jānatī́r nítya ā́ śaye  púnar vardhante ápi yanti devyàm  anyád várpaḥ pitróḥ kr̥ṇvate sácā

translation.text: Now covered, now displayed he grasps as one who knows his resting-place in those who know him well. A second time they wax and gather Godlike power, and blending both together change their Parents' form.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॒ग्रुवः॑ के॒शिनीः॒ सं हि रे॑भि॒र ऊ॒र्ध्वास्त॑स्थुर्म॒म्रुषीः॒ प्रायवे॒ पुनः॑ तासां॑ ज॒रां प्र॑मु॒ञ्चन्ने॑ति॒ नान॑द॒दसुं॒ परं॑ ज॒नय॑ञ्जी॒वमस्तृ॑तम्
verses.transliteration: tám agrúvaḥ keśínīḥ sáṃ hí rebhiré-  ūrdhvā́s tasthur mamrúṣīḥ prā́yáve púnaḥ  tā́sāṃ jarā́m pramuñcánn eti nā́nadad  ásum páraṃ janáyañ jīvám ástr̥tam

translation.text: The maidens with long, tresses hold him in embrace; dead, they rise up again to meet the Living One. Releasing them from age with a loud roar he comes, filling them with new spirit, living, unsubdued.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒धी॒वा॒सं परि॑ मा॒तू रि॒हन्नह॑ तुवि॒ग्रेभिः॒ सत्व॑भिर्याति॒ वि ज्रयः॑ वयो॒ दध॑त्प॒द्वते॒ रेरि॑ह॒त्सदानु॒ श्येनी॑ सचते वर्त॒नीरह॑
verses.transliteration: adhīvāsám pári mātū́ rihánn áha  tuvigrébhiḥ sátvabhir yāti ví jráyaḥ  váyo dádhat padváte rérihat sádā-  -ánu śyénī sacate vartanī́r áha

translation.text: Licking the mantle of the Mother, far and wide he wanders over fields with beasts that flee apace. Strengthening all that walk, licking up all around, a blackened path, forsooth, he leaves where'er he goes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माक॑मग्ने म॒घव॑त्सु दीदि॒ह्यध॒ श्वसी॑वान्वृष॒भो दमू॑नाः अ॒वास्या॒ शिशु॑मतीरदीदे॒र्वर्मे॑व यु॒त्सु प॑रि॒जर्भु॑राणः
verses.transliteration: asmā́kam agne maghávatsu dīdihi-  ádha śvásīvān vr̥ṣabhó dámūnāḥ  avā́syā śíśumatīr adīder  vármeva yutsú parijárbhurāṇaḥ

translation.text: O Agni, shine resplendent with our wealthy chiefs, like a loud-snorting bull, accustomed to the house. Thou casting off thine infant wrappings blazest forth as though thou hadst put on a coat of mail for war.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दम॑ग्ने॒ सुधि॑तं॒ दुर्धि॑ता॒दधि॑ प्रि॒यादु॑ चि॒न्मन्म॑नः॒ प्रेयो॑ अस्तु ते यत्ते॑ शु॒क्रं त॒न्वो॒३॒॑ रोच॑ते॒ शुचि॒ तेना॒स्मभ्यं॑ वनसे॒ रत्न॒मा त्वम्
verses.transliteration: idám agne súdhitaṃ dúrdhitād ádhi  priyā́d u cin mánmanaḥ préyo astu te  yát te śukráṃ tanvò rócate śúci  ténāsmábhyaṃ vanase rátnam ā́ tvám

translation.text: May this our perfect prayer be dearer unto thee than an imperfect prayer although it please thee well. With the pure brilliancy that radiates from thy form, mayest thou grant to us abundant store of wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथा॑य॒ नाव॑मु॒त नो॑ गृ॒हाय॒ नित्या॑रित्रां प॒द्वतीं॑ रास्यग्ने अ॒स्माकं॑ वी॒राँ उ॒त नो॑ म॒घोनो॒ जनाँ॑श्च॒ या पा॒रया॒च्छर्म॒ या च॑
verses.transliteration: ráthāya nā́vam utá no gr̥hā́ya  nítyāritrām padvátīṃ rāsy agne  asmā́kaṃ vīrā́m̐ utá no maghóno  jánāṃś ca yā́ pāráyāc chárma yā́ ca

translation.text: Grant to our chariot, to our house, O Agni, a boat with moving feet and constant oarage, One that may further well our wealthy princes and all the folk, and be our certain refuge.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भी नो॑ अग्न उ॒क्थमिज्जु॑गुर्या॒ द्यावा॒क्षामा॒ सिन्ध॑वश्च॒ स्वगू॑र्ताः गव्यं॒ यव्यं॒ यन्तो॑ दी॒र्घाहेषं॒ वर॑मरु॒ण्यो॑ वरन्त
verses.transliteration: abhī́ no agna ukthám íj juguryāḥ-  dyā́vākṣā́mā síndhavaś ca svágūrtāḥ  gávyaṃ yávyaṃ yánto dīrghā́hā-  -íṣaṃ váram aruṇyò varanta

translation.text: Welcome our laud with thine approval, Agni. May earth and heaven and freely flowing rivers Yield us long life and food and corn and cattle, and may the red Dawns choose for us their choicest.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: बळि॒त्था तद्वपु॑षे धायि दर्श॒तं दे॒वस्य॒ भर्गः॒ सह॑सो॒ यतो॒ जनि॑ यदी॒मुप॒ ह्वर॑ते॒ साध॑ते म॒तिर्ऋ॒तस्य॒ धेना॑ अनयन्त स॒स्रुतः॑
verses.transliteration: báḷ itthā́ tád vápuṣe dhāyi darśatáṃ  devásya bhárgaḥ sáhaso yáto jáni  yád īm úpa hvárate sā́dhate matír  r̥tásya dhénā anayanta sasrútaḥ

translation.text: YEA, verily, the fair effulgence of the God for glory was established, since he sprang from strength. When he inclines thereto successful is the hymn: the songs of sacrifice have brought him as they flow

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒क्षो वपुः॑ पितु॒मान्नित्य॒ आ श॑ये द्वि॒तीय॒मा स॒प्तशि॑वासु मा॒तृषु॑ तृ॒तीय॑मस्य वृष॒भस्य॑ दो॒हसे॒ दश॑प्रमतिं जनयन्त॒ योष॑णः
verses.transliteration: pr̥kṣó vápuḥ pitumā́n nítya ā́ śaye  dvitī́yam ā́ saptáśivāsu mātŕ̥ṣu  tr̥tī́yam asya vr̥ṣabhásya doháse  dáśapramatiṃ janayanta yóṣaṇaḥ

translation.text: Wonderful, rich in nourishment, he dwells in food; next, in the seven auspicious Mothers is his home. Thirdly, that they might drain the treasures of the Bull, the maidens brought forth him for whom the ten provide.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निर्यदीं॑ बु॒ध्नान्म॑हि॒षस्य॒ वर्प॑स ईशा॒नासः॒ शव॑सा॒ क्रन्त॑ सू॒रयः॑ यदी॒मनु॑ प्र॒दिवो॒ मध्व॑ आध॒वे गुहा॒ सन्तं॑ मात॒रिश्वा॑ मथा॒यति॑
verses.transliteration: nír yád īm budhnā́n mahiṣásya várpasaḥ-  īśānā́saḥ śávasā kránta sūráyaḥ  yád īm ánu pradívo mádhva ādhavé  gúhā sántam mātaríśvā mathāyáti

translation.text: What time from out the deep, from the Steer's wondrous form, the Chiefs who had the power produced him with their strength; When Mâtariṣvan rubbed forth him who lay concealed, for mixture of the sweet drink, in the days of old.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यत्पि॒तुः प॑र॒मान्नी॒यते॒ पर्या पृ॒क्षुधो॑ वी॒रुधो॒ दंसु॑ रोहति उ॒भा यद॑स्य ज॒नुषं॒ यदिन्व॑त॒ आदिद्यवि॑ष्ठो अभवद्घृ॒णा शुचिः॑
verses.transliteration: prá yát pitúḥ paramā́n nīyáte pári-  ā́ pr̥kṣúdho vīrúdho dáṃsu rohati  ubhā́ yád asya janúṣaṃ yád ínvataḥ-  ā́d íd yáviṣṭho abhavad ghr̥ṇā́ śúciḥ

translation.text: When from the Highest Father he is brought to us, amid the plants he rises hungry, wondrously. As both together join to expedite his birth, most youthful he is born resplendent in his light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदिन्मा॒तॄरावि॑श॒द्यास्वा शुचि॒रहिं॑स्यमान उर्वि॒या वि वा॑वृधे अनु॒ यत्पूर्वा॒ अरु॑हत्सना॒जुवो॒ नि नव्य॑सी॒ष्वव॑रासु धावते
verses.transliteration: ā́d ín mātr̥̄́r ā́viśad yā́sv ā́ śúcir  áhiṃsyamāna urviyā́ ví vāvr̥dhe  ánu yát pū́rvā áruhat sanājúvo  ní návyasīṣv ávarāsu dhāvate

translation.text: Then also entered he the Mothers, and in them pure and uninjured he increased in magnitude. As to the first he rose, the vigorous from of old, so now he runs among the younger lowest ones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आदिद्धोता॑रं वृणते॒ दिवि॑ष्टिषु॒ भग॑मिव पपृचा॒नास॑ ऋञ्जते दे॒वान्यत्क्रत्वा॑ म॒ज्मना॑ पुरुष्टु॒तो मर्तं॒ शंसं॑ वि॒श्वधा॒ वेति॒ धाय॑से
verses.transliteration: ā́d íd dhótāraṃ vr̥ṇate díviṣṭiṣu  bhágam iva papr̥cānā́sa r̥ñjate  devā́n yát krátvā majmánā puruṣṭutó  mártaṃ śáṃsaṃ viśvádhā véti dhā́yase

translation.text: Therefore they choose him Herald at the morning rites, pressing to him as unto Bhaga, pouring gifts, When, much-praised, by the power and will of Gods, he goes at all times to his mortal worshipper to drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि यदस्था॑द्यज॒तो वात॑चोदितो ह्वा॒रो न वक्वा॑ ज॒रणा॒ अना॑कृतः तस्य॒ पत्म॑न्द॒क्षुषः॑ कृ॒ष्णजं॑हसः॒ शुचि॑जन्मनो॒ रज॒ आ व्य॑ध्वनः
verses.transliteration: ví yád ásthād yajató vā́tacodito  hvāró ná vákvā jaráṇā ánākr̥taḥ  tásya pátman dakṣúṣaḥ kr̥ṣṇájaṃhasaḥ  śúcijanmano rája ā́ vyàdhvanaḥ

translation.text: What time the Holy One, wind-urged, hath risen up, serpent-like winding through the dry grass unrestrained, Dust lies upon the way of him who burneth all, black-winged and pure of birth who follows sundry paths.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथो॒ न या॒तः शिक्व॑भिः कृ॒तो द्यामङ्गे॑भिररु॒षेभि॑रीयते आद॑स्य॒ ते कृ॒ष्णासो॑ दक्षि सू॒रयः॒ शूर॑स्येव त्वे॒षथा॑दीषते॒ वयः॑
verses.transliteration: rátho ná yātáḥ śíkvabhiḥ kr̥tó  dyā́m áṅgebhir aruṣébhir īyate  ā́d asya té kr̥ṣṇā́so dakṣi sūráyaḥ  śū́rasyeva tveṣáthād īṣate váyaḥ

translation.text: Like a swift chariot made by men who know their art, he with his red limbs lifts himself aloft to heaven. Thy worshippers become by burning black of hue: their strength flies as before a hero's violence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॒ ह्य॑ग्ने॒ वरु॑णो धृ॒तव्र॑तो मि॒त्रः शा॑श॒द्रे अ॑र्य॒मा सु॒दान॑वः यत्सी॒मनु॒ क्रतु॑ना वि॒श्वथा॑ वि॒भुर॒रान्न ने॒मिः प॑रि॒भूरजा॑यथाः
verses.transliteration: tváyā hy àgne váruṇo dhr̥távrato  mitráḥ śāśadré aryamā́ sudā́navaḥ  yát sīm ánu krátunā viśváthā vibhúr  arā́n ná nemíḥ paribhū́r ájāyathāḥ

translation.text: By thee, O Agni, Varuṇa who guards the Law, Mitra and Aryaman, the Bounteous, are made strong; For, as the felly holds the spokes, thou with thy might pervading hast been born encompassing them round.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने शशमा॒नाय॑ सुन्व॒ते रत्नं॑ यविष्ठ दे॒वता॑तिमिन्वसि तं त्वा॒ नु नव्यं॑ सहसो युवन्व॒यं भगं॒ न का॒रे म॑हिरत्न धीमहि
verses.transliteration: tvám agne śaśamānā́ya sunvaté  rátnaṃ yaviṣṭha devátātim invasi  táṃ tvā nú návyaṃ sahaso yuvan vayám  bhágaṃ ná kāré mahiratna dhīmahi

translation.text: Agni, to him who toils and pours libations, thou, Most Youthful! sendest wealth and all the host of Gods. Thee, therefore, even as Bhaga, will we set anew, young Child of Strength, most wealthy! in our battle-song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे र॒यिं न स्वर्थं॒ दमू॑नसं॒ भगं॒ दक्षं॒ न प॑पृचासि धर्ण॒सिम् र॒श्मीँरि॑व॒ यो यम॑ति॒ जन्म॑नी उ॒भे दे॒वानां॒ शंस॑मृ॒त आ च॑ सु॒क्रतुः॑
verses.transliteration: asmé rayíṃ ná svárthaṃ dámūnasam  bhágaṃ dákṣaṃ ná papr̥cāsi dharṇasím  raśmī́m̐r iva yó yámati jánmanī ubhé  devā́nāṃ śáṃsam r̥tá ā́ ca sukrátuḥ

translation.text: Vouchsafe us riches turned to worthy ends, good luck abiding in the house, and strong capacity, Wealth that directs both worlds as they were guiding-reins, and, very Wise, the Gods' assent in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नः॑ सु॒द्योत्मा॑ जी॒राश्वो॒ होता॑ म॒न्द्रः शृ॑णवच्च॒न्द्रर॑थः स नो॑ नेष॒न्नेष॑तमै॒रमू॑रो॒ऽग्निर्वा॒मं सु॑वि॒तं वस्यो॒ अच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: utá naḥ sudyótmā jīrā́śvo  hótā mandráḥ śr̥ṇavac candrárathaḥ  sá no neṣan néṣatamair ámūro  -agnír vāmáṃ suvitáṃ vásyo ácha

translation.text: May he, the Priest resplendent, joyful, hear us, he with the radiant car and rapid horses. May Agni, ever wise, with best directions to bliss and highest happiness conduct us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्ता॑व्य॒ग्निः शिमी॑वद्भिर॒र्कैः साम्रा॑ज्याय प्रत॒रं दधा॑नः अ॒मी च॒ ये म॒घवा॑नो व॒यं च॒ मिहं॒ न सूरो॒ अति॒ निष्ट॑तन्युः
verses.transliteration: ástāvy agníḥ śímīvadbhir arkaíḥ  sā́mrājyāya prataráṃ dádhānaḥ  amī́ ca yé maghávāno vayáṃ ca  míhaṃ ná sū́ro áti níṣ ṭatanyuḥ

translation.text: With hymns of might hath Agni now been lauded, advanced to height of universal kingship. Now may these wealthy chiefs and we together spread forth as spreads the Sun above the rainclouds.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑द्धो अग्न॒ आ व॑ह दे॒वाँ अ॒द्य य॒तस्रु॑चे तन्तुं॑ तनुष्व पू॒र्व्यं सु॒तसो॑माय दा॒शुषे॑
verses.transliteration: sámiddho agna ā́ vaha  devā́m̐ adyá yatásruce  tántuṃ tanuṣva pūrvyáṃ  sutásomāya dāśúṣe

translation.text: KINDLED, bring, Agni, Gods to-day for him who lifts the ladle up. Spin out the ancient thread for him who sheds, with gifts, the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृ॒तव॑न्त॒मुप॑ मासि॒ मधु॑मन्तं तनूनपात् य॒ज्ञं विप्र॑स्य॒ माव॑तः शशमा॒नस्य॑ दा॒शुषः॑
verses.transliteration: ghr̥távantam úpa māsi  mádhumantaṃ tanūnapād  yajñáṃ víprasya mā́vataḥ  śaśamānásya dāśúṣaḥ

translation.text: Thou dealest forth, Tanûnapât, sweet sacrifice enriched with oil, Brought by a singer such as I who offers gifts and toils for thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुचिः॑ पाव॒को अद्भु॑तो॒ मध्वा॑ य॒ज्ञं मि॑मिक्षति नरा॒शंस॒स्त्रिरा दि॒वो दे॒वो दे॒वेषु॑ य॒ज्ञियः॑
verses.transliteration: śúciḥ pāvakó ádbhuto  mádhvā yajñám mimikṣati  nárāśáṃsaḥ trír ā́ divó  devó devéṣu yajñíyaḥ

translation.text: He wondrous, sanctifying, bright, sprinkles the sacrifice with mead, Thrice, Narâṣansa from the heavens, a God mid Gods adorable.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒ळि॒तो अ॑ग्न॒ आ व॒हेन्द्रं॑ चि॒त्रमि॒ह प्रि॒यम् इ॒यं हि त्वा॑ म॒तिर्ममाच्छा॑ सुजिह्व व॒च्यते॑
verses.transliteration: īḷitó agna ā́ vaha-  -índraṃ citrám ihá priyám  iyáṃ hí tvā matír máma-  -áchā sujihva vacyáte

translation.text: Agni, besought, bring hitherward Indra the Friend, the Wonderful, For this my hymn of praise, O sweet of tongue, is chanted forth to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तृ॒णा॒नासो॑ य॒तस्रु॑चो ब॒र्हिर्य॒ज्ञे स्व॑ध्व॒रे वृ॒ञ्जे दे॒वव्य॑चस्तम॒मिन्द्रा॑य॒ शर्म॑ स॒प्रथः॑
verses.transliteration: str̥ṇānā́so yatásruco  barhír yajñé svadhvaré  vr̥ñjé devávyacastamam  índrāya śárma sapráthaḥ

translation.text: The ladle-holders strew trimmed grass at this well-ordered sacrifice; A home for Indra is adorned, wide, fittest to receive the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि श्र॑यन्तामृता॒वृधः॑ प्र॒यै दे॒वेभ्यो॑ म॒हीः पा॒व॒कासः॑ पुरु॒स्पृहो॒ द्वारो॑ दे॒वीर॑स॒श्चतः॑
verses.transliteration: ví śrayantām r̥tāvŕ̥dho  prayaí devébhyo mahī́ḥ  pāvakā́saḥ puruspŕ̥ho  dvā́ro devī́r asaścátaḥ

translation.text: Thrown open be the Doors Divine, unfailing, that assist the rite, High, purifying, much-desired, so that the Gods may enter in.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ भन्द॑माने॒ उपा॑के॒ नक्तो॒षासा॑ सु॒पेश॑सा य॒ह्वी ऋ॒तस्य॑ मा॒तरा॒ सीद॑तां ब॒र्हिरा सु॒मत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ bhándamāne úpāke  náktoṣā́sā supéśasā-  yahvī́ r̥tásya mātárā  sī́datām barhír ā́ sumát

translation.text: May Night and Morning, hymned with lauds, united, fair to look upon, Strong Mothers of the sacrifice, seat them together on the grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒न्द्रजि॑ह्वा जुगु॒र्वणी॒ होता॑रा॒ दैव्या॑ क॒वी य॒ज्ञं नो॑ यक्षतामि॒मं सि॒ध्रम॒द्य दि॑वि॒स्पृश॑म्
verses.transliteration: mandrájihvā jugurváṇī  hótārā daívyā kavī́  yajñáṃ no yakṣatām imám  sidhrám adyá divispŕ̥śam

translation.text: May the two Priests Divine, the sage, the sweet-voiced lovers of the hymn, Complete this sacrifice of ours, effectual, reaching heaven to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुचि॑र्दे॒वेष्वर्पि॑ता॒ होत्रा॑ म॒रुत्सु॒ भार॑ती इळा॒ सर॑स्वती म॒ही ब॒र्हिः सी॑दन्तु य॒ज्ञियाः॑
verses.transliteration: śúcir devéṣv árpitā  hótrā marútsu bhā́ratī  íḷā sárasvatī mahī́  barhíḥ sīdantu yajñíyāḥ

translation.text: Let Hotrâ pure, set amang Gods, amid the Maruts Bhirati, Iḷâ, Sarasvatî, Mahi, rest on the grass, adorable.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्न॑स्तु॒रीप॒मद्भु॑तं पु॒रु वारं॑ पु॒रु त्मना॑ त्वष्टा॒ पोषा॑य॒ वि ष्य॑तु रा॒ये नाभा॑ नो अस्म॒युः
verses.transliteration: tán nas turī́pam ádbhutam  purú vā́ram purú tmánā  tváṣṭā póṣāya ví ṣyatu  rāyé nā́bhā no asmayúḥ

translation.text: May Tvashṭar send us genial dew abundant, wondrous, rich in gifts, For increase and for growth of wealth, Tvashṭar our kinsman and our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒व॒सृ॒जन्नुप॒ त्मना॑ दे॒वान्य॑क्षि वनस्पते अ॒ग्निर्ह॒व्या सु॑षूदति दे॒वो दे॒वेषु॒ मेधि॑रः
verses.transliteration: avasr̥jánn úpa tmánā  devā́n yakṣi vanaspate  agnír havyā́ suṣūdati  devó devéṣu médhiro

translation.text: Vanaspati, give forth, thyself, and call the Gods to sacrifice. May Agni, God intelligent, speed our oblation to the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒ष॒ण्वते॑ म॒रुत्व॑ते वि॒श्वदे॑वाय वा॒यवे॑ स्वाहा॑ गाय॒त्रवे॑पसे ह॒व्यमिन्द्रा॑य कर्तन
verses.transliteration: pūṣaṇváte marútvate  viśvádevāya vāyáve  svā́hā gāyatrávepase  havyám índrāya kartana

translation.text: To Vâyu joined with Pûshan, with the Maruts, and the host of Gods, To Indra who inspires the hymn cry Glory! and present the gift.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वाहा॑कृता॒न्या ग॒ह्युप॑ ह॒व्यानि॑ वी॒तये॑ इन्द्रा ग॑हि श्रु॒धी हवं॒ त्वां ह॑वन्ते अध्व॒रे
verses.transliteration: svā́hākr̥tāny ā́ gahi-  úpa havyā́ni vītáye  índrā́ gahi śrudhī́ hávaṃ  tvā́ṃ havante adhvaré

translation.text: Come hither to enjoy the gifts prepared with cry of Glory! Come, O Indra, hear their calling; they invite thee to the sacrifice.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तव्य॑सीं॒ नव्य॑सीं धी॒तिम॒ग्नये॑ वा॒चो म॒तिं सह॑सः सू॒नवे॑ भरे अ॒पां नपा॒द्यो वसु॑भिः स॒ह प्रि॒यो होता॑ पृथि॒व्यां न्यसी॑ददृ॒त्वियः॑
verses.transliteration: prá távyasīṃ návyasīṃ dhītím agnáye  vācó matíṃ sáhasaḥ sūnáve bhare  apā́ṃ nápād yó vásubhiḥ sahá priyó  hótā pr̥thivyā́ṃ ny ásīdad r̥tvíyaḥ

translation.text: To Agni I present a newer mightier hymn, I bring my words and song unto the Son of Strength, Who, Offspring of the Waters, bearing precious things sits on the earth, in season, dear Invoking Priest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स जाय॑मानः पर॒मे व्यो॑मन्या॒विर॒ग्निर॑भवन्मात॒रिश्व॑ने अ॒स्य क्रत्वा॑ समिधा॒नस्य॑ म॒ज्मना॒ प्र द्यावा॑ शो॒चिः पृ॑थि॒वी अ॑रोचयत्
verses.transliteration: sá jā́yamānaḥ paramé vyòmani-  āvír agnír abhavan mātaríśvane  asyá krátvā samidhānásya majmánā  prá dyā́vā śocíḥ pr̥thivī́ arocayat

translation.text: Soon as he sprang to birth that Agni was shown forth to Mâtariṣvan in the highest firmament. When he was kindled, through his power and majesty his fiery splendour made the heavens and earth to shine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य त्वे॒षा अ॒जरा॑ अ॒स्य भा॒नवः॑ सुसं॒दृशः॑ सु॒प्रती॑कस्य सु॒द्युतः॑ भात्व॑क्षसो॒ अत्य॒क्तुर्न सिन्ध॑वो॒ऽग्ने रे॑जन्ते॒ अस॑सन्तो अ॒जराः॑
verses.transliteration: asyá tveṣā́ ajárā asyá bhānávaḥ  susaṃdŕ̥śaḥ suprátīkasya sudyútaḥ  bhā́tvakṣaso áty aktúr ná síndhavo  -agné rejante ásasanto ajárāḥ

translation.text: His flames that wax not old, beams fair to look upon of him whose face is lovely, shine with beauteous sheen. The rays of Agni, him whose active force is light, through the nights glimmer sleepless, ageless, like the floods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यमे॑रि॒रे भृग॑वो वि॒श्ववे॑दसं॒ नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्या भुव॑नस्य म॒ज्मना॑ अ॒ग्निं तं गी॒र्भिर्हि॑नुहि॒ स्व आ दमे॒ य एको॒ वस्वो॒ वरु॑णो॒ न राज॑ति
verses.transliteration: yám eriré bhŕ̥gavo viśvávedasaṃ  nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ bhúvanasya majmánā  agníṃ táṃ gīrbhír hinuhi svá ā́ dáme  yá éko vásvo váruṇo ná rā́jati

translation.text: Send thou with hymns that Agni to his own abode, who rules, one Sovran Lord of wealth, like Varuṇa, Him, All-possessor, whom the Bhr̥igus with their might brought to earth's central point, the centre of the world.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यो वरा॑य म॒रुता॑मिव स्व॒नः सेने॑व सृ॒ष्टा दि॒व्या यथा॒शनिः॑ अ॒ग्निर्जम्भै॑स्तिगि॒तैर॑त्ति॒ भर्व॑ति यो॒धो न शत्रू॒न्त्स वना॒ न्यृ॑ञ्जते
verses.transliteration: ná yó várāya marútām iva svanáḥ  séneva sr̥ṣṭā́ divyā́ yáthāśániḥ  agnír jámbhais tigitaír atti bhárvati  yodhó ná śátrūn sá vánā ny r̥̀ñjate

translation.text: He whom no force can stay, even as the Maruts' roar, like to a dart sent forth, even as the bolt from heaven, Agni with sharpened jaws chews up and cats the trees, and conquers them as when the warrior smites his foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒विन्नो॑ अ॒ग्निरु॒चथ॑स्य॒ वीरस॒द्वसु॑ष्कु॒विद्वसु॑भिः॒ काम॑मा॒वर॑त् चो॒दः कु॒वित्तु॑तु॒ज्यात्सा॒तये॒ धियः॒ शुचि॑प्रतीकं॒ तम॒या धि॒या गृ॑णे
verses.transliteration: kuvín no agnír ucáthasya vī́r ásad  vásuṣ kuvíd vásubhiḥ kā́mam āvárat  codáḥ kuvít tutujyā́t sātáye dhíyaḥ  śúcipratīkaṃ tám ayā́ dhiyā́ gr̥ṇe

translation.text: And will not Agni find enjoyment in our praise, will not the Vasu grant our wish with gifts of wealth? Will not the Inspirer speed our prayers to gain their end? Him with the radiant glance I laud with this my song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृ॒तप्र॑तीकं व ऋ॒तस्य॑ धू॒र्षद॑म॒ग्निं मि॒त्रं न स॑मिधा॒न ऋ॑ञ्जते इन्धा॑नो अ॒क्रो वि॒दथे॑षु॒ दीद्य॑च्छु॒क्रव॑र्णा॒मुदु॑ नो यंसते॒ धिय॑म्
verses.transliteration: ghr̥tápratīkaṃ va r̥tásya dhūrṣádam  agním mitráṃ ná samidhāná r̥ñjate  índhāno akró vidátheṣu dī́dyac  -śukrávarṇām úd u no yaṃsate dhíyam

translation.text: The kindler of the flame wins Agni as a Friend, promoter of the Law, whose face is bright with oil. Inflamed and keen, refulgent in our gatherings, he lifts our hymn on high clad in his radiant hues.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप्र॑युच्छ॒न्नप्र॑युच्छद्भिरग्ने शि॒वेभि॑र्नः पा॒युभिः॑ पाहि श॒ग्मैः अद॑ब्धेभि॒रदृ॑पितेभिरि॒ष्टेऽनि॑मिषद्भिः॒ परि॑ पाहि नो॒ जाः
verses.transliteration: áprayuchann áprayuchadbhir agne  śivébhir naḥ pāyúbhiḥ pāhi śagmaíḥ  ádabdhebhir ádr̥pitebhir iṣṭe-  -ánimiṣadbhiḥ pári pāhi no jā́ḥ

translation.text: Keep us incessantly with guards that cease not, Agni, with guards auspicious, very mighty. With guards that never slumber, never heedless, never beguiled. O Helper, keep our children.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: एति॒ प्र होता॑ व्र॒तम॑स्य मा॒ययो॒र्ध्वां दधा॑नः॒ शुचि॑पेशसं॒ धिय॑म् अ॒भि स्रुचः॑ क्रमते दक्षिणा॒वृतो॒ या अ॑स्य॒ धाम॑ प्रथ॒मं ह॒ निंस॑ते
verses.transliteration: éti prá hótā vratám asya māyáyā-  -ūrdhvā́ṃ dádhānaḥ śúcipeśasaṃ dhíyam  abhí srúcaḥ kramate dakṣiṇāvŕ̥to  yā́ asya dhā́ma prathamáṃ ha níṃsate

translation.text: THE Priest goes forth to sacrifice, with wondrous power sending aloft the hymn of glorious brilliancy. He moves to meet the ladles turning to the right, which are the first to kiss the place where he abides.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भीमृ॒तस्य॑ दो॒हना॑ अनूषत॒ योनौ॑ दे॒वस्य॒ सद॑ने॒ परी॑वृताः अ॒पामु॒पस्थे॒ विभृ॑तो॒ यदाव॑स॒दध॑ स्व॒धा अ॑धय॒द्याभि॒रीय॑ते
verses.transliteration: abhī́m r̥tásya dohánā anūṣata  yónau devásya sádane párīvr̥tāḥ  apā́m upásthe víbhr̥to yád ā́vasad  ádha svadhā́ adhayad yā́bhir ī́yate

translation.text: To him sang forth the flowing streams of Holy Law, encompassed in the home and birth-place of the God. He, when he dwelt extended in the waters' lap, absorbed those Godlike powers for which he is adored.

verses.sanskrit_deva: युयू॑षतः॒ सव॑यसा॒ तदिद्वपुः॑ समा॒नमर्थं॑ वि॒तरि॑त्रता मि॒थः आदीं॒ भगो॒ न हव्यः॒ सम॒स्मदा वोळ्हु॒र्न र॒श्मीन्त्सम॑यंस्त॒ सार॑थिः
verses.transliteration: yúyūṣataḥ sávayasā tád íd vápuḥ  samānám árthaṃ vitáritratā mitháḥ  ā́d īm bhágo ná hávyaḥ sám asmád~ā́  vóḷhur ná raśmī́n sám ayaṃsta sā́rathiḥ

translation.text: Seeking in course altern to reach the selfsame end the two copartners strive to win this beauteous form. Like Bhaga must he be duly invoked by us, as he who drives the car holds fast the horse's reins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यमीं॒ द्वा सव॑यसा सप॒र्यतः॑ समा॒ने योना॑ मिथु॒ना समो॑कसा दिवा॒ न नक्तं॑ पलि॒तो युवा॑जनि पु॒रू चर॑न्न॒जरो॒ मानु॑षा यु॒गा
verses.transliteration: yám īṃ dvā́ sávayasā saparyátaḥ  samāné yónā mithunā́ sámokasā  dívā ná náktam palitó yúvājani  purū́ cárann ajáro mā́nuṣā yugā́

translation.text: He whom the two copartners with observance tend, the pair who dwell together in the same abode, By night as in the day the grey one was born young, passing untouched by eld through many an age of man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमीं॑ हिन्वन्ति धी॒तयो॒ दश॒ व्रिशो॑ दे॒वं मर्ता॑स ऊ॒तये॑ हवामहे धनो॒रधि॑ प्र॒वत॒ आ स ऋ॑ण्वत्यभि॒व्रज॑द्भिर्व॒युना॒ नवा॑धित
verses.transliteration: tám īṃ hinvanti dhītáyo dáśa vríśo  devám mártāsa ūtáye havāmahe  dhánor ádhi praváta ā́ sá r̥ṇvati-  abhivrájadbhir vayúnā návādhita

translation.text: Him the ten fingers, the devotions. animate: we mortals call on him a God to give us help. He speeds over the sloping surface of the land: new deeds hath he performed with those who gird him round.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ह्य॑ग्ने दि॒व्यस्य॒ राज॑सि॒ त्वं पार्थि॑वस्य पशु॒पा इ॑व॒ त्मना॑ एनी॑ त ए॒ते बृ॑ह॒ती अ॑भि॒श्रिया॑ हिर॒ण्ययी॒ वक्व॑री ब॒र्हिरा॑शाते
verses.transliteration: tváṃ hy àgne divyásya rā́jasi  tvám pā́rthivasya paśupā́ iva tmánā  énī ta eté br̥hatī́ abhiśríyā  hiraṇyáyī vákvarī barhír āśāte

translation.text: For, Agni, like a herdsman, thou by thine own might rulest o'er all that is in heaven and on the earth; And these two Mighty Ones, bright, golden closely joined, rolling them round are come unto thy sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ जु॒षस्व॒ प्रति॑ हर्य॒ तद्वचो॒ मन्द्र॒ स्वधा॑व॒ ऋत॑जात॒ सुक्र॑तो यो वि॒श्वतः॑ प्र॒त्यङ्ङसि॑ दर्श॒तो र॒ण्वः संदृ॑ष्टौ पितु॒माँ इ॑व॒ क्षयः॑
verses.transliteration: ágne juṣásva práti harya tád váco  mándra svádhāva ŕ̥tajāta súkrato  yó viśvátaḥ pratyáṅṅ ási darśató  raṇváḥ sáṃdr̥ṣṭau pitumā́m̐ iva kṣáyaḥ

translation.text: Agni, accept with joy, be glad in this our prayer, joy-giver, self-sustained, strong, born of Holy Law! For fair to see art thou turning to every side, pleasant to look on as a dwelling filled with food.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं पृ॑च्छता॒ स ज॑गामा॒ स वे॑द॒ स चि॑कि॒त्वाँ ई॑यते॒ सा न्वी॑यते तस्मि॑न्त्सन्ति प्र॒शिष॒स्तस्मि॑न्नि॒ष्टयः॒ स वाज॑स्य॒ शव॑सः शु॒ष्मिण॒स्पतिः॑
verses.transliteration: tám pr̥chatā sá jagāmā sá veda  sá cikitvā́m̐ īyate sā́ nv ī̀yate  tásmin santi praśíṣas tásminn iṣṭáyaḥ  sá vā́jasya śávasaḥ śuṣmíṇas pátiḥ

translation.text: Ask ye of him for he is come, he knoweth it; he, full of wisdom, is implored, is now implored. With him are admonitions and with him commands: he is the Lord of Strength, the Lord of Power and Might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमित्पृ॑च्छन्ति॒ न सि॒मो वि पृ॑च्छति॒ स्वेने॑व॒ धीरो॒ मन॑सा॒ यदग्र॑भीत् न मृ॑ष्यते प्रथ॒मं नाप॑रं॒ वचो॒ऽस्य क्रत्वा॑ सचते॒ अप्र॑दृपितः
verses.transliteration: tám ít pr̥chanti ná simó ví pr̥chati  svéneva dhī́ro mánasā yád ágrabhīt  ná mr̥ṣyate prathamáṃ nā́paraṃ váco  -asyá krátvā sacate ápradr̥pitaḥ

translation.text: They ask of him: not all learn by their questioning what he, the Sage, hath grasped, as 'twere, with his own mind. Forgetting not the former nor the later word, he goeth on, not careless, in his mental power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमिद्ग॑च्छन्ति जु॒ह्व१॒॑स्तमर्व॑ती॒र्विश्वा॒न्येकः॑ शृणव॒द्वचां॑सि मे पु॒रु॒प्रै॒षस्ततु॑रिर्यज्ञ॒साध॒नोऽच्छि॑द्रोतिः॒ शिशु॒राद॑त्त॒ सं रभः॑
verses.transliteration: tám íd gachanti juhvàs tám árvatīr  víśvāny ékaḥ śr̥ṇavad vácāṃsi me  purupraiṣás táturir yajñasā́dhanaḥ-  -áchidrotiḥ śíśur ā́datta sáṃ rábhaḥ

translation.text: To him these ladles go, to him these racing mares: he only will give ear to all the words I speak. All-speeding, victor, perfecter of sacrifice, the Babe with flawless help hath mustered vigorous might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒प॒स्थायं॑ चरति॒ यत्स॒मार॑त स॒द्यो जा॒तस्त॑त्सार॒ युज्ये॑भिः अ॒भि श्वा॒न्तं मृ॑शते ना॒न्द्ये॑ मु॒दे यदीं॒ गच्छ॑न्त्युश॒तीर॑पिष्ठि॒तम्
verses.transliteration: upasthā́yaṃ carati yát samā́rata  sadyó jātás tatsāra yújyebhiḥ  abhí śvāntám mr̥śate nāndyè mudé  yád īṃ gáchanty uśatī́r apiṣṭhitám

translation.text: Whate'er he meets he grasps and then runs farther on, and straightway, newly born,creeps forward with his kin. He stirs the wearied man to pleasure and great joy what time the longing gifts approach him as he comes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स ईं॑ मृ॒गो अप्यो॑ वन॒र्गुरुप॑ त्व॒च्यु॑प॒मस्यां॒ नि धा॑यि व्य॑ब्रवीद्व॒युना॒ मर्त्ये॑भ्यो॒ऽग्निर्वि॒द्वाँ ऋ॑त॒चिद्धि स॒त्यः
verses.transliteration: sá īm mr̥gó ápyo vanargúr  úpa tvacy ùpamásyāṃ ní dhāyi  vy àbravīd vayúnā mártyebhyo  -agnír vidvā́m̐ r̥tacíd dhí satyáḥ

translation.text: He is a wild thing of the flood and forest: he hath been laid upon the highest surface. He hath declared the lore of works to mortals, Agni the Wise, for he knows Law, the Truthful.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒मू॒र्धानं॑ स॒प्तर॑श्मिं गृणी॒षेऽनू॑नम॒ग्निं पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थे॑ नि॒ष॒त्तम॑स्य॒ चर॑तो ध्रु॒वस्य॒ विश्वा॑ दि॒वो रो॑च॒नाप॑प्रि॒वांस॑म्
verses.transliteration: trimūrdhā́naṃ saptáraśmiṃ gr̥ṇīṣe-  -ánūnam agním pitrór upásthe  niṣattám asya cárato dhruvásya  víśvā divó rocanā́paprivā́ṃsam

translation.text: I LAUD the seven-rayed, the triple-headed, Agni all-perfect in his Parents' bosom, Sunk in the lap of all that moves and moves not, him who hath filled all luminous realms of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्षा म॒हाँ अ॒भि व॑वक्ष एने अ॒जर॑स्तस्थावि॒तऊ॑तिर्ऋ॒ष्वः उ॒र्व्याः प॒दो नि द॑धाति॒ सानौ॑ रि॒हन्त्यूधो॑ अरु॒षासो॑ अस्य
verses.transliteration: ukṣā́ mahā́m̐ abhí vavakṣa ene  ajáras tasthāv itáūtir r̥ṣváḥ  urvyā́ḥ padó ní dadhāti sā́nau  rihánty ū́dho aruṣā́so asya

translation.text: As a great Steer he grew to these his Parents; sublime lie stands, untouched by eld, far-reaching. He plants his footsteps on the lofty ridges of the broad earth: his red flames lick the udder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नं व॒त्सम॒भि सं॒चर॑न्ती॒ विष्व॑ग्धे॒नू वि च॑रतः सु॒मेके॑ अ॒न॒प॒वृ॒ज्याँ अध्व॑नो॒ मिमा॑ने॒ विश्वा॒न्केताँ॒ अधि॑ म॒हो दधा॑ने
verses.transliteration: samānáṃ vatsám abhí saṃcárantī  víṣvag dhenū́ ví carataḥ suméke  anapavr̥jyā́m̐ ádhvano mímāne  víśvān kétām̐ ádhi mahó dádhāne

translation.text: Coming together to their common youngling both Cows, fairshaped, spread forth in all directions, Measuring out the paths that must be travelled, entrusting all desires to him the Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धीरा॑सः प॒दं क॒वयो॑ नयन्ति॒ नाना॑ हृ॒दा रक्ष॑माणा अजु॒र्यम् सिषा॑सन्तः॒ पर्य॑पश्यन्त॒ सिन्धु॑मा॒विरे॑भ्यो अभव॒त्सूर्यो॒ नॄन्
verses.transliteration: dhī́rāsaḥ padáṃ kaváyo nayanti  nā́nā hr̥dā́ rákṣamāṇā ajuryám  síṣāsantaḥ páry apaśyanta síndhum  āvír ebhyo abhavat sū́ryo nr̥̄́n

translation.text: The prudent sages lead him to his dwelling, guarding with varied skill the Ever-Youthful. Longing, they turned their eyes unto the River: to these the Sun of men was manifested.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒दृ॒क्षेण्यः॒ परि॒ काष्ठा॑सु॒ जेन्य॑ ई॒ळेन्यो॑ म॒हो अर्भा॑य जी॒वसे॑ पु॒रु॒त्रा यदभ॑व॒त्सूरहै॑भ्यो॒ गर्भे॑भ्यो म॒घवा॑ वि॒श्वद॑र्शतः
verses.transliteration: didr̥kṣéṇyaḥ pári kā́ṣṭhāsu jényaḥ-  īḷényo mahó árbhāya jīváse  purutrā́ yád ábhavat sū́r áhaibhyo  gárbhebhyo maghávā viśvádarśataḥ

translation.text: Born noble in the regions, aim of all mens' eyes to be implored for life by great and small alike, Far as the Wealthy One hath spread himself abroad, he is the Sire all-visible of this progeny.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒था ते॑ अग्ने शु॒चय॑न्त आ॒योर्द॑दा॒शुर्वाजे॑भिराशुषा॒णाः उ॒भे यत्तो॒के तन॑ये॒ दधा॑ना ऋ॒तस्य॒ साम॑न्र॒णय॑न्त दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: kathā́ te agne śucáyanta āyór  dadāśúr vā́jebhir āśuṣāṇā́ḥ  ubhé yát toké tánaye dádhānāḥ-  r̥tásya sā́man raṇáyanta devā́ḥ

translation.text: How, Agni, have the radiant ones, aspiring, endued thee with the vigour of the living, So that on both sides fostering seed and offspring, the Gods may joy in Holy Law's fulfilment?

verses.sanskrit_deva: बोधा॑ मे अ॒स्य वच॑सो यविष्ठ॒ मंहि॑ष्ठस्य॒ प्रभृ॑तस्य स्वधावः पीय॑ति त्वो॒ अनु॑ त्वो गृणाति व॒न्दारु॑स्ते त॒न्वं॑ वन्दे अग्ने
verses.transliteration: bódhā me asyá vácaso yaviṣṭha  máṃhiṣṭhasya prábhr̥tasya svadhāvaḥ  pī́yati tvo ánu tvo gr̥ṇāti  vandā́rus te tanvàṃ vande agne

translation.text: Mark this my speech, Divine One, thou, Most Youthful! offered to thee by him who gives most freely. One hates thee, and another sings thy praises: I thine adorer laud thy form, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये पा॒यवो॑ मामते॒यं ते॑ अग्ने॒ पश्य॑न्तो अ॒न्धं दु॑रि॒तादर॑क्षन् र॒रक्ष॒ तान्त्सु॒कृतो॑ वि॒श्ववे॑दा॒ दिप्स॑न्त॒ इद्रि॒पवो॒ नाह॑ देभुः
verses.transliteration: yé pāyávo māmateyáṃ te agne  páśyanto andháṃ duritā́d árakṣan  rarákṣa tā́n sukŕ̥to viśvávedāḥ-  dípsanta íd ripávo nā́ha debhuḥ

translation.text: Thy guardian rays, O Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Mâmateya from affliction. Lord of all riches, he preserved the pious the foes who fain would harm them did no mischief.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो नो॑ अग्ने॒ अर॑रिवाँ अघा॒युर॑राती॒वा म॒र्चय॑ति द्व॒येन॑ मन्त्रो॑ गु॒रुः पुन॑रस्तु॒ सो अ॑स्मा॒ अनु॑ मृक्षीष्ट त॒न्वं॑ दुरु॒क्तैः
verses.transliteration: yó no agne árarivām̐ aghāyúr  arātīvā́ marcáyati dvayéna  mántro gurúḥ púnar astu só asmai-  ánu mr̥kṣīṣṭa tanvàṃ duruktaíḥ

translation.text: The sinful man who worships not, O Agni, who, offering not, harms us with double-dealing,– Be this in turn to him a heavy sentence may he distress himself by his revilings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त वा॒ यः स॑हस्य प्रवि॒द्वान्मर्तो॒ मर्तं॑ म॒र्चय॑ति द्व॒येन॑ अतः॑ पाहि स्तवमान स्तु॒वन्त॒मग्ने॒ माकि॑र्नो दुरि॒ताय॑ धायीः
verses.transliteration: utá vā yáḥ sahasya pravidvā́n  márto mártam marcáyati dvayéna  átaḥ pāhi stavamāna stuvántam  ágne mā́kir no duritā́ya dhāyīḥ

translation.text: Yea, when a mortal knowingly, O Victor, injures with double tongue a fellow-mortal, From him, praised Agni! save thou him that lauds thee: bring us not into trouble and affliction.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: मथी॒द्यदीं॑ वि॒ष्टो मा॑त॒रिश्वा॒ होता॑रं वि॒श्वाप्सुं॑ वि॒श्वदे॑व्यम् नि यं द॒धुर्म॑नु॒ष्या॑सु वि॒क्षु स्व१॒॑र्ण चि॒त्रं वपु॑षे वि॒भाव॑म्
verses.transliteration: máthīd yád īṃ viṣṭó mātaríśvā  hótāraṃ viśvā́psuṃ viśvádevyam  ní yáṃ dadhúr manuṣyā̀su vikṣú  svàr ṇá citráṃ vápuṣe vibhā́vam

translation.text: WHAT Mâtariṣvan, piercing, formed by friction, Herald of all the Gods. in varied figure, Is he whom they have set mid human houses, gay-hued as light and shining forth for beauty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒दा॒नमिन्न द॑दभन्त॒ मन्मा॒ग्निर्वरू॑थं॒ मम॒ तस्य॑ चाकन् जु॒षन्त॒ विश्वा॑न्यस्य॒ कर्मोप॑स्तुतिं॒ भर॑माणस्य का॒रोः
verses.transliteration: dadānám ín ná dadabhanta mánma-  -agnír várūtham máma tásya cākan  juṣánta víśvāny asya kárma-  -úpastutim bháramāṇasya kāróḥ

translation.text: They shall not harm the man who brings thee praises: such as I am, Agni my help approves me. All acts of mine shall they accept with pleasure, laudation from the singer who presents it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नित्ये॑ चि॒न्नु यं सद॑ने जगृ॒भ्रे प्रश॑स्तिभिर्दधि॒रे य॒ज्ञिया॑सः प्र सू न॑यन्त गृ॒भय॑न्त इ॒ष्टावश्वा॑सो॒ न र॒थ्यो॑ रारहा॒णाः
verses.transliteration: nítye cin nú yáṃ sádane jagr̥bhré  práśastibhir dadhiré yajñíyāsaḥ  prá sū́ nayanta gr̥bháyanta iṣṭā́v  áśvāso ná rathyò rārahāṇā́ḥ

translation.text: Him in his constant seat men skilled in worship have taken and with praises have established. As, harnessed to a chariot fleet-foot horses, at his command let bearers lead him forward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रूणि॑ द॒स्मो नि रि॑णाति॒ जम्भै॒राद्रो॑चते॒ वन॒ आ वि॒भावा॑ आद॑स्य॒ वातो॒ अनु॑ वाति शो॒चिरस्तु॒र्न शर्या॑मस॒नामनु॒ द्यून्
verses.transliteration: purū́ṇi dasmó ní riṇāti jámbhair  ā́d rocate vána ā́ vibhā́vā  ā́d asya vā́to ánu vāti śocír  ástur ná śáryām asanā́m ánu dyū́n

translation.text: Wondrous, full many a thing he chews and crunches: he shines amid the wood with spreading brightness. Upon his glowing flames the wind blows daily, driving them like the keen shaft of an archer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यं रि॒पवो॒ न रि॑ष॒ण्यवो॒ गर्भे॒ सन्तं॑ रेष॒णा रे॒षय॑न्ति अ॒न्धा अ॑प॒श्या न द॑भन्नभि॒ख्या नित्या॑स ईं प्रे॒तारो॑ अरक्षन्
verses.transliteration: ná yáṃ ripávo ná riṣaṇyávo  gárbhe sántaṃ reṣaṇā́ reṣáyanti  andhā́ apaśyā́ ná dabhann abhikhyā́  nítyāsa īm pretā́ro arakṣan

translation.text: Him, whom while yet in embryo the hostile, both skilled and fain to harm, may never injure, Men blind and sightless through his splendour hurt not: his never-failing lovers have preserved him.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हः स रा॒य एष॑ते॒ पति॒र्दन्नि॒न इ॒नस्य॒ वसु॑नः प॒द आ उप॒ ध्रज॑न्त॒मद्र॑यो वि॒धन्नित्
verses.transliteration: maháḥ sá rāyá éṣate pátir dánn  iná inásya vásunaḥ padá ā́  úpa dhrájantam ádrayo vidhánn ít

translation.text: HITHER he hastens to give, Lord of great riches, King of the mighty, to the place of treasure. lie pressing-stones shall serve him speeding near us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स यो वृषा॑ न॒रां न रोद॑स्योः॒ श्रवो॑भि॒रस्ति॑ जी॒वपी॑तसर्गः प्र यः स॑स्रा॒णः शि॑श्री॒त योनौ॑
verses.transliteration: sá yó vŕ̥ṣā narā́ṃ ná ródasyoḥ  śrávobhir ásti jīvápītasargaḥ  prá yáḥ sasrāṇáḥ śiśrītá yónau

translation.text: As Steer of men so Steer of earth and heaven by glory, he whose streams all life hath drunken, Who hasting forward rests upon the altar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यः पुरं॒ नार्मि॑णी॒मदी॑दे॒दत्यः॑ क॒विर्न॑भ॒न्यो॒३॒॑ नार्वा॑ सूरो॒ न रु॑रु॒क्वाञ्छ॒तात्मा॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ yáḥ púraṃ nā́rmiṇīm ádīded  átyaḥ kavír nabhanyò nā́rvā  sū́ro ná rurukvā́ñ chatā́tmā

translation.text: He who hath lighted up the joyous castle, wise Courser like the Steed of cloudy heaven, Bright like the Sun, with hundredfold existence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि द्वि॒जन्मा॒ त्री रो॑च॒नानि॒ विश्वा॒ रजां॑सि शुशुचा॒नो अ॑स्थात् होता॒ यजि॑ष्ठो अ॒पां स॒धस्थे॑
verses.transliteration: abhí dvijánmā trī́ rocanā́ni  víśvā rájāṃsi śuśucānó asthāt  hótā yájiṣṭho apā́ṃ sadhásthe

translation.text: He, doubly born, hath spread in his effulgence through the three luminous realms, through all the regions, Best sacrificing Priest where waters gather.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं स होता॒ यो द्वि॒जन्मा॒ विश्वा॑ द॒धे वार्या॑णि श्रव॒स्या मर्तो॒ यो अ॑स्मै सु॒तुको॑ द॒दाश॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ sá hótā yó dvijánmā víśvā  dadhé vā́ryāṇi śravasyā́  márto yó asmai sutúko dadā́śa

translation.text: Priest doubly born, he through his love of glory hath in his keeping all things worth the choosing, The man who brings him gifts hath noble offspring.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रु त्वा॑ दा॒श्वान्वो॑चे॒ऽरिर॑ग्ने॒ तव॑ स्वि॒दा तो॒दस्ये॑व शर॒ण आ म॒हस्य॑
verses.transliteration: purú tvā dāśvā́n voce  -arír agne táva svid ā́  todásyeva śaraṇá ā́ mahásya

translation.text: AGNI, thy faithful servant I call upon thee with many a gift, As in the keeping of the great inciting God;

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्य॑नि॒नस्य॑ ध॒निनः॑ प्रहो॒षे चि॒दर॑रुषः क॒दा च॒न प्र॒जिग॑तो॒ अदे॑वयोः
verses.transliteration: vy àninásya dhanínaḥ  prahoṣé cid áraruṣaḥ  kadā́ caná prajígato ádevayoḥ

translation.text: Thou who ne'er movest thee to aid the indolent, the godless man, Him who though wealthy never brings an offering.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स च॒न्द्रो वि॑प्र॒ मर्त्यो॑ म॒हो व्राध॑न्तमो दि॒वि प्रप्रेत्ते॑ अग्ने व॒नुषः॑ स्याम
verses.transliteration: sá candró vipra mártyo  mahó vrā́dhantamo diví  prá-prét te agne vanúṣaḥ syāma

translation.text: Splendid, O Singer, is that man, mightiest of the great in heaven. Agni, may we be foremost, we thy worshippers.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रं न यं शिम्या॒ गोषु॑ ग॒व्यवः॑ स्वा॒ध्यो॑ वि॒दथे॑ अ॒प्सु जीज॑नन् अरे॑जेतां॒ रोद॑सी॒ पाज॑सा गि॒रा प्रति॑ प्रि॒यं य॑ज॒तं ज॒नुषा॒मवः॑
