verses.transliteration: mitráṃ ná yáṃ śímyā góṣu gavyávaḥ  svādhyò vidáthe apsú jī́janan  árejetāṃ ródasī pā́jasā girā́  práti priyáṃ yajatáṃ janúṣām ávaḥ

translation.text: HEAVEN and earth trembled at the might and voice of him, whom, loved and Holy One, helper of all mankind, The wise who longed for spoil in fight for kine brought forth with power, a Friend, mid waters, at the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्ध॒ त्यद्वां॑ पुरुमी॒ळ्हस्य॑ सो॒मिनः॒ प्र मि॒त्रासो॒ न द॑धि॒रे स्वा॒भुवः॑ अध॒ क्रतुं॑ विदतं गा॒तुमर्च॑त उ॒त श्रु॑तं वृषणा प॒स्त्या॑वतः
verses.transliteration: yád dha tyád vām purumīḷhásya somínaḥ  prá mitrā́so ná dadhiré svābhúvaḥ  ádha krátuṃ vidataṃ gātúm árcate-  utá śrutaṃ vr̥ṣaṇā pastyā̀vataḥ

translation.text: As these, like friends, have done this work for you, these prompt servants of Purumîḷha Somaofferer, Give mental power to him who sings the sacred song, and hearken, Strong Ones, to the master ofthe house.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॑ भूषन्क्षि॒तयो॒ जन्म॒ रोद॑स्योः प्र॒वाच्यं॑ वृषणा॒ दक्ष॑से म॒हे यदी॑मृ॒ताय॒ भर॑थो॒ यदर्व॑ते॒ प्र होत्र॑या॒ शिम्या॑ वीथो अध्व॒रम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vām bhūṣan kṣitáyo jánma ródasyoḥ  pravā́cyaṃ vr̥ṣaṇā dákṣase mahé  yád īm r̥tā́ya bháratho yád árvate  prá hótrayā śímyā vītho adhvarám

translation.text: The folk have glorified your birth from Earth and Heaven, to be extolled, ye Strong Ones, for your mighty power. Ye, when ye bring to singer and the rite, enjoy the sacrifice periormed with holy praise and strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र सा क्षि॒तिर॑सुर॒ या महि॑ प्रि॒य ऋता॑वानावृ॒तमा घो॑षथो बृ॒हत् यु॒वं दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तो दक्ष॑मा॒भुवं॒ गां न धु॒र्युप॑ युञ्जाथे अ॒पः
verses.transliteration: prá sā́ kṣitír asura yā́ máhi priyā́-  ŕ̥tāvānāv r̥tám ā́ ghoṣatho br̥hát  yuváṃ divó br̥ható dákṣam ābhúvaṃ  gā́ṃ ná dhury úpa yuñjāthe apáḥ

translation.text: The people prospers, Asuras! whom ye dearly love: ye, Righteous Ones, proclaim aloud the Holy Law. That efficacious power that comes from lofty heaven, ye bind unto the work, as to the pole an ox.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒ही अत्र॑ महि॒ना वार॑मृण्वथोऽरे॒णव॒स्तुज॒ आ सद्म॑न्धे॒नवः॑ स्वर॑न्ति॒ ता उ॑प॒रता॑ति॒ सूर्य॒मा नि॒म्रुच॑ उ॒षस॑स्तक्व॒वीरि॑व
verses.transliteration: mahī́ átra mahinā́ vā́ram r̥ṇvatho  -areṇávas túja ā́ sádman dhenávaḥ  sváranti tā́ uparátāti sū́ryam  ā́ nimrúca uṣásas takvavī́r iva

translation.text: On this great earth ye send your treasure down with might: unstained by dust, the crowding kine are in the stalls. Here in the neighbourhood they cry unto the Sun at morning and at evening, like swift birds of prey.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वा॑मृ॒ताय॑ के॒शिनी॑रनूषत॒ मित्र॒ यत्र॒ वरु॑ण गा॒तुमर्च॑थः अव॒ त्मना॑ सृ॒जतं॒ पिन्व॑तं॒ धियो॑ यु॒वं विप्र॑स्य॒ मन्म॑नामिरज्यथः
verses.transliteration: ā́ vām r̥tā́ya keśínīr anūṣata  mítra yátra váruṇa gātúm árcathaḥ  áva tmánā sr̥játam pínvataṃ dhíyo  yuváṃ víprasya mánmanām irajyathaḥ

translation.text: The flames with curling tresses serve your sacrifice, whereto ye sing the song, Mitra and Varuṇa. Send down of your free will, prosper our holy songs: ye are sole Masters of the singer's hymn of praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वां॑ य॒ज्ञैः श॑शमा॒नो ह॒ दाश॑ति क॒विर्होता॒ यज॑ति मन्म॒साध॑नः उपाह॒ तं गच्छ॑थो वी॒थो अ॑ध्व॒रमच्छा॒ गिरः॑ सुम॒तिं ग॑न्तमस्म॒यू
verses.transliteration: yó vāṃ yajñaíḥ śaśamānó ha dā́śati  kavír hótā yájati manmasā́dhanaḥ  úpā́ha táṃ gáchatho vīthó adhvarám  áchā gíraḥ sumatíṃ gantam asmayū́

translation.text: Whoso with sacrifices toiling brings you gifts, and worships, sage and priest, fulfilling your desire,– To him do ye draw nigh and taste his sacrifice. Come well-inclined to us unto our songs and prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वां य॒ज्ञैः प्र॑थ॒मा गोभि॑रञ्जत॒ ऋता॑वाना॒ मन॑सो॒ न प्रयु॑क्तिषु भर॑न्ति वां॒ मन्म॑ना सं॒यता॒ गिरोऽदृ॑प्यता॒ मन॑सा रे॒वदा॑शाथे
verses.transliteration: yuvā́ṃ yajñaíḥ prathamā́ góbhir añjate-  ŕ̥tāvānā mánaso ná práyuktiṣu  bháranti vām mánmanā saṃyátā gíraḥ-  -ádr̥pyatā mánasā revád āśāthe

translation.text: With sacrifices and with milk they deck you first, ye Righteous Ones, as if through stirrings of the mind. To you they bring their hymns with their collected thought, while ye with earnest soul come to us gloriously.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रे॒वद्वयो॑ दधाथे रे॒वदा॑शाथे॒ नरा॑ मा॒याभि॑रि॒तऊ॑ति॒ माहि॑नम् न वां॒ द्यावोऽह॑भि॒र्नोत सिन्ध॑वो॒ न दे॑व॒त्वं प॒णयो॒ नान॑शुर्म॒घम्
verses.transliteration: revád váyo dadhāthe revád āśāthe  nárā māyā́bhir itáūti mā́hinam  ná vāṃ dyā́vó 'habhir nótá síndhavo  ná devatvám paṇáyo nā́naśur maghám

translation.text: Rich strength of life is yours: ye, Heroes, have obtained through your surpassing powers rich farextending might. Not the past days conjoined with nights, not rivers, not the Papis have attained your Godhead and your wealth.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं वस्त्रा॑णि पीव॒सा व॑साथे यु॒वोरच्छि॑द्रा॒ मन्त॑वो ह॒ सर्गाः॑ अवा॑तिरत॒मनृ॑तानि॒ विश्व॑ ऋ॒तेन॑ मित्रावरुणा सचेथे
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ vástrāṇi pīvasā́ vasāthe  yuvór áchidrā mántavo ha sárgāḥ  ávātiratam ánr̥tāni víśvā-  r̥téna mitrāvaruṇā sacethe

translation.text: THE robes which ye put on abound with fatness: uninterrupted courses are your counsels. All falsehood, Mitra-Varuṇa! ye conquer, and closely cleave unto the Law Eternal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तच्च॒न त्वो॒ वि चि॑केतदेषां स॒त्यो मन्त्रः॑ कविश॒स्त ऋघा॑वान् त्रि॒रश्रिं॑ हन्ति॒ चतु॑रश्रिरु॒ग्रो दे॑व॒निदो॒ ह प्र॑थ॒मा अ॑जूर्यन्
verses.transliteration: etác caná tvo ví ciketad eṣāṃ  satyó mántraḥ kaviśastá ŕ̥ghāvān  triráśriṃ hanti cáturaśrir ugró  devanído ha prathamā́ ajūryan

translation.text: This might of theirs hath no one comprehended. True is the crushing word the sage hath uttered, The fearful four-edged bolt smites down the three-edged, and those who hate the Gods first fall and perish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पादे॑ति प्रथ॒मा प॒द्वती॑नां॒ कस्तद्वां॑ मित्रावरु॒णा चि॑केत गर्भो॑ भा॒रं भ॑र॒त्या चि॑दस्य ऋ॒तं पिप॒र्त्यनृ॑तं॒ नि ता॑रीत्
verses.transliteration: apā́d eti prathamā́ padvátīnāṃ  kás tád vām mitrāvaruṇā́ ciketa  gárbho bhārám bharaty ā́ cid asya  r̥tám píparty ánr̥taṃ ní tārīt

translation.text: The Footless Maid precedeth footed creatures. Who marketh, Mitra-Varuṇa, this your doing? The Babe Unborn supporteth this world's burthen, fuIfilleth Law and overcometh falsehood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒यन्त॒मित्परि॑ जा॒रं क॒नीनां॒ पश्या॑मसि॒ नोप॑नि॒पद्य॑मानम् अन॑वपृग्णा॒ वित॑ता॒ वसा॑नं प्रि॒यं मि॒त्रस्य॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ धाम॑
verses.transliteration: prayántam ít pári jāráṃ kanī́nām  páśyāmasi nópanipádyamānam  ánavapr̥gṇā vítatā vásānam  priyám mitrásya váruṇasya dhā́ma

translation.text: We look on him the darling of the Maidens, always advancing, never falling downward, Wearing inseparable, wide-spread raiment, Mitra's and Varuṇa's delightful glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न॒श्वो जा॒तो अ॑नभी॒शुरर्वा॒ कनि॑क्रदत्पतयदू॒र्ध्वसा॑नुः अ॒चित्तं॒ ब्रह्म॑ जुजुषु॒र्युवा॑नः॒ प्र मि॒त्रे धाम॒ वरु॑णे गृ॒णन्तः॑
verses.transliteration: anaśvó jātó anabhīśúr árvā  kánikradat patayad ūrdhvásānuḥ  acíttam bráhma jujuṣur yúvānaḥ  prá mitré dhā́ma váruṇe gr̥ṇántaḥ

translation.text: Unbridled Courser, horn but not of horses, neighing he flieth on with back uplifted. The youthful love mystery thought-surpassing, praising in Mitra-Varuṇa, its glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ धे॒नवो॑ मामते॒यमव॑न्तीर्ब्रह्म॒प्रियं॑ पीपय॒न्त्सस्मि॒न्नूध॑न् पि॒त्वो भि॑क्षेत व॒युना॑नि वि॒द्वाना॒साविवा॑स॒न्नदि॑तिमुरुष्येत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ dhenávo māmateyám ávantīr  brahmapríyam pīpayan sásminn ū́dhan  pitvó bhikṣeta vayúnāni vidvā́n  āsā́vívāsann áditim uruṣyet

translation.text: May the milch-kine who favour Mâmateya prosper in this world him who loves devotion. May he, well skilled in rites, be food, and calling Aditi with his lips give us assistance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॑ मित्रावरुणा ह॒व्यजु॑ष्टिं॒ नम॑सा देवा॒वव॑सा ववृत्याम् अ॒स्माकं॒ ब्रह्म॒ पृत॑नासु सह्या अ॒स्माकं॑ वृ॒ष्टिर्दि॒व्या सु॑पा॒रा
verses.transliteration: ā́ vām mitrāvaruṇā havyájuṣṭiṃ  námasā devāv ávasā vavr̥tyām  asmā́kam bráhma pŕ̥tanāsu sahyāḥ-  asmā́kaṃ vr̥ṣṭír divyā́ supārā́

translation.text: Gods, Mitra-Varuṇa, with love and worship, let me make you delight in this oblation. May our prayer be victorious in battles, may we have rain from heaven to make us prosper.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: यजा॑महे वां म॒हः स॒जोषा॑ ह॒व्येभि॑र्मित्रावरुणा॒ नमो॑भिः घृ॒तैर्घृ॑तस्नू॒ अध॒ यद्वा॑म॒स्मे अ॑ध्व॒र्यवो॒ न धी॒तिभि॒र्भर॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: yájāmahe vām maháḥ sajóṣāḥ-  havyébhir mitrāvaruṇā námobhiḥ  ghr̥taír ghr̥tasnū ádha yád vām asmé  adhvaryávo ná dhītíbhir bháranti

translation.text: WE worship with our reverence and oblations you, Mitra Varuṇa, accordant, mighty, So that with us, ye Twain whose backs are sprinkled with oil, the priests with oil and hymns support you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रस्तु॑तिर्वां॒ धाम॒ न प्रयु॑क्ति॒रया॑मि मित्रावरुणा सुवृ॒क्तिः अ॒नक्ति॒ यद्वां॑ वि॒दथे॑षु॒ होता॑ सु॒म्नं वां॑ सू॒रिर्वृ॑षणा॒विय॑क्षन्
verses.transliteration: prástutir vāṃ dhā́ma ná práyuktir  áyāmi mitrāvaruṇā suvr̥ktíḥ  anákti yád vāṃ vidátheṣu hótā  sumnáṃ vāṃ sūrír vr̥ṣaṇāv íyakṣan

translation.text: Your praise is like a mighty power, an impulse: to you, Twain Gods, a well-formed hymn is offered, As the priest decks yon, Strong Ones, in assemblies, and the prince fain to worship you for blessings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पी॒पाय॑ धे॒नुरदि॑तिर्ऋ॒ताय॒ जना॑य मित्रावरुणा हवि॒र्दे हि॒नोति॒ यद्वां॑ वि॒दथे॑ सप॒र्यन्त्स रा॒तह॑व्यो॒ मानु॑षो॒ न होता॑
verses.transliteration: pīpā́ya dhenúr áditir r̥tā́ya  jánāya mitrāvaruṇā havirdé  hinóti yád vāṃ vidáthe saparyán  sá rātáhavyo mā́nuṣo ná hótā

translation.text: O Mitra-Varuṇa, Aditi the Milch-cow streams for the rite, for folk who bring oblation, When in the assembly he who worships moves you, like to a human priest, with gifts presented.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त वां॑ वि॒क्षु मद्या॒स्वन्धो॒ गाव॒ आप॑श्च पीपयन्त दे॒वीः उ॒तो नो॑ अ॒स्य पू॒र्व्यः पति॒र्दन्वी॒तं पा॒तं पय॑स उ॒स्रिया॑याः
verses.transliteration: utá vāṃ vikṣú mádyāsv ándho  gā́va ā́paś ca pīpayanta devī́ḥ  utó no asyá pūrvyáḥ pátir dán  vītám pātám páyasa usríyāyāḥ

translation.text: So may the kine and heavenly Waters pour you sweet drink in families that make you joyful. Of this may he, the ancient House-Lord, give us. Enjoy, drink of the milk the cow provideth.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: विष्णो॒र्नु कं॑ वी॒र्या॑णि॒ प्र वो॑चं॒ यः पार्थि॑वानि विम॒मे रजां॑सि यो अस्क॑भाय॒दुत्त॑रं स॒धस्थं॑ विचक्रमा॒णस्त्रे॒धोरु॑गा॒यः
verses.transliteration: víṣṇor nú kaṃ vīryā̀ṇi prá vocaṃ  yáḥ pā́rthivāni vimamé rájāṃsi  yó áskabhāyad úttaraṃ sadhásthaṃ  vicakramāṇás tredhórugāyáḥ

translation.text: I WILL declare the mighty deeds of Vishṇu, of him who measured out the earthly regions, Who propped the highest place of congregation, thrice setting down his footstep, widely striding.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तद्विष्णुः॑ स्तवते वी॒र्ये॑ण मृ॒गो न भी॒मः कु॑च॒रो गि॑रि॒ष्ठाः यस्यो॒रुषु॑ त्रि॒षु वि॒क्रम॑णेष्वधिक्षि॒यन्ति॒ भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: prá tád víṣṇu stavate vīryèṇa  mr̥gó ná bhīmáḥ kucaró giriṣṭhā́ḥ  yásyorúṣu triṣú vikrámaṇeṣu-  adhikṣiyánti bhúvanāni víśvā

translation.text: For this his mighty deed is Vishṇu lauded, like some wild beast, dread, prowling, mountain-roaming; He within whose three wide-extended paces all living creatures have their habitation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र विष्ण॑वे शू॒षमे॑तु॒ मन्म॑ गिरि॒क्षित॑ उरुगा॒याय॒ वृष्णे॑ य इ॒दं दी॒र्घं प्रय॑तं स॒धस्थ॒मेको॑ विम॒मे त्रि॒भिरित्प॒देभिः॑
verses.transliteration: prá víṣṇave śūṣám etu mánma  girikṣíta urugāyā́ya vŕ̥ṣṇe  yá idáṃ dīrghám práyataṃ sadhástham  éko vimamé tribhír ít padébhiḥ

translation.text: Let the hymn lift itself as strength to Vishṇu, the Bull far-striding, dwelling on the mountains, Him who alone with triple step hath measured this common dwelling-place, long, far extended.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ त्री पू॒र्णा मधु॑ना प॒दान्यक्षी॑यमाणा स्व॒धया॒ मद॑न्ति य उ॑ त्रि॒धातु॑ पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्यामेको॑ दा॒धार॒ भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: yásya trī́ pūrṇā́ mádhunā padā́ni-  ákṣīyamāṇā svadháyā mádanti  yá u tridhā́tu pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m  éko dādhā́ra bhúvanāni víśvā

translation.text: Him whose three places that are filled with sweetness, imperishable, joy as it may list them, Who verily alone upholds the threefold, the earth, the heaven, and all living creatures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद॑स्य प्रि॒यम॒भि पाथो॑ अश्यां॒ नरो॒ यत्र॑ देव॒यवो॒ मद॑न्ति उ॒रु॒क्र॒मस्य॒ स हि बन्धु॑रि॒त्था विष्णोः॑ प॒दे प॑र॒मे मध्व॒ उत्सः॑
verses.transliteration: tád asya priyám abhí pā́tho aśyāṃ  náro yátra devayávo mádanti  urukramásya sá hí bándhur itthā́  víṣṇoḥ padé paramé mádhva útsaḥ

translation.text: May I attain to that his well-loved mansion where men devoted to the Gods are happy. For there springs, close akin to the Wide-Strider, the well of meath in Vishṇu's highest footstep.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वां॒ वास्तू॑न्युश्मसि॒ गम॑ध्यै॒ यत्र॒ गावो॒ भूरि॑शृङ्गा अ॒यासः॑ अत्राह॒ तदु॑रुगा॒यस्य॒ वृष्णः॑ पर॒मं प॒दमव॑ भाति॒ भूरि॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ vāṃ vā́stūny uśmasi gámadhyai  yátra gā́vo bhū́riśr̥ṅgā ayā́saḥ  átrā́ha tád urugāyásya vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ  paramám padám áva bhāti bhū́ri

translation.text: Fain would we go unto your dwelling-places where there are many-horned and nimble oxen, For mightily, there, shineth down upon us the widely-striding Bull's sublimest mansion.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वः॒ पान्त॒मन्ध॑सो धियाय॒ते म॒हे शूरा॑य॒ विष्ण॑वे चार्चत या सानु॑नि॒ पर्व॑ताना॒मदा॑भ्या म॒हस्त॒स्थतु॒रर्व॑तेव सा॒धुना॑
verses.transliteration: prá vaḥ pā́ntam ándhaso dhiyāyaté  mahé śū́rāya víṣṇave cārcata  yā́ sā́nuni párvatānām ádābhyā  mahás tasthátur árvateva sādhúnā

translation.text: To the great Hero, him who sets his mind thereon, and Vishṇu, praise aloud in song your draught of juice,– Gods ne'er beguiled, who borne as 'twere by noble steed, have stood upon the lofty ridges of the hills.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे॒षमि॒त्था स॒मर॑णं॒ शिमी॑वतो॒रिन्द्रा॑विष्णू सुत॒पा वा॑मुरुष्यति या मर्त्या॑य प्रतिधी॒यमा॑न॒मित्कृ॒शानो॒रस्तु॑रस॒नामु॑रु॒ष्यथः॑
verses.transliteration: tveṣám itthā́ samáraṇaṃ śímīvator  índrāviṣṇū sutapā́ vām uruṣyati  yā́ mártyāya pratidhīyámānam ít  kr̥śā́nor ástur asanā́m uruṣyáthaḥ

translation.text: Your Soma-drinker keeps afar your furious rush, Indra and Vishṇu, when ye come with all your might. That which hath been directed well at mortal man, bow-armed Kr̥iṣanu's arrow, ye turn far aside.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता ईं॑ वर्धन्ति॒ मह्य॑स्य॒ पौंस्यं॒ नि मा॒तरा॑ नयति॒ रेत॑से भु॒जे दधा॑ति पु॒त्रोऽव॑रं॒ परं॑ पि॒तुर्नाम॑ तृ॒तीय॒मधि॑ रोच॒ने दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: tā́ īṃ vardhanti máhy asya paúṃsyaṃ  ní mātárā nayati rétase bhujé  dádhāti putró 'varam páram pitúr  nā́ma tr̥tī́yam ádhi rocané diváḥ

translation.text: These offerings increase his mighty manly strength: he brings both Parents down to share the genial flow. He lowers, though a son, the Father's highest name; the third is that which is high in the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्त॒दिद॑स्य॒ पौंस्यं॑ गृणीमसी॒नस्य॑ त्रा॒तुर॑वृ॒कस्य॑ मी॒ळ्हुषः॑ यः पार्थि॑वानि त्रि॒भिरिद्विगा॑मभिरु॒रु क्रमि॑ष्टोरुगा॒याय॑ जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: tát-tad íd asya paúṃsyaṃ gr̥ṇīmasi-  -inásya trātúr avr̥kásya mīḷhúṣaḥ  yáḥ pā́rthivāni tribhír íd vígāmabhir  urú krámiṣṭorugāyā́ya jīváse

translation.text: We laud this manly power of him the Mighty One, preserver, inoffensive, bounteous and benign; His who strode, widely pacing, with three steppings forth over the realms of earth for freedom and for life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वे इद॑स्य॒ क्रम॑णे स्व॒र्दृशो॑ऽभि॒ख्याय॒ मर्त्यो॑ भुरण्यति तृ॒तीय॑मस्य॒ नकि॒रा द॑धर्षति॒ वय॑श्च॒न प॒तय॑न्तः पत॒त्रिणः॑
verses.transliteration: dvé íd asya krámaṇe svardŕ̥śo  -abhikhyā́ya mártyo bhuraṇyati  tr̥tī́yam asya nákir ā́ dadharṣati  váyaś caná patáyantaḥ patatríṇaḥ

translation.text: A mortal man, when he beholds two steps of him who looks upon the light, is restless with amaze. But his third step doth no one venture to approach, no, nor the feathered birds of air who fly with wings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒तुर्भिः॑ सा॒कं न॑व॒तिं च॒ नाम॑भिश्च॒क्रं न वृ॒त्तं व्यतीँ॑रवीविपत् बृ॒हच्छ॑रीरो वि॒मिमा॑न॒ ऋक्व॑भि॒र्युवाकु॑मारः॒ प्रत्ये॑त्याह॒वम्
verses.transliteration: catúrbhiḥ sākáṃ navatíṃ ca nā́mabhiś  cakráṃ ná vr̥ttáṃ vyátīm̐r avīvipat  br̥háccharīro vimímāna ŕ̥kvabhir  yúvā́kumāraḥ práty ety āhavám

translation.text: He, like a rounded wheel, hath in swift motion set his ninety racing steeds together with the four. Developed, vast in form, with those who sing forth praise, a youth, no more a child, he cometh to our call.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: भवा॑ मि॒त्रो न शेव्यो॑ घृ॒तासु॑ति॒र्विभू॑तद्युम्न एव॒या उ॑ स॒प्रथाः॑ अधा॑ ते विष्णो वि॒दुषा॑ चि॒दर्ध्यः॒ स्तोमो॑ य॒ज्ञश्च॒ राध्यो॑ ह॒विष्म॑ता
verses.transliteration: bhávā mitró ná śévyo ghr̥tā́sutir  víbhūtadyumna evayā́ u sapráthāḥ  ádhā te viṣṇo vidúṣā cid árdhyaḥ-  stómo yajñáś ca rā́dhyo havíṣmatā

translation.text: FAR-SHINING, widely famed, going thy wonted way, fed with the oil, be helpful. Mitra-like, to us. So, Vishṇu, e'en the wise must swell thy song of praise, and he who hath oblations pay thee solemn rites.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः पू॒र्व्याय॑ वे॒धसे॒ नवी॑यसे सु॒मज्जा॑नये॒ विष्ण॑वे॒ ददा॑शति यो जा॒तम॑स्य मह॒तो महि॒ ब्रव॒त्सेदु॒ श्रवो॑भि॒र्युज्यं॑ चिद॒भ्य॑सत्
verses.transliteration: yáḥ pūrvyā́ya vedháse návīyase  sumájjānaye víṣṇave dádāśati  yó jātám asya maható máhi brávat  séd u śrávobhir yújyaṃ cid abhy àsat

translation.text: He who brings gifts to him the Ancient and the Last, to Vishṇu who ordains, together with his Spouse, Who tells the lofty birth of him the Lofty One, shall verily surpass in glory e'en his peer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ स्तोतारः पू॒र्व्यं यथा॑ वि॒द ऋ॒तस्य॒ गर्भं॑ ज॒नुषा॑ पिपर्तन आस्य॑ जा॒नन्तो॒ नाम॑ चिद्विवक्तन म॒हस्ते॑ विष्णो सुम॒तिं भ॑जामहे
verses.transliteration: tám u stotāraḥ pūrvyáṃ yáthā vidáḥ-  r̥tásya gárbhaṃ janúṣā pipartana  ā́sya jānánto nā́ma cid vivaktana  mahás te viṣṇo sumatím bhajāmahe

translation.text: Him have ye satisfied, singers, as well as ye know, primeval germ of Order even from his birth. Ye, knowing e'en his name, have told it forth: may we, Vishṇu, enjoy the grace of thee the Mighty One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तम॑स्य॒ राजा॒ वरु॑ण॒स्तम॒श्विना॒ क्रतुं॑ सचन्त॒ मारु॑तस्य वे॒धसः॑ दा॒धार॒ दक्ष॑मुत्त॒मम॑ह॒र्विदं॑ व्र॒जं च॒ विष्णुः॒ सखि॑वाँ अपोर्णु॒ते
verses.transliteration: tám asya rā́jā váruṇas tám aśvínā  krátuṃ sacanta mā́rutasya vedhásaḥ  dādhā́ra dákṣam uttamám aharvídaṃ  vrajáṃ ca víṣṇuḥ sákhivām̐ aporṇuté

translation.text: The Sovran Varuṇa and both the Aṣvins wait on this the will of him who guides the Marut host. Vishṇu hath power supreme and might iliat finds the day, and with his Friend unbars the stable of the kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यो वि॒वाय॑ स॒चथा॑य॒ दैव्य॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ विष्णुः॑ सु॒कृते॑ सु॒कृत्त॑रः वे॒धा अ॑जिन्वत्त्रिषध॒स्थ आर्य॑मृ॒तस्य॑ भा॒गे यज॑मान॒माभ॑जत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yó vivā́ya sacáthāya daívyaḥ-  índrāya víṣṇuḥ sukŕ̥te sukŕ̥ttaraḥ  vedhā́ ajinvat triṣadhasthá ā́ryam  r̥tásya bhāgé yájamānam ā́bhajat

translation.text: Even he the Heavenly One who came for fellowship, Vishṇu to Indra, godly to the godlier, Who Maker, throned in three worlds, helps the Aryan man, and gives the worshipper his share of Holy Law.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: अबो॑ध्य॒ग्निर्ज्म उदे॑ति॒ सूर्यो॒ व्यु१॒॑षाश्च॒न्द्रा म॒ह्या॑वो अ॒र्चिषा॑ आयु॑क्षाताम॒श्विना॒ यात॑वे॒ रथं॒ प्रासा॑वीद्दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता जग॒त्पृथ॑क्
verses.transliteration: ábodhy agnír jmá úd eti sū́ryo  vy ùṣā́ś candrā́ mahy ā̀vo arcíṣā  ā́yukṣātām aśvínā yā́tave rátham  prā́sāvīd deváḥ savitā́ jágat pŕ̥thak

translation.text: AGNI is wakened: Sûrya riseth from the earth. Mighty, refulgent Dawn hath shone with all her light. The Aṣvins have equipped their chariot for the course. God Savitar hath moved the folk in sundry ways.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्यु॒ञ्जाथे॒ वृष॑णमश्विना॒ रथं॑ घृ॒तेन॑ नो॒ मधु॑ना क्ष॒त्रमु॑क्षतम् अ॒स्माकं॒ ब्रह्म॒ पृत॑नासु जिन्वतं व॒यं धना॒ शूर॑साता भजेमहि
verses.transliteration: yád yuñjā́the vŕ̥ṣaṇam aśvinā ráthaṃ  ghr̥téna no mádhunā kṣatrám ukṣatam  asmā́kam bráhma pŕ̥tanāsu jinvataṃ  vayáṃ dhánā śū́rasātā bhajemahi

translation.text: When, Aṣvins, ye equip your very mighty car, bedew, ye Twain, our power with honey and with oil. To our devotion give victorious strength in war: may we win riches in the heroes' strife for spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वाङ्त्रि॑च॒क्रो म॑धु॒वाह॑नो॒ रथो॑ जी॒राश्वो॑ अ॒श्विनो॑र्यातु॒ सुष्टु॑तः त्रि॒व॒न्धु॒रो म॒घवा॑ वि॒श्वसौ॑भगः॒ शं न॒ आ व॑क्षद्द्वि॒पदे॒ चतु॑ष्पदे
verses.transliteration: arvā́ṅ tricakró madhuvā́hano rátho  jīrā́śvo aśvínor yātu súṣṭutaḥ  trivandhuró maghávā viśvásaubhagaḥ  śáṃ na ā́ vakṣad dvipáde cátuṣpade

translation.text: Nigh to us come the Aṣvins' lauded three-wheeled car, the car laden with meath and drawn by fleet-foot steeds, Three-seated, opulent, bestowing all delight. may it bring weal to us, to cattle and to men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॒ ऊर्जं॑ वहतमश्विना यु॒वं मधु॑मत्या नः॒ कश॑या मिमिक्षतम् प्रायु॒स्तारि॑ष्टं॒ नी रपां॑सि मृक्षतं॒ सेध॑तं॒ द्वेषो॒ भव॑तं सचा॒भुवा॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ na ū́rjaṃ vahatam aśvinā yuvám  mádhumatyā naḥ káśayā mimikṣatam  prā́yus tā́riṣṭaṃ nī́ rápāṃsi mr̥kṣataṃ  sédhataṃ dvéṣo bhávataṃ sacābhúvā

translation.text: Bring hither nourishment for us, ye Aṣvins Twain; sprinkle us with your whip that drops with honey-dew. Prolong our days of life, wipe out our trespasses; destroy our foes, be our companions and our Friends.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं ह॒ गर्भं॒ जग॑तीषु धत्थो यु॒वं विश्वे॑षु॒ भुव॑नेष्व॒न्तः यु॒वम॒ग्निं च॑ वृषणाव॒पश्च॒ वन॒स्पतीँ॑रश्विना॒वैर॑येथाम्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ ha gárbhaṃ jágatīṣu dhattho  yuváṃ víśveṣu bhúvaneṣv antáḥ  yuvám agníṃ ca vr̥ṣaṇāv apáś ca  vánaspátīm̐r aśvināv aírayethām

translation.text: Ye store the germ of life in female creatures, ye lay it up within all living beings. Ye have sent forth, O Aṣvins passing mighty, the fire, the sovrans of the wood, the waters,

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं ह॑ स्थो भि॒षजा॑ भेष॒जेभि॒रथो॑ ह स्थो र॒थ्या॒३॒॑ राथ्ये॑भिः अथो॑ ह क्ष॒त्रमधि॑ धत्थ उग्रा॒ यो वां॑ ह॒विष्मा॒न्मन॑सा द॒दाश॑
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ ha stho bhiṣájā bheṣajébhir  átho ha stho rathyā̀ rā́thyebhiḥ  átho ha kṣatrám ádhi dhattha ugrā  yó vāṃ havíṣmān mánasā dadā́śa

translation.text: Leeches are ye with medicines to heal us, and charioteers are ye with skill in driving. Ye Strong, give sway to him who brings oblation and with his heart pours out his gift before you.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: वसू॑ रु॒द्रा पु॑रु॒मन्तू॑ वृ॒धन्ता॑ दश॒स्यतं॑ नो वृषणाव॒भिष्टौ॑ दस्रा॑ ह॒ यद्रेक्ण॑ औच॒थ्यो वां॒ प्र यत्स॒स्राथे॒ अक॑वाभिरू॒ती
verses.transliteration: vásū rudrā́ purumántū vr̥dhántā  daśasyátaṃ no vr̥ṣaṇāv abhíṣṭau  dásrā ha yád rékṇa aucathyó vām  prá yát sasrā́the ákavābhir ūtī́

translation.text: YE Vasus Twain, ye Rudras full of counsel, grant us, Strong Strengtheners, when ye stand beside us, What wealth Aucathya craves of you, great Helpers when ye come forward with no niggard succour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को वां॑ दाशत्सुम॒तये॑ चिद॒स्यै वसू॒ यद्धेथे॒ नम॑सा प॒दे गोः जि॒गृ॒तम॒स्मे रे॒वतीः॒ पुरं॑धीः काम॒प्रेणे॑व॒ मन॑सा॒ चर॑न्ता
verses.transliteration: kó vāṃ dāśat sumatáye cid asyaí  vásū yád dhéthe námasā padé góḥ  jigr̥tám asmé revátīḥ púraṃdhīḥ  kāmapréṇeva mánasā cárantā

translation.text: Who may give you aught, Vasus, for your favour, for what, at the Cow's place, ye grant through worship? Wake for us understanding full of riches, come with a heart that will fulfil our longing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒क्तो ह॒ यद्वां॑ तौ॒ग्र्याय॑ पे॒रुर्वि मध्ये॒ अर्ण॑सो॒ धायि॑ प॒ज्रः उप॑ वा॒मवः॑ शर॒णं ग॑मेयं॒ शूरो॒ नाज्म॑ प॒तय॑द्भि॒रेवैः॑
verses.transliteration: yuktó ha yád vāṃ taugryā́ya perúr  ví mádhye árṇaso dhā́yi pajráḥ  úpa vām ávaḥ śaraṇáṃ gameyaṃ  śū́ro nā́jma patáyadbhir évaiḥ

translation.text: As erst for Tugra's son your car, sea-crossing, strong, was equipped and set amid the waters, So may I gain your shelter and protection as with winged course a hero seeks his army.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑स्तुतिरौच॒थ्यमु॑रुष्ये॒न्मा मामि॒मे प॑त॒त्रिणी॒ वि दु॑ग्धाम् मा मामेधो॒ दश॑तयश्चि॒तो धा॒क्प्र यद्वां॑ ब॒द्धस्त्मनि॒ खाद॑ति॒ क्षाम्
verses.transliteration: úpastutir aucathyám uruṣyet-  mā́ mā́m imé patatríṇī ví dugdhām  mā́ mā́m édho dáśatayaś citó dhāk  prá yád vām baddhás tmáni khā́dati kṣā́m

translation.text: May this my praise preserve Ucathya's offispring: let not these Twain who fly with wings exhaust me. Let not the wood ten times up-piled consume me, when fixed for you it bites the ground it stands on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न मा॑ गरन्न॒द्यो॑ मा॒तृत॑मा दा॒सा यदीं॒ सुस॑मुब्धम॒वाधुः॑ शिरो॒ यद॑स्य त्रैत॒नो वि॒तक्ष॑त्स्व॒यं दा॒स उरो॒ अंसा॒वपि॑ ग्ध
verses.transliteration: ná mā garan nadyò mātŕ̥tamāḥ-  dāsā́ yád īṃ súsamubdham avā́dhuḥ  śíro yád asya traitanó vitákṣat  svayáṃ dāsá úro áṃsāv ápi gdha

translation.text: The most maternal streams, wherein the Dilsas cast me securely bound, have not devoured me. When Traitana would cleave my head asunder, the Dâsa wounded his own breast and shoulders.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दी॒र्घत॑मा मामते॒यो जु॑जु॒र्वान्द॑श॒मे यु॒गे अ॒पामर्थं॑ य॒तीनां॑ ब्र॒ह्मा भ॑वति॒ सार॑थिः
verses.transliteration: dīrghátamā māmateyó  jujurvā́n daśamé yugé  apā́m árthaṃ yatī́nām  brahmā́ bhavati sā́rathiḥ

translation.text: Dîrghatamas the son of Mamatâ hath come to length of days in the tenth age of human kind. He is the Brahman of the waters as they strive to reach their end and aim: their charioteer is he.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र द्यावा॑ य॒ज्ञैः पृ॑थि॒वी ऋ॑ता॒वृधा॑ म॒ही स्तु॑षे वि॒दथे॑षु॒ प्रचे॑तसा दे॒वेभि॒र्ये दे॒वपु॑त्रे सु॒दंस॑से॒त्था धि॒या वार्या॑णि प्र॒भूष॑तः
verses.transliteration: prá dyā́vā yajñaíḥ pr̥thivī́ r̥tāvŕ̥dhā  mahī́ stuṣe vidátheṣu prácetasā  devébhir yé deváputre sudáṃsasā-  -itthā́ dhiyā́ vā́ryāṇi prabhū́ṣataḥ

translation.text: I PRAISE with sacrifices mighty Heaven and Earth at festivals, the wise, the Strengtheners of Law. Who, having Gods for progeny, conjoined with Gods, through wonder-working wisdom bring forth choicest boons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त म॑न्ये पि॒तुर॒द्रुहो॒ मनो॑ मा॒तुर्महि॒ स्वत॑व॒स्तद्धवी॑मभिः सु॒रेत॑सा पि॒तरा॒ भूम॑ चक्रतुरु॒रु प्र॒जाया॑ अ॒मृतं॒ वरी॑मभिः
verses.transliteration: utá manye pitúr adrúho máno  mātúr máhi svátavas tád dhávīmabhiḥ  surétasā pitárā bhū́ma cakratur  urú prajā́yā amŕ̥taṃ várīmabhiḥ

translation.text: With invocations, on the gracious Father's mind, and on the Mother's great inherent power I muse. Prolific Parents, they have made the world of life, and for their brood all round wide immortality.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते सू॒नवः॒ स्वप॑सः सु॒दंस॑सो म॒ही ज॑ज्ञुर्मा॒तरा॑ पू॒र्वचि॑त्तये स्था॒तुश्च॑ स॒त्यं जग॑तश्च॒ धर्म॑णि पु॒त्रस्य॑ पाथः प॒दमद्व॑याविनः
verses.transliteration: té sūnávaḥ svápasaḥ sudáṃsaso  mahī́ jajñur mātárā pūrvácittaye  sthātúś ca satyáṃ jágataś ca dhármaṇi  putrásya pāthaḥ padám ádvayāvinaḥ

translation.text: These Sons of yours well skilled in work, of wondrous power, brought forth to life the two great Mothers first of all. To keep the truth of all that stands and all that moves, ye guard the station of your Son who knows no guile.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते मा॒यिनो॑ ममिरे सु॒प्रचे॑तसो जा॒मी सयो॑नी मिथु॒ना समो॑कसा नव्यं॑नव्यं॒ तन्तु॒मा त॑न्वते दि॒वि स॑मु॒द्रे अ॒न्तः क॒वयः॑ सुदी॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: té māyíno mamire suprácetaso  jāmī́ sáyonī mithunā́ sámokasā  návyaṃ-navyaṃ tántum ā́ tanvate diví  samudré antáḥ kaváyaḥ sudītáyaḥ

translation.text: They with surpassing skill, most wise, have measured out the Twins united in their birth and in their home. They, the refulgent Sages, weave within the sky, yea, in the depths of sea, a web for ever new.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्राधो॑ अ॒द्य स॑वि॒तुर्वरे॑ण्यं व॒यं दे॒वस्य॑ प्रस॒वे म॑नामहे अ॒स्मभ्यं॑ द्यावापृथिवी सुचे॒तुना॑ र॒यिं ध॑त्तं॒ वसु॑मन्तं शत॒ग्विन॑म्
verses.transliteration: tád rā́dho adyá savitúr váreṇyaṃ  vayáṃ devásya prasavé manāmahe  asmábhyaṃ dyāvāpr̥thivī sucetúnā  rayíṃ dhattaṃ vásumantaṃ śatagvínam

translation.text: This is to-day the goodliest gift of Savitar: this thought we have when now the God is furthering us. On us with loving-kindness Heaven and Earth bestow riches and various wealth and treasure hundredfold!

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वि॒श्वश॑म्भुव ऋ॒ताव॑री॒ रज॑सो धार॒यत्क॑वी सु॒जन्म॑नी धि॒षणे॑ अ॒न्तरी॑यते दे॒वो दे॒वी धर्म॑णा॒ सूर्यः॒ शुचिः॑
verses.transliteration: té hí dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ viśváśambhuvā-  r̥tā́varī rájaso dhārayátkavī  sujánmanī dhiṣáṇe antár īyate  devó devī́ dhármaṇā sū́ryaḥ śúciḥ

translation.text: THESE, Heaven and Earth, bestow prosperity on all, sustainers of the region, Holy Ones and wise, Two Bowls of noble kind: between these Goddesses the God, the fulgent Sun, travels by fixed decree.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रु॒व्यच॑सा म॒हिनी॑ अस॒श्चता॑ पि॒ता मा॒ता च॒ भुव॑नानि रक्षतः सु॒धृष्ट॑मे वपु॒ष्ये॒३॒॑ न रोद॑सी पि॒ता यत्सी॑म॒भि रू॒पैरवा॑सयत्
verses.transliteration: uruvyácasā mahínī asaścátā  pitā́ mātā́ ca bhúvanāni rakṣataḥ  sudhŕ̥ṣṭame vapuṣyè ná ródasī  pitā́ yát sīm abhí rūpaír ávāsayat

translation.text: Widely-capacious Pair, mighty, that never fail, the Father and the Mother keep all creatures safe: The two world-halves, the spirited, the beautiful, because the Father hath clothed them in goodly forms.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वह्निः॑ पु॒त्रः पि॒त्रोः प॒वित्र॑वान्पु॒नाति॒ धीरो॒ भुव॑नानि मा॒यया॑ धे॒नुं च॒ पृश्निं॑ वृष॒भं सु॒रेत॑सं वि॒श्वाहा॑ शु॒क्रं पयो॑ अस्य दुक्षत
verses.transliteration: sá váhniḥ putráḥ pitróḥ pavítravān  punā́ti dhī́ro bhúvanāni māyáyā  dhenúṃ ca pŕ̥śniṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ surétasaṃ  viśvā́hā śukrám páyo asya dukṣata

translation.text: Son of these Parents, he the Priest with power to cleanse, Sage, sanctifies the worlds with his surpassing power. Thereto for his bright milk he milked through all the days the party-coloured Cow and the prolific Bull.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं दे॒वाना॑म॒पसा॑म॒पस्त॑मो॒ यो ज॒जान॒ रोद॑सी वि॒श्वश॑म्भुवा वि यो म॒मे रज॑सी सुक्रतू॒यया॒जरे॑भिः॒ स्कम्भ॑नेभिः॒ समा॑नृचे
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ devā́nām apásām apástamo  yó jajā́na ródasī viśváśambhuvā  ví yó mamé rájasī sukratūyáyā-  -ajárebhi skámbhanebhiḥ sám ānr̥ce

translation.text: Among the skilful Gods most skilled is he, who made the two world-halves which bring prosperity to all; Who with great wisdom measured both the regions out, and stablished them with pillars that shall ne'er decay.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते नो॑ गृणा॒ने म॑हिनी॒ महि॒ श्रवः॑ क्ष॒त्रं द्या॑वापृथिवी धासथो बृ॒हत् येना॒भि कृ॒ष्टीस्त॒तना॑म वि॒श्वहा॑ प॒नाय्य॒मोजो॑ अ॒स्मे समि॑न्वतम्
verses.transliteration: té no gr̥ṇāné mahinī máhi śrávaḥ  kṣatráṃ dyāvāpr̥thivī dhāsatho br̥hát  yénābhí kr̥ṣṭī́s tatánāma viśváhā  panā́yyam ójo asmé sám invatam

translation.text: Extolled in song, O Heaven and Earth, bestow on us, ye mighty Pair, great glory and high lordly sway, Whereby we may extend ourselves ever over the folk; and send us strength that shall deserve the praise of men.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: किमु॒ श्रेष्ठः॒ किं यवि॑ष्ठो न॒ आज॑ग॒न्किमी॑यते दू॒त्यं१॒॑ कद्यदू॑चि॒म न नि॑न्दिम चम॒सं यो म॑हाकु॒लोऽग्ने॑ भ्रात॒र्द्रुण॒ इद्भू॒तिमू॑दिम
verses.transliteration: kím u śréṣṭhaḥ kíṃ yáviṣṭho na ā́jagan  kím īyate dūtyàṃ kád yád ūcimá  ná nindima camasáṃ yó mahākuló  -ágne bhrātar drúṇa íd bhūtím ūdima

translation.text: WHY hath the Best, why hath the Youngest come to us? Upon what embassy comes he? What have we said? We have not blamed the chalice of illustrious birth. We, Brother Agni, praised the goodness of the wood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एकं॑ चम॒सं च॒तुरः॑ कृणोतन॒ तद्वो॑ दे॒वा अ॑ब्रुव॒न्तद्व॒ आग॑मम् सौध॑न्वना॒ यद्ये॒वा क॑रि॒ष्यथ॑ सा॒कं दे॒वैर्य॒ज्ञिया॑सो भविष्यथ
verses.transliteration: ékaṃ camasáṃ catúraḥ kr̥ṇotana  tád vo devā́ abruvan tád va ā́gamam  saúdhanvanā yády evā́ kariṣyátha  sākáṃ devaír yajñíyāso bhaviṣyatha

translation.text: The chalice that is single make ye into four: thus have the Gods commanded; therefore am I come. If, O Sudhanvan's Children, ye will do this thing ye shall participate in sacrifice with Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं दू॒तं प्रति॒ यदब्र॑वीत॒नाश्वः॒ कर्त्वो॒ रथ॑ उ॒तेह कर्त्वः॑ धे॒नुः कर्त्वा॑ युव॒शा कर्त्वा॒ द्वा तानि॑ भ्रात॒रनु॑ वः कृ॒त्व्येम॑सि
verses.transliteration: agníṃ dūtám práti yád ábravītana-  -áśvaḥ kártvo rátha utéhá kártvaḥ  dhenúḥ kártvā yuvaśā́ kártvā dvā́  tā́ni bhrātar ánu vaḥ kr̥tvy émasi

translation.text: What to the envoy Agni in reply ye spake, A courser must be made, a chariot fashioned here, A cow must be created, and the Twain made young. When we have done these things, Brother, we turn to you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒कृ॒वांस॑ ऋभव॒स्तद॑पृच्छत॒ क्वेद॑भू॒द्यः स्य दू॒तो न॒ आज॑गन् य॒दावाख्य॑च्चम॒साञ्च॒तुरः॑ कृ॒तानादित्त्वष्टा॒ ग्नास्व॒न्तर्न्या॑नजे
verses.transliteration: cakr̥vā́ṃsa r̥bhavas tád apr̥chata  kvéd abhūd yáḥ syá dūtó na ā́jagan  yadā́vā́khyac camasā́ñ catúraḥ kr̥tā́n  ā́d ít tváṣṭā gnā́sv antár ny ā̀naje

translation.text: When thus, O R̥ibhus, ye had done ye questioned thus, Whither went he who came to us a messenger? Then Tvashṭar, when he viewed the four wrought chalices, concealed himself among the Consorts of the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हना॑मैनाँ॒ इति॒ त्वष्टा॒ यदब्र॑वीच्चम॒सं ये दे॑व॒पान॒मनि॑न्दिषुः अ॒न्या नामा॑नि कृण्वते सु॒ते सचाँ॑ अ॒न्यैरे॑नान्क॒न्या॒३॒॑ नाम॑भिः स्परत्
verses.transliteration: hánāmainām̐ íti tváṣṭā yád ábravīc  camasáṃ yé devapā́nam ánindiṣuḥ  anyā́ nā́māni kr̥ṇvate suté sácām̐  anyaír enān kanyā̀ nā́mabhi sparat

translation.text: As Tvashṭar thus had spoken, Let us slay these men who have reviled the chalice, drinking-cup of Gods, They gave themselves new names when Soma juice was shed, and under these new names the Maiden welcomed them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒ हरी॑ युयु॒जे अ॒श्विना॒ रथं॒ बृह॒स्पति॑र्वि॒श्वरू॑पा॒मुपा॑जत ऋ॒भुर्विभ्वा॒ वाजो॑ दे॒वाँ अ॑गच्छत॒ स्वप॑सो य॒ज्ञियं॑ भा॒गमै॑तन
verses.transliteration: índro hárī yuyujé aśvínā rátham  bŕ̥haspátir viśvárūpām úpājata  r̥bhúr víbhvā vā́jo devā́m̐ agachata  svápaso yajñíyam bhāgám aitana

translation.text: Indra hath yoked his Bays, the Aṣvins' car is horsed, Br̥ihaspati hath brought the Cow of every hue. Ye went as R̥ibhus, Vibhvan, Vâja to the Gods, and skilled in war, obtained your share in sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: निश्चर्म॑णो॒ गाम॑रिणीत धी॒तिभि॒र्या जर॑न्ता युव॒शा ताकृ॑णोतन सौध॑न्वना॒ अश्वा॒दश्व॑मतक्षत यु॒क्त्वा रथ॒मुप॑ दे॒वाँ अ॑यातन
verses.transliteration: níś cármaṇo gā́m ariṇīta dhītíbhir  yā́ járantā yuvaśā́ tā́kr̥ṇotana  saúdhanvanā áśvād áśvam atakṣata  yuktvā́ rátham úpa devā́m̐ ayātana

translation.text: Ye by your wisdom brought a cow from out a hide; unto that ancient Pair ye gave again their youth. Out of a horse, Sudhanvan's Sons, ye formed a horse: a chariot ye equipped, and went unto the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दमु॑द॒कं पि॑ब॒तेत्य॑ब्रवीतने॒दं वा॑ घा पिबता मुञ्ज॒नेज॑नम् सौध॑न्वना॒ यदि॒ तन्नेव॒ हर्य॑थ तृ॒तीये॑ घा॒ सव॑ने मादयाध्वै
verses.transliteration: idám udakám pibatéty abravītana-  -idáṃ vā ghā pibatā muñjanéjanam  saúdhanvanā yádi tán néva háryatha  tr̥tī́ye ghā sávane mādayādhvai

translation.text: Drink ye this water, were the words ye spake to them; or drink ye this, the rinsing of the Munjagrass. If ye approve not even this, Sudhanvan's Sons, then at the third libation gladden ye yourselves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आपो॒ भूयि॑ष्ठा॒ इत्येको॑ अब्रवीद॒ग्निर्भूयि॑ष्ठ॒ इत्य॒न्यो अ॑ब्रवीत् व॒ध॒र्यन्तीं॑ ब॒हुभ्यः॒ प्रैको॑ अब्रवीदृ॒ता वद॑न्तश्चम॒साँ अ॑पिंशत
verses.transliteration: ā́po bhū́yiṣṭhā íty éko abravīd  agnír bhū́yiṣṭha íty anyó abravīt  vadharyántīm bahúbhyaḥ praíko abravīd  r̥tā́ vádantaś camasā́m̐ apiṃśata

translation.text: Most excellent are waters, thus said one of you; most excellent is Agni, thus another said. Another praised to many a one the lightning cloud. Then did ye shape the cups, speaking the words of truth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रो॒णामेक॑ उद॒कं गामवा॑जति मां॒समेकः॑ पिंशति सू॒नयाभृ॑तम् आ नि॒म्रुचः॒ शकृ॒देको॒ अपा॑भर॒त्किं स्वि॑त्पु॒त्रेभ्यः॑ पि॒तरा॒ उपा॑वतुः
verses.transliteration: śroṇā́m éka udakáṃ gā́m ávājati  māṃsám ékaḥ piṃśati sūnáyā́bhr̥tam  ā́ nimrúcaḥ śákr̥d éko ápābharat  kíṃ svit putrébhyaḥ pitárā úpāvatuḥ

translation.text: One downward to the water drives the crippled cow, another trims the flesh brought on the carving-board. One carries off the refuse at the set of sun. How did the Parents aid their children in their task!

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒द्वत्स्व॑स्मा अकृणोतना॒ तृणं॑ नि॒वत्स्व॒पः स्व॑प॒स्यया॑ नरः अगो॑ह्यस्य॒ यदस॑स्तना गृ॒हे तद॒द्येदमृ॑भवो॒ नानु॑ गच्छथ
verses.transliteration: udvátsv asmā akr̥ṇotanā tŕ̥ṇaṃ  nivátsv apáḥ svapasyáyā naraḥ  ágohyasya yád ásastanā gr̥hé  tád adyédám r̥bhavo nā́nu gachatha

translation.text: On the high places ye have made the grass for man, and water in the valleys, by your skill, O Men. R̥ibhus, ye iterate not to-day that act of yours, your sleeping in the house of him whom naught can hide.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म्मील्य॒ यद्भुव॑ना प॒र्यस॑र्पत॒ क्व॑ स्वित्ता॒त्या पि॒तरा॑ व आसतुः अश॑पत॒ यः क॒रस्नं॑ व आद॒दे यः प्राब्र॑वी॒त्प्रो तस्मा॑ अब्रवीतन
verses.transliteration: sammī́lya yád bhúvanā paryásarpata  kvà svit tātyā́ pitárā va āsatuḥ  áśapata yáḥ karásnaṃ va ādadé  yáḥ prā́bravīt pró tásmā abravītana

translation.text: As, compassing them round, ye glided through the worlds, where had the venerable Parents their abode? Ye laid a curse on him who raised his arm at you: to him who spake aloud to you ye spake again.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒षु॒प्वांस॑ ऋभव॒स्तद॑पृच्छ॒तागो॑ह्य॒ क इ॒दं नो॑ अबूबुधत् श्वानं॑ ब॒स्तो बो॑धयि॒तार॑मब्रवीत्संवत्स॒र इ॒दम॒द्या व्य॑ख्यत
verses.transliteration: suṣupvā́ṃsa r̥bhavas tád apr̥chata-  -ágohya ká idáṃ no abūbudhat  śvā́nam bastó bodhayitā́ram abravīt  saṃvatsará idám adyā́ vy àkhyata

translation.text: When ye had slept your fill, ye R̥ibhus, thus ye asked, O thou whom naught may hide, who now hath wakened us? The goat declared the hound to be your wakener. That day, in a full year, ye first unclosed our eyes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वा या॑न्ति म॒रुतो॒ भूम्या॒ग्निर॒यं वातो॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षेण याति अ॒द्भिर्या॑ति॒ वरु॑णः समु॒द्रैर्यु॒ष्माँ इ॒च्छन्तः॑ शवसो नपातः
verses.transliteration: divā́ yānti marúto bhū́myāgnír  ayáṃ vā́to antárikṣeṇa yāti  adbhír yāti váruṇaḥ samudraír  yuṣmā́m̐ ichántaḥ śavaso napātaḥ

translation.text: The Maruts move in heaven, on earth this Agni; through the mid-firmament the Wind approaches. Varuṇa comes in the sea's gathered waters, O Sons of Strength, desirous of your presence.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ मि॒त्रो वरु॑णो अर्य॒मायुरिन्द्र॑ ऋभु॒क्षा म॒रुतः॒ परि॑ ख्यन् यद्वा॒जिनो॑ दे॒वजा॑तस्य॒ सप्तेः॑ प्रव॒क्ष्यामो॑ वि॒दथे॑ वी॒र्या॑णि
verses.transliteration: mā́ no mitró váruṇo aryamā́yúr  índra r̥bhukṣā́ marútaḥ pári khyan  yád vājíno devájātasya sápteḥ  pravakṣyā́mo vidáthe vīryā̀ṇi

translation.text: SLIGHT us not Varuṇa, Aryaman, or Mitra, R̥ibhukshan, Indra, Âyu, or the Maruts, When we declare amid the congregation the virtues of the strong Steed, God-descended.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यन्नि॒र्णिजा॒ रेक्ण॑सा॒ प्रावृ॑तस्य रा॒तिं गृ॑भी॒तां मु॑ख॒तो नय॑न्ति सुप्रा॑ङ॒जो मेम्य॑द्वि॒श्वरू॑प इन्द्रापू॒ष्णोः प्रि॒यमप्ये॑ति॒ पाथः॑
verses.transliteration: yán nirṇíjā rékṇasā prā́vr̥tasya  rātíṃ gr̥bhītā́m mukható náyanti  súprāṅ ajó mémyad viśvárūpaḥ-  indrāpūṣṇóḥ priyám ápy eti pā́thaḥ

translation.text: What time they bear before the Courser, covered with trappings and with wealth, the grasped oblation, The dappled goat goeth straightforward, bleating, to the place dear to Indra and to Pûshan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष च्छागः॑ पु॒रो अश्वे॑न वा॒जिना॑ पू॒ष्णो भा॒गो नी॑यते वि॒श्वदे॑व्यः अ॒भि॒प्रियं॒ यत्पु॑रो॒ळाश॒मर्व॑ता॒ त्वष्टेदे॑नं सौश्रव॒साय॑ जिन्वति
verses.transliteration: eṣá chā́gaḥ puró áśvena vājínā  pūṣṇó bhāgó nīyate viśvádevyaḥ  abhipríyaṃ yát puroḷā́śam árvatā  tváṣṭéd enaṃ sauśravasā́ya jinvati

translation.text: Dear. to all Gods, this goat, the share of Pûshan, is first led forward with the vigorous Courser, While Tvashṭar sends him forward with the Charger, acceptable for sacrifice, to glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्ध॑वि॒ष्य॑मृतु॒शो दे॑व॒यानं॒ त्रिर्मानु॑षाः॒ पर्यश्वं॒ नय॑न्ति अत्रा॑ पू॒ष्णः प्र॑थ॒मो भा॒ग ए॑ति य॒ज्ञं दे॒वेभ्यः॑ प्रतिवे॒दय॑न्न॒जः
verses.transliteration: yád dhaviṣyàm r̥tuśó devayā́naṃ  trír mā́nuṣāḥ páry áśvaṃ náyanti  átrā pūṣṇáḥ prathamó bhāgá eti  yajñáṃ devébhyaḥ prativedáyann ajáḥ

translation.text: When thrice the men lead round the Steed, in order, who goeth to the Gods as meet oblation, The goat precedeth him, the share of Pûshan, and to the Gods the sacrifice announceth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: होता॑ध्व॒र्युराव॑या अग्निमि॒न्धो ग्रा॑वग्रा॒भ उ॒त शंस्ता॒ सुवि॑प्रः तेन॑ य॒ज्ञेन॒ स्व॑रंकृतेन॒ स्वि॑ष्टेन व॒क्षणा॒ आ पृ॑णध्वम्
verses.transliteration: hótādhvaryúr ā́vayā agnimindhó  grāvagrābhá utá śáṃstā súvipraḥ  téna yajñéna svàraṃkr̥tena  svìṣṭena vakṣáṇā ā́ pr̥ṇadhvam

translation.text: Invoker, ministering priest, atoner, fire-kindler Soma-presser, sage, reciter, With this well ordered sacrifice, well finished, do ye fill full the channels of the rivers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒प॒व्र॒स्का उ॒त ये यू॑पवा॒हाश्च॒षालं॒ ये अ॑श्वयू॒पाय॒ तक्ष॑ति ये चार्व॑ते॒ पच॑नं स॒म्भर॑न्त्यु॒तो तेषा॑म॒भिगू॑र्तिर्न इन्वतु
verses.transliteration: yūpavraskā́ utá yé yūpavāhā́ś  caṣā́laṃ yé aśvayūpā́ya tákṣati  yé cā́rvate pácanaṃ sambháranti-  utó téṣām abhígūrtir na invatu

translation.text: The hewers of the post and those who carry it, and those who carve the knob to deck the Horse's stake; Those who prepare the cooking-vessels for the Steed,– may the approving help of these promote our work.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॒ प्रागा॑त्सु॒मन्मे॑ऽधायि॒ मन्म॑ दे॒वाना॒माशा॒ उप॑ वी॒तपृ॑ष्ठः अन्वे॑नं॒ विप्रा॒ ऋष॑यो मदन्ति दे॒वानां॑ पु॒ष्टे च॑कृमा सु॒बन्धु॑म्
verses.transliteration: úpa prā́gāt sumán me 'dhāyi mánma  devā́nām ā́śā úpa vītápr̥ṣṭhaḥ  ánv enaṃ víprā ŕ̥ṣayo madanti  devā́nām puṣṭé cakr̥mā subándhum

translation.text: Forth, for the regions of the Gods, the Charger with his smooth back is come my prayer attends him. In him rejoice the singers and the sages. A good friend have we won for the Gods' banquet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वा॒जिनो॒ दाम॑ सं॒दान॒मर्व॑तो॒ या शी॑र्ष॒ण्या॑ रश॒ना रज्जु॑रस्य यद्वा॑ घास्य॒ प्रभृ॑तमा॒स्ये॒३॒॑ तृणं॒ सर्वा॒ ता ते॒ अपि॑ दे॒वेष्व॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: yád vājíno dā́ma saṃdā́nam árvato  yā́ śīrṣaṇyā̀ raśanā́ rájjur asya  yád vā ghāsya prábhr̥tam āsyè tŕ̥ṇaṃ  sárvā tā́ te ápi devéṣv astu

translation.text: May the fleet Courser's halter and his heel-ropes, the head-stall and the girths and cords about him. And the grass put within his mouth to bait him,– among the Gods, too, let all these be with thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदश्व॑स्य क्र॒विषो॒ मक्षि॒काश॒ यद्वा॒ स्वरौ॒ स्वधि॑तौ रि॒प्तमस्ति॑ यद्धस्त॑योः शमि॒तुर्यन्न॒खेषु॒ सर्वा॒ ता ते॒ अपि॑ दे॒वेष्व॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: yád áśvasya kravíṣo mákṣikā́śa  yád vā svárau svádhitau riptám ásti  yád dhástayoḥ śamitúr yán nakhéṣu  sárvā tā́ te ápi devéṣv astu

translation.text: What part of the Steed's flesh the fly hath eaten, or is left sticking to the post or hatchet, Or to the slayer's hands and nails adhereth,– among the Gods, too, may all this be with thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदूव॑ध्यमु॒दर॑स्याप॒वाति॒ य आ॒मस्य॑ क्र॒विषो॑ ग॒न्धो अस्ति॑ सु॒कृ॒ता तच्छ॑मि॒तारः॑ कृण्वन्तू॒त मेधं॑ शृत॒पाकं॑ पचन्तु
verses.transliteration: yád ū́vadhyam udárasyāpavā́ti  yá āmásya kravíṣo gandhó ásti  sukr̥tā́ tác chamitā́raḥ kr̥ṇvantu-  -utá médhaṃ śr̥tapā́kam pacantu

translation.text: Food undigested steaming from his belly, and any odour of raw flesh remaining, This let the immolators set in order and dress the sacrifice with perfect cooking.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॒ गात्रा॑द॒ग्निना॑ प॒च्यमा॑नाद॒भि शूलं॒ निह॑तस्याव॒धाव॑ति मा तद्भूम्या॒मा श्रि॑ष॒न्मा तृणे॑षु दे॒वेभ्य॒स्तदु॒शद्भ्यो॑ रा॒तम॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: yát te gā́trād agnínā pacyámānād  abhí śū́laṃ níhatasyāvadhā́vati  mā́ tád bhū́myām ā́ śriṣan mā́ tŕ̥ṇeṣu  devébhyas tád uśádbhyo rātám astu

translation.text: What from thy body which with fire is roasted, when thou art set upon the spit, distilleth, Let not that lie on earth or grass neglected, but to the longing Gods let all be offered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये वा॒जिनं॑ परि॒पश्य॑न्ति प॒क्वं य ई॑मा॒हुः सु॑र॒भिर्निर्ह॒रेति॑ ये चार्व॑तो मांसभि॒क्षामु॒पास॑त उ॒तो तेषा॑म॒भिगू॑र्तिर्न इन्वतु
verses.transliteration: yé vājínam paripáśyanti pakváṃ  yá īm āhúḥ surabhír nír haréti  yé cā́rvato māṃsabhikṣā́m upā́sate-  utó téṣām abhígūrtir na invatu

translation.text: They who observing that the Horse is ready call out and say, the smell is good; remove it; And, craving meat, await the distribution, -may their approving help promote labour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यन्नीक्ष॑णं माँ॒स्पच॑न्या उ॒खाया॒ या पात्रा॑णि यू॒ष्ण आ॒सेच॑नानि ऊ॒ष्म॒ण्या॑पि॒धाना॑ चरू॒णाम॒ङ्काः सू॒नाः परि॑ भूष॒न्त्यश्व॑म्
verses.transliteration: yán nī́kṣaṇam mām̐spácanyā ukhā́yāḥ-  yā́ pā́trāṇi yūṣṇá āsécanāni  ūṣmaṇyā̀pidhā́nā carūṇā́m  aṅkā́ḥ sūnā́ḥ pári bhūṣanty áśvam

translation.text: The trial-fork of the flesh-cooking caldron, the vessels out of which the broth is sprinkled, The warming-pots, the covers of the dishes, hooks, carving-boards,– all these attend the Charger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि॒क्रम॑णं नि॒षद॑नं वि॒वर्त॑नं॒ यच्च॒ पड्बी॑श॒मर्व॑तः यच्च॑ प॒पौ यच्च॑ घा॒सिं ज॒घास॒ सर्वा॒ ता ते॒ अपि॑ दे॒वेष्व॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: nikrámaṇaṃ niṣádanaṃ vivártanaṃ  yác ca páḍbīśam árvataḥ  yác ca papaú yác ca ghāsíṃ jaghā́sa  sárvā tā́ te ápi devéṣv astu

translation.text: The starting-place, his place of rest and rolling, the ropes wherewith the Charger's feet were fastened, The water that he drank, the food he tasted, -among the Gods, too, may all these attend thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा त्वा॒ग्निर्ध्व॑नयीद्धू॒मग॑न्धि॒र्मोखा भ्राज॑न्त्य॒भि वि॑क्त॒ जघ्रिः॑ इ॒ष्टं वी॒तम॒भिगू॑र्तं॒ वष॑ट्कृतं॒ तं दे॒वासः॒ प्रति॑ गृभ्ण॒न्त्यश्व॑म्
verses.transliteration: mā́ tvāgnír dhvanayīd dhūmágandhir  mókhā́ bhrā́janty abhí vikta jághriḥ  iṣṭáṃ vītám abhígūrtaṃ váṣaṭkr̥taṃ  táṃ devā́saḥ práti gr̥bhṇanty áśvam

translation.text: Let not the fire, smoke-scented, make thee crackle, nor glowing caldron smell and break to pieces. Offered, beloved, approved, and consecrated,– such Charger do the Gods accept with favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदश्वा॑य॒ वास॑ उपस्तृ॒णन्त्य॑धीवा॒सं या हिर॑ण्यान्यस्मै सं॒दान॒मर्व॑न्तं॒ पड्बी॑शं प्रि॒या दे॒वेष्वा या॑मयन्ति
verses.transliteration: yád áśvāya vā́sa upastr̥ṇánti-  adhīvāsáṃ yā́ híraṇyāny asmai  saṃdā́nam árvantam páḍbīśam  priyā́ devéṣv ā́ yāmayanti

translation.text: The robe they spread upon the Horse to clothe him, the upper covering and the golden trappings, The halters which restrain the Steed, the heel-ropes,– all these, as grateful to the Gods, they offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॑ सा॒दे मह॑सा॒ शूकृ॑तस्य॒ पार्ष्ण्या॑ वा॒ कश॑या वा तु॒तोद॑ स्रु॒चेव॒ ता ह॒विषो॑ अध्व॒रेषु॒ सर्वा॒ ता ते॒ ब्रह्म॑णा सूदयामि
verses.transliteration: yát te sādé máhasā śū́kr̥tasya  pā́rṣṇyā vā káśayā vā tutóda  srucéva tā́ havíṣo adhvaréṣu  sárvā tā́ te bráhmaṇā sūdayāmi

translation.text: If one, when seated, with excessive urging hath with his heel or with his whip distressed thee, All these thy woes, as with the oblations' ladle at sacrifices, with my prayer I banish.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चतु॑स्त्रिंशद्वा॒जिनो॑ दे॒वब॑न्धो॒र्वङ्क्री॒रश्व॑स्य॒ स्वधि॑तिः॒ समे॑ति अच्छि॑द्रा॒ गात्रा॑ व॒युना॑ कृणोत॒ परु॑ष्परुरनु॒घुष्या॒ वि श॑स्त
verses.transliteration: cátustriṃśad vājíno devábandhor  váṅkrīr áśvasya svádhitiḥ sám eti  áchidrā gā́trā vayúnā kr̥ṇota  páruṣ-parur anughúṣyā ví śasta

translation.text: The four-and-thirty ribs of the. Swift Charger, kin to the Gods, the slayer's hatchet pierces. Cut ye with skill, so that the parts be flawless, and piece by piece declaring them dissect them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एक॒स्त्वष्टु॒रश्व॑स्या विश॒स्ता द्वा य॒न्तारा॑ भवत॒स्तथ॑ ऋ॒तुः या ते॒ गात्रा॑णामृतु॒था कृ॒णोमि॒ ताता॒ पिण्डा॑नां॒ प्र जु॑होम्य॒ग्नौ
verses.transliteration: ékas tváṣṭur áśvasyā viśastā́  dvā́ yantā́rā bhavatas tátha r̥túḥ  yā́ te gā́trāṇām r̥tuthā́ kr̥ṇómi  tā́-tā píṇḍānām prá juhomy agnaú

translation.text: Of Tvashṭar's Charger there is one dissector,– this is the custom-two there are who guide him. Such of his limbs as I divide in order, these, amid the balls, in fire I offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा त्वा॑ तपत्प्रि॒य आ॒त्मापि॒यन्तं॒ मा स्वधि॑तिस्त॒न्व१॒॑ आ ति॑ष्ठिपत्ते मा ते॑ गृ॒ध्नुर॑विश॒स्ताति॒हाय॑ छि॒द्रा गात्रा॑ण्य॒सिना॒ मिथू॑ कः
verses.transliteration: mā́ tvā tapat priyá ātmā́piyántam  mā́ svádhitis tanvà ā́ tiṣṭhipat te  mā́ te gr̥dhnúr aviśastā́tihā́ya  chidrā́ gā́trāṇy asínā míthū kaḥ

translation.text: Let not thy dear soul burn thee as thou comest, let not the hatchet linger in thy body. Let not a greedy clumsy immolator, missing the joints, mangle thy limbs unduly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न वा उ॑ ए॒तन्म्रि॑यसे॒ न रि॑ष्यसि दे॒वाँ इदे॑षि प॒थिभिः॑ सु॒गेभिः॑ हरी॑ ते॒ युञ्जा॒ पृष॑ती अभूता॒मुपा॑स्थाद्वा॒जी धु॒रि रास॑भस्य
verses.transliteration: ná vā́ u etán mriyase ná riṣyasi  devā́m̐ íd eṣi pathíbhiḥ sugébhiḥ  hárī te yúñjā pŕ̥ṣatī abhūtām  úpāsthād vājī́ dhurí rā́sabhasya

translation.text: No, here thou diest not, thou art not injured: by easy paths unto the Gods thou goest. Both Bays, both spotted mares are now thy fellows, and to the ass's pole is yoked the Charger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒गव्यं॑ नो वा॒जी स्वश्व्यं॑ पुं॒सः पु॒त्राँ उ॒त वि॑श्वा॒पुषं॑ र॒यिम् अ॒ना॒गा॒स्त्वं नो॒ अदि॑तिः कृणोतु क्ष॒त्रं नो॒ अश्वो॑ वनतां ह॒विष्मा॑न्
verses.transliteration: sugávyaṃ no vājī́ sváśvyam  puṃsáḥ putrā́m̐ utá viśvāpúṣaṃ rayím  anāgāstváṃ no áditiḥ kr̥ṇotu  kṣatráṃ no áśvo vanatāṃ havíṣmān

translation.text: May this Steed bring us all-sustaining riches, wealth in good kine,good horses, manly offspring. Freedom from sin may Aditi vouchsafe us: the Steed with our oblations gain us lordship!

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदक्र॑न्दः प्रथ॒मं जाय॑मान उ॒द्यन्त्स॑मु॒द्रादु॒त वा॒ पुरी॑षात् श्ये॒नस्य॑ प॒क्षा ह॑रि॒णस्य॑ बा॒हू उ॑प॒स्तुत्यं॒ महि॑ जा॒तं ते॑ अर्वन्
verses.transliteration: yád ákrandaḥ prathamáṃ jā́yamānaḥ-  udyán samudrā́d utá vā púrīṣāt  śyenásya pakṣā́ hariṇásya bāhū́  upastútyam máhi jātáṃ te arvan

translation.text: WHAT time, first springing into life, thou neighedst, proceeding from the sea or upper waters, Limbs of the deer hadst thou, and eagle pinions. O Steed, thy birth is nigh and must be lauded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒मेन॑ द॒त्तं त्रि॒त ए॑नमायुन॒गिन्द्र॑ एणं प्रथ॒मो अध्य॑तिष्ठत् ग॒न्ध॒र्वो अ॑स्य रश॒नाम॑गृभ्णा॒त्सूरा॒दश्वं॑ वसवो॒ निर॑तष्ट
verses.transliteration: yaména dattáṃ tritá enam āyunag  índra eṇam prathamó ádhy atiṣṭhat  gandharvó asya raśanā́m agr̥bhṇāt  sū́rād áśvaṃ vasavo nír ataṣṭa

translation.text: This Steed which Yama gave hath Trita harnessed, and him, the first of all, hath Indra mounted. His bridle the Gandharva grasped. O Vasus, from out the Sun ye fashioned forth the Courser.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असि॑ य॒मो अस्या॑दि॒त्यो अ॑र्व॒न्नसि॑ त्रि॒तो गुह्ये॑न व्र॒तेन॑ असि॒ सोमे॑न स॒मया॒ विपृ॑क्त आ॒हुस्ते॒ त्रीणि॑ दि॒वि बन्ध॑नानि
verses.transliteration: ási yamó ásy ādityó arvann  ási tritó gúhyena vraténa  ási sómena samáyā vípr̥ktaḥ-  āhús te trī́ṇi diví bándhanāni

translation.text: Yama art thou, O Horse; thou art Âditya; Trita art thou by secret operation. Thou art divided thoroughly from Soma. They say thou hast three bonds in heaven that hold thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रीणि॑ त आहुर्दि॒वि बन्ध॑नानि॒ त्रीण्य॒प्सु त्रीण्य॒न्तः स॑मु॒द्रे उ॒तेव॑ मे॒ वरु॑णश्छन्त्स्यर्व॒न्यत्रा॑ त आ॒हुः प॑र॒मं ज॒नित्र॑म्
verses.transliteration: trī́ṇi ta āhur diví bándhanāni  trī́ṇy apsú trī́ṇy antáḥ samudré  utéva me váruṇaś chantsy arvan  yátrā ta āhúḥ paramáṃ janítram

translation.text: Three bonds, they say, thou hast in heaven that bind thee, three in the waters, three within the ocean. To me thou seernest Varuṇa , O Courser, there where they say is thy sublimest birth-place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा ते॑ वाजिन्नव॒मार्ज॑नानी॒मा श॒फानां॑ सनि॒तुर्नि॒धाना॑ अत्रा॑ ते भ॒द्रा र॑श॒ना अ॑पश्यमृ॒तस्य॒ या अ॑भि॒रक्ष॑न्ति गो॒पाः
verses.transliteration: imā́ te vājinn avamā́rjanāni-  -imā́ śaphā́nāṃ sanitúr nidhā́nā  átrā te bhadrā́ raśanā́ apaśyam  r̥tásya yā́ abhirákṣanti gopā́ḥ

translation.text: Here-, Courser, are the places where they groomed thee, here are the traces of thy hoofs as winner. Here have I seen the auspicious reins that guide thee, which those who guard the holy Law keep safely.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒त्मानं॑ ते॒ मन॑सा॒राद॑जानाम॒वो दि॒वा प॒तय॑न्तं पतं॒गम् शिरो॑ अपश्यं प॒थिभिः॑ सु॒गेभि॑ररे॒णुभि॒र्जेह॑मानं पत॒त्रि
verses.transliteration: ātmā́naṃ te mánasārā́d ajānām  avó divā́ patáyantam pataṃgám  śíro apaśyam pathíbhiḥ sugébhir  areṇúbhir jéhamānam patatrí

translation.text: Thyself from far I recognized in spirit,– a Bird that from below flew through the heaven. I saw thy head still soaring, striving upward by paths unsoiled by dust, pleasant to travel.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्रा॑ ते रू॒पमु॑त्त॒मम॑पश्यं॒ जिगी॑षमाणमि॒ष आ प॒दे गोः य॒दा ते॒ मर्तो॒ अनु॒ भोग॒मान॒ळादिद्ग्रसि॑ष्ठ॒ ओष॑धीरजीगः
verses.transliteration: átrā te rūpám uttamám apaśyaṃ  jígīṣamāṇam iṣá ā́ padé góḥ  yadā́ te márto ánu bhógam ā́naḷ  ā́d íd grásiṣṭha óṣadhīr ajīgaḥ

translation.text: Here I beheld thy form, matchless in glory, eager to win thee food at the Cow's station. Whene'er a man brings thee to thine enjoyment, thou swallowest the plants most greedy eater.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑ त्वा॒ रथो॒ अनु॒ मर्यो॑ अर्व॒न्ननु॒ गावोऽनु॒ भगः॑ क॒नीना॑म् अनु॒ व्राता॑स॒स्तव॑ स॒ख्यमी॑यु॒रनु॑ दे॒वा म॑मिरे वी॒र्यं॑ ते
verses.transliteration: ánu tvā rátho ánu máryo arvann  ánu gā́vó 'nu bhágaḥ kanī́nām  ánu vrā́tāsas táva sakhyám īyur  ánu devā́ mamire vīryàṃ te

translation.text: After thee, Courser, come the car, the bridegroom, the kine come after, and the charm of maidens. Full companies have followed for thy friendship: the pattern of thy vigour Gods have copied.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यशृ॒ङ्गोऽयो॑ अस्य॒ पादा॒ मनो॑जवा॒ अव॑र॒ इन्द्र॑ आसीत् दे॒वा इद॑स्य हवि॒रद्य॑माय॒न्यो अर्व॑न्तं प्रथ॒मो अ॒ध्यति॑ष्ठत्
verses.transliteration: híraṇyaśr̥ṅgó 'yo asya pā́dāḥ-  mánojavā ávara índra āsīt  devā́ íd asya havirádyam āyan  yó árvantam prathamó adhyátiṣṭhat

translation.text: Horns made of gold hath he: his feet are iron: less fleet than he, though swift as thought, is Indra. The Gods have come that they may taste the oblation of him who mounted, first of all, the Courser.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒र्मान्ता॑सः॒ सिलि॑कमध्यमासः॒ सं शूर॑णासो दि॒व्यासो॒ अत्याः॑ हं॒सा इ॑व श्रेणि॒शो य॑तन्ते॒ यदाक्षि॑षुर्दि॒व्यमज्म॒मश्वाः॑
verses.transliteration: īrmā́ntāsaḥ sílikamadhyamāsaḥ  sáṃ śū́raṇāso divyā́so átyāḥ  haṃsā́ iva śreṇiśó yatante  yád ā́kṣiṣur divyám ájmam áśvāḥ

translation.text: Symmetrical in flank, with rounded haunches, mettled like heroes, the Celestial Coursers Put forth their strength, like swans in lengthened order, when they, the Steeds, have reached the heavenly causeway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ शरी॑रं पतयि॒ष्ण्व॑र्व॒न्तव॑ चि॒त्तं वात॑ इव॒ ध्रजी॑मान् तव॒ शृङ्गा॑णि॒ विष्ठि॑ता पुरु॒त्रार॑ण्येषु॒ जर्भु॑राणा चरन्ति
verses.transliteration: táva śárīram patayiṣṇv àrvan  táva cittáṃ vā́ta iva dhrájīmān  táva śŕ̥ṅgāṇi víṣṭhitā purutrā́-  -áraṇyeṣu járbhurāṇā caranti

translation.text: A body formed for flight hast thou, O Charger; swift as the wind in motion is thy spirit. Thy horns are spread abroad in all directions: they move with restless beat in wildernesses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॒ प्रागा॒च्छस॑नं वा॒ज्यर्वा॑ देव॒द्रीचा॒ मन॑सा॒ दीध्या॑नः अ॒जः पु॒रो नी॑यते॒ नाभि॑र॒स्यानु॑ प॒श्चात्क॒वयो॑ यन्ति रे॒भाः
verses.transliteration: úpa prā́gāc chásanaṃ vājy árvā  devadrī́cā mánasā dī́dhyānaḥ  ajáḥ puró nīyate nā́bhir asya-  -ánu paścā́t kaváyo yanti rebhā́ḥ

translation.text: The strong Steed hath come forward to the slaughter, pondering with a mind directed God-ward. The goat who is his kin is led before him the sages and the singers follow after.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॒ प्रागा॑त्पर॒मं यत्स॒धस्थ॒मर्वाँ॒ अच्छा॑ पि॒तरं॑ मा॒तरं॑ च अ॒द्या दे॒वाञ्जुष्ट॑तमो॒ हि ग॒म्या अथा शा॑स्ते दा॒शुषे॒ वार्या॑णि
verses.transliteration: úpa prā́gāt paramáṃ yát sadhástham  árvām̐ áchā pitáram mātáraṃ ca  adyā́ devā́ñ júṣṭatamo hí gamyā́ḥ-  áthā́ śāste dāśúṣe vā́ryāṇi

translation.text: The Steed is come unto the noblest mansion, is come unto his Father and his Mother. This day shall he approach the Gods, most welcome: then he declares good gifts to him who offers.

suktas.rsi: Dirghatamas, Son of Ucathya and Mamata

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य वा॒मस्य॑ पलि॒तस्य॒ होतु॒स्तस्य॒ भ्राता॑ मध्य॒मो अ॒स्त्यश्नः॑ तृ॒तीयो॒ भ्राता॑ घृ॒तपृ॑ष्ठो अ॒स्यात्रा॑पश्यं वि॒श्पतिं॑ स॒प्तपु॑त्रम्
verses.transliteration: asyá vāmásya palitásya hótus  tásya bhrā́tā madhyamó asty áśnaḥ  tr̥tī́yo bhrā́tā ghr̥tápr̥ṣṭho asya-  -átrāpaśyaṃ viśpátiṃ saptáputram

translation.text: OF this benignant Priest, with eld grey-coloured, the brother midmost of the three is lightning. The third is he whose back with oil is sprinkled. Here I behold the Chief with seven male children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त यु॑ञ्जन्ति॒ रथ॒मेक॑चक्र॒मेको॒ अश्वो॑ वहति स॒प्तना॑मा त्रि॒नाभि॑ च॒क्रम॒जर॑मन॒र्वं यत्रे॒मा विश्वा॒ भुव॒नाधि॑ त॒स्थुः
verses.transliteration: saptá yuñjanti rátham ékacakram  éko áśvo vahati saptánāmā  trinā́bhi cakrám ajáram anarváṃ  yátremā́ víśvā bhúvanā́dhi tasthúḥ

translation.text: Seven to the one-wheeled chariot yoke the Courser; bearing seven names the single Courser draws it. Three-naved the wheel is, sound and undecaying, whereon are resting all these worlds of being.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं रथ॒मधि॒ ये स॒प्त त॒स्थुः स॒प्तच॑क्रं स॒प्त व॑ह॒न्त्यश्वाः॑ स॒प्त स्वसा॑रो अ॒भि सं न॑वन्ते॒ यत्र॒ गवां॒ निहि॑ता स॒प्त नाम॑
verses.transliteration: imáṃ rátham ádhi yé saptá tasthúḥ  saptácakraṃ saptá vahanty áśvāḥ  saptá svásāro abhí sáṃ navante  yátra gávāṃ níhitā saptá nā́ma

translation.text: The seven who on the seven-wheeled car are mounted have horses, seven in tale, who draw them onward. Seven Sisters utter songs of praise together, in whom the names of the seven Cows are treasured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को द॑दर्श प्रथ॒मं जाय॑मानमस्थ॒न्वन्तं॒ यद॑न॒स्था बिभ॑र्ति भूम्या॒ असु॒रसृ॑गा॒त्मा क्व॑ स्वि॒त्को वि॒द्वांस॒मुप॑ गा॒त्प्रष्टु॑मे॒तत्
verses.transliteration: kó dadarśa prathamáṃ jā́yamānam  asthanvántaṃ yád anasthā́ bíbharti  bhū́myā ásur ásr̥g ātmā́ kvà svit  kó vidvā́ṃsam úpa gāt práṣṭum etát

translation.text: Who hath beheld him as he sprang to being, seen how the boneless One supports the bony? Where is the blood of earth, the life, the spirit? Who may approach the man who knows, to ask it?

verses.sanskrit_deva: पाकः॑ पृच्छामि॒ मन॒सावि॑जानन्दे॒वाना॑मे॒ना निहि॑ता प॒दानि॑ व॒त्से ब॒ष्कयेऽधि॑ स॒प्त तन्तू॒न्वि त॑त्निरे क॒वय॒ ओत॒वा उ॑
verses.transliteration: pā́kaḥ pr̥chāmi mánasā́vijānan  devā́nām enā́ níhitā padā́ni  vatsé baṣkáyé 'dhi saptá tántūn  ví tatnire kaváya ótavā́ u

translation.text: Unripe in mind, in spirit undiscerning, I ask of these the Gods' established places; For up above the yearling Calf the sages, to form a web, their own seven threads have woven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अचि॑कित्वाञ्चिकि॒तुष॑श्चि॒दत्र॑ क॒वीन्पृ॑च्छामि वि॒द्मने॒ न वि॒द्वान् वि यस्त॒स्तम्भ॒ षळि॒मा रजां॑स्य॒जस्य॑ रू॒पे किमपि॑ स्वि॒देक॑म्
verses.transliteration: ácikitvāñ cikitúṣaś cid átra  kavī́n pr̥chāmi vidmáne ná vidvā́n  ví yás tastámbha ṣáḷ imā́ rájāṃsi-  ajásya rūpé kím ápi svid ékam

translation.text: I ask, unknowing, those who know, the sages, as one all ignorant for sake of knowledge, What was that ONE who in the Unborn's image hath stablished and fixed firm these worlds' six regions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ह ब्र॑वीतु॒ य ई॑म॒ङ्ग वेदा॒स्य वा॒मस्य॒ निहि॑तं प॒दं वेः शी॒र्ष्णः क्षी॒रं दु॑ह्रते॒ गावो॑ अस्य व॒व्रिं वसा॑ना उद॒कं प॒दापुः॑
verses.transliteration: ihá bravītu yá īm aṅgá véda-  -asyá vāmásya níhitam padáṃ véḥ  śīrṣṇáḥ kṣīráṃ duhrate gā́vo asya  vavríṃ vásānā udakám padā́puḥ

translation.text: Let him who knoweth presently declare it , this lovely Bird's securely founded station. Forth from his head the Cows draw milk, and, wearing his vesture, with their foot have drunk the water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा॒ता पि॒तर॑मृ॒त आ ब॑भाज धी॒त्यग्रे॒ मन॑सा॒ सं हि ज॒ग्मे सा बी॑भ॒त्सुर्गर्भ॑रसा॒ निवि॑द्धा॒ नम॑स्वन्त॒ इदु॑पवा॒कमी॑युः
verses.transliteration: mātā́ pitáram r̥tá ā́ babhāja  dhīty ágre mánasā sáṃ hí jagmé  sā́ bībhatsúr gárbharasā níviddhā  námasvanta íd upavākám īyuḥ

translation.text: The Mother gave the Sire his share of Order: with thought, at first, she wedded him in spirit. She, the coy Dame, was filled with dew prolific: with adoration men approached to praise her.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒क्ता मा॒तासी॑द्धु॒रि दक्षि॑णाया॒ अति॑ष्ठ॒द्गर्भो॑ वृज॒नीष्व॒न्तः अमी॑मेद्व॒त्सो अनु॒ गाम॑पश्यद्विश्वरू॒प्यं॑ त्रि॒षु योज॑नेषु
verses.transliteration: yuktā́ mātā́sīd dhurí dákṣiṇāyāḥ-  átiṣṭhad gárbho vr̥janī́ṣv antáḥ  ámīmed vatsó ánu gā́m apaśyad  viśvarūpyàṃ triṣú yójaneṣu

translation.text: Yoked was the Mother to the boon Cow's car-pole: in the dank rows of cloud the Infant rested. Then the Calf lowed, and looked upon the Mother, the Cow who wears all shapes in three directions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒स्रो मा॒तॄस्त्रीन्पि॒तॄन्बिभ्र॒देक॑ ऊ॒र्ध्वस्त॑स्थौ॒ नेमव॑ ग्लापयन्ति म॒न्त्रय॑न्ते दि॒वो अ॒मुष्य॑ पृ॒ष्ठे वि॑श्व॒विदं॒ वाच॒मवि॑श्वमिन्वाम्
verses.transliteration: tisró mātr̥̄́s trī́n pitr̥̄́n bíbhrad ékaḥ-  ūrdhvás tasthau ném áva glāpayanti  mantráyante divó amúṣya pr̥ṣṭhé  viśvavídaṃ vā́cam áviśvaminvām

translation.text: Bearing three Mothers and three Fathers, single he stood erect: they never make him weary. There on the pitch of heaven they speak together in speech all-knowing but not all-impelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वाद॑शारं न॒हि तज्जरा॑य॒ वर्व॑र्ति च॒क्रं परि॒ द्यामृ॒तस्य॑ आ पु॒त्रा अ॑ग्ने मिथु॒नासो॒ अत्र॑ स॒प्त श॒तानि॑ विंश॒तिश्च॑ तस्थुः
verses.transliteration: dvā́daśāraṃ nahí táj járāya  várvarti cakrám pári dyā́m r̥tásya  ā́ putrā́ agne mithunā́so átra  saptá śatā́ni viṃśatíś ca tasthuḥ

translation.text: Formed with twelve spokes, by length of time, unweakened, rolls round the heaven this wheel of during Order. Herein established, joined in pairs together, seven hundred Sons and twenty stand, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पञ्च॑पादं पि॒तरं॒ द्वाद॑शाकृतिं दि॒व आ॑हुः॒ परे॒ अर्धे॑ पुरी॒षिण॑म् अथे॒मे अ॒न्य उप॑रे विचक्ष॒णं स॒प्तच॑क्रे॒ षळ॑र आहु॒रर्पि॑तम्
verses.transliteration: páñcapādam pitáraṃ dvā́daśākr̥tiṃ  divá āhuḥ páre árdhe purīṣíṇam  áthemé anyá úpare vicakṣaṇáṃ  saptácakre ṣáḷara āhur árpitam

translation.text: They call him in the farther half of heaven the Sire five-footed, of twelve forms, wealthy in watery store. These others say that he, God with far-seeing eyes, is mounted on the lower seven-wheeled, sixspoked car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पञ्चा॑रे च॒क्रे प॑रि॒वर्त॑माने॒ तस्मि॒न्ना त॑स्थु॒र्भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑ तस्य॒ नाक्ष॑स्तप्यते॒ भूरि॑भारः स॒नादे॒व न शी॑र्यते॒ सना॑भिः
verses.transliteration: páñcāre cakré parivártamāne  tásminn ā́ tasthur bhúvanāni víśvā  tásya nā́kṣas tapyate bhū́ribhāraḥ  sanā́d evá ná śīryate sánābhiḥ

translation.text: Upon this five-spoked wheel revolving ever all living creatures rest and are dependent. Its axle, heavy-laden, is not heated: the nave from ancient time remains unbroken.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सने॑मि च॒क्रम॒जरं॒ वि वा॑वृत उत्ता॒नायां॒ दश॑ यु॒क्ता व॑हन्ति सूर्य॑स्य॒ चक्षू॒ रज॑सै॒त्यावृ॑तं॒ तस्मि॒न्नार्पि॑ता॒ भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: sánemi cakrám ajáraṃ ví vāvr̥te-  uttānā́yāṃ dáśa yuktā́ vahanti  sū́ryasya cákṣū rájasaity ā́vr̥taṃ  tásminn ā́rpitā bhúvanāni víśvā

translation.text: The wheel revolves, unwasting, with its felly: ten draw it, yoked to the far-stretching car-pole. The Sun's eye moves encompassed by the region: on him dependent rest all living creatures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒कं॒जानां॑ स॒प्तथ॑माहुरेक॒जं षळिद्य॒मा ऋष॑यो देव॒जा इति॑ तेषा॑मि॒ष्टानि॒ विहि॑तानि धाम॒शः स्था॒त्रे रे॑जन्ते॒ विकृ॑तानि रूप॒शः
verses.transliteration: sākaṃjā́nāṃ saptátham āhur ekajáṃ  ṣáḷ íd yamā́ ŕ̥ṣayo devajā́ íti  téṣām iṣṭā́ni víhitāni dhāmaśáḥ-  sthātré rejante víkr̥tāni rūpaśáḥ

translation.text: Of the co-born they call the seventh single-born; the six twin pairs are called R̥ishis, Children of Gods. Their good gifts sought of men are ranged in order due, and various in their form move for the Lord who guides.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्त्रियः॑ स॒तीस्ताँ उ॑ मे पुं॒स आ॑हुः॒ पश्य॑दक्ष॒ण्वान्न वि चे॑तद॒न्धः क॒विर्यः पु॒त्रः स ई॒मा चि॑केत॒ यस्ता वि॑जा॒नात्स पि॒तुष्पि॒तास॑त्
verses.transliteration: stríyaḥ satī́s tā́m̐ u me puṃsá āhuḥ  páśyad akṣaṇvā́n ná ví cetad andháḥ  kavír yáḥ putráḥ sá īm ā́ ciketa  yás tā́ vijānā́t sá pitúṣ pitā́sat

translation.text: They told me these were males, though truly females: he who hath eyes sees this, the blind discerns not. The son who is a sage hath comprehended: who knows this rightly is his father's father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वः परे॑ण प॒र ए॒नाव॑रेण प॒दा व॒त्सं बिभ्र॑ती॒ गौरुद॑स्थात् सा क॒द्रीची॒ कं स्वि॒दर्धं॒ परा॑गा॒त्क्व॑ स्वित्सूते न॒हि यू॒थे अ॒न्तः
verses.transliteration: aváḥ páreṇa pará enā́vareṇa  padā́ vatsám bíbhratī gaúr úd asthāt  sā́ kadrī́cī káṃ svid árdham párāgāt  kvà svit sūte nahí yūthé antáḥ

translation.text: Beneath the upper realm, above this lower, bearing her calf at foot the Cow hath risen. Witherward, to what place hath she departed? Where calves she? Not amid this herd of cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वः परे॑ण पि॒तरं॒ यो अ॑स्यानु॒वेद॑ प॒र ए॒नाव॑रेण क॒वी॒यमा॑नः॒ क इ॒ह प्र वो॑चद्दे॒वं मनः॒ कुतो॒ अधि॒ प्रजा॑तम्
verses.transliteration: aváḥ páreṇa pitáraṃ yó asya-  -anuvéda pará enā́vareṇa  kavīyámānaḥ ká ihá prá vocad  devám mánaḥ kúto ádhi prájātam

translation.text: Who, that the father of this Calf discerneth beneath the upper realm, above the lower, Showing himself a sage, may here declare it? Whence hath the Godlike spirit had its rising?

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये अ॒र्वाञ्च॒स्ताँ उ॒ परा॑च आहु॒र्ये परा॑ञ्च॒स्ताँ उ॑ अ॒र्वाच॑ आहुः इन्द्र॑श्च॒ या च॒क्रथुः॑ सोम॒ तानि॑ धु॒रा न यु॒क्ता रज॑सो वहन्ति
verses.transliteration: yé arvā́ñcas tā́m̐ u párāca āhur  yé párāñcas tā́m̐ u arvā́ca āhuḥ  índraś ca yā́ cakráthuḥ soma tā́ni  dhurā́ ná yuktā́ rájaso vahanti

translation.text: Those that come hitherward they call departing, those that depart they call directed hither. And what so ye have made, Indra and Soma, steeds bear as 'twere yoked to the region's car-pole.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वा सु॑प॒र्णा स॒युजा॒ सखा॑या समा॒नं वृ॒क्षं परि॑ षस्वजाते तयो॑र॒न्यः पिप्प॑लं स्वा॒द्वत्त्यन॑श्नन्न॒न्यो अ॒भि चा॑कशीति
verses.transliteration: dvā́ suparṇā́ sayújā sákhāyā  samānáṃ vr̥kṣám pári ṣasvajāte  táyor anyáḥ píppalaṃ svādv átti-  ánaśnann anyó abhí cākaśīti

translation.text: Two Birds with fair wings, knit with bonds of friendship, in the same sheltering tree have found a refuge. One of the twain eats the sweet Fig-tree's fruitage; the other eating not regardeth only.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्रा॑ सुप॒र्णा अ॒मृत॑स्य भा॒गमनि॑मेषं वि॒दथा॑भि॒स्वर॑न्ति इ॒नो विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य गो॒पाः स मा॒ धीरः॒ पाक॒मत्रा वि॑वेश
verses.transliteration: yátrā suparṇā́ amŕ̥tasya bhāgám  ánimeṣaṃ vidáthābhisváranti  inó víśvasya bhúvanasya gopā́ḥ  sá mā dhī́raḥ pā́kam átrā́ viveśa

translation.text: Where those fine Birds hymn ceaselessly their portion of life eternal, and the sacred synods, There is the Universe's mighty Keeper, who, wise, hath entered into me the simple.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मि॑न्वृ॒क्षे म॒ध्वदः॑ सुप॒र्णा नि॑वि॒शन्ते॒ सुव॑ते॒ चाधि॒ विश्वे॑ तस्येदा॑हुः॒ पिप्प॑लं स्वा॒द्वग्रे॒ तन्नोन्न॑श॒द्यः पि॒तरं॒ न वेद॑
verses.transliteration: yásmin vr̥kṣé madhvádaḥ suparṇā́ḥ-  niviśánte súvate cā́dhi víśve  tásyéd āhuḥ píppalaṃ svādv ágre  tán nón naśad yáḥ pitáraṃ ná véda

translation.text: The, tree whereon the fine Birds eat the sweetness, where they all rest and procreate their offspring,– Upon its top they say the fig is luscious none gaineth it who knoweth not the Father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्गा॑य॒त्रे अधि॑ गाय॒त्रमाहि॑तं॒ त्रैष्टु॑भाद्वा॒ त्रैष्टु॑भं नि॒रत॑क्षत यद्वा॒ जग॒ज्जग॒त्याहि॑तं प॒दं य इत्तद्वि॒दुस्ते अ॑मृत॒त्वमा॑नशुः
verses.transliteration: yád gāyatré ádhi gāyatrám ā́hitaṃ  traíṣṭubhād vā traíṣṭubhaṃ nirátakṣata  yád vā jágaj jágaty ā́hitam padáṃ  yá ít tád vidús té amr̥tatvám ānaśuḥ

translation.text: How on the Gâyatrî. the Gâyatrî was based, how from the Trishṭup they fashioned the Trishṭup forth, How on the Jagatî was based the Jagatî,– they who know this have won themselves immortal life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गा॒य॒त्रेण॒ प्रति॑ मिमीते अ॒र्कम॒र्केण॒ साम॒ त्रैष्टु॑भेन वा॒कम् वा॒केन॑ वा॒कं द्वि॒पदा॒ चतु॑ष्पदा॒क्षरे॑ण मिमते स॒प्त वाणीः॑
verses.transliteration: gāyatréṇa práti mimīte arkám  arkéṇa sā́ma traíṣṭubhena vākám  vākéna vākáṃ dvipádā cátuṣpadā-  -akṣáreṇa mimate saptá vā́ṇīḥ

translation.text: With Gâyatrî he measures out the praise-song, Sâma with praise-song, triplet with the Trishṭup. The triplet witli the two or four-foot measure, and with the syllable they form seven metres.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जग॑ता॒ सिन्धुं॑ दि॒व्य॑स्तभायद्रथंत॒रे सूर्यं॒ पर्य॑पश्यत् गा॒य॒त्रस्य॑ स॒मिध॑स्ति॒स्र आ॑हु॒स्ततो॑ म॒ह्ना प्र रि॑रिचे महि॒त्वा
verses.transliteration: jágatā síndhuṃ divy àstabhāyad  rathaṃtaré sū́ryam páry apaśyat  gāyatrásya samídhas tisrá āhus  táto mahnā́ prá ririce mahitvā́

translation.text: With Jagatî the flood in heaven he stablished, and saw the Sun in the Rathantara Sâman. Gâyatrî hath, they say, three brands for kindling: hence it excels in majesty and vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ ह्वये सु॒दुघां॑ धे॒नुमे॒तां सु॒हस्तो॑ गो॒धुगु॒त दो॑हदेनाम् श्रेष्ठं॑ स॒वं स॑वि॒ता सा॑विषन्नो॒ऽभी॑द्धो घ॒र्मस्तदु॒ षु प्र वो॑चम्
verses.transliteration: úpa hvaye sudúghāṃ dhenúm etā́ṃ  suhásto godhúg utá dohad enām  śréṣṭhaṃ saváṃ savitā́ sāviṣan no  -abhī̀ddho gharmás tád u ṣú prá vocam

translation.text: I invocate the milch-cow good for milking so that the milker, deft of hand, may drain her. May Savitar give goodliest stimulation. The caldron is made hot; I will proclaim it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हि॒ङ्कृ॒ण्व॒ती व॑सु॒पत्नी॒ वसू॑नां व॒त्समि॒च्छन्ती॒ मन॑सा॒भ्यागा॑त् दु॒हाम॒श्विभ्यां॒ पयो॑ अ॒घ्न्येयं सा व॑र्धतां मह॒ते सौभ॑गाय
verses.transliteration: hiṅkr̥ṇvatī́ vasupátnī vásūnāṃ  vatsám ichántī mánasābhy ā́gāt  duhā́m aśvíbhyām páyo aghnyéyáṃ  sā́ vardhatām mahaté saúbhagāya

translation.text: She, lady of all treasure, is come hither yearning in spirit for her calf and lowing. May this cow yield her milk for both the Aṣvins, and may she prosper to our high advantage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गौर॑मीमे॒दनु॑ व॒त्सं मि॒षन्तं॑ मू॒र्धानं॒ हिङ्ङ॑कृणो॒न्मात॒वा उ॑ सृक्वा॑णं घ॒र्मम॒भि वा॑वशा॒ना मिमा॑ति मा॒युं पय॑ते॒ पयो॑भिः
verses.transliteration: gaúr amīmed ánu vatsám miṣántam  mūrdhā́naṃ híṅṅ akr̥ṇon mā́tavā́ u  sŕ̥kvāṇaṃ gharmám abhí vāvaśānā́  mímāti māyúm páyate páyobhiḥ

translation.text: The cow hath lowed after her blinking youngling; she licks his forehead, as she lows, to form it. His mouth she fondly calls to her warm udder, and suckles him with milk while gently lowing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं स शि॑ङ्क्ते॒ येन॒ गौर॒भीवृ॑ता॒ मिमा॑ति मा॒युं ध्व॒सना॒वधि॑ श्रि॒ता सा चि॒त्तिभि॒र्नि हि च॒कार॒ मर्त्यं॑ वि॒द्युद्भव॑न्ती॒ प्रति॑ व॒व्रिमौ॑हत
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ sá śiṅkte yéna gaúr abhī́vr̥tā  mímāti māyúṃ dhvasánāv ádhi śritā́  sā́ cittíbhir ní hí cakā́ra mártyaṃ  vidyúd bhávantī práti vavrím auhata

translation.text: He also snorts, by whom encompassed round the Cow laws as she clings unto the shedder of the rain. She with her shrilling cries hath humbled mortal man, and, turned to lightning, hath stripped off her covering robe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒नच्छ॑ये तु॒रगा॑तु जी॒वमेज॑द्ध्रु॒वं मध्य॒ आ प॒स्त्या॑नाम् जी॒वो मृ॒तस्य॑ चरति स्व॒धाभि॒रम॑र्त्यो॒ मर्त्ये॑ना॒ सयो॑निः
verses.transliteration: anác chaye turágātu jīvám  éjad dhruvám mádhya ā́ pastyā̀nām  jīvó mr̥tásya carati svadhā́bhir  ámartyo mártyenā sáyoniḥ

translation.text: That which hath breath and speed and life and motion lies firmly stablished in the midst of houses. Living, by offerings to the Dead he moveth Immortal One, the brother of the mortal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॑श्यं गो॒पामनि॑पद्यमान॒मा च॒ परा॑ च प॒थिभि॒श्चर॑न्तम् स स॒ध्रीचीः॒ स विषू॑ची॒र्वसा॑न॒ आ व॑रीवर्ति॒ भुव॑नेष्व॒न्तः
verses.transliteration: ápaśyaṃ gopā́m ánipadyamānam  ā́ ca párā ca pathíbhiś cárantam  sá sadhrī́cīḥ sá víṣūcīr vásānaḥ-  ā́ varīvarti bhúvaneṣv antáḥ

translation.text: I saw the Herdsman, him who never stumbles, approaching by his pathways and departing. He, clothed with gathered and diffusive splendour, within the worlds continually travels.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ईं॑ च॒कार॒ न सो अ॒स्य वे॑द॒ य ईं॑ द॒दर्श॒ हिरु॒गिन्नु तस्मा॑त् स मा॒तुर्योना॒ परि॑वीतो अ॒न्तर्ब॑हुप्र॒जा निर्ऋ॑ति॒मा वि॑वेश
verses.transliteration: yá īṃ cakā́ra ná só asyá veda  yá īṃ dadárśa hírug ín nú tásmāt  sá mātúr yónā párivīto antár  bahuprajā́ nírr̥tim ā́ viveśa

translation.text: He who hath made him cloth not comprehend him: from him who saw him surely is he hidden. He, yet enveloped in his Mother's bosom, source of much life, hath sunk into destruction.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यौर्मे॑ पि॒ता ज॑नि॒ता नाभि॒रत्र॒ बन्धु॑र्मे मा॒ता पृ॑थि॒वी म॒हीयम् उ॒त्ता॒नयो॑श्च॒म्वो॒३॒॑र्योनि॑र॒न्तरत्रा॑ पि॒ता दु॑हि॒तुर्गर्भ॒माधा॑त्
verses.transliteration: dyaúr me pitā́ janitā́ nā́bhir átra  bándhur me mātā́ pr̥thivī́ mahī́yám  uttānáyoś camvòr yónir antár  átrā pitā́ duhitúr gárbham ā́dhāt

translation.text: Dyaus is my Father, my begetter: kinship is here. This great earth is my kin and Mother. Between the wide-spread world-halves is the birthb-place: the Father laid the Daughter's germ within it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒च्छामि॑ त्वा॒ पर॒मन्तं॑ पृथि॒व्याः पृ॒च्छामि॒ यत्र॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ नाभिः॑ पृ॒च्छामि॑ त्वा॒ वृष्णो॒ अश्व॑स्य॒ रेतः॑ पृ॒च्छामि॑ वा॒चः प॑र॒मं व्यो॑म
verses.transliteration: pr̥chā́mi tvā páram ántam pr̥thivyā́ḥ  pr̥chā́mi yátra bhúvanasya nā́bhiḥ  pr̥chā́mi tvā vŕ̥ṣṇo áśvasya rétaḥ  pr̥chā́mi vācáḥ paramáṃ vyòma

translation.text: ask thee of the earth's extremest limit, where is the centre of the world, I ask thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं वेदिः॒ परो॒ अन्तः॑ पृथि॒व्या अ॒यं य॒ज्ञो भुव॑नस्य॒ नाभिः॑ अ॒यं सोमो॒ वृष्णो॒ अश्व॑स्य॒ रेतो॑ ब्र॒ह्मायं वा॒चः प॑र॒मं व्यो॑म
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ védiḥ páro ántaḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  ayáṃ yajñó bhúvanasya nā́bhiḥ  ayáṃ sómo vŕ̥ṣṇo áśvasya réto  brahmā́yáṃ vācáḥ paramáṃ vyòma

translation.text: This altar is the earth's extremest limit; this sacrifice of ours is the world's centre. The Stallion's seed prolific is the Soma; this Brahman highest heaven where Speech abideth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्तार्ध॑ग॒र्भा भुव॑नस्य॒ रेतो॒ विष्णो॑स्तिष्ठन्ति प्र॒दिशा॒ विध॑र्मणि ते धी॒तिभि॒र्मन॑सा॒ ते वि॑प॒श्चितः॑ परि॒भुवः॒ परि॑ भवन्ति वि॒श्वतः॑
verses.transliteration: saptā́rdhagarbhā́ bhúvanasya réto  víṣṇos tiṣṭhanti pradíśā vídharmaṇi  té dhītíbhir mánasā té vipaścítaḥ  paribhúvaḥ pári bhavanti viśvátaḥ

translation.text: Seven germs unripened yet are heaven's prolific, seed: their functions they maintain by Vishṇu's ordinance. Endued with wisdom through intelligence and thought, they compass us about present on every side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न वि जा॑नामि॒ यदि॑वे॒दमस्मि॑ नि॒ण्यः संन॑द्धो॒ मन॑सा चरामि य॒दा माग॑न्प्रथम॒जा ऋ॒तस्यादिद्वा॒चो अ॑श्नुवे भा॒गम॒स्याः
verses.transliteration: ná ví jānāmi yád ivedám ásmi  niṇyáḥ sáṃnaddho mánasā carāmi  yadā́ mā́gan prathamajā́ r̥tásya-  -ā́d íd vācó aśnuve bhāgám asyā́ḥ

translation.text: What thing I truly am I know not clearly: mysterious, fettered in my mind I wander. When the first-born of holy Law approached me, then of this speech I first obtain a portion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपा॒ङ्प्राङे॑ति स्व॒धया॑ गृभी॒तोऽम॑र्त्यो॒ मर्त्ये॑ना॒ सयो॑निः ता शश्व॑न्ता विषू॒चीना॑ वि॒यन्ता॒ न्य१॒॑न्यं चि॒क्युर्न नि चि॑क्युर॒न्यम्
verses.transliteration: ápāṅ prā́ṅ eti svadháyā gr̥bhītó  ámartyo mártyenā sáyoniḥ  tā́ śáśvantā viṣūcī́nā viyántā  ny ànyáṃ cikyúr ná ní cikyur anyám

translation.text: Back, forward goes he, grasped by strength inherent, the Immortal born the brother of the mortal Ceaseless they movelnopposite directions: men mark the one, and fail to mark the other.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒चो अ॒क्षरे॑ पर॒मे व्यो॑म॒न्यस्मि॑न्दे॒वा अधि॒ विश्वे॑ निषे॒दुः यस्तन्न वेद॒ किमृ॒चा क॑रिष्यति॒ य इत्तद्वि॒दुस्त इ॒मे समा॑सते
verses.transliteration: r̥có akṣáre paramé vyòman  yásmin devā́ ádhi víśve niṣedúḥ  yás tán ná véda kím r̥cā́ kariṣyati  yá ít tád vidús tá imé sám āsate

translation.text: Upon what syllable of holy praise-song, as twere their highest heaven, the Gods repose them,– Who knows not this, what will he do with praise-song? But they who know it well sit here assembled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सू॒य॒व॒साद्भग॑वती॒ हि भू॒या अथो॑ व॒यं भग॑वन्तः स्याम अ॒द्धि तृण॑मघ्न्ये विश्व॒दानीं॒ पिब॑ शु॒द्धमु॑द॒कमा॒चर॑न्ती
verses.transliteration: sūyavasā́d bhágavatī hí bhūyā́ḥ-  átho vayám bhágavantaḥ syāma  addhí tŕ̥ṇam aghnye viśvadā́nīm  píba śuddhám udakám ācárantī

translation.text: Forunate mayst thou be with goodly pasture, and may we also be exceeding wealthy. Feed on the grass, O Cow, at every season, and coming hitherward drink limpid water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गौ॒रीर्मि॑माय सलि॒लानि॒ तक्ष॒त्येक॑पदी द्वि॒पदी॒ सा चतु॑ष्पदी अ॒ष्टाप॑दी॒ नव॑पदी बभू॒वुषी॑ स॒हस्रा॑क्षरा पर॒मे व्यो॑मन्
verses.transliteration: gaurī́r mimāya salilā́ni tákṣatī-  ékapadī dvipádī sā́ cátuṣpadī  aṣṭā́padī návapadī babhūvúṣī  sahásrākṣarā paramé vyòman

translation.text: Forming the water-floods, the buffalo hath lowed, one-footed or two-footed or fourfooted, she, Who hath become eight-footed or hath got nine feet, the thou sand-syllabled in the sublimest heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्याः॑ समु॒द्रा अधि॒ वि क्ष॑रन्ति॒ तेन॑ जीवन्ति प्र॒दिश॒श्चत॑स्रः ततः॑ क्षरत्य॒क्षरं॒ तद्विश्व॒मुप॑ जीवति
verses.transliteration: tásyāḥ samudrā́ ádhi ví kṣaranti  téna jīvanti pradíśaś cátasraḥ  tátaḥ kṣaraty akṣáraṃ  tád víśvam úpa jīvati

translation.text: From her descend in streams the seas of water; thereby the world's four regions have their being, Thence flows the imperishable flood and thence the universe hath life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒क॒मयं॑ धू॒ममा॒राद॑पश्यं विषू॒वता॑ प॒र ए॒नाव॑रेण उ॒क्षाणं॒ पृश्नि॑मपचन्त वी॒रास्तानि॒ धर्मा॑णि प्रथ॒मान्या॑सन्
verses.transliteration: śakamáyaṃ dhūmám ārā́d apaśyaṃ  viṣūvátā pará enā́vareṇa  ukṣā́ṇam pŕ̥śnim apacanta vīrā́s  tā́ni dhármāṇi prathamā́ny āsan

translation.text: I saw from far away the smoke of fuel with spires that rose on high o'er that beneath it. The Mighty Men have dressed the spotted bullock. These were the customs in the days aforetime,

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रयः॑ के॒शिन॑ ऋतु॒था वि च॑क्षते संवत्स॒रे व॑पत॒ एक॑ एषाम् विश्व॒मेको॑ अ॒भि च॑ष्टे॒ शची॑भि॒र्ध्राजि॒रेक॑स्य ददृशे॒ न रू॒पम्
verses.transliteration: tráyaḥ keśína r̥tuthā́ ví cakṣate  saṃvatsaré vapata éka eṣām  víśvam éko abhí caṣṭe śácībhir  dhrā́jir ékasya dadr̥śe ná rūpám

translation.text: Three with long tresses show in ordered season. One of them sheareth when the year is ended. One with his powers the universe regardeth: Of one, the sweep is seen, but his figure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒त्वारि॒ वाक्परि॑मिता प॒दानि॒ तानि॑ विदुर्ब्राह्म॒णा ये म॑नी॒षिणः॑ गुहा॒ त्रीणि॒ निहि॑ता॒ नेङ्ग॑यन्ति तु॒रीयं॑ वा॒चो म॑नु॒ष्या॑ वदन्ति
verses.transliteration: catvā́ri vā́k párimitā padā́ni  tā́ni vidur brāhmaṇā́ yé manīṣíṇaḥ  gúhā trī́ṇi níhitā néṅgayanti  turī́yaṃ vācó manuṣyā̀ vadanti

translation.text: Speech hath been measured out in four divisions, the Brahmans who have understanding know them. Three kept in close concealment cause no motion; of speech, men speak only the fourth division.
