verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॑ मि॒त्रं वरु॑णम॒ग्निमा॑हु॒रथो॑ दि॒व्यः स सु॑प॒र्णो ग॒रुत्मा॑न् एकं॒ सद्विप्रा॑ बहु॒धा व॑दन्त्य॒ग्निं य॒मं मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑नमाहुः
verses.transliteration: índram mitráṃ váruṇam agním āhur  átho divyáḥ sá suparṇó garútmān  ékaṃ sád víprā bahudhā́ vadanti-  agníṃ yamám mātaríśvānam āhuḥ

translation.text: They call him Indra, Mitra, Varuṇa, Agni, and he is heavenly nobly-winged Garutman. To what is One, sages give many a title they call it Agni, Yama, Mâtariṣvan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कृ॒ष्णं नि॒यानं॒ हर॑यः सुप॒र्णा अ॒पो वसा॑ना॒ दिव॒मुत्प॑तन्ति त आव॑वृत्र॒न्त्सद॑नादृ॒तस्यादिद्घृ॒तेन॑ पृथि॒वी व्यु॑द्यते
verses.transliteration: kr̥ṣṇáṃ niyā́naṃ hárayaḥ suparṇā́ḥ-  apó vásānā dívam út patanti  tá ā́vavr̥tran sádanād r̥tásya-  -ā́d íd ghr̥téna pr̥thivī́ vy ùdyate

translation.text: Dark the descent: the birds are golden-coloured; up to the heaven they fly robed in the waters. Again descend they from the seat of Order, and all the earth is moistened with their fatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्वाद॑श प्र॒धय॑श्च॒क्रमेकं॒ त्रीणि॒ नभ्या॑नि॒ क उ॒ तच्चि॑केत तस्मि॑न्त्सा॒कं त्रि॑श॒ता न श॒ङ्कवो॑ऽर्पि॒ताः ष॒ष्टिर्न च॑लाच॒लासः॑
verses.transliteration: dvā́daśa pradháyaś cakrám ékaṃ  trī́ṇi nábhyāni ká u tác ciketa  tásmin sākáṃ triśatā́ ná śaṅkávo  -arpitā́ḥ ṣaṣṭír ná calācalā́saḥ

translation.text: Twelve are the fellies, and the wheel is single; three are the naves. What man hath understood it? Therein are set together spokes three hundred and sixty, which in nowise can be loosened.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॒ स्तनः॑ शश॒यो यो म॑यो॒भूर्येन॒ विश्वा॒ पुष्य॑सि॒ वार्या॑णि यो र॑त्न॒धा व॑सु॒विद्यः सु॒दत्रः॒ सर॑स्वति॒ तमि॒ह धात॑वे कः
verses.transliteration: yás te stánaḥ śaśayó yó mayobhū́r  yéna víśvā púṣyasi vā́ryāṇi  yó ratnadhā́ vasuvíd yáḥ sudátraḥ  sárasvati tám ihá dhā́tave kaḥ

translation.text: That breast of thine exhaustless, spring of pleasure, wherewith thou feedest all things that are choicest, Wealth-giver, treasure. finder, free bestower,– bring that, Sarasvatî, that we may drain it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञेन॑ य॒ज्ञम॑यजन्त दे॒वास्तानि॒ धर्मा॑णि प्रथ॒मान्या॑सन् ते ह॒ नाकं॑ महि॒मानः॑ सचन्त॒ यत्र॒ पूर्वे॑ सा॒ध्याः सन्ति॑ दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: yajñéna yajñám ayajanta devā́s  tā́ni dhármāṇi prathamā́ny āsan  té ha nā́kam mahimā́naḥ sacanta  yátra pū́rve sādhyā́ḥ sánti devā́ḥ

translation.text: By means of sacrifice the Gods accomplished their sacrifice: these were the earliest ordinances. These Mighty Ones attained the height of heaven, there where the Sâdhyas, Gods of old, are dwelling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मा॒नमे॒तदु॑द॒कमुच्चैत्यव॒ चाह॑भिः भूमिं॑ प॒र्जन्या॒ जिन्व॑न्ति॒ दिवं॑ जिन्वन्त्य॒ग्नयः॑
verses.transliteration: samānám etád udakám  úc caíty áva cā́habhiḥ  bhū́mim parjányā jínvanti  dívaṃ jinvanty agnáyaḥ

translation.text: Uniform, with the passing days, this water mounts and fails again. The tempest-clouds give life to earth, and fires re-animate the heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒व्यं सु॑प॒र्णं वा॑य॒सं बृ॒हन्त॑म॒पां गर्भं॑ दर्श॒तमोष॑धीनाम् अ॒भी॒प॒तो वृ॒ष्टिभि॑स्त॒र्पय॑न्तं॒ सर॑स्वन्त॒मव॑से जोहवीमि
verses.transliteration: divyáṃ suparṇáṃ vāyasám br̥hántam  apā́ṃ gárbhaṃ darśatám óṣadhīnām  abhīpató vr̥ṣṭíbhis tarpáyantaṃ  sárasvantam ávase johavīmi

translation.text: The Bird Celestial, vast with noble pinion, the lovely germ of plants, the germ of waters, Him who delighteth us with rain in season, Sarasvan I invoke that he may help us.

suktas.deity: Dialogue Between Indra, the Maruts and Agastya

verses.sanskrit_deva: कया॑ शु॒भा सव॑यसः॒ सनी॑ळाः समा॒न्या म॒रुतः॒ सं मि॑मिक्षुः कया॑ म॒ती कुत॒ एता॑स ए॒तेऽर्च॑न्ति॒ शुष्मं॒ वृष॑णो वसू॒या
verses.transliteration: káyā śubhā́ sávayasaḥ sánīḷāḥ  samānyā́ marútaḥ sám mimikṣuḥ  káyā matī́ kúta étāsa eté  -árcanti śúṣmaṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇo vasūyā́

translation.text: WITH what bright beauty are the Maruts jointly invested, peers in age, who dwell together? From what place have they come? With what intention? Sing they their strength through love of wealth, these Heroes?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कस्य॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि जुजुषु॒र्युवा॑नः॒ को अ॑ध्व॒रे म॒रुत॒ आ व॑वर्त श्ये॒नाँ इ॑व॒ ध्रज॑तो अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ केन॑ म॒हा मन॑सा रीरमाम
verses.transliteration: kásya bráhmāṇi jujuṣur yúvānaḥ  kó adhvaré marúta ā́ vavarta  śyenā́m̐ iva dhrájato antárikṣe  kéna mahā́ mánasā rīramāma

translation.text: Whose prayers have they, the Youthful Ones, accepted? Who to his sacrifice hath turned the Maruts? We will delay them on their journey sweeping-with what high spirit!-through the air like eagles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कुत॒स्त्वमि॑न्द्र॒ माहि॑नः॒ सन्नेको॑ यासि सत्पते॒ किं त॑ इ॒त्था सं पृ॑च्छसे समरा॒णः शु॑भा॒नैर्वो॒चेस्तन्नो॑ हरिवो॒ यत्ते॑ अ॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: kútas tvám indra mā́hinaḥ sánn  éko yāsi satpate kíṃ ta itthā́  sám pr̥chase samarāṇáḥ śubhānaír  vocés tán no harivo yát te asmé

translation.text: Whence comest thou alone, thou who art mighty, Indra, Lord of the Brave? What is thy purpose? Thou greetest us when meeting us the Bright Ones. Lord of Bay Steeds, say what thou hast against us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रह्मा॑णि मे म॒तयः॒ शं सु॒तासः॒ शुष्म॑ इयर्ति॒ प्रभृ॑तो मे॒ अद्रिः॑ आ शा॑सते॒ प्रति॑ हर्यन्त्यु॒क्थेमा हरी॑ वहत॒स्ता नो॒ अच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: bráhmāṇi me matáyaḥ śáṃ sutā́saḥ  śúṣma iyarti prábhr̥to me ádriḥ  ā́ śāsate práti haryanty ukthā́-  -imā́ hárī vahatas tā́ no ácha

translation.text: Mine are devotions, hymns; sweet are libations. Strength stirs, and hurled forth is my bolt of thunder. They call for me, their lauds are longing for me. These my Bay Steeds bear me to these oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अतो॑ व॒यम॑न्त॒मेभि॑र्युजा॒नाः स्वक्ष॑त्रेभिस्त॒न्व१॒॑ः शुम्भ॑मानाः महो॑भि॒रेताँ॒ उप॑ युज्महे॒ न्विन्द्र॑ स्व॒धामनु॒ हि नो॑ ब॒भूथ॑
verses.transliteration: áto vayám antamébhir yujānā́ḥ  svákṣatrebhis tanvàḥ śúmbhamānāḥ  máhobhir étām̐ úpa yujmahe nú-  índra svadhā́m ánu hí no babhū́tha

translation.text: Therefore together with our strong companions, having adorned our bodies, now we harness, Our spotted deer with might, for thou, O Indra, hast learnt and understood our Godlike nature.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व१॒॑ स्या वो॑ मरुतः स्व॒धासी॒द्यन्मामेकं॑ स॒मध॑त्ताहि॒हत्ये॑ अ॒हं ह्यु१॒॑ग्रस्त॑वि॒षस्तुवि॑ष्मा॒न्विश्व॑स्य॒ शत्रो॒रन॑मं वध॒स्नैः
verses.transliteration: kvà syā́ vo marutaḥ svadhā́sīd  yán mā́m ékaṃ samádhattāhihátye  aháṃ hy ū̀grás taviṣás túviṣmān  víśvasya śátror ánamaṃ vadhasnaíḥ

translation.text: Where was that nature then of yours, O Maruts, that ye charged me alone to slay the Dragon? For I in truth am fierce and strong and mighty. I bent away from every foeman's weapons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरि॑ चकर्थ॒ युज्ये॑भिर॒स्मे स॑मा॒नेभि॑र्वृषभ॒ पौंस्ये॑भिः भूरी॑णि॒ हि कृ॒णवा॑मा शवि॒ष्ठेन्द्र॒ क्रत्वा॑ मरुतो॒ यद्वशा॑म
verses.transliteration: bhū́ri cakartha yújyebhir asmé  samānébhir vr̥ṣabha paúṃsyebhiḥ  bhū́rīṇi hí kr̥ṇávāmā śaviṣṭha-  -índra krátvā maruto yád váśāma

translation.text: Yea, much hast thou achieved with us for comrades, with manly valour like thine own, thou Hero. Much may we too achieve, O mightiest Indra, with our great power, we Maruts, when we will it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वधीं॑ वृ॒त्रं म॑रुत इन्द्रि॒येण॒ स्वेन॒ भामे॑न तवि॒षो ब॑भू॒वान् अ॒हमे॒ता मन॑वे वि॒श्वश्च॑न्द्राः सु॒गा अ॒पश्च॑कर॒ वज्र॑बाहुः
verses.transliteration: vádhīṃ vr̥trám maruta indriyéṇa  svéna bhā́mena taviṣó babhūvā́n  ahám etā́ mánave viśváścandrāḥ  sugā́ apáś cakara vájrabāhuḥ

translation.text: Vr̥itra I slew by mine own strength, O Maruts, having waxed mighty in mine indignation. I with the thunder in my hand created for man these lucid softly flowing waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑त्त॒मा ते॑ मघव॒न्नकि॒र्नु न त्वावाँ॑ अस्ति दे॒वता॒ विदा॑नः न जाय॑मानो॒ नश॑ते॒ न जा॒तो यानि॑ करि॒ष्या कृ॑णु॒हि प्र॑वृद्ध
verses.transliteration: ánuttam ā́ te maghavan nákir nú  ná tvā́vām̐ asti devátā vídānaḥ  ná jā́yamāno náśate ná jātó  yā́ni kariṣyā́ḥ* kr̥ṇuhí pravr̥ddha

translation.text: Nothing, O Maghavan, stands firm before thee; among the Gods not one is found thine equal. None born or springing into life comes nigh thee. Do what thou hast to do, exceeding mighty?

verses.sanskrit_deva: एक॑स्य चिन्मे वि॒भ्व१॒॑स्त्वोजो॒ या नु द॑धृ॒ष्वान्कृ॒णवै॑ मनी॒षा अ॒हं ह्यु१॒॑ग्रो म॑रुतो॒ विदा॑नो॒ यानि॒ च्यव॒मिन्द्र॒ इदी॑श एषाम्
verses.transliteration: ékasya cin me vibhv àstv ójo yā́  nú dadhr̥ṣvā́n kr̥ṇávai manīṣā́  aháṃ hy ū̀gró maruto vídāno  yā́ni cyávam índra íd īśa eṣām

translation.text: Mine only be transcendent power, whatever I, daring in my spirit, may accomplish. For I am known as terrible, O Maruts I, Indra, am the Lord of what I ruined.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अम॑न्दन्मा मरुतः॒ स्तोमो॒ अत्र॒ यन्मे॑ नरः॒ श्रुत्यं॒ ब्रह्म॑ च॒क्र इन्द्रा॑य॒ वृष्णे॒ सुम॑खाय॒ मह्यं॒ सख्ये॒ सखा॑यस्त॒न्वे॑ त॒नूभिः॑
verses.transliteration: ámandan mā maruta stómo átra  yán me naraḥ śrútyam bráhma cakrá  índrāya vŕ̥ṣṇe súmakhāya máhyaṃ  sákhye sákhāyas tanvè tanū́bhiḥ

translation.text: Now, O ye Maruts, hath your praise rejoiced me, the glorious hymn which ye have made me, Heroes! For me, for Indra, champion strong in battle, for me, yourselves, as lovers for a lover.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वेदे॒ते प्रति॑ मा॒ रोच॑माना॒ अने॑द्यः॒ श्रव॒ एषो॒ दधा॑नाः सं॒चक्ष्या॑ मरुतश्च॒न्द्रव॑र्णा॒ अच्छा॑न्त मे छ॒दया॑था च नू॒नम्
verses.transliteration: evéd eté práti mā rócamānāḥ-  ánedyaḥ śráva éṣo dádhānāḥ  saṃcákṣyā marutaś candrávarṇāḥ-  áchānta me chadáyāthā ca nūnám

translation.text: Here, truly, they send forth their sheen to meet me, wearing their blameless glory and their vigour. When I have seen you, Matuts, in gay splendour, ye have delighted me, so now delight me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को न्वत्र॑ मरुतो मामहे वः॒ प्र या॑तन॒ सखीँ॒रच्छा॑ सखायः मन्मा॑नि चित्रा अपिवा॒तय॑न्त ए॒षां भू॑त॒ नवे॑दा म ऋ॒ताना॑म्
verses.transliteration: kó nv átra maruto māmahe vaḥ  prá yātana sákhīm̐r áchā sakhāyaḥ  mánmāni citrā apivātáyantaḥ-  eṣā́m bhūta návedā ma r̥tā́nām

translation.text: Who here hath magnified you, O ye Maruts? speed forward, O ye lovers, to your lovers. Ye Radiant Ones, assisting their devotions, of these my holy rites he ye regardful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यद्दु॑व॒स्याद्दु॒वसे॒ न का॒रुर॒स्माञ्च॒क्रे मा॒न्यस्य॑ मे॒धा ओ षु व॑र्त्त मरुतो॒ विप्र॒मच्छे॒मा ब्रह्मा॑णि जरि॒ता वो॑ अर्चत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yád duvasyā́d duváse ná kārúr  asmā́ñ cakré mānyásya medhā́  ó ṣú vartta maruto vípram ácha-  -imā́ bráhmāṇi jaritā́ vo arcat

translation.text: To this hath Mânya's wisdom brought us, so as to aid, as aids the poet him who worships. Bring hither quick! On to the sage, ye Maruts! These prayers for you the singer hath recited.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष वः॒ स्तोमो॑ मरुत इ॒यं गीर्मा॑न्दा॒र्यस्य॑ मा॒न्यस्य॑ का॒रोः एषा या॑सीष्ट त॒न्वे॑ व॒यां वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: eṣá va stómo maruta iyáṃ gī́r  māndāryásya mānyásya kāróḥ  éṣā́ yāsīṣṭa tanvè vayā́ṃ  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: May this your praise, may this your song, O Maruts, sung by the poet, Mâna's son, Mândârya, Bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance!

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्नु वो॑चाम रभ॒साय॒ जन्म॑ने॒ पूर्वं॑ महि॒त्वं वृ॑ष॒भस्य॑ के॒तवे॑ ऐ॒धेव॒ याम॑न्मरुतस्तुविष्वणो यु॒धेव॑ शक्रास्तवि॒षाणि॑ कर्तन
verses.transliteration: tán nú vocāma rabhasā́ya jánmane  pū́rvam mahitváṃ vr̥ṣabhásya ketáve  aidhéva yā́man marutas tuviṣvaṇo  yudhéva śakrās taviṣā́ṇi kartana

translation.text: Now let us publish, for the vigorous company the herald of the Strong One, their primeval might. With fire upon your way, O Maruts loud of voice, with battle, Mighty Ones, achieve your deeds of strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नित्यं॒ न सू॒नुं मधु॒ बिभ्र॑त॒ उप॒ क्रीळ॑न्ति क्री॒ळा वि॒दथे॑षु॒ घृष्व॑यः नक्ष॑न्ति रु॒द्रा अव॑सा नम॒स्विनं॒ न म॑र्धन्ति॒ स्वत॑वसो हवि॒ष्कृत॑म्
verses.transliteration: nítyaṃ ná sūnúm mádhu bíbhrata úpa  krī́ḷanti krīḷā́ vidátheṣu ghŕ̥ṣvayaḥ  nákṣanti rudrā́ ávasā namasvínaṃ  ná mardhanti svátavaso haviṣkŕ̥tam

translation.text: Bringing the pleasant mcath as 'twere their own dear son, they sport in sportive wise gay at their gatherings. The Rudras come with succour to the worshipper; self-strong they fail not him who offers sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मा॒ ऊमा॑सो अ॒मृता॒ अरा॑सत रा॒यस्पोषं॑ च ह॒विषा॑ ददा॒शुषे॑ उ॒क्षन्त्य॑स्मै म॒रुतो॑ हि॒ता इ॑व पु॒रू रजां॑सि॒ पय॑सा मयो॒भुवः॑
verses.transliteration: yásmā ū́māso amŕ̥tā árāsata  rāyás póṣaṃ ca havíṣā dadāśúṣe  ukṣánty asmai marúto hitā́ iva  purū́ rájāṃsi páyasā mayobhúvaḥ

translation.text: To whomsoever, bringer of oblations, they immortal guardians, have given plenteous wealth, For him, like loving friends, the Maruts bringing bliss bedew the regions round with milk abundantly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ये रजां॑सि॒ तवि॑षीभि॒रव्य॑त॒ प्र व॒ एवा॑सः॒ स्वय॑तासो अध्रजन् भय॑न्ते॒ विश्वा॒ भुव॑नानि ह॒र्म्या चि॒त्रो वो॒ यामः॒ प्रय॑तास्वृ॒ष्टिषु॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ yé rájāṃsi táviṣībhir ávyata  prá va évāsaḥ sváyatāso adhrajan  bháyante víśvā bhúvanāni harmyā́  citró vo yā́maḥ práyatāsv r̥ṣṭíṣu

translation.text: Ye who with mighty powers have stirred the regions up, your coursers have sped forth directed by themselves. All creatures of the earth, all dwellings are afraid, for brilliant is your coming with your spears advanced.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्त्वे॒षया॑मा न॒दय॑न्त॒ पर्व॑तान्दि॒वो वा॑ पृ॒ष्ठं नर्या॒ अचु॑च्यवुः विश्वो॑ वो॒ अज्म॑न्भयते॒ वन॒स्पती॑ रथी॒यन्ती॑व॒ प्र जि॑हीत॒ ओष॑धिः
verses.transliteration: yát tveṣáyāmā nadáyanta párvatān  divó vā pr̥ṣṭháṃ náryā ácucyavuḥ  víśvo vo ájman bhayate vánaspátiḥ-  rathīyántīva prá jihīta óṣadhiḥ

translation.text: When they in dazzling rush have made the mountains roar, and shaken heaven's high back in their heroic strength, Each sovran of the forest fears as ye drive near, aid the shrubs fly before you swift as whirling wheels.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं न॑ उग्रा मरुतः सुचे॒तुनारि॑ष्टग्रामाः सुम॒तिं पि॑पर्तन यत्रा॑ वो दि॒द्युद्रद॑ति॒ क्रिवि॑र्दती रि॒णाति॑ प॒श्वः सुधि॑तेव ब॒र्हणा॑
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ na ugrā marutaḥ sucetúnā-  -áriṣṭagrāmāḥ sumatím pipartana  yátrā vo didyúd rádati krívirdatī  riṇā́ti paśváḥ súdhiteva barháṇā

translation.text: Terrible Maruts, ye with ne'er-diminished host, with grcat benevolence fulfil our heart's desire. Where'er your lightning bites armed with its gory teeth it crunches up the cattle like a well-aimed dart.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र स्क॒म्भदे॑ष्णा अनव॒भ्ररा॑धसोऽलातृ॒णासो॑ वि॒दथे॑षु॒ सुष्टु॑ताः अर्च॑न्त्य॒र्कं म॑दि॒रस्य॑ पी॒तये॑ वि॒दुर्वी॒रस्य॑ प्रथ॒मानि॒ पौंस्या॑
verses.transliteration: prá skambhádeṣṇā anavabhrárādhaso  -alātr̥ṇā́so vidátheṣu súṣṭutāḥ  árcanty arkám madirásya pītáye  vidúr vīrásya prathamā́ni paúṃsyā

translation.text: Givers of during gifts whose bounties never fail, free from ill-will, at sacrifices glorified, They sing their song aloud that they may drink sweet juice: well do they know the Hero's first heroic deeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तभु॑जिभि॒स्तम॒भिह्रु॑तेर॒घात्पू॒र्भी र॑क्षता मरुतो॒ यमाव॑त जनं॒ यमु॑ग्रास्तवसो विरप्शिनः पा॒थना॒ शंसा॒त्तन॑यस्य पु॒ष्टिषु॑
verses.transliteration: śatábhujibhis tám abhíhruter aghā́t  pūrbhī́ rakṣatā maruto yám ā́vata  jánaṃ yám ugrās tavaso virapśinaḥ  pāthánā śáṃsāt tánayasya puṣṭíṣu

translation.text: With castles hundredfold, O Maruts, guard ye well the man whom ye have loved from ruin and from sin,– The man whom ye the fierce, the Mighty ones who roar, preserve from calumny by cherishing his seed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑नि भ॒द्रा म॑रुतो॒ रथे॑षु वो मिथ॒स्पृध्ये॑व तवि॒षाण्याहि॑ता अंसे॒ष्वा वः॒ प्रप॑थेषु खा॒दयोऽक्षो॑ वश्च॒क्रा स॒मया॒ वि वा॑वृते
verses.transliteration: víśvāni bhadrā́ maruto rátheṣu vo  mithaspŕ̥dhyeva taviṣā́ṇy ā́hitā  áṃseṣv ā́ vaḥ prápatheṣu khādáyaḥ-  -ákṣo vaś cakrā́ samáyā ví vāvr̥te

translation.text: O Maruts, in your cars are all things that are good: great powers are set as 'twere in rivalry therein. Rings are upon your shoulders when ye journey forth: your axle turns together both the chariot wheels.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरी॑णि भ॒द्रा नर्ये॑षु बा॒हुषु॒ वक्षः॑सु रु॒क्मा र॑भ॒सासो॑ अ॒ञ्जयः॑ अंसे॒ष्वेताः॑ प॒विषु॑ क्षु॒रा अधि॒ वयो॒ न प॒क्षान्व्यनु॒ श्रियो॑ धिरे
verses.transliteration: bhū́rīṇi bhadrā́ náryeṣu bāhúṣu  vákṣassu rukmā́ rabhasā́so añjáyaḥ  áṃseṣv étāḥ pavíṣu kṣurā́ ádhi  váyo ná pakṣā́n vy ánu śríyo dhire

translation.text: Held in your manly arms are many goodly things, gold chains are on your chests, and glistering ornaments, Deer-skins are on their shoulders, on their fellies knives: they spread their glory out as birds spread out their wings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हान्तो॑ म॒ह्ना वि॒भ्वो॒३॒॑ विभू॑तयो दूरे॒दृशो॒ ये दि॒व्या इ॑व॒ स्तृभिः॑ म॒न्द्राः सु॑जि॒ह्वाः स्वरि॑तार आ॒सभिः॒ सम्मि॑श्ला॒ इन्द्रे॑ म॒रुतः॑ परि॒ष्टुभः॑
verses.transliteration: mahā́nto mahnā́ vibhvò víbhūtayo  dūredŕ̥śo yé divyā́ iva stŕ̥bhiḥ  mandrā́ḥ sujihvā́ḥ sváritāra āsábhiḥ  sámmiślā índre marútaḥ pariṣṭúbhaḥ

translation.text: Mighty in mightiness, pervading, passing strong, visible from afar as 'twere with stars of heaven, Lovely with pleasant tongues, sweet singers with their mouths, the Maruts, joined with Indra, shout forth all around.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वः॑ सुजाता मरुतो महित्व॒नं दी॒र्घं वो॑ दा॒त्रमदि॑तेरिव व्र॒तम् इन्द्र॑श्च॒न त्यज॑सा॒ वि ह्रु॑णाति॒ तज्जना॑य॒ यस्मै॑ सु॒कृते॒ अरा॑ध्वम्
verses.transliteration: tád vaḥ sujātā maruto mahitvanáṃ  dīrgháṃ vo dātrám áditer iva vratám  índraś caná tyájasā ví hruṇāti táj  jánāya yásmai sukŕ̥te árādhvam

translation.text: This is your majesty, ye Maruts nobly born, far as the sway of Adid your bounty spreads. Even Indra by desertion never disannuls the boon bestowed by you upon the pious man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वो॑ जामि॒त्वं म॑रुतः॒ परे॑ यु॒गे पु॒रू यच्छंस॑ममृतास॒ आव॑त अ॒या धि॒या मन॑वे श्रु॒ष्टिमाव्या॑ सा॒कं नरो॑ दं॒सनै॒रा चि॑कित्रिरे
verses.transliteration: tád vo jāmitvám marutaḥ páre yugé  purū́ yác cháṃsam amr̥tāsa ā́vata  ayā́ dhiyā́ mánave śruṣṭím ā́vyā  sākáṃ náro daṃsánair ā́ cikitrire

translation.text: This is your kinship, Maruts, that, Immortals, ye were oft in olden time regardful of our call, Having vouchsafed to man a hearing through this prayer, by wondrous deeds the Heroes have displayed their might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येन॑ दी॒र्घं म॑रुतः शू॒शवा॑म यु॒ष्माके॑न॒ परी॑णसा तुरासः आ यत्त॒तन॑न्वृ॒जने॒ जना॑स ए॒भिर्य॒ज्ञेभि॒स्तद॒भीष्टि॑मश्याम्
verses.transliteration: yéna dīrghám marutaḥ śūśávāma  yuṣmā́kena párīṇasā turāsaḥ  ā́ yát tatánan vr̥jáne jánāsaḥ-  ebhír yajñébhis tád abhī́ṣṭim aśyām

translation.text: That, O ye Maruts, we may long time flourish through your abundant riches, O swift movers, And that our men may spread in the encampment, let me complete the rite with these oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष वः॒ स्तोमो॑ मरुत इ॒यं गीर्मा॑न्दा॒र्यस्य॑ मा॒न्यस्य॑ का॒रोः एषा या॑सीष्ट त॒न्वे॑ व॒यां वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: eṣá va stómo maruta iyáṃ gī́r  māndāryásya mānyásya kāróḥ  éṣā́ yāsīṣṭa tanvè vayā́ṃ  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: May this your laud, may this your song, O Maruts, sung by the poet, Mâna's son, Mândârya, Bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒हस्रं॑ त इन्द्रो॒तयो॑ नः स॒हस्र॒मिषो॑ हरिवो गू॒र्तत॑माः स॒हस्रं॒ रायो॑ माद॒यध्यै॑ सह॒स्रिण॒ उप॑ नो यन्तु॒ वाजाः॑
verses.transliteration: sahásraṃ ta indrotáyo naḥ  sahásram íṣo harivo gūrtátamāḥ  sahásraṃ rā́yo mādayádhyai  sahasríṇa úpa no yantu vā́jāḥ

translation.text: A THOUSAND are thy helps for us, O Indra: a thousand, Lord of Bays, thy choice refreshments. Wealth of a thousand sorts hast thou to cheer us: may precious goods come nigh to us in thousands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नोऽवो॑भिर्म॒रुतो॑ या॒न्त्वच्छा॒ ज्येष्ठे॑भिर्वा बृ॒हद्दि॑वैः सुमा॒याः अध॒ यदे॑षां नि॒युतः॑ पर॒माः स॑मु॒द्रस्य॑ चिद्ध॒नय॑न्त पा॒रे
verses.transliteration: ā́ nó 'vobhir marúto yāntv áchā  jyéṣṭhebhir vā br̥háddivaiḥ sumāyā́ḥ  ádha yád eṣāṃ niyútaḥ paramā́ḥ  samudrásya cid dhanáyanta pāré

translation.text: May the most sapient Maruts, with protection, with best boons brought from lofty heaven, approach us, Now when their team of the most noble horses speeds even on the sea's extremest limit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒म्यक्ष॒ येषु॒ सुधि॑ता घृ॒ताची॒ हिर॑ण्यनिर्णि॒गुप॑रा॒ न ऋ॒ष्टिः गुहा॒ चर॑न्ती॒ मनु॑षो॒ न योषा॑ स॒भाव॑ती विद॒थ्ये॑व॒ सं वाक्
verses.transliteration: mimyákṣa yéṣu súdhitā ghr̥tā́cī  híraṇyanirṇig úparā ná r̥ṣṭíḥ  gúhā cárantī mánuṣo ná yóṣā  sabhā́vatī vidathyèva sáṃ vā́k

translation.text: Close to them clings one moving in seclusion, like a man's wife, like a spear carried rearward, Well grasped, bright, decked with gold there is Vâk also, like to a courtly, eloquent dame, among them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॑ शु॒भ्रा अ॒यासो॑ य॒व्या सा॑धार॒ण्येव॑ म॒रुतो॑ मिमिक्षुः न रो॑द॒सी अप॑ नुदन्त घो॒रा जु॒षन्त॒ वृधं॑ स॒ख्याय॑ दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: párā śubhrā́ ayā́so yavyā́  sādhāraṇyéva marúto mimikṣuḥ  ná rodasī́ ápa nudanta ghorā́ḥ-  juṣánta vŕ̥dhaṃ sakhyā́ya devā́ḥ

translation.text: Far off the brilliant, never-weary Maruts cling to the young Maid as a joint possession. The fierce Gods drave not Rodasî before them, but wished for her to grow their friend and fellow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जोष॒द्यदी॑मसु॒र्या॑ स॒चध्यै॒ विषि॑तस्तुका रोद॒सी नृ॒मणाः॑ आ सू॒र्येव॑ विध॒तो रथं॑ गात्त्वे॒षप्र॑तीका॒ नभ॑सो॒ नेत्या
verses.transliteration: jóṣad yád īm asuryā̀ sacádhyai  víṣitastukā rodasī́ nr̥máṇāḥ  ā́ sūryéva vidható ráthaṃ gāt  tveṣápratīkā nábhaso nétyā́

translation.text: When chose immortal Rodasî to follow- she with loose tresses and heroic spirit- She climbed her servant's chariot, she like Sûryâ with cloud-like motion and refulgent aspect.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आस्था॑पयन्त युव॒तिं युवा॑नः शु॒भे निमि॑श्लां वि॒दथे॑षु प॒ज्राम् अ॒र्को यद्वो॑ मरुतो ह॒विष्मा॒न्गाय॑द्गा॒थं सु॒तसो॑मो दुव॒स्यन्
verses.transliteration: ā́ sthāpayanta yuvatíṃ yúvānaḥ  śubhé nímiślāṃ vidátheṣu pajrā́m  arkó yád vo maruto havíṣmān  gā́yad gātháṃ sutásomo duvasyán

translation.text: Upon their car the young men set the Maiden wedded to glory, mighty in assemblies, When your song, Maruts, rose, and, with oblation, the Soma-pourer sang his hymn in worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तं वि॑वक्मि॒ वक्म्यो॒ य ए॑षां म॒रुतां॑ महि॒मा स॒त्यो अस्ति॑ सचा॒ यदीं॒ वृष॑मणा अहं॒युः स्थि॒रा चि॒ज्जनी॒र्वह॑ते सुभा॒गाः
verses.transliteration: prá táṃ vivakmi vákmyo yá eṣām  marútām mahimā́ satyó ásti  sácā yád īṃ vŕ̥ṣamaṇā ahaṃyúḥ-  sthirā́ cij jánīr váhate subhāgā́ḥ

translation.text: I will declare the greatness of these Maruts, their real greatness, worthy to be lauded, How, with them, she though firm, strong-minded, haughty, travels to women happy in their fortune.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पान्ति॑ मि॒त्रावरु॑णावव॒द्याच्चय॑त ईमर्य॒मो अप्र॑शस्तान् उ॒त च्य॑वन्ते॒ अच्यु॑ता ध्रु॒वाणि॑ वावृ॒ध ईं॑ मरुतो॒ दाति॑वारः
verses.transliteration: pā́nti mitrā́váruṇāv avadyā́c  cáyata īm aryamó ápraśastān  utá cyavante ácyutā dhruvā́ṇi  vāvr̥dhá īm maruto dā́tivāraḥ

translation.text: Mitra and Varuṇa they guard from censure: Aryaman too, discovers worthless sinners Firm things are overthrown that ne'er were shaken: he prospers, Maruts, who gives choice oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒ही नु वो॑ मरुतो॒ अन्त्य॒स्मे आ॒रात्ता॑च्चि॒च्छव॑सो॒ अन्त॑मा॒पुः ते धृ॒ष्णुना॒ शव॑सा शूशु॒वांसोऽर्णो॒ न द्वेषो॑ धृष॒ता परि॑ ष्ठुः
verses.transliteration: nahī́ nú vo maruto ánty asmé  ārā́ttāc cic chávaso ántam āpúḥ  té dhr̥ṣṇúnā śávasā śūśuvā́ṃsaḥ-  -árṇo ná dvéṣo dhr̥ṣatā́ pári ṣṭhuḥ

translation.text: None of us, Maruts, near or at a distance, hath ever reached the limit of your vigour. They in courageous might still waxing boldly have compassed round their foemen like an ocean.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यम॒द्येन्द्र॑स्य॒ प्रेष्ठा॑ व॒यं श्वो वो॑चेमहि सम॒र्ये व॒यं पु॒रा महि॑ च नो॒ अनु॒ द्यून्तन्न॑ ऋभु॒क्षा न॒रामनु॑ ष्यात्
verses.transliteration: vayám adyéndrasya préṣṭhāḥ-  vayáṃ śvó vocemahi samaryé  vayám purā́ máhi ca no ánu dyū́n  tán na r̥bhukṣā́ narā́m ánu ṣyāt

translation.text: May we this day be dearest friends of Indra, and let us call on him in fight to-morrow. So were we erst. New might attend us daily! So be with us! R̥ibhukshan of the Heroes!

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष वः॒ स्तोमो॑ मरुत इ॒यं गीर्मा॑न्दा॒र्यस्य॑ मा॒न्यस्य॑ का॒रोः एषा या॑सीष्ट त॒न्वे॑ व॒यां वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: eṣá va stómo maruta iyáṃ gī́r  māndāryásya mānyásya kāróḥ  éṣā́ yāsīṣṭa tanvè vayā́ṃ  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: May this your laud, may this your song, O Maruts, sung by the poet, Mâna's son, Mândârya, Bring offspring for ourselves with. food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञाय॑ज्ञा वः सम॒ना तु॑तु॒र्वणि॒र्धियं॑धियं वो देव॒या उ॑ दधिध्वे आ वो॒ऽर्वाचः॑ सुवि॒ताय॒ रोद॑स्योर्म॒हे व॑वृत्या॒मव॑से सुवृ॒क्तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: yajñā́-yajñā vaḥ samanā́ tuturváṇir  dhíyaṃ-dhiyaṃ vo devayā́ u dadhidhve  ā́ vo 'rvā́caḥ suvitā́ya ródasyor  mahé vavr̥tyām ávase suvr̥ktíbhiḥ

translation.text: SWIFT gain is his who hath you near at every rite: ye welcome every song of himwho serves the Gods. So may I turn you hither with fair hymns of praise to give great succour for the weal of both the worlds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒व्रासो॒ न ये स्व॒जाः स्वत॑वस॒ इषं॒ स्व॑रभि॒जाय॑न्त॒ धूत॑यः स॒ह॒स्रिया॑सो अ॒पां नोर्मय॑ आ॒सा गावो॒ वन्द्या॑सो॒ नोक्षणः॑
verses.transliteration: vavrā́so ná yé svajā́ḥ svátavasaḥ-  íṣaṃ svàr abhijā́yanta dhū́tayaḥ  sahasríyāso apā́ṃ nórmáyaḥ-  āsā́ gā́vo vándyāso nókṣáṇaḥ

translation.text: Surrounding, as it were, self-born, self-powerful, they spring to life the shakers-down of food and light; Like as the countess undulations of the floods, worthy of praise when near, like bullocks and like kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमा॑सो॒ न ये सु॒तास्तृ॒प्तांश॑वो हृ॒त्सु पी॒तासो॑ दु॒वसो॒ नास॑ते ऐषा॒मंसे॑षु र॒म्भिणी॑व रारभे॒ हस्ते॑षु खा॒दिश्च॑ कृ॒तिश्च॒ सं द॑धे
verses.transliteration: sómāso ná yé sutā́s tr̥ptā́ṃśavo  hr̥tsú pītā́so duváso nā́sate  aíṣām áṃseṣu rambhíṇīva rārabhe  hásteṣu khādíś ca kr̥tíś ca sáṃ dadhe

translation.text: They who, like Somas with their well-grown stalks pressed out, imbibed within the heart, dwell there in friendly wise. Upon their shoulders rests as 'twere a warrior's spear and in their hand they hold a dagger and a ring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॒ स्वयु॑क्ता दि॒व आ वृथा॑ ययु॒रम॑र्त्याः॒ कश॑या चोदत॒ त्मना॑ अ॒रे॒णव॑स्तुविजा॒ता अ॑चुच्यवुर्दृ॒ळ्हानि॑ चिन्म॒रुतो॒ भ्राज॑दृष्टयः
verses.transliteration: áva sváyuktā divá ā́ vŕ̥thā yayur  ámartyāḥ káśayā codata tmánā  areṇávas tuvijātā́ acucyavur  dr̥ḷhā́ni cin marúto bhrā́jadr̥ṣṭayaḥ

translation.text: Self-yoked they have descended lightly from the sky. With your own lash, Immortals, urge yourselve's to speed. Unstained by dust the Maruts, mighty in their strength, have cast down e'en firm things, armed with their shining spears.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को वो॒ऽन्तर्म॑रुत ऋष्टिविद्युतो॒ रेज॑ति॒ त्मना॒ हन्वे॑व जि॒ह्वया॑ ध॒न्व॒च्युत॑ इ॒षां न याम॑नि पुरु॒प्रैषा॑ अह॒न्यो॒३॒॑ नैत॑शः
verses.transliteration: kó vo 'ntár maruta r̥ṣṭividyuto  réjati tmánā hánveva jihváyā  dhanvacyúta iṣā́ṃ ná yā́mani  purupraíṣā ahanyò naítaśaḥ

translation.text: Who among you, O Maruts armed with lightning-spears, moveth you by himself, as with the tongue his jaws? Ye rush from heaven's floor as though ye sought for food, on many errands like the Sun's diurnal Steed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व॑ स्विद॒स्य रज॑सो म॒हस्परं॒ क्वाव॑रं मरुतो॒ यस्मि॑न्नाय॒य यच्च्या॒वय॑थ विथु॒रेव॒ संहि॑तं॒ व्यद्रि॑णा पतथ त्वे॒षम॑र्ण॒वम्
verses.transliteration: kvà svid asyá rájaso mahás páraṃ  kvā́varam maruto yásminn āyayá  yác cyāváyatha vithuréva sáṃhitaṃ  vy ádriṇā patatha tveṣám arṇavám

translation.text: Say where, then, is this mighty region's farthest bound, where, Maruts, is the lowest depth that ye have reached, When ye cast down like chaff the firmly stablished pile, and from the mountain send the glittering water-flood?

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒तिर्न वोऽम॑वती॒ स्व॑र्वती त्वे॒षा विपा॑का मरुतः॒ पिपि॑ष्वती भ॒द्रा वो॑ रा॒तिः पृ॑ण॒तो न दक्षि॑णा पृथु॒ज्रयी॑ असु॒र्ये॑व॒ जञ्ज॑ती
verses.transliteration: sātír ná vó 'mavatī svàrvatī  tveṣā́ vípākā marutaḥ pípiṣvatī  bhadrā́ vo rātíḥ pr̥ṇató ná dákṣiṇā  pr̥thujráyī asuryèva jáñjatī

translation.text: Your winning is with strength, dazzling, with heavenly light, with fruit mature, O Maruts, fall of plenteousness. Auspicious is your gift like a free giver's meed, victorious, spreading far, as of immortal Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ ष्टोभन्ति॒ सिन्ध॑वः प॒विभ्यो॒ यद॒भ्रियां॒ वाच॑मुदी॒रय॑न्ति अव॑ स्मयन्त वि॒द्युतः॑ पृथि॒व्यां यदी॑ घृ॒तं म॒रुतः॑ प्रुष्णु॒वन्ति॑
verses.transliteration: práti ṣṭobhanti síndhavaḥ pavíbhyo  yád abhríyāṃ vā́cam udīráyanti  áva smayanta vidyútaḥ pr̥thivyā́ṃ  yádī ghr̥tám marútaḥ pruṣṇuvánti

translation.text: The rivers roar before your chariot fellies when they are uttering the voice of rain-clouds. The lightnings laugh upon the earth beneath them, what time the Maruts scatter forth their fatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असू॑त॒ पृश्नि॑र्मह॒ते रणा॑य त्वे॒षम॒यासां॑ म॒रुता॒मनी॑कम् ते स॑प्स॒रासो॑ऽजनय॒न्ताभ्व॒मादित्स्व॒धामि॑षि॒रां पर्य॑पश्यन्
verses.transliteration: ásūta pŕ̥śnir mahaté ráṇāya  tveṣám ayā́sām marútām ánīkam  té sapsarā́so (')janayantā́bhvam  ā́d ít svadhā́m iṣirā́m páry apaśyan

translation.text: Prani brought forth, to fight the mighty battle, the glittering army of the restless Maruts. Nurtured together they begat the monster, and then looked round them for the food that strengthens.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष वः॒ स्तोमो॑ मरुत इ॒यं गीर्मा॑न्दा॒र्यस्य॑ मा॒न्यस्य॑ का॒रोः एषा या॑सीष्ट त॒न्वे॑ व॒यां वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: eṣá va stómo maruta iyáṃ gī́r  māndāryásya mānyásya kāróḥ  éṣā́ yāsīṣṭa tanvè vayā́ṃ  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: May this your laud, may this your song O Maruts, sung by the poet Mâna's son, Mândârya, Bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हश्चि॒त्त्वमि॑न्द्र य॒त ए॒तान्म॒हश्चि॑दसि॒ त्यज॑सो वरू॒ता स नो॑ वेधो म॒रुतां॑ चिकि॒त्वान्त्सु॒म्ना व॑नुष्व॒ तव॒ हि प्रेष्ठा॑
verses.transliteration: maháś cit tvám indra yatá etā́n  maháś cid asi tyájaso varūtā́  sá no vedho marútāṃ cikitvā́n  sumnā́ vanuṣva táva hí préṣṭhā

translation.text: As, Indra, from great treason thou protectest, yea, from great treachery these who approach us, So, marking well, Controller of the Maruts grant us their blessings, for they are thy dearest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अयु॑ज्रन्त इन्द्र वि॒श्वकृ॑ष्टीर्विदा॒नासो॑ नि॒ष्षिधो॑ मर्त्य॒त्रा म॒रुतां॑ पृत्सु॒तिर्हास॑माना॒ स्व॑र्मीळ्हस्य प्र॒धन॑स्य सा॒तौ
verses.transliteration: áyujran ta indra viśvákr̥ṣṭīr  vidānā́so niṣṣídho martyatrā́  marútām pr̥tsutír hā́samānā  svàrmīḷhasya pradhánasya sātaú

translation.text: The various doings of all mortal people by thee are ordered, in thy wisdom, Indra. The host of Marutg goeth forth exulting to win the light-bestowing spoil of battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अम्य॒क्सा त॑ इन्द्र ऋ॒ष्टिर॒स्मे सने॒म्यभ्वं॑ म॒रुतो॑ जुनन्ति अ॒ग्निश्चि॒द्धि ष्मा॑त॒से शु॑शु॒क्वानापो॒ न द्वी॒पं दध॑ति॒ प्रयां॑सि
verses.transliteration: ámyak sā́ ta indra r̥ṣṭír asmé  sánemy ábhvam marúto junanti  agníś cid dhí ṣmātasé śuśukvā́n  ā́po ná dvīpáṃ dádhati práyāṃsi

translation.text: That spear of thine sat firm for us, O Indra: the Maruts set their whole dread power in motion. E'en Agni shines resplendent in the brush-wood: the viands hold him as floods hold an island.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं तू न॑ इन्द्र॒ तं र॒यिं दा॒ ओजि॑ष्ठया॒ दक्षि॑णयेव रा॒तिम् स्तुत॑श्च॒ यास्ते॑ च॒कन॑न्त वा॒योः स्तनं॒ न मध्वः॑ पीपयन्त॒ वाजैः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tū́ na indra táṃ rayíṃ dāḥ-  ójiṣṭhayā dákṣiṇayeva rātím  stútaś ca yā́s te cakánanta vāyóḥ-  stánaṃ ná mádhvaḥ pīpayanta vā́jaiḥ

translation.text: Vouchsafe us now that opulence, O Indra, as guerdon won by mightiest donation. May hymns that please thee cause the breast of Vâyu to swell as with the mead's refreshing sweetness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे राय॑ इन्द्र तो॒शत॑माः प्रणे॒तारः॒ कस्य॑ चिदृता॒योः ते षु णो॑ म॒रुतो॑ मृळयन्तु॒ ये स्मा॑ पु॒रा गा॑तू॒यन्ती॑व दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: tvé rā́ya indra tośátamāḥ  praṇetā́raḥ kásya cid r̥tāyóḥ  té ṣú ṇo marúto mr̥ḷayantu  yé smā purā́ gātūyántīva devā́ḥ

translation.text: With thee, O Indra, are most bounteous riches that further every one who lives uprightly. Now may these Maruts show us loving-kindness, Gods who of old were ever prompt to help us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॒ प्र या॑हीन्द्र मी॒ळ्हुषो॒ नॄन्म॒हः पार्थि॑वे॒ सद॑ने यतस्व अध॒ यदे॑षां पृथुबु॒ध्नास॒ एता॑स्ती॒र्थे नार्यः पौंस्या॑नि त॒स्थुः
verses.transliteration: práti prá yāhīndra mīḷhúṣo nr̥̄́n  maháḥ pā́rthive sádane yatasva  ádha yád eṣām pr̥thubudhnā́sa étās  tīrthé nā́ryáḥ paúṃsyāni tasthúḥ

translation.text: Bring forth the Men who rain down boons, O Indra: exert thee in the great terrestrial region; For their broad-chested speckled deer are standing like a King's armies on the field of battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ घो॒राणा॒मेता॑नाम॒यासां॑ म॒रुतां॑ शृण्व आय॒तामु॑प॒ब्दिः ये मर्त्यं॑ पृतना॒यन्त॒मूमै॑र्ऋणा॒वानं॒ न प॒तय॑न्त॒ सर्गैः॑
verses.transliteration: práti ghorā́ṇām étānām ayā́sām  marútāṃ śr̥ṇva āyatā́m upabdíḥ  yé mártyam pr̥tanāyántam ū́mair  r̥ṇāvā́naṃ ná patáyanta sárgaiḥ

translation.text: Heard is the roar of the advancing Maruts, terrific, glittering, and swiftly moving, Who with their rush o'erthrow as 'twere a sinner the mortal who would fight with those who love him

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं माने॑भ्य इन्द्र वि॒श्वज॑न्या॒ रदा॑ म॒रुद्भिः॑ शु॒रुधो॒ गोअ॑ग्राः स्तवा॑नेभिः स्तवसे देव दे॒वैर्वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: tvám mā́nebhya indra viśvájanyāḥ-  rádā marúdbhiḥ śurúdho góagrāḥ  stávānebhi stavase deva devaír  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: Give to the Mânas, Indra with Maruts, gifts universal, gifts of cattle foremost. Thou, God, art praised with Gods who must be lauded. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

suktas.deity: Dialogue Between Agastya, Indra and the Maruts

verses.sanskrit_deva: न नू॒नमस्ति॒ नो श्वः कस्तद्वे॑द॒ यदद्भु॑तम् अ॒न्यस्य॑ चि॒त्तम॒भि सं॑च॒रेण्य॑मु॒ताधी॑तं॒ वि न॑श्यति
verses.transliteration: ná nūnám ásti nó śváḥ  kás tád veda yád ádbhutam  anyásya cittám abhí saṃcaréṇyam  utā́dhītaṃ ví naśyati

translation.text: NAUGHT is to-day, to-morrow naught. Who comprehends the mystery? We must address ourselves unto another's thought, and lost is then the hope we formed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं न॑ इन्द्र जिघांससि॒ भ्रात॑रो म॒रुत॒स्तव॑ तेभिः॑ कल्पस्व साधु॒या मा नः॑ स॒मर॑णे वधीः
verses.transliteration: kíṃ na indra jighāṃsasi  bhrā́taro marútas táva  tébhiḥ kalpasva sādhuyā́  mā́ naḥ samáraṇe vadhīḥ

translation.text: The Maruts are thy brothers. Why, O Indra, wouldst thou take our lives? Agree with them in friendly wise, and do not slay us in the fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किं नो॑ भ्रातरगस्त्य॒ सखा॒ सन्नति॑ मन्यसे वि॒द्मा हि ते॒ यथा॒ मनो॒ऽस्मभ्य॒मिन्न दि॑त्ससि
verses.transliteration: kíṃ no bhrātar agastya  sákhā sánn áti manyase  vidmā́ hí te yáthā máno  -asmábhyam ín ná ditsasi

translation.text: Agastya, brother, why dost thou neglect us, thou who art our friend? We know the nature of thy mind. Verity thou wilt give us naught.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरं॑ कृण्वन्तु॒ वेदिं॒ सम॒ग्निमि॑न्धतां पु॒रः तत्रा॒मृत॑स्य॒ चेत॑नं य॒ज्ञं ते॑ तनवावहै
verses.transliteration: áraṃ kr̥ṇvantu védiṃ  sám agním indhatām puráḥ  tátrāmŕ̥tasya cétanaṃ  yajñáṃ te tanavāvahai

translation.text: Let them prepare the altar, let them kindle fire in front: we two Here will spread sacrifice for thee, that the Immortal may observe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमी॑शिषे वसुपते॒ वसू॑नां॒ त्वं मि॒त्राणां॑ मित्रपते॒ धेष्ठः॑ इन्द्र॒ त्वं म॒रुद्भिः॒ सं व॑द॒स्वाध॒ प्राशा॑न ऋतु॒था ह॒वींषि॑
verses.transliteration: tvám īśiṣe vasupate vásūnāṃ  tvám mitrā́ṇām mitrapate dhéṣṭhaḥ  índra tvám marúdbhiḥ sáṃ vadasva-  -ádha prā́śāna r̥tuthā́ havī́ṃṣi

translation.text: Thou, Lord of Wealth, art Master of all treasures, thou, Lord of friends, art thy friends' best supporter. O Indra, speak thou kindly with the Maruts, and taste oblations in their proper season.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ व ए॒ना नम॑सा॒हमे॑मि सू॒क्तेन॑ भिक्षे सुम॒तिं तु॒राणा॑म् र॒रा॒णता॑ मरुतो वे॒द्याभि॒र्नि हेळो॑ ध॒त्त वि मु॑चध्व॒मश्वा॑न्
verses.transliteration: práti va enā́ námasāhám emi  sūkténa bhikṣe sumatíṃ turā́ṇām  rarāṇátā maruto vedyā́bhir  ní héḷo dhattá ví mucadhvam áśvān

translation.text: To you I come with this mine adoration, and with a hymn I crave the Strong Ones' favour A hymn that truly makes you joyful, Maruts. Suppress your anger and unyoke your horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष वः॒ स्तोमो॑ मरुतो॒ नम॑स्वान्हृ॒दा त॒ष्टो मन॑सा धायि देवाः उपे॒मा या॑त॒ मन॑सा जुषा॒णा यू॒यं हि ष्ठा नम॑स॒ इद्वृ॒धासः॑
verses.transliteration: eṣá va stómo maruto námasvān  hr̥dā́ taṣṭó mánasā dhāyi devāḥ  úpem ā́ yāta mánasā juṣāṇā́ḥ-  yūyáṃ hí ṣṭhā́ námasa íd vr̥dhā́saḥ

translation.text: Maruts, to you this laud with prayer and worship, formed in the mind and heart, ye Gods, is offered. Come ye to us, rejoicing in your spirit, for ye are they who make our prayer effective.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तु॒तासो॑ नो म॒रुतो॑ मृळयन्तू॒त स्तु॒तो म॒घवा॒ शम्भ॑विष्ठः ऊ॒र्ध्वा नः॑ सन्तु को॒म्या वना॒न्यहा॑नि॒ विश्वा॑ मरुतो जिगी॒षा
verses.transliteration: stutā́so no marúto mr̥ḷayantu-  -utá stutó maghávā śámbhaviṣṭhaḥ  ūrdhvā́ naḥ santu komyā́ vánāni-  áhāni víśvā maruto jigīṣā́

translation.text: The Maruts, praised by us, shall show us favour; Maghavan, lauded, shall be most propitious. Maruts,, may all our days that are to follow be very pleasant, lovely and triumphant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माद॒हं त॑वि॒षादीष॑माण॒ इन्द्रा॑द्भि॒या म॑रुतो॒ रेज॑मानः यु॒ष्मभ्यं॑ ह॒व्या निशि॑तान्यास॒न्तान्या॒रे च॑कृमा मृ॒ळता॑ नः
verses.transliteration: asmā́d aháṃ taviṣā́d ī́ṣamāṇaḥ-  índrād bhiyā́ maruto réjamānaḥ  yuṣmábhyaṃ havyā́ níśitāny āsan  tā́ny āré cakr̥mā mr̥ḷátā naḥ

translation.text: I fled in terrror from this mighty Indra, my body trembling in alarm, O Maruts. Oblations meant for you had been made ready; these have we set aside: for this forgive us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येन॒ माना॑सश्चि॒तय॑न्त उ॒स्रा व्यु॑ष्टिषु॒ शव॑सा॒ शश्व॑तीनाम् स नो॑ म॒रुद्भि॑र्वृषभ॒ श्रवो॑ धा उ॒ग्र उ॒ग्रेभिः॒ स्थवि॑रः सहो॒दाः
verses.transliteration: yéna mā́nāsaś citáyanta usrā́ḥ-  vyùṣṭiṣu śávasā śáśvatīnām  sá no marúdbhir vr̥ṣabha śrávo dhāḥ-  ugrá ugrébhi stháviraḥ sahodā́ḥ

translation.text: By whom the Mânas recognize the day-springs, by whose strength at the dawn of endless mornings, Give us, thou Mighty, glory with Maruts. fierce with the fierce, the Strong who givest triumph.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं पा॑हीन्द्र॒ सही॑यसो॒ नॄन्भवा॑ म॒रुद्भि॒रव॑यातहेळाः सु॒प्र॒के॒तेभिः॑ सास॒हिर्दधा॑नो वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: tvám pāhīndra sáhīyaso nr̥̄́n  bhávā marúdbhir ávayātaheḷāḥ  supraketébhiḥ sāsahír dádhāno  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: Do thou, O Indra, guard the conquering Heroes, and rid thee of thy wrath against the Maruts, With them, the wise, victorious and bestowing. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चि॒त्रो वो॑ऽस्तु॒ याम॑श्चि॒त्र ऊ॒ती सु॑दानवः मरु॑तो॒ अहि॑भानवः
verses.transliteration: citró vo 'stu yā́maś  citrá ūtī́ sudānavaḥ  máruto áhibhānavaḥ

translation.text: WONDERFUL let your coming be, wondrous with help, ye Bounteous Ones, Maruts, who gleam as serpents gleam.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒रे सा वः॑ सुदानवो॒ मरु॑त ऋञ्ज॒ती शरुः॑ आ॒रे अश्मा॒ यमस्य॑थ
verses.transliteration: āré sā́ vaḥ sudānavo  máruta r̥ñjatī́ śáruḥ  āré áśmā yám ásyatha

translation.text: Far be from us, O Maruts, ye free givers, your impetuous shaft; Far from us be the stone ye hurl.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तृ॒ण॒स्क॒न्दस्य॒ नु विशः॒ परि॑ वृङ्क्त सुदानवः ऊ॒र्ध्वान्नः॑ कर्त जी॒वसे॑
verses.transliteration: tr̥ṇaskandásya nú víśaḥ  pári vr̥ṅkta sudānavaḥ  ūrdhvā́n naḥ karta jīváse

translation.text: O Bounteous Givers, touch ye not, O Maruts, Tr̥iṇaskanda's folk; Lift ye us up that we may live.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गाय॒त्साम॑ नभ॒न्यं१॒॑ यथा॒ वेरर्चा॑म॒ तद्वा॑वृधा॒नं स्व॑र्वत् गावो॑ धे॒नवो॑ ब॒र्हिष्यद॑ब्धा॒ आ यत्स॒द्मानं॑ दि॒व्यं विवा॑सान्
verses.transliteration: gā́yat sā́ma nabhanyàṃ yáthā vér  árcāma tád vāvr̥dhānáṃ svàrvat  gā́vo dhenávo barhíṣy ádabdhāḥ-  ā́ yát sadmā́naṃ divyáṃ vívāsān

translation.text: THE praise-song let him sing forth bursting bird-like: sing we that hymn which like heaven's light expandeth, That the milk-giving cows may, unimpeded call to the sacred grass the Gods' assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्च॒द्वृषा॒ वृष॑भिः॒ स्वेदु॑हव्यैर्मृ॒गो नाश्नो॒ अति॒ यज्जु॑गु॒र्यात् प्र म॑न्द॒युर्म॒नां गू॑र्त॒ होता॒ भर॑ते॒ मर्यो॑ मिथु॒ना यज॑त्रः
verses.transliteration: árcad vŕ̥ṣā vŕ̥ṣabhiḥ svéduhavyair  mr̥gó nā́śno áti yáj juguryā́t  prá mandayúr manā́ṃ gūrta hótā  bhárate máryo mithunā́ yájatraḥ

translation.text: Let the Bull sing with Bulls whose toil is worship, with a loud roar like some wild beast that hungers. Praised God! the glad priest brings his heart's devotion; the holy youth presents twofold oblation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नक्ष॒द्धोता॒ परि॒ सद्म॑ मि॒ता यन्भर॒द्गर्भ॒मा श॒रदः॑ पृथि॒व्याः क्रन्द॒दश्वो॒ नय॑मानो रु॒वद्गौर॒न्तर्दू॒तो न रोद॑सी चर॒द्वाक्
verses.transliteration: nákṣad dhótā pári sádma mitā́ yán  bhárad gárbham ā́ śarádaḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  krándad áśvo náyamāno ruvád gaúr  antár dūtó ná ródasī carad vā́k

translation.text: May the Priest come circling the measured stations, and with him bring the earth's autumnal fruitage. Let the Horse neigh led near, let the Steer bellow: let the Voice go between both worlds as herald,

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता क॒र्माष॑तरास्मै॒ प्र च्यौ॒त्नानि॑ देव॒यन्तो॑ भरन्ते जुजो॑ष॒दिन्द्रो॑ द॒स्मव॑र्चा॒ नास॑त्येव॒ सुग्म्यो॑ रथे॒ष्ठाः
verses.transliteration: tā́ karmā́ṣatarāsmai  prá cyautnā́ni devayánto bharante  jújoṣad índro dasmávarcāḥ-  nā́satyeva súgmyo ratheṣṭhā́ḥ

translation.text: To him we offer welcomest oblations, the pious bring their strength-inspiring praises. May Indra, wondrous in his might, accept them, car-borne and swift to move like the Nâsatyas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ ष्टु॒हीन्द्रं॒ यो ह॒ सत्वा॒ यः शूरो॑ म॒घवा॒ यो र॑थे॒ष्ठाः प्र॒ती॒चश्चि॒द्योधी॑या॒न्वृष॑ण्वान्वव॒व्रुष॑श्चि॒त्तम॑सो विह॒न्ता
verses.transliteration: tám u ṣṭuhī́ndraṃ yó ha sátvā  yáḥ śū́ro maghávā yó ratheṣṭhā́ḥ  pratīcáś cid yódhīyān vŕ̥ṣaṇvān  vavavrúṣaś cit támaso vihantā́

translation.text: Praise thou that Indra who is truly mighty, the car-borne Warrior, Maghavan the Hero; Stronger in war than those who fight against him, borne by strong steeds, who kills enclosing darkness;

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यदि॒त्था म॑हि॒ना नृभ्यो॒ अस्त्यरं॒ रोद॑सी क॒क्ष्ये॒३॒॑ नास्मै॑ सं वि॑व्य॒ इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒जनं॒ न भूमा॒ भर्ति॑ स्व॒धावाँ॑ ओप॒शमि॑व॒ द्याम्
verses.transliteration: prá yád itthā́ mahinā́ nŕ̥bhyo ásti-  áraṃ ródasī kakṣyè nā́smai  sáṃ vivya índro vr̥jánaṃ ná bhū́mā  bhárti svadhā́vām̐ opaśám iva dyā́m

translation.text: Him who surpasses heroes in his greatness: the earth and heavens suffice not for his girdles. Indra endues the earth to be his garment, and, God-like, wears the heaven as 'twere a frontlet,

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मत्सु॑ त्वा शूर स॒तामु॑रा॒णं प्र॑प॒थिन्त॑मं परितंस॒यध्यै॑ स॒जोष॑स॒ इन्द्रं॒ मदे॑ क्षो॒णीः सू॒रिं चि॒द्ये अ॑नु॒मद॑न्ति॒ वाजैः॑
verses.transliteration: samátsu tvā śūra satā́m urāṇám  prapathíntamam paritaṃsayádhyai  sajóṣasa índram máde kṣoṇī́ḥ  sūríṃ cid yé anumádanti vā́jaiḥ

translation.text: Thee, Hero, guardian of the brave in battles, who roamest in the van,– to draw thee hither, Indra, the hosts agree beside the Soma, and joy, for his great actions, in the Chieftain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा हि ते॒ शं सव॑ना समु॒द्र आपो॒ यत्त॑ आ॒सु मद॑न्ति दे॒वीः विश्वा॑ ते॒ अनु॒ जोष्या॑ भू॒द्गौः सू॒रीँश्चि॒द्यदि॑ धि॒षा वेषि॒ जना॑न्
verses.transliteration: evā́ hí te śáṃ sávanā samudré-  ā́po yát ta āsú mádanti devī́ḥ  víśvā te ánu jóṣyā bhūd gaúḥ  sūrī́ṃś cid yádi dhiṣā́ véṣi jánān

translation.text: Libations in the sea to thee are pleasant, when thy divine Floods come to cheer these people. To thee the Cow is sum of all things grateful when with the wish thou seekest men and princes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असा॑म॒ यथा॑ सुष॒खाय॑ एन स्वभि॒ष्टयो॑ न॒रां न शंसैः॑ अस॒द्यथा॑ न॒ इन्द्रो॑ वन्दने॒ष्ठास्तु॒रो न कर्म॒ नय॑मान उ॒क्था
verses.transliteration: ásāma yáthā suṣakhā́ya ena  svabhiṣṭáyo narā́ṃ ná śáṃsaiḥ  ásad yáthā na índro vandaneṣṭhā́s  turó ná kárma náyamāna ukthā́

translation.text: So may we in this One be well befriended, well aided as it were through praise of chieftains, That Indra still may linger at our worship, as one led swift to work, to hear our praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विष्प॑र्धसो न॒रां न शंसै॑र॒स्माका॑स॒दिन्द्रो॒ वज्र॑हस्तः मि॒त्रा॒युवो॒ न पूर्प॑तिं॒ सुशि॑ष्टौ मध्या॒युव॒ उप॑ शिक्षन्ति य॒ज्ञैः
verses.transliteration: víṣpardhaso narā́ṃ ná śáṃsair  asmā́kāsad índro vájrahastaḥ  mitrāyúvo ná pū́rpatiṃ súśiṣṭau  madhyāyúva úpa śikṣanti yajñaíḥ

translation.text: Like men in rivalry extolling princes, our Friend be Indra, wielder of the thunder. Like true friends of some city's lord within them held in good rule with sacrifice they help him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञो हि ष्मेन्द्रं॒ कश्चि॑दृ॒न्धञ्जु॑हुरा॒णश्चि॒न्मन॑सा परि॒यन् ती॒र्थे नाच्छा॑ तातृषा॒णमोको॑ दी॒र्घो न सि॒ध्रमा कृ॑णो॒त्यध्वा॑
verses.transliteration: yajñó hí ṣméndraṃ káś cid r̥ndháñ  juhurāṇáś cin mánasā pariyán  tīrthé nā́chā tātr̥ṣāṇám óko  dīrghó ná sidhrám ā́ kr̥ṇoty ádhvā

translation.text: For every sacrifice makes Indra stronger, yea, when he goes around angry in spirit; As pleasure at the ford invites the thirsty, as the long way brings him who gains his object.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मो षू ण॑ इ॒न्द्रात्र॑ पृ॒त्सु दे॒वैरस्ति॒ हि ष्मा॑ ते शुष्मिन्नव॒याः म॒हश्चि॒द्यस्य॑ मी॒ळ्हुषो॑ य॒व्या ह॒विष्म॑तो म॒रुतो॒ वन्द॑ते॒ गीः
verses.transliteration: mó ṣū́ ṇa indrā́tra pr̥tsú devaír  ásti hí ṣmā te śuṣminn avayā́ḥ  maháś cid yásya mīḷhúṣo yavyā́  havíṣmato marúto vándate gī́ḥ

translation.text: Let us not here contend with Gods, O Indra, for here, O Mighty One, is thine own portion, The Great, whose Friends the bounteous Maruts honour, as with a stream, his song who pours oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्तोम॑ इन्द्र॒ तुभ्य॑म॒स्मे ए॒तेन॑ गा॒तुं ह॑रिवो विदो नः आ नो॑ ववृत्याः सुवि॒ताय॑ देव वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: eṣá stóma indra túbhyam asmé  eténa gātúṃ harivo vido naḥ  ā́ no vavr̥tyāḥ suvitā́ya deva  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: Addressed to thee is this our praise, O Indra: Lord of Bay Steeds, find us hereby advancement. So mayst thou lead us on, O God, to comfort. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं राजे॑न्द्र॒ ये च॑ दे॒वा रक्षा॒ नॄन्पा॒ह्य॑सुर॒ त्वम॒स्मान् त्वं सत्प॑तिर्म॒घवा॑ न॒स्तरु॑त्र॒स्त्वं स॒त्यो वस॑वानः सहो॒दाः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ rā́jendra yé ca devā́ḥ-  rákṣā nr̥̄́n pāhy àsura tvám asmā́n  tváṃ sátpatir maghávā nas tárutras  tváṃ satyó vásavānaḥ sahodā́ḥ

translation.text: THOU art the King of all the Gods, O Indra: protect the men, O Asura, preserve us. Thou Lord of Heroes, Maghavan, our saver, art faithful, very rich, the victory-giver.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दनो॒ विश॑ इन्द्र मृ॒ध्रवा॑चः स॒प्त यत्पुरः॒ शर्म॒ शार॑दी॒र्दर्त् ऋ॒णोर॒पो अ॑नव॒द्यार्णा॒ यूने॑ वृ॒त्रं पु॑रु॒कुत्सा॑य रन्धीः
verses.transliteration: dáno víśa indra mr̥dhrávācaḥ  saptá yát púraḥ śárma śā́radīr dárt =6.20.10c  r̥ṇór apó anavadyā́rṇā  yū́ne vr̥trám purukútsāya randhīḥ

translation.text: Indra, thou humbledst tribes that spake with insult by breaking down seven autumn forts, their refuge. Thou stirredst, Blameless! billowy floods, and gavest his foe a prey to youthful Purukutsa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अजा॒ वृत॑ इन्द्र॒ शूर॑पत्नी॒र्द्यां च॒ येभिः॑ पुरुहूत नू॒नम् रक्षो॑ अ॒ग्निम॒शुषं॒ तूर्व॑याणं सिं॒हो न दमे॒ अपां॑सि॒ वस्तोः॑
verses.transliteration: ájā vŕ̥ta indra śū́rapatnīr  dyā́ṃ ca yébhiḥ puruhūta nūnám  rákṣo agním aśúṣaṃ tū́rvayāṇaṃ  siṃhó ná dáme ápāṃsi vástoḥ

translation.text: With whom thou drivest troops whose lords are heroes, and bringest daylight now, much worshipped Indra, With them guard lion-like wasting active Agni to dwell in our tilled fields and in our homestead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शेष॒न्नु त इ॑न्द्र॒ सस्मि॒न्योनौ॒ प्रश॑स्तये॒ पवी॑रवस्य म॒ह्ना सृ॒जदर्णां॒स्यव॒ यद्यु॒धा गास्तिष्ठ॒द्धरी॑ धृष॒ता मृ॑ष्ट॒ वाजा॑न्
verses.transliteration: śéṣan nú tá indra sásmin yónau  práśastaye pávīravasya mahnā́  sr̥jád árṇāṃsy áva yád yudhā́ gā́s  tíṣṭhad dhárī dhr̥ṣatā́ mr̥ṣṭa vā́jān

translation.text: They through the greatness of thy spear, O Indra, shall, to thy praise, rest in this earthly station. To loose the floods, to seek, for kine, the battle, his Bays he mounted boldly seized the booty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वह॒ कुत्स॑मिन्द्र॒ यस्मि॑ञ्चा॒कन्त्स्यू॑म॒न्यू ऋ॒ज्रा वात॒स्याश्वा॑ प्र सूर॑श्च॒क्रं वृ॑हताद॒भीके॒ऽभि स्पृधो॑ यासिष॒द्वज्र॑बाहुः
verses.transliteration: váha kútsam indra yásmiñ cākán  syūmanyū́ r̥jrā́ vā́tasyā́śvā  prá sū́raś cakráṃ vr̥hatād abhī́ke  -abhí spŕ̥dho yāsiṣad vájrabāhuḥ

translation.text: Indra, bear Kutsa, him in whom thou joyest: the dark-red horses of the Wind are docile. Let the Sun roll his chariot wheel anear us, and let the Thunderer go to meet the foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒घ॒न्वाँ इ॑न्द्र मि॒त्रेरू॑ञ्चो॒दप्र॑वृद्धो हरिवो॒ अदा॑शून् प्र ये पश्य॑न्नर्य॒मणं॒ सचा॒योस्त्वया॑ शू॒र्ता वह॑माना॒ अप॑त्यम्
verses.transliteration: jaghanvā́m̐ indra mitrérūñ  codápravr̥ddho harivo ádāśūn  prá yé páśyann aryamáṇaṃ sácāyós  tváyā śūrtā́ váhamānā ápatyam

translation.text: Thou Indra, Lord of Bays, made strong by impulse, hast slain the vexers of thy friends, who give not. They who beheld the Friend beside the living were cast aside by thee as they rode onward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रप॑त्क॒विरि॑न्द्रा॒र्कसा॑तौ॒ क्षां दा॒सायो॑प॒बर्ह॑णीं कः कर॑त्ति॒स्रो म॒घवा॒ दानु॑चित्रा॒ नि दु॑र्यो॒णे कुय॑वाचं मृ॒धि श्रे॑त्
verses.transliteration: rápat kavír indrārkásātau  kṣā́ṃ dāsā́yopabárhaṇīṃ kaḥ  kárat tisró maghávā dā́nucitrāḥ-  ní duryoṇé kúyavācam mr̥dhí śret

translation.text: Indra, the bard sang forth in inspiration: thou madest earth a covering for the Dâsa. Maghavan made the three that gleam with moisture, and to his home brought Kuyavâch to slay him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सना॒ ता त॑ इन्द्र॒ नव्या॒ आगुः॒ सहो॒ नभोऽवि॑रणाय पू॒र्वीः भि॒नत्पुरो॒ न भिदो॒ अदे॑वीर्न॒नमो॒ वध॒रदे॑वस्य पी॒योः
verses.transliteration: sánā tā́ ta indra návyā ā́guḥ  sáho nábhó 'viraṇāya pūrvī́ḥ  bhinát púro ná bhído ádevīr  nanámo vádhar ádevasya pīyóḥ

translation.text: These thine old deeds new bards have sung, O Indra. Thou conqueredst, boundest many tribes for ever. Like castles thou hast crushed the godless races, and bowed the godless scorner's deadly weapon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं धुनि॑रिन्द्र॒ धुनि॑मतीर्ऋ॒णोर॒पः सी॒रा न स्रव॑न्तीः प्र यत्स॑मु॒द्रमति॑ शूर॒ पर्षि॑ पा॒रया॑ तु॒र्वशं॒ यदुं॑ स्व॒स्ति
verses.transliteration: tváṃ dhúnir indra dhúnimatīr  r̥ṇór apáḥ sīrā́ ná srávantīḥ  prá yát samudrám áti śūra párṣi  pāráyā turváśaṃ yáduṃ svastí

translation.text: A Stormer thou hast made the stormy waters flow down, O Indra, like the running rivers. When o'er the flood thou broughtest them, O Hero, thou keptest Turvaga and Yadu safely.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॒स्माक॑मिन्द्र वि॒श्वध॑ स्या अवृ॒कत॑मो न॒रां नृ॑पा॒ता स नो॒ विश्वा॑सां स्पृ॒धां स॑हो॒दा वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: tvám asmā́kam indra viśvádha syāḥ-  avr̥kátamo narā́ṃ nr̥pātā́  sá no víśvāsāṃ spr̥dhā́ṃ sahodā́ḥ-  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: Indra, mayst thou be ours in all occasions, protector of the men, most gentle-hearted, Giving us victory over all our rivals. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मत्स्यपा॑यि ते॒ महः॒ पात्र॑स्येव हरिवो मत्स॒रो मदः॑ वृषा॑ ते॒ वृष्ण॒ इन्दु॑र्वा॒जी स॑हस्र॒सात॑मः
verses.transliteration: mátsy ápāyi te máhaḥ  pā́trasyeva harivo matsaró mádaḥ  vŕ̥ṣā te vŕ̥ṣṇa índur  vājī́ sahasrasā́tamaḥ

translation.text: GLAD thee: thy glory hath been quaffed, Lord of Bay Steeds, as 'twere the bowl's enlivening mead. For thee the Strong there is strong drink, mighty, omnipotent to win.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॑स्ते गन्तु मत्स॒रो वृषा॒ मदो॒ वरे॑ण्यः स॒हावाँ॑ इन्द्र सान॒सिः पृ॑तना॒षाळम॑र्त्यः
verses.transliteration: ā́ nas te gantu matsaró  vŕ̥ṣā mádo váreṇyaḥ  sahā́vām̐ indra sānasíḥ  pr̥tanāṣā́ḷ ámartyaḥ

translation.text: Let our strong drink, most excellent, exhilarating, come to thee, Victorious, Indra! bringing gain, immortal conquering in fight,

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं हि शूरः॒ सनि॑ता चो॒दयो॒ मनु॑षो॒ रथ॑म् स॒हावा॒न्दस्यु॑मव्र॒तमोषः॒ पात्रं॒ न शो॒चिषा॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ hí śū́raḥ sánitā  codáyo mánuṣo rátham  sahā́vān dásyum avratám  óṣaḥ pā́traṃ ná śocíṣā

translation.text: Thou, Hero, winner of the spoil, urgest to speed the car of man. Burn, like a vessel with the flame, the lawless Dasyu, Conqueror!

verses.sanskrit_deva: मु॒षा॒य सूर्यं॑ कवे च॒क्रमीशा॑न॒ ओज॑सा वह॒ शुष्णा॑य व॒धं कुत्सं॒ वात॒स्याश्वैः॑
verses.transliteration: muṣāyá sū́ryaṃ kave  cakrám ī́śāna ójasā  váha śúṣṇāya vadháṃ  kútsaṃ vā́tasyā́śvaiḥ

translation.text: Empowered by thine own might, O Sage, thou stolest Sarya's chariot wheel. Thou barest Kutsa with the steeds of Wind to Ṣushṇa as his death.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒ष्मिन्त॑मो॒ हि ते॒ मदो॑ द्यु॒म्निन्त॑म उ॒त क्रतुः॑ वृ॒त्र॒घ्ना व॑रिवो॒विदा॑ मंसी॒ष्ठा अ॑श्व॒सात॑मः
verses.transliteration: śuṣmíntamo hí te mádo  dyumníntama utá krátuḥ  vr̥traghnā́ varivovídā  maṃsīṣṭhā́ aśvasā́tamaḥ

translation.text: Most mighty is thy rapturous joy, most splendid is thine active power, Wherewith, foe-slaying, sending bliss, thou art supreme in gaining steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॒ पूर्वे॑भ्यो जरि॒तृभ्य॑ इन्द्र॒ मय॑ इ॒वापो॒ न तृष्य॑ते ब॒भूथ॑ तामनु॑ त्वा नि॒विदं॑ जोहवीमि वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: yáthā pū́rvebhyo jaritŕ̥bhya indra  máya ivā́po ná tŕ̥ṣyate babhū́tha  tā́m ánu tvā nivídaṃ johavīmi  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: As thou, O Indra, to the ancient singers wast ever joy, as water to the thirsty, So unto thee I sing this invocation. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मत्सि॑ नो॒ वस्य॑इष्टय॒ इन्द्र॑मिन्दो॒ वृषा वि॑श ऋ॒घा॒यमा॑ण इन्वसि॒ शत्रु॒मन्ति॒ न वि॑न्दसि
verses.transliteration: mátsi no vásya: iṣṭaye-  índram indo vŕ̥ṣā́ viśa  r̥ghāyámāṇa invasi  śátrum ánti ná vindasi

translation.text: CHEER thee with draughts to win us bliss: Soma, pierce Indra in thy strength. Thou stormest trembling in thy rage, and findest not a foeman nigh.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्मि॒न्ना वे॑शया॒ गिरो॒ य एक॑श्चर्षणी॒नाम् अनु॑ स्व॒धा यमु॒प्यते॒ यवं॒ न चर्कृ॑ष॒द्वृषा॑
verses.transliteration: tásminn ā́ veśayā gíro  yá ékaś carṣaṇīnā́ṃ  ánu svadhā́ yám upyáte  yávaṃ ná cárkr̥ṣad vŕ̥ṣā

translation.text: Make our songs penetrate to him who is the Only One of men; For whom the sacred food is spread, as the steer ploughs the barley in.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ हस्त॑योः॒ पञ्च॑ क्षिती॒नां वसु॑ स्पा॒शय॑स्व॒ यो अ॑स्म॒ध्रुग्दि॒व्येवा॒शनि॑र्जहि
verses.transliteration: yásya víśvāni hástayoḥ  páñca kṣitīnā́ṃ vásu  spāśáyasva yó asmadhrúg  divyévāśánir jahi

translation.text: Within whose hands deposited all the Five Peoples' treasures rest. Mark thou the man who injures us and kill him like the heavenly bolt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: असु॑न्वन्तं समं जहि दू॒णाशं॒ यो न ते॒ मयः॑ अ॒स्मभ्य॑मस्य॒ वेद॑नं द॒द्धि सू॒रिश्चि॑दोहते
verses.transliteration: ásunvantaṃ samaṃ jahi  dūṇā́śaṃ yó ná te máyaḥ  asmábhyam asya védanaṃ  daddhí sūríś cid ohate

translation.text: Slay everyone who pours no gift, who, hard to reach, delights thee not. Bestow on us what wealth he hath: this even the worshipper awaits.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आवो॒ यस्य॑ द्वि॒बर्ह॑सो॒ऽर्केषु॑ सानु॒षगस॑त् आ॒जाविन्द्र॑स्येन्दो॒ प्रावो॒ वाजे॑षु वा॒जिन॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́vo yásya dvibárhaso  -arkéṣu sānuṣág ásat  ājā́v índrasyendo  prā́vo vā́jeṣu vājínam

translation.text: Thou helpest him the doubly strong whose hymns were sung unceasingly. When Indra fought, O Soma, thou helpest the mighty in the fray.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॒ पूर्वे॑भ्यो जरि॒तृभ्य॑ इन्द्र॒ मय॑ इ॒वापो॒ न तृष्य॑ते ब॒भूथ॑ तामनु॑ त्वा नि॒विदं॑ जोहवीमि वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: yáthā pū́rvebhyo jaritŕ̥bhya indra  máya ivā́po ná tŕ̥ṣyate babhū́tha  tā́m ánu tvā nivídaṃ johavīmi  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: As thou, O Indra, to the ancient singers wast ever joy, like water to the thirsty, So unto thee I sing this invocation. May we find strengthenifig food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ च॑र्षणि॒प्रा वृ॑ष॒भो जना॑नां॒ राजा॑ कृष्टी॒नां पु॑रुहू॒त इन्द्रः॑ स्तु॒तः श्र॑व॒स्यन्नव॒सोप॑ म॒द्रिग्यु॒क्त्वा हरी॒ वृष॒णा या॑ह्य॒र्वाङ्
verses.transliteration: ā́ carṣaṇiprā́ vr̥ṣabhó jánānāṃ  rā́jā kr̥ṣṭīnā́m puruhūtá índraḥ  stutáḥ śravasyánn ávasópa madríg  yuktvā́ hárī vŕ̥ṣaṇā́ yāhy arvā́ṅ

translation.text: THE Bull of men, who cherishes all people, King of the Races, Indra, called of many, Fame-loving, praised, hither to me with succour turn having yoked both vigorous Bay Horses!

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये ते॒ वृष॑णो वृष॒भास॑ इन्द्र ब्रह्म॒युजो॒ वृष॑रथासो॒ अत्याः॑ ताँ आ ति॑ष्ठ॒ तेभि॒रा या॑ह्य॒र्वाङ्हवा॑महे त्वा सु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ सोमे॑
verses.transliteration: yé te vŕ̥ṣaṇo vr̥ṣabhā́sa indra  brahmayújo vŕ̥ṣarathāso átyāḥ  tā́m̐ ā́ tiṣṭha tébhir ā́ yāhy arvā́ṅ  hávāmahe tvā sutá indra sóme

translation.text: Thy mighty Stallions, yoked by prayer, O Indra, thy. Coursers to thy mighty chariot harnessed,– Ascend thou these, and borne by them come hither: with Soma juice out. poured, Indra, we call thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ति॑ष्ठ॒ रथं॒ वृष॑णं॒ वृषा॑ ते सु॒तः सोमः॒ परि॑षिक्ता॒ मधू॑नि यु॒क्त्वा वृष॑भ्यां वृषभ क्षिती॒नां हरि॑भ्यां याहि प्र॒वतोप॑ म॒द्रिक्
verses.transliteration: ā́ tiṣṭha ráthaṃ vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vŕ̥ṣā te  sutáḥ sómaḥ páriṣiktā mádhūni  yuktvā́ vŕ̥ṣabhyāṃ vr̥ṣabha kṣitīnā́ṃ  háribhyāṃ yāhi pravátópa madrík

translation.text: Ascend thy mighty car: the mighty Soma is poured for thee and sweets are sprinkled round us. Come down to us-ward, Bull of human races,come, having harnessed them, with strong Bay Horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं य॒ज्ञो दे॑व॒या अ॒यं मि॒येध॑ इ॒मा ब्रह्मा॑ण्य॒यमि॑न्द्र॒ सोमः॑ स्ती॒र्णं ब॒र्हिरा तु श॑क्र॒ प्र या॑हि॒ पिबा॑ नि॒षद्य॒ वि मु॑चा॒ हरी॑ इ॒ह
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ yajñó devayā́ ayám miyédhaḥ-  imā́ bráhmāṇy ayám indra sómaḥ  stīrṇám barhír ā́ tú śakra prá yāhi  píbā niṣádya ví mucā hárī ihá

translation.text: Here is God-reaching sacrifice, here the victim; here, Indra,are the prayers, here is the Soma. Strewn is thesacred grass: come hither, Ṣakra; seatthee and drink: unyoke thy two Bay Coursers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ सुष्टु॑त इन्द्र याह्य॒र्वाङुप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि मा॒न्यस्य॑ का॒रोः वि॒द्याम॒ वस्तो॒रव॑सा गृ॒णन्तो॑ वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: ó súṣṭuta indra yāhy arvā́ṅ  úpa bráhmāṇi mānyásya kāróḥ  vidyā́ma vástor ávasā gr̥ṇánto  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: Come to us, Indra, come thou highly lauded to the devotions of the singer Mâna. Singing, may we find early through thy succour, may we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्ध॒ स्या त॑ इन्द्र श्रु॒ष्टिरस्ति॒ यया॑ ब॒भूथ॑ जरि॒तृभ्य॑ ऊ॒ती मा नः॒ कामं॑ म॒हय॑न्त॒मा ध॒ग्विश्वा॑ ते अश्यां॒ पर्याप॑ आ॒योः
verses.transliteration: yád dha syā́ ta indra śruṣṭír ásti  yáyā babhū́tha jaritŕ̥bhya ūtī́  mā́ naḥ kā́mam maháyantam ā́ dhag  víśvā te aśyām páry ā́pa āyóḥ

translation.text: IF, Indra, thou hast given that gracious hearing where with thou helpest those who sang thy praises. Blast not the wish that would exalt us may I gain all from thee, and pay all man's devotions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न घा॒ राजेन्द्र॒ आ द॑भन्नो॒ या नु स्वसा॑रा कृ॒णव॑न्त॒ योनौ॑ आप॑श्चिदस्मै सु॒तुका॑ अवेष॒न्गम॑न्न॒ इन्द्रः॑ स॒ख्या वय॑श्च
verses.transliteration: ná ghā rā́jéndra ā́ dabhan no  yā́ nú svásārā kr̥ṇávanta yónau  ā́paś cid asmai sutúkā aveṣan  gáman na índraḥ sakhyā́ váyaś ca

translation.text: Let not the Sovran Indra disappoint us in what shall bring both Sisters to our dwelling. To him have run the quickly flowing waters.May Indra come to us with life and friendship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जेता॒ नृभि॒रिन्द्रः॑ पृ॒त्सु शूरः॒ श्रोता॒ हवं॒ नाध॑मानस्य का॒रोः प्रभ॑र्ता॒ रथं॑ दा॒शुष॑ उपा॒क उद्य॑न्ता॒ गिरो॒ यदि॑ च॒ त्मना॒ भूत्
verses.transliteration: jétā nŕ̥bhir índraḥ pr̥tsú śū́raḥ  śrótā hávaṃ nā́dhamānasya kāróḥ  prábhartā ráthaṃ dāśúṣa upāké-  údyantā gíro yádi ca tmánā bhū́t

translation.text: Victorious with the men, Hero in battles, Indra, who hearsthe singer's supplication, Will bring his car nigh to the man who offers, if he himself upholds the songs that praise him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा नृभि॒रिन्द्रः॑ सुश्रव॒स्या प्र॑खा॒दः पृ॒क्षो अ॒भि मि॒त्रिणो॑ भूत् स॒म॒र्य इ॒षः स्त॑वते॒ विवा॑चि सत्राक॒रो यज॑मानस्य॒ शंसः॑
verses.transliteration: evā́ nŕ̥bhir índraḥ suśravasyā́  prakhādáḥ pr̥kṣó abhí mitríṇo bhūt  samaryá iṣá stavate vívāci  satrākaró yájamānasya śáṃsaḥ

translation.text: Yea,Indra, with the men, through love of gloryconsumes the sacred food which friends have offered. The ever-strengthening song of him who worships is sung in fight amid the clash of voices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॑ व॒यं म॑घवन्निन्द्र॒ शत्रू॑न॒भि ष्या॑म मह॒तो मन्य॑मानान् त्वं त्रा॒ता त्वमु॑ नो वृ॒धे भू॑र्वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: tváyā vayám maghavann indra śátrūn  abhí ṣyāma maható mányamānān  tváṃ trātā́ tvám u no vr̥dhé bhūr  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: Aided by thee, O Maghavan, O Indra, may we subdue our foes who count them mighty. Be our protector, strengthen and increase us.May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒र्वीर॒हं श॒रदः॑ शश्रमा॒णा दो॒षा वस्तो॑रु॒षसो॑ ज॒रय॑न्तीः मि॒नाति॒ श्रियं॑ जरि॒मा त॒नूना॒मप्यू॒ नु पत्नी॒र्वृष॑णो जगम्युः
verses.transliteration: pūrvī́r aháṃ śarádaḥ śaśramāṇā́  doṣā́ vástor uṣáso jaráyantīḥ  minā́ti śríyaṃ jarimā́ tanū́nām  ápy ū nú pátnīr vŕ̥ṣaṇo jagamyuḥ

translation.text: 'Through many autumns have I toiled and laboured, at night and morn, through age-inducing dawnings. Old age impairs the beauty of our bodies. Let husbands still come near unto their spouses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये चि॒द्धि पूर्व॑ ऋत॒साप॒ आस॑न्त्सा॒कं दे॒वेभि॒रव॑दन्नृ॒तानि॑ ते चि॒दवा॑सुर्न॒ह्यन्त॑मा॒पुः समू॒ नु पत्नी॒र्वृष॑भिर्जगम्युः
verses.transliteration: yé cid dhí pū́rva r̥tasā́pa ā́san  sākáṃ devébhir ávadann r̥tā́ni  té cid ávāsur nahy ántam āpúḥ  sám ū nú pátnīr vŕ̥ṣabhir jagamyuḥ

translation.text: For even the men aforetime, law-fulfillers, who with the Gods declared eternal statutes,– – They have decided, but have not accomplished: so now let wives come near unto their husbands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न मृषा॑ श्रा॒न्तं यदव॑न्ति दे॒वा विश्वा॒ इत्स्पृधो॑ अ॒भ्य॑श्नवाव जया॒वेदत्र॑ श॒तनी॑थमा॒जिं यत्स॒म्यञ्चा॑ मिथु॒नाव॒भ्यजा॑व
verses.transliteration: ná mŕ̥ṣā śrāntáṃ yád ávanti devā́ḥ-  víśvā ít spŕ̥dho abhy àśnavāva  jáyāvéd átra śatánītham ājíṃ  yát samyáñcā mithunā́v abhy ájāva

translation.text: Non inutilis est labor cui Dii favent: nos omnes aemulos et aemulas vincamus. Superemus in hac centum artium pugna in qua duas partes convenientes utrinque commovemus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒दस्य॑ मा रुध॒तः काम॒ आग॑न्नि॒त आजा॑तो अ॒मुतः॒ कुत॑श्चित् लोपा॑मुद्रा॒ वृष॑णं॒ नी रि॑णाति॒ धीर॒मधी॑रा धयति श्व॒सन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: nadásya mā rudhatáḥ kā́ma ā́gann  itá ā́jāto amútaḥ kútaś cit  lópāmudrā vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ nī́ riṇāti  dhī́ram ádhīrā dhayati śvasántam

translation.text: Cupido me cepit illius tauri (viri) qui me despicit, utrum hinc utrum illinc ab aliqua parte nata sit. Lopamudra taurum (maritum suum) ad se detrahit: insipiens illa sapientem anhelantem absorbet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं नु सोम॒मन्ति॑तो हृ॒त्सु पी॒तमुप॑ ब्रुवे यत्सी॒माग॑श्चकृ॒मा तत्सु मृ॑ळतु पुलु॒कामो॒ हि मर्त्यः॑
verses.transliteration: imáṃ nú sómam ántito  hr̥tsú pītám úpa bruve  yát sīm ā́gaś cakr̥mā́ tát sú mr̥ḷatu  pulukā́mo hí mártyaḥ

translation.text: This Soma I address that is most near us, that which hath been imbibed within the spirit, To pardon any sins we have committed. Verily mortal man is full of longings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒गस्त्यः॒ खन॑मानः ख॒नित्रैः॑ प्र॒जामप॑त्यं॒ बल॑मि॒च्छमा॑नः उ॒भौ वर्णा॒वृषि॑रु॒ग्रः पु॑पोष स॒त्या दे॒वेष्वा॒शिषो॑ जगाम
verses.transliteration: agástyaḥ khánamānaḥ khanítraiḥ  prajā́m ápatyam bálam ichámānaḥ  ubhaú várṇāv ŕ̥ṣir ugráḥ pupoṣa  satyā́ devéṣv āśíṣo jagāma

translation.text: Agastya thus, toiling with strong endeavour, wishing for children, progeny and power, Cherished – a sage of mighty strength – both classes, and with the Gods obtained his prayer's fulfilment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वो रजां॑सि सु॒यमा॑सो॒ अश्वा॒ रथो॒ यद्वां॒ पर्यर्णां॑सि॒ दीय॑त् हि॒र॒ण्यया॑ वां प॒वयः॑ प्रुषाय॒न्मध्वः॒ पिब॑न्ता उ॒षसः॑ सचेथे
verses.transliteration: yuvó rájāṃsi suyámāso áśvāḥ-  rátho yád vām páry árṇāṃsi dī́yat  hiraṇyáyā vām paváyaḥ pruṣāyan  mádhvaḥ píbantā uṣásaḥ sacethe

translation.text: LIGHTLY your coursers travel through the regions when round thesea of air your car is flying. Your golden fellies scatter drops of moisture: drinking the sweetness ye atend the Mornings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वमत्य॒स्याव॑ नक्षथो॒ यद्विप॑त्मनो॒ नर्य॑स्य॒ प्रय॑ज्योः स्वसा॒ यद्वां॑ विश्वगूर्ती॒ भरा॑ति॒ वाजा॒येट्टे॑ मधुपावि॒षे च॑
verses.transliteration: yuvám átyasyā́va nakṣatho yád  vípatmano náryasya práyajyoḥ  svásā yád vāṃ viśvagūrtī bhárāti  vā́jāyéṭṭe madhupāv iṣé ca

translation.text: Ye as ye travel overtake the Courser who flies apart, the Friend of man, most holy. The prayer is that the Sister may convey you, all praised, meath-drinkers! to support and strengthen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं पय॑ उ॒स्रिया॑यामधत्तं प॒क्वमा॒माया॒मव॒ पूर्व्यं॒ गोः अ॒न्तर्यद्व॒निनो॑ वामृतप्सू ह्वा॒रो न शुचि॒र्यज॑ते ह॒विष्मा॑न्
verses.transliteration: yuvám páya usríyāyām adhattam  pakvám āmā́yām áva pū́rvyaṃ góḥ  antár yád vaníno vām r̥tapsū  hvāró ná śúcir yájate havíṣmān

translation.text: Ye have deposited, matured within her, in the raw cow the first milk of the milch-cow, Which the bright offerer, shining like a serpent mid trees, presents to you whose form is perfect.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं ह॑ घ॒र्मं मधु॑मन्त॒मत्र॑ये॒ऽपो न क्षोदो॑ऽवृणीतमे॒षे तद्वां॑ नरावश्विना॒ पश्व॑इष्टी॒ रथ्ये॑व च॒क्रा प्रति॑ यन्ति॒ मध्वः॑
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ ha gharmám mádhumantam átraye  -apó ná kṣódo 'vr̥ṇītam eṣé  tád vāṃ narāv aśvinā páśva: iṣṭiḥ-  ráthyeva cakrā́ práti yanti mádhvaḥ

translation.text: Ye made the fierce heat to be full of sweetness for Atri at his wish, like streaming water. Fire-offering thence is yours, O Aṣvins, Heroes: your car-wheels speed to us like springs of honey.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॑ दा॒नाय॑ ववृतीय दस्रा॒ गोरोहे॑ण तौ॒ग्र्यो न जिव्रिः॑ अ॒पः क्षो॒णी स॑चते॒ माहि॑ना वां जू॒र्णो वा॒मक्षु॒रंह॑सो यजत्रा
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ dānā́ya vavr̥tīya dasrā  gór óheṇa taugryó ná jívriḥ  apáḥ kṣoṇī́ sacate mā́hinā vāṃ  jūrṇó vām ákṣur áṃhaso yajatrā

translation.text: Like Tugra's ancient son may I, ye Mighty, bring you to give your gifts with milk-oblations. Your greatness compasseth Earth, Heaven, and Waters: decayed for you is sorrow's net, ye Holy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि यद्यु॒वेथे॑ नि॒युतः॑ सुदानू॒ उप॑ स्व॒धाभिः॑ सृजथः॒ पुरं॑धिम् प्रेष॒द्वेष॒द्वातो॒ न सू॒रिरा म॒हे द॑दे सुव्र॒तो न वाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: ní yád yuvéthe niyútaḥ sudānū  úpa svadhā́bhiḥ sr̥jathaḥ púraṃdhim  préṣad véṣad vā́to ná sūrír  ā́ mahé dade suvrató ná vā́jam

translation.text: When, Bounteous Ones, ye drive your yoked team downward, ye send, by your own natures, understanding. Swift as the wind let the prince please and feast you: he, like a pious man, gains strength for increase.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं चि॒द्धि वां॑ जरि॒तारः॑ स॒त्या वि॑प॒न्याम॑हे॒ वि प॒णिर्हि॒तावा॑न् अधा॑ चि॒द्धि ष्मा॑श्विनावनिन्द्या पा॒थो हि ष्मा॑ वृषणा॒वन्ति॑देवम्
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ cid dhí vāṃ jaritā́raḥ satyā́ḥ-  vipanyā́mahe ví paṇír hitā́vān  ádhā cid dhí ṣmāśvināv anindyā  pāthó hí ṣmā vr̥ṣaṇāv ántidevam

translation.text: For verily we truthful singers praise you the niggard trafficker is here excluded. Now, even now do ye O blameless Advins, ye Mighty, guard the man whose God is near him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वां चि॒द्धि ष्मा॑श्विना॒वनु॒ द्यून्विरु॑द्रस्य प्र॒स्रव॑णस्य सा॒तौ अ॒गस्त्यो॑ न॒रां नृषु॒ प्रश॑स्तः॒ कारा॑धुनीव चितयत्स॒हस्रैः॑
verses.transliteration: yuvā́ṃ cid dhí ṣmāśvināv ánu dyū́n  vírudrasya prasrávaṇasya sātaú  agástyo narā́ṃ nŕ̥ṣu práśastaḥ  kā́rādhunīva citayat sahásraiḥ

translation.text: You of a truth day after day, O Aṣvins, that he might win the very plenteous torrent, Agastya, famous among mortal heroes, roused with a thousand lauds like sounds of music.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यद्वहे॑थे महि॒ना रथ॑स्य॒ प्र स्य॑न्द्रा याथो॒ मनु॑षो॒ न होता॑ ध॒त्तं सू॒रिभ्य॑ उ॒त वा॒ स्वश्व्यं॒ नास॑त्या रयि॒षाचः॑ स्याम
verses.transliteration: prá yád váhethe mahinā́ ráthasya  prá syandrā yātho mánuṣo ná hótā  dhattáṃ sūríbhya utá vā sváśvyaṃ  nā́satyā rayiṣā́caḥ syāma

translation.text: When with the glory of your car ye travel, when we go speeding like the priest of mortals, And give good horses to sacrificers, may we, Nâsatyas! gain our share of riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वां॒ रथं॑ व॒यम॒द्या हु॑वेम॒ स्तोमै॑रश्विना सुवि॒ताय॒ नव्य॑म् अरि॑ष्टनेमिं॒ परि॒ द्यामि॑या॒नं वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: táṃ vāṃ ráthaṃ vayám adyā́ huvema  stómair aśvinā suvitā́ya návyam  áriṣṭanemim pári dyā́m iyānáṃ  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: With songs of praise we call to-day, O Aṣvins, that your new chariot, for our own well-being, That circles heaven with never-injured fellies. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कदु॒ प्रेष्टा॑वि॒षां र॑यी॒णाम॑ध्व॒र्यन्ता॒ यदु॑न्निनी॒थो अ॒पाम् अ॒यं वां॑ य॒ज्ञो अ॑कृत॒ प्रश॑स्तिं॒ वसु॑धिती॒ अवि॑तारा जनानाम्
verses.transliteration: kád u préṣṭāv iṣā́ṃ rayīṇā́m  adhvaryántā yád unninīthó apā́m  ayáṃ vāṃ yajñó akr̥ta práśastiṃ  vásudhitī ávitārā janānām

translation.text: WHAT, dearest Pair, is this in strength and riches that ye as Priests are bring from the waters? This sacrifice is your glorification, ye who protect mankind and give them treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वा॒मश्वा॑सः॒ शुच॑यः पय॒स्पा वात॑रंहसो दि॒व्यासो॒ अत्याः॑ म॒नो॒जुवो॒ वृष॑णो वी॒तपृ॑ष्ठा॒ एह स्व॒राजो॑ अ॒श्विना॑ वहन्तु
verses.transliteration: ā́ vām áśvāsaḥ śúcayaḥ payaspā́ḥ-  vā́taraṃhaso divyā́so átyāḥ  manojúvo vŕ̥ṣaṇo vītápr̥ṣṭhāḥ-  éhá svarā́jo aśvínā vahantu

translation.text: May your pure steeds, rain-drinkers, bring you hither, swift as the tempest, your celestial coursers, Rapid as thought, with fair backs, full of vigour, resplendent in their native light, O Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ रथो॒ऽवनि॒र्न प्र॒वत्वा॑न्त्सृ॒प्रव॑न्धुरः सुवि॒ताय॑ गम्याः वृष्णः॑ स्थातारा॒ मन॑सो॒ जवी॑यानहम्पू॒र्वो य॑ज॒तो धि॑ष्ण्या॒ यः
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ rátho 'vánir ná pravátvān  sr̥právandhuraḥ suvitā́ya gamyāḥ  vŕ̥ṣṇa sthātārā mánaso jávīyān  ahampūrvó yajató dhiṣṇyā yáḥ

translation.text: Your car is like a torrent rushing downward: may it come nigh, broad-seated, for our welfare,– Car holy, strong, that ever would be foremost, thought-swift, which ye, for whom we long, have mounted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒हेह॑ जा॒ता सम॑वावशीतामरे॒पसा॑ त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ नाम॑भिः॒ स्वैः जि॒ष्णुर्वा॑म॒न्यः सुम॑खस्य सू॒रिर्दि॒वो अ॒न्यः सु॒भगः॑ पु॒त्र ऊ॑हे
verses.transliteration: ihéha jātā́ sám avāvaśītām  arepásā tanvā̀ nā́mabhiḥ svaíḥ  jiṣṇúr vām anyáḥ súmakhasya sūrír  divó anyáḥ subhágaḥ putrá ūhe

translation.text: Here sprung to life, they both have sung together, with bodies free from stain, with signs that mark them; One of you Prince of Sacrifice, the Victor, the other counts as Heaven's auspicious offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वां॑ निचे॒रुः क॑कु॒हो वशाँ॒ अनु॑ पि॒शङ्ग॑रूपः॒ सद॑नानि गम्याः हरी॑ अ॒न्यस्य॑ पी॒पय॑न्त॒ वाजै॑र्म॒थ्रा रजां॑स्यश्विना॒ वि घोषैः॑
verses.transliteration: prá vāṃ nicerúḥ kakuhó váśām̐ ánu  piśáṅgarūpaḥ sádanāni gamyāḥ  hárī anyásya pīpáyanta vā́jair  mathrā́ rájāṃsy aśvinā ví ghóṣaiḥ

translation.text: May your car-seat, down-gliding, golden-coloured, according to your wish approach our dwellings. Men shall feed full the bay steeds of the other, and, Aṣvins they with roars shall stir the regions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वां॑ श॒रद्वा॑न्वृष॒भो न नि॒ष्षाट् पू॒र्वीरिष॑श्चरति॒ मध्व॑ इ॒ष्णन् एवै॑र॒न्यस्य॑ पी॒पय॑न्त॒ वाजै॒र्वेष॑न्तीरू॒र्ध्वा न॒द्यो॑ न॒ आगुः॑
verses.transliteration: prá vāṃ śarádvān vr̥ṣabhó ná niṣṣā́ṭ  pūrvī́r íṣaś carati mádhva iṣṇán  évair anyásya pīpáyanta vā́jair  véṣantīr ūrdhvā́ nadyò na ā́guḥ

translation.text: Forth comes your strong Bull like a cloud of autumn, sending abundant food of liquid sweetness. Let them feed with the other's ways and vigour: the upper streams have come and do us service.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॑र्जि वां॒ स्थवि॑रा वेधसा॒ गीर्बा॒ळ्हे अ॑श्विना त्रे॒धा क्षर॑न्ती उप॑स्तुताववतं॒ नाध॑मानं॒ याम॒न्नया॑मञ्छृणुतं॒ हवं॑ मे
verses.transliteration: ásarji vāṃ sthávirā vedhasā gī́r  bāḷhé aśvinā tredhā́ kṣárantī  úpastutāv avataṃ nā́dhamānaṃ  yā́mann áyāmañ chr̥ṇutaṃ hávam me

translation.text: Your constant song hath been sent forth, Disposers! that flows threefold in mighty strength, O Aṣvins. Thus lauded, give the suppliant protection moving or resting hear mine invocation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्या वां॒ रुश॑तो॒ वप्स॑सो॒ गीस्त्रि॑ब॒र्हिषि॒ सद॑सि पिन्वते॒ नॄन् वृषा॑ वां मे॒घो वृ॑षणा पीपाय॒ गोर्न सेके॒ मनु॑षो दश॒स्यन्
verses.transliteration: utá syā́ vāṃ rúśato vápsaso gī́s  tribarhíṣi sádasi pinvate nr̥̄́n  vŕ̥ṣā vām meghó vr̥ṣaṇā pīpāya  gór ná séke mánuṣo daśasyán

translation.text: This song of bright contents for you is swelling in the men's hall where three-fold grass is ready. Your strong rain-cloud, ye Mighty Ones, hath swollen, honouring men as 'twere with milk's outpouring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वां पू॒षेवा॑श्विना॒ पुरं॑धिर॒ग्निमु॒षां न ज॑रते ह॒विष्मा॑न् हु॒वे यद्वां॑ वरिव॒स्या गृ॑णा॒नो वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: yuvā́m pūṣévāśvinā púraṃdhir  agním uṣā́ṃ ná jarate havíṣmān  huvé yád vāṃ varivasyā́ gr̥ṇānó  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: The prudent worshipper, like Pûshan, Aṣvins! praises you as he praises Dawn and Agni, When, singing with devotion, he invokes you. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभू॑दि॒दं व॒युन॒मो षु भू॑षता॒ रथो॒ वृष॑ण्वा॒न्मद॑ता मनीषिणः धि॒यं॒जि॒न्वा धिष्ण्या॑ वि॒श्पला॑वसू दि॒वो नपा॑ता सु॒कृते॒ शुचि॑व्रता
verses.transliteration: ábhūd idáṃ vayúnam ó ṣú bhūṣatā  rátho vŕ̥ṣaṇvān mádatā manīṣiṇaḥ  dhiyaṃjinvā́ dhíṣṇyā viśpálāvasū  divó nápātā sukŕ̥te śúcivratā

translation.text: THIS was the task. Appear promptly, ye prudent Ones. Here is the chariot drawn by strong steeds: be ye glad. Heart-stirring, longed for, succourers of Vispala, here are Heaven's Sons whose sway blesses the pious man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑तमा॒ हि धिष्ण्या॑ म॒रुत्त॑मा द॒स्रा दंसि॑ष्ठा र॒थ्या॑ र॒थीत॑मा पू॒र्णं रथं॑ वहेथे॒ मध्व॒ आचि॑तं॒ तेन॑ दा॒श्वांस॒मुप॑ याथो अश्विना
verses.transliteration: índratamā hí dhíṣṇyā marúttamā  dasrā́ dáṃsiṣṭhā rathyā̀ rathī́tamā  pūrṇáṃ ráthaṃ vahethe mádhva ā́citaṃ  téna dāśvā́ṃsam úpa yātho aśvinā

translation.text: Longed for, most Indra-like, mighty, most Marut-like, most w6nderful in deed, car-borne, best charioteers, Bring your full chariot hither heaped with liquid sweet: thereon, ye Mvins, come to him who offers gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किमत्र॑ दस्रा कृणुथः॒ किमा॑साथे॒ जनो॒ यः कश्चि॒दह॑विर्मही॒यते॑ अति॑ क्रमिष्टं जु॒रतं॑ प॒णेरसुं॒ ज्योति॒र्विप्रा॑य कृणुतं वच॒स्यवे॑
verses.transliteration: kím átra dasrā kr̥ṇuthaḥ kím āsāthe  jáno yáḥ káś cid áhavir mahīyáte  áti kramiṣṭaṃ jurátam paṇér ásuṃ  jyótir víprāya kr̥ṇutaṃ vacasyáve

translation.text: What make ye there, ye Mighty? Wherefore linger ye with folk who, offering not, are held in high esteem? Pass over them; make ye the niggard's life decay: give light unto the singer eloquent in praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒म्भय॑तम॒भितो॒ राय॑तः॒ शुनो॑ ह॒तं मृधो॑ वि॒दथु॒स्तान्य॑श्विना वाचं॑वाचं जरि॒तू र॒त्निनीं॑ कृतमु॒भा शंसं॑ नासत्यावतं॒ मम॑
verses.transliteration: jambháyatam abhíto rā́yataḥ śúno  hatám mŕ̥dho vidáthus tā́ny aśvinā  vā́caṃ-vācaṃ jaritū́ ratnínīṃ kr̥tam  ubhā́ śáṃsaṃ nāsatyāvatam máma

translation.text: Crunch up on. every side the dogs who bark at us: slay ye our foes, O Aṣvins this ye understand. Make wealthy every word of him who praises you: accept with favour, both Nâsatyas, this my laud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वमे॒तं च॑क्रथुः॒ सिन्धु॑षु प्ल॒वमा॑त्म॒न्वन्तं॑ प॒क्षिणं॑ तौ॒ग्र्याय॒ कम् येन॑ देव॒त्रा मन॑सा निरू॒हथुः॑ सुपप्त॒नी पे॑तथुः॒ क्षोद॑सो म॒हः
verses.transliteration: yuvám etáṃ cakrathuḥ síndhuṣu plavám  ātmanvántam pakṣíṇaṃ taugryā́ya kám  yéna devatrā́ mánasā nirūháthuḥ  supaptanī́ petathuḥ kṣódaso maháḥ

translation.text: Ye made for Tugra's son amid the water-floods that animated ship with wings to fly withal, Whereon with God-devoted mind ye brought him forth, and fled with easy flight from out the mighty surge.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑विद्धं तौ॒ग्र्यम॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तर॑नारम्भ॒णे तम॑सि॒ प्रवि॑द्धम् चत॑स्रो॒ नावो॒ जठ॑लस्य॒ जुष्टा॒ उद॒श्विभ्या॑मिषि॒ताः पा॑रयन्ति
verses.transliteration: ávaviddhaṃ taugryám apsv àntár  anārambhaṇé támasi práviddham  cátasro nā́vo jáṭhalasya júṣṭāḥ-  úd aśvíbhyām iṣitā́ḥ pārayanti

translation.text: Four ships most welcome in the midst of ocean, urged by the Aṣvins, save the son of Tugra, Him who was cast down headlong in the waters, plunged in the thick inevitable darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कः स्वि॑द्वृ॒क्षो निष्ठि॑तो॒ मध्ये॒ अर्ण॑सो॒ यं तौ॒ग्र्यो ना॑धि॒तः प॒र्यष॑स्वजत् प॒र्णा मृ॒गस्य॑ प॒तरो॑रिवा॒रभ॒ उद॑श्विना ऊहथुः॒ श्रोम॑ताय॒ कम्
verses.transliteration: káḥ svid vr̥kṣó níṣṭhito mádhye árṇaso  yáṃ taugryó nādhitáḥ paryáṣasvajat  parṇā́ mr̥gásya patáror ivārábhe-  úd aśvinā ūhathuḥ śrómatāya kám

translation.text: What tree was that which stood fixed in surrounding sea to which the son of Tugra supplicating clung? Like twigs, of which some winged creature may take hold, ye, Aṣvins, bore him off safely to your renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वां॑ नरा नासत्या॒वनु॑ ष्या॒द्यद्वां॒ माना॑स उ॒चथ॒मवो॑चन् अ॒स्माद॒द्य सद॑सः सो॒म्यादा वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: tád vāṃ narā nāsatyāv ánu ṣyād  yád vām mā́nāsa ucátham ávocan  asmā́d adyá sádasaḥ somyā́d~ā́  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: Welcome to you be this the hymn of praises uttered by Mânas, O Nâsatyas, Heroes, From this our gathering where we offer Soma. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं यु॑ञ्जाथां॒ मन॑सो॒ यो जवी॑यान्त्रिवन्धु॒रो वृ॑षणा॒ यस्त्रि॑च॒क्रः येनो॑पया॒थः सु॒कृतो॑ दुरो॒णं त्रि॒धातु॑ना पतथो॒ विर्न प॒र्णैः
verses.transliteration: táṃ yuñjāthām mánaso yó jávīyān  trivandhuró vr̥ṣaṇā yás tricakráḥ  yénopayātháḥ sukŕ̥to duroṇáṃ  tridhā́tunā patatho vír ná parṇaíḥ

translation.text: MAKE ready that which passes thought in swiftness, that hath three wheels and triple seat, ye Mighty, Whereon ye seek the dwelling of the pious, whereon, threefold, ye fly like birds with pinions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒वृद्रथो॑ वर्तते॒ यन्न॒भि क्षां यत्तिष्ठ॑थः॒ क्रतु॑म॒न्तानु॑ पृ॒क्षे वपु॑र्वपु॒ष्या स॑चतामि॒यं गीर्दि॒वो दु॑हि॒त्रोषसा॑ सचेथे
verses.transliteration: suvŕ̥d rátho vartate yánn abhí kṣā́ṃ  yát tíṣṭhathaḥ krátumantā́nu pr̥kṣé  vápur vapuṣyā́ sacatām iyáṃ gī́r  divó duhitróṣásā sacethe

translation.text: Light rolls your easy chariot faring earthward, what time, for food, ye, full of wisdom, mount it. May this song, wondrous fair, attend your glory: ye, as ye travel, wait on Dawn Heaven's Daughter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ति॑ष्ठतं सु॒वृतं॒ यो रथो॑ वा॒मनु॑ व्र॒तानि॒ वर्त॑ते ह॒विष्मा॑न् येन॑ नरा नासत्येष॒यध्यै॑ व॒र्तिर्या॒थस्तन॑याय॒ त्मने॑ च
