verses.transliteration: ā́ tiṣṭhataṃ suvŕ̥taṃ yó rátho vām  ánu vratā́ni vártate havíṣmān  yéna narā nāsatyeṣayádhyai  vartír yāthás tánayāya tmáne ca

translation.text: Ascend your lightly rolling car, approaching the worshipper who turns him to his duties,– Whereon ye come unto the house to quicken man and his offspring, O Nâsatyas, Heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा वां॒ वृको॒ मा वृ॒कीरा द॑धर्षी॒न्मा परि॑ वर्क्तमु॒त माति॑ धक्तम् अ॒यं वां॑ भा॒गो निहि॑त इ॒यं गीर्दस्रा॑वि॒मे वां॑ नि॒धयो॒ मधू॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: mā́ vāṃ vŕ̥ko mā́ vr̥kī́r ā́ dadharṣīt-  mā́ pári varktam utá mā́ti dhaktam  ayáṃ vām bhāgó níhita iyáṃ gī́r  dásrāv imé vāṃ nidháyo mádhūnām

translation.text: Let not the wolf, let not the she-wolf harm you. Forsake me not, nor pass me by or others. Here stands your share, here is your hymn, ye Mighty: yours are these vessels, full of pleasant juices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वां गोत॑मः पुरुमी॒ळ्हो अत्रि॒र्दस्रा॒ हव॒तेऽव॑से ह॒विष्मा॑न् दिशं॒ न दि॒ष्टामृ॑जू॒येव॒ यन्ता मे॒ हवं॑ नास॒त्योप॑ यातम्
verses.transliteration: yuvā́ṃ gótamaḥ purumīḷhó átrir  dásrā hávaté 'vase havíṣmān  díśaṃ ná diṣṭā́m r̥jūyéva yántā-  -ā́ me hávaṃ nāsatyópa yātam

translation.text: Gotama, Purumîḷha, Atri bringing oblations all invoke you for protection. Like one who goes strai ht to the point directed, ye Nâsatyas, to mine invocation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अता॑रिष्म॒ तम॑सस्पा॒रम॒स्य प्रति॑ वां॒ स्तोमो॑ अश्विनावधायि एह या॑तं प॒थिभि॑र्देव॒यानै॑र्वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: átāriṣma támasas pārám asyá-  práti vāṃ stómo aśvināv adhāyi  éhá yātam pathíbhir devayā́nair  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: We have passed o'er the limit of this darkness: our praise hath been bestowed on you, O Aṣvins. Come hitherward by paths which Gods have travelled. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वा॑म॒द्य ताव॑प॒रं हु॑वेमो॒च्छन्त्या॑मु॒षसि॒ वह्नि॑रु॒क्थैः नास॑त्या॒ कुह॑ चि॒त्सन्ता॑व॒र्यो दि॒वो नपा॑ता सु॒दास्त॑राय
verses.transliteration: tā́ vām adyá tā́v aparáṃ huvema-  -uchántyām uṣási váhnir ukthaíḥ  nā́satyā kúha cit sántāv aryó  divó nápātā sudā́starāya

translation.text: LET us invoke you both this day and after the priest is here with lauds when morn is breaking: Nâsatyas, wheresoe'er ye be, Heaven's Children, for him who is more liberal than the godless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे ऊ॒ षु वृ॑षणा मादयेथा॒मुत्प॒णीँर्ह॑तमू॒र्म्या मद॑न्ता श्रु॒तं मे॒ अच्छो॑क्तिभिर्मती॒नामेष्टा॑ नरा॒ निचे॑तारा च॒ कर्णैः॑
verses.transliteration: asmé ū ṣú vr̥ṣaṇā mādayethām  út paṇī́m̐r hatam ūrmyā́ mádantā  śrutám me áchoktibhir matīnā́m  éṣṭā narā nícetārā ca kárṇaiḥ

translation.text: With us, ye Mighty, let yourselves be joyful, glad in our stream of Soma slay the niggards. Graciously hear my hymns and invitations, marking, O Heroes, with your cars my longing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रि॒ये पू॑षन्निषु॒कृते॑व दे॒वा नास॑त्या वह॒तुं सू॒र्यायाः॑ व॒च्यन्ते॑ वां ककु॒हा अ॒प्सु जा॒ता यु॒गा जू॒र्णेव॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ भूरेः॑
verses.transliteration: śriyé pūṣann iṣukŕ̥teva devā́  nā́satyā vahatúṃ sūryā́yāḥ  vacyánte vāṃ kakuhā́ apsú jātā́ḥ-  yugā́ jūrṇéva váruṇasya bhū́reḥ

translation.text: Nâsatyas, Pûshans, ye as Gods for glory arranged and set in order Sûryâ's bridal. Your giant steeds move on, sprung from the waters, like ancient times of Varuṇa the Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मे सा वां॑ माध्वी रा॒तिर॑स्तु॒ स्तोमं॑ हिनोतं मा॒न्यस्य॑ का॒रोः अनु॒ यद्वां॑ श्रव॒स्या॑ सुदानू सु॒वीर्या॑य चर्ष॒णयो॒ मद॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: asmé sā́ vām mādhvī rātír astu  stómaṃ hinotam mānyásya kāróḥ  ánu yád vāṃ śravasyā̀ sudānū  suvī́ryāya carṣaṇáyo mádanti

translation.text: Your grace be with us, ye who love sweet juices: further the hymn sung by the poet Mâna, When men are joyful in your glorious actions, to win heroic strength, ye Bounteous Givers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष वां॒ स्तोमो॑ अश्विनावकारि॒ माने॑भिर्मघवाना सुवृ॒क्ति या॒तं व॒र्तिस्तन॑याय॒ त्मने॑ चा॒गस्त्ये॑ नासत्या॒ मद॑न्ता
verses.transliteration: eṣá vāṃ stómo aśvināv akāri  mā́nebhir maghavānā suvr̥ktí  yātáṃ vartís tánayāya tmáne ca-  -agástye nāsatyā mádantā

translation.text: This praise was made, O liberal Lords, O Aṣvins, for you with fair adornment by the Mânas. Come to our house for us and for our children, rejoicing, O Nâsatyas, in Agastya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अता॑रिष्म॒ तम॑सस्पा॒रम॒स्य प्रति॑ वां॒ स्तोमो॑ अश्विनावधायि एह या॑तं प॒थिभि॑र्देव॒यानै॑र्वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: átāriṣma támasas pārám asyá-  práti vāṃ stómo aśvināv adhāyi  éhá yātam pathíbhir devayā́nair  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: We have passed o'er the limit of this darkness: our praise hath been'bestowed on you, O Aṣvins. Come hitherward by paths which Gods have travelled. may we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒त॒रा पूर्वा॑ कत॒राप॑रा॒योः क॒था जा॒ते क॑वयः॒ को वि वे॑द विश्वं॒ त्मना॑ बिभृतो॒ यद्ध॒ नाम॒ वि व॑र्तेते॒ अह॑नी च॒क्रिये॑व
verses.transliteration: katarā́ pū́rvā katarā́parāyóḥ  kathā́ jāté kavayaḥ kó ví veda  víśvaṃ tmánā bibhr̥to yád dha nā́ma  ví vartete áhanī cakríyeva

translation.text: WHETHER of these is elder, whether later? How were they born? Who knoweth it, ye sages? These of themselves support all things existing: as on a car the Day and Night roll onward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूरिं॒ द्वे अच॑रन्ती॒ चर॑न्तं प॒द्वन्तं॒ गर्भ॑म॒पदी॑ दधाते नित्यं॒ न सू॒नुं पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थे॒ द्यावा॒ रक्ष॑तं पृथिवी नो॒ अभ्वा॑त्
verses.transliteration: bhū́riṃ dvé ácarantī cárantam  padvántaṃ gárbham apádī dadhāte  nítyaṃ ná sūnúm pitrór upásthe  dyā́vā rákṣatam pr̥thivī no ábhvāt

translation.text: The Twain uphold, though motionless and footless, a widespread offspring having feet and moving. Like your own fon upon his parents' bosom, protect us, Heaven and earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ने॒हो दा॒त्रमदि॑तेरन॒र्वं हु॒वे स्व॑र्वदव॒धं नम॑स्वत् तद्रो॑दसी जनयतं जरि॒त्रे द्यावा॒ रक्ष॑तं पृथिवी नो॒ अभ्वा॑त्
verses.transliteration: anehó dātrám áditer anarváṃ  huvé svàrvad avadháṃ námasvat  tád rodasī janayataṃ jaritré  dyā́vā rákṣatam pr̥thivī no ábhvāt

translation.text: I call for Aditi's unrivalled bounty, perfect, celestial, deathless, meet for worship. Produce this, ye Twain Worlds, for him who lauds you. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत॑प्यमाने॒ अव॒साव॑न्ती॒ अनु॑ ष्याम॒ रोद॑सी दे॒वपु॑त्रे उ॒भे दे॒वाना॑मु॒भये॑भि॒रह्नां॒ द्यावा॒ रक्ष॑तं पृथिवी नो॒ अभ्वा॑त्
verses.transliteration: átapyamāne ávasā́vantī  ánu ṣyāma ródasī deváputre  ubhé devā́nām ubháyebhir áhnāṃ  dyā́vā rákṣatam pr̥thivī no ábhvāt

translation.text: May we be close to both the Worlds who suffer no pain, Parents of Gods, who aid with favour, Both mid the Gods, with Day and Night alternate. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं॒गच्छ॑माने युव॒ती सम॑न्ते॒ स्वसा॑रा जा॒मी पि॒त्रोरु॒पस्थे॑ अ॒भि॒जिघ्र॑न्ती॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ नाभिं॒ द्यावा॒ रक्ष॑तं पृथिवी नो॒ अभ्वा॑त्
verses.transliteration: saṃgáchamāne yuvatī́ sámante  svásārā jāmī́ pitrór upásthe  abhijíghrantī bhúvanasya nā́bhiṃ  dyā́vā rákṣatam pr̥thivī no ábhvāt

translation.text: Faring together, young, with meeting limits, Twin Sisters lying in their Parents' bosom, Kissing the centre of the world together. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒र्वी सद्म॑नी बृह॒ती ऋ॒तेन॑ हु॒वे दे॒वाना॒मव॑सा॒ जनि॑त्री द॒धाते॒ ये अ॒मृतं॑ सु॒प्रती॑के॒ द्यावा॒ रक्ष॑तं पृथिवी नो॒ अभ्वा॑त्
verses.transliteration: urvī́ sádmanī br̥hatī́ r̥téna  huvé devā́nām ávasā jánitrī  dadhā́te yé amŕ̥taṃ suprátīke  dyā́vā rákṣatam pr̥thivī no ábhvāt

translation.text: Duly I call the two wide seats, the mighty, the general Parents, with the God's protection. Who, beautiful to look on, make the nectar. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒र्वी पृ॒थ्वी ब॑हु॒ले दू॒रेअ॑न्ते॒ उप॑ ब्रुवे॒ नम॑सा य॒ज्ञे अ॒स्मिन् द॒धाते॒ ये सु॒भगे॑ सु॒प्रतू॑र्ती॒ द्यावा॒ रक्ष॑तं पृथिवी नो॒ अभ्वा॑त्
verses.transliteration: urvī́ pr̥thvī́ bahulé dūréante  úpa bruve námasā yajñé asmín  dadhā́te yé subháge suprátūrtī  dyā́vā rákṣatam pr̥thivī no ábhvāt

translation.text: Wide, vast, and manifold, whose bounds are distant,– these, reverent, I address at this our worship, The blessed Pair, victorious, all-sustaining. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वान्वा॒ यच्च॑कृ॒मा कच्चि॒दागः॒ सखा॑यं वा॒ सद॒मिज्जास्प॑तिं वा इ॒यं धीर्भू॑या अव॒यान॑मेषां॒ द्यावा॒ रक्ष॑तं पृथिवी नो॒ अभ्वा॑त्
verses.transliteration: devā́n vā yác cakr̥mā́ kác cid ā́gaḥ  sákhāyaṃ vā sádam íj jā́spatiṃ vā  iyáṃ dhī́r bhūyā avayā́nam eṣāṃ  dyā́vā rákṣatam pr̥thivī no ábhvāt

translation.text: What sin we have at any time committed against the Gods, our friend, our house's chieftain, Thereof may this our hymn be expiation. Protect us, Heaven and Earth, from fearful danger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भा शंसा॒ नर्या॒ माम॑विष्टामु॒भे मामू॒ती अव॑सा सचेताम् भूरि॑ चिद॒र्यः सु॒दास्त॑राये॒षा मद॑न्त इषयेम देवाः
verses.transliteration: ubhā́ śáṃsā náryā mā́m aviṣṭām  ubhé mā́m ūtī́ ávasā sacetām  bhū́ri cid aryáḥ sudā́starāya-  -iṣā́ mádanta iṣayema devāḥ

translation.text: May both these Friends of man, who bless, preserve me, may they attend me with their help and favour. Enrich the man more liberal than the godless. May we, ye Gods, be strong with food rejoicing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तं दि॒वे तद॑वोचं पृथि॒व्या अ॑भिश्रा॒वाय॑ प्रथ॒मं सु॑मे॒धाः पा॒ताम॑व॒द्याद्दु॑रि॒ताद॒भीके॑ पि॒ता मा॒ता च॑ रक्षता॒मवो॑भिः
verses.transliteration: r̥táṃ divé tád avocam pr̥thivyaí-  abhiśrāvā́ya prathamáṃ sumedhā́ḥ  pātā́m avadyā́d duritā́d abhī́ke  pitā́ mātā́ ca rakṣatām ávobhiḥ

translation.text: Endowed with understanding, I have uttered this truth, for all to hear, to Earth and Heaven. Be near us, keep us from reproach and trouble. Father and Mother, with your help preserve us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं द्या॑वापृथिवी स॒त्यम॑स्तु॒ पित॒र्मात॒र्यदि॒होप॑ब्रु॒वे वा॑म् भू॒तं दे॒वाना॑मव॒मे अवो॑भिर्वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: idáṃ dyāvāpr̥thivī satyám astu  pítar mā́tar yád ihópabruvé vām  bhūtáṃ devā́nām avamé ávobhir  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: Be this my prayer fulfilled, O Earth and Heaven, wherewith, Father and Mother, I address you. Nearest of Gods be ye with your protection. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ न॒ इळा॑भिर्वि॒दथे॑ सुश॒स्ति वि॒श्वान॑रः सवि॒ता दे॒व ए॑तु अपि॒ यथा॑ युवानो॒ मत्स॑था नो॒ विश्वं॒ जग॑दभिपि॒त्वे म॑नी॒षा
verses.transliteration: ā́ na íḷābhir vidáthe suśastí  viśvā́naraḥ savitā́ devá etu  ápi yáthā yuvāno mátsathā no  víśvaṃ jágad abhipitvé manīṣā́

translation.text: LOVED of all men, may Savitar, through praises offered as sacred food, come to our synod, That you too, through-our hymn, ye ever-youthful, may gladden, at your visit, all our people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॒ विश्व॒ आस्क्रा॑ गमन्तु दे॒वा मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा वरु॑णः स॒जोषाः॑ भुव॒न्यथा॑ नो॒ विश्वे॑ वृ॒धासः॒ कर॑न्त्सु॒षाहा॑ विथु॒रं न शवः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ no víśva ā́skrā gamantu devā́ḥ-  mitró aryamā́ váruṇaḥ sajóṣāḥ  bhúvan yáthā no víśve vr̥dhā́saḥ  káran suṣā́hā vithuráṃ ná śávaḥ

translation.text: To us may all the Gods come trooped together, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuṇa concordant, That all may be promoters of our welfare, and with great might preserve our strength from slackness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेष्ठं॑ वो॒ अति॑थिं गृणीषे॒ऽग्निं श॒स्तिभि॑स्तु॒र्वणिः॑ स॒जोषाः॑ अस॒द्यथा॑ नो॒ वरु॑णः सुकी॒र्तिरिष॑श्च पर्षदरिगू॒र्तः सू॒रिः
verses.transliteration: préṣṭhaṃ vo átithiṃ gr̥ṇīṣe  -agníṃ śastíbhis turváṇiḥ sajóṣāḥ  ásad yáthā no váruṇaḥ sukīrtír  íṣaś ca parṣad arigūrtáḥ sūríḥ

translation.text: Agni I sing, the guest you love most dearly: the Conqueror through our lauds is friendly-minded. That he may be our Varuṇa rich in glory and send food like a prince praised by the godly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ व॒ एषे॒ नम॑सा जिगी॒षोषासा॒नक्ता॑ सु॒दुघे॑व धे॒नुः स॒मा॒ने अह॑न्वि॒मिमा॑नो अ॒र्कं विषु॑रूपे॒ पय॑सि॒ सस्मि॒न्नूध॑न्
verses.transliteration: úpa va éṣe námasā jigīṣā́-  -uṣā́sānáktā sudúgheva dhenúḥ  samāné áhan vimímāno arkáṃ  víṣurūpe páyasi sásminn ū́dhan

translation.text: To you I seek with reverence, Night and Morning, like a cow good to milk, with hope to conquer, Preparing on a common day the praise. song with milk of various hues within this udder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नोऽहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्यो॒३॒॑ मय॑स्कः॒ शिशुं॒ न पि॒प्युषी॑व वेति॒ सिन्धुः॑ येन॒ नपा॑तम॒पां जु॒नाम॑ मनो॒जुवो॒ वृष॑णो॒ यं वह॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: utá nó 'hir budhnyò máyas kaḥ  śíśuṃ ná pipyúṣīva veti síndhuḥ  yéna nápātam apā́ṃ junā́ma  manojúvo vŕ̥ṣaṇo yáṃ váhanti

translation.text: May the great Dragon of the Deep rejoice us: as one who nourishes her young comes Sindhu, With whom we will incite the Child of Waters whom vigorous course swift as thought bring hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त न॑ ईं॒ त्वष्टा ग॒न्त्वच्छा॒ स्मत्सू॒रिभि॑रभिपि॒त्वे स॒जोषाः॑ आ वृ॑त्र॒हेन्द्र॑श्चर्षणि॒प्रास्तु॒विष्ट॑मो न॒रां न॑ इ॒ह ग॑म्याः
verses.transliteration: utá na īṃ tváṣṭā́ gantv áchā  smát sūríbhir abhipitvé sajóṣāḥ  ā́ vr̥trahéndraś carṣaṇiprā́s  tuvíṣṭamo narā́ṃ na ihá gamyāḥ

translation.text: Moreover Tvashṭar also shall approach us, one-minded with the princes at his visit. Hither shall come the Vr̥itra-slayer Indra, Ruler of men, as strongest of the Heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त न॑ ईं म॒तयोऽश्व॑योगाः॒ शिशुं॒ न गाव॒स्तरु॑णं रिहन्ति तमीं॒ गिरो॒ जन॑यो॒ न पत्नीः॑ सुर॒भिष्ट॑मं न॒रां न॑सन्त
verses.transliteration: utá na īm matáyó 'śvayogāḥ  śíśuṃ ná gā́vas táruṇaṃ rihanti  tám īṃ gíro jánayo ná pátnīḥ  surabhíṣṭamaṃ narā́ṃ nasanta

translation.text: Him too our hymns delight, that yoke swift horses, like mother cows who lick their tender youngling. To him our songs shall yield themselves like spouses, to him the most delightful of the Heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त न॑ ईं म॒रुतो॑ वृ॒द्धसे॑नाः॒ स्मद्रोद॑सी॒ सम॑नसः सदन्तु पृष॑दश्वासो॒ऽवन॑यो॒ न रथा॑ रि॒शाद॑सो मित्र॒युजो॒ न दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: utá na īm marúto vr̥ddhásenāḥ  smád ródasī sámanasaḥ sadantu  pŕ̥ṣadaśvāso 'vánayo ná ráthāḥ-  riśā́daso mitrayújo ná devā́ḥ

translation.text: So may the Maruts, armed with mighty weapons, rest here on heaven and earth with hearts in concord, As Gods whose cars have dappled steeds like torrents, destroyers of the foe allies of Mitra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र नु यदे॑षां महि॒ना चि॑कि॒त्रे प्र यु॑ञ्जते प्र॒युज॒स्ते सु॑वृ॒क्ति अध॒ यदे॑षां सु॒दिने॒ न शरु॒र्विश्व॒मेरि॑णं प्रुषा॒यन्त॒ सेनाः॑
verses.transliteration: prá nú yád eṣām mahinā́ cikitré  prá yuñjate prayújas té suvr̥ktí  ádha yád eṣāṃ sudíne ná śárur  víśvam ériṇam pruṣāyánta sénāḥ

translation.text: They hasten on to happy termination their orders when they are made known by glory. As on a fair bright day the arrow flieth o'er all the barren soil their missiles sparkle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रो अ॒श्विना॒वव॑से कृणुध्वं॒ प्र पू॒षणं॒ स्वत॑वसो॒ हि सन्ति॑ अ॒द्वे॒षो विष्णु॒र्वात॑ ऋभु॒क्षा अच्छा॑ सु॒म्नाय॑ ववृतीय दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: pró aśvínāv ávase kr̥ṇudhvam  prá pūṣáṇaṃ svátavaso hí sánti  adveṣó víṣṇur vā́ta r̥bhukṣā́ḥ-  áchā sumnā́ya vavr̥tīya devā́n

translation.text: Incline the Aṣvins to show grace, and Pûshan, for power and might have they, their own possession. Friendly are Vishṇu, Vâta, and R̥ibhukshan so may I bring the Gods to make us happy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं सा वो॑ अ॒स्मे दीधि॑तिर्यजत्रा अपि॒प्राणी॑ च॒ सद॑नी च भूयाः नि या दे॒वेषु॒ यत॑ते वसू॒युर्वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ sā́ vo asmé dī́dhitir yajatrāḥ-  apiprā́ṇī ca sádanī ca bhūyāḥ  ní yā́ devéṣu yátate vasūyúr  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: This is my reverent thought of you, ye Holy; may it inspire you, make you dwell among us,– Thought, toiling for the Gods and seeking treasure. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒तुं नु स्तो॑षं म॒हो ध॒र्माणं॒ तवि॑षीम् यस्य॑ त्रि॒तो व्योज॑सा वृ॒त्रं विप॑र्वम॒र्दय॑त्
verses.transliteration: pitúṃ nú stoṣam  mahó dharmā́ṇaṃ táviṣīm  yásya tritó vy ójasā  vr̥tráṃ víparvam ardáyat

translation.text: Now will I glorify Food that upholds great strength, By whose invigorating power Trita rent Vr̥itra limb frorn limb.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वादो॑ पितो॒ मधो॑ पितो व॒यं त्वा॑ ववृमहे अ॒स्माक॑मवि॒ता भ॑व
verses.transliteration: svā́do pito mádho pito  vayáṃ tvā vavr̥mahe  asmā́kam avitā́ bhava

translation.text: O pleasant Food, O Food of meath, thee have we chosen for our own, So be our kind protector thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ नः पित॒वा च॑र शि॒वः शि॒वाभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ म॒यो॒भुर॑द्विषे॒ण्यः सखा॑ सु॒शेवो॒ अद्व॑याः
verses.transliteration: úpa naḥ pitav ā́ cara  śiváḥ śivā́bhir ūtíbhiḥ  mayobhúr adviṣeṇyáḥ  sákhā suśévo ádvayāḥ

translation.text: Come hitherward to us, O Food, auspicious with auspicious help, Health-bringing, not unkind, a dear and guileless friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ त्ये पि॑तो॒ रसा॒ रजां॒स्यनु॒ विष्ठि॑ताः दि॒वि वाता॑ इव श्रि॒ताः
verses.transliteration: táva tyé pito rásāḥ-  rájāṃsy ánu víṣṭhitāḥ  diví vā́tā iva śritā́ḥ

translation.text: These juices which, O Food, are thine throughout the regions are diffused. like winds they have their place in heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॒ त्ये पि॑तो॒ दद॑त॒स्तव॑ स्वादिष्ठ॒ ते पि॑तो प्र स्वा॒द्मानो॒ रसा॑नां तुवि॒ग्रीवा॑ इवेरते
verses.transliteration: táva tyé pito dádatas  táva svādiṣṭha té pito  prá svādmā́no rásānāṃ  tuvigrī́vā iverate

translation.text: These gifts of thine, O Food, O Food most sweet to taste, These savours of thy juices work like creatures that have mighty necks.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे पि॑तो म॒हानां॑ दे॒वानां॒ मनो॑ हि॒तम् अका॑रि॒ चारु॑ के॒तुना॒ तवाहि॒मव॑सावधीत्
verses.transliteration: tvé pito mahā́nāṃ  devā́nām máno hitám  ákāri cā́ru ketúnā  távā́him ávasāvadhīt

translation.text: In thee, O Food, is set the spirit of great Gods. Under thy flag brave deeds were done he slew the Dragon with thy help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒दो पि॑तो॒ अज॑गन्वि॒वस्व॒ पर्व॑तानाम् अत्रा॑ चिन्नो मधो पि॒तोऽरं॑ भ॒क्षाय॑ गम्याः
verses.transliteration: yád adó pito ájagan  vivásva párvatānām  átrā cin no madho pito-  -áram bhakṣā́ya gamyāḥ

translation.text: If thou be gone unto the splendour of the clouds, Even from thence, O Food of meath, prepared for our enjoyment, come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒पामोष॑धीनां परिं॒शमा॑रि॒शाम॑हे वाता॑पे॒ पीव॒ इद्भ॑व
verses.transliteration: yád apā́m óṣadhīnām  pariṃśám āriśā́mahe  vā́tāpe pī́va íd bhava

translation.text: Whatever morsel we consume from waters or from plants of earth, O Soma, wax thou fat thereby.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्ते॑ सोम॒ गवा॑शिरो॒ यवा॑शिरो॒ भजा॑महे वाता॑पे॒ पीव॒ इद्भ॑व
verses.transliteration: yát te soma gávāśiro  yávāśiro bhájāmahe  vā́tāpe pī́va íd bhava

translation.text: What Soma, we enjoy from thee in milky food or barley-brew, Vâtâpi, grow thou fat thereby.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒र॒म्भ ओ॑षधे भव॒ पीवो॑ वृ॒क्क उ॑दार॒थिः वाता॑पे॒ पीव॒ इद्भ॑व
verses.transliteration: karambhá oṣadhe bhava  pī́vo vr̥kká udārathíḥ  vā́tāpe pī́va íd bhava

translation.text: O Vegetable, Cake of meal, he wholesome, firm, and strengthening: Vâtâpi, grow thou fat thereby.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ व॒यं पि॑तो॒ वचो॑भि॒र्गावो॒ न ह॒व्या सु॑षूदिम दे॒वेभ्य॑स्त्वा सध॒माद॑म॒स्मभ्यं॑ त्वा सध॒माद॑म्
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā vayám pito  vácobhir gā́vo ná havyā́ suṣūdima  devébhyas tvā sadhamā́dam  asmábhyaṃ tvā sadhamā́dam

translation.text: O Food, from thee as such have we drawn forth with lauds, like cows, our sacrificial gifts, From thee who banquetest with Gods, from thee who banquetest with us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑द्धो अ॒द्य रा॑जसि दे॒वो दे॒वैः स॑हस्रजित् दू॒तो ह॒व्या क॒विर्व॑ह
verses.transliteration: sámiddho adyá rājasi  devó devaíḥ sahasrajit  dūtó havyā́ kavír vaha

translation.text: WINNER of thousands, kindled, thou shinest a God with Gods to-day. Bear out oblations, envoy, Sage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तनू॑नपादृ॒तं य॒ते मध्वा॑ य॒ज्ञः सम॑ज्यते दध॑त्सह॒स्रिणी॒रिषः॑
verses.transliteration: tánūnapād r̥táṃ yaté  mádhvā yajñáḥ sám ajyate  dádhat sahasríṇīr íṣaḥ

translation.text: Child of Thyself the sacrifice is for the righteous blent with meath, Presenting viands thousandfold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒जुह्वा॑नो न॒ ईड्यो॑ दे॒वाँ आ व॑क्षि य॒ज्ञिया॑न् अग्ने॑ सहस्र॒सा अ॑सि
verses.transliteration: ājúhvāno na ī́ḍyo  devā́m̐ ā́ vakṣi yajñíyān  ágne sahasrasā́ asi

translation.text: Invoked and worthy of our praise bring Gods whose due is sacrifice: Thou, Agni, givest countless gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒चीनं॑ ब॒र्हिरोज॑सा स॒हस्र॑वीरमस्तृणन् यत्रा॑दित्या वि॒राज॑थ
verses.transliteration: prācī́nam barhír ójasā  sahásravīram astr̥ṇan  yátrādityā virā́jatha

translation.text: To seat a thousand Heroes they eastward have strewn the grass with might, Whereon, Âdityas, ye shine forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒राट् स॒म्राड्वि॒भ्वीः प्र॒भ्वीर्ब॒ह्वीश्च॒ भूय॑सीश्च॒ याः दुरो॑ घृ॒तान्य॑क्षरन्
verses.transliteration: virā́ṭ samrā́ḍ vibhvī́ḥ prabhvī́r  bahvī́ś ca bhū́yasīś ca yā́ḥ  dúro ghr̥tā́ny akṣaran

translation.text: The sovran all-imperial Doors, wide, good, many and manifold, Have poured their streams of holy oil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒रु॒क्मे हि सु॒पेश॒साधि॑ श्रि॒या वि॒राज॑तः उ॒षासा॒वेह सी॑दताम्
verses.transliteration: surukmé hí supéśasā-  -ádhi śriyā́ virā́jataḥ  uṣā́sāv éhá sīdatām

translation.text: With gay adornment, fair to see, in glorious beauty shine they forth: Let Night and Morning rest them here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒थ॒मा हि सु॒वाच॑सा॒ होता॑रा॒ दैव्या॑ क॒वी य॒ज्ञं नो॑ यक्षतामि॒मम्
verses.transliteration: prathamā́ hí suvā́casā  hótārā daívyā kavī́  yajñáṃ no yakṣatām imám

translation.text: Let these two Sages first of all, heralds divine and eloquent, Perform for us this sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भार॒तीळे॒ सर॑स्वति॒ या वः॒ सर्वा॑ उपब्रु॒वे ता न॑श्चोदयत श्रि॒ये
verses.transliteration: bhā́ratī́ḷe sárasvati  yā́ vaḥ sárvā upabruvé  tā́ naś codayata śriyé

translation.text: You I address, Sarasvatî, and Bhâratî, and Iḷâ, all: Urge ye us on to glorious fame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वष्टा॑ रू॒पाणि॒ हि प्र॒भुः प॒शून्विश्वा॑न्त्समान॒जे तेषां॑ नः स्फा॒तिमा य॑ज
verses.transliteration: tváṣṭā rūpā́ṇi hí prabhúḥ  paśū́n víśvān samānajé  téṣāṃ na sphātím ā́ yaja

translation.text: Tvashṭar the Lord hath made all forms and all the cattle of the field Cause them to multiply for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॒ त्मन्या॑ वनस्पते॒ पाथो॑ दे॒वेभ्यः॑ सृज अ॒ग्निर्ह॒व्यानि॑ सिष्वदत्
verses.transliteration: úpa tmányā vanaspate  pā́tho devébhyaḥ sr̥ja  agnír havyā́ni siṣvadat

translation.text: Send to the Gods, Vanaspati, thyself, the sacrificial draught: Let Agni make the oblations sweet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रो॒गा अ॒ग्निर्दे॒वानां॑ गाय॒त्रेण॒ सम॑ज्यते स्वाहा॑कृतीषु रोचते
verses.transliteration: purogā́ agnír devā́nāṃ  gāyatréṇa sám ajyate  svā́hākr̥tīṣu rocate

translation.text: Agni, preceder of the Gods, is honoured with the sacred song: He glows at offerings blest with Hail!

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ नय॑ सु॒पथा॑ रा॒ये अ॒स्मान्विश्वा॑नि देव व॒युना॑नि वि॒द्वान् यु॒यो॒ध्य१॒॑स्मज्जु॑हुरा॒णमेनो॒ भूयि॑ष्ठां ते॒ नम॑उक्तिं विधेम
verses.transliteration: ágne náya supáthā rāyé asmā́n  víśvāni deva vayúnāni vidvā́n  yuyodhy àsmáj juhurāṇám éno  bhū́yiṣṭhāṃ te námaÅktiṃ vidhema

translation.text: BY goodly paths lead us to riches, Agni, God who knowest every sacred duty. Remove the sin that makes us stray and wander. most ample adoration will we bring thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ त्वं पा॑रया॒ नव्यो॑ अ॒स्मान्त्स्व॒स्तिभि॒रति॑ दु॒र्गाणि॒ विश्वा॑ पूश्च॑ पृ॒थ्वी ब॑हु॒ला न॑ उ॒र्वी भवा॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय॒ शं योः
verses.transliteration: ágne tvám pārayā návyo asmā́n  svastíbhir áti durgā́ṇi víśvā  pū́ś ca pr̥thvī́ bahulā́ na urvī́  bhávā tokā́ya tánayāya śáṃ yóḥ

translation.text: Lead us anew to happiness, O Agni; lead us beyond all danger and affliction. Be unto us a wide broad ample castle bless, prosper on their way our sons and offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ त्वम॒स्मद्यु॑यो॒ध्यमी॑वा॒ अन॑ग्नित्रा अ॒भ्यम॑न्त कृ॒ष्टीः पुन॑र॒स्मभ्यं॑ सुवि॒ताय॑ देव॒ क्षां विश्वे॑भिर॒मृते॑भिर्यजत्र
verses.transliteration: ágne tvám asmád yuyodhy ámīvāḥ-  ánagnitrā abhy ámanta kr̥ṣṭī́ḥ  púnar asmábhyaṃ suvitā́ya deva  kṣā́ṃ víśvebhir amŕ̥tebhir yajatra

translation.text: Far from us, Agni, put thou all diseases let them strike lauds that have no saving Agni. God, make our home again to be a blessing, with all the Immortal Deities, O Holy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पा॒हि नो॑ अग्ने पा॒युभि॒रज॑स्रैरु॒त प्रि॒ये सद॑न॒ आ शु॑शु॒क्वान् मा ते॑ भ॒यं ज॑रि॒तारं॑ यविष्ठ नू॒नं वि॑द॒न्माप॒रं स॑हस्वः
verses.transliteration: pāhí no agne pāyúbhir ájasrair  utá priyé sádana ā́ śuśukvā́n  mā́ te bhayáṃ jaritā́raṃ yaviṣṭha  nūnáṃ vidan mā́paráṃ sahasvaḥ

translation.text: Preserve us, Agni, with perpetual succour, refulgent in the dwelling which thou lovest. O Conqueror, most youthful, let no danger touch him who praises thee to-day or after.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॑ अ॒ग्नेऽव॑ सृजो अ॒घाया॑वि॒ष्यवे॑ रि॒पवे॑ दु॒च्छुना॑यै मा द॒त्वते॒ दश॑ते॒ मादते॑ नो॒ मा रीष॑ते सहसाव॒न्परा॑ दाः
verses.transliteration: mā́ no agné 'va sr̥jo aghā́ya-  -aviṣyáve ripáve duchúnāyai  mā́ datváte dáśate mā́dáte no  mā́ rī́ṣate sahasāvan párā dāḥ

translation.text: Give not us up a prey to sin, O Agni, the greedy enemy that brings us trouble; Not to the fanged that bites, not to the toothless: give not us up, thou Conqueror, to the spoiler.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि घ॒ त्वावाँ॑ ऋतजात यंसद्गृणा॒नो अ॑ग्ने त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ वरू॑थम् विश्वा॑द्रिरि॒क्षोरु॒त वा॑ निनि॒त्सोर॑भि॒ह्रुता॒मसि॒ हि दे॑व वि॒ष्पट्
verses.transliteration: ví gha tvā́vām̐ r̥tajāta yaṃsad  gr̥ṇānó agne tanvè várūtham  víśvād ririkṣór utá vā ninitsór  abhihrútām ási hí deva viṣpáṭ

translation.text: Such as thou art, born after Law, O Agni when lauded give protection to our bodies, From whosoever would reproach or injure: for thou, God, rescuest from all oppression.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ताँ अ॑ग्न उ॒भया॒न्वि वि॒द्वान्वेषि॑ प्रपि॒त्वे मनु॑षो यजत्र अ॒भि॒पि॒त्वे मन॑वे॒ शास्यो॑ भूर्मर्मृ॒जेन्य॑ उ॒शिग्भि॒र्नाक्रः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tā́m̐ agna ubháyān ví vidvā́n  véṣi prapitvé mánuṣo yajatra  abhipitvé mánave śā́syo bhūr  marmr̥jénya uśígbhir nā́kráḥ

translation.text: Thou, well discerning both these classes, comest to men at early morn, O holy Agni. Be thou obedient unto man at evening, to be adorned, as keen, by eager suitors.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवो॑चाम नि॒वच॑नान्यस्मि॒न्मान॑स्य सू॒नुः स॑हसा॒ने अ॒ग्नौ व॒यं स॒हस्र॒मृषि॑भिः सनेम वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: ávocāma nivácanāny asmin  mā́nasya sūnúḥ sahasāné agnaú  vayáṃ sahásram ŕ̥ṣibhiḥ sanema  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: To him have we addressed our pious speeches, I, Mâna's son, to him victorious Agni. May we gain countless riches with the sages. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न॒र्वाणं॑ वृष॒भं म॒न्द्रजि॑ह्वं॒ बृह॒स्पतिं॑ वर्धया॒ नव्य॑म॒र्कैः गा॒था॒न्यः॑ सु॒रुचो॒ यस्य॑ दे॒वा आ॑शृ॒ण्वन्ति॒ नव॑मानस्य॒ मर्ताः॑
verses.transliteration: anarvā́ṇaṃ vr̥ṣabhám mandrájihvam  bŕ̥haspátiṃ vardhayā návyam arkaíḥ  gāthānyàḥ surúco yásya devā́ḥ-  āśr̥ṇvánti návamānasya mártāḥ

translation.text: GLORIFY thou Br̥ihaspati, the scatheless, who must be praised with hymns, sweet-tongued and mighty, To whom as leader of the song, resplendent, worthy of lauds, both Gods and mortals listen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमृ॒त्विया॒ उप॒ वाचः॑ सचन्ते॒ सर्गो॒ न यो दे॑वय॒तामस॑र्जि बृह॒स्पतिः॒ स ह्यञ्जो॒ वरां॑सि॒ विभ्वाभ॑व॒त्समृ॒ते मा॑त॒रिश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: tám r̥tvíyā úpa vā́caḥ sacante  sárgo ná yó devayatā́m ásarji  bŕ̥haspátiḥ sá hy áñjo várāṃsi  víbhvā́bhavat sám r̥té mātaríśvā

translation.text: On him wait songs according to the season even as a stream of pious men set moving. Br̥ihaspati-for helaid out the expanses- was, at the sacrifice, vast Mâtariṣvan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑स्तुतिं॒ नम॑स॒ उद्य॑तिं च॒ श्लोकं॑ यंसत्सवि॒तेव॒ प्र बा॒हू अ॒स्य क्रत्वा॑ह॒न्यो॒३॒॑ यो अस्ति॑ मृ॒गो न भी॒मो अ॑र॒क्षस॒स्तुवि॑ष्मान्
verses.transliteration: úpastutiṃ námasa údyatiṃ ca  ślókaṃ yaṃsat savitéva prá bāhū́  asyá krátvāhanyò yó ásti  mr̥gó ná bhīmó arakṣásas túviṣmān

translation.text: The praise, the verse that offers adoration, may he bring forth, as the Sun sends his arms out, He who gives daily light through this God's wisdom, strong as a dread wild beast, and inoffensive.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य श्लोको॑ दि॒वीय॑ते पृथि॒व्यामत्यो॒ न यं॑सद्यक्ष॒भृद्विचे॑ताः मृ॒गाणां॒ न हे॒तयो॒ यन्ति॑ चे॒मा बृह॒स्पते॒रहि॑मायाँ अ॒भि द्यून्
verses.transliteration: asyá ślóko divī́yate pr̥thivyā́m  átyo ná yaṃsad yakṣabhŕ̥d vícetāḥ  mr̥gā́ṇāṃ ná hetáyo yánti cemā́ḥ-  bŕ̥haspáter áhimāyām̐ abhí dyū́n

translation.text: His song of praise pervades the earth and heaven – let the wise worshipper draw it, like a courser. These of Br̥ihaspati, like hunters' arrows, go to the skies that change their hue like serpents.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये त्वा॑ देवोस्रि॒कं मन्य॑मानाः पा॒पा भ॒द्रमु॑प॒जीव॑न्ति प॒ज्राः न दू॒ढ्ये॒३॒॑ अनु॑ ददासि वा॒मं बृह॑स्पते॒ चय॑स॒ इत्पिया॑रुम्
verses.transliteration: yé tvā devosrikám mányamānāḥ  pāpā́ bhadrám upajī́vanti pajrā́ḥ  ná dūḍhyè ánu dadāsi vāmám  bŕ̥haspate cáyasa ít píyārum

translation.text: Those, God, who count thee as a worthless bullock, and, wealthy sinners, live on thee the Bounteous,– On fools like these no blessing thou bestowest: Br̥ihaspati, thou punishest the spiteful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒प्रैतुः॑ सू॒यव॑सो॒ न पन्था॑ दुर्नि॒यन्तुः॒ परि॑प्रीतो॒ न मि॒त्रः अ॒न॒र्वाणो॑ अ॒भि ये चक्ष॑ते॒ नोऽपी॑वृता अपोर्णु॒वन्तो॑ अस्थुः
verses.transliteration: supraítuḥ sūyávaso ná pánthāḥ-  durniyántuḥ páriprīto ná mitráḥ  anarvā́ṇo abhí yé cákṣate naḥ-  -ápīvr̥tā aporṇuvánto asthuḥ

translation.text: Like a fair path is he, where grass is pleasant, though hard to win, a Friend beloved most early. Those who unharmed by enemies behold us, while: they would make them bare, stood closely compassed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं यं स्तुभो॒ऽवन॑यो॒ न यन्ति॑ समु॒द्रं न स्र॒वतो॒ रोध॑चक्राः स वि॒द्वाँ उ॒भयं॑ चष्टे अ॒न्तर्बृह॒स्पति॒स्तर॒ आप॑श्च॒ गृध्रः॑
verses.transliteration: sáṃ yáṃ stúbho 'vánayo ná yánti  samudráṃ ná sraváto ródhacakrāḥ  sá vidvā́m̐ ubháyaṃ caṣṭe antár  bŕ̥haspátis tára ā́paś ca gŕ̥dhraḥ

translation.text: He to whom songs of praise go forth like torrents, as rivers eddying under banks flow sea-ward- Br̥ihaspati the wise, the eager, closely looks upon both, the waters and the vessel.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा म॒हस्तु॑विजा॒तस्तुवि॑ष्मा॒न्बृह॒स्पति॑र्वृष॒भो धा॑यि दे॒वः स नः॑ स्तु॒तो वी॒रव॑द्धातु॒ गोम॑द्वि॒द्यामे॒षं वृ॒जनं॑ जी॒रदा॑नुम्
verses.transliteration: evā́ mahás tuvijātás túviṣmān  bŕ̥haspátir vr̥ṣabhó dhāyi deváḥ  sá na stutó vīrávad dhātu gómad  vidyā́meṣáṃ vr̥jánaṃ jīrádānum

translation.text: So hath Br̥ihaspati, great, strong and mighty, the God exceeding powerful, been brought hither. May he thus lauded give us kine and horses. May we find strengthening food in full abundance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कङ्क॑तो॒ न कङ्क॒तोऽथो॑ सती॒नक॑ङ्कतः द्वाविति॒ प्लुषी॒ इति॒ न्य१॒॑दृष्टा॑ अलिप्सत
verses.transliteration: káṅkato ná káṅkataḥ-  -átho satīnákaṅkataḥ  dvā́v íti plúṣī íti  ny àdŕ̥ṣṭā alipsata

translation.text: VENOMOUS, slightly venomous, or venomous aquatic worm,– Both creatures, stinging, unobserved, with poison have infected me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒दृष्टा॑न्हन्त्याय॒त्यथो॑ हन्ति पराय॒ती अथो॑ अवघ्न॒ती ह॒न्त्यथो॑ पिनष्टि पिंष॒ती
verses.transliteration: adŕ̥ṣṭān hanty āyatī́-  átho hanti parāyatī́  átho avaghnatī́ hanti-  átho pinaṣṭi piṃṣatī́

translation.text: Coming, it kills the unobserved; it kills them as it goes away, It kills them as it drives them off, and bruising bruises them to death.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒रासः॒ कुश॑रासो द॒र्भासः॑ सै॒र्या उ॒त मौ॒ञ्जा अ॒दृष्टा॑ वैरि॒णाः सर्वे॑ सा॒कं न्य॑लिप्सत
verses.transliteration: śarā́saḥ kúśarāso  darbhā́saḥ sairyā́ utá  mauñjā́ adŕ̥ṣṭā vairiṇā́ḥ  sárve sākáṃ ny àlipsata

translation.text: Ṣaragrass, Darbha, Kuṣara, and Sairya, Munja, Vîraṇa, Where all these creatures dwell unseen, with poison have infected me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि गावो॑ गो॒ष्ठे अ॑सद॒न्नि मृ॒गासो॑ अविक्षत नि के॒तवो॒ जना॑नां॒ न्य१॒॑दृष्टा॑ अलिप्सत
verses.transliteration: ní gā́vo goṣṭhé asadan  ní mr̥gā́so avikṣata  ní ketávo jánānāṃ  ny àdŕ̥ṣṭā alipsata

translation.text: The cows had settled in their stalls, the beasts of prey had sought their lairs, Extinguished were the lights of men, when things unseen infected me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒त उ॒ त्ये प्रत्य॑दृश्रन्प्रदो॒षं तस्क॑रा इव अदृ॑ष्टा॒ विश्व॑दृष्टाः॒ प्रति॑बुद्धा अभूतन
verses.transliteration: etá u tyé práty adr̥śran  pradoṣáṃ táskarā iva  ádr̥ṣṭā víśvadr̥ṣṭāḥ  prátibuddhā abhūtana

translation.text: Or these, thesereptiles, are observed, like lurking thieves at evening time. Seers of all, themselves unseen: be therefore very vigilant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यौर्वः॑ पि॒ता पृ॑थि॒वी मा॒ता सोमो॒ भ्रातादि॑तिः॒ स्वसा॑ अदृ॑ष्टा॒ विश्व॑दृष्टा॒स्तिष्ठ॑ते॒लय॑ता॒ सु क॑म्
verses.transliteration: dyaúr vaḥ pitā́ pr̥thivī́ mātā́  sómo bhrā́tā́ditiḥ svásā  ádr̥ṣṭā víśvadr̥ṣṭāḥ  tíṣṭhateláyatā sú kam

translation.text: Heaven is your Sire, your Mother Earth, Soma your Brother, Aditi Your Sister: seeing all, unseen, keep still and dwell ye happily.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये अंस्या॒ ये अङ्ग्याः॑ सू॒चीका॒ ये प्र॑कङ्क॒ताः अदृ॑ष्टाः॒ किं च॒नेह वः॒ सर्वे॑ सा॒कं नि ज॑स्यत
verses.transliteration: yé áṃsyā yé áṅgyāḥ  sūcī́kā yé prakaṅkatā́ḥ  ádr̥ṣṭāḥ kíṃ canéhá vaḥ  sárve sākáṃ ní jasyata

translation.text: Biters of shoulder or of limb, with needle-stings, most venomous, Unseen, whatever ye may be, vanish together and be gone.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्पु॒रस्ता॒त्सूर्य॑ एति वि॒श्वदृ॑ष्टो अदृष्ट॒हा अ॒दृष्टा॒न्त्सर्वा॑ञ्ज॒म्भय॒न्त्सर्वा॑श्च यातुधा॒न्यः॑
verses.transliteration: út purástāt sū́rya eti  viśvádr̥ṣṭo adr̥ṣṭahā́  adŕ̥ṣṭān sárvāñ jambháyan  sárvāś ca yātudhānyàḥ

translation.text: Slayer of things unseen, the Sun, beheld of all, mounts, eastward, up, Consuming all that are not seen, and evil spirits of the night.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॑पप्तद॒सौ सूर्यः॑ पु॒रु विश्वा॑नि॒ जूर्व॑न् आ॒दि॒त्यः पर्व॑तेभ्यो वि॒श्वदृ॑ष्टो अदृष्ट॒हा
verses.transliteration: úd apaptad asaú sū́ryaḥ  purú víśvāni jū́rvan  ādityáḥ párvatebhyo  viśvádr̥ṣṭo adr̥ṣṭahā́

translation.text: There hath the Sun-God mounted up, who scorches much and everything. Even the Âditya from the hills, all-seen, destroying things unseen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सूर्ये॑ वि॒षमा स॑जामि॒ दृतिं॒ सुरा॑वतो गृ॒हे सो चि॒न्नु न म॑राति॒ नो व॒यं म॑रामा॒रे अ॑स्य॒ योज॑नं हरि॒ष्ठा मधु॑ त्वा मधु॒ला च॑कार
verses.transliteration: sū́rye viṣám ā́ sajāmi  dŕ̥tiṃ súrāvato gr̥hé  só cin nú ná marāti  nó vayám marāma-  -āré asya yójanaṃ  hariṣṭhā́ mádhu tvā  madhulā́ cakāra

translation.text: I hang the poison in the Sun, a wine-skin in a vintner's house, He will not die, nor shall we die: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒य॒त्ति॒का श॑कुन्ति॒का स॒का ज॑घास ते वि॒षम् सो चि॒न्नु न म॑राति॒ नो व॒यं म॑रामा॒रे अ॑स्य॒ योज॑नं हरि॒ष्ठा मधु॑ त्वा मधु॒ला च॑कार
verses.transliteration: iyattikā́ śakuntikā́  sakā́ jaghāsa te viṣám  só cin nú ná marāti  nó vayám marāma-  -āré asya yójanaṃ  hariṣṭhā́ mádhu tvā  madhulā́ cakāra

translation.text: This little bird, so very small, hath swallowed all thy poison up. She will not die, nor shall we die: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिः स॒प्त वि॑ष्पुलिङ्ग॒का वि॒षस्य॒ पुष्य॑मक्षन् ताश्चि॒न्नु न म॑रन्ति॒ नो व॒यं म॑रामा॒रे अ॑स्य॒ योज॑नं हरि॒ष्ठा मधु॑ त्वा मधु॒ला च॑कार
verses.transliteration: tríḥ saptá viṣpuliṅgakā́  viṣásya púṣyam akṣan  tā́ś cin nú ná maranti  nó vayám marāma-  -āré asya yójanaṃ  hariṣṭhā́ mádhu tvā  madhulā́ cakāra

translation.text: The three-times-seven bright sparks of fire have swallowed up the poison's strength. They will not die, nor shall we die: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒वा॒नां न॑वती॒नां वि॒षस्य॒ रोपु॑षीणाम् सर्वा॑सामग्रभं॒ नामा॒रे अ॑स्य॒ योज॑नं हरि॒ष्ठा मधु॑ त्वा मधु॒ला च॑कार
verses.transliteration: navānā́ṃ navatīnā́ṃ  viṣásya rópuṣīṇām  sárvāsām agrabhaṃ nā́ma-  -āré asya yójanaṃ  hariṣṭhā́ mádhu tvā  madhulā́ cakāra

translation.text: Of ninety rivers and of nine with power to stay the venom's course,– The names of all I have secured: his path is far: he whom Bay Horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिः स॒प्त म॑यू॒र्यः॑ स॒प्त स्वसा॑रो अ॒ग्रुवः॑ तास्ते॑ वि॒षं वि ज॑भ्रिर उद॒कं कु॒म्भिनी॑रिव
verses.transliteration: tríḥ saptá mayūryàḥ  saptá svásāro agrúvaḥ  tā́s te viṣáṃ ví jabhrire-  udakáṃ kumbhínīr iva

translation.text: So have the peahens three-times-seven, so have the maiden Sisters Seven Carried thy venom far away, as girls bear water in their jars.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒य॒त्त॒कः कु॑षुम्भ॒कस्त॒कं भि॑न॒द्म्यश्म॑ना ततो॑ वि॒षं प्र वा॑वृते॒ परा॑ची॒रनु॑ सं॒वतः॑
verses.transliteration: iyattakáḥ kuṣumbhakás  takám bhinadmy áśmanā  táto viṣám prá vāvr̥te  párācīr ánu saṃvátaḥ

translation.text: The poison-insect is so small; I crush the creature with a stone. I turn the poison hence away, departed unto distant lands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒षु॒म्भ॒कस्तद॑ब्रवीद्गि॒रेः प्र॑वर्तमान॒कः वृश्चि॑कस्यार॒सं वि॒षम॑र॒सं वृ॑श्चिक ते वि॒षम्
verses.transliteration: kuṣumbhakás tád abravīd  giréḥ pravartamānakáḥ  vŕ̥ścikasyārasáṃ viṣám  arasáṃ vr̥ścika te viṣám

translation.text: Forth issuing from the mountain's side the poison-insect spake and said: The scorpion's venom hath no strength Scorpion, thy venom is but weak.
